Many research studies include weight and height as primary outcomes. Although having trained personnel conduct direct measurements of body weight and height using research quality equipment and standardized techniques is considered the “gold standard” in research, financial and/or logistical considerations  frequently preclude the application of this gold standard. This can be a problem for the many research studies that use weight and height or Body Mass Index  as primary outcomes.
Recognition of the morbidity and premature mortality associated with mental disorders has prompted attempts to increase access to treatment and opportunities for early detection among children . Although MH issues commonly present in primary care, primary care providers  typically receive limited training in their diagnosis and treatment . Most PCPs expand their expertise over the course of their careers through consultation and collaboration with specialists.
Saphenous vein grafts have been established as the gold standard conduit for lower extremity bypass grafting . Conventionally, the great saphenous vein  is typically harvested via a long continuous or “skip” incisions that may extend from the groin to the ankle, before its use as an arterial conduit. This approach however is associated with significant morbidities including surgical site infections, ischemic skin flaps, fat necrosis, lymph leak, increased postoperative pain and longer hospital stay for as many as 24% to 43% of patients  .
In vivo evidence of cerebral amyloid angiopathy  was limited until the introduction of gradient echo T2*  weighted magnetic resonance  imaging, which remains the clinical standard for detection of brain microbleeds  which often result from CAA . Though recent reviews of the BMB literature have attempted to codify the interpretation of these findings, the inconsistency of data sets, the lack of pathological confirmation and the need for better designed prospective studies to determine their clinical significance has been emphasized . SWI is an advance in T2* weighted brain MR imaging that enhances contrast from local susceptibility tissue variations .
Neutrophils, through their ability to be rapidly recruited to tissues and deploy adiverse array of antimicrobial effector mechanisms, are essential for the clearance of manybacterial pathogens. The current paradigm of neutrophil recruitment is described by a well definedseries of steps that occur within post capillary venules, . The first of these istethering and rolling on the vascular endothelium, which is mediated by P selectinglycoprotein ligand 1  or VLA 4  on the neutrophiland E  and P selectin or VCAM 1  on theendothelium.
p38 is one of the major MAP kinases, which regulates multiple biological processes in mammals . It was initially identified as a key mediator of inflammation and stress responses. Later studies also implicated p38 in cell cycle and proliferation, cell differentiation, cellular senescence, and DNA damage responses  .
The reversible formation of disulfide bonds between cysteine residues is increasingly recognized as an important mechanism for the regulation of protein function. As a result, these modifications affect diverse cellular processes, including metabolism, gene expression and cytoskeletal dynamics, . Glutathione  reduces protein disulfides in a reaction that produces glutathione disulfide .
Several research groups have initiated efforts to use computational approaches to investigate intrinsic disorder within integral membrane proteins   that include voltage gated potassium channels , notch pathway proteins , single pass membrane proteins from humans , and plasma membrane proteins in humans and in bacteria such as E. coli . Intrinsically disordered proteins  and intrinsically disordered protein regions  do not have rigid three dimensional or stable secondary structures under physiological conditions  . This dynamic structure in solution is characterized by mobility on different timescales.
Cancer is largely a disease affecting older adults . Seventy two percent of cancer survivors are 60 years of age and older . Cancer treatments lead to a number of side effects in older adults including cancer related fatigue and global side effect burden .
Infection with the parasite Trypanosoma cruzi causes Chagas disease. Chagas disease is endemic in many areas of Latin America, affecting ~20 million infected people. Chagasic heart disease, which accounts for thousands of deaths annually, is manifested by congestive heart failure, conduction abnormalities, and thrombo embolic events.
Normal pregnancy is associated with dramatic increases in placental blood flow, which is directly correlated with fetal growth and survival as well as neonatal birth weights and survivability . These increases in placental blood flows result from both angiogenesis and vasodilatation . Cellular responses to VEGF and FGF2 are initiated by binding to their corresponding specific receptors, thereby activating the cytoplasmic tyrosine kinase domains of the receptors.
Alzheimer’s disease  is the most common cause of dementia in mid to late life. It is essential as the population ages, that treatments that target the cause of this disease be developed. One promising approach are anti amyloid therapies, based on the hypothesis that increased amyloid beta  deposits in the brain is a major underlying cause of the pathology of AD .
Inflammation and cancer have been linked in numerous studies , yet the mechanistic basis for this relationship remains unknown. Among these reactive species are superoxide, hydrogen peroxide and HOCl— the latter generated by myeloperoxidase from activated neutrophils . 5 fluorouracil  and 5 iodouracil  have yet to be reported under physiological conditions.
Major histocompatibility complex class I and II molecules play a vital role in initiating immune responses by presenting peptide antigens to CD8 and CD4 T lymphocytes respectively. Early research indicated that expression of MHC class II  was restricted to particular APC subsets including professional APCs or dendritic cells, monocytes, macrophages and B lymphocytes. More recent research however has shown that MHC II is not exclusively expressed by these populations and can be found on non APC subsets, such as activated T lymphocytes  and basal vascular endothelial cells .
Brugada syndrome  is characterized by an electrocardiographic pattern of ST segment elevation in the right precordial leads and an increased risk of sudden cardiac death. BrS has been associated with cardiac sodium channels  mutations causing decreased sodium current . We have reported that the A280V mutation in the glycerol 3 phosphate dehydrogenase 1 like  causes BrS by reducing INa.
Inhalational anesthetics produce various clinically important actions, including hypnosis, amnesia and immobility . It is believed that different anesthetic actions involve distinct molecular targets in specific neural pathways; for immobilization, the site of action is spinal . Although the precise substrates for immobilizing actions are not known with certainty, it is nevertheless clear that anesthetics cause a depression of motor output that is general and profound .
The Southwest United States, including Arizona and New Mexico, has a diverse climate  and is home to many different avian species . Arizona, in particular is part of the Pacific flyway which starts in Alaska and extends as far as South America . Conversely, New Mexico is in the Central flyway that includes Colorado, Montana, Texas, Oklahoma, Wyoming, Kansas, North and South Dakota, and north into Canada .
Gastric hydrochloric acid  is a noxious stimulus that following penetration through the mucosal barrier contributes to pain arising from the oesophagus, stomach and upper small intestine. Exposure of the rodent stomach to excess HCl elicits a visceromotor response indicative of pain  and causes many neurons in the nucleus tractus solitarii  of the brainstem to express c Fos, a marker of neuronal excitation . Intramucosal acidosis may excite sensory neurons by activation of molecular acid sensors such as the acid sensing ion channels  which belong to the voltage insensitive, amiloride sensitive epithelial Na+ channel/degenerin family .
Bipolar disorder  is a prevalent, severe, and highly disabling psychiatric disease characterized by recurrent depressive and manic episodes, and is associated with increased morbidity and mortality due to general medical conditions, such as obesity, diabetes and cardio disease  . Changes include DNA damage in peripheral blood of BD patients , increased pro apoptotic serum activity in BD patients  and mitochondrial dysfunction . These studies implicate the involvement of cell death in the pathophysiology of BD .
In the United States, one out of every three persons aged 20 and older has hypertension, with more than 100 million people having either pre hypertension or definite hypertension. , Nitric oxide is catalyzed by endothelial nitric oxide synthase , an enzyme with multiple genetic variants that might confer risk for hypertension. Three single nucleotide polymorphisms  in the NOS3 gene have been shown to be associated with hypertension, including Glu298Asp, T786C and a VNTR in intron 4.
Microbicides will be used by healthy women to prevent HIV and sexually transmitted infections ; therefore these products require an exceptional safety profile. Similarly, a recent trial of cellulose sulfate was halted due to concerns about safety . Preclinical and early clinical studies failed to identify potential toxic effects and did not indicate that there may be issues with safe use of these products .
Human and mouse studies have proven that high levels of cholesterol rich remnants cause atherosclerosis, but the relevance of triglyceride rich lipoproteins  to atherogenesis remains controversial. In part, this controversy stems from the fact that elevated levels of TRLs and remnants often coexist . Humans with chylomicronemia have severe hypertriglyceridemia but low levels of cholesterol rich remnants.
Sonoporation has shown promise to facilitate intracellular transport of drugs, proteins, genes, and other therapeutic agents that are otherwise impermeable to the cell . Because ultrasound exposure can be non invasively controlled in application volume and location as well as exposure duration, sonoporation is uniquely suitable for in vivo site specific delivery . However, even with recent progress in the field, a detailed mechanistic description of sonoporation and its full range of bioeffects remains to be elucidated  .
Autism spectrum disorder  is featured by severe deficits in social communication, social interaction, and restricted, repetitive patterns of behaviors, interests and activities . One more model of autism emphasizes abnormalities in neural connectivity . There were suggested also models based on mirror neurons system and imitation deficits in autism  .
The population of the United States  is aging rapidly. The number of adults in the U.S. age 65 or older will more than double to approximately 71 million by 2030 . Approximately 80% of older adults have at least one chronic disease and the numbers of elders living in the community with serious, eventually fatal chronic conditions has increased dramatically over the last decade placing tremendous strain on family members .
Indoleamine 2,3 dioxygenase 1  is a metabolically active enzyme with the capacity to promote immune tolerance and exert anti microbial effects. IDO expression supports localized depletion of tryptophan, the rarest of essential amino acids, while its kynurenine based metabolites are produced in excess. These changes to the microenvironment lead to important immunomodulatory effects, in part via activation of GCN2 kinase.
Adolescence is a developmental period in which an individual transitions from immaturity and dependence on the family unit into maturity and independence. It has been suggested that human adolescents experience more stressors and negative life events than children or adults . It is still not clear, however, whether human adolescents differ from their adult counterparts in terms of how they behaviorally and hormonally respond to stressors and whether the adverse consequences of stress exposure would more profoundly impact the development of anxiety disorders during adolescence than during adulthood.
In vivo bioluminescence imaging  uses luciferase enzymes  as reporters to generate light emission during the catalytic oxidation of their substrates for non invasive imaging of biological targets and processes in intact cells and living animals . BLI employs both the enzyme and substrate to generate the light emission, and many strategies have been developed to regulate the activity of the reporter enzyme at the various levels  for molecular imaging . Alternatively, the substrates may be chemically converted into an inactive “caged” form that can be activated by certain biological targets to generate the original substrates for imaging.
The psychological impairments observed in schizophrenia  involve most, but not all, cognitive functions . While initial reports attributed this pattern to deficiencies in striatal dopaminergic function similar to those observed in Parkinson's disease , subsequent studies have implied that the source of dysfunction may lie in reward processing areas of the prefrontal cortex and fronto striatal communication . If patients exhibit selective alterations in these neural systems, we might expect to observe a failure to exhibit one of these biases and, hence, a paradoxical advantage in the relevant task .
Cerebral ischemia is a devastating aspect of stroke, cardiac arrest, and surgical procedures that interrupt blood flow to the brain. An early mild ischemic insult protects CA1 pyramidal neurons against subsequent, normally lethal ischemic challenges . This phenomenon is referred to as ischemic preconditioning .
Profound neurogenesis occurs in restricted areas of the adult mammalian brain under physiological conditions . In the olfactory system, central neurogenesis provides subventricular zone derived interneurons to the OB . Peripheral neurogenesis in the olfactory epithelium produces OSNs throughout life .
Non infection related morbidity and mortality has become increasingly significant in the care and management of HIV infected patients treated with combination antiretroviral therapy . An increased risk of myocardial infarction  in HIV infected patients was described in 2007 by Triant et al. . HIV infection is associated with known cardiovascular risk factors such as increased total cholesterol, decreased HDL cholesterol, lipodystrophy and the metabolic syndrome .
Ca2+ mediated signaling regulates diverse aspects of cellular functions in bacteria, plants, fungi and animals . It had been generally believed that many ion channels and transporters in the animal Ca2+ signaling machinery were animal specific and were developed in ancient multicellular animals  . Recent molecular and genomics studies on a choanoflagellate, Monosiga brevicollis, one of the closest unicellular relatives of animals , reveal the presence of cell surface adhesion molecules, receptor tyrosine kinases and several other signaling molecules previously thought to be restricted to animals .
Understanding life history evolution requires knowledge of the forces shaping correlated suites of fitness characters in response to patterns of age specific mortality . Therefore, it is necessary to integrate how life history traits are expressed across environments  and standing levels of genetic variation in fitness components  with patterns of demographic and environmental variability . In order to predict life history patterns, we must also examine the genetic architecture of life history variation and the unfolding of organismal developmental programs over the life cycle .
The ErbB family of receptor tyrosine kinases includes EGFR, ErbB2 , ErbB3 , and ErbB4 . Over the past ten years, it has become evident that many epithelial cancers require EGFR or HER2 signaling for their growth and survival. Inhibitors of EGFR and HER2 come in the form of small molecule tyrosine kinase inhibitors  and targeted antibodies .
Despite the efficacy of empirically supported treatment options for patients with anxiety disorders , a great many patients with anxiety disorders are not reaping the benefits of these treatments, and treatment refusal and attrition remain a significant problem. It therefore follows that motivation is key to increasing treatment attendance, and in fact available data in this area, though sparse, suggest that this is the case for at least some patients. The question then arises as to how to increase motivation for treatment.
Muscle pain can result from repetitive or eccentric activity, and may persist for days  or weeks  after exposure to these activities . While the underlying cellular mechanisms in these pain syndromes are not well understood, inflammatory cytokines, which sensitize high threshold mechano sensitive muscle afferents  are likely to be involved . For example, following eccentric exercise in humans  and in a repetitive motion induced muscle pain model in the rat , levels of inflammatory cytokines are increased in the exercised limb .
Tissue factor pathway inhibitor , a Kunitz type serine protease inhibitor, is an endogenous inhibitor of TF mediated coagulation. The formation of a quaternary TF:VIIa:TFPI:Xa complex dampens ongoing FXa generation. Additionally, TFPI also has been shown to regulate coagulation by inducing the internalization and degradation of TF:VIIa complex on cell surfaces.
Global change is mostly associated with increasing concentrations of atmospheric CO2 and other greenhouse gases triggering climate change, but other anthropogenic processes also affect the local and global environment. Among these, the anthropogenic production of reactive nitrogen through nitrogen fertilization, agricultural N2 fixation and fossil fuel combustion has far reaching consequences on ecosystem functions, productivity, biodiversity and the climate itself . As a consequence, there is little information on how much deposition has changed in remote areas and we do not know if this has affected the nitrogen cycle or other ecosystem processes .
Endothelin 1  is the predominant isoform of three distinct isopeptides constitutively secreted by endothelial and other vascular cells, and the most potent endogenous vasoconstrictor known . ET 1 activates two G protein coupled receptors, ETA and ETB . ET 1 acts in concert with other endothelium derived contracting factors to balance the activity of endothelium derived relaxing factors .
Cancer development has been known to share many molecular frameworks with embryonic development, tissue renewal and differentiation . For example, in normal tissues the Notch signaling pathway is activated under strict temporal and spatial control during tissue regeneration and cell fate determination. In contrast, during tumor development Notch is constitutively activated and its sustained activation could be a result of genetic or epigenetic alterations.
The incidence of type 1 diabetes  has been increasing globally at a rate of approximately 3% per year since the 1960s , and it varies in different parts of the world, with high figures in the Nordic countries  and the opposite in the countries of East Asia such as China and Japan with ∼1 case/year/100,000 individuals . These geographical differences in T1D incidence may be related to food consumption , as large quantities of soy products are widely used in traditional Asian diets, which are typically low in fat. In addition, diabetic kidney disease  is a complication that occurs in some people with T1D , and glomerulosclerosis is known to be a classic change characteristic of the chronic phase of diabetic nephropathy.
The development of T cells in the thymus is an ordered progression of differentiation and proliferation events . Gene knockout experiments have shown that this developmental pathway is regulated by several transcription factors and signaling pathways . The majority of these regulators play ongoing roles throughout T cell development, however their specific effects can vary from one stage to another .
Tumors of the central nervous system  have significant intra  and inter tumor heterogeneity in terms of cellular composition, cellular proliferation, invasiveness and epigenetic status . In addition, there are at least two prognostic subgroups of pediatric GBM based on association with or without aberrantly active Ras/AKT pathway . Heterogeneity in GBM tumors may be responsible for differential response to therapeutic interventions , and understanding the etiology of tumor heterogeneity in animal models may become increasingly important to design therapeutic strategies effective at targeting molecularly defined tumor subtypes .
However, despite the prevalence of loss experiences in young adults, and the potential for problematic grief responses, this age group has received relatively limited empirical attention . Psychological responses to loss of a family member or friend are complex, and vary in intensity and types of symptoms . There has been little investigation of whether personality variables  or the quality of the relationship between the bereaved and deceased  may play a role in the development of complicated grief or depression, particularly among young adults.
Mast cells play an important role in many immunological and inflammatory reactions. A role for these cells has been described in defense against bacteria, virus or parasites, the induction of immune responses and several autoimmune diseases . FcεRIs are members of the immune receptor family that are present on many cells of the immune system.
Over three fourths of the population with heart failure  is aged 65 years and older, and the proportion of older HF patients is projected to increase as more adults are surviving into old age. Indeed, older HF patients have greater hospitalization rates, health care expenditures, and mortality  as well as symptoms of exercise intolerance that are often more severe than in younger HF patients. Formal assessment of exercise performance with measurement of peak exercise oxygen consumption  and exercise ventilatory efficiency  using cardiopulmonary exercise testing , is commonly used to guide management of HF patients.
Human immunodeficiency virus type 1  is a member of the lentivirus subfamily of the Retroviridae family and the etiologic agent of acquired immune deficiency syndrome . During or shortly after budding, Gag is proteolytically cleaved by the viral protease into the four major structural proteins: matrix , capsid, nucleocapsid, p6; and the two spacer proteins p1 and p2. Numerous single amino acid substitutions in the N terminal region of MA  as well as the beginning of α5  abrogate ENV incorporation  .
Recent studies have suggested that general anesthetics act through specific ion channels to inhibit neuronal excitability. It is now known that some ligand gated channels such as GABAA , NMDA , as well as background  potassium channels , are sensitive to anesthetics. Furthermore, some studies  indicate that voltage gated Ca2+ channels are also affected by volatile general anesthetics at concentrations that occur under clinical conditions.
Tocomin® represents commercially available mixture of naturally occurring tocotrienols  and tocopherol  extracted from palm oil/palm fruits that possess powerful antioxidant, anticancer, neuro/cardioprotective and cholesterol lowering properties. Cellular autophagy represents a defense mechanism against oxidative stress and several anticancer compounds. Recently, we reported that tocotrienols induce apoptosis and endoplasmic reticulum stress in breast cancer cells .
Craniosynostosis is defined as the premature fusion of one or more cranial sutures and is a common malformation  occurring in all ethnic groups . Craniosynostosis of the sagittal suture is the most common form of craniosynostosis, accounting for 5560% of all craniosynostoses . Twin studies reported by  suggested a multifactorial pattern of inheritance, supporting both an environmental  and genetic origin in midline craniosynostosis .
Polypeptides expressed from the Hepatitis C virus  genome are of interest because the virus infects more than 170 million people . The amino acid sequence of p7 is shown in ; also shown are the sequences of two truncated constructs that have also been expressed and purified. It provides an opportunity to study these proteins in lipid environments that resemble the native cell membrane.
Heterotaxy syndrome is characterized by multiple congenital anomalies arising from defects in embryonic left right patterning and loss of normal asymmetric laterality . Heterotaxy patients are often described as being “bilateral left sided”  or “bilateral right sided” . In normal SA nodal development, the initial electrical pacemaker emerges at the inflow region of the linear heart tube  and develops adjacent to the venous sinus as it shifts rightward and is incorporated into the right atrium .
Modic changes  are signal variations of the vertebral endplate and the adjacent subchondral vertebral marrow seen on magnetic resonance images  . According to the patterns of signal changes on T1  and T2 weighted images, traditionally MCs have been classified into three types . Type 1 MCs show decreased signal intensity on T1 weighted images and increased signal intensity on T2 weighted images.
Breast cancer is a common malignancy and a leading cause of cancer deaths in women . It results from the accumulation of genetic alterations including activation of oncogenes and inactivation of tumor suppressor genes . Identification and characterization of these genes improve our understanding of breast cancer and management of patients.
Aortic root dilation leading to aortic dissection has been associated with numerous connective tissue disorders such as Marfan syndrome , EhlersDanlos syndrome  and LoeysDietz syndrome  . Other patients at risk include those with valvular abnormalities such as bicuspid aortic valve  and various genetic syndromes such as Turner syndrome, 18q deletion syndrome, and fragile X syndrome . Identifying patients with aortic root dilation in these at risk groups of patients is important as progressive dilation can lead to aortic dissection and death if left untreated .
Mouse thyroglobulin  sensitized splenocytes activated in vitro with MTG and IL 12 induce a severe granulomatous form of experimental autoimmune thyroiditis  after transfer to syngeneic recipients . G EAT lesions are characterized by infiltration of inflammatory cells and destruction of thyroid follicles . CD4+ T cells are the primary effector cells for G EAT  and CD8+ T cells are important for G EAT resolution  .
Childhood asthma is the most common chronic disease among children and is a major public health problem in the United States as well as in many other countries, such as Colombia, which has a prevalence estimated at 10 12% . Over the past decade, the concept of asthma control as the degree to which manifestations of the disease are reduced or removed by therapy has been clearly defined and has been incorporated into current asthma guidelines . Asthma control has been considered a key therapeutic goal and an outcome measure in clinical research studies, and its regular assessment has been recommended as a guide to a stepwise  approach to asthma therapy  .
Conventional chemotherapeutic regimens involve high doses of a cytotoxic agent followed by a 3  to 4 week rest period. However, recent studies using this approach have demonstrated a rapid acquisition of chemoresistance in certain patient populations after an initial response . Furthermore, conventional chemotherapy drugs have been associated with many toxic adverse effects that often impair quality of life and limit continuation of therapy  .
For nearly 50 years the rate of progression of COPD has been defined by the slope of the annual decline in FEV1 determined from serial measurements of FEV1 obtained over a span of years in the course of observational or intervention studies. In intervention trials conducted over the last few decades, this slope has been determined mainly from serial measurements of the post , rather than the pre , bronchodilator FEV1 . The rationale for the latter practice appears to derive from the assumption that there may be less variability in the post  than the pre bronchodilator measurement and that the post bronchodilator value would be less influenced by noncompliance with instructions to withhold bronchodilator medication during the washout period prior to scheduled spirometric testing.
Malaria continues to impose a substantial health burden across the globe. Erythrocyte invasion is an essential gateway to malaria disease and a key target for disease intervention. The Gs protein is heterotrimeric, consisting of an alpha, beta and gamma subunit.
Neurotrophic factors including the tolloid/bone morphogenetic protein 1  family of metalloproteinases enhance the survival, growth, and function of neurons. The tolloids and BMP 1 contain a conserved metalloproteinase domain not found in BMPs 27 which are classed as transforming growth factor β  superfamily members . The best characterized developmental response of the tolloid/BMP 1s is to regulate activity of TGFβ signaling.
The social brain hypothesis states that the emergence of computationally more powerful brains cannot be explained solely by the ensuing advantage in solving problems posed by the physical environment. Trustworthiness and attractiveness in a face convey particularly pivotal social information. An overestimation of others’ approachability has been reported in cases of bilateral amygdala  lesion in monkeys  and humans .
Nanomaterials are used in a range of appliances and household products, in the manufacture of textiles and electronics, as well as for medical products and in bioremediation technology. Nanoscale zinc oxide  and copper oxide  are manufactured in large scale for both industrial and household use since they possess greater promise for future applications, such as fillers, opacifiers, catalysts, semiconductors, cosmetics, and microelectronics . ZnO NPs are additives in personal care products, including toothpaste, beauty products and sunscreens, as well as in textiles , wastewater treatment, and chemotherapy .
The kidney shows a quantifiable decrease in function with age . Furthermore, the capacity of the kidney to concentrate urine reduces progressively with age . It is important to understand and detect changes in renal function and structure that normally occur with aging, and to distinguish these changes from alterations that take place with disease.
Brain metabolite measurements using MR spectroscopy  generally require averaging of many acquisitions from the same spatial location to obtain acceptable signal to noise ratio . Such motion can cause errors and artifacts that may not be evident in typical quality assurance procedures. Even if movement is noticed by the scanner operator, subject motion is often the cause of repeated scans, resulting in inefficient use of scanner time .
Glutamate, the major excitatory neurotransmitter in the central nervous system , is neurotoxic when its extracellular concentration is high. Glutamate transporters, also called excitatory amino acid transporters , play an important role in removing glutamate from extracellular space into cells . Five EAATs  have been characterized; each has about 520580 amino acid residues .
Resistance to chemotherapy is a major obstacle for the success of cancer therapy. In epithelial tumors including breast, ovarian and lung cancers, resistance to chemotherapy is frequently observed and is associated with poor clinical outcome  . Paclitaxel mainly targets β tubulin at the molecular level and stabilizes microtubule dynamics to induce microtubule polymerization .
Depression and substance abuse are common among low income, minority adults in safety net settings. Little is known about comorbidities across service sectors supporting these clients . The study uses cross sectional baseline client data  from Community Partners in Care , an initiative to improve depression services in Los Angeles County.
Glaucoma is a multifactorial disease that results in progressive death of retinal ganglion cells and loss of visual fields. Furthermore, it has a younger age of onset, progresses more rapidly and occurs with greater severity in the AD population . Glaucoma has been noted to affect up to six times more people of AD than those of ED .
Members of the ABC  transporter superfamily are widely recognized as major contributors to controlling drug distribution and pharmacokinetics, and the acquisition of anticancer drug resistance. Expressed largely in the plasma membranes of cancer cells, ABC transporters mediate cellular resistance to anticancer agents by the ATP dependent efflux of toxic chemotherapeutics from cells. While several ABC transporters have been shown to transport anticancer drugs in vitro, P glycoprotein  stands out by conferring the highest level of resistance to a vast array of drugs and because of its demonstrated association with clinical multidrug resistance  and poor clinical outcome .
Barriers to consent when conducting prehospital research are unavoidable. Federal regulations allow an exception from informed consent  for certain studies. However, before an EFIC study can be approved, investigators must consult both the geographic community where the study will be conducted and the community from which subjects will be drawn  .
TSC is an autosomal dominant disorder characterized by the growth of benign tumors called hamartomas in multiple organs including the brain . TSC patients suffer from epilepsy, autism and developmental delay. Within the central nervous system, TSC is associated with cortical tubers, made up of giant cells, dysmorphic neurons and astrocytes.
For many years, multidrug resistance  has been explained solely as the result of ABCB1 over expression in a tumor . This transporter, called P glycoprotein, was found to be expressed in Chinese hamster ovary cells selected for colchicine resistance. The authors discovered that these cells displayed resistance to a variety of structurally and mechanistically unrelated drugs in addition to colchicine .
Mail order pharmacies are widely used to deliver medications in the U.S., with up to 1/3 of chronic illness medications delivered by mail. Research suggests a positive association between mail order pharmacy use and greater adherence to diabetes and antihypertensive medications,  and with better LDL C control. These favorable outcomes may reflect improved access to medications with mail order pharmacy use, which may be of particular value to patients with disabilities, time constraints, or limited transportation ., However, there may be unintended consequences to using mail order pharmacies.
Imaging and therapy play crucial roles in prevention, early diagnosis, efficient treatment, and confirmation of complete cure. They also mutually and synergistically affect optimal prognosis for many diseases, especially cancer. , Recently, there has been great interest in developing nanomaterials that are capable of pinpointing abnormal lesions with molecular specificity, while converting the nanomaterials themselves to be therapeutic effectors in the pinpointed areas .
Tobacco use is the major preventable cause of premature death in the United States, accounting for more than 400,000 annual deaths from cancer, cardiovascular and respiratory disease., Health effects in children include low birth weight, asthma, increased ear and respiratory infections and sudden infant death. Cotinine is further metabolized by P450 2A6 to trans 3' hydroxycotinine . Phenylalanine was one of the first molecules analyzed in DBS, and its routine quantitation has allowed the analysis of phenylketonuria in millions of newborns.
Long term efficacy of osteochondral allografts  depends on the presence of viable chondrocytes within graft cartilage to locally maintain homeostasis and prevent degeneration. In contrast, frozen OCA are devoid of viable chondrocytes and, as used for massive oncologic joint reconstructions, result in cartilage that, in retrievals, is acellular and exhibits surface and bulk tissue degeneration. While chondrocyte viability is a useful marker of overall cartilage tissue function, future improvements in the application of OCA would benefit from identifying markers of allograft biological performance and sensitive indices of cartilage function .
Food frequency questionnaires  facilitate dietary data collection in large cohort studies and are the most frequently used diet assessment method in nutritional epidemiology to assess habitual eating habits and rank individuals’ energy and nutrient intake . Development of an appropriate food and nutrient database is required to translate information derived from FFQs into estimates of nutrient intake, dietary quality or for absolute or rank ordered nutritional risk assessment . Experts use a variety of approaches in database development for FFQ analysis, including reliance on expert opinion , population specific data driven methods , or a combination of the two .
The development of Ln magnetic resonance imaging  contrast agents that report on their environment through molecular interactions is an active area of research. For the well known Gd MRI contrast agents, contrast properties are modulated through a change in the number of exchangeable water ligands in the inner coordination sphere or through an change in rotational correlation time and associated relaxivity induced by binding to a macromolecule. Efforts have been made to develop PARACEST agents that respond to both outer and innersphere ligands.
CXCR4  is a G protein coupled receptor which serves many functions in the immune system. Studies of mice carrying a targeted gene disruption of CXCR4 have revealed its critical role in hematopoiesis, B cell lymphopoiesis, myelopoiesis, germinal center organization, and maintenance of stem cell pools in the bone marrow . In addition, CXCR4 is a well studied molecule in both HIV and cancer.
Endothelin 1  is one of several vasoconstrictors that may play a role in the progression of Crohn’s Disease and ulcerative colitis, conditions categorized as inflammatory bowel disease . Elevated plasma  and tissue  levels of the potent vasoconstrictor have been found in IBD patients, with the elevations speculated to induce hypoxia  as a consequence of decreased blood flow. over 30 years ago, decreases in blood flow are found more frequently in chronic and mild IBD and in the late fibrosing stage of Crohn’s Disease, while increases in blood flow can be found in severe IBD .
The twin epidemics of obesity and diabetes threaten to overwhelm healthcare systems in the U.S. and worldwide. Thus, a better understanding of factors that contribute to their incidence is critical in order to manage this major public health issue. Important contributors to obesity and diabetes are lack of exercise and consumption of a high fat/calorie Western style diet .
The endoplasmic reticulum associated degradation  pathway mediates the destruction of numerous normal and misfolded ER localized proteins . Accordingly, there is great impetus to understand the molecular mechanisms that mediate this important route of protein degradation . In most cases, ancillary factors participate in substrate recognition and transfer of the ubiquitinated substrate to the proteasome  .
Statistical analyses are an essential component of medical research, which when appropriately applied can further our understanding of risk factors, treatment effects and other aspects of disease. Although it is arguable that one may not have to fully understand all the statistical analyses presented in a research article in order to grasp the article’s main message, a basic understanding of statistics is important to allow critical appraisal of the presented material. Clinicians should be able to evaluate the medical literature in order to make informed decisions regarding best practice, a critical component of evidence based medicine.
The human mitochondrial genome  is a small, circular, highly coding molecule , making mtDNA mutations more likely to be deleterious than nuclear ones . Nuclear MSI has been proposed to result from DNA slippage and mispairing in repetitive DNA sequences during DNA replication. MMR deficiency increases cellular mutation rates and is associated with cancer susceptibility.
Subtilosin, a ribosomally synthesized 3.4 kDa cyclical peptide  produced by both Bacillus subtilis  and Bacillus amyloliquefaciens , is a bacteriocin that has the potential for applications in contraception and reproductive health due to its unique properties, such as natural origin, biodegradability, antimicrobial properties, lack of immunogenicity, overall safety, ease of production and formulation . Previous studies have demonstrated that subtilosin reduces sperm motility in vitro in a dose dependent fashion . Over 530 million people worldwide are infected with HSV 2, which can cause recurrent and painful genital lesions, being recurrent genital herpes, the most prevalent sexually transmitted disease  .
Cardiac amyloidosis involves the deposition of insoluble fibrils in the myocardium and is an underdiagnosed cause of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction . The most clinically relevant cardiac involvement occurs in primary light chain  amyloidosis, familial transthyretin amyloidosis , and senile transthyretin amyloidosis . Other forms of systemic amyloidosis including secondary AA amyloidosis rarely affect the heart.
Large intracranial arterial occlusions are associated with high morbidity and mortality. In patients who are ineligible for or fail intravenous thrombolytic therapy, endovascular revascularization is often the only method that can potentially improve functional outcome. Although a good arterial occlusive lesion  score represents good or excellent target vessel recanalization and is associated with favorable clinical outcomes, it does not necessarily equate to tissue revascularization.
The growth in science and engineering research conducted by teams has dramatically accelerated since 1975, making multi university collaborations the fastest growing authorship structure. Research and intellectual property developed by highly functioning multidisciplinary research teams has greater impact in peer recognition through citations and patent uses than research products from siloed investigators. The literature also includes definitions of teams according to a wide range of organizational/structuralist dimensions, such as size, organizational complexity, geographic scope, funding, duration, leadership structure, team goals, etc.
The intracellular adaptor Dab1 is a key regulator of neuronal migration during brain development . The protein is composed of an N terminus domain of approximately 180 amino acids, named PI/PTB , followed by a cluster of five tyrosines and a C terminus containing two consensus regions for the serine/threonine kinase Cdk5 . Two of these lipoprotein receptors function as receptors for Reelin , a large glycoprotein implicated in the control of neuronal migration .
The spirochete genus Borrelia comprises three major groups of species. The species of the second group are transmitted by hard  ticks of the genus Ixodes and include agents of Lyme borreliosis , such as B. burgdorferi and B. afzelii, as well as species, such as B. bissettii, that have not been associated with human disease. Another species in this third group is B. miyamotoi, which is transmitted by Ixodes species, has rodents as reservoirs, and occurs in Asia, Europe, and North America.
Decades of epidemiological data strongly suggest that high density lipoproteins  protect against cardiovascular disease . In this pathway, HDL removes cholesterol from peripheral tissues and transports it to the liver for excretion via bile formation . The physiological importance of SR BI in mediating cholesterol flux in humans was obtained from the recent identification of three loss of function mutations in SCARB1  in heterozygote carriers with high HDLcholesterol  levels .
Although control of cardiovascular disease  risk factors reduces morbidity and mortality, most Americans at risk for CVD related events have not achieved therapeutic goals for management of these factors. The American Diabetes Association and the National Diabetes Education Program have promoted use of the ABC indicators, which include:  glycated hemoglobin  for control of diabetes mellitus,  blood pressure, and  cholesterol  as modifiable indicators targeted for treatment in order to reduce CVD risk. The D factor  has been added by the current researchers as an additional risk factor.
In 1992, six years after Bill Brinkley became editor in chief of Cell Motility and the Cytoskeleton following the untimely death of founding editor Robert D. Allen,  demonstrated that tubulin and the radial spokes of Chlamydomonas flagella are delivered to the distal tip of the flagellar axoneme where assembly of the organelle occurs. Very shortly thereafter, the process of intraflagellar transport  was first observed in the Rosenbaum laboratory at Yale . IFT is necessary for organelle assembly and maintenance because IFT transports materials to the distal tip, the site of organelle growth and turnover, and returns components back to the cell body for degradation or recycling .
Basic mechanisms responsible for temperature regulation in living animals are well understood. Since no “heat storage” is known to exist in the brain, temperature regulation in the brain can only rely on communication between brain and body as metabolites are delivered and heat is exchanged through blood flow. In humans, on average 3.75 μmol of oxygen is delivered per 1 g of brain tissue every minute .
The acute defensive response to a threatening event prompts behavioral, physiological, and cognitive reactions that are essential to survival. It has been a matter of debate whether acute defensive engagement  is accompanied by heightened sensitivity to external cues, or alternatively, by a focus on bodily processes and internal cues  . These motivational circuits are activated by environmental and memorial cues and initiate cognitive processes that enhance perception in the service of selecting an appropriate action .
The most frequently studied candidate gene for Neuroticism, depression, anxiety related traits and disorders is the serotonin transporter . The SLC6A4 gene is on chromosome 17q11.1 q12. estimated that the polymorphism accounted for 3% to 4% of total variation and 7% to 9% of inherited variance of anxiety related personality traits.
Psoriasis is an autoimmune disease affecting 7.5 million Americans. There is increasing evidence that psoriasis is associated with the prevalence and incidence of diabetes and diabetes related complications. Prospective studies from several countries have found that the risk of developing diabetes is increased among those with psoriasis, especially among those with more severe psoriasis.
One of the greatest challenges in ocular drug delivery is effectively administering drugs to the back of the eye to treat diseases of the retina, choroid and vitreous body . Such posterior segment diseases include macular degeneration and diabetic retinopathy, which are two of the leading cause of blindness. Posterior segment delivery is often achieved via systemic delivery, which generally does not target the eye and thereby can cause side effects, or intravitreal injection, which is unpleasant for patients, requires expert clinical administration, and carries the risk of complications, such as retinal detachment, cataract, endophthalmitis and pain  .
The human  and mouse  melanocortin 1 G protein coupled cell surface receptors play important roles in melanocyte biology, notably in the production of melanin pigment . The Mc1r ligands, melanocyte stimulating hormone  and ACTH are derived from the propriomelanocortin peptide   released from keratinocytes on exposure to UV radiation . Engagement between Mc1r and α MSH results in stimulation of black eumelanin production through a cAMP dependent signaling pathway .
Acyl CoA binding protein , also known as diazepam  binding inhibitor , is a soluble 10 kDa lipid binding protein ubiquitously expressed in all tissues of eukaryotic species examined . ACBP expression differs significantly among cell types and is highly regulated by hormones . Via the ACBP promoter, ACBP expression is also determined by several nuclear transcription factors important in lipid and glucose metabolism: peroxisome proliferator activated receptors   α and  γ as well as sterol regulatory element binding protein  .
Ovarian carcinoma is the fourth most common cause of cancer death among women in the United States, with more than 21,550 new cases diagnosed and an 14,600 deaths estimated for 2009 . Cytoreductive surgery followed by platinum based chemotherapy usually combined with paclitaxel is the standard initial treatment and has improved survival in patients with epithelial ovarian cancer . High levels of VEGF have also been found in the serum, plasma and ascites of ovarian cancer patients and are associated with poor patient prognosis .
NADH:quinone oxidoreductase 1  is a cytosolic protein that catalyzes metabolism of quinones and their derivatives . It has been shown that the two electron reduction of quinones, catalyzed by NQO1, competes with the one electron reduction catalyzed by cytochromes P450 and P450 reductase. Interestingly, NQO1 is part of an electrophilic and/or oxidative stress induced cellular defense mechanism that includes the induction of more than two dozen genes .
The study of open set masked sentence recognition is often limited by the number of unique items available in a particular corpus. There are a handful of speech corpora with 500 or more sentences, including AzBio , IEEE , CUNY , and BEL  sentences. This balance is only approximate, however, and deviations in list equivalence are particularly evident when testing is performed under different conditions and with different types of listeners than used in the construction of the corpus .
Proliferation of somatic cells in higher eukaryotes depends on the presence of external mitogens, which activate corresponding receptors present on the plasma membrane. A common downstream event of these receptor activations is the activation of the mitogen activated protein kinase  cascade by Ras . A critical mediator of ERK functions is the 90 kDa ribosomal S6 kinase  .
Acetaminophen is one of the most commonly used over the counter analgesics and the major cause of acute liver failure due to accidental and intentional overdose . Toxicity is characterized by centrilobular hepatic necrosis progressing to fulminant liver failure . Tissue repair following acetaminophen intoxication involves proliferation of remnant hepatocytes and the production of new extracellular matrix proteins .
Since its invention, MRI has moved to ever stronger magnetic fields to exploit the concomitant increases in signal to noise ratio and the opportunity to obtain images with improved contrast. Despite formidable challenges from the underlying physics, cardiac MRI has recently been demonstrated at 7 Tesla  . The FLASH   and bSSFP   images obtained are of sufficient quality to assess cardiac volume and function ; and right coronary angiography is feasible .
In clinical and research assessments of respiratory health, it is often necessary to conduct multiple tests during a brief visit. Although closely spaced tests may be unavoidable, concern that one test could influence the results of subsequent tests may lead to test ordering recommendations to minimize possible carryover effects. Furthermore, carryover effects may vary by health status, leading to different test ordering recommendations for clinical assessment  and research assessment  .
The combination of mass spectrometry with solution phase hydrogen/deuterium exchange  has become a powerful method to study protein structure and protein/protein interactions  . High resolution mass analysis  is particularly advantageous for accurately assigning the peptide fragments after protease digestion and in resolving overlap of peptide isotopic distributions, both before and after HDX , . The reliability and sequence resolution of solution phase HDX monitored by mass spectrometry has been hampered by the limited number and poor specificity of proteases that are active at the low pH necessary to quench HDX.
Bacteria are oftentimes found associated with animals, plants, fungi, and protists, as well as other bacteria. They have been successful in colonizing both extra cellular and intracellular tissues of their host, enabling some specific function or capability. In particular, environmental transmission has a number of obstacles prior to infection as well as during colonization and persistence that bacteria are constantly subjected to .
In striated muscle, ryanodine receptor channels  located at the sarcoplasmic reticulum  calcium stores are the main pathway for intracellular Ca2+ release upon physiological or pharmacological stimulation ,  and  . Functional studies of gating of RyR channel molecules require their isolation from cells  and . The response to pharmacological and physiological agonists of these isolated RyRs, studied in lipid bilayers or purified SR vesicles, is similar to that of RyR mediated Ca2+ signaling in cells ,  and .
Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive neuronal degenerative disorder of the central nervous system that ultimately results in the loss of cognitive function . This disease is characterized by the accumulation of toxic amyloid β  proteins in the extracellular space of the brain and on the wall of blood vessels in the brain  . The endothelium of brain blood vessels provides a semi permeable barrier between blood components and brain tissue.
Asthma is a complex disease caused by multiple genetic and environmental factors. Two traditional approaches for identification of asthma susceptibility genes are association studies of candidate genes and linkage studies followed by positional cloning. Candidate gene association studies focus on genes plausibly involved in disease pathogenesis or located in a region of linkage for the disease.
A population of resident cardiac stem/progenitor cells  has been found to contribute to the regeneration of myocardium after injury, myocardial infarction , or with stress such as pressure overload . This resident CSPC population can be defined by the expression of stem cell markers, c kit, Sca1, or the multi drug resistance protein . These stem cells can be modulated by factors such as Notch and its ligand Delta to contribute to the creation of cardiovascular endothelial, smooth muscle, or myocardial cell types.
Phosphorylation of myofilament proteins is an important post translational modification which regulates cardiomyocyte contractility of the heart. Specifically, the functional properties of cardiac troponin I  are regulated by phosphorylation and play a vital role in tuning cardiomyocyte performance in health and disease. cTnI is the “inhibitor” of the trimeric troponin complex, which together with cardiac troponin C  and cardiac troponin T , controls the position of tropomyosin on the actin filament in response to Ca2+ and thereby regulates actin myosin interactions and thus cardiomyocyte force development and relaxation.
The great French physiologist, Claude Bernard, introduced the idea of the “inner world” of the body, when he theorized that body systems function as they do to maintain a constant internal environment what he called the milieu interieur. According to Pasteur’s followers, diseases would result mainly from external threats to the well being of the organism, such as exposure to germs; the body’s responses would be relatively unimportant. Pasteur on his deathbed is said to have conceded, “Bernard was right.
While a wide variety of self report measures have been developed to assess adherence with HIV ART, few of the questionnaire items that make up these measures have been subjected to rigorous cognitive testing to ensure that the items are consistently understood by respondents. They could also be useful for research when more objective measures such as MEMS caps  or unannounced pill counts  are impractical or too costly  . Correlations with viral loads are consistently in the 0.3 0.4 range , and sometimes a little better.
Rapid developments in tissue engineering utilizing decellularized whole organs as biologic scaffolds coupled with advances in stem and endogenous lung progenitor cell biology have offered the potential of using acellular suboptimal donor or cadaveric lungs recellularized with appropriate cell types for ex vivo lung regeneration . As acellular scaffolds derived from rodent lungs are readily available and easily handled, high throughput approaches can be utilized to study cell matrix interaction or to assess the multiple conditions needed for effective recellularization and development of functional lung tissue . However, there is a more limited supply of larger lungs, including those from humans and potential xenogenic sources .
Dysregulation of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal axis , one of the body's major stress sensitive physiological systems, is frequently implicated in the etiology of Major Depressive Disorder  . The few existing studies taking this prospective longitudinal approach have converged upon similar findings. Although elevated cortisol levels across the full day and especially during the evening hours, are the most frequent cross sectional correlates of MDD , it is elevated morning cortisol that is prospectively predictive of depression  .
Accurate computation of free energies of binding remains a key challenge for computer aided drug design. In principle, water mediated protein ligand interactions can be investigated by Monte Carlo  or molecular dynamics  simulations with the solvent explicitly represented. However, as the exchange of water molecules between a binding site and the bulk can be slow, specialized methodologies may be required to estimate accurately the locations and energetics of ordered water molecules.
In the classical view, the cellular signal generated by a heterotrimeric guanine nucleotidebinding protein coupled receptor  is governed by the affinity and efficacy of its natural agonist. To pass the rigorous quality control system in the endoplasmic reticulum  and move through the Golgi apparatus to the plasma membrane, GPCRs interact with general chaperones such as calnexin and, in some cases, with accessory proteins that are specific for a given group of receptors. In addition to facilitating the trafficking of receptors to the plasma membrane, RAMPs act as switches to control the ligand preferences of two class B GPCRs, calcitonin and calcitonin receptorlike receptors  .
Although primary Sjögren’s syndrome  affects up to 0.10.6% of the general population, few rigorous etiologic studies have focused on the initiating immunopathologic process occurring in the exocrine glands. Interestingly, the severity of secretory dysfunction does not always correlate with the extent or degree of leukocytic infiltration and loss of acinar tissue, suggesting that immune dysregulation might impair exocrine gland secretion very early in the disease process  . Recently, elegant studies reported data supporting the potential role of innate or cognate  effectors in setting the stage of a Th17 based inflammation in pSS  .
The number of distinct spoken words is a widely used measure of early language abilities, which manifests during infancy. Word comprehension  in typically developing children starts at the age of about 6 to 9 months and the spontaneous production of words  emerges at about 10 to 15 months,. During the next months the accumulation of words is typically slow, but then followed by an increase in rate, often quite sharp, around 14 to 22 months of age ,.
Epigenetic mechanisms, i.e., DNA methylation and histone modification, are important for normal development including imprinting, X inactivation, cell differentiation and transcription. , The status of transcription  is associated with specific types of modifications at particular residues of histone tails. Epigenetic regulation provides a novel mechanism by which these environmental factors modify neural development and/or adult function.
Dyskeratosis congenita is a rare skin and bone marrow failure syndrome, associated with a classical triad of mucocutaneous abnormalities, namely abnormal skin pigmentation, leukoplakia and nail dystrophy . Pancytopenia is frequent and bone marrow failure is the most common cause of death. The more common X linked form is due to mutations in DKC1, encoding dyskerin .
Idiopathic intracranial hypertension  is increasingly recognized as a cause of spontaneous cerebrospinal  leak in the ENT and neurosurgical literature. The diagnosis of IIH in patients with spontaneous CSF leaks is classically made a few weeks after surgical repair of the CSF leak when symptoms and signs of elevated intracranial pressure  appear . Two young obese women developed spontaneous CSF rhinorrhea related to an empty sella in one, and a cribriform plate encephalocele in the other.
Microglia activation constitutes a major mechanism of self defense against brain injury, infection and disease. Changes in glial function could perhaps be a component of metabolic abnormalities which are observed in epileptic patients  and rodent seizure models . One approach to investigate this question is to modulate the microglia activation state concurrently with seizures .
Diet is a complex and irrefutable risk factor for cardiovascular disease . Egg is a significant source of cholesterol, containing an average of 213 mg per egg. Since the 1970's, egg consumption in the United States has been particularly discouraged by health stakeholders in the absence of empirical data.
Structural changes in glycosylation that are influenced by disease states have been of great interest, especially with respect to oncogenesis and tumor progression, and many reports have focused on such biomarkers for cancer related diagnosis. Thus, we have focused on the plasma glycome to represent that non invasive monitor of malignancy. The need for a detailed characterization, , for every monomer, and documenting each intervening linkage brings enormous analytical challenge.
Nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide  is an essential coenzyme regulating numerous cellular metabolic pathways. In the last few decades, a growing number of studies have uncovered an additional, nonredox function of NAD in cellular physiology. The founding member of this family, Sir2 in yeasts and its mammalian homologue SIRT1, catalyzes a unique reaction in which the cleavage of NAD and the deacetylation of substrate are coupled to the formation of O acetyl ADP ribose  A common feature of all these “NAD dependent” enzymes is the cleavage of the ADP ribose moiety of NAD with the concomitant release of nicotinamide , which therefore serves as an endogenous end product inhibitor .
Adults in all human societies face the task of supervising and socializing the young to follow norms for acceptable behavior. Accordingly, the influence of adults is a central theme in the study of adolescent deviant behaviors such as delinquency and drug use. Most of this work focuses on parents , the adults with primary responsibility for these tasks and with whom children initially spend the most time.
Influenza viruses belong to the family Orthomyxoviridae and are divided into three genera A, B, and C . Influenza A and B viruses are responsible for the annual epidemics in humans . Contemporary influenza B viruses can be divided into two genetically and antigenically distinct lineages known as Victoria and Yamagata lineages .
Protein arginine methyltransferase  5 belongs to a family of enzymes that transfer a methyl group from S adenosylmethionine to the arginine side chains of histones and other proteins . PRMT members are divided into four types  based on patterns of arginine methylation. PRMT5 is a type II enzyme and generates ω NG monomethyl and ω NG,N’ G symmetric di methylarginine residues.
Control over a previous stressful experience is an important factor in determining an organism’s neural and behavioral response to future stressful events. On the other hand, both the ES and IS session elicit strong and indistinguishable HPA axis hormone secretion profiles . IS can also enhance the behavioral struggling responses to subsequent novel stressors , and is also known to produce a sensitized neural response  in the hypothalamic paraventricular nucleus  to subsequent novel stress challenge .
The body responds to tissue damage and infection by mounting an inflammatory response that serves to protect the affected tissue from further insult. As a result, a thorough understanding of the many ways through which inflammation can be regulated is imperative for learning how to control and to treat inflammatory diseases . While there is some debate as to whether P. gingivalis derived LPS activates both TLR2 and TLR4, several studies indicate that both receptors can be stimulated by highly purified LPS or lipid A molecules, and by stimulation with the intact bacterium .
The cilium is a subcellular organelle that protrudes from the plasma membrane of almost every vertebrate cell. The cilium serves as a sensory organelle for developmental signals or as a motile structure that creates fluid flow . To date, nineteen BBS genes have been reported .
Mitochondria are essential for maintaining neuronal viability and neuronal function because of their ability to provide ATP, regulate calcium homeostasis and control Fe/S cluster biogenesis . Recent evidence demonstrates that mitochondria are highly dynamic structures that display significant variability in size, shape and distribution. Three such GTPases, Mfn1, Mfn2, and OPA1 regulate fusion in mammalian cells .
Ovarian cancer remains the most lethal gynecologic cancer, with approximately 15,000 ovarian cancer related deaths estimated in the United States in 2008 . Secretory leukocyte protease inhibitor  has been reported as one of the most commonly amplified genes in epithelial ovarian cancer , an observation that is explained in part by genomic amplification of the SLPI locus, 20q12 13 . Evidence also points towards direct roles for SLPI in tumor development and progression .
The obligate intracellular pathogen, Anaplasma phagocytophilum, survives and propagates primarily within neutrophils by reprogramming critical granulocyte functions. These modifications occur with active intracellular replication and with changes in host gene transcription. Moreover, delayed apoptosis is in part maintained by upregulated transcription of BCL2 family genes, whereas neutrophil recruitment is enhanced by upregulated chemokine gene transcription, especially IL8 .
Iron, copper, and zinc are three of the most abundant transition metals in biology and are essential components of most cells . The intracellular availability of these transition metals is tightly regulated , as both metal deficiency and excess are potentially toxic to a cell. To date, transition metal physiology within the oocyte has been studied exclusively using non mammalian model systems where the cell is larger and easily isolated in significant quantities, such as Xenopus laevis and Caenorhabditis elegans .
HIV drug resistance  testing is not routinely available in many resource limited settings , therefore ART program and site factors known to be associated with HIVDR should be monitored to optimize the quality of patient care and minimize the emergence of preventable HIVDR . In 2009, Namibia selected five World Health Organization Early Warning Indicators  and piloted abstraction at nine antiretroviral therapy  sites: ART prescribing practices, Patients lost to follow up  at 12 months, Patient retention on first line ART at 12 months, On time antiretroviral  drug pick up, and ARV drug supply continuity . Based on a review of available patient records, Namibia chose to pilot the following five EWIs: ART Prescribing practices, Patients lost to follow up  at 12 month, Patient retention on first line ART at 12 months, On time ARV drug pick up, and ARV drug supply continuity.
Rapamycin  is a specific inhibitor of the mTORC1 signaling complex, the central regulator of cell nutrient sensing and energy metabolism . Applied in high doses , rapa is a well known immune suppressant, used to prevent organ rejection . However, recent seminal studies highlighted the importance of nutrient sensing pathways during an immune response by showing that short term mTORC1 inhibition using low dose rapa  enhanced the development of antigen specific memory CD8 T cells during acute infection .
Compared with cone mediated photopic vision or rod mediated scotopic vision, mesopic vision is more complex because it involves both rods and cones, i.e., rod and cone signals interact with each other to contribute to our vision. Psychophysically, the activation of rods at mesopic light levels alters many cone dependent visual functions and perceptions , including color appearance , chromatic discrimination , and temporal processing  . Modern anatomical and physiological studies have identified three major neural retinogeniculate pathways in the primate visual system that convey retinal information to visual cortex, the magnocellular , parvocellular , and koniocellular  pathways .
Hyperthermia therapy for the treatment of solid tumors has been under investigation and used in clinical trials for several decades. at Duke University confirmed the European results for superficial tumors. One of the most significant barriers to wider acceptance of hyperthermia has been the lack of adequate temperature monitoring which has limited the optimization and control of the treatment at time of delivery .
Octadecyl rhodamine B  is a cationic amphiphile used in numerous studies including electronic energy transfer in organized molecular assemblies,  membrane structure,  and distances of closest approach between protein domains and membranes. The resultant FRET is analyzed in terms of a model that interprets acceptor surface density, and transfer efficiency with respect to separation distances or distances of closest approach  between the LDV FITC probe and multiple R18 acceptors incorporated into the plasma membrane . The plasma membrane is a system in which there is environmental heterogeneity.
Increasing evidence indicates that many cell types including fibroblasts respond to stresses, such as oxidative stress, inflammatory cytokines and various genotoxic agents, by engaging in a senescent like phenotype, which differs from replicative senescence in that no telomere shortening is detected . With compelling evidence for the existence of senescence in vivo , this irreversible cell cycle arrest state has been considered as an important tumor suppressor mechanism . Paradoxically, abundant evidence indicates that senescent fibroblasts secrete degradative enzymes, cytokines and growth factors, which closely resemble activated those of fibroblasts .
Liver ischemia and reperfusion injury , an exogenous Ag independent inflammatory event, occurs in multiple clinical settings, including partial hepatectomy, trauma, and transplantation. Our group was among the first to document that activation of TLR4 was required for the induction of IR triggered hepatic inflammation/damage . In agreement with others , we have reported that T lymphocytes, particularly of CD4 phenotype, represent the key mediators in IR triggered liver IRI .
Naked mole rats are eusocial African rodents that inhabit a cooperative social environment that is characterized by a reproductive hierarchy and division of labor . Naked mole rats live in large subterranean colonies where a single reproductively active breeding female, or queen, will mate and produce offspring for the entire colony . The queen actively suppresses reproduction in the remaining subordinate “worker” mole rats, and these animals engage in colony maintenance, defense, foraging and pup rearing .
Functional deficits after spinal cord injury  are caused primarily by destruction of axonal connections between neurons and failure of spontaneous axonal regeneration. Regeneration failure is attributed to factors intrinsic to injured neurons, including the inability to activate genetic growth programs  , and to extrinsic factors, including molecular inhibitors . An unfulfilled goal of spinal cord regeneration research remains the reinnervation of natural neuronal targets.
Nephrotoxic serum  mediated kidney disease is a well studied mouse model of glomerulonephritis  and has proven to be a valuable model providing insights into the mechanism of lupus nephritis . The severity of injury correlates directly with the dose of antibody injected. Infiltrated PMNs are activated by deposited immune complexes, which results in glomerular injury .
Peripheral neuropathy associated with agenesis of the corpus callosum is an autosomal recessive disease characterized by progressive sensorimotorneuropathy, mental retardation, dysmorphic features  and complete or partial agenesis of the corpuscallosum . In a mouse model where the KCC3gene was disrupted to produce a global knockout, an early onset and severe locomotordeficit similar to the crippling human peripheral neuropathy disorder was observed. The mice alsodeveloped high blood pressure , age related deafness , and renal dysfunction .
Reported rates of sphincter preserving surgery  for rectal cancer in the US range from 26.9% to 54.3% . Preservation of continence is an important goal, but will not be technically feasible in all patients. While reported rates have increased over time  with improved surgical technique  and preoperative imaging modalities , a large amount of institutional variability remains .
Rats display differential response to stress. Two groups of rat populations were identified, one exhibiting extreme aggression, and the other displaying docile behavior. It seems reasonable to suggest that just as not all rats within the same strain will be defeated , all rats within the same strain may not be aggressive .
Amyloid β  has been the most cited probable causative factor in Alzheimer’s disease  since the identification of Aβ in 1984 . As a result, significant amounts of research have been performed analyzing the relationship between Aβ42 and Aβ40 levels and cognitive performance in transgenic mice, and numerous articles have claimed a significant correlation between increased Aβ levels and cognitive decline  . One of the most common methods of experimentally assessing Aβ in AD is to subject transgenic AD mice to behavioral tests that assess memory/learning and then subsequently measure Aβ levels posttest .
Altered metabolism was among the earliest observed differences between cancer and healthy tissues. Under anaerobic conditions pyruvate is converted to lactate and ATP generation is limited . Overall, this change in metabolism in cancer cells is referred to as the Warburg effect and allows cells to meet the metabolic requirements of cell proliferation .
Chronic exposure to inorganic arsenic  in drinking water has been associated with cancer and it is suspected to cause other chronic diseases, including diabetes. There is, however, a high degree of inter individual variation in iAs metabolism and disease manifestation. Arsenic  methyltransferase  is the key enzyme in the pathway for the methylation of iAs.
Amide amide NOESY provides valuable distance constraints for calculating global folds of large proteins, which are especially important for proteins with high β sheet content. In extreme cases, such as β barrel proteins, amide amide constraints alone can be sufficient to define the overall topology. Amide amide NOESY is also useful for defining secondary structure elements and for confirming and extending backbone amide assignments.
Both coronary artery calcium  and the ankle brachial index  are measures of subclinical cardiovascular disease ., From a prevention perspective, it is important to monitor these subclinical CVD measures and determine which risk factors may contribute to their changes. In this regard, the direct effects of physical activity  on the development or progression of subclinical atherosclerosis are not well established. The ABI is used to detect peripheral artery disease , with a value < 0.90 being indicative of significant flow limiting atherosclerotic disease in the lower extremity,  which can lead to mobility loss  and mortality., However, it is unknown whether a population free of baseline CVD would show a similar association .
Failure to form an optimally vascularized and adequately invaded placenta may result in a range of pathologies, including recurrent miscarriage and pregnancy induced hypertension  . Many aspects of placental development are believed to be genetically determined and therefore genes responsible for placental development are obvious candidates for susceptibility to conditions associated with placental dysfunction, such as preeclampsia . We hypothesize that genes involved in early placental development and, in particular, trophoblast invasion, will be important regulators of placental invasion and that genetic variations in such genes may play a role in predisposing to the development of PIH .
Racial minorities are priority populations to reduce HIV/AIDS disparities in the United States. Despite these efforts, HIV related stigma undermines the optimal execution of these programs and adoption of healthier behaviors . HIV related stigma is associated with decreased likelihood of HIV testing,  , reducing HIV treatment engagement and maintenance  , reducing the quality of care for persons living with HIV/AIDS  , and reducing the efficacy of HIV preventive interventions behaviors   .
The intestine is exposed constantly to many antigens and innate immune stimuli, including dietary constituents, commensal bacteria and pathogens . The intestinal immune system must discriminate between these different agents, mounting protective immunity against pathogens, but developing active tolerance to harmless materials. If this process fails, inappropriate responses can lead to inflammatory bowel diseases and celiac disease.
It is well established that regular participation in vigorous and moderate intensity physical activity lowers the risk of cardiovascular disease  and CVD mortality. Accordingly, efforts to identify adults at elevated risk for physical activity associated cardiovascular complications usually center on assessment of CVD risk factors and/or diagnosis of occult CVD . For adults, such screening can take many forms and varies in formality and thoroughness, from physician led examination and testing, to cardiovascular health assessments by allied health professionals, to self administered health questionnaires .
It is well established that the NF κB family of transcription factors plays a critical role in B cell physiology,.
