In addition, mature B cells depend on continuous signaling through the canonical NF κB pathway, in which activation of the IKK complex, which consists of IKK1, IKK2  and NF κB essential modulator  , plays a central role. In contrast, the role of NF κB signaling in B cell development remains unclear, and is indeed highly controversial .
Many glomerular diseases accompany proteinuria, and structural damage develops along the downstream tubule. Clinical studies indicated that the level of proteinuria predicts the risk of developing into end stage renal failure . pointed to uncertainties underlying those studies.
The mesolimbic dopamine  pathway is composed of DA neurons in the ventral tegmental area  of the midbrain that project to the dorsal striatum, hippocampus, amygdala, and prefrontal cortex . This diffuse modulatory pathway is involved in attention to rewarding stimuli, learned behavior, and drug addiction . It is believed that VTA DA neurons are inhibited by local GABA interneurons, and projection GABA neurons from other brain regions .
Differentiated thyroid cancer  constitutes approximately 95% of thyroid carcinomas. DTC arises from aberrant follicular cells and is classified histologically as either papillary, follicular , or poorly differentiated., However, 723% of patients develop distant metastases, and two thirds of patients with distant metastases become RAI refractory. These patients have poor prognosis, and lack of effective therapy  makes their clinical management difficult.
The response of insects to microbial infections encompasses several distinct mechanisms . Melanin plug formation results from the polymerization of highly reactive orthoquinones, which are themselves produced by the oxidation of mono  or diphenol compounds. The fat body, a functional analogue of the vertebrate liver, synthesizes large quantities of potent antimicrobial peptides  that are released in the hemolymph, where they combat invading microorganisms.
The autonomic nervous system  plays a crucial role in the tonic maintenance of blood pressure . Additionally, it has been known for decades that MSNA among normotensive individuals of both sexes can vary greatly, despite similar levels of resting BP . investigated this paradox and showed that BP in young men is regulated by a balance between cardiac output   and sympathetic neural control of peripheral resistance .
Asthma is a complex heterogeneous disorder, with a broad spectrum of phenotypes ranging from mild to severe disease with varying degrees of responsiveness to standard steroid therapy. Traditionally, asthma is viewed as an eosinophilic airway disorder and research has focused on the role of T helper  2 cells and cytokines  in promoting these pathological features. Severe asthma differs from mild or moderate persistent asthma as it can often be characterized by neutrophilic inflammation in the presence or absence of classical TH2 induced eosinophilic inflammation.
Acanthamoeba keratitis  is a debilitating, extremely painful and vision impairing infection of the cornea caused by parasites of genus Acanthamoeba . In immunocompetent individuals, cornea is the single tissue most susceptible to infection by Acanthamoebae. Contact lens wear is thought to be the leading risk factor .
Protein splicing is an auto catalytic posttranslational process in which an in frame protein fusion, called an intein, is excised from the precursor protein with the concomitant ligation of the two flanking exteins, the N  and C exteins. Inteins have been widely used in protein engineering, labeling, purification, and control of protein functions. Inteins are also attractive drug targets as they are only found in unicellular organisms.
Over the past three decades, fretting and corrosion of modular taper connections has been studied in the context of total hip arthroplasty . While a considerable amount of research has been conducted to determine the prevalence and associated factors of fretting corrosion for modular junctions in THA , comparatively little is known about the risk of fretting corrosion in components for total knee arthroplasty  . Modularity affords the surgeon greater flexibility to restore knee function and stability for the patient.
Macrocyclic antibiotics were first introduced as a new class of chiral selectors for enantioseparations by HPLC and capillary electrophoresis in 1994. There are many structurally related oligophenolic glycopeptides belonging to the later group which have proven to be useful. They all show great selectivity over a wide rage of chiral molecules including amino acids, carboxylic acids and neutral compounds.
The differentiation fates of cells are often influenced by the intercellular signals that cells receive. This influence is usually manifested by a coordinated change in gene expression, often through the regulation of transcription factors within cells. A number of mechanisms have been described that are used during signaling to regulate the activities of transcription factors.
Prolonged hypertension is a prevalent and significant contributor to morbidity and mortality from heart failure. Therefore, a whole food approach rather than altered nutrients alone may be a more appropriate dietary intervention to alter hypertension and related pathologies, including heart failure . Previous studies by our group showed that in Dahl Salt Sensitive rats fed with a high salt diet, dietary intake of whole table grape powder significantly reduced blood pressure but did not prevent the development of hypertension.
Ganaxolone , the 3β methyl analog of the progesterone metabolite allopregnanolone, is the first neurosteroid related agent to be evaluated in man for the drug treatment of epilepsy . According to a widely held definition, neurosteroids are endogenous steroids that directly modulate neural excitability through non genomic actions. The most studied and best accepted molecular target of neurosteroids is GABAA receptors .
Protein kinases play key regulatory roles for many processes in cells, influencing signal transduction cascades by the phosphorylation of target proteins. As such, misregulated kinases are associated with many types of human disease. For example, activating mutations are a common and recurrent cause of diverse types of cancer .
Bronchopulmonary dysplasia  is the most common cause of pulmonary morbidity in premature infants. Infants with BPD are at increased risk for death, and survivors have life long morbidities. Despite the increased survival of extremely premature infants, BPD remains a major morbidity., Approximately 40% of infants born between 22 and 28 weeks gestation are diagnosed with BPD, defined as oxygen supplementation at 36 weeks postmenstrual age .,, Developing drugs to prevent or treat BPD, a major goal of neonatal care over the past 20 years, would substantially decrease long term morbidity and reduce healthcare costs of premature infants .
Arterially perfused right and left ventricular wedge preparations have proved valuable in the elucidation of the cellular basis for the electrocardiogram  and the mechanisms underlying a variety of arrhythmogenic syndromes, including the Brugada, long QT, and short QT syndromes  as well as conduction disease, catecholaminergic VT , and ischemia related arrhythmias. , In all cases, transmural heterogeneities, or differences in the action potential duration and morphology across the ventricular wall, have been shown to contribute prominently to arrhythmogenesis attending these syndromes . Timothy syndrome, also referred to as syndactyly associated long QT syndrome  or LQT8, is a multisystem disorder characterized by developmental defects causing dysmorphic facial features including round face, flat nasal bridge, receding upper jaw, thin upper lip and webbing of the toes and fingers .
Obesity is a major public health concern. Despite efforts to decrease obesity prevalence, the number of obese adults continues to rise. Exercise, and more commonly physical activity  are used to increase energy expenditure .
Loma Linda University, in collaboration with Northern Illinois University and UC Santa Cruz, has built and tested a pre clinical prototype proton CT  scanner based on a design presented previously . The system is designed for scanning of head sized phantoms and small animals. This report presents some of our preliminary test results for the scanner installed on the research beam line at Loma Linda University Medical Center  .
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are a diverse family of ligand gated cation channels found primarily in neuronal and muscle cells in humans. Structurally, each nAChR exists as either a homopentamer of α subunits or a heteropentamer of α and β proteins. The α6 containing nAChRs are primarily expressed at the presynaptic endings of catecholaminergic neurons in the brain, where their activity modulates the release of dopamine  and norepinephrine.
The human pathogen, Helicobacter pylori, has colonized the stomach of the majority of humans for millennia . The fact that only a small percentage of infected patients develop H. pylori related disease is believed to result from a combination of bacterial, host, and environmental factors . These include a high frequency of spontaneous mutation, gene conversion, transposition, and natural competence .
Testicular germ cell carcinoma  is the most common malignancyin younger men. Age, history of undescended testes, family history of testicular cancer, and race/ethnicity are the only established risk factors for the disease . Although not entirely consistent, associations observed for inguinal hernia, estrogen excess during gestation, maximal height attained, and the relatively young age at which testicular cancers are diagnosed compared to other cancers suggest that early life events are involved in testicular cancer carcinogenesis .
Sterol carrier protein 2  is known as a nonspecific intracellular lipid carrier. The majority of the members of the SCP 2 protein family are multidomain proteins . It is evident that single SCP 2 domain genes are expanded in mosquitoes.
As a term, hypoxia, in its most encompassing, indicates a diminished availability of oxygen. Outside the primary care setting, pulmonary disease associated hypoxia often significantly impacts well being, as the acute and overt consequences of labored breathing, dyspnea, and dizziness significantly suppresses the performance of activities of daily living . Less dramatic hypoxia precipitates a variety of symptoms that elicit the subjective feelings of sickness including malaise, fatigue, lethargy and loss of interest in the physical and social environment.
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services’ http://medicare.gov/hospitalcompare website makes available to the public quality of care data from over 4,000 hospitals in the United States. The website is designed such that patients can make side by side comparisons of hospitals that are geographically close to one another with the stated purpose to “help you make decisions about where you get your health care.” Among the measures that CMS reports on the website are a group of surgical process of care measures called the Surgical Care Improvement Project . CMS hopes that patients will be able to choose among surgical providers using SCIP data as a guidepost for differentiating higher quality centers.
Retail clinics provide a new model of urgent care. Located in retail stores such as pharmacy, discount, or grocery chains, these clinics require no appointments, are open on weekends and evenings, report little waiting time, and offer services limited to immunizations and treatment of minor acute conditions. Compared to outpatient physicians, retail clinics serve a population that is younger, more likely to be uninsured, and less likely to have a primary care physician.
Systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis  is a chronic inflammatory disease of childhood characterized by a combination of systemic features  and arthritis. Compared to normal monocytes, SJIA monocytes produce more pro inflammatory cytokines, including IL 1β and IL 6 . Uncontrolled monocyte activation may result from a killing defect in NK cells.
Hematopoietic cell transplantation  is a complex treatment procedure for various malignant and non malignant hematological disorders. Patients who undergo allogeneic HCT often experience post transplant complications which may lead to prolonged hospitalizations, readmissions or even death. Patients who may benefit from allogeneic HCT are often referred to larger treatment centers.
Proteases play a critical role in tumorigenesis by facilitating rapid cell cycling, mediating local invasion, fueling angiogenesis, and promoting metastasis . Specifically, cathepsin B , a lysosomal cysteine protease, has been shown to be involved in tumor initiation, hyperproliferation, and de differentiation and is up regulated in early human colon adenomas, carcinomas and metastasic lesions . The central role of CTSB in carcinogenesis suggests that it is not only a promising target for therapy or chemoprevention, but for molecular detection of neoplasia  .
Frontotemporal lobar degeneration  describes a heterogeneous group of non Alzheimer forms of dementia with onset of illness usually before 65 years of age arising from the degeneration of the frontal and temporal lobes. The main clinical syndrome in FTLD is frontotemporal dementia , though related disorders of semantic dementia  and progressive non fluent aphasia  stem from differing topographical distributions of what is considered to be a similar underlying pathology . However, a tau negative, ubiquitin positive  histology  is the most common histological change underlying FTLD and accounts for about 55% of cases .
Atherosclerosis has been linked to multiple risk factors including hypertension, elevated cholesterol, smoking, diabetes, and obesity. The adductor canal  is the region in which the femoral artery passes from the anterior thigh at the femoral triangle, between the vastus and adductor muscles, to the posterior thigh at the adductor hiatus where it exits the canal and becomes the popliteal artery . This region of the artery is relatively straight and free of major branches, yet is a prevalent site for disease , suggesting that mechanical factors are especially important here.
The senile plaque is a pathological hallmark of Alzheimer’s disease  and is composed of β amyloid , activated microglia, astrocytes and degenerating neurons . However, their exact role in the pathogenesis of AD remains to be elucidated. Aβ can activate microglia to produce cytokines and neurotoxins, hence promoting neurodegeneration .
T1 weighted gradient echo and T2 weighted spin echo imaging is a routine component of pediatric abdominal MRI for evaluation of the abdomen. Although respiratory triggering and navigation is routinely used for T2 weighted imaging and coronary imaging , there has been less attention to mitigating motion artifacts in T1 weighted imaging. One common approach is phase reordering .
Molecular screening lies at the foundation of biological tests in the clinic and at the bench, with specific examples including expression profiling of messenger RNA to connect drug responses to disease  and microRNA profiling for cancer diagnostics. Few commercial platforms exist and are limited by their coding scheme to scan up to ∼ 100 targets at a time. It can also be viewed as a limitation in throughput, when considering sample pooling .
5 Fluorouracil  based neoadjuvant chemoradiation therapy has become standard care for patients with advanced rectal cancer, resulting in decreased local recurrence rates, improved tolerance of prescribed therapy, improved organ preservation, and fewer treatment related complications . Molecular mechanisms resulting in therapeutic resistance in colorectal cancer  are poorly understood. Therefore, investigating molecular pathways associated with chemoradiation resistance should provide insight into tumor cell survival mechanisms and identify novel targets to improve CRC response to therapy .
Brugada syndrome  is a primary arrhythmogenic disease that can cause sudden cardiac death in young populations. It is inherited as an autosomal dominant trait, with approximately 20% of BrS cases caused by mutations in the SCN5A gene that encodes the α subunit of the cardiac sodium channel. Electrophysiological studies using animal models and mammalian cell lines have suggested that reduced sodium currents account for loss of the epicardial action potential  dome, which may lead to the exaggeration of the transmural AP dispersion in the right ventricular outflow tract and gives rise to the typical ST segment elevation in the right precordial electrocardiogram  leads.
Cystine  and cysteine residues are important for protein structure and function. In their reduced form, cysteines participate in the active site of different enzymes and, together with histidine, are the two most common residues involved in the coordination of zinc ions in Zn finger motifs  . In a seminal work,  showed that chemical shifts of proteins can be computed accurately by quantum chemical approaches.
Uterine leiomyosarcoma  is a high risk malignancy that is diagnosed in only a few thousand women each year in the United States. Median survival for women with advanced or unresectable, recurrent disease is less than one year. Treatment regimens that can achieve objective response in patients with advanced or recurrent uterine LMS include doxorubicin with or without ifosfamide  and fixed dose rate gemcitabine plus docetaxel .
Centrosome duplication in somatic cells is regulated so that the parental centrosome assembles one and only one daughter centrosome during each division cycle . Restricting the centrosome duplication cycle to once per cell cycle is crucial; the loss of this control can lead to abnormal centrosome duplication and tumorigenesis . Such a potential template would spatially restrict the formation of new centrioles, thereby limiting centrosome duplication to once per cell cycle.
Cancer of the skin is one of the most common types of human cancers. eIF4E controls the translation of various malignancy associated mRNAs which are involved in polyamine synthesis, cell cycle progression, activation of proto oncogenes, angiogenesis, autocrine growth stimulation, cell survival, invasion and communication with the extracellular environment. It was also reported that abrogation of the phosphorylation of the translation initiation factor eIF 2 causes malignant transformation of NIH3T3 cells .
Rabies is an important zoonotic disease that is estimated to kill at least 60 000 people worldwide each year . It is caused by the rabies virus, a non segmented, negative strand lyssavirus in the Rhabdoviridae family. Therefore, there is a great need to decrease RABV infection in dogs  and to develop new therapeutics to successfully extend the window of successful post exposure treatment from days to perhaps weeks or months.
Although diabetes prevalence and incidence continues to increase in the United States , the burden of diabetes varies greatly among race/ethnicity subgroups, with nationally representative data indicating African Americans having the highest prevalence followed by Latinos and whites . Diabetes burden also varies among US immigrants by place of birth, with foreign born Asians having the highest diabetes prevalence . When compared to US born individuals, diabetes prevalence is typically higher among foreign born individuals .
For decades, psychopathy researchers have theorized that the extreme affective and behavioral traits that characterize the disorder could arise through different causal mechanisms. Based on this etiological perspective, two classes of psychopaths have been proposed. In the “primary” subtype, psychopathy is presumed to arise directly from some fundamental intrinsic deficit, likely involving innate dysfunction in basic affective and attentional mechanisms.
Diffusion tensor MRI  has emerged as a promising tool for in vivo studies of muscle architecture , damage and inflammatory processes , microstructure , and for quantitative interpretation of blood oxygenation level dependent  contrast effects . Several recent quantitative muscle architecture studies have used DT MRI based muscle fiber tractography . and subsequently confirmed in studies of both skeletal  and cardiac  muscle.
An essential function of the visual system is to maintain stable representations of the environment across saccadic eye movements. As the eyes move, the retinotopic  positions of objects change, while their spatiotopic  positions remain stable. One idea is that the apparent stability of visual perception is due in part to neural “remapping”, updating the spatial receptive field of a neuron with each saccade, often before the saccade is completed.
For persons with severe mental illness , the period following discharge from inpatient psychiatric treatment is frequently a period of significant personal disequilibrium. Disengagement from mental health services and other supports jeopardizes the potential for future community adjustment, and warrants interventions that establish, maintain and strengthen adequate linkages to ongoing care . Researchers have focused on continuity of care  as a key indicator of quality of care in health services generally , including in the domain of mental health services  for persons with severe mental illness .
Helicobacter pylori infects half of the world’s population and is a causative agent of gastritis, peptic ulcer, gastric cancer and lymphoma . The host response to H. pylori provides an environment in which epithelial cells may be damaged by mediators of inflammation including cytokines , proteases and reactive oxygen and nitrogen species . Apoptosis is executed by the activation of caspases which act as effector molecules .
It is widely appreciated that with aging comes an increasing risk of cancer incidence, yet epidemiologic data indicate that at ages greater than about 60 years, the rate at which incidence increases begins to diminish, and at sufficiently old ages, may even decrease . This explanation is insufficient, however, as studies in animal models demonstrate the same pattern . A second contributing factor is variation among individuals in intrinsic cancer susceptibility, also referred to as frailty .
The blood brain barrier  is one of the most challenging factors for effective diagnosis and treatment of brain diseases. The poor clinical outcomes were presumably the result of the BBB and other challenges inherent in tumor drug delivery . Other works have demonstrated improvements in survival and decreased tumor growth in animal tumor models .
Postoperative hypersensitivity  can be defined as pain in a tooth associated with mastication or with contact with hot, cold, sweet, or sour stimuli that occurs 1 week or more posttreatment. Pain associated with clenching, which may indicate a restoration in hyperocclusion, is typically excluded from definitions of POH . A 2006 survey of the authors’ practice based research network  revealed that POH following posterior resin based composite  restorations is a common concern among its member practitioner investigators.
Long lived serological memory is the product of long lived memory B cells  and plasma cells . Bmem cells are long lived although their half life is as yet undefined in both mouse and man . Lastly, PCs residing in the bone marrow  are long lived cells, quiescent, terminally differentiated and produce Ig for long periods of time  .
Adolescents’ involvement in high risk sexual behaviors renders them vulnerable to unplanned pregnancies and sexually transmitted infection  . An emerging body of research has investigated this problem from the perspective of Life History Theory  . LHT, a branch of evolutionary biology, maintains that organisms maximize their reproductive success in response to environmental conditions .
We report here on a new genome scan meta analysis   of genome wide linkage scans  of schizophrenia . But an adequately powered GWLS can detect a signal from many kinds of susceptibility variants  in one or more loci in a region. Meta analysis can achieve much larger sample sizes than single studies.
Regaining mobility at the community level is a fundamental component of successful rehabilitation among stroke survivors . Being able to move around in the community is multidimensional capability, reflecting not only physical function but also cognitive function, social integration, and community participation. However, current research on poststroke mobility has focused primarily on visible physical attributes, for example, gait performance .
Stress is considered to be an important factor in the initiation, maintenance and relapse to alcohol abuse . Human laboratory studies have supported a strong positive relationship between experimentally induced stress and alcohol related behaviours. Furthermore, preliminary studies conducted in our laboratory have demonstrated that heavy drinkers who ordinarily engage in binge drinking consume more alcohol during stress, compared to heavy drinkers who do not binge .
Parkinson disease  is an age associated neurodegenerative disease clinically defined as a progressive movement disorder. PD is manifested as motor impairment with characteristic symptoms including resting tremor, rigidity, postural instability and bradykinesia. GSH depletion during PD precedes mitochondrial damage and dopamine loss and the degree of its loss has been observed to correlate with disease severity .
Dynamic cerebral autoregulation adjusts cerebral perfusion pressure  in response to arterial pressure fluctuations on a beat to beat basis within a relatively short time, ranging from 6 to 12 sec . Impairment of autoregulation is observed after traumatic brain injury  , and it is one of the mechanisms rendering the brain vulnerable to secondary ischemia and leading to fatal outcomes . Reliable assessment of cerebral autoregulation is clinically important for monitoring of patients requiring neurological intensive care .
Ras genes frequently sustain oncogenic mutations in human and rodent cancers and many immortalized cell lines can be transformed by introduction of activated Ras alleles such as H RasV12 . CCAAT/enhancer binding protein β  is a bZIP transcription factor that is post translationally regulated by growth factor signals transmitted through Ras kinases and their downstream effectors, as well as by oncogenic H RasV12 . Moreover, using Myc/Rafinduced transformation of C/EBPβ−/−bone marrow we found a critical role for C/EBPβ in proliferation and survival of macrophage like tumor cells .
Membrane proteins carry out their functions by changing their structures under specific environmental cues. The M2 protein forms a pH gated tetrameric proton channel in the virus envelope that is important for virus replication . The structure of a longer construct of the M2 protein containing the transmembrane domain was also reported .
The kidney derives from the intermediate mesoderm  that is a narrow strip of mesodermal cells sandwiched between the paraxial mesoderm and the lateral plate mesoderm. During embryogenesis, three sets of nephric structures  emerge from the nephric cord within the IM in succession from an anterior to posterior direction. In mammals, the metanephric kidney is the definitive kidney.
Stroke is the third major cause of death and the leading cause of long term disability in the U.S. Although men are at greater risk for stroke, older women have a higher risk for stroke than men , more fatal strokes, greater post stroke disability and mental impairment . However, hormone therapy to postmenopausal women significantly increases the risk for stroke , while, paradoxically, low dose oral estrogen based contraceptives does not significantly increase stroke risk in young women .
Allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  is a curative therapy for hematological malignancies , owing to the graft versus leukemia/lymphoma  effect mediated by alloreactive T cells, but graft versus host disease  mediated by the same alloreactive T cells remains as a major obstacle . Critical cellular interactions occur in secondary lymphoid organs such as mesenteric lymph nodes  that function as the meeting ground between host APCs and donor T cells . Activated T cells subsequently migrate to epithelial tissues such as the gut and skin to cause GVHD  .
Arterial spin labeling   is a magnetic resonance  method for the measurement of tissue perfusion, and has been most widely used for the evaluation of cerebral blood flow  . In combination with measurements of other MR parameters , evolving tissue status can be assessed over experimental time courses of minutes or hours  . Quantification of CBF using ASL methods is an active area of research .
In settings as diverse as malignant transformation to stem cell differentiation, when cells change their identities, epigenetic mechanisms mediate and finalize these new cellular identities. They arise de novo or progress from lower grade to higher grade over time . Recent work has assisted in classification of glioma tumors .
Cyclooxygenase II  is one of two enzymes that catalyze the rate limiting step in the synthesis of prostaglandins. In contrast to the widespread constitutive expression of COX 1, COX 2 is strongly inducible by a variety of agents in a limited number of cell types, including neoplastic tissues . COX 2 is associated with mammographic density, a significant risk factor for breast cancer .
We report a boy who received two allogeneic stem cell transplantations from umbilical cord donors to treat chronic granulomatous disease . The CGD was cured after the second transplantation, but 2½ years later, he was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy  . Examinations of his DNA, muscle tissue, and myoblast cultures derived from muscle tissue were performed to determine whether any donor dystrophin was being expressed .
The central auditory system changes as a function of experience, reorganizing throughout the lifespan according to available auditory input. One way of shaping the auditory system is to use auditory training exercises. Animal studies have shown that auditory processing can be altered with training and such changes have been attributed to a number of processes including: 1) greater numbers of neurons responding in the sensory field, 2) improved neural synchrony , and 3) de correlated activity among neurons, whereby each neuron responds differently in relation to their functional specificity relative to other members of the population  Scalp recorded brain activity  has been used to measure training related changes in humans.
Macroautophagy  is a catabolic process in which sequestered cytosolic components are delivered to a specialized compartment for degradation by lysosomal hydrolases. As this process has been elucidated, it is become apparent that autophagosome maturation is a complex sequential, step wise process that involves fusion with multiple components of the endo lysosomal system to produce autolysosomes with degradative capacity . VCP  is a highly conserved AAA+ ATPase that regulates a wide array of cellular processes.
Cortical bone is a composite material containing approximately 25% water by volume . In normal bone, most of the water is loosely bound to the organic matrix . Specifically, higher pore water fraction is seen in more porous and weaker bone, whereas higher bound water fraction  is seen in stronger bone.
The prognosis for patients with high grade brain tumors such as glioblastoma multiforme  remains poor. Photodynamic therapy  has been investigated as a postoperative treatment option following surgical tumor resection . PDT is a local form of treatment involving the administration of a tumor localizing photosensitizing drug that is spatially activated by light of a specific wavelength .
The turkey, Meleagris gallopavo, is native to North America and exists widely as both an important wild bird and the second most widely consumed poultry meat species in developed countries. It is surprising that the turkey, an ecologically and agriculturally important species, lacks a whole mtGenome sequence, which is one of the reasons why the phylogenetic relationship between the turkey and other avian species, especially gallinaceous birds, is also very little understood. The few avian phylogenetic studies that involved the turkey include that by , which used restriction enzyme based maps involving 161 restriction sites to describe relationships among the turkey and six other phasianoids that were different from those by traditional and protein based comparisons.
Health effects associated with air pollution have been studied in various cities around the world . Recent studies have found significant heterogeneity of PM associated health effects across cities or regions . More recent epidemiological studies have analyzed health outcomes associated with estimated exposure to PM related constituents , in addition to the standard PM mass metrics  .
Ornithine lipids  belong to a class of fatty acylated amino acids that do not contain either glycerol or phosphate. Finally, we have recently noted that OL’s are one of the lipid species that remain associated to cytochrome c oxidase , when purified and crystallized from R. sphaeroides  . To date, ornithine is the only type of non glycerol and non phosphate containing lipoamino acid reported to be present in R. sphaeroides .
Radiation exposure from a nuclear accident or a radiological attack may cause death from acute radiation syndrome , which results from radiation injury to key organ systems such as the hematopoietic system . Hematopoiesis is a radiation sensitive process and complications from radiation injury arise rapidly because radiation destroys both proliferating progenitor cells in the bone marrow and mature circulating cells in the peripheral blood . After 2  to 8 Gy radiation exposure, damage to the hematopoietic compartment occurs, with pancytopenia and anemia evident after lower radiation doses and peripheral blood and hematopoietic stem/progenitor cell  loss along with pancytopenia, marrow aplasia and spontaneous bleeding after higher doses of 48 Gy  .
Human adolescents are at an increased risk of alcohol use. According to the 2006 Monitoring the Future National Survey, 6% of 8th graders, 19% of 10th graders and 30% of 12th graders reported being drunk within the past 30 days . Similarly, adolescent rats show high levels of social behavior, with these social interactions being essential for developing the ability to express and understand intraspecific communication signals .
Ischemic heart disease is the leading cause of death worldwide. Despite the reduction in mortality rates, as a result of the use of pharmacological agents and percutaneous and surgical coronary intervention, the permanent net loss of contractile cardiac tissue initiates sequelae of congestive heart failure, life threatening arrhythmias, and ultimately death. One of the fundamental principles of this approach is that the newly formed tissue must maintain its own blood supply to support cellular proliferation, induce structural support and promote tissue regeneration.
Making medical decisions in the context of serious illness is stressful, especially for surrogate decision makers. Although advance directive forms were developed in part to ease the burden of surrogate decision making,   a growing body of literature demonstrates that surrogates often feel unsupported and experience emotional burden and post traumatic stress. Understanding the factors associated with surrogate stress is critical given the important role of surrogates in end of life decision making.
Control of mixing and transport in capillary bioreactors and biofouled capillary membranes is an important engineering challenge in industrial and biomedical systems. Staphylococcus epidermidis is a gram positive, coagulase negative member of the bacterial genus Staphylococcus. Commonly found on human skin, S. epidermidis is the most common species used in laboratory tests.
Polychlorinated biphenyls  were commercially manufactured in the United States from 1930 to 1970 for use as dielectrics in transformers and capacitors, and as cooling fluids in hydraulic systems. Nevertheless these compounds remain in use and in our environment today and represent a potential human health hazard  . The carcinogenicity of PCBs in humans has been examined in several epidemiological studies, and associations have been noted in some studies between PCB exposure and cancers of the liver, biliary tract, and intestines, as well as malignant melanoma .
Freezing of biological tissue is emerging in biomedical applications to treat diseased tissues  or to preserve tissues . Cryotherapies are minimally invasive surgical techniques to destroy malignant tissues by freezing while sparing surrounding normal tissues. This can provide a prolonged time window for transplantation and implantation surgery, and ultimately “off the shelf” availability of engineered tissues .
Depression is an often overlooked but pervasive disorder having a lifetime prevalence of 16% among the U.S. population  with women twice as likely to be affected as men . In women, depression has been studied in relation to polycystic ovarian syndrome , in vitro fertilization treatment success , and premenstrual dysphoric disorder . In addition, women with mental disorders, including clinical depression, are more likely to report menstrual cycle disturbances .
It is evident from pre clinical studies that tumor cells can be recognized by the immune system . Current research has focused on improving tumor vaccine strategies in order to elicit more potent anti tumor immune responses . However, the promising results from the pre clinical data have not translated into significant clinical benefit for cancer patients.
Musculoskeletal models of the shoulder typically represent muscle lines of action as a collection of line segments . These models have been useful for a wide variety of applications including simulating surgical procedures , investigating wheelchair mechanics , and controlling neuroprostheses . However, shoulder muscles have characteristics that make them challenging to represent using line segment representations.
Our knowledge of the prospective association between two major public health problems of adolescents, depression and the use of addictive substances, remains limited. Smokeless tobacco use in adolescence has been infrequently studied, but smokeless tobacco is used in early adolescence, and efforts to ban it in some countries, including Finland, have not restricted its use . Cross sectional designs suggest that smokeless tobacco may associate with mood related symptoms  .
Pelvic floor muscles  in women, which support the pelvic organs, include the levator ani and the coccygeus muscles, but do not include the external urethral sphincter  or the external anal sphincter. The PFM in female rats has a similar bowl shaped anatomic organization as humans with some exceptions, such as lack of a recognized puborectalis muscle. , There are conflicting opinions regarding levator ani and pudendal nerve innervation of the PFM.
Atherosclerosis contributes to nearly one half of the mortality in the western world and is growing in epidemic proportions in rapidly developing countries in Asia. High levels of blood cholesterol, high blood pressure, obesity, diabetes, stress, and lifestyles including smoking are among the risk factors contributing to this alarming increase in this disease. However, these therapeutic modalities do not decrease atherosclerotic plaque burden.
RNA molecules are extremely versatile functional biopolymers that participate in key informational pathways that characterize living organisms on Earth. Far from being simply coding for proteins as mRNA, a plethora of non coding RNAs are actively contributing to proteins translation as ribosomal RNAs and transfer RNAs, and various catalytic and regulatory functions as ribozymes, riboswitches and regulatory elements. Understanding how RNA folding and assembly can be controlled in order to create any desired functional shapes made of RNA is therefore an important and challenging problem, with numerous implications in the developments of therapeutics and tools for nano medicine and synthetic biology applications .
Chelatable iron and other transition metals such as copper catalyze formation of highly reactive hydroxyl radical  from H2O2 and superoxide , which damages DNA, proteins and membranes . Cytoprotection by desferal in various models of oxidative stress and hypoxia/ischemia suggests a role for iron in the pathogenesis of injury . In hepatocytes, generation of reactive oxygen species , including H2O2, O2• , and OH•, contributes to lethal cell injury from oxidative stress, various hepatotoxicants and ischemia/reperfusion .
The myriad of changes that occur in adolescence require substantial revision to the systems responsible for understanding one's experience. The socialization style observed among girls likely reflects the nature of both the biological changes initiated by adolescence, and the socio cognitive transformations that accompany this maturation . In the service of establishing and maintaining these essential social norms, adolescent girls are known to employ a unique form of aggression to enforce social compliance.
Macroevolutionary studies of neuroanatomy tend to show coordinated variation of different brain structures that are related to developmental constraints. Alternatively, mosaic evolution will be more likely when different brain regions are relatively independent from one another, thus giving rise to distinct modules. Although this relative interdependence of different brain components has a macroevolutionary result, it also has a microevolutionary origin and thus requires an intraspecific context to be addressed .
Studies on both animals  and humans  have suggested a role for pathogens in the etiology of atherosclerosis, including cytomegalovirus , herpes simplex virus , hepatitis A virus , Helicobacter pylori , and particularly Chlamydia pneumoniae . The observation that periodontitis is related to atherosclerosis  further supports an infectious etiology. In addition to individual pathogens, pathogen burden  has been also found in association with atherosclerosis  .
Almost half of all deaths due to childhood pneumonia occur in sub Saharan African . For over two decades, these guidelines have recommended classification into four classes of severity based on clinical signs at initial presentation with inpatient management reserved for the severe categories   . Recently, however, the WHO undertook a major revision of these guidelines.
Stroke patients with higher density of cerebral blood vessels fare better and survive longer than those with lower vascular density . Arteriogenesis and angiogenesis serve as efficient mechanisms to restore perfusion with oxygen and nutrition in the ischemic brain and promote long term functional recovery in patients treated with or without thrombolysis for stroke . Adult bone marrow stromal cells  selectively target the injury site, participate in arteriogenesis and angiogenesis, and induce a neovascular response resulting in a significant increase in blood flow to the ischemic area which aids in repair of injured brain .
The microbiota plays an essential role in regulating intestinal homeostasis through its capacity to modulate various biological activities ranging from barrier, immunity and metabolic function. Whether microbial dysbiosis observed in CRC patients is a consequence of the pathology or is a causal, active modifier of disease outcome remains to be defined. Importantly, inflammation experienced by IBD patients is associated with a higher abundance of Enterobacteriaceae/E.
HDACs are a family of enzymes that were initially characterized as histone deacetylases . Reversible histone acetylation on lysine residues is a dynamic and highly regulated post translational modification which plays a central role in gene regulation and chromatin remodeling . This is due in part to the existence of at least eleven HDAC family members in the human genome .
B cell commitment, survival, and immunoglobulin assembly are all products of a carefully orchestrated network of transcription factors guiding gene expression. Deletion of either PU.1 or Ikaros in mice leads to a block in HSC differentiation into CLPs and a lack of expression of downstream B cell specific transcription factors. The transcription factors E2A, EBF and Pax5 are each required for the transition from CLPs to the pro B cell stage.
All of us experience the involuntary shaking of the hands which is physiological tremor. This tremor places severe constraints on motor performance. Individuals with exceptionally precise motor control, such as champion dart players and microsurgeons, have very low tremor; drugs which artificially reduce tremor are banned in many sports.
Inhibition of AR function is standard therapy for the initial presentation of disseminated prostate cancer . However, treatment almost invariably fails leading to the emergence of castration resistant prostate cancer . The AR functions as a driver of G1 progression through cross communication with the cell cycle machinery and regulation of transcription of genes that control the G1 S transition .
Chemokines are 812 kDa sized secreted proteins that mediate the directed migration  of leukocytes. The chemokine family encompasses nearly fifty members, which are classified based on the relative position of their conserved N terminal cysteine residues . Chemokines elicit intracellular responses via G protein coupled receptors .
The Botzinger complex  is a neuronal population of expiratory  neurons with an augmenting  discharge pattern within the most rostral extension of the ventral respiratory column  in the vicinity of the retrofacial nucleus . The BOT region and surrounding reticular formation also contain some E units with decrementing  discharge patterns  as well as other respiratory related neurons . During cough, the activation of E dec units promotes the termination of the cough I period.
Measures of arterial pulse pressure  variation and left ventricular  stroke volume  variation induced by positive pressure breathing vary in proportion to preload responsiveness. However, the accuracy of commercially available devices to report dynamic LV SV variation has never been validated . We compared the accuracy of measured arterial PP and estimated LV SV reported from two FDA approved aortic flow monitoring devices, one using arterial pulse power  and the other esophageal Doppler monitor  .
Ischemic stroke is an important contributor to morbidity and mortality. Pediatric stroke may occur in as many as 1 in 4000 births  and complications due to hypoxia/ischemia are common . Balancing the risks and benefits of tPA is one of the central issues in managing patients with stroke and other cerebrovascular disorders accompanied by thrombosis and ischemia.
Bone marrow derived mesenchymal stromal cells  have been widely investigated for their therapeutic potential in both autoimmune and alloimmune diseases . By comparison the successful clinical translation of BMSC therapy is still in question  and the mechanism of action remains largely unknown , representing an obstacle to further clinical applications of BMSC . These mechanisms, however, do not explain the suppression of adaptive immunity observed when BMSC are used to treat alloimmunity .
In the mammalian forebrain, most excitatory synapses are located on dendritic spines, small protrusions of dendrites. Spine morphology modulates synaptic properties and the ability to undergo plasticity, . Accordingly, spines can undergo morphological changes in live animals following changes in sensory input, and during social interactions, stress, environmental enrichment, learning and other behavioral conditions .
Ideally, family implies a functional group living situation in which opportunities exist for economic and instrumental cooperation, informal communications, and reciprocated social and emotional obligations among family members . Often, family involves the rearing of and caring for children. Thus, family is a manifestation of an important human characteristic of our nature as social beings .
In multi cellular organisms, a variety of biochemical, physiological and behavioral processes undergo rhythmic fluctuations that closely parallel the time course of the daily solar cycle. These 24 hour or circadian rhythms are normally entrained or synchronized to external time cues but persist even under constant environmental conditions. For example, mutant mice with targeted disruption of Per2 are distinguished by altered rhythms of Bmal1expression and arrhythmic patterns of locomotor activity  .
Few studies have analyzed the cohort effects of lifecourse socioeconomicposition  on racial disparities in body mass index  trajectories. We assessedthe contribution of lifecourse SEP on racial differences in BMI trajectories among twodifferent age cohorts of women . Four waves of the Americans' Changing Lives' study  were usedto compute BMI trajectories for 2194 Black and White women.
Protein isoforms can differ in their biological activity, regulatory properties, temporal and spatial expression and intracellular location . Protein isoforms harbor variations in the amino acid sequence and can originate from separate genes that have evolved from a single ancestor gene generated by gene duplication or from a single gene by alternative splicing. The myofilament proteins, arranged to form the sarcomere of a myofibril, are the main regulators in striated muscle  contractility.
A major limitation in human information processing concerns the ability of the brain to process two temporally close meaningful stimuli. At present, it is unclear why physically identical information sometimes does and sometimes does not reach awareness. For example, T2 detection has been found to benefit from a diffusion of attention .
TiO2 nanoparticles  are a promising vehicle for the delivery of therapeutic and diagnostic agents. Moreover, the semiconductor and photocatalytic properties of TiO2 make it a potent source of electrons and electropositive holes as well as reactive oxygen species —all of which can react with cellular DNA., , , Furthermore, the subcellular localization of NCs is another important factor in determining their biological function., Therefore, the ability to control the uptake of NCs and target them towards specific cells and subcellular compartments would be very useful. To achieve this goal, we have created TiO2 NCs that can bind Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor .
Temperature affects our lifestyle, as it conveys information about the environment and influences our comfort level. Animals need to process a variety of temperature stimuli appropriately to exhibit a proper behavioral response. ThermoTRP channels , which are evolutionally conserved temperature sensors , detect a wide range of temperatures and contribute to behaviors in many animals, including Drosophila .
The early down regulation of CB1  was first observed in post mortem tissue of HD patients and occurs in most mouse models of HD, including R6/2, R6/1, YAC128 and HdhQ150 mice . Down regulation of CB1   the neuronal population expressing the highest amount of CB1 receptors   precedes the loss of other synaptic proteins, including dopamine D2 and D1 receptors and striatal synaptophysin . Together, this evidence led to the hypothesis that CB1 dysfunction controls downstream pathological events occurring in HD patients and mouse models .
Photoreceptor cells are the sensory neurons in eye that absorb light to initiate vision. Since these cells are post mitotic, loss of photoreceptors results in permanent blindness. Insults that can kill photoreceptors include genetic mutations, mechanical injury and oxidative damage .
The pharmacokinetics of mycophenolic acid , the pharmacologically active component of mycophenolate mofetil  are well described in transplant recipients and population pharmacokinetic models are reported. After oral intake, MMF is rapidly and completely absorbed, hydrolyzed into the active MPA, which is 98% bound to plasma proteins, including albumin. MPA is primarily metabolized by glucuronidation to form the 7 O glucuronide conjugate  which then undergoes elimination via the kidneys or enterohepatic recirculation back to MPA in the gastrointestinal tract.
The size and asymmetry of neurons result in a non uniform distribution of demand for mitochondrial functions such as ATP synthesis and calcium homeostasis. As a result, neurons redistribute their mitochondria in response to immediate and local physiological conditions, both in vivo and in vitro . Mitochondria are concentrated in areas of the neuron expected to have higher ATP consumption; indeed, synapses were first recognized ultrastructurally based in part on their high density of mitochondria .
Inwardly rectifying potassium channels, and Kir2 channels in particular, are crucial for setting a sharp threshold for excitation in excitable cells, as well as stabilizing the resting membrane potential in both excitable and non excitable cells. Kir2.1 knockout mice die shortly after birth; however, studies in neonates reveal a lack of IK1 current, broadened action potentials and ineffective clamping of the resting membrane potential leading to spontaneous action potentials . Variations in Kir2 function have been implicated in a number of cardiac diseases.
In the United States depression affects up to 2.5 percent of children and 8.3 percent of adolescents . The selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor  fluoxetine  is approved by the Food and Drug Administration for child and adolescent depression . SSRIs are also used in anxiety and conduct disorders such as separation anxiety and aggression in these populations.
Endogenous serum peptides that carry important information of disease are considered to be great potential biomarkers for clinical diagnosis. Hepcidin, a hormone peptide, has been recognized as a potential biomarker for iron related disease. Several methods have been developed for quantifying hepcidin, including antibody based,  and mass spectrometry  based methods.
Discovery of antibodies to citrullinated protein antigens  has improved our understanding of the seropositive subset of rheumatoid arthritis . ACPAs and rheumatoid factor  are present in serum of RA patients years before clinical diagnosis of RA. While these autoantibodies, particularly anti cyclic citrullinated peptide , are highly specific  for RA, the sensitivity in those who later develop RA is notably lower .
Pain present 6 months following root canal treatment  may be either of odontogenic or nonodontogenic origin. This is importance because treatments and prognoses are different; therefore the aim of this study was to provide specific diagnoses of patients reporting pain 6 months after receiving initial orthograde RCT . We enrolled patients from the Midwest region of an existing prospective observational study of pain after RCT.
The loss of skeletal muscle mass and alterations in contractile function known as sarcopenia is a common, though poorly understood phenomena of aging . Although the origins of sarcopenia are yet unknown, oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction are believed to play a role . Recent evidence in sarcopenic gastrocnemius muscle of young and old rats revealed increased proteolysis, reactive oxygen species  overproduction and vulnerability to apoptosis .
Bioluminescence is a naturally occurring phenomenon in certain species such as the firefly resulting from oxidation of luciferin to oxyluciferin in the presence of molecular oxygen and adenosine triphosphate. This reaction is catalyzed by the enzyme luciferase and results in the emission of light . Bioluminescence imaging  is an in vivo optical imaging technique that detects light emitted from firefly luciferase expressing cells by special charge coupled device  camera .
Mechanical loading of cartilage explants can regulate chondrocyte metabolism and direct growth and remodeling . Flexure is a physiologically relevant mode of deformation for many types of cartilage including those located within the nose, ears, and ribs. To better understand the biomechanical functions of these tissues, tests such as three point or curved beam bending have been used to characterize nasal septal, auricular, costal, and tracheal cartilages, with moduli reported in the range of 49 MPa .
Obesity is a significant public health problem, and the impact of caring for increasing numbers of obese individuals is being felt worldwide and across medical disciplines. Both animal and human studies have demonstrated that obesity is associated with adverse health consequences, including susceptibility to a diverse group of diseases affecting the cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, and endocrine systems . A growing body of literature has been devoted to examination of the pathophysiologic mechanisms that link obesity to these maladies, with a general consensus that chronic inflammation provides the connection  .
Insulin degrading enzyme  is an 110 kDa zinc metalloprotease that belongs to the M16A family ; . IDE also plays a role in preventing formation of amyloid deposits by degrading amyloid β , a key peptide for the development of Alzheimer's disease; ; ; ; . Outside of insulin and Aβ, several short peptides with molecular weights of 310 kDa have been shown to serve as substrates of IDE, such as insulin like growth factor II ; , amylin, glucagon, transforming growth factor α , and atrial natriuretic peptide  .
Human transplant recipients harbor significant numbers of alloreactive memory T cells generated by previous encounter to alloantigens, via heterologous immunity or homeostatic proliferation as a result of lymphoablation . Alloreactive memory T cells contribute to both acute and chronic allograft rejection, indicating that current im munosuppressive therapies do not inhibit the generation or maintenance of T cell memory . Donor reactive memory T cells can precipitate costimulatory blockade resistant allograft rejection .
myc is well known for its role in tumorigenesis when overexpressed and N myc  is most strongly associated with primitive “blast” nervous system tumors neuroblastoma, medulloblastoma, retinoblastoma, and glioblastoma . They can activate and repress the transcription of specific protein coding genes, influence expression of miRNA and rRNA, drive DNA synthesis, and globally influence chromatin structure. There is growing evidence of key roles for myc genes at endogenous levels in both somatic stem cells such as NSC and ESC.
Higher arterial stiffness and pressure pulsatility, hallmarks of aging, are associated with increased risk for cardiovascular disease  morbidity, including incident hypertension. Carotid femoral pulse wave velocity , the current reference standard measure of global aortic stiffness, is associated with CVD events including coronary heart disease, stroke, and CVD mortality. Arterial calcification, in turn, is also associated with CVD events and mortality, whether assessed in the coronary arteries ,,  thoracic aorta ,,  or abdominal aorta .
The mammalian target of rapamycin  regulates cell growth and metabolism. Cancer cells have increased metabolic autonomy. Stearoyl CoA desaturase 1  is a critical mediator of fatty acid synthesis.
Many of the decisions we make on a day to day basis require balancing out factors driving the desire to achieve good results , with those associated with avoiding potentially perilous situations. Such decisions often benefit from past experience, and are therefore supported by adaptive mechanisms for learning from positive and negative outcomes. When confronted with potential gains and losses, individuals differ substantially, both in their choices and in their neural responsiveness to reinforcement .
Hepatitis C virus  coinfection is common among HIV infected individuals worldwide; it has been estimated that 45 million HIV infected individuals are chronic HCV carriers. The risk for liver disease progression has been shown to be two to six times higher in HIV HCV coinfected patients than HCV mono infected patients. In addition, recent studies have shown that coinfected patients are diagnosed at a younger age, have more advanced HCC, and have shorter survival time than HCV mono infected patients.
That estradiol modulates neural functions like mood, affect, anxiety, fear and vulnerability to addictive drugs in addition to its well documented role in reproduction is now well accepted . Moreover, estradiol also exerts influence over higher order cognitive function, predominantly enhancing learning and memory . ERs may also act directly at nuclear sites  to regulate transcription .
Cardiovascular disease, including coronary artery and peripheral vascular disease, is the leading cause of mortality in the United States and accounted for over 30% deaths in 2004. Synthetic materials, including Dacron and expanded polytetrafluoroethylene , have been used as vascular grafts under conditions when patients do not have suitable autologous vessels, but high rate of thrombosis formation has limited the use of these synthetic grafts as small diameter vascular grafts. However, these tissue engineered vascular grafts either lack sufficient mechanical strength or require long culture periods to obtain the mechanical strength that is required for implantation,, and are thus cost  and labor intensive .
Glioblastoma  is the most common malignant primary brain tumor in adults. Four out of every 100,000 Americans are diagnosed with GBM, which represents ~15% of all primary brain tumors . Once the diagnosis of GBM has been made, the overall median survival time for patients treated with surgery, radiation and chemotherapy is only 14 to 15 months .
Protein isoforms coded by alternatively spliced pre mRNAs expand the functional repertoire of genes. The significance of alternative splicing to neurons is underscored by the variety of neurological diseases that result from its dysregulation  . Mutations in the fragile X mental retardation gene  result in fragile X syndrome, a leading form of heritable mental retardation.
More than 70 million Americans live with cardiovascular diseases, which lead to >910,000 deaths each year. Accurate diagnosis is highly desirable so that appropriate therapy can be given before irreversible damage occurs in patients with coronary artery disease . MPI is capable of identifying regional abnormalities in coronary artery and determining their physiological relevance to myocardial function and viability.
L selectin is a type 1 transmembrane adhesion protein expressed by leukocytes. It plays a critical role in directing neutrophils to sites of inflammation by facilitating their accumulation along the vascular wall in a direct and indirect manner . L selectin cleavage occurs by cis protease activity and is abrogated by hydroxymate inhibitors of zinc dependent metalloproteases .
Human plasma high density lipoprotein  particles have been classically defined as a group of pseudomicellar, quasispherical protein/lipid complexes with hydrated densities in the range of 1.063 to 1.210 g/ml. Apolipoprotein A I  is the most common protein constituent, accounting for approximately 70% of HDL protein mass, with apoA II comprising 15 20%. The remaining 10 15% of protein mass is composed of minor amphipathic proteins, including apoC’s, apoE, apoD, apoM and apoA IV, with enzymes and lipid transfer proteins such as lecithin:cholesterol acyl transferase  and cholesteryl ester transfer protein .
Lynch Syndrome, also called hereditary non polyposis colon cancer , is an autosomal dominant inherited cancer predisposition syndrome characterized by predisposition to develop a number of cancers at an early age and high penetrance with mutation carriers having a significantly increased lifetime risk of developing colorectal  and other forms of cancer . A small proportion of cases have been shown to be caused by germline mutations in two other MMR genes, MSH6 and PMS2; however, PMS2 mutations and MSH6 mutations are often associated with weaker family histories, later ages of diagnosis and potentially a different cancer spectrum . In addition, there are apparently polymorphisms in MMR genes that may cause increased risk of developing cancer .
While interferon  plays crucial roles in the defense against viral infection, excessive production may lead to pathogenesis of autoimmune diseases . Both isoforms of ADAR1 convert adenosine to inosine on its double strand RNA substrates, potentially changing the coding information on mRNAs . Besides its role in editing RNAs, ADAR1 exerts additional effects through binding to RNA  or through interacting with other proteins .
Diffuse gliomas are common and variably aggressive primary central nervous system tumors, currently stratified by the World Health Organization  into three malignancy grades: II, III and IV. Glioblastoma  is generally classified as a diffuse glioma of astrocytic morphology with microvascular proliferation and/or necrosis. Determination of grade , is made primarily on the basis of tumor proliferative activity , along with additional criteria of increased cellularity and nuclear atypia.
Embryonic stem cells harbor a consistent capacity for multi lineage differentiation . Stem cell based cardiopoiesis originates from undifferentiated progenitors that are specified into early cardiac mesoderm . Yet, the risk of unregulated growth and neoplastic transformation, inherent to pluripotency, limits therapeutic applications .
Maternal psychosocial stress has been associated with adverse maternal child outcomes. Vulnerable women’s experiences with stressors during pregnancy and their desires and priorities for appropriate and useful stress reduction interventions for pregnant women are not well understood . Qualitative interviews with low income, urban women explored their stress exposures and reactions during pregnancy, ways that stressors overlapped and interacted, and their priorities for stress reduction.
Alcohol abuse is a leading cause of preventable death and illness, and the economic cost of alcohol abuse is estimated to be $185 billion annually in the USA alone. Adoption and twin studies suggest that alcohol use disorders  are 50 60% genetically determined,. Insight into cerebellar contributions to AUD risk comes from studies of the low level of response  to EtOH phenotype, which is defined as requiring a higher dose of alcohol  to achieve a given effect.
Aging is associated with significant changes in limb skeletal muscles, of which sarcopenia is the most evident. However, the effect of aging on extraocular muscle  structure and function is not as well studied. Aging increases the latency of eye movement onset and decreases peak velocity, acceleration and range of eye movement .
Attention and emotion impart a value system to sensory processing, allowing the central nervous system to mold sensory experience into a subjective landscape . Imaging studies of attentional pain modulation commonly show that decreased pain during distraction is paralleled by decreased activity in thalamo cortical ascending pain pathways . Such areas include thalamus, primary and secondary somatosensory cortices , insular cortex , and anterior cingulate cortex  .
Chemical cross linking coupled with mass spectrometry is a commonly used technique to characterize proteins, interactions and complex topologies . Among all these types of products, the desired inter cross linked products are of low abundance, which creates significant challenges for detection and identifcation, , . In their UVPD strategy, only the conjugated peptides were dissociated under UV condition, which specially distinguished the conjugated peptides from the other non conjugated peptides.
Obesity is a complex disorder with heterogeneous adiposity phenotypes. One recognized phenotype is the metabolically healthy obese  individual who, despite having excessive body fatness, seems to be protected from adipose associated metabolic abnormalities . There is no consensus on how to define the MHO phenotype.
Glycolytic enzymopathies are severe heritable human diseases that result from specific mutations affecting enzymes involved in anaerobic metabolism. Familial triosephosphate isomerase  deficiency is an autosomal recessive disorder that manifests in patients as anemia, progressive locomotor impairment and neurodegeneration, and premature death . However the pathogenesis of this disease is not well understood.
In our recent paper describing the heating of human skin by mm waves we used a homogeneous skin model . We showed that mm waves in spite of shallow penetration into the skin  were able to heat much deeper subcutaneous layers. In the homogeneous model, the skin is considered to be a tissue with uniform physical and thermo physical properties and with uniform blood flow over the entire tissue volume.
The transition between wakefulness, NREM, and REM sleep is accompanied by neuromodulatory changes. Accompanying these changes in neuronal activity are variations in energy metabolism. In waking and REM sleep overall brain metabolism is high in both animals and humans .
MicroRNAs , a class of small noncoding RNAs, serve as key post transcriptional regulators of gene expression and mRNA translation , . miRNAs are increasingly recognized as mediators in a variety of biological processes including cardiovascular development and disorders , . Highly specific miRNA expression patterns have been reported in association with heart failure , , myocardial infarction , and cancer .
Over the past decade, yeast display has emerged as a leading technology for the selection and characterization of monoclonal antibodies  from both immune and nonimmune libraries. The majority of yeast display antibody libraries that have been constructed to date utilize the single chain variable fragment  format, and there are only three examples in the literature of combinatorial antigen binding fragment  yeast display libraries. ScFvs are generally less stable and more prone to aggregation than Fab fragments,, and due to their decreased stability, scFvs generally bind with lower affinity than Fabs.
Inhibition studies are routinely performed to gain insight into the structure and function of transporters, particularly when a transporter crystal structure is not available. For example, two project areas in our laboratory involve the apical sodium dependent bile acid transporter  and the organic cation/carnitine transporter , where transport inhibition studies by novel compounds and diverse drugs has yielded pharmacophore models and quantitative structure activity relationships  . Determining type of inhibition can also help in understanding of interaction of inhibitors at the binding site of transporter.
Mesial temporal lobe epilepsy  is the most common type of epilepsy in adults , and frequently becomes resistant to drug therapy, leaving ultimately only a neurosurgery option to control seizures. TLE develops following a variety of insults, including brain injury and status epilepticus . Precipitating insults are followed by a characteristic seizure free “latent period” lasting months or even years in humans .
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  has prioritized interventions to reduce sexual risk taking among HIV positive persons . Disclosure of HIV positive status to sexual partners may reduce risk of transmission in serodiscordant partnerships . However, the association between HIV serodisclosure and sexual risk behavior is complex, varying by person , partner  and situation level factors .
PTEN , the tumor suppressor gene located at 10q23.3, is known to participate in the pathogenesis of a wide variety of hereditary cancer syndromes and sporadic malignancies . Germline mutations in PTEN have been described in hamartoma syndromes, including Cowden syndrome , BannayanRileyRuvalcaba syndrome , Proteus syndrome , and a Proteus like syndrome . In cutaneous melanoma, PTEN is the second most frequently altered tumor suppressor , whereas in cultured melanoma cell lines, the frequency of intragenic mutations and homozygous deletions is 60% .
Ovarian cancer is the most lethal gynecologic malignancy and the fifth most common cause of cancer related deaths in women. The standard treatment for epithelial ovarian cancer consists of cytoreductive surgery followed by a paclitaxel  and platinum based chemotherapy regimen . Paclitaxel resistance develops leading to treatment failure and death.
Obesity or accumulated adiposity is an important etiological factor in the clustering of clinical conditions that comprise the metabolic syndrome  . These conditions include central obesity, hypertension, hyperglycemia, and dyslipidemia . Therefore, other markers including weight, waist circumference, skinfold patterns, BMI and waist hip ratio are used as convenient and economical clinical proxies to evaluate adiposity .
Although the classical teaching has been one of a chronic inflammatory demyelinating disease marked by multi focal white matter lesions, multiple sclerosis  is being increasingly recognized as a disease of the central nervous system  characterized by widespread demyelination, axonal loss and gliosis, and neurodegeneration . In line with these diffuse histopathological changes, prior study, such as through PET examination, has revealed decreased oxygen utilization and extraction, with extensive reduction in cerebral glucose metabolism in MS patients . As tissue damage in MS has been shown to invariably extend beyond the focal plaque, modern MRI techniques are being developed to allow for the qualitative and quantitative demonstration of the global, diffuse nature of neuropathological changes in order to closely monitor disease severity, progression, and response to therapy .
Airway secretions contain a broad spectrum of endogenous antimicrobial factors  which contribute to the inherent host defense of the respiratory tract. Complement factors, surfactant proteins, antimicrobial peptides , antibacterial polypeptides, and host derived lipids are all integral components of this intrinsic defense system. Cathelicidins are a family of propeptides consisting of a highly conserved N terminal sequence  and a heterogeneous cationic and antimicrobially active C terminal domain.
Cataract is an opaqueness of the lens that causes decreased visual acuity . Cataract becomes more common with increasing age and is one of the leading causes of blindness and visual impairment among the elderly population throughout the less developed world . Thus, identification of factors that could delay or prevent cataract development would be important both for increasing the well being of older adults and for reducing medical care costs.
DNA structure is fundamental to diverse DNA transactions, such as replication, repair, nucleosome assembly, and the regulation of gene expression. , Architectural and regulatory proteins bind to DNA with an affinity, specificity, and kinetics appropriate to their biological roles. Designated dsxA, this enhancer element contains subsites related to multiple classes of eukaryotic transcription factors .
Among term infants, hypoxicischemic encephalopathy  due to acute perinatal asphyxia is an important cause of neurological morbidity and mortality. Currently, therapeutic hypothermia represents the only intervention, which has been demonstrated to favorably alter the outcome of term infants who suffered from perinatal asphyxia. Part of the MRI limitations may be solved by having an MRI unit within the neonatal intensive care unit; however, only very few hospitals have this setup available.
Bacteriophage endosialidases hydrolyse internal α 2,8 linkages in polysialic acid , a polymer which may exceed 200 N acetyl neuraminic acid  residues, which comprises the capsular polysaccharide of Escherichia coli K1 and group B Neisseria meningitidis  and is also expressed at limited sites in vertebrates . PSA NCAM is an oncodevelopmental marker in tumours of the human kidney and neuroendocrine cells  and modulates neurite outgrowth in the developing vertebrate central nervous system . PSA has also been implicated in the process of metastasis of small cell and non small cell lung carcinoma .
Parkinson’s disease  is a neurodegenerative disorder where there is a loss of dopamine  neurons of the substantia nigra . Clinically PD is characterized by motor symptoms such as bradykinesia, rigidity, resting tremor and hypometria . In addition to deficits of motor performance such as bradykinesia, or slowness in the initiation, execution and termination of movements or generating movements of smaller amplitude than desired , patients with PD often display cognitive motor deficits such as abnormal movement sequences .
Type 1 diabetes is one of the most prevalent chronic illnesses diagnosed in childhood . Exploration of sleep in relation to diabetes management is a relatively new area of study . Child sleep may also be directly impacted by nighttime BG monitoring and treatment of hypoglycemic or hyperglycemic episodes .
There are many different mutations in the HPRT1 gene encoding the purine salvage enzyme hypoxanthine guanine phosphoribosyltransferase  that cause a broad spectrum of clinical phenotypes . These phenotypes are typically grouped into three categories based on the presence or absence of specific clinical features . An intermediate phenotype is HGprt related neurological dysfunction , which includes problems related to uric acid, along with varying degrees of motor impairment and neurocognitive abnormalities.
Female sexual dysfunction is a multicausal and multidimensional problem that combines sexual, physiological, physical, psychological, and interpersonal determinants, having a major impact on interpersonal relationships and quality of life. , Community based studies indicate a prevalence of sexual dysfunction among all women between 25% and 63%, ,, while the prevalence of sexual dysfunction in post menopausal women varies from 68% to 87%. , Among the sexual dysfunctions described in females, dyspareunia appears to be common, with a prevalence of 7% in a national probability sample assessing sexual dysfunction in the United States.
An increased rate of age related decline in white matter  integrity has been demonstrated in schizophrenia patients in several  but not all studies . The accelerated rate of WM change coincides with schizophrenia patients’ increased rates in somatic diseases such as cardiovascular illnesses, hypertension and diabetes , all of which are known to increase in occurrence with normal aging. Schizophrenia patients also have an increased mortality rate and shorter  average lifespan, even after accounting for suicide .
Epidemiological evidence on the association between red and processed meat and lung cancer has been suggestive, yet limited, inconsistent, and mainly based on retrospective data. High temperature cooking of meat results in the formation of heterocyclic amines , , and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons , which are also present in cured and smoked foods. Both HCAs and PAHs are potent lung carcinogens in animal studies.
