Endophenotypes, intermediate component elements closer to genetic action than the indexed phenotype, are useful in psychopathology research because of the inherent difficulty of finding genes that have a one to one relationship with complex multifactorial behavioral disorders . A key property of an endophenotype is that it must run in families, and ultimately, be under some significant degree of heritable control. A recent study by  is a noteworthy exception both in sample size and in variety of EF measures assessed.
Organophosphorus  compounds inhibit serine esterases by organophosphylation of the active site serine . Inhibition of acetylcholinesterase  produces cholinergic toxicity regardless of whether or not aging has occurred. Moreover, whereas AChE inhibition, acute stress, and inflammatory stimuli can induce changes in AChE gene expression and microRNAs targeting AChE , AChE inhibition is not involved in the etiology of OPIDN  .
CCAAT/Enhancer Binding Protein beta  is a critical regulator of tissue specific gene expression in several cell lineages . All three proteins contain a basic leucine zipper  domain at their C terminus that functions as DNA binding domain. The C/EBPβ LIP protein that completely lacks this N terminal end can function as an inhibitor of both C/EBPβ LAP*  and C/EBPβ LAP mediated gene regulation .
Stem cell based interventional approaches for myocardial regeneration have recently generated substantial enthusiasm as a novel treatment for heart failure. Experimental studies routinely find the vast majority of adoptively transferred stem cells die or vanish shortly after delivery. CPCs have been isolated and used with modest success for treatment and regeneration of damaged heart tissue after infarction,  .
Of the Angiotensin  receptors, the AT1 receptor is known to mediate most of the Ang II actions, including vasoconstriction, antinatriuresis, aldosterone secretion, increased sympathetic outflow and cellular growth/proliferation. Abnormal regulation and function of AT1 receptor contributes to development and maintenance of various forms of hypertension. On the other hand, the AT2 receptor is suggested as a functional antagonist of AT1 receptors.
Children who are overweight are more likely to become overweight adults . Obesity is the result of an imbalance between the energy consumed and the energy expended . Dietary behaviors that have been positively associated with increased body mass among children include energy intake , percent energy from fat  and energy density  while fruit and vegetable intake has been negatively associated .
Human telomeres terminate in a 50 200 nucleotide single stranded 3′ overhang that plays a pivotal role in chromosome end protection . Furthermore, the telomeric overhang invades the duplex region forming a t loop and thereby blocking ATR and ATM signaling which is essential to prevent the chromosome end from being incorrectly recognized as a DNA double strand break  . Owing to the end replication problem, the ends of chromosome shorten with each round of DNA replication in all somatic cells .
Since bone mass is lost throughout adult life as part of the aging process, a major risk factor for the development of osteoporosis is the failure to obtain a normal peak bone mass during early adulthood . Multiple studies have shown that alcohol abuse is an important risk factor for osteopenia . Excessive alcohol consumption continues to be a major public health problem in the United States with dangerous drinking practices such as binge drinking common in the adolescent and young adult populations .
Somatic cells have developed sophisticated mechanisms to regulate assembly of pre replication complexes , license the ability of an origin of replication  to initiate DNA synthesis, and prevent re replication of DNA . During the M to G1 transition, preRCs are assembled, which entails the assembly of an ORI that is composed of ORC16 at many sites in the genome. Recruitment of MCM is termed replication licensing because the origin recognition complex  is now capable of supporting DNA replication.
Over the last decade, compelling evidence emerged in support of a cancer stem cell  origin in many solid tumors including hepatic cancers. For these reasons CSCs are of great translational importance with a variety of therapeutic implications. c MYC is one of the most commonly activated oncogenes implicated in the development of human cancers including liver cancer.
Since the beginning of the South African epidemic, an estimated 2 million adults have died from HIV/AIDS,, 6.1 million South Africans are currently living with HIV, the prevalence in the 1549 year age range is 17.9%, and the incidence is 1.43% per year among those aged 1549. Over 370,000 HIV infections and 240,000 AIDS related deaths occur in South Africa each year . South Africa’s HIV Testing and Counselling campaign and rollout of antiretroviral therapy  are well established.
Designing and engineering polypeptides that have specific structures or functions in biological membranes remains one of the more intractable problems in bioengineering. Although the general principles of binding, folding and self assembly in membranes are well known,, the details are not understood well enough for rational de novo design. One desirable bioengineering objective that could lead to new biosensors, antibiotics and cell penetrating peptides is the design of polypeptides that destabilize the permeability barrier of lipid bilayer membranes.
Over the last 50 years, research efforts have focused on the process of post maturational sex changes in fishes. This process has been described by histological studies of the gonads, as well as through characterization of body morphology . California Sheephead, Semicossyphus pulcher , is a commercially and recreationally valuable labrid found from Monterey Bay, California, to Cabo San Lucas, Mexico .
Most of the newly human immunodeficiency virus type 1  infected women acquire infection through vaginal intercourse in which semen associated virus is deposited in the mucosa of the lower female genital tract before infecting primary HIV 1 target cells and disseminating to the regional lymph nodes ,. The lack of understanding of the basic mechanisms of HIV 1 transmission and dissemination in the female lower genital tract is a limitation to developing efficient protection measures as evidenced from the recent controversial results on the efficacy of vaginal microbicides ,  . In order to reach its primary cell targets in the female lower genital tract, i.e. CD4+ T lymphocytes, dendritic cells  and sub epithelial macrophages , the virus must circumvent mucosal barriers .
The widespread diffusion of HIV prevention programs for adolescents is an important public health goal. Even when community agencies have had staff trained in an EB program, fewer than half will implement the program  . Since community providers will inevitably adapt, tailor, or reinvent the EB program, it is necessary for the program’s non adaptable ‘core elements’ to be identified.
Genomic instability resulting in DNA amplification, rearrangements or deletions, is a common mechanism by which tumors modulate gene expression and acquire invasive and metastatic potential . The 11q13 amplicon core is a gene rich region containing at least 10 genes. However, despite reports on overexpression of other genes in the region  the most likely tumorigenic driver at this locus is still thought to be CCND1, which encodes cyclin D1 .
Kaposi’s sarcoma  is a multifocal angioproliferative inflammatory condition well described in its classical, post transplantation and African endemic forms before the advent of the epidemic of HIV 1/AIDS. KS cell lines have been shown to express markers of endothelial, lymphatic and smooth muscle lineages. Seroepidemiological studies have clearly established HHV 8  as the etiologic agent of all clinical forms of KS.
Bisphosphate , also called lysobisphosphatidic acid , is a characteristic lipid of the endocytic degradative pathway that is found in the luminal membranes of the late endosome in concentrations of approximately 15 mole percent . Due to its increased concentration in the late endosomes, BMP is thought to play important structural and functional roles in this organelle . The structures of BMP and GM1 are shown in  .
Vascular smooth muscle cell  proliferation and deposition of extracellular matrix are characteristic of progressive atherosclerotic lesions . Multiple growth factors and hormones have the potential to stimulate growth of VSMCs  and may play a role in the evolution of atherosclerotic vascular disease. Alternatively, locally generated signaling molecules such as nitric oxide and PGI2 act to antagonize cell growth and matrix deposition .
Intraductal carcinoma of the prostate and high grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia  comprise the two main intraepithelial neoplastic lesions occurring in the prostate . When diagnosed as isolated lesions on needle biopsies, these two entities have dramatically different implications for patient prognosis and care care . Accordingly, PIN is frequently an isolated finding, occurring in biopsies without invasive carcinoma and, if not present in at least 23 separate biopsy cores, is not associated with an increased risk of cancer diagnosis on subsequent biopsies done within the following year .
Despite the success of highly active antiretroviral therapy  in lowering viral load to undetectable levels in ~70% of human immunodeficiency virus  infected patients , treatment failure is a growing problem. A central role in HAART is played by nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors . These are prodrugs that require intracellular conversion to triphosphorylated forms for antiviral activity.
Cytolethal distending toxin  is potentially one of several virulence factors of Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans, the prime etiological agent of localized aggressive periodontitis . Little is known regarding the Cdt specific antibody response in humans. The current study is a quantitative and qualitative evaluation of the toxin specific antibody response in a cohort of LAP patients and age , race  and sex matched controls .
There is some biologic evidence that antidepressants are related to cancer risk. Certain antidepressants promote mammary tumor growth in mouse models. Further, administration of antidepressants has been associated with acute increases in prolactin levels in woman, and higher serum prolactin levels have been associated with increased breast cancer risk.
Late onset Tay Sachs disease  is a lysosomal storage disease caused by deficient Beta hexosaminidase A activity . We describe a 53 year old woman who presented with adult onset leg weakness, and whose initial diagnosis was progressive muscular atrophy without identifiable etiology. Development of cerebellar ataxia in mid life prompted reassessment .
Microfluidic devices are now widely accepted analytical tools, having matured from their initial characterization work,, to integrated microfluidic devices, and, more recently, even more impressive devices that allow incorporation of biological entities into the chip format with the ability to stimulate and analyze their releasates with various detection schemes. Related to the work presented here, multiple layer PDMS  microchips with polycarbonate membranes sandwiched between two channel networks have been used for a variety of applications. Initial work with these devices investigated differential analyte transport  across the membrane.
Anger states and traits appear to affect pain sensitivity. Recently, models have been proposed to explain how anger variables may influence pain  . Frew and Drummond  reported that in healthy women, discouragement induced by a mental arithmetic task performed under threat of electric shock was associated with endogenous opioid release that tempered the otherwise hyperalgesic effects of this negative affect.
The opiorphins are a newly characterized class of peptides that act as potent endogenous neutral endopeptidase  inhibitors. Recent reports have suggested that they play an important role in erectile physiology . During a microarray screen of gene changes that occur in a rat diabetic model of erectile dysfunction , Vcsa1 was one of the most down regulated genes in the rat corpora.
Daily multivitamins, typically comprised of at least 10 vitamins and 10 minerals and the U.S. Recommended Daily Allowances of vitamins C, D, and E, represent an important source of essential nutrients. For example, several recent studies indicate that there may be protective effects of Vitamin D and calcium for breast and colorectal cancer , areas in which socioeconomic and racial/ethnic disparities are striking.
It is unknown how evoked myotonia varies with stimulus frequency or train length, or how it compares to voluntary myotonia in myotonic dystrophy type 1  . After approval by our medical center institutional review board, 10 DM1 patients and 10 age  and gender matched controls were evaluated prospectively. They also possessed an abnormal expansion of the CTG repeat in the myotonic dystrophy gene  as demonstrated by genetic analysis of leukocyte DNA.
Differential diagnosis of benign vocal fold lesions, such as nodules, polyps and cysts, remains a challenge in laryngology. At the same time, various treatment responses are indicated among the lesions. An accurate diagnosis of benign vocal fold lesions is needed for a more effective clinical management and to spare patients from unnecessary and costly treatments.
Brain tumors are collectively the leading cause of childhood cancer related mortality. High grade gliomas have a particularly poor prognosis, with a long term survival rate of less than 20%, despite conventional surgical, radio therapeutic, and chemotherapeutic interventions . Although these tumors are comparable morphologically to malignant gliomas that arise in adults, childhood gliomas have a number of distinctive molecular characteristics, which suggests the involvement of somewhat different pathways of tumorigenesis.
Both the moderate decreases in extracellular   that occur during normal synaptic activity , and the substantial decreases in o due to focal brain trauma or ischemia , indicate that o is dynamic. A decrease in o is predicted to sharply inhibit synaptic transmission . However, recordings of sustained high frequency activity indicate that this is not always the case .
The macrophage, as one of the effector cells of the innate immune system, recognizes pathogen associated molecular patterns from both pathogens and commensal microorganisms through TLRs. IBD may be caused by dysregulation of the mucosal immune system, which might be due to excessive immune responses to normal microflora. Protective effects of macrophages in intestinal inflammation include release of cytoprotective prostaglandins in the peri cryptal stem cell niche to promote epithelial cell wound healing .
Neural tube defects  are the second most common birth defect, occurring in approximately 1 in 1000 live births of American Caucasians . NTDs arise when the neural tube fails to close properly during early fetal development; this usually occurs within the third and fourth weeks of pregnancy and often before the pregnancy is detected. The most common of all NTDs are spina bifida and anencephaly.
In a growing number of applications, high dielectric materials have been used to improve the local sensitivity and/or homogeneity of the radiofrequency  magnetic  field in human MRI . Brain imaging with pads of distilled water or a suspension made by calcium titanate  powder in distilled or deuterated water placed beside the head have shown a significant increase in signal to noise ratio  in the area of the temporal lobe at 7 T  . Near the coil, the primary source of magnetic field is Jc within the transmit coil.
Alzheimer's disease  is a neurodegenerative process characterized by memory loss and dementia. At the neural level, the cholinergic system is one of the most affected. This structure provides approximately 80% of the cholinergic neurons in the CNS .
Antigen mediated CD8 T cell responses undergo various phases, starting with activation, followed by extensive proliferation and subsequent differentiation to effector cells capable of killing  and/or secreting lymphokines capable of inhibiting tumor growth. Some controversy exists regarding the role of CD4 T helper cells in the generation of effector and memory CD8 T cell responses. In addition, some of these studies showed that this “licensing” of APCs could be bypassed by the administration of agonistic anti CD40 antibodies.
Axial patterning is required for the transition of a single sheet of cells into a three dimensional organ. Axial patterning involves generation of two different cell populations or compartments. Compartments are the fundamental units of patterning that are generated by localized expression of transcription factors called selectors.
One of the predictions from evolutionary game theory is that same sex conspecific individuals will escalate their expression of aggression with each other when they detect the presence of a limiting resource . Experiments that corroborate this prediction are also of interest in the context of animal cognition because they may reveal particular resources that are salient to the escalating individual . We have been especially interested in using jumping spiders  for considering these cognitive implications .
Sodium loading, and subsequent volume expansion, suppresses aldosterone levels in individuals with normal renal function. We hypothesised that loss of renal function impairs this volume aldosterone relationship . With multifrequency bioimpedance spectroscopy, we measured total body water , extracellular volume , and intracellular volume in five haemodialysis patients at varied states of hydration and in five healthy volunteers during low , normal , and high salt diets.
As one of the most ubiquitous and versatile electron carriers,  clusters play an important role in biological electron transfer as well as in biosynthetic and bioregulatory functions. , However, probing the environmental effects is difficult due to the complexity of the protein environment. Moreover, the density functionals and basis sets in our BS DFT calculations have been calibrated by extensive comparisons of experimental and theoretical results for gas phase Fe S clusters by Wang and co workers and our group.
Verbal autopsy  is the process of eliciting information about the circumstances of a death from family or friends of the recently deceased person in cases where medical certification of death is incomplete or absent . Algorithms have the potential to address these concerns  but raise others, such as reliability and the difficulty of considering parallel possibilities along the lines of classic clinical differential diagnoses . Bayes' theorem seeks to define the probability of a cause  given the presence of a particular indicator , and can be represented as: P=P×PP×P+P×P where P is the probability of not  .
The mammalian target of rapamycin , a serine threonine protein kinase related tightly to the family of the phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase related kinases, exerts different biological functions primarily through forming two complexes with the essential partner protein raptor  and rictor  . Hence, great efforts have been made to identify novel mTOR inhibitors that suppress both mTORC1 and mTORC2 activity. A robust in vivo anticancer activity of these inhibitors against certain types of cancers was also observed .
Prostate Cancer remains the most clinically diagnosed malignancy within the United States for men . In patients who exhibit rapid disease progression and/or develop metastases to visceral organs such as bone, chemotherapy is often recommended as the next line of defense . Docetaxel  plus prednisone is the standard of care for metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer .
The structural organization of multiple convergent sensory modalities in the brain is an important determinant in identifying mechanisms of multimodal integration in neural circuits. The superior colliculus  in the midbrain of vertebrates integrates multimodal sensory information and generates motor responses. In birds and mammals, the superior colliculus is compartmentalized into multiple layers, composed of cell bodies, fibers and neuropil, which are thought to reflect segregation of task related sensory and motor processing .
N RAP is a striated muscle specific scaffolding protein involved in myofibril assembly . The N RAP gene is highly conserved between mouse and humans, and consists of 42 exons spread over 70 kilobases . These exons encode a 196 kilodalton protein consisting of an N terminal LIM domain, 11 modules homologous to single nebulin repeats, and an additional 35 modules arranged into 5 super repeats homologous to nebulin super repeats.
Since the emergence of an increasing number of 3D biological structures, molecular docking has become a major computational method for discovering and designing new ligands for biological targets. Since the pioneering work of Kuntz et al.,, Docking programs also have a tendency to position ligands to match the shape of the protein surface. Since each docking program has its own algorithms and parameters, it is advisable to use caution in different situations, depending on the size, hydrophobicity, and solvation accessibility of the binding pocket.
Parents report children’s dietary intake and/or physical activity, but studies  underscore concerns about such reports. Children eat meals and conduct physical activity at school where parents are not present, so it is unrealistic to expect parents to accurately report children’s intake and/or physical activity that occur at school. Validation studies of children’s dietary recalls have identified omissions  and intrusions ;,  results show that dietary recall accuracy is improved when the retention interval  is minimized.,, Children have simultaneously reported dietary intake and physical activity in two validation studies.
Nearly a century ago, Clarence C. Little and his colleagues at the Roscoe B. Jackson Memorial Laboratory  identified the occurrence of heritable white spotting in the house mouse . Mutations at the Kit locus affect embryonic stem cell migration, resulting in pleiotropic effects on hematopoiesis, primordial germ cell development and melanogenesis. Generally, homozygotes die in utero due to severe macrocytic anemia.
Desmoid tumors are rare, benign, sometimes aggressive tumors resulting from unregulated proliferation of fibroblast like cells . Their natural history is one of slow growth with progressive infiltration of surrounding soft tissues leading in some cases to strangulation of nerves and blood vessels. Abdominal desmoid tumors are the most common and can be classified into sporadic and familial forms .
Metastasis is a multistep process, and the acquisition of metastatic ability has traditionally been considered a late step in cancer evolution . Recent evidence in mouse models of breast and pancreatic cancer suggests that cancer cells within premalignant lesions may already possess the ability to disseminate . Lung adenocarcinoma is the most common subtype of lung cancer, with over 90,000 patients diagnosed each year with this form of lung cancer in the United States alone .
Massively parallel  resequencing is potentially a powerful tool with which to study heteroplasmic mitochondrial DNA  mutations due to the high breadth and depth of coverage possible. Studying very low level variants  is likely to yield the most useful insights into somatic  mtDNA mutation, but is challenging due to the difficulty in differentiating true variants from background noise at this resolution. Recent studies using amplicon based re sequencing  have indicated  that mtDNA mutations at ~0.2% heteroplasmy level or greater can be successfully resolved, but only after very stringent data cleaning, including the exclusion of homo polymeric tracts which are known hot spots for technical artefact on this platform.
The evolutionarily conserved Notch signaling pathway plays critical roles in controlling multiple aspects of vascular development and EC  function, ranging from proliferation, motility and lumen formation to vessel stability and cell fate determination , . In vertebrates, the Notch signaling pathway consists of four Notch family receptors  and five Notch ligands . Receptor ligand interactions between neighboring cells initiates the proteolytic cleavage of the Notch receptor extracellular domain, the Ɣ secretase dependent release of the Notch intracellular domain , and its subsequent translocation to the nucleus where it associates with the DNA binding protein, RBPJK/CBF1/Su, as well as a co activator of the Mastermind like  family, thereby triggering the transcription of downstream target genes, including Hey/Hes family members .
Schwann cells are often described as expressing one of only two possible phenotypes, myelinating or non myelinating . Recently, however, this view has been modified by the discovery that Schwann cell growth factor expression is regulated by both the modality of their axonal partners and by their central peripheral location along the neuraxis . What is not known, however, is which of the growth factors that we have shown to differ in expression are responsible for the modality specific support of regeneration .
Prescription drug overdoses have reached epidemic proportions. Federal and state governments are eager to identify strategies to reduce misuse, abuse and diversion. The Office of National Drug Control Policy  advocates prescription drug monitoring programs  as one strategy for reducing prescription drug abuse.
Ovarian cancer is the leading cause of death from gynaecological malignancy, in spite of initially high response rates to chemotherapy treatment. The molecular basis of acquired drug resistance remains poorly understood  . First, genetically heterogenous clones may exist within the tumour mass prior to treatment, and populations with advantageous mutations are selected for survival and expansion following clearance of the dominant, sensitive clone by chemotherapy.
Cardiac vessel distribution and patterning are important for the proper maintenance and function of the myocardium. In disease states, a characteristic feature of the progression toward pathological hypertrophy is a significant reduction in the capillary density and increase in the intercapillary distance . Manipulation of pro angiogenic factors, such as vascular endothelial growth factor , have also been shown to protect the myocardium against ischemic injury, prevent myocardial apoptosis, preserve contractile function, and delay the onset of pathological hypertrophy .
The development of human cancers involves multiple pathological events through which cancerous cells gain the ability to overcome adverse stress imposed by adjacent normal tissue. Tumor angiogenesis, an integral part of solid tumor development, provides nutrients and oxygen in a hypoxic microenvironment formed in the centers of growing tumors and facilitates tumor cell proliferation by enhancing oxygenation and the removal of metabolic wastes that would normally induce necrosis. A number of angiogenic factors such as vascular endothelial growth factor  and basic fibroblast growth factor  have been demonstrated to play critical roles in the development of tumor vasculature .
Assisted living  facilities currently provide care to approximately 1 million people in the United States, and that number is expected to rise considerably over the coming decades. Although the provision of social and supportive services are central components of AL,, the ability to safely manage the medical illnesses of residents has been identified as a priority. , However, it has been suggested that some residents with multiple, complex medical conditions present a challenge that some ALs may not be prepared to manage.
In Western societies, intervertebral disc degeneration  related lower back pain affects between 60% and 80% of the population at some point in their lives, making it one of the most important public health issues today. IDD is thought to result from multifatorial causes. Finally, the height of the intervertebral discs is reduced and osteophytes appear at the anterior and lateral edges of the disc.
Much human cognitive control consists in the ability to stop inappropriate action. Here we explore the neurocognitive basis for how foreknowledge is used to stop particular response tendencies . In the standard version, the participant has a general goal to stop when a stop signal occurs, but he or she does not need to deploy this selectively for one motor representation rather than another.
Melanoma is the sixth most common malignancy in the United States; the estimated 62,480 new cases that will be diagnosed this year justify ongoing efforts to identify variables that will accurately predict outcome. In evaluating these variables, age has become an important factor. Researchers also have reported increased rates of SN non visualization in older patients.
Nonspecific effects play a significant role in symptom improvement in a wide range of medical conditions, particularly those that have components of pain or psychological symptoms . Placebo effects are expected in hot flash treatment. A pooled analysis of 10 clinical trials of non hormonal pharmacologic therapies for menopausal hot flashes showed that responses to placebo ranged from 27% to 52%  .
Parathyroid hormone  is a major regulator of calcium metabolism that defends against hypocalcemia, in part by stimulating bone resorption and thereby the release of calcium from the skeleton. The expansion of the osteoblastic pool induced by iPTH is initiated by the release from the bone matrix undergoingresorption of TGFβ, IGF 1, and other growth factors that recruit SCs to remodeling areas. Wnt proteins initiate a canonical signaling cascade by binding to receptors of the Frizzled family together with the coreceptors LRP5 6, which results in the stabilization of cytosolic β catenin.
DMGDH is a mammalian flavin mitochondrial enzyme , which catalyzes the oxidative demethylation of dimethylglycine . In the cell, the redox partner of DMGDH is an electron transferring flavoprotein  . The demethylation is performed using FAD as electron acceptor which is covalently bound to His84  via a histidyl FAD bond .
During the past decade, animal models of Alzheimer’s disease  have made considerable contribution to our understanding of molecular and pathophysiological mechanisms of AD leading to memory deficits , which are difficult to address in human studies and impossible in cultured cells. Furthermore, extensive behavioral studies have demonstrated progressive Aβ dependent memory impairments in a series of AD transgenic mouse models, using a broad battery of hippocampus dependent memory assays such as Morris water maze, Y maze, fear conditioning and object or social recognition tasks. However, these studies predominantly tested the acquisition of learning or memories shortly  after training in APP mice, thus mainly evaluating defects in hippocampal coding of various types of memories .
Alzheimer’s disease  and progressive supranuclear palsy  are two common neurodegenerative tauopathies. In contrast, PSP is a relatively “pure” tauopathy and is characterized by deposition of 4R tau. Elevated concentrations of tau can be measured in AD CSF using assays that quantify central tau epitopes.
Lung cancer remains the leading cause of cancer related deaths in the US and worldwide. Adenocarcinoma is the most common type of lung cancer and encompasses lesions with widely variable clinical outcomes. In the absence of noninvasive risk stratification, individualized patient management remains challenging.
Radiation therapy  is commonly used as primary treatment and as an adjuvant to the surgical excision of oral squamous cell cancer in the head and neck. The ensuing hypocellularity and hypoxic environment leads to scarring and fibrosis that make secondary reconstruction of the surgical site difficult. In addition, reconstruction of recurrent tumors and the treatment of extensive osteoradionecrosis, as a side effect of XRT, often require the removal of large amounts of bone in a previously irradiated field.
Classic congenital adrenal hyperplasia  is an autosomal recessive condition caused by an enzymatic deficiency. Girls and women with classic CAH have been found to show some behavioral masculinization, similar to that seen following experimental manipulations of androgens in other species . The potential impact of glucocorticoid abnormality on behavior in individuals with CAH is relatively unexplored.
SCD is a hereditary hemolytic disorder characterized by recurring episodes of painful vaso occlusive crises and endothelial dysfunction . The constant sickling and unsickling cycles result in RBC lysis in the microvasculature and the release of acellular HbS . Plasma hemopexin  has high affinity for free heme that might be released from metHb  .
Docosahexaenoic acid  and arachidonic acid  are two long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids  that are important in infant development of neural functioning  and visual acuity . Linoleic acid  and α linolenic acid  are the parent compounds of ARA and DHA, respectively. Both LA and ALA are considered to be essential fatty acids because they cannot be produced endogenously by humans.
Chromosomal aberrations that are detectable by cytogenetic methods cause a wide variety of developmental abnormalities, which vary with the size and gene content of the aberration . Deletions of the short arm of chromosome 20 are a relatively rare chromosome abnormality, with less than 35 such patients reported in the literature . Deletions can either be cytogenetically visible or sub microscopic, diagnosable only by molecular cytogenetic or other molecular level studies .
Parkinson's disease  is a progressive neurodegenerative disease characterized clinically as gait and motor disturbances such as rigidity, resting tremor, slowness of voluntary movement, and postural instability. In some cases these evolve to frank dementia . Pathologically, PD is characterized by nigrostriatal degeneration precipitated by progressive loss of dopaminergic neuronal cell bodies in the substantia nigra pars compacta  and their projections to the dorsal striatum.
The hyper IgE syndromes   are rare primary immunodeficiencies , characterized by the clinical triad of recurrent staphylococcal skin abscesses, recurrent pneumonia and serum IgE levels of >10 times the upper norm. The genetic causes of AR HIES are largely unknown. reported a monogenetic defect in the cytoplasmatic tyrosine kinase Tyk2 in a single patient with clinical features of AR  HIES who had consanguineous parents .
The burden of lung cancer in the world remains extremely high: the International Agency for Research on Cancer  estimated 1.6 million new diagnoses in 2008  and 1.4 million deaths  . In the U.S. and Canada, incidence  is 48.5 for males and 35.8 for females, while mortality is 37.9 and 24.2, respectively, and cumulative risk  of dying from lung cancer is 3% in females and 4.6% in males. In the U.S. 228,000 new cases of lung cancer and about 160,000 deaths were estimated for 2013 .
Newborn screening  for cystic fibrosis  aims to identify newborns with CF and initiate treatment before symptoms arise. In the United States, NBS begins with an initial blood test at birth and those infants with a positive screening result for CF require additional follow up testing to determine whether they have the disease. The child’s primary care provider  is responsible for notifying parents of the infant’s initial NBS result and for arranging the appropriate follow up testing.
The LGI1 gene, located in 10q24, was isolated through its association with a chromosome translocation breakpoint in the T98G glioma cell line  and has since been shown to regulate cell movement, invasion, and growth in soft agar phenotypes in glioma cells , and is frequently inactivated in head and neck cancer . Early studies using RT PCR analysis suggested that LGI1 expression was lost, or significantly down regulated in advanced stage gliomas , although the subsequent demonstration of high levels of LGI1 expression in neurons  made interpretation of these results more difficult because of the co mingling of this cell type in gliomas. Although reports of LGI1 specific antibodies support the loss of expression in high grade gliomas, the suggestion that these antibodies may cross react with other members of the LGI family of proteins cautions over interpretation of these observations .
Ghrelin is a 28 amino acid peptide first identified in the rat stomach and reported as an endogenous ligand for growth hormone secretagogue receptors . More notably, ghrelin has been implicated in improving endothelial dysfunction, increasing endothelial nitric oxide synthase  expression and reducing pro inflammatory reactions in human endothelial cells. Previous studies have demonstrated that deacylated ghrelin , unlike the standard form of ghrelin, does not inhibit tumor necrosis factor alpha  induced interleukin 8  release.
Transcription, DNA repair, and replication are associated with changes in chromatin . Among these, reversible acetylation of histones at lysine residues play a role in controlling the structure of the chromatin , where highly acetylated histones make the chromatin more accessible to host factors, signifying active transcription. Thus, HATs are also referred to as lysine acetyltransferases .
The humoral and cellular immune responses are critical for the control of human immunodeficiency virus  and simian immunodeficiency virus  infections. The CD4 T cells play a key role in regulating the magnitude and function of humoral and cellular immunity . During acute HIV/SIV infection, massive depletion of memory CD4 T cells occurs predominantly at mucosal sites, with over one half of all memory CD4 T cells in SIV infected rhesus macaque  being destroyed directly by viral infection.
The mammalian amygdala plays an important role in detecting and learning the emotional significance of stimuli encountered by an organism . Within the systems level framework of emotion, the amygdala contributes several component processes, such as stimulus appraisal, relevance detection, activation of neuroendocrine responses, and somatic motor expressions of emotion . As a manifestation of its role in assessing the relevance/significance of stimuli, the amygdala is involved in allocating attention to stimuli of importance .
Motor learning as it is usually studied in the laboratory occurs in a constrained, artificial environment in which the stimulus and desired response are rigidly controlled. Indeed, such experiments allow one to hone in on fundamental, relatively low level mechanisms that underlie adaptive motor control. In other words, because environmental or sensory conditions can change suddenly, the brain must be capable of learning different behavioral modes to produce accurate movements under multiple circumstances.
Type 2 diabetes mellitus  and Alzheimer’s disease  are chronic, age related degenerative disorders that are leading causes of morbidity and mortality in the elderly. Each has attained epidemic proportion, affecting an excess of 171  and 24 million people , respectively, worldwide. A variety of risk factors implicated in the development of T2DM, such as genetic predisposition, age, oxidative stress, obesity, diet, and physical inactivity  appear to also be involved in AD, the most common form of senile dementia .
Anatomic and functional magnetic resonance imaging  has been shown to be a valuable tool in staging prostate cancer above and beyond what is possible with standard clinical tests such as digital rectal exams, transrectal ultrasound guided biopsy and serum prostate specific antigen  measures . While anatomic MRI based primarily on T2 weighted contrast provides delineation of zonal anatomy, extracapsular extension, and regions of cancer, functional MRI studies have been shown to further increase sensitivity and specificity over anatomic imaging alone by improving the differentiation of cancer from benign processes. that the increased spatial encoding capability of the receive B1 field  of each coil element at high field can be used to increase reduction factors  while maintaining a relatively low geometry factor .
Receiving shocks is a physically painful and emotionally distressing event experienced by those living with an implantable cardioverter defibrillator  . Shocks decrease quality of life and increase health care utilization . The longer a person has had the ICD the less accurate they are at remembering how many shocks they received  .
Particle maturation is an integral part of the assembly of complex viruses . The subject of this study was Nudaurelia capensis ω virus , a non enveloped virus with a bipartite, positive sense RNA genome . VLPs purified from baculovirus at pH 7.6 were found to be round, porous particles of diameter 480Å.
Models of blood circulation and gas exchange in the human body have advanced steadily over the past decade. The application focus for these models has been on predicting the dynamics of medically relevant events like carotid artery compression, hypotension, hypercapnia, and thigh cuff deflation. The aim of the present work is to recast a nonlinear dynamic physiological model in the context of neuroimaging.
Vestibular control is a multi component process that involves coordination between eye, head and body movements to allow for the stabilization of the trunk in space during locomotion, and for stabilization of the eyes in space to maintain a steady image on the retina. In some studies, scientists have also employed an experimental approach that allows one to simultaneously examine coordinated eye and head movements . In this paper we present data from guinea pigs that were allowed to move their heads in a completely natural manner during passive stimulation, allowing for simultaneous analysis of their eye and head movements.
Demyelinating diseases are a heterogeneous group of diseases characterized by the destruction of myelin and extensive loss of myelin sheaths of the nerve fibers that can affect both the central and the peripheral nervous systems. Amongst these diseases both primarily autoimmune  and primarily infectious  conditions are included. The labile border between infection and autoimmunity in these diseases is nevertheless epitomized by progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy , a pathology that appears during the treatment of HIV infection.
Myocardial ischemia is a disorder of cardiac function that occurs when blood supply to myocardium is insufficient. AMPK is a stress sensitive kinase that can be activated by ATP depletion such as hypoxia , ischemia  and exercise . Activated AMPK can phosphorylate Acetyl CoA carboxylase  to inhibit its activity involved in fatty acid synthesis .
Alzheimer’s disease and vascular dementia are the two most common forms of cognitive impairment in the elderly. For decades, each was considered a distinct disorder; recent results, however, show that they share many characteristics, including risk factors, neuropathology, and hemodynamics. One common link between these three entities  cerebrovascular dysfunction, ischemic brain injury, and Alzheimer’s disease  is cerebral amyloid angiopathy  .
Research from national population based studies in the United States have generally found that risks of hazardous drinking, alcohol dependence, or other alcohol related problems are greater among sexual minority women compared to heterosexual women . Minority stress may be particularly salient in predicting alcohol problems for sexual minority populations . Significant predictors of substance use among sexual minority women, which are relevant to minority stress, include internalized homophobia  and rejecting reactions to disclosure of sexual minority identity .
Major depression  is more common in subjects with coronary artery disease  than in the general population, with prevalence ranging from 17 to 30% . Depression may be predictive of CAD , although life style factors such as poor diet, lack of exercise, excessive smoking, and poor compliance with medical treatment may also contribute. Sub clinical inflammation may also cause CAD: subjects with depression often exhibit immune imbalance, altered endothelial function, and other inflammatory features .
Acquired immune deficiency syndrome  is a devastating disease that has claimed the lives of an estimated 36 million people. HIV 1 has a small genome and expresses only 15 proteins but exhibits a complex life cycle. Like all viruses it is dependent on host cell proteins and factors for productive replication and spread.
Considerable effort is underway to identify screening strategies that accurately diagnose ovarian cancer in its early stages when it is most treatable . Biomarkers that can be measured in blood products are of particular interest for their potential to provide a low cost, noninvasive screening modality suitable for application to large populations. Mesothelin  and HE4  are two of the most promising novel ovarian cancer biomarkers and are of particular interest as candidate early detection markers.
For American men, prostate cancer has the highest incidence of all cancers and is the third leading cause of death behind heart disease and lung cancer. It is imperative that new treatments be developed to battle this fatal disease . These three qualities allow a TIC to generate the heterogeneous population of cells found within a tumor, while continually maintaining the regenerative pool of TICs.
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease  is the most prevalent respiratory disease in the world and is the 5th leading cause of death in developed nations . It is characterized by airflow limitation that is not fully reversible and commonly affects both the airways and lung parenchyma. The processes that maintain the alveolar capillary network have not been fully defined, however it is increasingly recognized that bone marrow derived progenitor cells play important roles, particularly hematopoietic progenitor cells  and endothelial progenitor cells .
Lung cancer is the second most common cancer and the leading cause of cancer deaths, accounting for 30% of male and 26% of female cancer deaths . With treatment, clinical stage 1A non small cell lung cancer  has a 5 year survival of 61%, while stage IV disease has a 5 year survival of only 1% . Current lung cancer diagnosis and staging focus only on the detection and anatomic distribution of the tumor.
Vascular disorders, including ischemic stroke, are leading causes of mortality and morbidity in modern societies. The underlying patho physiology is likely to be under the influence of both genetic and environmental factors . Telomeres are tandem repeats of DNA sequences located at the ends of eukaryotic chromosomes with the primary function being to protect the telomeric regions from recombination and degradation, thus avoiding a DNA damage cellular response .
Breast cancer remains a leading cause of death amongst women worldwide. There has been a dramatic rise in the incidence of ductal carcinoma in situ  in the US which is at least partially due to the use of screening mammography . Currently, therapy for DCIS involves surgical resection with or without radiation and sometimes adjuvant hormone therapy .
Until recently most research focusing on American Indian/Alaska Native  people and communities was conducted by researchers from academic institutions. These researchers were often “outsiders”; in other words they were not familiar with the community/participants under study nor did they spend time in the community or attend to important cultural differences. In addition, such research practices sometimes led to interventions and practices that were not effective or acceptable to AIAN communities .
Whereas endocrine studies have traditionally been used in conservation to monitor reproduction in rare or threatened species, hormones are now being used to monitor stress physiology as an indicator of how animals cope with social and ecological challenges in their daily lives . In recent years, our understanding of responses by free living animals to potential stressors has been greatly enhanced by the development of methods for non invasive hormone sampling , mainly because more traditional methods of blood sampling can themselves be stressful . Fecal steroid analysis, in particular, offers an economical alternative to drawing blood for frequent collection of samples without disrupting the normal behavior of individuals or groups.
Ionising radiation is a potent human carcinogen. Several tissues and organs are susceptible to the transforming effects of ionising radiation, including the breast in adolescent and young women in whom risk is both dose  and age dependent. In women treated with radiotherapy for Hodgkin lymphoma, there is a linear relationship between radiation exposure and breast cancer risk, with those under the age of 20 years at the time of exposure at the highest risk of developing subsequent breast cancer.
High mobility group box 1 protein  is a ubiquitous 215 amino acid nuclear protein that binds to DNA and promotes its bending, while maintaining genome stability, DNA processing and repair, and controlling autophagy and autophagic clearance of defective mitochondria by regulating the transcription of heat shock protein 27. In addition to these intracellular homeostatic functions and regulation of energy metabolism, HMGB1 can be released from necrotic and non lethally damaged cells into the extracellular milieu where it behaves as a pro inflammatory cytokine. While in the case of necrosis the passive liberation of HMGB1 appears to represent a consequence of nucleorrhexis, much interest has been placed on the process of HMGB1 translocation across the nuclear and plasma membranes of non lethally stressed cells.
Needle biopsy of breast masses is widely recognized as a highly accurate and economical diagnostic procedure when tissue sampling is sufficient. Nondiagnostic samples, typically classified as those which are void of epithelial cells , occur in up to 35% of palpation guided FNAB  procedures and 12% of image guided CNB procedures targeting nonpalpable lesions . These difficulties lead to rebiopsy in approximately 4% of the patients that undergo percutaneous procedures  .
Tuberculosis  is a leading global cause of death. Vitamin D deficiency associates with susceptibility to active TB in numerous settings  and vitamin D supplementation enhances antimycobacterial immunity . Vitamin D is synthesized in the skin during exposure to ultra violet light and is metabolized by the liver to form 25 hydroxyvitamin D D), the major circulating vitamin D metabolite and accepted measure of vitamin D status.
Significant progress has been made recently in treating certain forms of inherited retinal degenerations with gene specific approaches . Treatment is effective regardless if EPO is delivered systemically or intraocularly . To avoid this complication, intraocular delivery was tested.
Human decision making can be biased by context and risk . For example, a supermarket might advertise yogurt as “99% fat free” instead of “1% fat” to encourage sales, although these statements mean the same thing. This framing effect  is conceptually embraced by prospect theory .
Evidence suggests that leukocyte adhesion and leukostasis play an important role in the pathogenesis of diabetic retinopathy . Signal to noise is reduced for two reasons. First, the retinal vasculature is embedded in the retina’s thick, multilayered structure.
It is widely accepted that the number of people identified with autism spectrum disorders  has risen over the past decade . For many youth with ASD, it appears that there is a connection between problems with anxiety and the social impairment that characterizes these disorders. Anxiety, in turn, may exacerbate the social deficit.
Cortical   basal ganglia loop circuits have a vital role in normal learning and decision making, and dysfunction of these circuits is implicated in a wide range of human neurological and psychiatric disorders. Although classic “box and arrow” models of basal ganglia organization  have spurred much fruitful research, it has also been recognized for some time that we require greater knowledge about the dynamics of brain activity in these circuits to reveal their operational principles. Along these lines there has been much recent interest in oscillations and synchrony within the basal ganglia, in both normal and pathological states .
School readiness is a multi dimensional construct that refers to how physically, cognitively, emotionally, socially, and behaviorally prepared for school children are. A large body of research has focused on school readiness not only because of its importance for children’s transition to formal education but also because school readiness has been associated with important long term outcomes including school completion and academic achievement . The vast majority of research on school readiness has examined North American or European samples, which has led to important understanding of these contexts.
Colour vision in most mammals, including mice, is dichromatic, being mediated by M and S opsin photopigments for sensitivity to medium long  and short  wavelengths of light, respectively . Opsins are expressed in cone photoreceptors which are generated before birth in the mouse . Cones begin to express S opsin near birth and M opsin at P8 .
Glioblastoma multiforme  is the most malignant  astrocytoma and is the most frequent type of primary brain tumor. Standard of care treatment involves radiation, chemotherapy, and maximal surgical re section of the tumor; however, as the poor survival rate indicates, these treatments have not been effective in preventing disease progression. One of the hallmarks of GBM is its invasiveness.
Several missense and deletion mutations of DJ 1 cause early onset familial Parkinson’s disease. Several studies suggested DJ 1 may be involved in oxidative sensoring , ubiquitin proteasome system  and post transcriptional regulation  . The expression pattern of DJ 1 in the brain remains controversial.
Multiple sclerosis  is a demyelinating disease affecting humans that is associated with an inflammatory autoimmune response in the central nervous system . The innate immune response recognizes pathogens by pathogen associated molecular patterns  which enables the differentiation between self and non self. Pattern recognition receptors, including the Toll like receptors , recognize PAMPs and signal the cell to respond to the pathogen.
Retinal cell loss is the cause of many degenerative human diseases, including retinitis pigmentosa and age related macular degeneration. Intriguingly, Müller glia , the cell type that initiates retina regeneration, are not specific to the zebrafish retina, but are common to all vertebrates . Treatment of explants with transcription factors and select growth factors can induce mammalian MG to mount a regeneration response but the response is extremely limited .
During the 1990’s, preclinical, early ecological and observational studies historically reported that dietary fat intake was positively associated with breast  and colorectal cancer  risk. A sizeable randomized, controlled trial with adequate statistical power was designed to test this hypothesis. The Women’s Health Initiative  randomized low fat dietary modification  trial  was initiated with incidence of  breast cancer and colorectal cancer as primary outcomes, to test the hypothesis that an intervention involving reduced total fat  would reduce incidence of these outcomes over a 9 year period in 48,000 free living postmenopausal women .
Many studies have demonstrated the ability of folic acid supplementation to prevent neural tube defects  . Folic acid fortification of the food supply was implemented in the U.S. in early 1998, with the goal of reducing NTD prevalence. Indeed, NTD prevalence has declined in the U.S. subsequent to fortification .
The increasing prevalence of obesity among older adults is a major public health problem, because of the increasing number of older adults and the medical complications associated with obesity . Obese older adults are at particularly high risk for developing nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  because both obesity  and aging  are associated with increased IHF accumulation. The development of NAFLD in older adults has serious clinical implications, because of the potential progression to severe liver disease and the association of NAFLD with metabolic risk factors for coronary heart disease, including insulin resistance, diabetes, and dyslipidemia .
Convection enhanced delivery  uses fluid pressure at the tip of the delivery cannula and bulk flow to propagate substances within the extracellular fluid spaces . With the increasing use of CED in clinical neurosurgery , investigators have sought to visualize the delivery of therapeutics intra operatively. Adeno associated viral vectors  contain single stranded DNA genomes and are members of the nonpathogenic parvovirus family.
It is argued by some that, as an organizing principle for US health care, approaching each patient strictly as an individual is obsolete, and that the population health approach is an alternative for improving and maintaining the health of everyone in the community . Within the ICF, activity constitutes the “execution of a task by an individual,” and participation represents “involvement in a life situation,” characterized according to identical sets of “chapters” . IADLs, more complex domestic life and household management tasks, are necessary for all individuals if they are to participate in community life .
Over the past decade, there has been a precipitous decline in HIV related deaths worldwide because of the wide availability of antiretroviral therapy , which means that HIV infected parents are living healthier and longer and are increasingly likely to have children and/or raise their children into adolescence or adulthood. However, HIV infected parents often find it difficult to disclose their HIV status to children  due to various concerns . However, empirical data on these issues are limited to date .
It has been well established from current combat related injuries during US military operations in Iraq and Afghanistan that the ratio of serious injuries to fatal casualties exceeds that of previous conflicts. Orthopaedic trauma comprises the vast majority of these war wounds, as 70% of casualties involve the musculoskeletal system, 26% are fractures, and 82% of the fractures are open. Thus, it is not surprising that the incidence of osteomyelitis  in combat related extremity injuries is between 2% to 15%, and is of great concern.
Determination of high resolution three dimensional structures of transmembrane proteins remains a major challenge in biochemistry. Furthermore, structures of TMPs from eukaryotic sources appear to be particularly elusive. 2) Purification of particular TMPs away from other membrane components requires solubilization in detergent, which can denature proteins and remove critical co factors or bound lipids.
Tumor antigen specific CD4+ helper T cells play important roles in the induction and maintenance of antitumor immune responses. In addition, immune potentiating cytokines from CD4+ T cells may help other immune cells to overcome the actions of immunosuppressive factors . In the classical view of antigen presentation, intracellular and extracellular proteins are presented to CD8+ and CD4+ T cells via the MHC class I  and MHC class II  pathways, respectively .
The urokinase type plasminogen activator  system plays an important role in the progression of many types of cancer . Binding of uPA to its receptor  initiates a proteolytic cascade that ultimately results in degradation of extracellular matrix  components and activation of matrix metalloproteases . These processes in turn lead to tumor invasion and metastasis.
In adolescents, externalizing disorders and the syndrome of neurobehavioral disinhibition are a broad spectrum of disorders involving poor impulse control as a cardinal feature. These disorders are linked to substance use disorder , thus possibly representing a vulnerability to addiction . With the eventual goal of assessing whether deficits of impulse control predate and/or potentially predispose to drug use, our laboratory studies impulsivity in adolescents who are at high risk for poor impulse control .
Chemokines play a major role in orchestrating innate and adaptive immune responses by controlling the migration of leukocytes using G protein coupled chemokine receptors that decorate the surface of these cells. In humans, ACKR2 is expressed by lymphatic endothelial cells , trophoblasts, and some leukocyte populations . IBC serve key roles during homeostasis, autoimmunity and infection, and new properties of these cells continue to be defined.
Sturge Weber syndrome  is characterized by vascular malformations present in the skin , eye, and meninges  . The intracranial vascular anomaly is most often unilateral and involves the occipital and parietal lobes, although it might affect other lobes and spare the most posterior region in some cases . Seizures are the most common neurologic complications, varying from 72% to 93% in unilateral and bilateral involvement, respectively .
Several examples of DNA templated organic reactions have been reported, but far fewer stereo  and regio specific DNA mediated polymerization reactions are known. In previous work, we have reported the attachment of dicarboxyl and diamino groups to the 2′ position of uridine nucleoside analogs. These side chains were condensed to form short segments of a nylon like polymer pendent from the nucleic acid backbone.
The AAS are synthetic derivatives of testosterone whose therapeutic use has been overshadowed by illicit self administration of excessive doses of these drugs resulting in adverse effects on reproduction and sexual behaviors . AAS abuse by teenagers  may present even greater risks than for adults, given the greater hormone sensitivity of the brain during adolescence . Administration of supraphysiological levels of AAS in rodents alters pubertal onset and reproductive behaviors and is associated with suppression of gonadotropin secretion and disruption of the hypothalamic pituitary gonadal  axis .
T cells are the only leukocyte subset in the ovarian cancer microenvironment known to exert spontaneous immune pressure against tumor progression, such that the infiltration of tumor islets by CD3+ T cells was definitively associated with a better outcome in a large cohort of patients . Interestingly, subsequent studies confirming the protective role of T cells in ovarian cancer suggest that CD4+ T cells actually have an unfavorable effect on prognosis, restricting the beneficial mediators of antitumor immune pressure to CD8+ T cells  . Yet, studies dating back more than two decades, indicate that in the absence of CD8+ T cells, CD4+ T cells directly act to eradicate both solid and haematologic malignancies .
We hypothesized that the degree of preserved functional connectivity within the DMN during the first week after cardiopulmonary arrest  would be associated with functional outcome at hospital discharge . Initially comatose CPA survivors with indeterminate prognosis at 72 hours were enrolled. In hospital and out of hospital CPA patients were identified by provider referral, screening the hospital census, and review of the hospital Code Blue record.
The extracellular pH  of malignant solid tumors is acidic, in the range of 6.5 to 6.9, whereas the pHe of normal tissues is significantly more alkaline, 7.2 to 7.5 . Mathematical models of the tumor host interface  and in vivo measurements have shown that solid tumors export acid into the surrounding parenchyma . Previous in vitro studies have shown that tumor cell invasion can be stimulated by acidic conditions and that this may involve lysosomal proteases .
In 2014, approximately 55,070 new cases of head and neck cancer, the majority of which are of a squamous histology , will be diagnosed in the United States and an estimated 12,000 individuals will die of these cancers . Alcohol and tobacco use are the major risk factors for HNSCC. HPV is also strongly associated with some HNSCC, especially oropharynx cancers  .
Animal lesion models and studies involving patients with selective damage to structures of the medial temporal lobe  have demonstrated critical involvement of this brain region in the encoding and retrieval of long term declarative memory, the memory for facts and events . Neuroimaging and neuropsychological studies of patients with damage to the prefrontal cortex  have also suggested the contribution of the PFC to the encoding of long term memory  . The topdown influence of prefrontal activity upon parahippocampal activity is consistent with the anatomical connectivity between these brain regions .
Acute Myeloid Leukemia  is an aggressive malignancy of the bone marrow characterized by accumulation of early myeloid blood cells that fail to mature and differentiate. The course of the disease is marked by poor prognosis, frequent relapse, and high disease related mortality . Recent clinical investigation has focused on the identification of prognostic subgroups in adult AML with the goal of guiding patients into risk adapted therapies.
Trigeminal pain disorders, such as migraine and temporomandibular disorders , are more prevalent in women than in men , which has been attributed to oestrogen fluctuations over the course of the menstrual cycle . Trigeminal pain in women changes with the menstrual cycle. Although clinical data suggest that oestrogen increases susceptibility to trigeminal pain disorders, the fall in oestrogen at the time of menstruation may precipitate an attack, suggesting a complex relationship between oestrogen levels and trigeminal pain .
Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A  is an essential regulator of vascular physiology. VEGF A plays key roles in vasculogenesis and angiogenesis during development. Angiogenesis is needed for embryogenesis and wound healing but is also associated with cancer, eye diseases and other chronic disorders.
Ewing's family tumors are malignancies that share histological features as well as a recurrent and specific t chromosomal translocation . This translocation results in a chimeric transcript encoding the N terminal domain of the RNA binding protein EWS and the DNA binding domain of the ETS family transcription factor Fli1 . The resultant EWS Fli1 chimeric fusion protein is known to affect both gene transcription and RNA splicing  .
DNA damage from endogenous and exogenous sources can promote increased mutation rates and cell death, two processes implicated in diseases such as cancer and neurodegeneration . Importantly, it has been demonstrated that activities belonging to direct, base excision, mismatch, nucleotide excision, and recombination repair pathways are present in organisms ranging from bacteria to humans, with many of the initial mechanistic and genetic studies performed in E. coli  . Further, the coordination and integration of DNA damage signaling pathways with each other and the rest of the cellular proteome are still relatively uncharacterized.
B cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia  represents the most common form of leukemia in adults of Western countries, accounts for 25% of all cases of leukemia in adults. However, this traditional view has changed in the past decade. Recent investigations have shown that high lymphocyte count can result from not only the prolonged survival, but also from proliferating cells originated in the bone morrow, lymph nodes or spleen.
Coronary heart disease is an important threat to public health in the world . Elevated plasma triglyceride  and reduced high density lipoprotein cholesterol  concentrations are major risk factors for coronary heart disease . Intensive and sustained lifestyle modifications such as physical activity and diets especially when associated with weight loss, reduced TG levels, but for many individuals pharmacological interventions are needed to achieve substantial reduction in TGs.
Historically, therapeutic alliance has received considerable attention in adult treatment, with over 7000 studies of therapeutic alliance in adult psychotherapy . The most common definition of therapeutic alliance makes reference to the development of an affective bond, agreement on tasks, and agreement on goals . In child psychotherapy, therapeutic alliance has been strongly associated with improved parenting , reductions in the child’s symptomatology , and improved family functioning .
Early life stress has been implicated in mental health disorders, such as schizophrenia, clinical depression and more recently, Autism Spectrum Disorder . Maternal separation has frequently been used in rodents to model neonatal stress and has been well characterized in terms of its developmental programming of the HPA axes and associated behavioral alterations . The objective of this study is to provide an initial behavioral characterization of a new stress paradigm in Balb/CByJ mice, which minimizes maternal separation time from the pups.
Measuring older adults’ decision making competence  reliably and validly is critical for  identifying individuals whose decision making abilities are impaired;  avoiding inappropriate removal of decision making power from competent individuals, and  advancing theories of when and how decision makers across the adult lifespan are able to meet the demands of various decision environments. Even though robust assessment tools are essential for modeling and assisting successful aging, few tools provide a performance based analysis of older adults’ DMC. In this article, we report progress in an ongoing research program that aims to measure older adults’ decision skills using behavioral decision tasks .
Styrene  is an important industrial chemical widely used in the manufacture of plastics, resins, and synthetic rubbers. The highest levels of human exposure to styrene occur in the reinforced plastic industry. Occupational and environmental exposures to styrene take place mainly by inhalation.
Chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome  is a common but poorly understood condition. Pelvic pain or discomfort is the principal diagnostic criterion. , The mechanisms underlying the development of CP/CPPS are unknown.
Patients suffering from chronic heart failure have a reduced capacity for physical work. These peripheral skeletal muscle adaptations limit physical function independent of cardiac impairment and persist despite correction of cardiac dysfunction. Aerobic fitness is commonly assumed to be the primary determinant of physical function in heart failure patients because exertional fatigue and dyspnea are predominant symptoms of the disease.
Regulation of connexins is critical in maintaining normal cell function. Connexins compose gap junctions, plasma membrane channels that mediate the direct cell to cell exchange of small molecules such as ions, second messengers, and small metabolites . Cx43 is the most widely expressed connexin and is critical in various physiological events, such as cell growth, differentiation, and certain developmental processes .
The Kruppel like family of zinc finger transcription factors  regulates a range of biological processes, including cell growth, differentiation, embryogenesis and tumorigenesis . In the intestine, expression of Klf4 appears to be associated primarily with the terminally differentiated state of epithelial cells since by in situ hybridization and immunostaining, Klf4 localizes to the upper region of the colonic crypt of the adult mouse  . Thus, the broader role that Klf4 may play in the maturation program of other cell types in the intestinal mucosa is not clear.
OSU 03012, a derivative of the drug Celecoxib, lacks COX2 inhibitory activity . COX2 is over expressed in several tumor types and drugs that inhibit COX2 i.e. Celecoxib have been shown to cause tumor cell specific increases in cell death, and that are also associated with a lower rate of growth . Expression levels of COX2 do not simplistically correlate with tumor cell sensitivity to COX2 inhibitors .
Tooth development is largely under genetic control and all familial cases as well as the majority of sporadic cases of congenital tooth agenesis are likely to be caused by sequence variations in one of the many genes that are involved in tooth development . Hypohidrotic Ectodermal Dysplasia  is such a syndrome, which features hypoplasia of most epithelial appendages including variable numbers of missing teeth, sparse hair, hypoplastic or aplastic sweat glands leading to hypohidrosis with potentially life threatening hyperthermia. Non syndromic tooth agenesis on the other hand, has been defined as affecting predominantly the dentition and involving primarily tooth specific genes   .
Cystic fibrosis  lung disease is characterized by airway obstruction, chronic infection, and neutrophil dominated inflammation leading to progressive and irreversible lung destruction. Neutrophil derived DNA contributes to the increased viscosity of airway secretions. Dornase alfa  hydrolyzes DNA, reducing the viscosity of CF sputum.
Alcohol is the most commonly used intoxicant among underage youth in the U.S. followed by marijuana, with 45% of teens report drinking and 18% report using marijuana in the past month . Alcohol related effects on sleep have been extensively studied in adults. Acute and subacute alcohol withdrawal  have been associated with decreased Slow Wave Sleep  and higher Rapid Eye Movement  pressure .
Epithelial cell migration plays a fundamental role in a wide variety of physiological processes ranging from tissue and organ remodeling during embryogenesis to cancer progression and other pathological events. Epithelial cell sheet migration has a central role in skin wound healing. Myosin II, an abundant motor protein in nonmuscle cells, has key roles in this respect during cell migration, in posterior cell retraction, and via poorly understood mechanisms, in helping stabilize nascent focal adhesions in the anterior portion of the cell .
Leishmaniasis, caused by infection with parasites of the Leishmania genus, affects millions of individuals worldwide causing serious morbidity and mortality. Individuals infected with Leishmania present with different clinical forms, depending on the species/strain of the parasite, as well as characteristics of the host’s immune response. CL is the most frequent form and is clinically characterized by the presence of a single skin ulcer with elevated borders that can progress to spontaneous healing.
Salivary glands are highly specialized exocrine organs secreting large amounts of protein and fluid. Both acini and ductal cells can synthesize and secrete large amounts of proteins but acinar cells typically produce most protein. Autonomic nerves closely control levels of protein synthesis  so that feeding  drives protein synthesis to replenish stored proteins.
Changes in the configurational entropy of molecules are believed to contribute importantly to the free energies of conformational change and binding. A reliable method of computing configurational entropy could provide valuable insights into the mechanism of such processes, and could also offer important assistance in problems of molecular design. However, calculating entropy is traditionally a highly challenging problem, especially for complex molecules.
As a transcription factor that is activated by environmental stimuli and cellular stresses, NF κB plays an important role in numerous biological and pathological processes . In cancer cells, NF κB is frequently activated and contributes to proliferation, survival, invasion, and metastasis . NF κB is generally considered as a cell survival factor that protect cancer cells against apoptosis because it upregulates expression of anti apoptotic genes .
Serotonin , is a major neurotransmitter acting upon several receptor subtypes in brain, among which is the well characterized serotonin subtype 4  receptor . This G protein coupled receptor is positively linked to adenylyl cyclase  with influence over acetylcholine , dopamine  and serotonin release . The distribution of 5 HT4 receptors in human brain is postsynaptic and is relatively dense in basal ganglia and hippocampal formation, less dense in neocortex and absent in cerebellum .
Benign prostatic hyperplasia , the most common benign neoplasm in American men, is a chronic, progressive condition associated with the development of lower urinary tract symptoms . While LUTS rarely progress to become life threatening, they frequently have a negative impact on men’s quality of life. It has been demonstrated that the effect of moderate LUTS on health related quality of life  was comparable to that of having diabetes, high blood pressure or cancer, while the effect of severe LUTS was comparable to having had a heart attack or stroke.
Asperger syndrome  is an autism spectrum disorder which is characterized by deficient social interaction and communication skills, stereotyped behaviors, as well as circumscribed special interests . Furthermore, auditory hypersensitivity is common in AS , and might be partly explained by the enhanced cortical sound discrimination ability reported in this syndrome  . However, research on this topic has so far been quite sparse.
Identification of new biomarkers to predict bad pregnancy/fetal outcomes would be of enormous clinical benefit. In particular, a non invasive detection of a biomarker that can identify pregnancies at risk would allow determining optimal timing of delivery and implementation of neuroprotective strategies to the mother. Currently, there are very few methods to predict adverse pregnancy/fetal outcomes .
The incidence of delayed fracture healing, or non union, is estimated to occur in 5 10% of fractures . Studies have found mechanosensitivity to have a genetic basis . Within this pathway, the PTEN gene  encodes the Pten protein and negatively regulates activation of Akt.
Parkinson's disease  is a disabling neurodegenerative disorder marked by progressive motor dysfunction and characterized by the loss of nigrostriatal dopamine  neurons and cytoplasmic inclusions termed Lewy bodies . While the pathogenesis of PD has not yet been established, previous studies have implicated both genetic as well as environmental contributions. In a recent study, a nematode model of α syn induced misfolding and age dependent DA neurodegeneration was used to screen a candidate list of ∼900 starting targets, derived from analysis of proteins or pathways implicated in PD, as well as co expressed and interacting partners .
Ebola  and Marburg  virus are members of the family Filoviridae, which belongs to the order Mononegavirales. The isolation of highly pathogenic strains of MARV  now makes rates of fatality from MARV similar to those of EBOV in Zaire, Sudan and Ivory Coast —fatalities originating from a viral induced hemorrhagic fever that reach rates of up to 90%  .
