The MARV genome, like other members of the order, is a negative sense single stranded  RNA genome just over 19kb in length that encodes seven genes .
Cross cultural studies of substance use behaviors have demonstratedconsiderable variation in the types of substances most commonly consumed, as well asthe social and physical contexts in which they are consumed . For example, a 2002 review article on minority womenand drinking opened with the statement that “Women's drinking patterns areinfluenced by the cultural norms and practices of the ethnic groups to which theybelong, in addition to other environmental and biological factors,” . We find this use ofthe concept of cultural norms, published in NIAAA's practitioner directed journalAlcohol Research & Health, to be fairly typical of theliterature in our field .
Human plasma phospholipid transfer protein  is a 476 amino acid protein secreted by a wide variety of tissues  and is associated predominantly with apo A I containing lipoproteins in plasma . Among the diverse biological functions proposed for PLTP is its role in modulating vascular lipoproteins. In vitro, PLTP can facilitate the transfer of phospholipids and cholesterol from the lower density lipoproteins to high density lipoproteins .
The proportion of women who are overweight  25 30 kg/m2) or obese  when they become pregnant is substantial and rapidly increasing; a recent study estimated that over 20% of US women are obese at the start of pregnancy. High pre pregnancy BMI, particularly obesity, increases the risk of numerous adverse maternal and fetal outcomes including preeclampsia, gestational diabetes and fetal death. The impact of obesity on physical health during pregnancy has been studied extensively, while the relationship between obesity and maternal mental health has been largely neglected.
Primary Sjögren’s Syndrome  is an autoimmune disease characterized by a lymphocytic infiltrate in, and subsequent destruction of, the lacrimal and salivary glands . Immune mediated impairment of glandular function results in keratoconjunctivitis sicca and xerostomia . Traditionally, animal models have been employed to dissect the cellular and genetic mechanisms underlying many human diseases.
Urinary tract infections  occur in women with diabetes mellitus more frequently than in women without diabetes, are more severe, with pyelonephritis occurring at a five fold higher rate, and often result in complications that are otherwise rare, such as emphysematous cystitis, and fungal infections . Asymptomatic bacteriuria  occurs three times more often among women with diabetes than among otherwise healthy women; ASB is associated with an increased risk of symptomatic infection but is not causative . The presence of ASB in diabetic women is not associated with a faster decline in renal function , or greater risk of diabetic complications or mortality.
The costs of an uncomplicated renal transplant event are approximately $100 000 for the first in 90 days of care . CMS is the primary payer for most of kidney transplant patients and though kidney transplantation is cost effective compared to long term dialysis, kidney transplant recipients consume significant healthcare resources . CMS spends $27 billion/year on the care of renal failure patients, and approximately 13% of this amount is for kidney transplantation  .
One of the still unsolved mysteries of anesthesia is how temporary amnesia is produced during wakefulness by drugs such as midazolam or propofol. Encoding is defined as the process of acquiring and representing information in memory. For the purposes of the current study memory processes after encoding are divided into working and long term memories.
Emotions are associated with the automatic generation of bodily responses, notably those mediated by the autonomic nervous system: changes in heart rate, blood pressure and bodily states contributes to emotional feelings: coupling of emotion with peripheral arousal is highlighted by influential theories of emotion, such as that of James and Lange, who argued that the central representation of bodily arousal states provides emotional colour to otherwise emotionless sensory experiences . There is increasing interest in neuroanatomy supporting interactions between affect and bodily arousal states. It is also noteworthy that all these regions have been shown to be sensitive to visceral changes .
Reactions of high valent iron complexes have attracted considerable interest because iron oxo intermediates are formed in catalytic oxidations in the laboratory and in nature . In a typical catalytic sequence, an iron species is oxidized to an iron oxo transient with a formal oxidation state of +5 on iron by a peroxy  or oxo containing sacrificial oxidant, and the high valent iron oxo species then oxidizes a substrate in a two electron, oxo transfer process to return the iron complex . Synthetic porphyrin iron complexes and related corrole iron complexes mimic heme containing peroxidase and cytochrome P450 enzymes, and high valent iron oxo species with both types of macrocycles have been known for years .
Pyrethroids are synthetic chemicals modeled after the naturally occurring pyrethrins, found in chrysanthemums . These axonic poisons cause paralysis and ultimately death of the organism by keeping sodium channels open in the neuronal membranes. Pyrethroid pesticides are often thought of as “safer” alternatives to the more toxic organophosphates because of their low mammalian toxicity.
Coordination of activity between the hippocampus and medial prefrontal cortex  has been demonstrated extensively during sleep and wakefulness . During sleep, ensembles of hippocampal place cells reactivate memory traces that represent spatial trajectories encoded during wakefulness . The reactivation of place cells occurs during brief high frequency oscillations  in the hippocampal local field potential  and is thought to have a direct role in memory consolidation .
Squamous cell carcinoma  is the most common malignancy of the upper aero digestive tract. Despite continually evolving therapeutic options, we have witnessed little improvement in survival for patients with squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck  over the past three decades . However, such vaccination approaches designed to stimulate anti tumor T cell immunity for SCCHN have demonstrated only limited efficacy .
Cognition is a set of high level brain functions that vary substantially among individuals. Genes involved in synaptic signaling or plasticity have been implicated in cognitive variability. Recently, two genes have received particular attention for these effects.
Advances in the treatment of pediatric major depressive disorder have demonstrated effective acute phase treatments, including antidepressant medication , psychotherapy  and their combination ). Most treatment studies focus on acute phase outcomes, and those studies which report long term outcomes generally continue the acute phase treatments into long term care. Few studies have included specific sequential continuation treatment strategies developed to improve long term outcomes .
Gastric cancer  is a major cause of cancer related death, worldwide. Helicobacter pylori  plays an important role in gastric carcinogenesis, although the majority of individuals with H. pylori infection do not develop gastric cancer. It is now widely accepted that changes in DNA methylation patterns, particularly promoter hypermethylation and global  hypomethylation, contribute to cancer development and tumor growth.
The class B scavenger receptor family is a group of integral membrane proteins which includes scavenger receptor class B type I , its splicing variant SR BII , thrombospondin receptor CD36 and lysosomal integral membrane protein II . CD36 is a well known lipoprotein receptor and a long chain fatty acid  transporter . CD36 also binds oxidized low density lipoprotein  facilitating foam cell formation and development of atherosclerosis .
Prostate cancer is one of the most common cancers affecting men in the United States with approximately 234,000 new cases and 30,000 deaths in year 2006 alone . Lipoxygenases  are a family of non heme iron containing proteins that catalyze the dioxygenation of polyunsaturated fatty acids containing the 1 cis 4 cis pentadiene moiety to form bioactive lipids. Dependent on the predominant position of the incorporation of hydroperoxy group, LOXs are classfied as 5 , 8 , 12 , and 15 LOXs, whose main products are 5 , 8 , 12, and 15 HETE, respectively .
Schistosomiasis, also known as bilharzia or snail fever, is a neglected tropical disease caused by parasitic schistosomes  indigenous to tropical and subtropical regions of the developing world. Biomphalaria fresh water snails serve as intermediate hosts for Schistosoma mansoni and release infectious larvae , which burrow into human skin upon contact with contaminated water sources. After definitive host penetration, the parasite transforms into a schistosomulum that enters the circulation and migrates to the hepatic portal and mesenteric veins surrounding the liver.
Experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis  is a CD4+ T cell mediated demyelinating autoimmune disease of the central nervous system  in mice , which serves as a model of multiple sclerosis  in humans. EAE in rodents is characterized by histological lesions in the CNS, typically consisting of demyelination and infiltrates of autoreactive T cells and other mononuclear cells . Although these cells reside predominantly in tissue exposed to the external environment, including the skin, intestinal tract, and trachea, they are also normally present in the heart, lymph nodes, spleen, and the CNS .
Congenital heart defects  occur in approximately 1% of live births and are the most common birth defects . Most CHDs are caused by abnormalities in septation and valvulogenesis. The tubular OFT rotates counterclockwise during the formation of the great arteries .
Paclitaxel is a first line chemotherapeutic agent that inhibits the dynamic instability of microtubules, thus preventing bi orientation of chromosomes during mitosis . Our goal here was to identify the cell autonomous components that permit escape from mitotic stress induced cell death in a paclitaxel resistant NSCLC setting . By inhibiting the dynamic instability of microtubules, paclitaxel disrupts chromosome alignment, thereby preventing satisfaction of the spindle assembly checkpoint .
Kaposi sarcoma associated herpesvirus , also known as human herpesvirus 8  was first described in 1994 . KSHV is etiologically associated with all forms of Kaposi sarcoma , primary effusion lymphoma , and multicentric Castleman disease  . Successful KSHV infection is characterized by both virus entry and the ability of the virus to establish latency.
The high level of alcohol binge drinking during adolescence remains an important public health concern . The adolescent brain is more sensitive to the neurotoxic effects of alcohol than the adult brain . Especially vulnerable are brain structures that mature later in development, such as the cortex and hippocampus , which are key regions in the modulation of attentional and cognitive processes and impulsivity .
Although the health benefits of breastfeeding are well established, the rates of breastfeeding initiation, continuation, and exclusive breastfeeding during the first few months of infancy are lower than expected among US mothers . Multiple health organizations, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention , the World Health Organization, and the American Academy of Pediatrics, recommend exclusive breastfeeding for the first four to six months of life . Despite this, the CDC estimates the national rate for exclusive breastfeeding among new US mothers at infant age three months to be only 35 percent .
Men who have sex with men  continue to make up the vast majority of HIV infections in the US. For example, BMSM on the whole report fewer sex partners and similar rates of unprotected anal intercourse when compared with WMSM. Alarming rates of HIV among BMSM have led this group to be among the foremost priority HIV prevention populations in the US.
In the United States, there exists a common stereotype of the Asian model minority: a group of individuals who excel academically and exhibit few behavioral difficulties . For this reason, at risk Asian American youth remain relatively understudied. Between 1980 and 2000, juvenile arrests of Asian youth increased by 11 percent in the U.S., while juvenile arrests during the same period decreased for African American and European American adolescents .
Interactions between neurons and glial cells are crucial mechanisms underlying synaptic plasticity in the spinal dorsal horn in pathological pain conditions . Previous studies have shown that glial cells can enhance activation of glutamate receptors in the spinal dorsal horn by reducing glial glutamate transporter functions  and releasing pro inflammatory cytokines including interleukin 1beta  . Further, impairment of glial glutamate transporters reduces GABAergic synaptic activities in the spinal dorsal horn due to insufficient GABA synthesis through the glutamate glutamine cycle between astrocytes and neurons .
The majority of aligned sample solid state NMR studies on proteins immobilized in supramolecular complexes, such as virus particles or membranes, have relied on 1H/15N double resonance experiments . There are several advantages to this approach, including the relative ease and low cost of labeling all nitrogen sites in proteins obtained by expression in bacteria . Solid state NMR experiments on uniformly 15N labeled proteins are straightforward because they have no nitrogen atoms directly bonded to other nitrogen atoms in either backbone or side chain sites.
EC have been shown to play a central role in vasculogenesis during development and in angiogenesis . Besides their potential role in regenerative medicine, EC are an important tool for studying vasculogenic and angiogenic mechanisms involved in the pathogenesis of vascular disease, cancer, and diabetic retinopathy. In addition, endothelial signaling in developmental organogenesis appears to be universal in vertebrates , making them important for tissue engineering.
Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia  remains a life threatening disease process prevalent among immunosuppressed populations. Despite many improvements in our ability to care for critically ill patients, the mortality attributable to PcP has changed little and remains unacceptably high . Therefore new treatment modalities that specifically address the pathophysiology of PcP are needed.
Serotonin  has long been documented to play a critical trophic role in early brain development . One unique developmental feature concerning 5 HT is its transient presence in thalamocortical afferents, particularly those involved in primary sensory circuits . These findings suggest that abnormal development of the 5 HT system could lead to altered wiring of neural circuits and inappropriate behavior .
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a systemic inflammatory disease of unknown etiology characterized by destructive joint disease, significant morbidity and increased mortality . There are numerous genetic factors associated with increased risk for RA including HLA alleles containing the shared epitope , PTPN22 polymorphism, and others . These genetic factors are thought to predispose individuals to the development of autoimmunity, likely due to genetic and environmental interactions .
Back pain is a common occupational problem in commercial fishermen. Low back symptoms were the most common cause of work impairment among a cohort of North Carolina commercial fishermen . However, the importance of these factors from a prevention standpoint is limited by the degree to which they are modifiable.
Most therapeutic regimens for lymphoma are based on combinations of drugs, radiation and/or surgery to maximize patient survival. Moreover, several current clinical trials are based on the combination of oncolytic viruses with other therapies , . We reasoned that MV might be especially adept to treat lymphoma because of its natural tropism for lymphocytes .
Individuals lower in socioeconomic status  consistently suffer poorer mental and physical health. These patterns make low SES one of the most robust risk factors for disease and disability . In children, the types of factors that have most consistently been found to be protective against outcomes such as mood and antisocial disorders include supportive relationships with others such as close family relationships and authoritative parenting  .
Worldwide, nearly half of all pregnancies are unintended, contributing to substantial negative health outcomes including maternal morbidity and mortality, complicated pregnancy outcomes and significant societal burdens . Despite a wide variety of reversible hormonal contraceptive methods available for women , no new reversible contraception options have been developed for men since the invention of condoms over 400 years ago. Reduced levels of circulating gonadotropins cause suppression of intratesticular testosterone concentrations and the combination of reduced intratesticular testosterone and reduced serum follicle stimulating hormone  levels markedly suppresses spermatogenesis.
During the last decade, attempts to improve survival of adults with ALL have focused on the role of early dose intensification to eradicate minimal residual disease and prevent the emergence of drug resistant sub clones. Several trials have explored the role of allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation performed in first remission,. Others have tested the efficacy of dose intensification of several of the drugs that are standard components of ALL regimens,.
Family relationship quality predicts medical outcomes in stroke , end stage renal disease , and heart failure . Important aspects of family relationships include the extent to which family members are critical or blaming of each other, and the extent to which family members can express their feelings with each other and confide in each other. People with marital dissatisfaction are almost three times more likely to develop an episode of depression over a 12 month period than people who are satisfied with their marital relationship  and perceived criticism from family members predicts higher rates of relapse in depression  .
Chromosomes are not randomly arranged in the vertebrate cell nucleus . However, it is not clear to what extent their nuclear positions, together with their neighborhoods, are conserved in daughter cells . Using similar experimental approaches, the results of recent studies argued that the chromosomes were arranged similarly in maternal and daughter cells , or that positions of chromosomes in daughter nuclei were conserved only partly and in most cases largely differed from the positions seen in mother cell nuclei  .
While the biomedical effectiveness of antiretroviral therapy  for HIV/AIDS is well established , far less is known about the “social effectiveness” of ART for adults in sub Saharan Africa. One primary way that working aged adults contribute to household welfare is by generating income in either the formal or informal sector. Unlike biomedical effectiveness, which can readily be determined for individual patients through laboratory monitoring and medical exams, in most settings labor productivity cannot be measured at the individual level.
The immediate early gene  Arc/Arg3.1  was identified as a hippocampal transcript strongly induced by seizures and synaptic plasticity inducing electrical stimulation in the rat hippocampus . Since the publication of the two original papers, Arc/Arg3.1 has become one of the best studied brain expressed IEGs, and a large amount of data has demonstrated Arc/Arg3.1 induction under physiological and pathological conditions . Thus, although the detailed mechanisms through which Arc/Arg3.1 affects hippocampal functions are still under investigation, with recent evidence pointing to regulation of AMPA receptor endocytosis , mapping of Arc/Arg3.1 transcriptional induction provides a high resolution approach to linking the activity of neural circuits to complex hippocampus based behavior .
Epithelial ovarian cancer  is the fourth leading cause of cancer related deaths in women in the United States and the leading cause of gynecologic cancer deaths. Although 80% 90% of patients initially respond to first line chemotherapy agents carboplatin and paclitaxel, less than 1015% remain in complete remission and most patients eventually recur with chemoresistant tumors . Treatment advances have led to an improved five year survival of about 45%, but not in overall survival.
Neural differentiation of embryonic stem cells  has become a prolific area of stem cell research. However, the use of hESCs for generating cell types appropriate for cell based interventions is dependent on progress in defining the mechanisms controlling their fate into different subtypes including motor neurons and astrocytes as well as developing distinct biomarkers for their isolation, . Proteomics has emerged as a powerful direct method of simultaneous identification and quantitation of proteins.
G protein coupled receptors  are the largest family of signal transduction proteins in the mammalian genome and a major target of therapeutic drugs,. β arrestins are multifunctional scaffold proteins involved in desensitization, clathrin mediated endocytosis  and GPCR signaling. Historically, GPCR signaling was considered linear and drug development programs focused on the discovery of ligands that would either activate or block receptor function.
Developing hematopoietic cells normally require input from growth factor signaling pathways to support basal glucose metabolism for cell survival and proliferation. The extent to which this metabolic phenotype impacts cell survival or oncogenesis, however, remains unclear . Cancer cells can become growth factor independent through the activation of pathways that mimic growth factor signaling and inhibition of these pathways has proven an effective way to eliminate cancer cells.
Childhood overweight  and obesity  affect nearly 1/3 of U.S. children, and the prevalence of these conditions has increased at least four fold since the 1970s . It is unclear whether risk factors for obesity in ASD are the same or different from risk factors for children generally. For instance, poor sleep quality, which is common in ASD , may be both a cause  and a consequence  of unhealthy weight.
Changes in vascular growth and survival play an important role in neointimal formation during the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis and the arterial response to injury . As similar changes are also apparent during vascular morphogenesis and modeling of the embryonic vasculature  , we postulated that the control of cell growth and maintenance following vascular injury may share similar signaling patterns . Hedgehogs  are a class of 19 kDa morphogens that interact with heparin on the cell surface through an N terminal basic domain and are tethered to the surface through cholesterol and fatty acyl modification .
Symptomatic seizures in infancy are associated with later life epilepsy and cognitive deficits. Hypoxia is one of the most common causes of neonatal seizures, occurring in 12/1000 live births , and is associated with development of epilepsy, neurobehavioral deficits, and intellectual disability . Epilepsy and autistic like behavior have been described to occur concurrently in 30% of patients with either disorder ; the rate of co occurrence is even higher in subjects with both autism and intellectual disability .
Social phobia is characterized by pervasive social timidity, social distress and avoidance, and for some individuals, difficulty in basic social discourse. Studies aimed at elucidating its phenomenology reveal a picture of social reticence, the perception of an inability to maintain social conversations, an increased expectation of failure, fewer friends, minimal engagement in social activities, and selection of occupations based on expectancy of social interaction . These two subtypes differ on many aspects of psychopathology.
Aromatase, a member of the cytochrome P450  protein superfamily  is a unique gene product of the CYP19 gene. Aromatase is expressed in various organs including the brain . To date, there have been no published studies of aromatase distribution or regulation throughout the human brain, while animal studies suggest that brain aromatase activity is higher in adult males than in adult females and is modulated by changes in testosterone levels but not the phase of the female estrus cycle  .
Gastroschisis is a congenital defect of the ventral body wall, resulting in protrusion of the intestines outside the abdominal cavity. Evidence in support of this hypothesis comes from both human embryology and clinical observations. Normal re routing of the blood supply in the area of the developing abdominal wall results in an asymmetry, as the left omphalomesenteric artery undergoes apoptosis and the right side is retained .
The prognosis of acute internal carotid artery  occlusion may be difficult to predict. Patients with acute ICA occlusion may be asymptomatic or experience neurological effects ranging from transient ischaemic attack to devastating stroke. One possible explanation for such variation is that relatively good prognoses may be associated with robust collateral circulation from other arterial sources .
The ductus arteriosus is a prostaglandin sensitive fetal vascular shunt. Maintenance of ductus arteriosus patency in utero is required for adequate perfusion and oxygen delivery to fetal tissues. Patency of the fetal ductus is primarily attributed to low oxygen tension and active vasodilation by endogenous prostaglandins and nitric oxide .
Fractional flow reserve  enables physiologic assessment of coronary lesions at the time of invasive coronary angiography , and is the gold standard for identification of lesions that cause ischemia . Prior studies have demonstrated the importance of FFR, with identification of ischemia causing lesions associated with worsened survival, and with FFR guided revascularization enhancing event free survival . Use of FFR has established stenosis severity as an unreliable indicator of ischemia, with approximately half of high grade stenoses manifesting no ischemia.
Crohn's disease  is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease that often has its onset during young adulthood and is characterized by a protracted course of relapses and remission, . Advances in medical therapy over the past two decades has significantly revolutionized the management of CD and improved our ability to achieve remission, and reduce the number of surgeries and hospitalization . Yet, nearly half the patients with CD continue to require at least one surgical resection during the course of their disease.
Understanding the transcriptional and signaling programs that specify cardiomyocyte fate from uncommitted progenitors may provide important clues to impact cellular strategies for treating failing or infarcted heart tissue. However, Gata4 does function in cardiac cells. Tetraploid complementation was used to rescue the extra embryonic defects in Gata4 null embryos, in order to analyze the function of Gata4 during mouse organogenesis .
It is generally appreciated that the intrinsic mechanical properties of soft tissues provide insight into a variety of disease processes including liver fibrosis , breast lesions , myocardial infarction , hypertension , diastolic dysfunction , arterial stiffness , and muscle function . While in clinical practice the assessment of tissue stiffness using palpation has proven effective, this technique is limited due to its superficial and subjective nature. As such, there exists a continuing need for the improved noninvasive detection, assessment, and quantification of tissue mechanical properties .
Serine and glycine are nutrients that fuel metabolic pathways including one carbon metabolism and sulfur metabolism. This metabolic unit referred to as the serine, glycine and one carbon  network provides an integration point in cellular metabolism that allows for cells to achieve diverse biological functions by converting serine and glycine into several metabolic outputs. These outputs include building blocks for nucleotide, lipid, and protein synthesis.
Stress incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse are highly prevalent conditions which are often managed surgically. Since the introduction of the tension free mesh slings in the late 1990’s for incontinence and the subsequent development of vaginal mesh procedures for pelvic organ prolapse, the surgical management of both conditions has increased substantially. With these recent changes in surgical practice, an assessment of the lifetime risk of surgery for stress incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse is necessary to understand the overall public health impact and burden of pelvic floor disorders.
Differentiated epithelial and endothelial cells have strong attachment requirements, presumably to prevent cellular vagrancy and consequent tissue disorganization. During transformation, cells lose such anchorage context and not only survive but also proliferate without attachment to solid matrix. Certain pathways downstream from integrins may influence detachment signals.
Lung cancer is formerly the highest cause of mortality among tumor pathologies worldwide. There are no validated techniques for an early detection of pulmonary cancer lesions other than low dose helical CT scan. Unfortunately, this method have some downside effects .
The peroxisome proliferator activated receptors PPARα and PPARγ are nuclear receptors that, upon heterodimerization with the retinoid X receptor , function as ligand activated transcriptional regulators of genes controlling lipid and glucose metabolism . A splice variant, PPAR γ2, is primarily expressed in both white and brown adipose tissue . The metabolic syndrome is characterized by a) central obesity, b) atherogenic dyslipidemia , c) hypertension, d) insulin resistance or glucose intolerance, e) a prothrombotic state, and f) a proinflammatory state.
The vertebrate retina is an accessible, well described sensory tissue that continuously provides valuable insights into neurogenesis, nerve structure, and nervous system circuitry . In particular, major advances have been made using the retina as a model for central nervous system development. In the developing retina, neurogenesis begins in the central retina as newly differentiated neurons signal to the adjacent retinal progenitor cells  to initiate a central to peripheral wave of neurogenesis.
We aim to better characterize the staining patterns of inverted papilloma  with and without carcinoma by performing immunohistochemistry for p16, EGFR , p53, and Cyclin D1 antibodies on a large patient cohort . One hundred and sixty two IP specimens from 122 patients treated at the University of Michigan between 1996 and 2011. Twenty two specimens contained carcinoma.
HER 2/neu is a 185 kDa transmembrane protein homologous to epidermal growth factor receptor . Dimerization of this protein  results in downstream signaling events leading to proliferation, migration, adhesion and transformation of cells. It is overexpressed in several cancers of epithelial origin including breast, colorectal, ovarian and pancreatic carcinomas .
Allergic disease, including food allergy, allergic rhinitis , atopic dermatitis , and asthma, is one of the major causes of morbidity worldwide . Its prevalence has been rising in many parts of the world and the global prevalence differences are lessening . As such, the economic burden of these diseases is substantial in both developed and developing countries .
Converging evidence suggests that inbred Wistar Kyoto rats  are models of inherent anxiousness and vulnerability to stress. Fear potentiated startle is absent in this strain , suggesting reduced ability to form stimulus stimulus associations. Studying this response allows for evaluation of general reactivity to the conditional stimulus  and the unconditional stimulus  in addition to associative learning itself in the freely moving rat  .
Clinical applications of 13C MRS have been explored in a wide range of human brain diseases from the new born to advanced age . 13C enriched glucose and acetate have been used to distinguish neuronal from glial metabolism and, with low power  decoupling within the FDA limits of power deposition , previous no go frontal areas of the brain have become accessible to 13C MRS examinations . A remaining hurdle preventing wider utilization of this 13C MRS for this purpose is the long data acquisition, demanding two or more hours of MR examination time.
Unremitting bacterial infection increases nitrogen excretion resulting from an imbalance between rates of whole body protein synthesis and degradation . The mechanism by which prolonged sepsis leads to muscle atrophy involves both a decreased rate of protein synthesis and increased the rate of proteolysis . Such changes adversely affect morbidity and mortality in severely catabolic individuals , so limiting muscle loss in an attempt to preserve muscle function should improve the recovery process .
In mammals with haemachorial placentation, pregnancy represents a physiological state in which intimate contact between maternal and fetal tissues must occur. Thus, signals responsible for regulating these two molecules during pregnancy warrants further investigation . PSGs are highly glycosylated, with N linked glycosylation composing approximately 30% of their molecular mass .
It has become well accepted that osteocytes play an important role in bone maintenance and adaptation in response to mechanical stimuli . Osteocytes can detect mechanical loads by sensing fluid flow through the lacunar canalicular network , an interconnected pore system surrounding osteocytes and their processes . Transport of these osteocyte derived signaling molecules in bone is believed to occur through the lacunar canalicular system because the mineralized matrix was found to be impermeable as demonstrated using exogenously injected tracers .
Heavy alcohol consumption and illicit drug use during college are associated with significant adverse effects on the health, well being and safety of young adults . Researchers have long advocated for early identification, screening, and intervention with high risk students as part of a comprehensive approach to reducing problems related to substance use . Screening instruments that have been suggested for use, such as the CAGE , DAST , or diary methods to track consumption levels, focus on the assessment of drinking behavior per se .
One of the most effective strategies to improve BP control involves team based care that includes collaborative care or independent management by a pharmacist. We recently reported the results of a prospective, cluster randomized efficacy trial in 179 patients with previously uncontrolled BP conducted in five clinics that was included in the systematic review. BP control was achieved in 89% of patients following a 9 month physician\pharmacist collaborative intervention compared to 53% in the control group as defined by the 7th Joint National Committee on Prevention, Detection, Evaluation and Treatment of High Blood Pressure .
Atherosclerosis is a chronic inflammatory condition in which immune and non immune mechanisms induce endothelial dysfunction, the first step in atherogenesis. Despite significant progress in the past decade, the cellular and molecular pathogenesis of atherosclerosis is still not fully understood. Enzymatic cleavage of C5 generates C5b which initiates the terminal complement cascade leading to polymerization of C9 and insertion of MAC into cell membranes, .
Prostate cancer  is the most common non skin cancer among men in developed countries and the second leading cause of cancer death . Therefore, an improved understanding of the molecular pathways leading to chemo resistance will have direct clinical implications by increasing our capability to develop new treatment options that may overcome drug resistance in advanced PCa . The neoplastic transforming activity of the mt PCPH oncoprotein is mediated by its ability to  provoke a Ras independent, sustained activation of ERK , and/or  render cancer cells resistant to a variety of apoptosis inducing stimuli , including serum deprivation, hyperthermia, ionizing radiation, and chemotherapeutic drugs.
Frontotemporal lobar degeneration  comprises a clinically heterogeneous group of disorders that primarily affect either personality or language. Together, these conditions account for a large proportion of early onset dementia. SD is characterized by loss of semantic knowledge and a progressive fluent aphasia whereas PNFA presents with difficulties in speech production.
The cellular mechanisms underlying nigral dopaminergic degeneration associated with various pathological conditions such as Parkinson’s disease  and methamphetamine abuse are yet to be clarified. Oxidative damage triggered by reactive oxygen species  such as hydrogen peroxide  can activate a series of signaling events ultimately leading to programmed cell death, or apoptosis. In fact, caspase 3 activity is significantly increased in the brains of PD patients.
Sickle cell disease  is a chronic disease associated with a diversity of serious pathophysiologic complications including, but not limited to, chronic hemolytic anemia, stroke, acute chest syndrome, pulmonary embolus, pulmonary hypertension, cholecystitis, hepatic and splenic sequestration, retinal detachment and hemorrhage, aseptic necrosis of the joints, priapism, iron overload, and chronic leg ulcers. Patients describe this pain as severe, and often of sudden onset. It is common for both SCD patients and providers to be frustrated by ED care.
Cancer is the leading cause of death in U.S. and many developed countries. According to the World Health Organization Fact Sheet 2005, 7.6 million people died of cancer worldwide, and more than 70% of those deaths were reported in low and middle income countries. The number of global cancer deaths is projected to increase 45% from 2007 to 2030 .
There is increasing evidence to suggest that size at birth and childhood growth are important determinants of body composition and chronic disease in later life . Although maternal birth weight, smoking, exercise levels and adiposity in pregnancy have all been shown to influence bone mass at birth , less is known about the prenatal determinants of other aspects of neonatal body composition such as fat and lean mass, and the extent to which these effects are modified by the early postnatal environment. Many epidemiologic studies of obesity have used BMI as the main outcome measure but interpretation of BMI is difficult because it reflects both fat and muscle mass.
The synapse between the motor nerve and skeletal muscle, commonly referred to as the neuromuscular junction , is cholinergic in vertebrates and is a model system for the investigation of synapses . On the postsynaptic face of the NMJ, the AChRs span the membrane, with each AChR forming a pentameric structure. γ and ε are developmentally regulated and can substitute for each other.
Oxidative stress, defined as an imbalance between the production of reactive oxygen species  and the antioxidant defence system, plays an important role in the pathogenesis of insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes mellitus  . Attention has therefore been focused on the potential protective role of dietary antioxidants in the aetiology of impaired glucose tolerance and T2DM . A meta analysis of observational data from cohort studies showed protective effects of greater intakes of dietary antioxidants on risk of T2DM .
The presence of epileptiform abnormalities on electroencephalogram  augments clinical information about seizures and helps with both diagnosis and classification. Since the first EEG does not always show an epileptiform abnormality and serial EEGs may all be normal , multiple EEGs are often recorded in an effort to find an epileptiform abnormality that may guide treatment, particularly if patients continue to experience seizures . The reported yield of an epileptiform abnormality on the first EEG in new onset unprovoked seizure or incident epilepsy ranges from 32% to 59% in children  and from 12% to 44% in adults ; .
Motor redundancy or, when considered more positively, motor abundance  makes it possible for multiple variations of joint and muscle coordination to be used to achieve a given task performance. That motor abundance is actually used by the central nervous system  when coordinating the motor elements  has been established in numerous studies of a variety of functional tasks . One exception was a recent study of finger force production .
Gray ProRoot mineral trioxide aggregate   was patented in 1995 as a root end filling material . White ProRoot mineral trioxide aggregate  from the same vendor was later introduced , with iron compounds extracted and lower aluminoferrite concentration, to decrease anterior tooth discoloration . Mineral trioxide aggregate  has two phases, calcium oxide and calcium phosphate; the calcium oxide reacts with tissue fluid to form calcium hydroxide  .
Cognitive models of social anxiety posit that the interpretation of ambiguous information as threatening maintains anxiety . However, presenting threat  and benign  primes before the ambiguous stimuli may better imitate the priming effects of pre existing beliefs on interpretative processes . modified  homograph paradigm to examine learning on multiple encounters with social ambiguity.
In 1932 Joannes Cassianus Pompe described the clinical and pathological findings in a 7 month old girl who died with an unusual disease  that has come to bear his name . In an insightful study almost a decade later , Hers inferred that it was a lysosomal storage disease, the first in what has become an extensive list of 40 to 50 lysosomal storage diseases  . Pompe disease was recognized in the early 1990s to be due to a defect in the acid α glucosidase gene  .
Poly  based hydrogels are currently being investigated for a myriad of biomedical applications, including drug delivery, surface modifications, diagnostic devices, and tissue engineering due to their appeal as a hydrophilic and cytocompatible biomaterial as well as the range of physicochemical properties that can be achieved to meet the needs of the application . By varying parameters such as network morphology, crosslinking density, and polymer composition, PEG based hydrogels can be easily tailored to meet the requirements for regeneration of a multitude of tissue types  . Many tissue engineering strategies involving hydrogel scaffolds have taken advantage of their high water content to deliver a variety of bioactive molecules and encapsulated cells to promote tissue regeneration ,.
The ability to track drug delivery and disposition is critical to the development and assessment of new therapeutic agents. Detailed analysis of absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion  is required by regulatory agencies that govern the approval process. Traditional pharmacokinetic studies for pharmaceutical agents involve blood and tissue sampling to determine concentrations, which serve as inputs to compartmental or mechanism based models for calculation of dose/effect relationships .
The ability to rapidly change the velocity and direction of whole body center of mass is a fundamental locomotor skill in most sports. It is not surprising therefore that this ability, typically referred to as agility, has been shown to discriminate among skill levels in soccer , American football, and rugby . Currently, little is known regarding definitive factors that influence agility.
In endochondral bone development mesenchymal condensates differentiate into chondrocytes that proliferate to form and enlarge the bone structure . In long bones of the limbs, growth plates are detectable around embryonic day 14.5 in mice and around Hamburger Hamilton  stage 36  in chickens. The chondrocytes undergo cycles of proliferation, flatten and form orderly columns, become hypertrophic and eventually die, to be replaced by osteoblasts adjacent to the growth plate in the marrow space and the bone collar.
BCL 2 family proteins are important regulators of the mitochondrial outermembrane potential  and thereby the induction of apoptosis . The proapoptotic BCL 2 family members BAX and BAK containmultiple BH domains and control the MOMP. Nur77 is an orphan nuclear receptorthat interacts with the BCL 2 N terminal loop region and induces a BCL 2conformational change .
To fully understand the biological relevance, regulation and function of DNA in processes ranging from replication to transcription and repair, it is important to gain atomic level insight into the sequence specific structure, deformability and dynamics of DNA . These approaches range from varied NMR experiments  and Fourier transform IR difference spectroscopy  to triplet anisotropy decay , electron paramagnetic resonance, and pulsed electron electron double resonance to active nitroxide or other spin labels . Compared to Watson Crick DNA helices that do not show exchange processes or internal dynamics on this timescale, the NMR results of the mismatch clearly resolve exchange processes on the 26 ± 8 μs timescale, which is consistent with the higher expected opening rates.
Optimal recovery of cerebral blood flow  has been implicated as a critical factor in determining neuronal survival after asphyxial cardiac arrest  in infants and children. CBF after CA is well described in adult animal models; however there are limited data on CBF after pediatric asphyxial CA. In adult CA models CBF after CA is phasic in nature, with global hyperemia present for 15 30 min after return of spontaneous circulation  characterized by CBF 2 3 times higher than baseline, followed by delayed hypoperfusion that occurs after 15 30 min and continues for several hours after ROSC  .
Social networks are imperative for human survival and reproduction: they allow the sharing of information, knowledge and resources, as well as aiding cooperation, for example in hunting and for collective childcare . However, rather than being aggregated in a single location, the members of a hunter gatherer’s social network are distributed between a number of different residential groups, which disperse and re aggregate over time across an ecologically determined home range area . Sustaining social bonds beyond the residential band is a challenge that hunter gatherers need to solve in order to survive.
The stem cell niche is essential in the maintenance and differentiation of stem and progenitor cells in vivo . Organ specific stem cells including intestinal stem cells and hematopoietic stem cells have been found to reside within such specific locations as the base of intestinal crypts and in the osteoblastic and perivascular niches, respectively . In addition to growth factors, most culture systems also include feeder layers.
Tobacco smoke exposure during pregnancy results in a number of deleterious health effects for both mother and offspring . Nicotine exposure also continues postnatally via maternal milk consumption by the pups . Administration through the drinking water minimizes nicotine induced hypoxia, maternal stress and injury risk and is suggested to be a good model for human exposure patterns as mice consume water, and therefore nicotine, primarily during their active phase .
Taxol  is one of the most effective microtubule targeting drugs for breast cancer treatment and it accounts for significant improvements in breast cancer patient’s survival in the last two decades. However, despite a remarkable response of initial treatment with Taxol, progressive diseases eventually develop in most patients. Taxol resistance is a major obstacle that severely limited the improvement of response and survival in Taxol treated cancer patients .
Trichomonas vaginalis is a sexually transmitted protozoan that causes vaginitis in approximately 2050% of infected women, and non gonococcal urethritis in a small percentage of infected men. We previously hypothesized that this lack of specific symptoms might facilitate persistent and undetected trichomonosis  in men, thereby providing T. vaginalis with greater opportunity to ascend to the prostate than other more symptomatic sexually transmitted agents. Indeed, early trichomonosis researchers believed the prostate to be the reservoir for T. vaginalis based on its frequent detection in prostate fluid from male partners of women with trichomonal vaginitis.
In recent years, the WHO has estimated that suicide rates have shown a 60 % rise worldwide with nearly one million deaths from suicides each year. Strikingly, low and middle income developing countries have accounted for 84 % of suicides . Experts emphasize the importance of a diathesis stress explanation in theoretical formulations of suicide across the lifespan with predisposing biological factors , pre morbid personality , cognitive vulnerability , and exposure to negative life events , and co occurring psychiatric and physical disorders  .
Noncovalent interactions, such as hydrogen bonding, hydrophobic packing, and aromatic interactions, are important forces in biomolecules because these collective interactions contribute to the overall stability of nucleic acids, proteins, and peptides. The majority of efforts have been devoted to cation π interactions in model systems. This interaction is electrostatic in nature and plays a critical role in biomolecular stability.
Post operative wound infections in pediatric patients undergoing cardiothoracic surgery occurs in 2.38% of patients . This complication results in increased morbidity, longer hospitalizations, and increased cost—with over $1.6 billion annually in extra hospital charges reported . The CPB machine requires priming with a certain volume that is determined by the length and diameter of tubing, size of reservoir, and specific oxygenator.
Manipulating gene expression in skeletal muscle is of interest for a wide array of fundamental and applied research questions relating to gene function in neuromuscular development, health and disease. Embryonic or perinatal lethality resulting from manipulating gene expression can prove to be a significant hurdle to research. Notably, the Cre/loxP system is used in mice to allow for conditional activation or inactivation of mutations.
Neuromyotonia is defined as persistent muscle contraction following voluntary movement, resulting from hyperexcitability of the peripheral nerve and not the muscle itself. In total, 8 mutations were identified in 33 families, often in a compound heterozygous state although the R37P allele was prevalent and did appear as a homozygous variant. A subset of HINT1 patients has undergone extensive electrophysiological characterization .
Voltage gated ion channels are multi functional . In addition to regulating electrical excitability through ion conduction, some voltage gated ion channels contribute to processes as diverse as intracellular signaling, transcriptional regulation, scaffolding, and cell adhesion without requiring changes in ion flux . VGSCs isolated from mammalian neurons are heterotrimers, composed of a single α subunit, one non covalently linked β subunit , and one disulfide linked β subunit  .
Stroke is the leading cause of neurological disability among adults , with associated behavioral sequelae ranging from the functional  to the clinical  . Although 70% of incident stroke patients experience some degree of post stroke cognitive impairment , the extent and determinants of post stroke cognitive decline are associated with multiple factors, including severity and location of the lesion and assorted demographic factors such as age and education. Aging is a major risk factor for stroke .
Neurons of the major pelvic ganglia  innervate urogenital organs and components of the lower bowel. Classically the ganglia have been perceived as relay stations for the central neurochemical drive to the peripheral organs. However, the presence of a diversity of neurotransmitter and neuromodulator substances indicates neurotransmission through the ganglion might be more complex than originally perceived .
It is well recognized in economic theory, as well as in everyday life, that purchasing decisions are influenced by price and disposable income. This principle applies to the sale of cigarettes as it does other consumer goods. The affordability of cigarettes can influence smoking behavior by encouraging smoking cessation and reducing the amount smoked per day.
Calpain is a cytosolic cystein protease that translocates to membrane upon activation. Active calpain not only cleaves its substrates but also disrupts protein interactions. Specifically in endothelial cells however, limited knowledge exists regarding how calpain signals to modulate cell functions.
The two emerging techniques for the study of fetal brain function in utero are functional magnetic resonance imaging  and fetal magnetoencephalography . Fetal MEG is a completely passive and non invasive methodology with superior temporal resolution developed for the recording of magnetic signals from the fetal brain. This technique has the potential to provide physicians with a non invasive instrument capable of direct neurological assessment of the fetus during pregnancy.
Diabetes mellitus is a chronic metabolic disease with serious oral health implications. For people with poorly controlled or uncontrolled diabetes, periodontal disease progresses more rapidly and more severely than in their controlled or non diabetic counterparts . Studies  also suggest a bidirectional relationship between periodontal disease and diabetes, with periodontal disease worsening glycemic control, and poorly controlled or uncontrolled diabetes increasing the likelihood of destructive periodontitis .
Peripartum hysterectomy, a surgical procedure performed at the time of delivery or in the immediate postpartum period, although a rare event, is associated with increased morbidity and mortality. Moreover, it is considered one of the most devastating complications in obstetrics resulting in high costs to the health care system, and adverse outcomes for women desiring to maintain their fertility. Many studies have estimated an incidence rate in the US between 0.8 and 1.5 per 1,000 deliveries,, although, the incidence has been reported to be as high as 2.28 per 1,000 deliveries.
Minority families often reside in neighborhoods with few supermarkets or alternative healthy food options , making fresh produce difficult to obtain. This qualitative study identified factors influencing fruit and vegetable shopping and use of alternative healthy food options . Forty eight minority women with children completed interviews regarding food shopping habits and use of and attitudes toward alternative healthy food options.
Glioma is one of the most fatal tumors and its etiology is largely unknown . The biological mechanism behind this association is thought to be elimination of pro cancerous cells by increased immuno surveillance due to the hyperactive immune state seen in atopy. Currently, the number of studies that have evaluated the association between glioma and atopy history is less than a dozen .
While tuberculosis  control programs have made major strides in reducing TB incidence in adults in many high burden countries, assessing program impact on pediatric TB remains difficult because of the lack of a dependable “gold standard test”. Technical and economic factors compound these diagnostic problems. The best available diagnostic tests are costly, while traditional methods are slow and insensitive.
Despite declines over the last 25 years, more than a fifth of the US population continues to smoke, and an increasing number of tobacco users are intermittent smokers in social settings . It is likely that environmental cues contribute to social and habitual tobacco use. In addicted individuals, the rewarding properties of cues associated with a primary reinforcer such as nicotine are thought to play a more predominant role than primary reinforcement in compulsive drug use .
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease , a hepatic manifestation of the metabolic syndrome, and NASH, a progressive form of NAFLD, are two of the most common chronic liver diseases in the United States and worldwide. These two pathological states have been shown to progress to cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma. The successful prevention and treatment of NASH relies on the ability to identify vulnerable subpopulations and detect the disease early and greatly depends on a better understanding of the underlying molecular mechanisms involved in NASH pathogenesis.
Carcinomas are epithelial cancers that constitute 90% of human malignancies and are fatal due to their metastases. Non small cell lung cancer  is the leading cause of cancer related deaths in Western countries. Genes that disrupt cell polarity and epithelial architecture contribute to invasive and metastatic phenotypes.
One type of RNA editing involves the conversion of adenosine residues into inosine  in double stranded RNA  through the action of ADAR  . Since the translation machinery reads inosines as if they were guanosines, when it occurs within the coding sequence, RNA editing could result in the synthesis of proteins not directly encoded by the genome. A→I RNA editing is involved in alterations of neurotransmitter receptor and channel functions  as well as modulation of microRNA expression levels and target selection  .
Activated protein C  is an endogenous serine protease with anticoagulant, anti inflammatory and cytoprotective activities . Its anticoagulant activity is mediated by irreversible inactivation of the coagulation cofactors, factor Va and FVIIIa . Independent of its anticoagulant activity, APC exerts direct cytoprotective effects, including anti apoptotic and anti inflammatory alterations in gene expression profiles which require APC mediated activation of protease activated receptor 1   .
Interest in the substance abuse treatment workforce is increasing while service providers and researchers are attempting to understand the intricate social factors that facilitate or impede service delivery and adoption of new technologies. Not only can turnover disrupt delivery of client services, but in instances where new clinical initiatives are being put into practice, it can also threaten the implementation and sustainability of newly embraced initiatives. The importance of managerial/supervisory support has been recognized, and turnover among these key personnel will likely impede efforts to alter practice.
Plasma and red blood cell  fatty acid  composition have both been proposed as biomarkers for cardiovascular disease  risk . Not only individual FAs but also composite indices  may predict CVD events and could therefore theoretically serve as risk markers. One approach to risk marker validation is to conduct a case control study in which the FA composition of samples taken from patients with disease is compared to that of individuals free of the disease.
Breast cancer  survivors face unique health challenges, such as lymphedema, which may impact their health related quality of life . The prevalence of lymphedema varies from 056%; up to 50% of survivors report symptoms consistent with lymphedema, with or without a clinical diagnosis. Lymphedema may develop at any time from initial treatment to twenty years later.
Homeodomain containing transcription factors  were discovered on the basis of their remarkable role in specifying positional information along the body axis, a function widely conserved among metazoans . Hox proteins of the Abdominal B  family control varied aspects of sexual development. These include formation of male specific sensory organs, sex muscle differentiation, and gonadal development  .
Binge eating  and night eating  are behaviors associated with dysregulated eating. Each represents a core behavioral feature in a proposed DSM eating disorder category . The lifetime prevalence of the behavior of BE is estimated to be 4.5% for adults in the United States with slightly higher prevalence among women .
Wound classification  has an interesting background. On September 19, 1958, the National Academy of Sciences National Research Council met to design a multi institutional study that evaluated the effect of ultraviolet irradiation in preventing operative infections. The study results were first published in the Annals of Surgery in 1964 with a further report in 1968., The reported infection rates were much higher than current day experience, with 5.1% of clean, 10.8% of clean contaminated, 16.3% of contaminated, and 28.6% of dirty wound class cases developing infections.
In amyotrophic lateral sclerosis , unlike other motor neuron diseases, both the cortical and spinal components of motor neuron circuitry progressively degenerate . Therefore, bringing effective treatments to ALS requires targeting both the spinal motor neurons  in the spinal cord and the corticospinal motor neurons  in the motor cortex. Therefore, due to the central involvement of CSMN in motor neuron circuitry and their selective vulnerability and degeneration in various diseases, it is imperative to understand cellular mechanisms for CSMN vulnerability and to develop CSMN directed gene delivery approaches in the cerebral cortex .
Antibiotics are the most commonly prescribed medications to children across all age groups. Outpatient antibiotic overuse has been correlated with higher rates of antibiotic resistant pathogens  . In an effort to combat the emergence of drug resistance, the Infectious Diseases Society of America  published guidelines for developing antimicrobial stewardship programs .
Niemann Pick C disease  is a lethal, neuronopathic autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder of childhood caused by mutations in the NPC1 or NPC2 proteins, leading to an accumulation of unesterified cholesterol and glycosphingolipids  in lysosomes . Clinically, NPC is characterized by progressive neurological deterioration and hepato splenomegaly, with varying age at onset and ensuing course . Two disease causing genes, NPC1  and NPC2  have been identified .
Chronic kidney disease  is a serious public health problem. According to the National Kidney Foundation, 26 million people in America  have CKD and millions more are at an increased risk. CKD progresses through 5 stages; Stage 5 CKD requires renal replacement therapy .
Each year influenza viruses cause significant morbidity and mortality . Of the influenza positive specimens, 79% were influenza A viruses and 62% of these were of the H1 subtype . Interestingly, the highest incidence of illness occurs in pre school and school age children with 20 to 30% of children in this age group being diagnosed with influenza infections each year .
Pain interference  refers to the degree to which pain limits or interferes with individuals' physical, mental and social activities. A number of measures of pain interference have been developed including a 9 item scale from the West Haven Yale Multidimensional Pain Inventory  , a 7 item scale from the Brief Pain Inventory , a 6 item Pain Impact Questionnaire  , a 3 item scale from the Chronic Pain Grade , and the 7 item Pain Disability Index . One weakness of existing instruments is that they are static measures; they require respondents to complete all items, even items that provide no additional information about a person's level of pain interference.
In musculoskeletal medicine an increasing clinical need exists for bone regeneration and grafting strategies to treat bony voids after spinal fusion, maxillofacial surgery, implant fixation, resection of primary tumors and metastases, or trauma. Autologous bone is commonly used for grafting as it contains many crucial features such as mesenchymal progenitor cells, osteoinductive factors, and an osteoconductive matrix that together support skeletal healing. A critical component for the successful repair of osseous defects are bone marrow stromal cells .
The morphogenetic events of early embryonic development are comprised of a series of complex cell and tissue movements. Xenopus mesendoderm provides a striking example of cells migrating cooperatively as a cohesive unit. Cohesion of the mesendoderm tissue is maintained by cadherin based cell cell contacts across which tensile forces are distributed .
Great strides have been made in reducing incidence and mortality from colorectal cancer  in the United States over the last decade. CRC rates decreased from 52.3 per 100,000 in 2003 to 45.5 per 100,000 in 2007. In addition, mortality rates decreased from 19.0 cases per 100,000 in 2003, to 16.7 per 100,000 cases in 2007.
Protein design was cast in 1983 as an “inverted” folding problem by Pabo, who discussed how finding sequences compatible with a given structure might be easier than predicting how a sequence folds. In the 1990s this approach to protein design was rendered practical for real problems by the advent of powerful algorithms and fast computers . Since that time, many experimentally validated examples have shown that not only folds, but also functions, can be encoded in protein sequences rationally using such procedures  .
Traditionally comprising three major families: the Conidae , the Terebridae , and the Turridae s.l. , the superfamily Conoidea is an extremely biodiverse group of venomous marine snails. The extant species traditionally assigned to Turridae encompass a huge morphological diversity.
Adenovirus vectors have garnered significant attention as candidate vaccine platforms due to their large transgene coding capacity and potent immunogenicity. Ad vector based vaccines are being pursued for a number of viral infections, including Ebola , influenza , hepatitis C , rabies  and HIV 1 . Recently we have evaluated an Ad26 vector based vaccine for HIV 1 in clinical trials , and preclinical studies with Ad26 based vaccine regimens in non human primates resulted in partial protection against acquisition of infection as well as virologic control following SIVmac251 challenges .
Mechanical circulatory assist  devices such as ventricular assist devices  are often employed to augment the function of failing ventricles in patients with advanced heart failure. While VADs are effectively utilized to provide a bridge to transplant or as destination therapy, they unfortunately still have limitations such as mechanical failure, infection, bleeding, and thrombosis . These conditions make platelets more susceptible to shear induced activation, resulting in enhanced coagulation and formation of thromboemboli .
The increase in resistance of bacterial strains to existing antibiotics is a major public health concern  World Health Statistics 2008. World Health Organization Press), and has spurred intensive efforts to develop new classes of antibiotics that are effective against antibiotic resistant strains, with limited success . These are characterized by being short , having an overall positive charge of +2 to +9, and sufficient hydrophobicity to allow for interaction with or traversing of membranes of target cells   .
Onset of bipolar disorder  during childhood significantly affects an individual’s psychosocial development. Moreover, youth with BP are at high risk for suicidal behaviors and completed suicide, substance abuse, and legal problems, and have particularly high rates of health services utilization . Since anxiety disorders are also accompanied by significant impairment in the psychosocial functioning of the child , it is important to evaluate the prevalence and clinical correlates of the association between BP and anxiety in youth.
Over 28,000 solid organ transplants are performed annually in the United States . Improved survival of transplant recipients in recent decades is due in large part to the effectiveness of current immunosuppressive therapies in preventing organ rejection, but the acute and long term immunosuppression also increases recipients’ risk of a number of malignancies . In particular, post transplant lymphoproliferative disorder  is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in transplant recipients .
In the United States, approximately 39,000 women will be diagnosed with endometrial cancer and over 7,400 deaths will be attributable to this disease . Although the incidence of endometrial cancer is 30% lower among Black women compared to White women, mortality among Blacks with endometrial cancer is 60% higher . The underlying cause of this racial disparity in endometrial cancer outcome among Black patients with endometrial cancer is felt to be multifactorial  .
The molecular chaperone heat shock protein 90  is currently of major interest as an anticancer drug target. However, there are few reports in the literature on acquired resistance to HSP90 inhibitors . However, the mechanisms of resistance were not identified .
The human organic cation transporter  type 1 was first isolated from the cultured human glioma cell line SK MG 1 . As was previously shown that 4  styryl) N methylpyridinium iodide , MPP and polyamines are substrates for polyspecific OCT transporters of SLC22A family . ASP+ is a fluorescent marker of glioma cell cytoplasm in vivo in tumors during early developmental stages .
Macrophages are permissive to CCR5 tropic HIV 1 and in most models can host active viral replication without significant cytopathic effect,. This interaction may contribute to HIV related disease during HIV 1 transmission when R5 tropic virus predominates, by transfer of virus to T cells, as a long lived viral reservoir and by provoking bystander cell apoptosis that may be involved in T cell or neuronal death,. HIV 1 mediated inhibition of complement and Fc receptor phagocytosis, and attenuated intracellular killing of Leishmania​ suggest that the role of macrophages as host defence effector cells may be compromised.
Thermal ablation with radiofrequency  and microwave energies is becoming an increasingly important treatment for unresectable tumors of the liver, kidney, lung, and bone . Prior to use in patients, ablation device performance is typically predicted by computer modeling, or characterized with experiments in ex vivo and in vivo models . The expected size and shape of an ablation zone created by a given device is often based upon these experimental results and utilized to predict clinical performance during human application.
The level and localization of p53, often referred to as “the guardian of the genome”, is tightly regulated . It is not surprising that the localization of p53 is tightly controlled and greatly complex . Normally, p53 shuttles between the cytoplasm and the nucleus.
Epidemiologic studies have established that depression and anxiety disorders are predictive of numerous health outcomes in later life, including risk of cardiovascular disease,  type 2 diabetes,  osteoporosis,  cognitive decline,  and mortality, particularly among those with established cardiovascular and metabolic disease. , The mechanisms underlying these associations remain largely unspecified. Constructs such as allostatic load aim to capture this multi system impact, and thus are thought to provide a more holistic approach to understanding the biological impact of depression and anxiety.
Haloferax volcanii is a halophilic archaeon  commonly isolated from hypersaline environments such as the Dead Sea. volcanii maintains homeostasis by accumulating high concentrations of intracellular cations or counterions . As a result, most haloarchaeal proteins require salt for activity and possess a highly acidic surface that serves as a hydration shell, enabling catalysis to occur under high salt conditions and preventing protein aggregation.
Recognition memory is supported by the medial temporal lobe , as damage to this brain region across species impairs performance on recognition memory tasks . Studies have consistently demonstrated a role for the perirhinal cortex in this type of memory ; however the role of the hippocampus has been subject to much debate. Numerous studies have reported impairments in recognition memory with hippocampal lesions , yet others have reported no impairments  or even enhancements with reversible lesions  .
Effective fat suppression or separation is critical for diagnostic quality in body MRI and is commonly used to eliminate undesired adipose tissue signals or prevent chemical shift artifacts. Protons in these semisolids have a very broad spectrum and can be selectively saturated by off resonance RF pulses. Using this tissue dependent feature, MT contrast  sequences can produce MTC images with useful diagnostic information.
Angiogenesis, the formation of new capillaries from the existing vasculature, is a process subject to exquisite regulation. Neovascularization within the eye is often the result of ischemia, which induces tissue hypoxia . Of the growth factors involved in retinal angiogenesis, vascular endothelial cell growth factor  is thought to be a principal mediator .
Geographical, epidemiological and in vitro evidence support the hypothesis that Glucose 6 phosphate dehydrogenase  deficiency confers protection from disease caused by the Plasmodium falciparum parasite . This process releases toxic by products, inducing oxidative stress on the cell. G6PD is encoded by a 16.2kb gene found on the X chromosome.
Mechanical stimuli have long been recognized as an important factor in determining the structure and function of living cells and tissues. , For decades, physicians have been applying mechanical loads to living tissue in order to achieve beneficial therapeutic effects. Distraction osteogenesis is an example wherein gradual lengthening of long bones is realized by the sequential application of axial forces.
Left ventricular noncompaction  is associated with heart failure and arrhythmias such as atrio ventricular  block and intraventricular conduction disturbance . Both patients showed sporadic heterozygote mutation. One of the patients had a family history of sudden cardiac death .
Over the past two decades, the question of what factors govern agreement behavior has been a major focus of language production research. Since these studies, there has been intensive investigation of a wide range of such factors. This effect has turned out to be quite reliable in English , and to be relatively reliable across languages , though there does appear to be some cross linguistic variability .
Most patients with malignant pleural mesothelioma  present with locally advanced disease, and treatment for these patients involves palliative chemotherapy. However, the scarcity of data regarding the efficacy of further treatment leaves oncologists unsure how to proceed . Many choose to treat their patients with either vinorelbine or gemcitabine based on subgroup analyses from first line studies, small phase II trials, or retrospective analyses.
Recent studies demonstrate a mechanistic link between reduced proximal neuromuscular control and increased risk for knee and anterior cruciate ligament  injuries in the women athletic population. In addition to the weak hip abductor status, a cross sectional laboratory controlled study found that individuals with PFPS exhibit increased hip adduction angles toward the end of prolonged treadmill running compared with anthro pometrically matched control individuals . Significant evidence supports rehabilitative and prophylactic benefits of performing hip strengthening exercises on knee joint and related pathologies .
Autism is a behavioral syndrome defined by the presence of social deficits, abnormalities in communication, the presence of stereotyped, repetitive behaviors, and a characteristic course . Cognitive abilities may range from severe mental retardation to above average intelligence . Clinical heterogeneity is thought to be due to underlying etiologic heterogeneity.
Most of the molecules found in living systems are naturally prepared via the iterative assembly of a limited number of bifunctional building blocks . For example, proteins are usually derived from just 20 amino acids, and DNA and RNA are each made from only 4 nucleotides. Capitalizing on this inherent modularity, generalized building block based strategies have been developed for efficient, flexible, and fully automated access to these molecules in the laboratory,  and the resulting impacts on science, medicine, and technology have been transformational.
The Geant4 Application for Emission Tomography   is a suite of programs for generating and processing Monte Carlo simulations of PET and single photon imaging systems. Radiation transport is modeled using, as the name suggests, the well validated Geant4 engine. Data may be output in several formats including some that are compatible with existing or historically available commercial scanners .
Human immunodeficiency virus  infection severely impacts the immune system causing phenotypic changes in peripheral cells altering both innate and adaptive immune responses. Within weeks of infection, during the acute phase, HIV 1 attacks and kills CCR5 expressing CD4+ T lymphocytes in the gastrointestinal tract, which impairs the mucosal layer and integrity of the barrier function . The innate immune system responds immediately following HIV 1 infection producing cytokines designed to limit viral infection and replication.
Astrocyte cultures derived from neonatal rodent or human fetal brains are readily available systems that have aided our understanding of astrocyte responses to various insults. Treatment of cultures with toll like receptor  ligands or cytokines has become a popular approach to investigate astrocyte neuroinflammatory responses and to simulate the neural environment in various CNS disorders. One of the highly debated issues in glial biology is the context in which astrocytes participate in the innate immune responses.
Nature relies on chemistry to maintain liquid water for life at subfreezing temperatures. Microbial communities have been discovered in ice, snow, permafrost, and at the polar ice caps. Gram negative Cryseobacterium and Gram positive Enterococci were found to have a symbiotic interaction.
Chronic and excessive alcohol intake is associated with increased oxidative stress , a decrease in antioxidant enzymes , and induction of the cytochrome P4502E1  enzyme . The absence of antioxidants has been shown to further promote alcohol induced oxidative stress, which could lead to an inflammatory state . Chronic alcohol intake also induces bacterial endotoxin , which is associated with activation of the nuclear factor κB inflammatory pathway, leading to the activation of several proinflammatory cytokines, including tumor necrosis factor α , and increased hepatic infiltration by inflammatory cells.
Topical microbicides are agents applied within the vagina or rectum to prevent the transmission of sexually transmitted diseases including Human Immunodeficiency Virus  infections. Tenofovir , a Food and Drug Administration  approved microbicide , has been proven to prevent HIV transmission through the vagina. TFV belongs to the class of anti retroviral drugs under the sub category of nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors .
