Pediatric anxiety disorders affect approximately 10 15% of children and adolescents, and are associated with significant, enduring impairment, Although research on pediatric anxiety disorders is rapidly growing, knowledge of pathophysiology remains limited. While extensively used, this task is criticized because performance may reflect processes beyond attention, such as interference in response selection or execution. , The stimuli then disappear and one is replaced by a target probe.
Military veterans who participated in atmospheric nuclear weapons testing conducted by the United States between 1945 and 1963 are being studied for late occurring health effects. The study cohort consists of 115,329 individuals who were present in one or more of seven test series: CASTLE, CROSSROADS, GREENHOUSE, REDWING, and HARDTACK I conducted at the Bikini and Enewetak Atolls and Johnston Island in the Pacific Proving Grounds ; UPSHOT KNOTHOLE and PLUMBBOB conducted at the Nevada Test Site ; and TRINITY, the first nuclear test, conducted in New Mexico . This article describes the methodology developed to estimate radiation doses and associated uncertainties to be used for the epidemiological analysis .
Despite high survival rates for early stage breast cancer, it is still the second leading cause of cancer related deaths in the United States. This is due to the poor survival associated with late stage, invasive disease and treatment resistant breast cancers. RON is minimally expressed in normal breast epithelium but is highly expressed in approximately 50% of human breast cancers.
Clostridium difficile is an anaerobic spore forming rod shaped gram positive bacterium that can infect both humans and animals. It causes a spectrum of clinical manifestations from mild diarrhea to severe pseudomembranous colitis and has been recognized as a major nosocomial pathogen responsible for 15 20% of antibiotic related diarrhea . Over the past decade, there has been a progressive increase in the prevalence, severity, and mortality of CDI worldwide.
Monoclonal antibody  L8A4 binds specifically to the epidermal growth factor receptor variant III  that is present on gliomas but not normal tissues, and is internalized rapidly after receptor binding. Because of the short range of its β emissions, labeling this mAb with177Lu would be an attractive approach for the treatment of residual tumor margins remaining after surgical debulking of brain tumors . L8A4 mAb was labeled with 177Lu using the acyclic ligands  trans  cyclohexane 1,2 diamine  pentaacetic acid  and 2  6 methyldiethylene  triaminepentaacetic acid , and the macrocyclic ligands S 2  1,4,7,10 tetraazacyclododecane tetraacetic acid  and α  1,4,7,10 tetraazacyclododecane 1,4,7,10  tetraacetic acid .
With recognition that the nucleus tractus solitarii  is the primary site of termination of cardiovascular reflex afferent nerves , electrophysiological and anatomical studies contributed to an understanding of reflex transmission from those afferents to NTS neurons and beyond. Amongst the sites to which the NTS projects and from which it receives afferent projections is the cerebral cortex . Because lesions affecting cortical areas are known to produce autonomic dysfunction and, at times, sudden cardiac death , the reciprocal connections could be critically important in clinical medicine .
Nef, an accessory protein expressed by HIV and other primate lentiviruses, plays an essential role in viral pathogenesis,. Studies in several animal models have demonstrated that Nef is a critical determinant of viral replication, viral and immune receptor downregulation, and AIDS progression. Despite the lack of intrinsic biochemical activity, Nef influences numerous signaling pathways through interactions with a diverse group of host cell proteins.
The RAS RAF mitogen activated protein kinase /extra cellular signal regulated kinase  kinase  ERK and phosphoinositide 3 kinase  PTEN AKT signaling pathways play central roles in the signal transduction networks promoting tumor initiation and tumor progression. This is highlighted by the high frequency of mutations of RAS, RAF, PI3KCA, AKT, and PTEN as well as amplification of AKT present in a broad spectrum of human malignancies . Because signal transduction networks integrate multiple upstream inputs, targeting pathways downstream of the receptors could conceivably result in greater therapeutic efficacy and broader applicability.
Glutamate is an endogenous excitatory neurotransmitter, and it was estimated that this neurotransmitter is utilized by as many as one third of the synapses in the central nervous system . Glutamate can induce cytotoxicity via two different pathways. In this neuronal oxidative stress model, high concentrations of extracellular glutamate cause intracellular GSH depletion and increase ROS production .
Vertebrate vision is based on two physiologically different photoreceptor cell types: rods and cones. The turn off and recovery of the visual signal are achieved by reactions inactivating R* and the Gαt1GTP/PDE6 complex, and restoration of cGMP levels through Ca2+  dependent activation of retinal guanylate cyclases. Cone signaling proteins are highly homologous to their rod counterparts.
During the first human H5N1 outbreak in 1997, 18 cases of H5N1 influenza A infection in humans were confirmed, and more than 300 infected individuals have been diagnosed since 2003. H5N1 influenza infection of humans causes severe pneumonia, systemic disease, and mortality in more than 50% of patients. H5N1 avian influenza A viruses  are potential agents of pandemic influenza, but existing strains are incapable of efficient human to human transmission.
Glutamate is the major excitatory neurotransmitter and essential for many functions in the mammalian central nervous system . Glutamate receptors can be divided into two classes: ionotropic glutamate receptors and metabotropic glutamate receptors  . The G protein coupled mGluRs have the capacity to modulate the actions of the ionotropic glutamate receptors as well as other neurotransmitter receptors, which make them good candidates for pharmacotherapeutic targets .
Regeneration is a process by which damaged or lost structures are perfectly or near perfectly replaced . The caudal fin model of regeneration is particularly attractive because the fin is a relatively simple structure, quick to regenerate and non essential to the viability of fishes. Zebrafish are also amenable to molecular and genetic manipulations including transgenic techniques and forward genetic screens.
The interplay between the immune system and cancer is an ongoing focus of scientific interest. Increasing evidence indicates that dysregulation of the immune system, as for example found in allergic and autoimmune disorders, can affect survival of cells in developing tumors . This observation suggests that the cancer rates in individuals affected by such disorders might be different from those in individuals that do not suffer from allergies or autoimmune diseases.
Most of our understanding of sound representation in cerebral cortex comes from experiments using synthetic acoustic stimuli . In the limited regime of the synthetic stimuli used for model estimation, a model might accurately predict neural responses, but it is impossible to know how well that model generalizes to natural conditions unless it is tested with natural stimuli . Typically, STRFs are estimated using synthetic broadband stimuli .
Polyunsaturated fatty acids have multiple regulatory actions within cells including activating cellular signaling pathways and regulating gene expression. The mechanism by which polyunsaturated fatty acids transduce their signal within cells is not completely understood. Therefore, we asked if a lipogenic gene regulated exclusively at a posttranscriptional level would involve AMPK activity in the inhibition of its expression by polyunsaturated fatty acids .
The yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae has been used as a model eukaryote to study the aging process for 50 years . Similar to cells in metazoans, yeast cells undergo replicative and chronological aging. Chronological life span  is defined as the length of time that a non dividing cell remains viable.
Tumor hypoxia is known to contribute to tumor radioresistance and poor clinical outcomes . HIF 1, the best studied member, is a heterodimer consisting of a tightly regulated HIF 1α subunit and a constitutively expressed HIF 1β subunit. Low oxygen levels enhance HIF 1 expression through increased protein stability , leading to downstream expression of genes affecting angiogenesis, glycolysis, apoptosis, differentiation, and proliferation .
Methadone is an evidence based medication for the treatment of opioid dependence, and has been available in the U.S. for over four decades., In the U.S., the delivery of pharmacological treatments for opioid dependence has long been relegated to a specialty sector of the healthcare system due, in large part, to government regulations and physicians’ reluctance to prescribe medications for addiction treatment., Buprenorphine was approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for the treatment of opioid dependence in late 2002. In its early stages of adoption, buprenorphine tended to be used by populations with insurance coverage, and patients relying on the publicly funded treatment sector often did not have equal access to buprenorphine when it first became available. Under the new policies, access to both medications was rapidly expanded.
As access to antiretroviral drugs is expanding in sub Saharan Africa and second line treatments are often not readily available in the setting, it is imperative that adequate assessment on the prevalence and transmission of drug resistance mutations is performed to ensure optimization of treatment efficacy . Antiretroviral therapy  has been successful in suppressing the human immunodeficiency virus , however it fails to completely eliminate HIV from infected individuals and often elicits drug resistant variants. In addition the presence of these mutations has been demonstrated to have a negative impact on the antiretroviral therapeutic response and shortens the time to the first virological failure .
Autism is defined by impairments in the areas of social interaction and communication and marked by the presence of a restricted repertoire of behavioral activities and interest. Although not identified as a core phenotype of autism spectrum disorders , face processing and recognition is thought to be a relative area of weakness for many individuals with ASD . Briefly, alterations in face processing in ASD may include: biases toward high spatial frequency information in faces ; reduced configural processing of faces ; alternative patterns of attention to features within the face such as atypical or reduced eye attention ; and differential patterns of responses to familiar vs. unfamiliar faces .
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is a major cause of chronic liver disease. Although hepatocyte injury and death are uniformly worse in NASH than in steatosis, the outcomes of NASH are variable . The liver harbors resident populations of cells that regulate innate immune responses.
One dimensional semiconductor nanostructures such as quantum wires  and quantum rods ,  have been attracting significant interest over the last decade due to their tunable optical properties, which in turn give rise to applications in biomedical fields ranging from multiplex imaging to sensors, . Recently, a wide array of methods in manipulating the shape and size of CdSe nanocrystals  have been reported. These include larger absorption cross section, and larger surface area per particle, which facilitates conjugation with multiple active molecules .
The study of RNA enzymes, or ribozymes, is of considerable interest due to their importance in biology, their evolutionary implications, and potential impact for the design of drugs and new biomedical technology. , The hammerhead ribozyme , ,  is a small self cleaving ribozyme derived from RNA discovered in satellites of various plant virus genomes. Catalysis results from in line nucleophilic attack of the 2′O of C17 to the adjacent scissile phosphate, followed by cleavage of the P O5′ bond of C1.1 to produce a 2′,3′ cyclic phosphate and a 5′ hydroxy terminus in two RNA product strands.
The phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase  pathway plays an integral role in the regulation of many key cellular processes, mediating proliferation, differentiation, intracellular signaling, and glucose metabolism . For this reason, identifying novel biomarkers of target inhibition that are detectable by noninvasive methods is essential for determining the efficacy of treatment and correlation with antitumor effects  . We have used MRS to identify biomarkers of response to emerging targeted therapies .
Suicide is an enormous public health problem in the United States and around the world. A recent report from the Institute of Medicine  estimated that in the United States the value of lost productivity due to suicide is $11.8 billion per year . Reports from the World Health Organization  indicate that suicide accounts for the largest share of the intentional injury burden in developed countries  and that suicide is projected to become an even greater contributor to the global burden of disease over the coming decades .
The global burden of morbidity and mortality from hepatitis C virus  infection is truly pandemic . HCV is transmitted primarily through percutaneous exposure to blood contaminated with HCV. The prevalence of HCV is disproportionately high among injection drug users ; with seroprevalence as high as 95% .
Chronic viral infections, such as those caused by human immunodeficiency virus , hepatitis C virus , and hepatitis B virus  are among the leading causes of death in the world . In the United States, there are approximately four million people with persistent hepatitis C infection and more than ten thousand HCV related deaths each year, with mortality from HCV expected to double in this decade and possibly surpass that caused by HIV  . HCV is not only an important cause of disease, but it is also an ideal infection in which to study viral evasion mechanisms because infection persists in the majority of infected individuals but not all since approximately 25% of those infected successfully clear the virus.
In order to help educators and policy makers build the primary care physician work force, researchers must systematically evaluate medical students’ reasons for choosing primary care or specialty practice. In summary, primary care oriented students have different beliefs about the value of primary care. Work life perceptions are influenced by both students’ direct observations of practicing physicians and the culture of medical education, including the “informal curriculum.”, , , Within this informal curriculum, students at many U.S. institutions have described hearing negative messages about primary care from peers, residents, and faculty., , , Among other criticisms, primary care has been labeled “unchallenging and mundane” and is associated with short visits, restrictive cost controls, burdensome paperwork, and overwhelmed and unhappy physicians., , By examining student perceptions, we aim to assess whether students who choose primary care view primary care work life more positively than their peers, or whether they view primary care work life negatively, but choose primary care despite these negative perceptions .
Prostate cancer  is the most frequently diagnosed malignant tumor and was the second leading cause of cancer related death in American men in 2011. Metastatic CaP can be treated effectively with androgen ablation. However, one of the most troubling aspects of this disease is that after hormone treatment, the tumor inevitably progresses from an androgen dependent  to an incurable castration resistant  form .
The apolipoprotein E  ε4 allele on chromosome 19 is a major genetic risk factor for late onset Alzheimer’s disease  that may account for as much as 50% of the risk for developing the disease . In fact, these cognitive declines and functional changes in APOE ε4 carriers tend to become most evident after age 65 . Changes in language abilities during prodromal AD have been the subject of some interest.
Pancreatic carcinoma is the fourth leading cause of cancer related deaths in the United States today . Gemcitabine  remains the best treatment option, though it only modestly increases survival . The spindle checkpoint monitors both the attachment of microtubules to the kinetochores and the tension exerted by these attachments .
The neurohypophysial hormone vasopressin  is the hormonal regulator of water homeostasis and has major effects on behaviour and vascular tone . The mPVN together with the supraoptic  nuclei of the hypothalamus constitute the neurohypophysial system that is the primary source of Avp and the related peptide oxytocin  released into the systemic circulation from neurons terminating in the posterior pituitary. Under basal conditions about 50% of these neurons also express Avp .
It is generally accepted that the tendency of insulin to self associate in solution is strongly enhanced in the presence of zinc ion , which is normally present at a concentration of ca 0.2 mM in human serum . In particular, under conditions where zinc free insulin exists in monomeric form, insulin in the presence of zinc is thought to exist primarily as a hexamer binding two moles of zinc per mole of hexamer . The concentration dependent self association of bovine Zn insulin at pH 7.0 was previously studied by Milthorpe et al  via sedimentation equilibrium over the concentration range 0.03  0.6 mg/ml, who reported that over this concentration range the sedimentation equilibrium could be accounted for by an equilibrium between monomer and hexamer.
Synchronization of cortical areas in the human brain plays an important role in the understanding of the computational basis for human cognition . However, coupling across frequencies would allow for much more complex cortico cortical interactions  and has been examined in brain signals . Cross frequency coupling in the human brain suggests nonlinear interaction and it is speculated that such interactions play a crucial role in the coordination of complex cortical computation.
Neuronal exocytosis is a highly regulated Ca2+ triggered process involving the membrane fusion of synaptic vesicles with the presynaptic plasma membrane. However, the mechanisms by which syt1 triggers membrane fusion are not understood. Synaptotagmin 1 also interacts with the SNAREs, and there is evidence that syt1 binds simultaneously to phospholipids and the SNARE complex through interactions of its C2 domains  .
Spiral ganglion neurons  transmit primary acoustic information from cochlear hair cells to the brain. SGNs extend a peripheral process to hair cells and a central process to target neurons in the cochlear nucleus . The central processes of SGNs bifurcate into ascending and descending branches within the CN and maintain a tonotopic map .
Over the past several years, three different laboratories have independently isolated mitotically active germ cells from juvenile and adult mouse ovaries that can be propagated ex vivo , generate what appear to be oocytes in defined cultures in vitro , and differentiate into fertilization competent eggs after intraovarian transplantation in vivo . Adding to this, very recent gene expression profiling studies have shown that oogonial stem cells  isolated from adult ovaries differ markedly from embryonic primordial germ cells , indicating that these two populations of oocyte producing germline stem cells in females are distinct entities . Although more experiments are needed to define the exact physiological contribution of these newly discovered cells to adult ovarian function and perhaps aging related ovarian failure, the now large body of evidence from multiple laboratories supporting the existence and functionality of mammalian OSCs provides a strong impetus to characterize these cells more rigorously  .
Peer relationships provide a socialization context of great importance during adolescence, in part because adolescents who are similar to one another tend to aggregate in groups and to influence one another’s behavior in those groups . Concurrent links between social standing in the peer group  and youth behavior  are well documented . However, less is known about the stability of social standing in the peer group, individual characteristics that may predict changes in social standing, and implications of changes in social standing for subsequent behavior.
Copy number alterations represent a substantial category of genetic variation. Germline copy number variants can be used for phenotypic mapping in genome wide association studies, and have been linked to various diseases . Ideally, such characterization should include both the precise identification of the chromosomal breakpoints of each alteration and the accurate estimation of copy numbers in each chromosomal segment.
Disclosure of HIV status among people who test positive for HIV has important implications for preventing new HIV infections and for the treatment, care and support of people living with HIV/AIDS  . The potential preventive health benefits of disclosure have been emphasized in health research and programs  with a particular focus on HIV disclosure to sexual partners  . There is mixed evidence that disclosure to sexual partners leads to sexual risk behavior change .
Mental disorders are leading causes of disability in the U.S. , and antidepressant medications are a mainstay of treatment for depressive and anxiety disorders . However, many people do not receive effective treatment, particularly ethnic minorities . These differences in mental health care may contribute to the persistence and severity of mental disorders and the burden of non lethal suicidality among black Americans .
Rapid economic growth, including that of the alcohol industry combined with poor regulatory policies, multiple health risk factors, such as infectious diseases and malnutrition, and inadequate public health resources make alcohol related problems especially significant in developing countries . Alcohol production and consumption in India have shown increasing trends . While overall abstention rates continue to be high, especially in women , significant numbers of men drink and up to half meet criteria for heavy use.
Primary vaginal cancer occurs predominantly in post menopausal women over the age of 60 and accounts for less than 2% of gynecological cancers diagnosed . Due to the overall low frequency of vaginal cancer, research into new treatment options is slow and traditional treatment regimes dominate . To be successful, this approach must be both safe and effective.
Humoral immune responses play a major role in conferring naturally acquired immunity to malaria . This immunity, however, appears to be slow to develop and ineffectively maintained , also demonstrated by the low prevalence of Plasmodium falciparum  malaria antigen specific memory B cells  even in high endemic areas . While the complex nature of the parasite  and the high degree of antigenic variation  certainly contribute to this apparently impaired generation of humoral immune memory, there is also increasing evidence that the malaria parasite actively alters B cell function .
At a physiological level, endothelin  1 plays an important role in the control of fluid volume balance and blood pressure. Specifically, ET 1 promotes diuresis and natriuresis within the collecting duct and action through ETB receptors. Systemically, ETB receptors clear ET 1 from the circulation and protect against ETA receptor dependent vasoconstriction, cell proliferation, matrix accumulation, and inflammation.
Type II diabetes mellitus  is a metabolic disorder with multiple derangements in metabolic and immune pathways that predisposes individuals to cardiovascular disease. While glycemic control is of paramount importance, recent data indicate that broad pleiotropic strategies that target multiple pathways are more likely to succeed in the reducing cardiovascular risk in these patients. Emerging evidence suggests an important role for theincretin hormone, glucagon like peptide , in the regulation of post prandial glycemic control and satiety.
Obesity is associated with expansion of metabolically active adipose tissues leading to local and systemic inflammation, insulin resistance, and dyslipidemia, all of which can contribute to cardiovascular disease. In particular, expression of MCP 1 is approximately 1040 fold higher in perivascular adipocytes  compared to corresponding subcutaneous and perirenal adipocytes derived from the same subjects. MCP 1 is best known for its role in recruiting monocytes/macrophages to the arterial wall, but it may also contribute to vascular smooth muscle cell  proliferation, angiogenesis and other pathological processes.
LRP1 is a multifunctional member of the LDL receptor gene family that interacts with numerous ligands. Subsequent vascular studies have demonstrated a role for LRP1 using cell specific deletion, with particular emphasis on macrophages and smooth muscle cells . Recent studies have suggested a role for LRP1 in human vascular pathologies, particularly aortic aneurysms.
Chronic hyperactivation of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis results in long term exposure to elevated circulating glucocorticoids, which exert long lasting and often detrimental effects on an organism’s growth and development , immune functioning , reproduction , mood and addictive tendencies , and cognitive functioning. For example, in healthy adults both the administration of glucocorticoids and the implementation of a brief stressor increase salivary cortisol levels and adversely affect non emotional memory processes . Higher blood cortisol levels predict poorer cognitive performance in healthy aged subjects .
Diagnosis of the sporadic form of the fatal motor neuron degenerative disorder amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  depends on clinical criteria and electromyographic evaluation for definitive confirmation. Despite progress in the field, radiographic tests such as diffusion tensor tractography and serum biomarkers such as angiogenin have not yet achieved widespread utility in this clinically heterogeneous disorder . Mounting evidence suggests a link between the Nogo A protein and ALS.
Pseudomonas aeruginosa remains a significant cause of nosocomial infection and septic mortality in patients admitted to the intensive care units . The bacterium is uniquely problematic because of a combination of inherent resistance to many drug classes and its ability to acquire resistance to all relevant treatments. With 5570 open reading frames, P. aeruginosa genome is among the largest genomes of the prokaryotic world and encodes a vast array of proteins involved in regulation, transport and virulence factors, which may explain the high versatility and adaptive capacity of the species .
CD81 is a ubiquitously expressed member of the tetraspanin superfamily of proteins. Their most striking property is the ability to interact with multiple proteins . These associations are thought to occur mainly in membrane compartments such as lipid rafts and tetraspanin enriched microdomains , thereby forming a membrane network known as the “tetraspanin web”.
Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death among persons with diabetes and there is evidence that cardiac damage is often present at the time of clinical diagnosis of diabetes , . In addition, persons with hyperglycemia even below the threshold for the diagnosis of diabetes are known to be at high risk for cardiovascular events  . Elevated glucose levels are thought to induce hyperglycemia mediated coronary microvascular dysfunction and result in myocardial injury  .
In the adult skeleton, bone is continuously being formed and resorbed. Bone resorption and formation do not occur along the bone surface at random. Disturbances of the bone remodeling process are often associated with skeletal diseases, including CED, which is an inherited skeleton remodeling disorder, characterized by a fusiform thickening of the diaphyses of the long bones and skull .
The ability to speak, swallow, taste food, and maintain a healthy oral cavity is heavily reliant on the presence of saliva, an important effect of which on our everyday lives is often unappreciated . Salivary glands  have an important role not only in oral health but also for general health and well being. It is highly common especially in patients undergoing radiotherapy treatment for head and neck cancer, drug usage and patients suffering from Sjogren’s syndrome.
Endometrial cancer is the most frequently diagnosed malignancy of the female genital tract. The majority of endometrial cancers  are adenocarcinomas, which originate in uterine epithelial cells. All endometrial cancers can be further delineated into two types .
Folliculogenesis is a coordinated process driven by signals from ovarian cells as well as the anterior pituitary. This growth is accompanied by differentiation of the granulosa and theca cells, leading to antrum formation and increased steroidogenic function. Investigating this complex sequence of events has been difficult in vivo due to the limited ability to track or monitor individual follicles.
Neurotransmitter release is essential for communication between neurones and thus brain function. It is stimulated by influx of extracellular calcium  via voltage dependent Ca2+ channels on nerve terminal depolarization by action potentials . Because of the tight coupling between Ca2+ and exocytosis many laboratories have examined their relationship.
Broadly, stress can simultaneously provoke both an adaptive and apoptotic response within cells. Understanding this alternative, adaptive pathway known as autophagy, has thus become increasingly important . Autophagy presently is viewed as a “doubled edged sword” whereby downregulation of this process promotes tumorigenesis and upregulation in an established tumor promotes cell survival .
Transcranial magnetic stimulation  can be used within the MRI scanner to noninvasively manipulate brain activity while subjects undergo functional neuroimaging. As the technical challenges related to delivering TMS in the scanner have been overcome , this multimodal approach has been increasingly used to causally map motor, sensory, and cognitive brain networks in humans . TMS can be shaped by nearby magnetic fields , so the scanner’s static field likely influences the TMS coil’s field.
The introduction of α1,3 galactosyltransferase gene knockout  pigstransgenic for human complement regulatory proteins, markedly improved pig xenograftsurvival in non human primates  . However,dysregulation of coagulation in the form of thrombotic microangiopathy in the graft and/orconsumptive coagulopathy  in the recipient remains a major barrier . It has beenreported that increased immunosuppressive therapy  significantly prolongs organxenograft survival, but not systemic anticoagulation .
Chronic kidney disease is now recognized as a major public health concern. , It is estimated that approximately 26.3 million adults in the US have non dialysis dependent kidney disease and over 470,000 have end stage renal disease, collectively representing over 13% of the US population. In the next 20 years, the burden of chronic kidney disease is expected to increase, with over 2 million individuals projected to be receiving renal replacement therapy  by 2030.
Although the initiating factors and sequence of molecular and cellular events leading to the dysfunction and death of neurons in Alzheimer's disease  are not fully understood, the accumulation of amyloid β peptide  and hyperphosphorylated tau, oxidative stress, impaired energy metabolism and a disruption of neuronal Ca2+ regulation are implicated . The reduced energy availability and increased oxidative stress that occur in AD may promote neuronal membrane depolarization and overactivation of glutamate receptors resulting in excitotoxic damage to the neurons . Excessive and sustained increases in the intracellular Ca2+ concentration in neurons may impair synaptic function, and damage and kill neurons in AD .
Research with split brain patients provides considerable evidence for left hemisphere involvement  in the critical domains of reasoning, decision making, and problem solving  while limiting the role of the right hemisphere, and in particular the right prefrontal cortex  to little more than visual organization . However, this traditional view is being modified. Several neuroimaging studies have activated right PFC in specific conditions of logical reasoning tasks.
Epidermal fatty acid binding protein  belongs to a family of low molecular weight  cytosolic proteins that binds long chain free fatty acids. The members of the FABP family share similar tertiary structure which consists of two short α helical segments and a fatty acid binding cavity surrounded by two five stranded antiparallel β sheets . FABPs are thought to play a prominent role in trafficking of long chain free fatty acids to respective final metabolic or regulatory sites within the cell.
The prevalence of diet induced obesity is reaching epidemic proportions in industrialized nations. Together, these two diseases are an enormous health and financial burden. To maintain body mass, energy input through food intake and absorption, must match energy expenditure through physical activity, basal metabolism and adaptive thermogenesis.
The vocal fold mucosa is a layered structure comprised of epithelium and lamina propria ; both of which are superficial to the thyroarytenoid  muscle. Together, these mucosal structures facilitate vocal fold immune, transport and barrier function, and underpin self sustained tissue oscillation for voice production . The LP is especially important for vocal fold oscillation as it contains an extracellular matrix  rich in proteins and glycans with favorable viscoelasticity .
Cardiac ryanodine receptors  are sarcoplasmic reticulum  Ca release channels, crucial in excitation contraction coupling . Dysfunctional RyR2, exhibiting enhanced Ca leak has been implicated in arrhythmogenesis and heart failure . Homotetrameric RyR2s have a transmembrane channel domain, and regulatory and scaffolding cytoplasmic domain .
Health literacy has been defined as “the degree to which individuals have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions” . Evidence for the negative impact of poor health literacy is accumulating. Adults with limited health literacy have less knowledge of disease management and of health promoting behaviors, are less likely to use preventive services, and report poorer health status .
Prostate tumors are usually androgen dependent in the beginning, so front line therapies are initially aimed at reducing the amount of free androgens that sustain these tumors. Estrogen treatment is thought to indirectly decrease androgen production by negative feedback control on the hypothalamic pituitary testicular axis , though with the proven androgen independence of these tumors, this may not provide much additional therapeutic benefit. They bind to both intracellular and membrane receptors that transduce extracellular signals to downstream effectors .
The epidermal growth factor receptor  is the prototypical receptor tyrosine kinase. Ligands, such epidermal growth factor , bind to the extracellular domain of the receptor and induce a conformational change in the receptor that allows two receptors to dimerize. These cellular changes are critical to proper tissue development, regeneration, and homeostasis .
The contraction of striated muscles is regulated by the troponin complex, which controls the association of actin and myosin in a calcium dependent manner. Calcium bound TnC undergoes a conformational change increasing its apparent affinity for the inhibitory subunit of the troponin complex, troponin I . This movement of TnI, along with an accompanying shift of the tropomyosin strand, removes both a kinetic and a steric hindrance for myosin's binding to actin, facilitating crossbridge cycling and force generation  .
Interleukin 22  is a cytokine expressed by immune cells but acting on non haematopoetic cells. The receptor for IL 22 is expressed in barrier sites such as skin, intestine, lung as well as in liver, pancreas and kidney . Thus, the expression pattern of IL 22 and its receptor creates signaling directionality from the immune system to the tissues in line with the important function IL 22 has in maintaining tissue integrity.
Alveolar Capillary Dysplasia with Misalignment of Pulmonary Veins   is a rare, lethal disorder of the lungs. Affected patients typically present with severe respiratory failure and refractory pulmonary hypertension within a few hours after birth and die in the first month of life, although rare late onset presentations have been reported . Histopathologically, ACDMPV is characterized by malposition of pulmonary veins adjacent to small pulmonary arteries, medial thickening of small pulmonary arteries, deficient lobular development, a paucity of alveolar wall capillaries, and occasional lymphangiectasis .
Arterial and venous thromboses are major causes of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality and arterial thrombosis is the most common cause of myocardial infarction and stroke . New anticoagulant drugs for the prevention and treatment of vascular thrombosis have focused on improved efficacy, predictable dosing in a wide range of patients, and, importantly, acceptable bleeding risk  . Heparin has played a central role in the treatment of arterial and venous thrombosis .
Graft versus host disease  has severely limited the use of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  for the treatment of hematological malignancies . Cytokines, such as TNF α, can augment aGVHD through direct cytotoxic impact on host tissues . Other proinflammatory cytokines including IL 1, IL 17, IL 6 and IFN γ can indirectly lead to priming, activation and differentiation of respective immune cells .
The olfactory bulb  is a unique model for investigating in vivo the correlation between vascular density, synaptic transmission, metabolism and neurovascular coupling . Dorsal glomeruli can be easily imaged in vivo with two photon laser scanning microscopy , a technique that allows one to characterize vascular architecture with a micrometer spatial resolution, and to measure cerebral blood flow  and neuronal activity  with a millisecond time resolution. These two layers thus sharply differ in their cellular contents and can be expected to show differences in metabolism .
Chronic transplant dysfunction, likely caused by ischemia secondary to graft arteriosclerosis , is the most significant factor limiting long term survival after clinical heart and kidney transplantation. The histopathology of GA includes proliferative intimal expansion, primarily of vascular smooth muscle cells , with inadequate outward vessel remodeling, resulting in luminal narrowing. Evidence supports a possible association of acute graft arterial injury and GA  .
Currently, more than 2 billion individuals have been infected with M. tuberculosis and about 5%10% those infected will develop active TB disease during their lifetime. In 1921, the vaccine Mycobacterium bovis BCG, developed by Albert Calmette and Camille Guérin, was first used in humans . Currently M. bovis BCG has been administrated to over 4 billion people and remains the only licensed anti TB vaccine worldwide .
Motor related, cortical areas have long been thought to contribute more to movements than simple commands. These “higher order” processes have been suggested to include memory, prediction, timing, abstraction or targets, etc. but specific demonstrations of how these processes are manifest during specific movements has been lacking generally.
Voltage sensitive sodium channels are large integral membrane proteins that consist of four homologous domains  each containing six transmembrane segments  connected by extra  and intracellular loops . Sodium channel blocking insecticides  are a relatively new group of insecticides. Metaflumizone , the second SCBI to be commercialized, causes poisoning symptoms that are similar to those produced by other SCBIs .
Patients receiving hospice care have a variety of distressing symptoms and problems facing them, with fatigue and pain being among the most distressing. As patients near the end of life, priorities may shift from concerns about work and health to concerns about what comes after death. Thus, many patients may strengthen or renew their relationship with God, however they may define that relationship, confirming the need for clergy to be included in the interdisciplinary team.
Despite the health consequences of cigarette smoking , 20.8% of Americans continue to smoke . One possible route to the development of more effective treatments for TD is a better understanding of how current treatments, such as bupropion HCl and practical group counseling  psychotherapy, influence brain activity. We therefore examined effects of these treatments on resting cerebral glucose metabolism, an index of regional brain function.
The pancreas is a complex organ with two distinct functions. Embedded within the exocrine compartment is the endocrine pancreas, composed of the islets of Langerhans, which secrete hormones including insulin into the bloodstream to maintain glucose homeostasis. Like other family members, HB EGF is synthesized as a transmembrane protein  that can be cleaved by metalloproteinases to release a soluble, diffusible ligand.
The paired box transcription factor  family consists of 9 highly related members with critical roles in organogenesis and tissue specification during development, including skeletal muscle, pancreas, central nervous system, kidney, and immune system . Mutations and gene rearrangement of PAX genes are frequently associated with human diseases and cancers . RMS is the most common soft tissue sarcoma in children  that consists of alveolar  and embryonal  subtypes.
Amblyopia, also known as “lazy eye,” is a spatial vision disorder that affects about 3% of the population . It is characterized by reduced visual acuity in one or both eyes without any organic origin. Although conventional wisdom on visual development suggests that spatial vision becomes hard wired after the critical period  and only infant and young child amblyopes are treated in current clinical practice, a number of recent studies suggest that perceptual learning might be a potential treatment for adult amblyopia .
H5N1 influenza A viruses that transmitted from poultry to humans in 1997 claimed the lives of six of the 18 people infected . One such pair of viruses is A/Hong Kong/483/97  and A/Hong Kong/486/97 . The case patient from whom HK/483 was isolated had a low total peripheral leukocyte count at hospital admission and ultimately succumbed to infection.
Body dissatisfaction is pervasive among adolescents  and has been linked with poor emotional well being  and weight and shape control behaviors . In the 2011 Youth Risk Behavior Survey, a nationally representative sample of US high school students, 61% of girls and 32% of boys reported trying to lose weight; 12% of adolescents reported fasting, 5% reported using diet pills, and 4% reported self induced vomiting or laxative use for the purpose of weight control . In addition, there is growing awareness and concern regarding the use of muscle enhancing behaviors among adolescents .
Sensory systems sample the environment, translating external stimuli into transient and sometimes enduring internal neural codes or representations. In the olfactory system, volatile odorants are detected in the periphery by ORNs which transduce chemical stimuli into electrical signals that are relayed downstream to the OB or the AL. These dynamic patterns change most rapidly during the odor's onset and offset .
Carcinomas arise from transformed epithelial cells and account for >80% of adult malignancies. Lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer deaths with five year survival rates of 10 15%. This poor prognosis is due to lack of effective screening modalities resulting in patients presenting with advanced disease that is not responsive to current therapies.
E2F1 is a highly conserved member of the E2F family, a group of nine transcription factors that coordinate a transcription program underlying cell cycle progression. Embedded within the transactivation domain is the pocket binding motif for tumor suppressor Retinoblastoma protein , which binds E2F1 during quiescence and G1 to repress E2F1 activity . E2F1 is present in neurons during brain development and increases in expression through neuronal maturation .
While Pseudomonas aeruginosa is a frequent cause of acute nosocomial pneumonia in patients undergoing mechanical ventilation, burn victims, patients with corneal trauma, patients with healing surgical wounds  and cystic fibrosis  , healthy individuals are generally highly resistant to serious infection. There are clearly multiple, redundant innate immune mechanisms contributing to this resistance. Lipid rafts are specialized areas of the plasma membrane that are enriched in cholesterol and sphingolipids .
The HIV 1 envelope  protein is encoded by the 3’ end of the HIV 1 viral RNA  genome in a region that overlaps the Vpu open reading frame , and the Tat and Rev ORFs . Also encoded in this region is the rev responsive element  that binds to Rev . Ordinarily, the nuclear export signal  of Rev binds to a complex of the cellular proteins Crm1 and Ran GTP to facilitate the nuclear export of the HIV 1 vRNA that encodes the Gag and GagPol proteins, as well as other incompletely spliced HIV 1 RNAs .
Agonists acting at spinal α2 adrenergic and opioid receptors , share common signal transduction systems mediated through inhibitory G proteins, the activation of which inhibits pain transmission. In addition, agonists acting at α2ARs and ORs interact in a greater than additive  manner when co administered to the spinal cord . Synergistic interactions can result in greater than 100 fold increases in analgesic potency as well as increased maximum efficacy.
Psoriasis is a common chronic inflammatory skin disease of unsolved pathogenesis. Psoriatic plaques are dominated by T lymphocytes as well as innate immune cells such as dendritic cells and macrophages . Important advancements have been made in deciphering the role of growth factors , inflammatory cytokines  and their downstream transcription factors  in the crosstalk between immune and epithelial cells that underlies the pathogenesis of psoriasis .
Pneumonia, an inflammatory condition of the lung, causes greater mortality than any other respiratory disease globally . More than AIDS, malaria and tuberculosis combined, pneumonia is responsible for about 19% of all deaths in children below five years . Even when pneumonia is caused by bacteria and respiratory viruses other than influenza, influenza has nonetheless been shown to increase the susceptibility for other etiologies of pneumonia .
Gene targeting, through the use of homologous recombination , provides the ability to modify any endogenous gene in a predetermined and precise manner. When it first became clear that somatic cell nuclear transfer  may offer an opportunity for HR in livestock species, it appeared that somatic targeting efficiency may be much lower than in mouse ESC . Thus, gene targeting in somatic cells could be expected to be much less efficient than in ESC.
Hemorrhagic shock results in the disruption of the microvascular endothelial cell barrier leading to vascular leak . Studies from our laboratory have shown that ROS formation and the activation of the “intrinsic” apoptotic signaling cascade are major mediators of vascular leak following hemorrhagic shock . Sex dimorphism in the clinical manifestation of conditions such as trauma, hemorrhage and sepsis have been subjects of recent investigation .
In mammals circadian rhythms in overt body functions which enable the organism to anticipate and to adapt to the solar cycle are controlled by a master circadian rhythm generator located in the hypothalamic suprachiasmatic nucleus  that synchronises peripheral oscillators . The positive regulators BMAL1 and CLOCK/NPAS2  activate transcription of negative regulators, such as mPER1/2 and mCRY1/2, as well as clock controlled output genes like Avp . The mPER and mCRY proteins inhibit CLOCK:BMAL1 mediated transcription in a circadian manner .
Over the past decade, significant progress has been made in the development of non contact wide field technologies for quantitative, sub surface functional imaging. Frequency domain photon migration  and fluorescence lifetime imaging  have been applied to large fields of view   for normal versus tumor cell delineation through natural chromophore contrast , or for improved exogenous and endogenous fluorescence signal detection through lifetime contrast . Most of these technologies require multiple images to be acquired with a varying parameter , and images must be registered to the same position in space over the period of data acquisition.
The development of squamous cell carcinoma  of the epidermis occurs via a multistage, stepwise process whereby keratinocytes accumulate distinct genetic lesions in oncogenes and tumor suppressor genes that promote cell growth and cell survival . In addition, these genetic lesions are common events in human epidermal SCC  and play crucial roles in its development . Therefore, identification of gene regulatory pathways that are acquired during immortalization and transformation could reveal attractive targets for therapies designed to inhibit tumor progression .
Consistent with diagnostic requirements, assessment of attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder  focuses on the presence of symptoms and associated impairment., In pediatrics, shared decision making includes integrating parents’ goals and concerns about their children with medical evidence to achieve a family centered medical decision process. The American Academy of Pediatrics  recommends use of shared decision making in its practice guidelines for ADHD, with a focus on identifying goals for ADHD. Specifically, the AAP calls for “addressing individualized and specific behavioral, academic, and social target goals” .
The human genome encodes about 518 protein kinases  which constitutes one of the largest class of genes, termed the “Human Kinome”. Phosphorylation of the activation loop is one common mechanism for kinase activation. The other hallmark feature of an active state conformation is the orientation of the αC helix located on the N terminal domain; in an active conformation it is rotated inward toward the active site, together with a characteristic ion pair interaction between the conserved Glu of the αC helix and the Lys of the β3 strand of the β sheet in the N lobe, , .
Robust lung inflammation induced by infectious and non infectious stimuli can lead to severe pathological states including acute respiratory distress syndrome  and multi organ failure with devastating, often lethal consequences. Upon activation by toll like receptor  or other pattern recognition receptor signaling, macrophages recruit additional pro inflammatory immune cells including neutrophils, exudative macrophages, and Th1 lymphocytes to the lung and alveolar space as a critical part of the innate immune response . As a result, ET has been associated with worse outcomes including increased mortality and secondary infections .
Polychlorinated biphenyls  and other persistent organic pollutants , such as hexachlorobenzene , and p,p’ dichlorophenyldichloroethylene , a metabolite of p,p’ DDT, have been found to elicit a broad spectrum of biologic, metabolic, and immunologic responses . The potential of these POPs to impair immune responses and trigger autoimmune disease is of growing concern. Given the structural similarity to thyroid hormones, PCBs  may mimic thyroid hormone action and even modulate the mechanisms and interfere with the binding of these hormones , potentially leading to thyroid functional disorders and autoimmune thyroid diseases  .
Depressive disorders, including major depressive disorder and dysthymia, are common among adolescents and are associated with substantial health, social, and developmental consequences. Approximately 8% of adolescents experience an episode of major depression in a given year , and 12% of adolescents have experienced a depressive disorder in their lifetime . In the short term, depressive disorders are associated with adverse outcomes among adolescents, including an increased risk for comorbid mental health problems , substance use disorders , and obesity .
Vibrio cholerae, an autochthonous aquatic bacterium, is the causative agent of cholera, a severe, watery, life threatening diarrheal disease. Genes encoding for cholera toxin, ctxAB, and other pathogenic factors have been shown to reside in various mobile genetic elements . Isolates from the sixth pandemic are almost exclusively Classical biotype.
The involvement of protein kinase A  and protein kinase C  in the induction and maintenance of LTP in hippocampal pyramidal cells has been studied intensively . In area CA3, PKA plays a fundamental role in the induction and maintenance of the N methyl D aspartate receptor  independent form of LTP at mossy fiber  to pyramidal cell synapses . Furthermore, it is well established that PKA modulates the activation of the L type voltage gated Ca2+ channels  required for the induction of NMDAR independent LTP at Schaffer collateral to pyramidal cell synapses  as well as MF to pyramidal cell synapses .
ADAMTS13, a member of A Disintegrin And Metalloprotease with ThromboSpondin type repeats  family,  controls the sizes of von Willebrand factor  by cleaving vWF at the Tyr1605 Met1606 bond in the central A2 domain. Profound thrombocytopenia, microangiopathic hemolytic anemia and organ ischemia are characteristic features of TTP syndrome. If left untreated, the mortality rate is as high as 80~100%.
Strabismus, a manifest misalignment of the visual axes, is one of the most common childhood visual disorders, occurring in 3 4% of the population . Phoria, a latent misalignment of the visual axes, exists to some degree in nearly all individuals. However, either genes or environment can contribute to resemblance among family members; therefore, familial clustering does not clarify etiology.
The denatured state of a protein is the starting point for folding a protein to its native structure which confers its function. Structural data, particularly from NMR studies of denatured proteins, and computational studies demonstrate the presence of persistent secondary structure and hydrophobic clusters under denaturing conditions. In so doing, non random structures can greatly increase protein folding efficiency, thereby satisfying Levinthal’s Paradox.
Curcumin, 1,7 bis 1,6 heptadien 3,5 dione, is the primary bioactive component isolated from turmeric, a dietary spice made from the rhizome of Curcuma longa . Curcumin has chemopreventative and chemotherapeutic properties in numerous experimental models and has been shown to inhibit a variety of cellular targets that promote survival and metastasis including nuclear factor kappa B  and signal transducer and activator of transcription 3 , among others . These data suggest that curcumin may be an effective means to modulate pathways that contribute to chronic inflammation leading to cancer.
Results from genome wide scans have confirmed common genetic variants with very small effects on breast cancer risk; however, this approach likely misses clinically and functionally important cancer susceptibility alleles because of false negatives and poor coverage in some regions. Therefore, examination of candidate genes still provides a useful, complementary approach. The Breast Cancer Association Consortium, a collaborative data pooling effort of more than 60,000 subjects, was initiated to validate reported genetic associations with breast cancer risk.
Advances in immunosuppression and perioperative management have revolutionized liver transplantation  outcomes in the past 3 decades . Improved long term survival has led in turn to increased prevalence of ‘late’ complications after LTx such as chronic kidney disease . CKD has become one of the leading causes of morbidity and death after LTx .
Chromosomal inversions are known to occur in a wide variety of organisms where they are associated with instances of adaptive evolution, speciation, selfish genes, sex chromosomes, human disease and disease susceptibility . Although inversions have been studied for nearly a century, only recently have researchers begun to elucidate their effects on patterns of molecular evolution. Dobzhansky proposed that natural selection would favor inversions if they captured a set of positively interacting alleles, which he referred to as a “supergene” complex .
Pseudomonas aeruginosa is an opportunistic gram negative pathogen capable of eliciting acute or chronic infection of immunocompromised, burn and cystic fibrosis patients. Given the great infectious threat to hospitalized patients, alternative means are necessary to treat and prevent acute P. aeruginosa infections . However, these vaccines never gained clinical acceptance due to a wide array of problems  .
Falls are among the most serious problems facing older adults, which can cause injuries and even death . Slips comprise 40% of outdoor falls among older adults . Therefore an effective training program to prevent sliprelated falls is highly desired.
Chronic postsurgical pain  occurs in 10 50% of patients undergoing major surgery and results in pain sufficient to negatively impact quality of life. Low preoperative CPM correlates with a greater incidence of CPSP following thoracotomy and abdominal surgery. In the current study, we use a rodent postoperative pain model with a nerve injury component to examine for the first time the relationship between preoperative CPM and time course of recovery from surgery and examine one potential mechanism involved in this relationship .
6  Fluoro L dopa  is a radiopharmaceutical that follows the metabolic pathway of L dopa . In catecholaminergic neurons, FDOPA is decarboxylated by aromatic L amino acid decarboxylase  to fluorodopamine, which is taken up into synaptic vesicles by vesicular monoamine transporter type 2  and cleared from the synaptic cleft by dopamine transporters . Specific uptake of FDOPA in the striatum as measured by positron emission tomography  has been correlated with pathophysiology, duration, and functional status in Parkinson's disease .
Shanks, also known as ProSAP, Synamon, SSTRIP, CortBP and Spank, are a family of scaffold proteins at the postsynaptic density . Shank proteins are thought to promote enlargement and maturation of spines ,  and have been implicated in a number of neuronal diseases including autism  . Shanks have multiple protein interaction domains and can bind to other PSD scaffolds, GKAPs and Homers .
Individual agents used to treat human osteoporosis reduce fracture risk by ~50 60%. Since agents that act with complementary mechanisms are available, sequential therapies that mix anti resorptive and anabolic agents could improve fracture risk reduction, when compared to monotherapies . We evaluated bone mass, bone microarchitecture, and bone strength in adult ovariectomized , osteopenic rats, during different sequences of vehicle , parathyroid hormone , alendronate , or raloxifene  in three 90 day treatment periods, over nine months.
Diabetes mellitus  is one of the most frequent metabolic disorders, with an estimate of 371 million people living with this condition worldwide . Incidence and prevalence are rising, carrying high costs  and rates of morbid mortality, with premature deaths . Around 4.8 million people died in 2012 due to diabetes, half of them were under 60 years  .
The liver performs many complex functions including carbohydrate metabolism, urea and lipid metabolism, storage of essential nutrients, and the production/secretion of bile acids. Therefore, hepatic failure, end stage cirrhosis and infections targeting the liver present a major health problem. Given the shortage of organs for liver transplantation, an increasing emphasis is being placed on cell based liver therapies.
Regulation of gene expression in eukaryotes is an extremely complex process. Cis regulatory sequences on promoters and enhancers of target genes facilitate the cooperative assembly of transcriptional regulatory complexes. Ets1•Runx1 partnership provides a perfect basis for filling the gap.
Research in motor learning has been performed with nonfunctional, non novel tasks involving movements that have already been established in the abilities of individual performers . EEG changes have been found to occur during various mental activities , are collected in real time, and provide solid supplements to verbal protocols currently used in motor learning and sport psychology . Specifically, EEG activity is measured by EEG signal power in μVolts2 and increased activity equates to greater power measured from a given electrode, and vice versa.
Hypertension is a global health problem affecting 65 million persons in the United States  and about 1 billion persons worldwide. Despite the availability of effective pharmacologic therapies, low adherence to antihypertensive medication remains a public health challenge  and is associated with increased health care costs and with high rates of cardiovascular disease and hospitalization;. It is estimated that adherence rates are approximately 50% for chronic medications.
Despite modest improvements in survival rates from colorectal cancer  over the last 25 years, deaths from CRC still account for approximately 10% of all cancer deaths in the UK. Globally, CRC is ranked second as a cause of cancer mortality with 492,000 deaths per annum . Some studies have reported that lifestyle factors such as physical activity and body mass index influence particular characteristics of the tumour systemic inflammatory response, which affects cancer survival .
It has been widely proposed that connexin43 , the main gap junction protein expressed in astrocytes, can under specific conditions form functional “hemichannels”, providing a transmembrane pathway for the diffusion of ions and relatively large molecules . Evidence in support is primarily pharmacological, showing blockade of uptake of fluorescent dyes  and of release of intracellular molecules  by compounds known to block gap junction channels; additionally, electrophysiological recordings have demonstrated the presence of large  conductance channels in astrocytes  . Recently, a newly discovered group of proteins, the pannexins , were cloned from mammalian tissues.
Previous reports indicate that the frontal eye field , a cortical region involved in vision and eye movements, codes predominately for contralateral space . These operations include shifting RFs  and vector subtraction . There are a number of potential routes for ipsilateral signals to reach the FEF.
Transmissible spongiform encephalopathies , such as human Creutzfeldt Jakob Disease , endemic sheep scrapie, and epidemic bovine spongiform encephalopathy  are fatal neurodegenerative diseases caused by infectious particles of ~25 nm diameter and 106107 daltons . Their molecular composition remains speculative. These infectious particles separate from the majority of host encoded prion protein  by field flow sedimentation  as well as other purification procedures.
Studies have shown that the posterior visual regions have maximal amplitude of alpha rhythm in electroencephalography  , while the thalamus plays a critical role in generating and coordinating alpha activity . However, several inconsistent results have also been reported. However, little is known about a direct relationship between the neuronal activities of the two regions.
In the United States, the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental DisordersIV Text Revision provides the official classification of mental and substance use disorders widely employed in clinical, research, educational, and statistical settings. The categorical classification, however, also constitutes a primary limitation because it works best when all members of a given diagnosis are homogeneous and when there are clear boundaries between distinct diagnoses. DSM IV acknowledges this limitation and further suggests the presence of heterogeneity among individuals who share a diagnosis.
The aortic heart valve  normally consists of three cuspal shaped leaflets  that regulate blood flow from left ventricle to the aorta. BAV defects occur in about 12% of the population, making it the most prevalent congenital cardiac anomaly. Growing clinical and scientific data indicate that BAV is an exceptionally strong risk factor for life threatening aortic valve and/or ascending aortic pathology.,,, Accelerated valve calcification producing aortic stenosis  before the sixth decade of life is the most common clinical manifestation of BAV.
Single molecule force spectroscopy is a technique that provides unique information about the biomolecular interaction landscape that is hitherto not possible to obtain from conventional spectroscopy methods. , In this technique, biorecognition molecules of interest are pulled apart or stretched under an external loading force. The distribution of rupture forces at a constant loading rate enables the prediction of the most probable rupture force, which is a quantitative measure of the biospecific interaction at that loading rate.
Catheter ablation has been shown to be superior to antiarrhythmic therapy for the treatment of drug refractory, symptomatic atrial fibrillation . The past decade has produced significant advances in catheter ablation approaches for AF and improved procedural outcomes. This may be due to a variety of factors, including better patient selection, technological advances and greater operator experience.
Inhibitory control is an important component of executive function, and it is typically assessed using tasks in which participants must withhold or inhibit a prepotent response. Differences in SSRT across individuals relate to activation of a number of neural systems involved in the “stopping network”, including right inferior frontal gyrus, posterior parietal cortex, and pre supplementary motor areas . Individuals with shorter SSRTs, reflective of stronger/faster inhibition, typically show greater activation of these neural systems on inhibition trials .
In humans, stress exposure increases cocaine craving and induces relapse of cocaine use , and in animal models, stressors facilitate cocaine self administration, enhance conditioned place preference , and reinstate cocaine seeking . Although the adaptive responses to stress are generally protective, repeated and uncontrollable stress exposure can increase the risk of mood disorders . Dynorphins are a family of endogenous neuropeptides derived from a common precursor and sharing structural features conferring selectivity for the kappa opioid receptor  .
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are ligand gated cation channels composed as homopentameric or heteropentameric combinations of α and β subunits . The most abundant heteromeric nAChR in the brain contain α4 subunits, bind nicotine with high affinity, and have been implicated in conditions including Parkinson’s disease, Alzheimer's disease, epilepsy, and drug dependence  . Each nAChR subunit shares a conserved topology, having an extensive extracellular N terminal domain, four transmembrane domains , short intracellular cytoplasmic loops between M1 and M2 and between M3 and M4, a short extracellular loop between M2 and M3, a large second cytoplasmic loop  between M3 and M4, and a short C terminal extracellular tail .
Growth factors and other mitogens often provide the molecular cues that induce many cellular events, including differentiation, proliferation, and migration . Thus, synthetic immobilization of biomolecules has become a common technique to prolong bioactivity and control biomolecule presentation and concentration . Epidermal growth factor  participates in the growth and repair of many types of tissues throughout the body.
Molecular and morphological alterations related to carcinogenesis have been found in terminal duct lobular units , the microscopic structures from which most breast cancer precursors and cancers develop, and therefore, analysis of these structures may reveal early changes in breast carcinogenesis and etiologic heterogeneity. Accordingly, we evaluated relationships of breast cancer risk factors and tumor pathology to estrogen receptor  and progesterone receptor  expression in TDLUs surrounding breast cancers . We analyzed 270 breast cancer cases included in a population based breast cancer case control study conducted in Poland.
Imatinib  is a small molecule that targets the BCR ABL tyrosine kinase and is effective in the treatment of BCR ABL positive chronic myeloid leukemia . While imatinib has been remarkably successful in reducing the tumor burden and suppressing the progression of patients in the chronic phase of CML, it has been less successful in the treatment of the accelerated phase of the disease. Whether the increase in BCR ABL simply requires a higher level of imatinib to suppress or induces more qualitative changes in intracellular signaling pathways leading to imatinib resistance has not been examined .
Photodynamic therapy  is a rapidly developing approach for cancer treatment that utilizes the combination of a nontoxic dye, termed a photosensitizer , and harmless visible or near infrared  light to kill cancer cells and destroy tumors by generating reactive oxygen species , such as singlet oxygen, superoxide and hydroxyl radical. PDT has the advantage of dual selectivity such that the PS can be targeted to its destination cells or tissues and the illumination can be spatially directed to the lesion. Alternation of this photophysical property is possible upon molecular functionalization to various fullerenyl derivatives.
Heterotrimeric αβγ guanine nucleotide binding proteins  are molecular switches that relay signals from activated G protein coupled receptors  to  cellular effector systems such as ion channels or enzymes that, in turn, control production, release, or degradation of second messengers . These G proteins function by adopting two principal conformational states: an “off state” in which guanosine diphosphate  bound Gα is in complex with the Gβγ heterodimer, and an “on state” in which guanosine triphosphate  bound Gα is liberated from its Gβγ binding partner. Ligand activated GPCRs act as guanine nucleotide exchange factors  for G proteins that stimulate exchange of GDP for GTP on the Gα subunit .
Endometriosis is a chronic estrogen dependent disease characterized by the growth of ectopic endometrial tissue . The shed tissue then implants and grows ectopically. In accordance with Sampson's hypothesis, endometriosis spontaneously develops only in menstruating animals such as humans and some primate species.
Herbal medicines and products are used globally for treatment of diverse pathological conditions. In developing countries, people consult traditional health practitioners  who live within the communities, have been trusted over years, share identical cultural and spiritual beliefs and are ever willing to assist patients with their knowledge and skills sometimes at a reduced cost . They are usually sold as nutritional supplements with benefits in the various disease conditions or maintenance of health without specific medicinal claims  .
Despite progress in the prevention of mother to child HIV transmission, nearly 260,000 infections occurred among children in 2012. Pediatric HIV infection remains a public health problem, but early treatment improves survival and preserves immune health. Cure of HIV infection remains elusive due to the early establishment of viral latency in long lived resting memory CD4+ T cells that evade immune surveillance mechanisms and antiretroviral drugs.
There has been considerable interest in the neurobehavioral changes, both in terms of cognitive and mood related, that occur in retired National Football League  players, but despite increased media attention, little has been done to systematically examine later life functioning in retired professional athletes. There is wide variation in the persistence of these defects, with the majority of individuals showing good recovery within days, weeks or months following injury and a small minority showing persistent deficits. Among aging, retired NFL players, 11% have reported having depression with a correlation between history of recurrent concussions and a lifetime history of depression.
Streptococcus pneumoniae  is a major cause of bacterial meningitis in the developing world , including recently described epidemic disease in Sub Saharan Africa . Safe and effective vaccines to prevent pneumococcal meningitis now exist  and many developing countries will introduce vaccine in the near future. As part of vaccine introduction, countries will monitor impact of vaccine against various outcomes, including meningitis.
Cigarette smoking is a well documented risk factor for cardiovascular diseases, including atherosclerosis, coronary artery disease, acute myocardial infarction, hypertension and sudden cardiac death. Multiple prospective studies have consistently shown that cigarette smoking is associated with increased risk of hypertension. It has been well proved that nicotine is the main reason of smoking dependence, and approximately 80% of the inhaled nicotine from smoking is metabolized to cotinine by C oxidation in liver, then the cotinine is further metabolized into trans 3 hydroxycotinine that is finally excreted in urine as the major nicotine metabolite.
Dopamine receptor genes are key players in regulating neurotransmission in response to dopamine and, therefore, are of central interest in a range of neuropsychiatric diseases, including schizophrenia, substance addiction, and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder . There are five dopamine receptors belonging to two families, characterized by whether they activate  or inhibit  adenylate cyclase in response to ligand binding . These dopamine receptors have been the subject of numerous studies focusing on the role of dopaminergic genes in a variety of diseases .
The pronounced occurrence of “feminization” and other endocrine abnormalities at sites downstream from municipal wastewater treatment plants  was first noted in 1994 . This had led to interest in various oxidative treatments , with some particular emphasis on the promise of enzyme mediated pollution abatement. For the particular case of environmental estrogens, “peroxidase” enzymes  possess both demonstrated detoxification abilities and real potential for effective protein engineering  .
Leptin is an adipocyte derived hormone that plays a critical role in the regulation of energy homeostasis. Among these distributed brain sites, there is increasing evidence for functional leptin receptors  in the nucleus tractus solitarii , albeit in lower levels than in the arcuate nucleus. Ob Rb mRNA is expressed in the NTS of mice and rats .
The conclusion of general parasite host models that parasites may regulate the abundance of hosts in some circumstances  continues to motivate empirical research . Only a few studies, however, have provided empirical support for this hypothesis for wildlife species, and the majority have focused on epidemic pathogens causing high levels of mortality. This is in spite of the fact that most pathogens are endemic, persist in host populations and show relatively small fluctuations in prevalence .
Solid tumors present formidable challenge in the multi disciplinary management of cancer patients. Among solid tumors, breast and lung cancer account for an estimated 399,470 new cases in the United States in 2008, and despite multi modality therapy, remain the leaders in cancer related mortality . Since tumor resistance limits effectiveness of current treatments, such as radiotherapy, the identification of novel therapeutic strategies is critical for improving outcome.
Receptor stimulated activation of the small guanosine triphosphatase  Ras is central to many signal transduction pathways that control developmental, physiologic, and pathologic processes in the immune system and throughout biology. Phosphorylated LAT  can associate with critical proteins to form two complexes that regulate Ras activation. On LAT, activated PLC γ1 cleaves phosphatidylinositol 4, 5 bisphosphate  to generate inositol 1,4,5 trisphosphate , which triggers the release of intracellular stores of Ca2+, and diacylglycerol .
Frontotemporal lobar degeneration  is a common cause of dementia, particularly in younger individuals with disease onset at ages less than 65. FTLD represents at least three clinical syndromes which are distinct from Alzheimer's Disease . The clinical and pathological heterogeneity of FTLD creates particular challenges for determining optimal pharmacological management.
The intestinal mucosa experiences diverse forces in normal and diseased states. These forces all alter intra luminal pressure and strain, which along with other physiologic forces may support the normal gut mucosal cytoarchitecture. The intestinal mucosa is constantly subjected to injuries that it must heal to maintain normal function.
Epidemiologic studies have linked obesity with the risk of developing certain cancers, including colorectal, postmenopausal breast, kidney, esophageal , pancreatic, liver, gallbladder, and endometrial cancers. Many of these cancers arise as a result of physiologically altered endocrine and/or metabolic functioning in obese people. Large, prospective, population based studies have demonstrated that in addition to increasing the risk of developing cancer, obesity remains an independent risk factor for death from malignancy in both obesity associated and non obesity associated tumors .
The standard somnological armamentarium lacks affordable tools for objective assessment of sleep architecture on a large scale or repeatedly over time . Multichannel polysomnography  is encumbering and costly for such applications; simpler devices for assessment of sleep disordered breathing  provide only autonomic indices of sleep quality that have not been validated in non SDB populations; actigraphs estimate duration and timing of sleep but render no information about its macro  or microstructure; finally, diaries and questionnaires are subjective. Recent years have seen the emergence of self applicable recorders worn on the forehead that assess sleep architecture from the mixture of electroencephalograms , electrooculograms  and electromyograms  recorded in a single differential derivation .
Granulocyte transfusions have long been recognized as a potential therapeutic option for treating infections in individuals with neutropenia . Nonetheless, the use of granulocyte transfusions has remained infrequent and only about 1000 granulocyte units are transfused per year in the US .
