Mutations in the CRF  and CRF1 receptor  genes have been associated with traits predictive for panic disorder and panic disorder diagnoses, respectively.
Electrophysiological abnormalities in specific oscillatory frequencies  and in event related potentials  such as mismatch negativity   are consistently reported in schizophrenia. Our understanding on the causes of these diverse electrical anomalies is limited. NMDA receptor function is sensitively indexed by MMN in animals and humans .
Accumulating evidence from both animal studies and pilot clinical trials has demonstrated that pro angiogenic endothelial progenitor cells  have therapeutic effects including stimulation of neovascularization and regeneration of injured endothelium . Aging is one of the major risk factors for the onset and development of cardiovascular diseases . However, the mechanisms underlying effects of aging on functions of EPCs are poorly understood .
When viruses infect cells, intrinsic defensive actions are initiated almost immediately. The innate immune system is activated when microbial products, such as lipopolysaccharide or viral nucleic acids, are detected. RIG I and MDA 5 proteins comprise an amino terminal caspase recruitment domain  and an RNA helicase domain .
Involuntary smoking  entails exposure to human carcinogens, which are present in tobacco smoke. The composition of involuntary smoking includes both mainstream smoke and sidestream smoke. Mainstream smoke is inhaled and exhaled by smokers; sidestream smoke is released between puffs into the air from the burning cone.
Ascorbic acid  is essential for human health, and in order to survive humans must obtain this nutrient from their diet, primarily from fresh fruits and vegetables . AsA is also critical to plant health, as evidenced by the fact that no plant mutant completely devoid of AsA has ever been described. Despite the importance of AsA, however, the factors regulating its metabolism in plants are not well understood.
The magnocellular neuroendocrine system, with cell somas and dendrites in the supraoptic  and paraventricular  nuclei, has an essential role in osmoregulation . Resulting renal water re absorption and natriuresis restore plasma tonicity, while vasopressin and oxytocin release from the dendrites influence innervating afferent fibers in the SON , the firing rates of magnocellular neurons  and plasticity of local neuro glia interactions  . IL 1β expressed in oxytocinergic and vasopressinergic neurons  may enhance magnocellular responses to osmotic stimulation.
The pharmacologically important membrane bound flavoenzyme monoamine oxidase A 1 functions in the oxidative degradation of the neurotransmitters dopamine, norepinephrine and serotonin . Human MAO A is found to be ~90% identical in sequence with rat MAO A with each enzyme containing an FAD cofactor covalently attached to conserved cysteinyl residues via an 8 α S thioether linkage. These similarities constitute the premise for using rat MAO A as a model for the human enzyme in drug development studies.
Central to adaptive immunity is the linked recognition of antigen by T cells and antigen presenting cells  through direct cell to cell contact. While TPEM provides a paradigm for how human adaptive immune responses might proceed, it cannot be used to directly study immunity in humans . Conventional histology can be used to describe tissue morphology, and immunohistochemistry can be used to assess the relative frequencies of individual cell types.
Poliovirus, the prototypic picornavirus, is a small positive sense RNA virus with a genome of approximately 7500 nucleotides. The RNA secondary structures act as binding sites for both host and viral proteins to mediate viral gene expression and RNA replication. One important example of the multiple RNA protein interactions that are required during a poliovirus infection is the interaction of a cellular protein, poly binding protein 2 , with stem loop IV of the 5′ noncoding region  to mediate cap independent translation initiation.
Intensive research has been recently directed towards designing new materials for biomedical applications. Hydrogels have been of potential use in this respect since they serve as scaffolds with properties similar to the extracellular matrices of many biological tissues. Much of the modeling has focused on articular cartilage, which is a highly hydrated soft tissue between bones and contributes to lubrication and load bearing.
K Cl cotransport is the coupled electroneutral movement of K and Cl ions carried out by four protein isoforms, KCC1 4. These transporters play an important role in epithelial ion transport and osmotic homeostasis . The neuron specific KCC2 is critical for the maturation of inhibitory GABA responses in the central nervous system by the control of intracellular Cl− concentration .
Iodide , the negatively charged  form of the iodine atom, is essential for the synthesis of thyroid hormones . It is transported from the bloodstream into thyroid follicular cells by the sodium/iodide symporter   and is eventually incorporated into thyroglobulin . Iodide transport is induced by thyrotropin   and suppressed by numerous factors, including an excess of iodide and follicular Tg .
Alpha actinins belong to a family of actin crosslinking proteins of which there are four major isoforms in mammals . Of these, alpha actinins 2  and  3  are expressed almost exclusively in muscle, while alpha actinins 1  and  4  display ubiquitous expression profiles  . ACTN1 and ACTN4 are closely related at both the nucleotide and amino acid levels and each localizes to the lamellipodial extensions of motile cells .
The generation of distinct cellular lineages from multipotent progenitor cells involves differentiation programs that couple up regulation of lineage specific genes with silencing of genes expressed in progenitor cells and alternative lineages. The initiation, maintenance, and silencing of gene expression during lineage commitment are regulated by genetic and epigenetic mechanisms. Depending on the affinity of such interactions, thymocytes die by “neglect”, are rescued from programmed cell death and further differentiate , or are actively deleted .
Lipoprotein oxidation plays an in important role in initiation and progression of atherosclerosis, a vascular inflammatory disease, which leads to complications that cause myocardial infarction and stroke . LDL oxidation is a gradual process, progressing from lipid hydroperoxides to degradation products, such as aldehydes and ketones, which can form covalent adducts with proteins and lipids. Thus, we have demonstrated that hydroperoxide rich minimally oxidized LDL  activates macrophages via toll like receptor 4  .
There is a growing interest in using fMRI to study distributed networks of interacting regions across the whole brain . However, the BOLD signal results from a coupling between neuronal activity and vascular responses . The dynamics, location, and magnitude of the BOLD signal are heavily influenced by the vasculature in each voxel; large vessel effects can cause delays of up to 4 sec relative to capillary effects .
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer related deaths, but currently available non invasive screening programs have achieved only a modest decrease in mortality. MicroRNAs  play important role in a wide array of biological processes and are commonly dysregulated in neoplasia. We aimed to evaluate the feasibility of fecal miRNAs as biomarkers for colorectal neoplasia screening .
Emerging research indicates that chemokines and their receptors are part of a signaling system within the CNS that is utilized for communication between cells of the CNS as well as between immune cells and cells of the CNS . Although a number of chemokines are expressed in the CNS, there is growing interest in the role of CXCL10, primarily driven by the higher expression of this chemokine in certain neuroinflammatory conditions and correlations between a high level of expression of CXCL10 and altered CNS function. For example, CXCL10 levels in the CSF are elevated in HIV infection, with higher levels in HIV infected individuals with neurologic disorders than in HIV infected individuals without neurological deficits .
The hypothalamic suprachiasmatic nucleus  receives direct synaptic input from the retina , and serves as the master circadian oscillator in the brain that keeps 24 hr time, and drives and orchestrates circadian rhythms throughout both the CNS and peripheral organ systems. A large number of neuroactive transmitters are found in the SCN , and many of these influence clock function. Within this context, cannabinoid receptor 1  axonal immunoreactivity has been reported in the medial hypothalamus, including the SCN .
A link between the Epstein Barr virus  and MS is supported by the increased risk of MS, in individuals with history of mononucleosis ,  or with elevated serum titers of antibodies against EBV nuclear antigens   , and by the higher prevalence of EBV infection in MS cases than controls. There are no longitudinal studies, however, estimating MS risk in EBV negative individuals or the temporal relation between EBV infection and MS. We therefore addressed these questions prospectively in a large population of healthy young adults  Active duty US Army, Navy, and Marines personnel who have at least one serum sample in the Department of Defense Serum Repository , which stores approximately 46 million serum samples originally collected from over 8 million individuals for HIV testing. , For each case, we obtained up to three pre clinical samples .
Colorectal cancer  is one of the most common fatal malignancies worldwide . CRC develops in about 5 percent of the adult population in the United States, and almost half of the affected individuals will die from this disease . While chronic inflammation may contribute to oncogenic mutagenesis through production of reactive oxygen and nitrogen species , experimental evidence suggests that it mainly acts as a tumor promoter rather than an initiator  .
Altered tissue stiffness through loss of tensional homeostasis is a hallmark of cancer. Malignant tumors have been typically associated with increased tissue rigidity relative to the normal host tissue, which may influence therapeutic response and promote metastasis  and invasiveness. Physical palpation exploits the differences in compliance between tumor and host tissue, and has provided an invaluable, yet limited, diagnostic tool for the detection of malignancies since before the origin of modern medicine .
The human regenerating  gene family encodes five small secreted and structurally unique proteins that share strong structural similarities to the proteins of the calcium dependent lectin  super family. Identified members of the human Reg gene family include Reg Iα, Reg Iβ, Reg IIIα, Reg IIIβ and Reg IV. These genes are constitutively expressed in normal gastrointestinal  mucosa.
The emergence of next generation sequencing technology, along with the development of the exome chip, has led many investigators to study the role of rare genetic variation in complex human traits. Rather than analyze rare variants individually, many statistical approaches for rare variant association mapping employ grouping strategies that aggregate rare variants in a gene or region for analysis to improve power. Family designs also can solve genetic problems that are hard to answer in population based studies.
The development of antigen specific effector T cells during the induction of immune responses must be tightly regulated to prevent excessive damage of tissues and organs. Recent studies have identified elimination of antigen presenting cells , including dendritic cells  and B cells, as an important mechanism restricting T cell mediated immune responses . Several have reported that APC elimination is mediated through apoptosis induced by CD4+ T cells reactive to antigen/class II MHC complexes presented by the DC .
Autophagy is an adaptive and essential cellular process that eliminates damaged or harmful cellular components . When optimally regulated, autophagy has been shown to be cardioprotective. Several physiologic pathways affect autophagy signaling and induction.
The term retrotrapezoid nucleus  was originally coined by  to describe a rostral extension of the ventrolateral medullary reticular formation containing neurons that innervate the solitary tract nucleus and more caudal regions of the ventrolateral medulla. The RTN lies below the facial motor nucleus and above a portion of the ventral medullary surface believed since the 1960s to contribute to respiratory chemoreception . For instance, the RTN contains neurons that are activated by CO2 in vivo  and the same region contains neurons that are activated by acidification in slices, including under conditions of reduced synaptic activity or action potential blockade .
One of the numerous deficits resulting from SCI is hyperreflexia and spasticity below the level of the lesion. The H reflex or Hoffman reflex has been used to quantify hyperreflexia , and several investigators have utilized frequency dependent depression of the H reflex to examine changes in spinal cord circuitry after SCI  Previously, we reported the time course that the animal with a complete transection  transitions to a state of hyperreflexia . The literature is limited when examining exercise paradigms that compare exercise during the acute vs chronic phases .
There is rapidly accumulating evidence in the field of complementary health practices that greater mindfulness can not only reduce stress and stress related medical symptoms, but can also enhance positive emotions and quality of life. Moreover, studies are beginning to show a relationship between  how much people practice meditation,  how much more mindful they become, and  the positive effects they experience in terms of mental and physical health. This brief, selective review presents some of the most recent scientific findings that demonstrate how practicing mindfulness meditation can impact the mind, the brain, the body, and behavior in ways that may promote whole person health .
Reverse engineering of cellular networks in prokaryotes and lower eukaryotes, as well as in mammals, has started to unravel the remarkable complexity of transcriptional programs. These programs, however, may change substantially as a function of the availability of proteins affecting their post translational modification, such as phosphorylation, acetylation and ubiquitination enzymes, as well as of those participating in transcription complexes , thus making cellular networks highly context dependent . Although the large scale reprogramming of the cell’s transcriptional logic was studied in yeast, , identification of a repertoire of genes that effect these events remains elusive.
Visual hallucinations  are a common and problematic behavior in dementia. , In the short term, VHs pose treatment challenges for clinicians because of the risks of prescribing neuroleptics to dementia patients, but more globally, these symptoms are also associated with rapid cognitive decline, early institutionalization, and high mortality. , Several clinico pathological studies have addressed the neuropathologic  features underlying VHs in dementia.
Glutamate receptors, including NMDARs, have profound effects on neuronal development. In both animal models and human subjects, NMDA receptor inhibition causes psychosis and cognitive impairments resembling symptoms of schizophrenia . NMDARs are composed of a common NR1 subunit assembled with NR2 or NR3 subunits to form a functional ion channel.
Rotavirus  is the principal etiological agent of severe gastroenteritis  in young children worldwide . Despite their preferential replication in the intestine, RV induces both an intestinal and systemic immune response, the latter most probably related to the antigenemia and viremia present in acutely infected children and animals . The RV serum IgA titer, measured shortly after natural infection or oral vaccination, is a relatively good correlate of protection .
Myriad changes in brain structure and function accompany aging even in health. Fewer studies have measured iron deposition in normal aging  or have examined functional correlates of regional iron deposition  . Care was taken to exclude cases with cerebrovascular and neuropsychiatric disorders to reduce the likelihood that measured iron was not reflective of hemoglobin iron, that is, from blood, suggestive of hemorrhagic stroke.
Within the central nervous system vasopressin  acts as a neuromodulator that can influence social behaviors, such as aggression, across species . Two Avp receptors mediate the central actions of Avp: the Avp 1a receptor  and the Avp 1b receptor . In hamsters, there is ample evidence that the Avpr1a is important for aggression .
Inter ethnic differences in focal segmental glomerulosclerosis  and steroid resistant nephrotic syndrome  have been found in pediatric patients in the USA . In one study, African American  children were shown to suffer from FSGS or SRNS with a higher prevalence and with more severe outcome  than Caucasian children . The ethnicities in these studies were derived by patient self identification.
Heart disease is the leading cause of death in the United States and acute myocardial infarction is the primary culprit. Because the amount of tissue destroyed during infarction is a major determinant of prognosis , protecting the ischemic myocardium remains an urgent, yet unmet, need. For example, in most studies published to date, animals have not been randomized, investigators have not been blinded, exclusion criteria and sample sizes have not been established a priori, and details of protocols  have not been thoroughly standardized.
Dietary fat is an important modifiable risk factor for hypertension. Interventions that reduce total fat intake can effectively lower systolic and diastolic blood pressure . Recent research further suggest that subtypes of fat with different molecular structure may have different effects on BP.
Synchronization of neocortical neuronal activity, particularly at gamma  frequencies, is related to cognitive functions such as working memory maintenance, attentional selection, sensory motor integration, and memory retrieval ), while disruption of oscillatory synchronization is associated with attention and cognition disorders, including schizophrenia, epilepsy, and ADHD ). However, the physiological and functional consequences of gamma activity for individual neurons remain unclear . The generation and transmission of these oscillations depends critically upon activity in networks of fast spiking inhibitory neurons ; reviewed in , which synapse on the perisomatic compartments of their targets .
RAG1 and RAG2 comprise the site specific endonuclease that creates DNA double strand breaks in the initial steps of VJ recombination. , There are two types of RSS  that are distinguished by the length of spacer sequence between the heptamer and nonamer. Second, the resulting 3′ hydroxyl group is activated to carry out a nucleophilic attack on the complementary strand of DNA, forming a DNA hairpin.
Arteriogenesis, which refers to the lumenal growth of the arterioles into larger arteries, has been primarily investigated using models of arterial insufficiency for skeletal muscle, brain,, and heart. In these models, the contribution of bone marrow derived cells  has been intensely studied and is now coming into focus. Monocytes, in particular, appear necessary for arteriogenesis.
Challenges in biomaterial design for tissue engineering applications include achieving material properties that match the tissue to be replaced as well as inducing biological responses for enhanced cell attachment, proliferation and/or differentiation . In the absence of any incorporated biological cues, the biological activity of a tissue engineering scaffold is indirectly determined by the physicochemical nature of the material. In particular, its physical properties, such as hydrophobicity, surface charge, topography, and stiffness may directly influence adsorption of adhesion proteins and subsequent cellular interactions .
Inflammatory substances, such as capsaicin, have been used experimentally to measure clinical pain dimensions of hyperalgesia and allodynia, characteristics of central sensitization . Capsaicin induced cutaneous sensitivity has been observed in a number of painful conditions, including post herpetic neuralgia , complex regional pain syndrome , fibromyalgia , rheumatoid arthritis , vulvodynia , unilateral sciatica , and multiple chemical sensitivity . These disorders may represent a common dysfunction in central processing of pain stimuli .
Fruits and vegetables contain a wide variety of potential cancer inhibitory nutrients and other phytochemicals. Substantial evidence has indicated a biological link between dietary constituents and carcinogenesis . Colorectal adenomas as established precursors of colorectal cancers have drawn research interest.
Risk stratification in acute heart failure syndromes  is problematic. A recent set of recommendations describes emergency department  patients with AHFS who do not fulfill high risk criteria and may be good candidates for observation unit  management. The goal of this analysis was to report on the outcomes experienced by ED patients with AHFS who do not have any of these high risk criteria .
Cancer is the second leading cause of death in the United States. Tumors arise when control points regulating cell growth or death are compromised. Chemotherapeutic agents such as taxol interfere with cell division.
Charcot Marie Tooth disease , or hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy, is the most common human inherited neuromuscular disorder affecting specifically the peripheral nerves. There is no cure for any of these CMT phenotypes, posing substantial personal, social and economic burden. Notably, the known gene products do not represent a single functional category, but range from molecules regulating and establishing the myelin component of the peripheral nervous system  to ubiquitously expressed proteins.
Human monocytes and macrophages are essential cellular components of multiple physiological activities, including innate and adaptive immunity, tissue homeostasis and systemic metabolism. Macrophage functional phenotype is determined by patterns of gene expression, which are modulated by environmental cues . Key inducers of inflammatory responses include microbial products, TNF, and IFN γ, which activate inflammatory genes via NF κB, MAPK, and Jak STAT signaling pathways and IRF family transcription factors.
Motion artifact suppression is a major challenge in coronary magnetic resonance angiography . These approaches bear a number of limitations. In prospective ECG gating, the fixed trigger delay and acquisition window duration, determined visually from a cine pre scan, are not only reader dependent but can also become invalid should the heart rate of the subject changes significantly.
Synovial joints allow vertebrates to display a great range of motions by articulating bones with one another. They consist of multiple highly specialized tissues. In addition, the knee features shock absorbing menisci, cruciate ligaments, and space filler fat pads.
The importance of diagnostic testing in the management of infectious diseases was recently highlighted in the report of the Infectious Diseases Society of America’s  Diagnostics Task Force report: “Better Tests: Better Care: Improved Diagnostics for Infectious Diseases.” Similar sentiments are expressed in the report on Antibiotic Resistance Threats in the United States from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . A number of new diagnostic technologies for infectious diseases  are rapidly emerging: e.g., broad range PCR, next generation sequencing and matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight  mass spectrometry. The reports from the IDSA and the CDC highlight deficiencies in current diagnostic methods, and call for approval and access to methods that are rapid, available at the point of care, use direct from specimen analysis and demonstrate high levels of sensitivity and specificity across a wide range of disease syndromes.
Resting heart rate  measured at hospital admission predicts mortality after acute myocardial infarction  However, during this initial phase, sinus tachycardia can accompany chest pain and/or stress and subside when adrenergic triggers are relieved. Thus, HR measured upon admission is quite dependent on the sympathetic activity and this risk indicator has not gained widespread clinical acceptance, possibly because of the circumstances under which it is measured. A similar risk of death is associated with elevated HR during hospital stay, but there is no study that ascertained HR after hospital dismissal during the first year of MI follow up.
Although the incidence of gastric cancer declined in the West from the 1940s to the 1980s, it remains a major public health problem throughout the world and the cause of 12% of all cancer related deaths each year . The aggressive nature of human gastric cancer is a result of a variety of intracellular events, including activation of various oncogenes, inactivation of tumor suppressor genes, and abnormal expression of growth factors and their receptors . However, the molecular mechanisms responsible for abnormal expression of many of these angiogenic factors in gastric cancer, including VEGF, remain unclear.
Human vision is functional over a wide range of light intensities by virtue of two light detection systems. All cones absorb photons over a wide range of wavelengths, but in human retina each type contains an opsin which makes it optimally sensitive to long , medium  or short  wavelength light so that the interaction of signals generated by these cones determines perceived color . In low level illumination, rod mediated vision comes into play.
Perceived discrimination—defined as “a behavioral manifestation of a negative attitude, judgment, or unfair treatment toward members of a group” —is a widely used concept in psychological research and has been studied in many different types of consequences. A general consensus on perceived discrimination in previous research is that it can be a chronic stressor regardless of the sources of discrimination , suggesting potential pathways linking to negative physical and mental health outcomes. One of the most widely used measures for perceived discrimination is the Everyday Discrimination Scale .
The prevalence of adult and childhood non alcoholic fatty liver disease  has increased markedly in conjunction with increasing prevalence of obesity. Lipogenesis is mediated by lipogenic transcription factor SREBP 1c  and its downstream lipogenic enzyme target, FAS . Fatty acid oxidation is facilitated by co activator, PGC 1α  and downstream transcription factor, HNF 4α .
Vaccines prepared from attenuated or heat inactivated viruses have been very successful in treating pathogens such as poliomyelitis , Variola major , and influenza . Activation of an innate immune response occurs by stimulation of pattern recognition receptors , such as toll like receptors  and the more recently identified NOD like receptors  . Imidazoquinolines  are synthetic FDA approved immunostimulants that have recently been successful in improving the efficacy of subunit vaccines .
Phospholipids are important constituents of cell membranes in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes. Many intracellular parasites can alter the membrane components of their hosts and exchange lipid moieties, allowing parasites to survive and multiply within the host cell. In Entamoeba and trichomonads, the major fatty acids in the cell resemble those found in serum and are, therefore, likely obtained from the growth medium  .
Parkinson’s disease , the most common neurodegenerative movement disorder in human, is caused due to the loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substancia nigra pars compacta  . Parkin and DJ 1 are known to stimulate and support the survival of existing dopaminergic neurons. Consistently, in PD, Parkin and DJ 1 have been suggested as rescuers of these vulnerable cells .
In bacteria, proteins are synthesized at the core of ribosome large subunit 50S at the peptidyl transferase center . After the first evidence from low resolution density maps from electron microscopy, and the monitoring of a nascent polypeptide emerging through an attached polypeptide conducting channel, the dynamics of the exit tunnel and the mechanism of nascent polypeptide secretion have been an important subject for the understanding of protein synthesis,  . However, any tertiary structure would seem not to fit due to simple geometrical restrictions, but the deformability of the tunnel is an important issue in this regard.
Williams syndrome  is a multisystem disorder caused by deletion of 26 contiguous genes on chromosome 7q11.23. Haploinsufficiency for the elastin gene in this region accounts for many of the signs and symptoms of the disorder, including the most significant cause of morbidity and mortality, supravalvar aortic stenosis . Elastin is a major component of elastic fibers that confer elasticity and recoil to several tissues.
The degree of major and minor histocompatibility antigen mismatch between donor and recipient in hematopoietic cell transplantation  is the most important risk factor for graft versus host disease . Immunocompetent donor T cells play an essential role in the pathogenesis of GVHD. GVHD can be prevented by graft T cell depletion but at the expense of a higher risk of graft rejection and relapse.
In eukaryotic cells, early steps in the secretory pathway involve the formation of vesicles that traffic the newly synthesized proteins from the ER to the Golgi apparatus . Several mechanisms of membrane remodeling rely on the interplay between proteins and membranes . A set of five cytosolic proteins  constitute the “coat protein II”  coat machinery that transports nascent proteins from the ER to the Golgi .
Simulation modeling and clinical trials offer different and complementary methods of exploring the relationship between a health care intervention and health outcomes. However, most clinical trials have a relatively short time horizon ; by extrapolating from the short term trial data, modeling can estimate the longer term consequences  of the intervention. Despite the importance of model calibration, there is no standard practice in the disease modeling literature for measuring the level of discrepancy between the model output and the calibration targets.
Repeated exposure to the same stress results in a process of adaptation; that is, a change in the response to the stressor which signals that the individual is making the necessary behavioural and physiological adjustments to cope with its demands . Altered gene expression in the brain in response to stress is now recognized as one indicator of this process. Repeated exposure modifies this pattern of gene expression: some areas  show slowly diminishing levels of response; in others, such as the hypothalamic paraventricular nucleus , adaptation in IEG expression is more rapid and complete; .
Substantial evidence implicates EGF like growth factor activity in the regulation of cell migration, proliferation, survival and differentiation of normal and malignant epithelial cells . All EGFR ligands are synthesized as membrane bound precursors that require MP mediated proteolytic cleavage to produce the soluble, mature forms ). Ligand binding results in conformational changes of the extracellular receptor domains  initiating signaling mechanisms that regulate multiple cellular responses such as migration, proliferation, differentiation and survival  .
Alzheimer’s disease  is characterized by: widespread neurodegeneration throughout the association cortex, basal forebrain, hippocampus, and limbic system ; abnormal accumulation of amyloid β ; excess phosphorylation, misfolding, and aggregation of tau protein ; and increased microglial activation  and reactive astrogliosis . It is possible that modulating upstream mechanisms promoting the formation of pathological tau will be particularly effective; however, the search for small molecules capable of regulating such mechanisms remains at nascent stages. The p75 neurotrophin receptor  is one of the few receptors directly connected to multiple nodes of signaling networks that undergo abnormal modulation in AD .
In recent years, the health information environment has become increasingly crowded and complex. Individuals can access a wide range of channels of information spanning a broad range of topics related to health . In addition, health advocates have begun to encourage patients to take greater responsibility for their health and to increase their participation in the decision making process .
Muscle invasive bladder cancer treatment requires a radical cystectomy or chemotherapy with radiation protocol . Radical cystectomy has many quality of life implications. Treatment options for metastatic bladder cancers are extremely limited, with a 5 year survival rate of ∼6% and a median survival time of 12 to 20 months .
Most cancer patients with advanced tumors undergo combination pharmacotherapy. A challenge in treating these patients is predicting which individuals will respond to a specific therapy. Recent studies have demonstrated the potential that tumor response to chemotherapeutics can be predicted using multivariate Gene Expression based Models .
Hedgehog  proteins, which include Sonic hedgehog , Indian hedgehog, and Desert hedgehog, act as morphogens in multiple tissues during embryonic development . The role of Shh in vasculogenesis has been documented in a variety of contexts. Hypervascularization of the neuroectoderm has been observed after transgenic overexpression of Shh in the dorsal neural tube of mouse embryos , Shh deficient zebrafish exhibit disorganized endothelial precursors and are unable to form the dorsal aorta or axial vein , and the developing lungs of Shh deficient mice lack proper vascularization  .
Biliverdin reductase A is an evolutionarily conserved enzyme  that catalyzes the reduction of biliverdin IXa, the product of the catalytic activity of the heme oxygenase  enzymes: HO 1 & HO 2, to the quencher of free radicals, bilirubin . The second form, BVR B is predominantly expressed in fetal tissue . The human protein is a 296 residue, soluble protein  that in the past was known to be localized only in the cytoplasm and recognized only for its reductase capacity.
Clostridium difficile is a gram positive, anaerobic, spore forming bacterium and a major cause of antibiotic associated diarrhea in many countries worldwide . C. difficile illness  has reached epidemic proportions in several countries since the year 2000, and emerging hypervirulent strains are causing increased morbidity and mortality among patients. One group of these hypervirulent strains has been characterized as ribotype 027, restriction enzyme analysis type BI, North American Pulsed Field Type 1 .
Abnormalities in brain white matter  have been detected and characterized using preferentially T2 weighted magnetic resonance imaging  sequences, which generally detect a prolongation of T2 relaxation as the proportion of unbound water in WM lesions  increases . Furthermore, T2 weighting has been combined with fluid attenuation inversion recovery  to better separate the signal of tissue from that of free water such as in the cerebrospinal fluid  . Previous studies have indicated that incidental hyperintensities of deep and subcortical WM in FLAIR images are associated with, for example, aging , multiple sclerosis , cardiovascular disease , diabetes , cognitive impairment , stroke , AIDS , schizophrenia , bipolar disorder , and brain injury .
Cancer is one of the leading causes of death among women worldwide. For cancers of the breast, cervix, and colon , regular screening can reduce mortality. Unfortunately, screening participation is variable,, even in health systems with adequate resources.
While various clinical and experimental immunosuppressive therapies promote the acceptance of transplanted organs, it is intuitive that graft acceptance is likely achieved by distinct immunologic mechanisms depending upon the therapy. A better understanding of immune parameters responsible for maintaining various forms of graft acceptance would facilitate the development of strategies aimed at achieving vigorous and non reversible transplant acceptance . For example, we have previously reported that inductive therapy with either anti CD4  or anti CD40L  mAb markedly prolongs cardiac allograft survival.
Repetitive behaviors constitute one of the three core domains of symptoms required for autism spectrum diagnoses. There is lower consensus about how early repetitive and stereotyped behaviors are present. The goal of the present study was to examine whether the manner in which infants explore objects at 12 months of age differs in children later diagnosed with autism or ASD .
Vibrio fischeri is a model for investigations of bioluminescence and mutualistic symbioses, two fields connected by the importance of oxygen. Luminescence emanating from bacteria colonizing the symbiotic light organ of the host indicates that O2 is present; however, evidence suggests that luciferase is O2 limited in this environment  despite its high affinity  for O2 . Moreover, anaerobic respiration is apparently induced in symbiotic V. fischeri , consistent with the idea that  is low in the light organ .
We recently discovered a novel phenomenon that drives an active contribution of vascular endothelial cells to peripheral pain mechanisms . Stimulus dependent hyperalgesia is distinct from the direct hyperalgesic effect of ET 1 and epinephrine mediated by their cognate receptors on the peripheral terminals of the nociceptor . The discovery of the role of vascular endothelial cells in stimulus dependent hyperalgesia was made possible by adaptation of a method from the cardiovascular and renal vascular literature using the intravenous administration of octoxynol 9 to attenuate endothelial cell function .
For health outcome domains such as fatigue, pain, physical functioning, and emotional functioning there exist numerous instruments purporting to measure the same or similar constructs. The use of different measures in different studies produces results that are difficult to compare and restrict generalizability across studies. Multiple short forms that target particular measurement settings, goals, and demands can be developed while producing scores on a common mathematical metric.
The pace of research and development in nanotechnology has generated a large number of unique materials with potential application in many fields, including medicine. Like other laboratories, we approach the assessment of potential unwanted bioactivity of NPs through the use of in vitro systems. This approach can assist in defining conditions of exposure as well as relevant signals of cellular response.
In the decades since chronic illnesses replaced infectious diseases as the leading causes of death, public health researchers have shifted their focus from the individual to the community in recognition that community level changes will foster and sustain behavior change. The prior emphasis on individual lifestyle change has been broadened to include social and environmental factors, often without increased resources . Recommendations from this panel included promoting community based participatory research, surveillance, training and capacity building .
The organization of ion channels within specific subcellular domains along myelinated axons is essential for proper nerve conduction. Specialized axo glial septate like junctions, formed between the glial paranodal loops and the underlying axolemma, mediate the segregation of ion channels within myelinated axons . Genetic ablation of the genes encoding these proteins in mice results in loss of axo glial junctions, ion channel disorganization, impaired nerve conduction, and ultimately axonal degeneration .
The Insulin Resistance Atherosclerosis Family Study  is a multi center, family based study with the goal of identifying genetic components underlying quantitative measures of adiposity and glucose homeostasis. An initial linkage scan and subsequent fine mapping revealed suggestive evidence of linkage of Body Mass Index , Visceral Adipose Tissue , and waist circumference  to a ~40cM interval  on chromosome 17q2417q25 in the Hispanic cohort . Though VAT was consistently the trait with the greatest evidence of linkage on chromosome 17q, VAT and WAIST showed greatly diminished LOD scores following adjustment for BMI , consistent with the linked locus/loci contributing to overall adiposity rather than VAT specifically.
Electrophilic fluorination under mild conditions allows the introduction of the positron emitting isotope fluorine 18 into molecules. However, this synthetic method is rarely used due to the nature of fluorine gas. Unlike other halogens, fluorine usually reacts with complex organic molecules in a non specific way, completely destroying the target precursor.
Memory is central to our cognitive lives, enabling us to discriminate novel people, places, and things from stimuli that are familiar due to previous experience. For example, neuropsychological data demonstrate that MTL lesions impair novelty detection , and numerous neuroimaging studies in humans indicate that functional activation in MTL structures is greater when encountering novel relative to repeated stimuli , with the magnitude of the MTL novelty response correlating with subsequent memory outcome  . For example, perirhinal cortex and parahippocampal cortex receive inputs from unimodal and polymodal association cortices in the lateral temporal, frontal, and parietal lobes via distinct pathways .
Cannabinoid receptors and their ligands constitute an endogenous signaling system that is found throughout the body, and is particularly prominent in the nervous system . It is this system that is activated by exogenous cannabinoids such as Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol . Significant strides have been made to advance our understanding of the cannabinoid signaling system since the identification of the two known cannabinoid receptors 1 and 2  CB1 and CB2 .
Voltage gated Ca2+ channels  shape electrical signals in excitable cells and generate a ubiquitous and essential chemical signal, Ca2+ ion. The voltage dependence of Gβγ inhibition thus stems mainly from the voltage dependent unbinding of Gβγ. The molecular and biophysical mechanisms underlying this dissociation remain largely unclear .
Myocardial infarction  leads to an irreversible loss of cardiomyocytes with expansion and remodeling of the extracellular matrix  and scar formation. Recent reports have proposed that a population of post mitotic cardiomyocytes, if exposed to the proper environment, may be capable of proliferation. The trigger that drives this small percentage of cells to proliferate has not yet been determined.
Melioidosis is a community acquired infection frequent in SouthEast Asia and Northern Australia . The symptoms of infection are diverse, often resembling tuberculosis or cancer. Consequently, the disease is likely to be often misdiagnosed .
Leukemia is the most common cancer type in children, with 5,000 new cases expected in the US in 2012 . The most common type of childhood leukemia is acute lymphoblastic leukemia , which accounts for 78% of cases in childhood, followed by acute myeloid leukemia  which makes up 16% of childhood leukemias . Established causes of childhood leukemia including genetic predisposition, ionizing radiation, and chemotherapeutic agents are estimated to explain < 10% of cases, leaving the majority of cases with an unresolved etiology  .
Evidence from a variety of sources suggests that the language processing system includes at least some components that discriminate between nouns and verbs at the cortical level. It may be that these various patterns are associated with functional impairments at different stages of word production, all of which lead to a behavioral dissociation in producing nouns and verbs . Careful neuropsychological studies offer some support for this postulate.
Complex atypical hyperplasia is a benign condition of the endometrium characterized by an increased gland/stroma ratio, abnormal glandular architecture, and nuclear atypia. This abnormality may progress to or co exist with endometrial cancer. In the United States, the incidence of endometrial cancer is 23 cases per 100,000 women per year, whereas the incidence of complex atypical hyperplasia is 17 cases per 100,000 women per year.
The relationship between oral contraceptive  use and breast cancer risk has been extensively studied, yet the composition and patterns of OC use have evolved considerably over time and more recent formulations have received relatively little scrutiny. Notably, there have been changes in OC formulations since they were introduced in the United States  in the 1960s, including decreased estrogen doses, the addition of new synthetic progestins, and the approval of extended cycle OCs . Given that OCs are the leading contraceptive method in the U.S. , ongoing evaluation of their benefits and harms is of critical public health importance .
In registration trials, triple therapy with telaprevir , pegylated interferon , and ribavirin  achieved sustained virological response  rates between 6475%, but the clinical effectiveness and economic burdens of this treatment in real world practice remain to be determined . Records of 147 patients who initiated TVR based triple therapy at the Mount Sinai Medical Center  were reviewed. Direct medical costs for pre treatment, on treatment, and post treatment care were calculated using data from Medicare reimbursement databases, RED Book, and Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project database.
The incidence of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is increasing dramatically in the United States and developed countries . It is estimated that 25%30% of adults in the United States have NAFLD  and that NAFLD accounts for 39% of newly diagnosed cases of chronic liver disease . More importantly, NAFLD is considered to be a major risk factor for the development of other chronic liver diseases, such as fibrosis, cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma .
Cellular components in biological tissue have different refractive indices that contribute to light scattering, which limits the photon density delivered to subsurface target chromophores . first reported optical tissue clearing by glycerol, HCAs have been frequently utilized as an effective method to reduce light scattering of tissue and, therefore, improve optical tissue clearing. HCAs have been shown to induce optical tissue clearing by skin dehydration and collagen dissociation or a combination thereof .
In 2002, findings of the ALLHAT Study , reinforced by the Seventh Report of the Joint National Committee on Prevention, Detection, Evaluation, and Treatment of High Blood Pressure  , provided a simplified, effective algorithm for initiating and advancing therapy in most newly recognized patients with hypertension. Monitoring and public reporting of blood pressure control for patients with hypertension in commercial and Medicare patients also helped to enhance health plan and physician awareness of blood pressure control. Between 1999 and 2004, blood pressure control improved in U.S. adults with hypertension.
Phenotypic differences between strains of mice are commonly ascribed as being related to differences in genetic background, or more specifically to differences between strains in the nucleotide sequence of genes . However, it has long been acknowledged that variations in environmental conditions also lead to alterations in strain specific behavior . The mechanisms through which these environmental experiences are able to alter gene expression during development and hence adult phenotype are increasingly being explored in rodent models.
Specific interactions between small molecules and protein receptors are of crucial physiological and pharmacological importance. Additionally, the pre determined receptor conformational ensemble may not capture receptor conformational changes upon binding to novel ligands. Such a limitation could be avoided if we model the flexibility of both ligand and receptor simultaneously .
The goal of treatment of malignancies is containment of tumor growth either by prompt killing of the targeted tumor cells or by elimination of their reproductive potential. Apoptosis is frequently the mode of cell death upon treatment with most antitumor modalities. Though cells in certain malignancies, particularly leukemias, are prone to undergo apoptosis, in many solid tumors the mechanism of treatment induced suppression of growth relies on irreversible impairment of cell reproductive capacity, which is often defined as “senescence like growth arrest”, “accelerated senescence”, “premature senescence” or “drug , or radiation  induced senescence”.
Infiltrating ductal carcinoma  is the most commonly diagnosed breast cancer in women , with African American women more likely to be diagnosed with larger and later stage tumors . However, the mechanism associated with hypermethylation related silencing of E cadherin is not elucidated . In other models, Kaiso regulated genes associated with EMT, including E cadherin , Wnt 11 , and matrilysin .
The molybdopterin  lies at the heart of more than fifty enzymes that catalyse important chemical transformations in all forms of life. These reactions play important roles in global cycling of C, S, N, As and Se to prodrug metabolism. The molybdopterin itself is a metal chelating ligand, that is known to bind molybdenum as well as tungsten in biology.
Hypoxia inducible factor 1  is a transcription factor that mediates adaptive responses to hypoxia. First identified in studies of erythropoietin gene expression , HIF 1 was subsequently shown to regulate oxygen homeostasis at both the cellular and systemic levels . HIF 1 is a heterodimer composed of HIF 1α and HIF 1β subunits .
Numerous pharmacological or behavioral interventions to manage symptoms experienced by cancer patients during treatment have been designed and tested. First, it is argued that symptoms are ephemeral lasting from hours to weeks. Symptoms reported when patients are screened for entry into a trial may be present but at less severe levels or not present at all when patients begin the trial and patients may no longer perceive a need to participate or may be experiencing different symptoms from those that are the focus of the intervention.
The novel interleukin IL23 was identified as recently as 2000. IL23 is a heterodimer cytokine composed of a p40 subunit  and the unique p19 subunit encoded by the IL23 gene. Recent genetic findings have confirmed previous immunological data that have implicated the IL23/IL17 pathway in inflammatory bowel disease  pathogenesis.
In the United States, the rate of obesity is steadily rising. Among women of child bearing age, approximately 64% are overweight and 35% are obese. Maternal obesity is a predictor of adverse health conditions in pregnancy; such as preeclampsia, gestational diabetes, inflammation and increased risk for maternal death.
Due to lack of good in vitro models, our understanding of development and stem cell biology of the human lung remains limited. Important aspects of human lung development, repair and regeneration have been studied through the use of mouse models . Clara cells  are found throughout the murine airways but are enriched only in the distal bronchioles of the human lung .
At the 20th Annual Meeting of the International Neuropsychological Society in February of 1992, Arthur Benton delivered the Herbert Birch Memorial Lecture, in which he reprised the highlights of developments in clinical neuropsychology from 1960 to 1990. The idea that we speak with the left hemisphere was firmly established. The work by Hécaen and Zangwill showed conclusively that right hemisphere damage led to defects in visuospatial and visuoconstructional abilities .
Recently, a Multidimensional Prognostic Index  for 1 year mortality derived from data collected in a standardized Comprehensive Geriatric Assessment  was developed and validated in two independent cohorts of older patients hospitalized for acute diseases or relapse of a chronic disease. The strong prognostic value for mortality suggests that the MPI captures a critical dimension of increased susceptibility to disease and impairment that characterizes many frail older persons. It has been suggested that some individuals are genetically predisposed to develop strong disease susceptibility earlier in life than others.
mRNA localization is a widespread mechanism used to achieve intracellular polarity in diverse cellular and developmental contexts. Over 1500 transcripts are localized to multiple distinct subcellular locations in the early Drosophila embryo alone, representing approximately 70% of all mRNAs expressed at this time . All four are maternal mRNAs that are synthesized by the ovarian nurse cells, then transported into the oocyte through connecting cytoplasmic channels.
Phytoplasmas are small, wall less mollicutes causing more than 700 diseases in hundreds of plant species. Within this group all confirmed natural BN vectors are planthoppers belonging to the family Cixiidae . C. arvensis and U. dioica are among other plant species known as hosts for nymphs and adults of H. obsoletus  from which they take up the phytoplasmas.
The ability to perform more than one task at a time is essential for older adults to maintain functional independence. Walking in home and local neighborhoods often involves simultaneous activities of upper limbs such as carrying bags. Deterioration of gait has been reported when walking while performing concurrent upper limb tasks such as buttoning  or carrying an object in older adults .
Pyramidal neurons are abundant in brain regions associated with complex cognitive functions, including the cortex, hippocampus, and the amygdala. In general, pyramidal neurons have a dendritic tree that is divided into two domains  the apical dendrite, which extends towards the pial surface, and basal dendrites, which emerge from the base of the cell body. The majority of synapses received by neocortical pyramidal neurons form on the basal dendrites.
Approximately 30,000 American men lose their lives due to prostate cancer every year . Evidence from in vitro studies supports a dynamic contribution of androgen receptor  cross talk with transforming growth factor β  signaling towards the emergence of androgen resistant prostate cancer . AR overexpression is an effective way of hormone refractory prostate tumors to overcome the growth inhibition effects of elevated serum TGF β levels, even in the absence of DHT  .
Autoimmunity represents a collection of over 80 heterogeneous disorders often controlled by complex genetic and environmental factors. The pathogenesis is thought to result from a breakdown in the mechanisms controlling central and/or peripheral tolerance, which ultimately culminates in autoimmune disease. Thus, the path to effective therapies likely requires an understanding of the mechanisms that underlie the breakdown of tolerance normally maintained by regulatory T  cells.
Racial and ethnic disparity in the survival of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma  has been well documented. In the year 2000, mortality rates for oral cancer for African American men were 85% higher than for white men. Three causes of the racial and ethnic disparity for HNSCCA have been suggested.
CD30, a member of the tumour necrosis factor receptor superfamily, has been the subject of much investigation because of its greatly elevated expression in several types of leukaemia and lymphoma cells, including anaplastic large cell lymphoma  and Hodgkin’s lymphoma  . Two major NF κB pathways have been described both of which are activated in response to CD30 stimulation . In addition, several members of the IAP family, including the cellular IAP proteins , contain a carboxy terminal RING domain that possesses E3 ubiquitin ligase activity .
Patients with end stage cirrhotic liver disease are known to exhibit unique abnormalities in cardiovascular physiology, known collectively as “cirrhotic cardiomyopathy”  . Presence of CC has been shown to peri operative outcomes in adults and children . Liver transplantation, alone has so far been shown to reverse some of the features of cardiac dysfunction , but the degree to which CC is reversible is unknown .
“I get by with a little help from my friends” goes the well known Beatles lyric, and indeed there is strong evidence that social support is protective of health  while social isolation is associated with adverse health outcomes . Though some evidence suggests that social relationships are directly positive for health and well being , other research finds that social relationships can also be associated with negative health risk behaviors . Evidence also suggests that social support may buffer the harmful effects of stress from serious or chronic health conditions  .
Supraspinal modulation of the excitability of spinal nociceptive networks plays a key role in the perception and reaction to pain . The rostral ventral medulla , of the brainstem comprises several nuclei which send descending projections to the spinal cord that modulate nociception . Little is known about the role of descending brainstem controls in young animals.
  This was a prospective cohort study, which enrolled a convenience sample of ED patients presenting with AF. Primary outcome was occurrence of ≥1 AF related adverse outcome  within 30 days. This validation study was performed at the same institution where the RED AF decision aid was derived.
Differences in the built environment—which refers to the physical features of geographic areas— may have particular relevance to disability. Although there is growing evidence supporting the association between the neighborhood built environment and late life disability , the link between the built environment and disability experiences among other segments of this diverse population are unknown. The purpose of this study is to explore the relationship between the built characteristics of communities and neighborhoods and participation among young and middle age adults with acquired, chronic, physical impairment .
The appropriate patterning, morphogenesis and integration of the gnathostome skull are achieved via an exquisitely positioned and timed cross talk between the embryonic cephalic epithelia and the subjacent mesenchyme. The lambdoidal junction , formed where the maxillary division of the first branchial arch  meets the medial  and lateral  frontonasal processes, exemplifies a morphologically and molecularly intricate epithelial mesenchymal craniofacial interface . Outside of enamel producing ameloblasts, cephalic epithelia don’t yield cranial skeletal structures: the importance of these epithelial cells to cranial skeletal morphology and evolution thus largely lies in their influences on the mesenchyme, much of it cranial neural crest  in origin.
Carboplatin  0,0' ] platinum) is one of the platinum agents with enhanced anti tumor activity and reduced side effects in comparison with cisplatin . guinea pigs , rabbits , monkeys , mice , and zebrafish . The ototoxic effects of carboplatin have been observed vary significantly across these species.
Leukocytes are immune cells involved in host defense. To reach sites of inflammation, leukocytes roll along the vascular endothelium  by a series of molecular bonds between the leukocyte and the endothelium that rapidly form and dissociate. Most leukocyte rolling is mediated by PSGL 1 binding to P selectin  expressed on the inflammation activated endothelium .
Sensitive biomolecule detection assays with streamlined workflows are crucial for measurement of low concentration clinical analytes and for precise characterization of biological systems. Since a single target binding event is reported by the enzymatic turnover of several substrate molecules, the strategy provides signal amplification. Recent studies have however been successful in further amplifying net signal and gaining up to three orders of magnitude increase in assay sensitivity by shrinking the reaction volume to concentrate the reaction products.
HIV 1 infection elicits host immune responses that include dysregulation of regulatory pathways for cytokine expression that are characterized by decreased production of pro inflammatory cytokines including IL 12 and IFN γ and increased expression of the anti inflammatory cytokine IL 10, the latter of which has been identified as a factor responsible for impaired innate and T helper type 1  responses in AIDS patients . Innate immunity provides the initial host protective response to infectious danger. Stimulation of TLRs on DC results in secretion of pro inflammatory cytokines and increases effector functions such as phagocytosis and the ability to present antigen to T cells.
Pancreatic cancer is a rapidly progressing disorder that is often diagnosed at an advanced, non resectable stage and it is highly resistant to chemotherapy. Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma is believed to result from the accumulation of several genetic mutations, including Kras, p16, p53, SMAD4, and BRCA2 , and may arise from precursor lesions called pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasias . Therefore there is clearly a need for pancreatic cancer chemoprevention and there appears to be an adequate window of opportunity to improve on the dismal survival of this disease through the development of effective chemoprevention strategies aimed at prevention of the primary tumor or the development of metastases  .
Estrogens have multiple effects on the brain and impact selective aspects of cognitive function in animal models and humans . For example, estradiol replacement typically affect tasks of verbal fluency, verbal memory and working memory in menopausal women . Thus, predominant activation of one or the other receptor may elicit different cognitive responses .
The gut mucosa is an important site of early SIV and HIV pathogenesis. The majority of CD4+ T cells in the gut express CCR5, the co receptor for HIV, and exhibit an activated, memory phenotype presumably due to constant exposure to dietary and bacterial antigens . The degree to which the CD4+ T cell population in the gut can be reconstituted with antiretroviral therapy is still unclear.
Chronic idiopathic patellofemoral  pain affects 1417% of the young active population  and is typically exacerbated by activities such as stair ascent/descent, prolonged sitting with flexed knees, jumping, and open chain extension exercises . The Q angle  is often used, in conjunction with several other common clinical measures , to identify contributing factors to PF pain/instability , guide rehabilitation, and plan surgical interventions . However, this measure has been subject to substantial controversy over its clinical utility , reliability , and relationship to PF kinematics .
In 2008, 63% of deaths were due to non communicable diseases  . Smoking and physical inactivity are the two primary risk factors for NCDs, with each contributing to about 5 million deaths annually . Reducing physical inactivity has and will continue to be a public health priority to reduce NCDs and the associated burden.
Psoriasis is a chronic, relapsing autoimmune disorder that affects 2 3% of the population and manifests as lesions of the skin with scaling and redness . Therapeutic approaches directed at blocking some of these inflammatory mediators have proven effective in reducing patients’ symptoms. Further, IL 22 plays a critical role in the maintenance of normal barrier homeostasis and psoriatic patients have elevated serum levels of IL 22, contributing to barrier disruption .
Amphipols  are polymeric surfactants that maintain membrane proteins  water soluble in the absence of detergent, while stabilizing them . Their physicalchemical properties make them as promising vehicles for the delivery of MPs, or, possibly, other therapeutic agents, such as hydrophobic membrane targeting peptides . Previous studies have shown that A835, a polyacrylate based APol , is not toxic when added to cell cultures at a concentration sufficient to deliver MPs to their plasma membrane , or when injected to mice at doses sufficient to formulate a vaccine .
Extracellular serotonin  in brain is regulated in part by the presynaptic serotonin reuptake transporter . They also demonstrate increased anxiety and depression like behaviors and reduced aggressiveness on various tests  . Reduced serotonergic function in 5 HTT+/− and 5 HTT−/− mice is thought to be comparable to reduced serotonergic function in humans who carry one or two short  compared with long  alleles of the promoter region polymorphism of 5 HTT , or who express rs25531 or rs25532 variants of the 5 HTT allele .
Metabolic syndrome , a clustering of obesity, insulin resistance, glucose intolerance, dyslipidemia, and elevated blood pressure, is occurring with epidemic frequency in westernized countries. The prevalence of MetS falls between 20%30% with higher values in African Americans, Hispanic Americans, and females. Studies have shown that as compared to healthy individuals, MetS patients have higher odds of developing cardiovascular disease  ranging from 1.26 to 3.86, depending on the study population and MetS definitions applied.
Desmosomes are cellcell adhesion structures  that are particularly abundant in tissues and organs that have to withstand significant mechanical stress, such as skin and heart. The functions of desmosomes are not restricted to maintaining tissue integrity. The basic building blocks of desmosomes belong to three protein families: the desmosomal cadherins , plakins  and armadillo proteins .
Ovarian cancer is the number one cause of death of the gynecological cancers. It is expected that there will be 21 650 incidences of ovarian cancer in the United States with 15 520 deaths. The epidermal growth factor receptor  has been found to be able to translocate to the nucleus upon stimulation with epidermal growth factor  .
Extensive research has provided important insights into the unique motivational state of the female mammal. In rats, as well as virtually every other mammalian species, the female expresses remarkable motivation to seek out and interact with unique natural stimuli, such as offspring, during her natural lifecycle . Both cocaine and cocaine seeking behavior can rapidly alter VTA activity  and transiently increase accumbal dopamine  via VTA dependent mechanisms .
In the last few years, several susceptibility genes for schizophrenia have been identified by positional cloning. Candidate gene studies have been proceeding simultaneously. However, possibly in part because they began at a time in which few genetic variants per gene were known, they have tended to test relatively few polymorphisms per gene.
Despite great increase in understanding of cancer at molecular level, cancer remains as the second most common cause of death in the U.S. Survival rates for many common cancer types have changed little over the past two decades . For this reason, improvements in ability to detect cancer early may significantly reduce mortality from cancer.
Hepatic fibrosis results from many chronic liver diseases, including hepatitis B and C, autoimmune hepatitis, alcoholic liver disease and non alcoholic steatohepatitis  . Hepatic stellate cells  are the principal liver cells that promote hepatic fibrosis, . Cirrhosis, the end stage of hepatic fibrosis, may result in hepatic dysfunction, portal hypertension and hepatocellular carcinoma ,.
Prostate cancer is one of the most common cancers in men in the United States, with 186,320 new cases estimated in 2008, and one of the leading causes of cancer death among males, with approximately 28,660 deaths estimated in 2008 . In the last few years, immunotherapy employing several different prostate cancer vaccines has shown promising evidence of clinical benefit in various patient populations . Tissue specific antigens, which are expressed in both normal prostate and prostate cancer cells, can be targeted for prostate cancer specific immunotherapy .
The acquisition time for whole brain magnetic resonance imaging  data is limited by the time required to traverse the k space. The quest for higher temporal resolution in fMRI has been motivated by its potential to detect and to suppress physiological fluctuations in order to increase the sensitivity of detecting brain activity . This can be achieved by using partial k space sampling , compressed sensing , or exploiting a priori information , such as key hole imaging  and singular value decomposition MRI .
Prognostic factors related to the clinical outcome following traumatic brain injury  include lesion type, level of consciousness and the extent of associated systemic injuries. Additionally, age has long been recognized as a critical prognostic factor when predicting outcome . Although elderly patients may gradually regain some of their lost abilities following TBI, the functional recovery is usually incomplete and unsatisfactory since the adult brain loses much of the capacity for plasticity and repair as it ages  .
Fibrotic disorders, including systemic sclerosis  and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis , are characterized by excessive deposition of extracellular matrix  components such as collagen and fibronectin . Activated fibroblasts are a primary source of ECM in fibrotic tissues . Cav 1 was recently implicated in fibrosis.
Individual differences in body weight regulation are partially determined by genetic factors . Nevertheless, a detailed account of the hereditary effects on adiposity has been elusive to date, in part because a large number of genes that may each play a minor role . Furthermore, genetic influences are likely to interact with environmental effects, such as diet and lifestyle.
The endoplasmic reticulum  is one of the largest cellular organelles, its membranes representing as much as half of the total membranes of the cell. An essential function of the ER is the proper assembly of proteins that are ultimately destined for intracellular organelles and the cell surface . Cellular perturbations such as loss of the luminal oxidizing environment, imbalance in calcium homeostasis and aberrant N linked glycosylation can disrupt ER homeostasis and lead to the accumulation of unfolded proteins and protein aggregates in the ER lumen.
The management of sarcomas of the head and neck remains a challenge in the field of head and neck oncology. As sarcomas comprise less than 1% of all head and neck malignancies , there are no prospective, randomized controlled trials to guide management. Sarcomas are malignancies that arise from transformed cells of mesenchymal origin.
The most common cause of premenopausal, chronic intercourse pain  is localized provoked vulvodynia . LPV exacts a severe psychosexual and interpersonal toll. The pathogenesis of LPV is unknown, resulting in a disarray of disease classification and a lack of mechanism specific therapy.
Autism spectrum disorders  are developmental disabilities resulting from dysfunction in the central nervous system and are characterized by impairments in three behavioral areas: communication , social interactions, and repetitive behaviors or restricted interests . ASD usually manifest before three years of age and the severity can vary greatly. Familial studies provide evidence that individuals closely related to an autistic individual  may have “autistic tendencies” but do not meet criterion for ASD, suggesting that a broad autism phenotype  may also exist  .
Heroin addiction is a chronic, relapsing brain disease that is characterized by drug dependence, tolerance and compulsive seeking and use despite harmful consequences. This complex disorder is a worldwide major public health problem. The relatively high heritability  of this disorder  indicates that genetic variants may play a role in vulnerability to its development.
Retinal degenerative diseases, such as age related macular degeneration and retinitis pigmentosa, lead to blindness due to the loss of photoreceptors . Recent clinical trials of epiretinal electronic implants  in patients blinded by retinitis pigmentosa demonstrated equivalent visual acuity up to 20/1260 in the most successful patient, leading to clinical approval in US and Europe. Therefore, direct RGC stimulation may allow precise mimicking of RGC bursts characteristic to normal vision , so long as the network response is avoided.
A variation in bone response to fluoride  exposure has been attributed to genetic factors. Increasing fluoride doses  for three inbred mouse strains with different susceptibilities to developing dental enamel fluorosis  had different effects on their cortical and trabecular bone mechanical properties. In this paper, the structural and material properties of the bone were evaluated to explain the previously observed changes in mechanical properties .
Systemic lupus erythematosus  is an autoimmune disease with varied clinical presentations. SLE accounts for up to 10% of patients with pediatric rheumatic diseases with an estimated prevalence of between 5,000 and 10,000 children in the United States . In adults, the prevalence of SLE is estimated at 20 to 150 cases per 100,000, with the prevalence in African American women 2.5  to 3 fold higher than in Caucasian women  .
Fetal alcohol spectrum disorder  caused by prenatal ethanol exposure is the most frequent preventable birth defect syndrome . FASD prevalence ranges from 0.3 to 5% within most populations, reaching as high as 8.9% in some low socioeconomic populations . Experiments using mice showed that in utero ethanol exposure induced specific defects in rod photoreceptor sensitivity and dark adaptation .
Injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve  or vagal nerve causing unilateral vocal fold paralysis  is most commonly due to surgery of the head and neck, skull base, or thoracic cavity. However, multiple technical modifications and implants of varying shapes and sizes have been proposed. Proper positioning in the paraglottic space is a known requirement and the limitations of thyroplasty implant in closing the posterior glottis have been discussed.
Mitogen activated protein kinase  kinase 4  is a component of stress activated MAPK signaling modules . It can activate by phosphorylation the c Jun N terminal protein kinase  and p38 families of MAPKs in response to various stimuli. However, our previous studies have provided genetic evidence that MKK4 is mostly required for JNK activation in vivo , although MKK4 was shown to contribute to p38 stimulation in cells where both MKK3 and MKK6 have been removed  .
The ability of proteins to bind preferentially to specific DNA sequences depends on a variety of readout mechanisms involving both the recognition of hydrogen bonding and hydrophobic groups on different bases  and shape readout . The latter category includes sequence dependent deformability , intrinsic bending  and both global and local conformational variability . We have recently identified an additional shape readout mechanism involving sequence dependent variations in minor groove width that is often associated with A tract sequences .
The goal of genetic studies is to unravel the genetic basis of a phenotype. Therefore, it is important to obtain reliable heritability estimates. For a continuous phenotype of interest, the observed trait value can be partitioned into variance components that reflect unobserved genetic and environmental factors .
Since the discovery of leptin as a major anorexic adipokine that acts on the hypothalamus to reduce food intake, most neuroscientists have focused on the neuronal functions of the leptin system. Unexpectedly, in both C57 male mice fed a high fat diet  and mice with a genetic predisposition to obesity resulting from the agouti viable yellow  mutation , there is robust upregulation of leptin receptor  immunoreactivity in glial fibrillary acidic protein   astrocytes in the hypothalamus. Adult onset obesity is associated with hyperleptinemia and partial saturation of leptin transport across the blood brain barrier  .
Dorsal root ganglia  contain diverse subpopulations of primary sensory neurons that transduce and encode a variety of stimuli that impact an array of unique tissue types. These distinct electrophysiological properties reflect the differential distribution of ion channels  . Large conductance voltage dependent and Ca2+ modulated K+  channels are key regulators of cellular excitability .
Binaural processing of acoustic signals is essential for localizing sound and extracting signals in a noisy environment. Low frequency sounds are localized by interaural differences in the arrival times of sound created by a spatial separation of the ears . In the avian auditory brainstem, a modified Jeffress model is represented by nucleus magnocellularis  and nucleus laminaris .
In the human brain, objects are represented in a large swath of ventral temporal and lateral occipital cortex that responds more strongly to object stimuli than to their scrambled counterparts . Initially, it was thought that this substantial part of visual cortex had no further functional organization other than containing a small number of modules that appear to preferentially process information regarding specific biologically relevant object categories such as faces , places , and bodies . This notion was later revised by Malach and colleagues who found evidence for a systematic representation of eccentricity in ventral visual cortex with medial regions such as parahippocampal cortex representing peripheral eccentricities and lateral regions such as lateral occipital cortex representing foveal eccentricities .
Antiretroviral therapy  greatly reduces morbidity and mortality for people with HIV/AIDS . However, to benefit fully, patients must maintain strict adherence . A growing literature also suggests that certain patient characteristics are related to antiretroviral non adherence.
Multiple myeloma  represents approximately 10% of all hematologic malignancies and the median overall survival  of those diagnosed in the last decade has approached 4 years . High dose melphalan at 200 mg/m2 remains an integral modality of myeloma treatment and tandem transplants continue to be offered to a fraction of patients  . Historically, approximately 20 30% of patients with newly diagnosed MM fail to respond to induction treatment regimens such as vincristine, adriamycin and dexamethasone  or thalidomide and dexamethasone , hence these patients were thought to have poorly responsive disease.
In response to different environmental and physiological stress conditionsthat increase the load of unfolded proteins in the ER, protein sensors located inthe luminal face of the ER membrane activate the unfolded protein response . Activation of this signaling pathwayleads to a reduction in the influx of proteins into the ER, activates proteindegradation pathways and increases the folding capacity of the ER . These mechanisms allow adaptive and repair mechanisms thatre establish homeostasis.
