In CNS neurons, NFs are assembled into long linear polymers containing four subunits, NFH, NFM, NFL and α internexin . Because of their unique sidearms and ability to align in parallel arrays, NFs are well suited to support the extreme polar shapes of neurons , and expand axons for optimal electrical impulse conduction  . The kinetic behaviors of NF and their incorporation into the axonal cytoskeleton have long been controversial.
Cardiac hypertrophy is typically characterized by enlargement of the heart and an increase in myocyte cell volume that occurs in response to diverse pathophysiologic stimuli such as hypertension, ischemic heart disease, valvular insufficiency, infectious agents, exercise, or mutations in sarcomeric genes. MAPK signaling is comprised of a series of successively acting kinases that function as central regulators of cell growth, differentiation, transformation, and death. , MAPK signaling pathways culminate in the activation of extracellular signal regulated protein kinases 1/2 , the c Jun NH2 terminal kinases , p38, and ERK5.
Senescence is associated with alterations in the structureand function of neural circuits underlying sensorimotor, cognitive, and emotional processes. Converging evidence indicates that prominent changes occur across the human life span in declarative memory as well as in emotional information processing. Senescence related deficits in declarative memory have been well characterized.
Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma  is the sixth most common type of cancer worldwide. The term HNSCC comprises epithelial tumors that arise in the oral cavity, pharynx, larynx and nasal cavity, with the main risk factors being alcohol and/or tobacco abuse . HNSCC results from the accumulation of numerous genetic and epigenetic alterations that occur in a multistep process.
For the approximately 25,000 patients in the US annually diagnosed with a glioma , the most common and lethal primary brain tumor, treatment options are limited and ineffective . Over 80% of glioma patients report seizures , and 35% continue to have spontaneous seizure recurrence, which is termed tumor associated  epilepsy . Prior work has shown that the excitatory amino acid neurotransmitter glutamate  accumulates in peritumoral tissue due to its avid release from tumors via the “system xc”  cystine glutamate anti porter .
Prescription drug abuse and overdose have reached epidemic status in the United States, and prescription drug monitoring programs  have been implemented in nearly every state to combat the epidemic. Such shopping  is associated with increased risk of drug related overdose and death, . PDMPs originated from law enforcement and have only recently received attention as health care tools with potential benefits for patient care.
Regulatory T cells  represent a subset of CD4+ T cells defined by expression of the forkhead transcription factor , which is encoded by the X linked gene Foxp3,. Deficiencies in Foxp3 function result in autoimmunity very early in life in both mice and humans due to a lack of proper immune regulation ,. The vital role of Tregs in immune homeostasis has led to the development of novel tools to further dissect the functions of Tregs.
Despite the use of adjuvant endocrine treatment prognosis remains poor for a significant population of patients with estrogen receptor positive  breast cancer . The cellular basis for the efficacy of endocrine therapy treatment is principally through inhibitory effects on the tumor cell cycle  because, unlike cytotoxic chemotherapy, it has never been clearly demonstrated that endocrine therapy promotes cell death through apoptosis . To address this hypothesis we focused on combining endocrine agents with inhibitors of phosphoinositide 3 kinase  because this pathway promotes cell survival in a number of tumor types  .
In mammals, circuits essential for respiratory rhythmogenesis are distributed bilaterally as columns in ventrolateral medulla. These networks remain spontaneously active in a variety of neonate rodent in vitro medullary preparations . EBs have been proposed to play a critical role in respiratory rhythm generation, elaborated using cellular  and network  models, which have obtained experimental support .
Allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  offers the possibility of a curative treatment for malignant and non malignant hematological diseases. However, SCT is frequently complicated by graft versus host disease , which remains a major cause of transplant related morbidity and mortality. The anti CD20 chimeric monoclonal antibody Rituximab  given prior to, or during conditioning for T cell replete SCT has been reported to decrease acute , and chronic , and may decrease transplant related mortality  .
Asthma is a chronic inflammatory disease characterized by inflammation of the airways, tissue remodeling, and a decline in respiratory function . Despite intense ongoing research, the incidence of the disease continues to rise, necessitating the need for new scientific inquiry . MicroRNAs  are single stranded non coding RNAs of 1925 nucleotides in length that mediate post transcriptional silencing of target genes .
It is well known that the Hispanic/Latino  population living in the United States  suffers from an unequal burden of certain diseases compared to non Hispanic Whites . Melanoma, the most aggressive of the three skin cancers listed, has been strongly linked to sunburns during childhood. Although the number of melanoma cases is lower among Blacks and Hispanics as compared to Whites, late stage presentations are more common among skin of color populations.
Falls are a leading cause of injury at both home and the work place. When the RCOF at heel contact exceeds the ACOF, the number of slips and falls during straight gait has been shown to increase and continue increasing as the discrepancy grows . While many RCOF values have been reported for straight walking, stair climbing, ramp ascent and descent, and for a variety of surfaces, few RCOF values have been reported for turning.
Reported incidence rates of therapy related myeloid neoplasms  after autologous blood or marrow transplantation , vary from 1% to 20% . The reported incidence rates of t MN after ASCT generally appear higher than those reported after multiple cycles of conventional dose therapy . Though t MN are usually associated with clonal marrow cytogenetic abnormalities  , it is not clear that isolated therapy related CMCA, those that occur in the setting of normal bone marrow pathology, are always associated with t MN.
In magnetic resonance imaging , the radiofrequency  field  inhomogeneity can produce flip angle variations, which can ultimately lead to signal intensity variations and quantitative measurement errors. Typically, B1 + variation within the human body at high magnetic field strengths  can vary on the order of 20 63% . The B1 + variation is in part due to the spatial variation of the field strength produced by the RF coil and in part due to the dielectric properties of the human body.
Neurofibrillary tangles  consist of fibrillar tau aggregates. Thus, tau is probably released from cells as a physiological process. CSF tau levels change under certain pathological conditions.
Pancreas cancer is a disease with high rates of metastatic disease at diagnosis, poor prognosis and high rates of recurrence even after attempts at cure with surgery. Gemcitabine with or without erlotinib has demonstrated a response rate of 89%, with an associated modest improvement in survival . A combination of 5 FU, leucovorin, irinotecan, and oxaliplatin  has demonstrated a significant improvement over gemcitabine in patients with a good performance status; while the response rates and overall survival improvements are significant, the regimen is associated with significant toxicity, particularly myelosuppression  .
Being incarcerated in the United States is the only circumstance where primary health care is constitutionally guaranteed . Correctional facilities provide many individuals with their first access to health care as adults and can shape their future health care practices. It is estimated that 80% of prisoners see a health care provider when incarcerated, and 30% to 50% are diagnosed with a new chronic condition .
Human adult vocal folds consist of five layers: epithelium, superficial, intermediate and deep layers of the lamina propria of the mucosa and the vocalis muscle. It has been well documented that human vocal fold fibroblasts , the main cellular component of the lamina propria, are responsible for the maintenance, development and repair of ECM of the lamina propria. Numerous investigations have described the age related anatomic, physiological and acoustic changes of the voice and the larynx,  histopathology  of the aging larynx , and more recent studies have delved into the gene expression, and protein level of aged fibroblasts.
The skull is divided into two compartments: the viscerocranium, which comprises the facial skeleton , and the neurocranium, which together encases the brain and cranial sense organs. Because the cranial base spans almost the entire rostro caudal length of the head, from the foramen magnum to the tip of the cartilaginous nasal septum, its proper development is crucial for subsequent normal development of the cranial vault and facial bones. In the adult mouse, the cranial base is composed of the ethmoid, presphenoid, basisphenoid, and basioccipital bones along with the auditory capsules of the temporal bones.
With the availability of next generation sequencing data, there has been increasing interest in studying associations between complex traits and low frequency variants  or rare variants ; see two recent reviews . Accordingly, there have been intensive efforts in developing new statistical tests for LFVs and RVs. conducted a comprehensive review and comparison of many existing association tests for LFVs and RVs with unrelated samples.
Several artifactual factors can impair the accuracy of DXA  measurements of the spine, including surgical hardware or cement, gastrointestinal barium or calcium tablets, and external objects like buttons, snaps, buckles and knives. One unavoidable external artifact is unremovable navel jewelry. This has not received much attention because it is an infrequent artifact in the elderly, who usually receive bone densitometry .
Protein modification involving small ubiquitin like modifier  has been shown to play an important role in regulation of diverse cellular functions . Sumoylation is a multi step process and requires several enzymes. Among them is the E2 conjugating enzyme Ubc9 which transfers the activated SUMO to protein substrates .
Organophosphate pesticides  are among the most widely used class of insecticides in agricultural settings with an estimated 33 million pounds applied in the United States  every year. The US Environmental Protection Agency  mandated the nationwide elimination of AZM by September 30, 2012 . Although the short term health effects of exposure to OPs are widely known, the health effects of chronic exposures are less well understood, and are hampered by challenges faced when studying farmworkers who are often seasonal and migratory .
Microvascular cerebral blood volume  is known to adjust during periods of increased neuronal activity . Since such CBV changes occur in the microvasculature and not large draining veins, identification of CBV adjustment concurrent to neuronal activity should be useful for improving the spatial localization of brain function over conventional blood oxygenation level dependent  fMRI  . Vascular space occupancy  fMRI  is gaining popularity as a method for noninvasively assessing CBV changes accompanying neuronal activity.
Recent advances in restorative dentistry emphasize the development of materials and procedures that facilitate the preservation of sound dental tissues before restoration, thus favoring minimal invasiveness. Chemo mechanical methods of caries removal have been increasingly indicated as an option for minimally invasive treatments. The papain enzyme, particularly, a plant derived cysteine protease of broad proteolytic activity , has been used as a chemo mechanical material since its recent introduction by Bussadori’s group .
A number of longitudinal studies have documented that depressive symptoms rise moderately after midlife . Nevertheless, empirical studies on these hypotheses are largely based on analyses of physical health measures. Few of them have focused on changes in depressive symptoms .
Reproduction can be dangerous and energetically costly, exposing individuals to physical harm, infectious disease, and reduced immunity . Within this framework, long lived female mammals represent an interesting group because female mammals exhibit several adaptations that may help mitigate the high costs of reproduction. Gestation and lactation are energetically demanding and may often constrain the resources females can devote to maintenance or immunity .
Adverse drug reactions are the fifth leading cause of death in the United States , and thousands of additional patients are prescribed medications from which they derive no benefit; overall efficacy rates for even the most common drugs treating the most prevalent diseases have been estimated to be only about 50% . The prospect of attaining a future of more informed prescribing practice in our medical system has become today’s possibility through the advance of technology and the ability to rapidly and accurately determine millions of pieces of genetic variation information for large numbers of individuals. This has led to the identification of genetic factors governing response and toxicity for hundreds of drugs , with many such associations now replicated, incorporated into drug labels, and encompassed by clinical prescribing guidelines .
Families of children with Autism Spectrum Disorder  endure significant financial and employment burden due to their children's numerous needed services. The study objective is to describe additional impact on families of children with intellectual disability  in addition to ASD . The study is a secondary data analysis of the 2009 2010 National Survey of Children with Special Health Care Needs.
Steady postural contractions that stabilize a limb with accuracy are required forsuccessful performance of many daily tasks including carrying objects, driving, and walking. However, thereremains uncertainty as to the role of intensity and volume of cortical activation in forceregulation  and the motor areasinvolved with increased activation especially among lower to moderate force contractions,which are forces at which many daily tasks are performed  . Despite the primary role of lower limb muscles as agonists and stabilizers duringfunctional tasks such as driving and walking, most studies have studied upper limb musclesand little is understood about cortical activation during leg movements.
Autism spectrum disorder  is characterized by deficits in social communication and interactions, stereotypic behaviors, and restricted interests . These symptoms often cause significant challenges to individuals with ASD and their families. These atypical antipsychotic medications are effective in reducing irritability.
Aerobic glycolysis, the switch in glucose metabolism from oxidative phosphorylation to enhanced glycolysis, occurs in cancer cells even in the presence of adequate oxygen levels. This phenomenon, first described by Otto Warburg in the 1920s, is referred to as the Warburg effect . The understanding that metabolism is tightly regulated by signaling pathways and transcriptional programs, together with the development of diagnostic tools such as 18F fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography , have led to a renewed interest in the Warburg effect , which was recently described as the seventh hallmark of cancer  .
Breast cancer  is the most commonly diagnosed cancer among American women, accounting for approximately 32%  of all new cancer cases per year . It is the second leading cause of cancer death for women in the USA, claiming the lives of 41,000 annually. Patients with ER positive  BCa generally respond to anti estrogen therapy with tamoxifen and/or aromatase inhibitors, the therapeautics most commonly used to treat the disease , and have a better diagnosis than those with ER negative  BCa.
The non competitive glutamatergic NMDA receptor antagonist, phencyclidine , has long been recognized to induce acute schizophrenia like symptoms in humans . Schizophrenia is a severe neuropsychiatric disorder which affects approximately one percent of the population worldwide. Unfortunately, its etiology and pathophysiology are poorly defined.
Protein Protein interactions are critical in most biological systems. They comprise an important and exceptionally challenging family of drug targets. Alanine scanning has proven to be a powerful experimental tool for dissecting and understanding protein protein interactions at the atomic level.
Neuropathic pain remains a significant clinical problem and is often resistant to conventional analgesics. These abnormal neuronal activities play an important role in the development of hyperalgesia and allodynia associated with neuropathic pain. However, the molecular mechanisms underlying the increased excitability of neurons in the DRG and spinal dorsal horn after nerve injury are not fully understood .
Diet induced obesity and metabolic syndrome are important contributors to cardiovascular diseases, including vascular restenosis after angioplasty and atherosclerosis. Vascular smooth muscle cell  migration contributes significantly to these pathological processes. SERCA is an important enzyme that maintains optimal intracellular calcium levels in SMCs by taking up calcium into the sarco/endoplasmic reticulum.
The glomerular and granule cell layer interneurons of the main olfactory bulb  are derived primarily from the mammalian subventricular zone , a proliferative region that generates neural progenitors and remains active throughout life . Mature OB interneurons express a variety of neurotransmitter and neuroactive molecules, such as GABA and dopamine  . The molecular mechanisms regulating the differentiation of OB DAergic interneurons, in particular, are not well defined, but are clearly distinct from those in midbrain DAergic neurons .
The prevalence of fecal incontinence  is approximately 3 fold greater in nursing home  residents  compared to the non institutionalized population aged 70 or older . This has contributed to the belief that FI is a major risk factor for NH referral, but there is little direct evidence to support this belief. Thom and colleagues reported that incontinence is a significant contributor to NH referral, but this study did not distinguish between FI and urinary incontinence .
Vocal fold paresis is increasingly recognized as a commonly encountered clinical condition causing dysphonia., There is common consensus that laryngeal paresis may go unrecognized during clinical voice evaluation due to the lack of an obvious sign indicative of paresis such as reduced vocal fold mobility., Previously reported laryngeal findings of paresis in the presence of normally mobile vocal folds have included asymmetry in the alignment of laryngeal cartilages, vocal fold bowing, glottal gap, vocal process height mismatch, false vocal fold hyperadduction, deviation of the epiglottic petiole, and vibratory amplitude abnormalities. However, these signs may not be always present. Vocal fold paresis and paralysis lead to reduced vocal fold stiffness, which is expected to have direct consequences on vibratory properties., Three vibratory characteristics relevant to vocal fold paresis and paralysis can be assessed: the phase of vibration, assessed as the symmetry  of the excursion of the vocal fold medial edge during the opening and closing phases of the glottal cycle; mucosal wave amplitude, noted as the most lateral excursion of the visible mucosal wave on the superior vocal fold surface; and the vibratory amplitude, noted as the most lateral displacement of the vocal fold medial edge during the glottal cycle., Systematic studies of the influence of vocal fold adductor paresis as an independent variable on laryngeal function have not been performed.
Parasitic protozoa such as Leishmania, Trypanosoma and Plasmodium are unable to synthesize purines de novo and are completely reliant upon their hosts to provide them with preformed purines . Since most cells in vertebrates are capable of purine biosynthesis, the requirement of these protozoa for host derived purines is one of the principal biochemical distinctions between the host and parasite and represents a potential target for therapeutic intervention. To scavenge purines, these parasites have evolved a unique set of purine transporters and salvage enzymes that allow them to take up a variety of purine nucleosides and nucleobases and convert them into essential purine metabolites .
Metastatic melanomas are invariably chemoresistant and carry a grim prognosis . A hierarchical mapping of these alterations  has remained elusive. However, neither MITF, MAPK nor NF κB inhibition abrogates the expression of these BCL 2 family members , suggesting alternative, and yet unknown, mechanisms of regulation of the apoptotic machinery in melanoma cells .
Tumor angiogenesis, the development of new capillaries from preexisting blood vessels, is indispensable for tumor growth and metastasis . Without the concomitant growth of new blood vessels, tumors cannot expand beyond a minimal size, invade locally, or metastasize to distant sites . Thus, the “angiogenic switch” during tumorigenesis is recognized as a rate limiting secondary event that can be effectively targeted as a therapeutic approach to treat cancer .
Alcohol is the 5th leading risk factor in the Global Burden of Disease  estimates, accounting for 3.9% of the GBD, and is the 3rd leading risk factor among men and 1st among those 1535 years old . The relative risk  of injury from alcohol consumption is one important component in estimation of alcohol attributable non fatal injury. Risk estimates have typically been derived from mortality rather than morbidity data, however, been based on chronic rather than on acute consumption , have not examined the dose response relationship and have assumed a uniform risk across gender, age, cause of injury and country .
Selenium  is an essential dietary nutrient for all mammalian species, including humans . The mechanism of action of Se compounds, either via a pro oxidant pathway  or an antioxidant pathway , is still unclear, but is nonetheless intriguing. However, the mechanisms for such effects on the survival pathway remain unclear .
Glucocorticoids are potential mediators to cause muscle wasting. It has been reported that anabolic androgenic steroids have the potential to reverse the glucocorticoid induced catabolic effects on muscles . Androgen also attenuated muscle wasting in COPD patients receiving prolonged glucocorticoid therapy ,.
Early treatment of HIV infection with combination anti retroviral therapy  improves health outcomes in infected individuals and reduces transmission . Many public health experts advocate for expanding treatment provision through a “test and treat” strategy , in which HIV infected individuals are offered ART regardless of clinical status. Such policies have had beneficial impacts on HIV related outcomes in resource rich settings .
Differences in spirometric measures of lung function between European Americans and African Americans are well documented. European Americans had higher mean FEV1 and FVC than the other racial/ethnic groups. It has been suggested that body habitus, particularly the smaller trunk   leg ratio in African Americans, could be partially responsible for these differences.
The brain is enriched in polyunsaturated fatty acids  that fall into two categories based on a double bond at the n 6 or n 3 position. Both AA and DHA, including their oxygenated derivatives, can modulate brain function, alter signal transduction, and disrupt other brain processes . The eicosanoids  and docosanoids  may have antagonistic effects during inflammation.
One of the hallmarks of the adaptive immune response is its ability to generate immunological memory against foreign antigens so as to generate a stronger immune response on secondary encounter. However, when an immune response is generated against self antigens, immunological memory is often thought to contribute to the persistence of the autoimmune response in autoimmune diseases . In a model of skin autoimmunity, it has been shown that memory Treg cells in the tissue confer superior protection against autoimmune attack .
Automated projection spectroscopy  was introduced nearly a decade ago . In spite of a court injunction which blocked the use of APSY and related techniques for several years , APSY NMR has become a standard technique for projects of the Joint Center for Structural Genomics . Within the J UNIO protocol for extensive automation of protein structure determination , APSY NMR is routinely used for polypeptide backbone assignments of proteins with sizes up to about 150 amino acid residues, and significantly larger proteins have also been successfully studied .
Deregulation of cell cycle progression plays an important role in the development of cancer . Cell cycle progression occurs in an orderly fashion and is tightly regulated by the expression and activity of cyclin/cyclin dependent kinase  complexes . Of cyclins, cyclin D1 is critical in controlling cell cycle progression from G1 to S phase .
Inhibitory neurons comprise about 20% of all cortical neurons and are crucial to cortical function. They can be further subdivided into numerous classes or subtypes based on their immunochemical, morphological, and physiological properties . The most informative markers are those that have minimal overlap with other markers and that correlate closely with other features.
The magnitude reconstruction typically used in MRI combines the real and imaginary components of a complex spatial signal so that the resulting image is independent of the arbitrary phase setting and is not affected by phase artifacts . For diffusion MRI, the SNR is further reduced by diffusion weighting of the signal . As a result, parameter estimation for DKI can be more sensitive to noise effects than for DTI , which limits the attainable resolution.
The burden of diabetes mellitus  and prediabetes vary substantially among racial/ethnic groups in the United States , with American Indians having the highest prevalence of type 2 DM . Even though the higher burden of type 2 DM among Hispanics has been widely documented in the US , there are limited data on the burden of these conditions across Hispanic subgroups. Puerto Ricans, the second largest Hispanic subgroup in the US, are disproportionately affected by DM and other cardiovascular risks factors compared to other ethnic groups .
GSTM1 is one of a family of cytosolic GSTs that act as multifunctional Phase II enzymes and regulators of stress activated inflammatory signaling . The GSTM1 gene has 2 alleles: a wild type allele GSTM1*1 and a non functional variant null allele GSTM1*0 . In normal lungs, GSTM1 is predominantly expressed in airway epithelium and smooth muscle cells .
In eukaryotic cells, the spatial segregation of transcription in the nucleus and translation in the cytoplasm imposes the requirement of transporting thousands of macromolecules between these two cellular compartments. The NPC features a doughnut shaped symmetric core with a central transport channel that is asymmetrically decorated by a “nuclear basket” structure and cytoplasmic filaments. Computational approaches have revealed that nups primarily consist of α helical regions, β propellers, and unstructured phenylalanine glycine  repeats., Nup88 and Nup214 share similar domain organizations with an N terminal β propeller and a C terminal α helical region.
Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors  are the medications most commonly used as first line treatment for major depressive disorder . Trivedi and colleagues  reported that 29.7% of the patients in the group who received adjunctive bupropion SR in doses up to 400 mg/day for an additional 12 weeks  achieved remission . In order to shorten the time to remission, one possible option is to use a combination of antidepressant medications early in the course of the illness.
Adipose derived stem cells  are multipotent adult stem cells derived from fat that have the ability to differentiate in vitro along a variety of lineage pathways, including bone, cartilage, adipose, neuronal like, and muscle . These cells exhibit a high expansion rate in vitro, and after several passages the population exhibits a low immunogenic profile as shown by low expression of MHC class II molecules and costimulatory molecules. When utilized as stimulator cells in a one way mixed lymphocyte reaction , they do not stimulate a proliferative response from allogeneic T cells.
It is well known that radiation exposure occurring by intentional or un intentional ways causes cell death and damage in a dose dependent fashion. In mammals, radiation does the most damage to actively dividing cell populations like hematopoietic cells and cells lining mucosal surfaces. For this reason, a clearer understanding of the cellular and molecular events following radiation injury in humans is of paramount importance if a radionuclear event ever happens.
Magnetic resonance guided high intensity focused ultrasound  is a powerful technique for thermally ablating focal lesions. MRgHIFU offers multiple advantages compared to other forms of focal ablation including the high precision of energy delivery, the lack of adjacent tissue toxicity, and the completely non invasive approach . However, the number of potential applications has rapidly increased over the last decade, with multiple studies examining its use for liver, breast, renal, prostate, and brain tumors, in addition to stroke, peripheral neurolysis, and essential tremor .
The vestibular otolith receptors have evolved to detect linear motion and head position with respect to gravity. These are essential functions, about which all coordinated and reflexive movements, as well as spatial orientation and navigation through space depend. However, little is known about otolith system development.
Aromatic peptides have the intrinsic ability to self assemble into highly ordered nanostructures such as nanospheres, nanotubes, nanofibrils, nanoplates, etc. . Piezoelectricity is a characteristic of non centrosymmetric materials, whereby the material will undergo a mechanical stress/strain when placed under an electric field, or conversely, the material will generate an electric charge under a mechanical stress.
Vesicle fusion is followed by vesicle endocytosis, which forms new vesicles. Studies in the last two decades revealed that endocytosis can be rapid  or slow  . Slow endocytosis has been observed at every secretory cell and synapse examined .
Calcium channels are multi subunit complexes comprised of a major pore forming α1 subunit approximately 250 kDa in size and smaller auxiliary β, α2δ, and γ subunits . While the synprint region is implicated in presynaptic targeting of both Cav2.1 and Cav2.2 in superior cervical ganglion neurons , it appears to be nonessential for polarized axonal trafficking in cultured hippocampal neurons . The C terminus of Cav2.2 plays a critical role in channel synaptic targeting by binding to the active zone scaffolding proteins CASK and Mint1  and to the motor dynein light chain subunit tctex1 .
Tyrosine phosphorylation is involved in the regulation of many physiological processes, including growth, proliferation and differentiation, metabolism, cell cycle regulation and cytoskeletal function, cell cell interactions, neuronal development, gene transcription, and the immune response. Until recently, PTKs were considered to be the main enzymes regulating tyrosine phosphorylation and huge progress has been made over the last 20 years in clarifying their significance in signal transduction. The ability of PTPs to dephosphorylate phosphotyrosine residues selectively on their substrates plays an important role in initiating, sustaining and terminating cellular signaling.
The tumor suppressor p53 exhibits distinct functions at the cytoplasm, the nucleus and the mitochondria . In the nucleus, p53 forms a tetramer via its tetramerization domain   allowing its DNA binding domain  to bind to DNA activating various genes that are involved in apoptosis, DNA repair and cell cycle arrest  . Although p53 does not contain a mitochondrial targeting signal , it can still translocate to the mitochondria.
One of the defining features of autism is language impairment. A number of studies have linked language impairment in autism with reversed or absent patterns of neural asymmetry as compared with the typically developing population. Such asymmetries have been shown in autism in evoked potentials to speech stimuli  and also volume of neural language structures, including frontal and temporal areas  and in particular, the planum temporale .
Although clinical and research studies commonly acquire complementary brain images from each participant, the statistical analyses in most studies are performed with the data from different images analyzed separately , and often use “univariate” methods that treat different voxels or regions of interest  within an image as independent. In contrast to univariate image analysis methods, multivariate image analysis techniques can be used to characterize voxel  or region based patterns of covariance. For instance, multivariate image analysis methods have been used to analyze patterns  of the regional cerebral metabolic rate for glucose  in fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography  and gray matter volume in magnetic resonance images , as well as patterns of activation in 15O water PET images and functional MRI  .
IgA nephropathy , the most common form of primary glomerulonephritis worldwide, is characterized by a proliferation of mesangial cells and matrix and deposits containing predominantly IgA1 and C3 . The pathogenesis of IgAN has so far not been completely elucidated but much research has focused on the importance of galactose deficient IgA1 . The O glycans consist of N acetylgalactosamine , with the possible addition of galactose and up to two sialic acid residues.
Liver fibrosis represents a wound healing process in response to a variety of acute and chronic stimuli, including ethanol, viral infections, cholestasis, and metabolic diseases . Characterized by excess synthesis and deposition of extracellular matrix , fibrosis disrupts the normal architecture of the liver leading to organ dysfunction, which can progress to cirrhosis and ultimately organ failure if left untreated. Currently, few therapeutic strategies exist to treat liver fibrosis .
Recent epidemiologic data using an objective measure of physical activity indicate that fewer than 12% of male and 6% of female adolescents in the United States are engaging in sufficient physical activity to meet public health recommendations . Data from studies around the world indicate that this problem is not confined to North America. Despite increased attention to this issue, efforts to reverse this trend have been minimally successful.
Based on pathologic examination of the entire prostate, the Gleason grading system is the most powerful variable available for distinguishing between indolent Gleason score 3+3=6 cancers and cancers with lethal potential, virtually all of which are Gleason score 3+4=7 or higher . Currently, there are few predictors of which patients with Gleason score 6 prostate tumors on biopsy are likely to harbor higher grade disease. Tumor upgrading from biopsy to radical prostatectomy can occur for multiple reasons, including tumor progression, pathology errors, and inter observer variability in Gleason grading.
Physical inactivity is associated with an increased overall risk of cancer mortality  and mortality associated with specific anatomic sites such as colon  and breast . However, there is little information regarding the association of inactivity and lung cancer, which is the most common cause of cancer death in the United States. According to the most recent report from the American Cancer Society, in 2009, an estimated 116,090 new cases of lung cancer will be diagnosed and approximately 88,900 men are expected to die from this disease .
Enhancing the capacity of neurons to adapt to hypoxic stress has implications for improving the survival of neurons during lethal insults from diseases such as stroke and hypoxic encephalopathy. We propose that the endoplasmic reticulum  is involved in the phenomenon of hypoxic preconditioning, in which a prior exposure to non injurious hypoxia induces tolerance to subsequent severe hypoxic or ischemic stress . The ER unfolded protein response  is a set of protein signaling pathways and transcription factors that control apoptosis after severe oxidative stress or in neurodegenerative diseases  and in neuronal preconditioning .
Ostensibly aversive stress experiences can increase the pursuit and use of alcohol and stimulants in humans and animals . It has been challenging to reliably and adequately characterize the stress alcohol relationship in animal models . Episodic exposure even to brief, intermittent social interactions can have extensive long  and short term cardiovascular, thermoregulatory, and behavioral changes in rodents  .
Propofol is a commonly used intravenous agent for the induction and maintenance of general anesthesia used on millions of patients worldwide. Although the GABA A dependent mechanisms are well established, there is a growing interest in elucidating secondary mechanisms that might have long lasting side effects . The underlying mechanism for these effects is unclear but may be related to long term changes in the transcriptional state of the neuronal cells .
Black pigmenting anaerobic bacteria, including Porphyromonas gingivalis and Prevotella intermedia, are among the major pathogens associated with severe periodontitis , an inflammatory disease which damages the periodontal tissues supporting the teeth. The paradigm for haem acquisition from iron oxyhaemoglobin by both P. gingivalis and P. intermedia involves a crucial initial haemoglobin oxidation stage which concomitantly reduces the affinity of the globin for the iron protoporphyrin IX and renders the protein susceptible to further proteolytic degradation . For P. intermedia, the proteolytic oxidation step is mediated by interpain A  , a major extracellular cysteine protease , which is capable of disarming the host defences by degrading complement .
Neurologists who care for stroke patients are required to certify in use of The National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale  now that Disease Specific Specialty Designation as a Primary Stroke Center is available from the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Health Care Organization, . The NIHSS is a widely used stroke deficit assessment tool used in nearly all large clinical stroke trials to document baseline and outcome severity . A training and certification process exists to assure that raters use the NIHSS in a uniform manner, : videotapes were used for training and certification from 1988 2006.
Adult bone mass may be influenced by stressors over the life course. We examined the association between marital life history and bone mineral density  net socioeconomic and behavioral factors known to influence bone mass. We sought evidence for a gender difference in the association between marital history and adult BMD .
Ethanol and dietary fat are closely related at the behavioral level. Clinical evidence shows significantly elevated ethanol intake in subjects consuming fat . Studies in rats have yielded similar results relating ethanol to fat consumption.
An increase in vascular permeability is a key hallmark of inflammation and has been implicated in the pathophysiology of many disease states including acute lung injury, ischemia reperfusion injury, atherosclerosis, and diabetes. Under physiological conditions, adherens junctions predominate in endothelial cell cell contacts and control pulmonary endothelial barrier integrity. Oxidants including superoxide and hydrogen peroxide  generated by activated neutrophils and endothelial cells in response to inflammatory stimuli increase paracellular endothelial permeability by promoting the loss of cellcell adhesion and activation of actin myosin based cell retraction.
Cancers hijack the immune system to avoid detection and to allow for progression, invasion, and metastasis . Towards this end, the understanding and application of immunologic therapies in cancer treatments continues to increase perennially. Currently, over 100 active clinical trials that utilize a form of IL 12 therapy, 27 of which implement gene therapy, are in progress  .
The side chains of several natural amino acids contain nucleophiles. In contrast, the side chains of proteinogenic amino acids lack reactive electrophiles, other than half cystines. Toward this end, we set forth to probe the attributes of  4 ketoproline , which is also known as  4 oxoproline, in a collagen mimetic peptide  .
Cardiovascular disease remains the leading cause of death among kidney transplant patients. , Cardiac disease accounts for 43% of all cause mortality among dialysis patients, and for about 38% of all cause mortality posttransplant. , The number of kidney transplants  performed annually increased gradually from 3784 in 1980 to a peak of 18,018 in 2006, with a small decline to 17,356 in 2008.
In recent decades, there has been an alarming increase in the rates of overweight and obesity on a global scale . Due to the health risks associated with obesity, efforts have been made to properly quantify body fat in individuals and in different populations . In addition, site specific selection for skinfold thickness measurements based on sex has been recommended  .
There is abundant evidence of disruptions in neuronal metabolism and mitochondrial respiration in Huntington’s Disease . Recent reports have revealed that the metabolic transcriptional regulator peroxisome proliferator activated receptor γ coactivator 1α  and multiple PGC 1α target genes are downregulated in the striatum of patients with HD and in mouse models of HD ). It has been proposed that mutant huntingtin represses the expression of PGC 1α by binding to its promoter; overexpression of the transcription factors CREB and TAF4 are able to reverse mutant huntingtin mediated PGC 1α downregulation .
Exposure assessment is a key aspect of observational studies in human toxicology and epidemiology, where individual dosages are not part of the study design. In commonly used statistical analysis, the exposure variable is treated as an independent variable without error. Unfortunately, the frequently occurring non differential errors in the exposure parameter tend to bias the dose response relationship toward null .
Corticobasal ganglia  circuits are thought to promote motor skill acquisition through reinforcement learning . During reinforcement learning, individuals first explore their environment. Thereby, repetition of a successful behavior  replaces exploration .
Abdominal aortic aneurysm  rupture is the tenth leading cause of death in the United States. In fact, there is ample evidence that this pathological condition has the potential to be of long term concern in the medical field. Similar transient patterns of flow separation in the downstream expanding region of a stenosed vessel were shown by Raz et al.
Waldenström’s macroglobulinemia  is an incurable low grade B cell lymphoproliferative disorder characterized by bone marrow  infiltration of a clonal population of small B lymphocytes, plasmacytoid lymphocytes and plasma cells that secrete monoclonal IgM antibody . The etiology of the disease is still unknown. Although believed to be predominantly sporadic, familial cases suggest a possible predisposing genetic defect  .
To date, in vivo molecular imaging techniques have made great progress due to improvements in imaging technology and the design of novel imaging probes. Several modalities are now utilized for molecular imaging, including nuclear imaging, optical imaging, MRI and ultrasound . Both nuclear imaging and optical imaging have comparable high sensitivities, however, nuclear imaging is superior for quantification due to good tissue penetration of gamma rays and the ability to accurately measure count rate in tissue, which permits whole body quantitative imaging not only in small animals but also in humans.
Of the 22,000 ovarian cancer cases that will be diagnosed in 2013, approximately 10% can be attributed to an inherited predisposition. Women who have a BRCA1 mutation have a 39% to 46% risk of developing ovarian cancer by age 70, while women with a BRCA2 mutation carry a 10% to 27% risk by age 70. RRSO provides a 75% to 96% reduction in ovarian cancer risk, and is the most efficacious method of ovarian cancer prevention for these women.
Physiologically, pulmonary dead space is the portion of ventilation that is unable to participate in gas exchange and is essentially wasted. Indeed, dead space fraction has been shown in both adult and pediatric populations to have important prognostic value in acute lung injury and congenital diaphragmatic hernia. Chest wall mechanics are disturbed by thoracotomy, and the use of cardiopulmonary bypass may result in inflammatory damage to the lungs.
Fucose can be linked through α, α and α bonds to N acetylglucosamine and through α to galactose in a range of glycoproteins and glycolipids. At least five major isoforms of the ALF enzyme have been identified . There is a considerable degree of structural heterogeneity, both tissue specific and within tissues.
Proliferation of EC is a critical process involved in angiogenesis and atherogenesis . Through cell cell contact inhibition, normal vascular EC are in a quiescent non proliferative state . However, rapid proliferative burst occurs in EC when they are exposed to injuries that include iatrogenic factors such as balloon angioplasty  and various pathophysiologic events such as modified LDL and angiogenic or atherogenic factors .
Glucocorticoids  affect almost every aspect of adipose tissue biology. Although the powerful actions of GCs on adipose tissue biology are well documented, the molecular events and mechanisms through which GCs regulate adipose tissue development and function are not fully elucidated . The action of GCs on target cells is thought to be mediated by the type 2 glucocorticoid receptor , a member of nuclear receptor superfamily that is expressed in almost every tissue, including adipose tissue.
We examined the association between smoking and the risk of Barrett's esophagus , a metaplastic precursor to esophageal adenocarcinoma . We conducted a case control study within the Kaiser Permanente Northern California population. Patients with a new diagnosis of BE  were matched to persons with gastroesophageal reflux disease   and to population controls .
During evolution, the primate cerebral cortex has expanded disproportionately, relative to overall brain size. Consequently, the cortical sheet becomes folded, to fit in the limited volume provided by the skull . Inward bending  folds are called ‘sulci’, and outward bending  folds are called ‘gyri’.
High density lipoproteins  are well recognized to be antiatherogenic and to play a role in mediating cholesterol efflux from cells, . BMP 2 and  4 may contribute to the progression of vascular calcification due to their osteoinductive properties. In osteoblastic cells, MSX2 and distal less homeodomains 3 and 5  have been shown to co regulate genes that are essential in bone development, including the RUNX2 and the osteocalcin genes .
The striated perineal muscles and the motoneurons that innervate them have been the subjects of intense investigation, owing to their unusual androgen dependence . They are innervated by motoneurons in the spinal nucleus of the bulbocavernosus . As a result, adult females lack a BC and possess only a remnant, or no, LA.
The physiology canon asserts that Mb serves as an O2 stores or facilitates O2 transport. Textbooks have embraced the concept; even though in vivo experiments have presented conflicting evidence . Certainly, Mb can supply O2 during a transient decrease in the O2 supply, such as during a marine mammal dive or during the initiation of muscle contraction .
With the growing amount of clinical research studies in the field of interventional oncology, selective patient data is becoming more difficult to store and organize effectively. For most studies, spreadsheet programs such as Microsoft Excel®  are often used as a data repository similar to a database to record and organize patient data for research. Once the spreadsheet is populated, it is manually filtered by set study parameters and then pushed to statistical analysis software for further analysis.
Sphingomyelin  is an abundant phospholipid in the cell membranes and lipoproteins of all vertebrate animals, and is an essential component of membrane rafts, the microdomains of cell membrane that play a critical role in cell signaling and other cellular processes . Recent epidemiologic studies show that increased plasma levels of SM are associated with an increase in risk of atherosclerosis , but the underlying mechanisms are largely unknown. Part of the reason for this is that the normal physiological functions of SM in cells and lipoproteins are not well understood.
Since the initial use of interferon monotherapy in 1986, great strides have been made in the treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus  infection. The addition of the guanosine analogue ribavirin improved on treatment clearance of viremia, and perhaps more importantly, decreased relapse rates and improved rates of sustained virological response after a complete course of therapy. Even with the recent development of potent HCV protease and polymerase inhibitors, ribavirin appears to be necessary to maximize response rates.
Individuals with obesity, advancing age, hypertension and heart failure all demonstrate increased muscle sympathetic nerve activity , increased cardiovascular disease risk and reduced exercise tolerance. Excessive sympathetic mediated vasoconstriction within skeletal muscles may limit blood flow in such conditions. As the world wide obesity trend increases, it will be important to understand the functional consequences of heightened MSNA associated with obesity, hypertension and insulin resistance in the human condition of metabolic syndrome .
During protein synthesis, nascent polypeptide chains can modulate the efficiency of translation. Nascent polypeptide mediated translation regulation can be an intrinsic property of the nascent chain or can depend on the additional presence of a ligand, e.g. a macrolide antibiotic such as erythromycin,. Biochemical and genetic studies of several drug dependent regulatory peptides have provided initial models for how interactions within the ribosomal tunnel can relay back to the PTC to induce translation arrest,.
The decline in episodic memory with amnestic forms of mild cognitive impairment  is well established for verbal material. A number of problems inherent in available test materials for nonverbal memory have made a comparison with verbal memory difficult. We were interested in studying whether the memory impairment associated with amnestic MCI and mild Alzheimer’s disease  would include impairment on the WMS III Faces recognition test.
Centenarians represent an increasingly large segment of the United States  population, with the most recent census estimating over 53,000 living in the US in 2010 , and a relative increase in the proportion of the population reaching age 100 has been reported in many industrialized nations, including the US, England and Wales, Japan, and Sweden . Available normative data on cognitive test performance of commonly administered neuropsychological tests is lacking in this age group. For example, the most recent version of the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale  provides normative comparisons for adults up to age 90  and even clinical research programs specifically aimed at providing normative data for older adults face challenges with having adequate sample sizes for this exceptionally old age group .
Dynamic nuclear polarization  in conjunction with 13C MR metabolic imaging offers an exciting method of assessing in vivo metabolism with a substantial gain in sensitivity over conventional MR methods . Recent studies using hyperpolarized  pyruvate as a substrate have demonstrated utility for examining in vivo tumor metabolism in rodent brain tumor models . These preclinical studies have shown the feasibility of using this technique for differentiation of tumor from normal brain tissue, characterization of 13C metabolite patterns between pathologically heterogeneous abnormal and normal brain tissue, and detection of early response to treatment in animal models of high grade gliomas .
Previous studies showed liver dysfunction after severe burn, and that this is associated with activation of endoplasmic reticulum  stress. Autophagy is a catabolic process to maintain cellular organelle balance; ER stress is associated with autophagy signaling cascades. We thus sought to determine whether autophagy signals were associated with damage in the liver after burn, and further whether burn associated ER stress activates autophagy signals in hepatocytes .
CBFβ binding to the Runt related  family of transcription factors is required for fidelity of bone  , hematopoietic   and gastrointestinal   development, proliferation and differentiation of respective lineages. The activity of RUNX transcription factors is primarily confined to the nucleus and bound to the nuclear scaffold . Association of CBFβ with RUNX factors also confers protection against RUNX protein degradation .
RNA, in its varied forms, interacts with proteins to carry out fundamental roles in the cell. Conventional purification steps to remove nucleic acid contaminants include nuclease digestion, chemical treatments, or ultracentrifugation steps . PEI is a positively charged polyelectrolyte  with the structural formula n .
High grade gliomas in patients are invasive and histologically heterogeneous. These brain tumors typically consist of a solid tumor mass, often mixed with necrosis, and individual tumor cells infiltrating into edematous or even normal appearing brain tissue . Currently, these tumors are generally evaluated using gadolinium contrast enhanced MRI, in combination with T2 weighted or fluid attenuated inversion recovery  MRI, which are used to determine the extent of involvement, to guide treatments, and to assess a therapeutic response .
The number of women presently involved in the U.S. criminal justice system has grown quickly in recent years, with current data indicating involvement of 1 out of every 89 women in the country . In 2011, almost one million women were sanctioned under community corrections, including probation and parole . The skyrocketing increase in women’s criminal justice involvement is largely attributed to: 1) The War on Drugs; 2) mandatory minimum sentencing; and 3) the lack of programming to meet women’s needs .
described the first case of PitB occurring in a 13 month old female Korean child presenting with Cushing's syndrome and diabetes insipidus . A sellar and suprasellar mass measuring 3.5 cm was identified on magnetic resonance imaging . Histopathologically, the excised tumor was distinct from other pediatric adenohypophyseal tumors, exhibiting primitive Rathke type epithelium arranged in rosettes and glandular structures, small folliculo stellate  cells and a limited range of fully differentiated secretory cells.
Although variola virus, the causative agent for smallpox, was eradicated in 1978, recent events have reawakened concerns that variola could be used as a biological weapon . Over 100 million Americans have been born since universal immunization ceased , and the waning immunity of the estimated 150 million Americans who were remotely vaccinated means that reintroduction of smallpox in the United States could lead to catastrophic consequences . The smallpox vaccine used in the United States up until 2008, Dryvax, while highly effective in preventing disease caused by smallpox , has a significant incidence of adverse effects, which have prompted efforts to develop safer smallpox vaccines .
Water protein interactions are ubiquitous in biological systems and play an important role in the folding, stability, and function of proteins. NMR has long been used to investigate protein water interactions and the mechanisms of polarization transfer from water to proteins . Several spin diffusion solid state NMR  experiments have been introduced to determine the distances of proteins to membrane associated water and to lipid chains .
Successful language processing requires the integration of grammatical information across linguistic units within a sentence. Agreement phenomena are of particular interest because they present some interesting paradoxes for language processing. These errors are especially likely to occur in contexts where a sentence's subject noun phrase  contains two nouns that mismatch in number features .
Androgen blockade therapy  for treating prostate cancer  was initially conceived through the discovery by Dr. Huggins and colleagues that PCa growth is dependent on androgens , and this now has become a standard treatment. Two new drugs approved by the FDA in 2012, Abiraterone  and MDV3100  that effectively block either the androgen synthesis enzyme, CYP17, or AR ligand binding, respectively, have energized the ABT field . Both agents prolong the overall survival of patients with castration resistant prostate cancer .
Handedness is first demonstrated between 910 weeks gestation, as embryos begin to exhibit single arm movements . The archaeological record of cultural and skeletal remains provides evidence of population level biases towards right handedness in early humans . From a neuropsychological perspective, lateralization in the form of hand or foot preference remains the best behavioral predictor of cerebral lateralization.
Older adults frequently report the subjective feeling that their mental abilities have worsened. This phenomenon has been labeled subjective memory complaint or subjective memory impairment. Indeed, memory problems are frequently reported as one of the first losses in both normal and accelerated cognitive aging.
The acute inflammatory response is mainly a protective mechanism; it destroys and/or separates the injurious agent, removes damaged tissue and repairs the area as best possible . While inflammation is a fundamental component of normal host defense and wound repair, it is also implicated in a broad range of diseases . Elucidation of the relationship between such major diseases and inflammation has led to the targeting of inflammatory mediators, particularly those derived from membrane lipids, as potential therapeutics.
Over 700 million pounds of pesticides are used annually in agriculture in the US , and several studies document increased exposures for farmers, farm workers, and families living in agricultural regions compared with non farming populations . Organophosphate pesticide exposures during pregnancy have been associated with decreased birth weight in Dominican and African American populations in an urban US area , but not in a farmworker population in central California . Similarly, studies examining maternal herbicide exposure yield conflicting results regarding potential effects on fetal growth ,.
New biomedical interventions, including pre exposure prophylaxis  and nonoccupational post exposure prophylaxis  have recently been approved and endorsed for use in preventing HIV transmission in high risk populations, especially among men who have sex with men . Other emerging biomedical primary prevention approaches, such as topical microbicides, have shown promise in clinical trials with female users, but have not yet been approved for rectal use in MSM who represent the majority of HIV infections in the U.S.. In regards to secondary prevention, early antiretroviral therapy was found to substantially reduce transmissions to HIV negative partners among heterosexual couples in developing countries , but significant challenges may remain for applying this model to U.S. MSM.
The introduction of optical coherence tomography  into clinical practice has changed ophthalmology, and with progression of new technology, the ability to obtain a true, non invasive “optical biopsy” of the posterior segment is almost achievable. With advancements in OCT image processing software, more refined details of the posterior segment can be appreciated and characterized in vivo. The choroid plays a vital role in the pathophysiology of many diseases affecting the retina but adequate visualization of the choroid using OCT has not been possible until recently.
Asthma is the most prevalent chronic disease of childhood and the most frequent reason for childhood hospitalization in the United States., As such, the ability of clinicians to assess severity of acute asthma exacerbations is variable and limited in accuracy. Approximately thirty six acute asthma severity scores have been proposed. The purpose of such a score is to assess severity at the bedside in order to assist clinicians in applying appropriate immediate treatment.
Altered cellular metabolism is emerging as a hallmark of cancer and has been shown to support several steps along the pathway of cancer development. Indeed, inhibition of fatty acid synthase  has been shown to trigger ER stress in tumor cells, while FASN inhibitors, such as orlistat and C75, have been found to produce antitumor effects in a variety of cancers, including ovarian cancers  . Interestingly, several recent studies suggest a “lipid addiction” phenotype for ovarian cancers.
Oxysterols are hydroxylated derivatives of cholesterol that play important functions in lipid metabolism and, as signaling active and mutagenic compounds, received considerable attention in tumor biology . Excess brain cholesterol is hydroxylated mainly to 24S hydroxycholesterol  and secreted via the bloodbrain barrier into the circulation . Consequently oxysterols are able to interfere with tumor growth in a dual manner:  through regulation of the proinflammatory potential of immune cells by dampening the anti tumor response of dendritic cells in an liverXreceptor  dependent manner  or  by recruiting a population of  immune cells via LXR independent pathways  .
The endotoxin, Lipopolysaccharide , is a major component of the outer cell wall of Gram negative bacteria and is a potent inducer of inflammation. This results in augmentation of the host immune defense system and helps eliminate bacterial infection . Following infection with Gram negative bacteria, LPS, which forms a complex with LPS binding protein , binds to the TLR4 receptor complex consisting of the adaptor molecules  and Toll IL 1R domain containing adaptor protein , which then recruits cytoplasmic proteins IRAK1, IRAK4 and TRAF6.
The processes underlying coronary atherosclerosis and acute myocardial infarction  are complex and multifactorial. Notably, disruption of unstable atheromatous plaques may lead to exposing thrombogenic material to blood under high shear conditions and the formation of coronary thrombosis . Of critical importance, the rupture of a lipid laden, unstable plaque may stimulate thrombus formation in part by activating glycoprotein VI  , a platelet specific collagen receptor from the immunoglobulin superfamily .
Degeneration of the locus coeruleus  appears to precede substantia nigra pars compacta  and hippocampal damage in Parkinson’s disease  and Alzheimer’s disease , respectively . The SNpc and LC are vulnerable to neuroinflammation . Several aspects of early AD can be reproduced by chronic infusion of lipopolysaccharide  into the fourth ventricle of young rats .
The peptide, galanin , is known to have a stimulatory effect on food intake . This effect is strongest with GAL administration directly into the hypothalamic paraventricular nucleus , where injection of a GAL receptor antagonist suppresses food intake . In addition to stimulating food intake, GAL also increases the consumption of ethanol .
Ovarian cancer is the leading cause of death from gynecological malignancy and is the fourth most frequent cause of death from cancer in women  mostly because of its late clinical manifestations and absence of screening methods for early detection. The majority of women who develop this cancer do not carry highly penetrant BRCA gene mutations; therefore, discovering common low penetrance gene mutations could be useful in detecting women at higher risk of ovarian cancer, allowing for an individualized approach to screening . There is evidence from experimental  and epidemiological studies  for a role of exogenous and endogenous estrogen in ovarian carcinogenesis.
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer deaths in the U.S. Regular CRC screening  is recommended beginning at age 50 for average risk adults. , Understanding individuals' perceptions of CRCS is important for developing effective interventions to increase adherence to screening guidelines.
Musculoskeletal foot disorders are common among older adults, with estimates suggesting that more than 60% may be affected. The prevalence of these disorders has been shown to vary by race,  and obesity,, , ,  with Caucasians more likely to have Tailor’s bunions than African Americans; among the non obese, African Americans are more likely to present with hallux valgus, hammer toes, and overlapping toes than Caucasians; among obese persons, a potentially lower prevalence of hallux valgus may occur compared to non obese persons. Foot disorders are associated with foot symptoms, impaired balance and fall risk, and disability,, , , ,  but their etiology is not well understood.
Carcinogenesis is a multiple step process involving the accumulation of multiple genetic and epigenetic changes that allows the clonal selection of progeny with growth and survival advantages . Oncogenes, once activated, can promote carcinogenesis by conferring certain selective growth advantages to the affected cell . In contrast, TSGs have tumor inhibitory functions that need to be inactivated for tumor growth.
KSHV is the etiologic agent of Kaposi’s sarcoma  . Like other herpesviruses, KSHV establishes a latent infection in infected cells but lytic replication can occur spontaneously or upon activation by various stimuli . One of these cellular factors is a KRAB containing zinc finger protein ZnF426 which we have identified previously; it interacts with the KSHV RTA, and was named KSHV RTA binding protein   .
Antiretroviral combination regimens of dual nucleoside/nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors  plus either a protease inhibitor  or a non nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor  are preferentially used in treatment naïve human immunodeficiency virus  infected patients to achieve maximum durable anti viral activity. , The newer once daily fixed dose combinations of tenofovir/emtricitabine or lamivudine/abacavir are the preferred choices in industrialized countries because of dosing convenience and lower incidence of short and long term toxicities. , The pharmacokinetics of the antiretroviral drugs may depend on genetic polymorphisms of drug metabolizing enzymes or transporters, biological factors , drug drug interactions and/or drug formulation.
The neural ectoderm  forms on the dorsal side of the vertebrate embryo in response to factors secreted from the dorsal blastula center  and the Organizer that inhibit BMP signaling . As a result, several transcription factors  are co expressed in broad overlapping domains in the nascent NE . gem is expressed similar to the sox genes, but more intensely in the anterior rather than posterior neural plate.
Osteoporosis is a prevalent disorder characterized by low bone mineral density , deterioration of bone microarchitecture and increased incidence of fracture; and genetic factors account for 60 80% of total variability in BMD. Although candidate genes in the 5q33 35 interval were not identified, this region contains the gene for osteonectin/Sparc , one of the most abundant non collagenous extracellular matrix proteins in bone. In osteoblasts, osteonectin promotes commitment, differentiation, and survival.
Bacillus anthracis  is a virulent spore producing bacterium. The use of B. anthracis as a lethal biological weapon has provoked renewed research interest. Although there is a rapid movement to develop effective vaccines against B. anthracis, there is no effective vaccine .
Red blood cell transfusions are commonly indicated in veterinary medicine. Canine blood for transfusion is generally obtained from in house or community blood donors, or may be purchased from commercial blood banks. Thus, it is important to ensure that any red cells collected remain viable prior to and after transfusion, and to optimize delivery techniques to minimize complications and morbidity .
Prior to 1998, 1 bromopropane  was primarily used to manufacture pharmaceuticals, pesticides and other chemicals. Occupational exposure limits are not available at this time. However the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health  has estimated the levels of 1 BP in the breathing zones of workers in three plants where a spray adhesive containing 1 BP was used in the manufacturing of seat cushions for aircrafts or furniture.
Epstein Barr virus  is a successful pathogen that infects more than 90% of all adults in the world . It maintains its DNA as a licensed, extra chromosomal replicon. This viral replicon is present in clonally derived cells with a wide distribution of numbers of DNA molecules per cell .
A favorable cardiovascular disease  risk profile, based on traditional risk factors, is uncommon among adult Americans and is associated with low long term mortality rates and greater longevity. Among middle aged adults, low levels of major CVD risk factors   particularly lower cholesterol and blood pressure  and non use of cigarettes   confer marked reduction in the relative risk of both coronary heart disease  death and all cause mortality, and appear to increase longevity by up to 9 years. Subclinical vascular disease, such as increased carotid intimal medial thickness  and low ankle brachial index , predict future CVD events independently of traditional risk factors.
In species ranging from worms to non human primates, the lifespan of individuals is nearly always assessed in conditions where males and females are kept separate. Yet in the wild, the opposite sexes coexist, at least during attraction and mating. In flies and worms, the presence of males decreases longevity in the opposite sex .
Mitochondrial damage realized through superoxide dependent pathways plays a critical role in radiation injury to cells and tissues . These effects of superoxide and other superoxide derived reactive oxygen species on mitochondria may be realized immediately due to irradiation  induced radiolysis of water, as well as at later time during the mitochondrial stage of apoptotic response . Manganese superoxide dismutase  provides the first line of defense against superoxide overproduced in the mitochondria .
The Larmor frequency of a nucleus is affected by a number of factors including its intrinsic quantum energy levels determined by nuclear magnetic moment, chemical shifts caused by electronic shielding and magnetic coupling with the surrounding chemical environment. This induced magnetic moment will oppose the field for diamagnetic materials and be along the field for paramagnetic materials. Traditionally, off resonant frequency or image phase has been largely discarded due to its poor contrast and the perceived lack of meaningful information except for in a few cases such as phase contrast imaging where phase is specifically generated to measure flow velocity.
Mouse models have been instrumental in contributing to our understanding of how rare, inherited mutations can cause some human diseases. At present it is unclear whether common human genetic variations can be modeled phenotypically in the mouse . The allelic distribution of this common SNP varies in different ethnic backgrounds and geographical locations.
Melanin Concentrating Hormone  is a cyclic neuropeptide produced primarily in the lateral hypothalamus and zona incerta that activates one G protein coupled receptor in rodents, the Melanin Concentrating Hormone 1 receptor  . Studies have strongly indicated that MCH may regulate food intake , anxiety like behavior , depression like behavior , performance in learning and memory behavioral tests , and drug self administration  in rodents. MCH1R is expressed throughout the brain with particularly dense localization in the nucleus accumbens shell, hippocampus, amygdala, locus coeruleus and cerebral cortex  which suggests the receptor is involved in a wide range of physiological functions In 1997 Knigge et al reported that acute central injection of MCH inhibits pentylenetetrazol  induced seizures in both rats and guinea pigs , but this finding has not been further investigated.
Selective estrogen receptor modulators  are widely used in the clinic for the treatment and prevention of breast cancer, osteoporosis, and other indications in postmenopausal women . All SERMs and their active metabolites share common polyaromatic phenolic scaffolds that are redox active in vitro and in vivo . Formation of o quinones, quinone methides, and di quinone methides has been reported from the oxidative metabolism of SERMs .
Surveillance for hepatocellular carcinoma includes following patients with chronic hepatitis or liver cirrhosis every six to 12 months  and monitoring them with abdominal ultrasonography , serum alpha fetoprotein , and/or the protein induced by vitamin K absences  . Abdominal US has been described as highly user dependent . Although AFP determination is less costly compared to US , it is a non specific marker for HCC, especially among HCV cirrhotic patients.
TMS is a powerful tool that uses the principle of electromagnetic induction to alter neural activity in a localized brain area. The safe, noninvasive nature of this technique allows for study of normal brain function in humans . When delivered as single pulses that are carefully timed relative to stimulus delivery , it can serve as a tool for mental chronometry .
Parkinson’s disease  is characterized by progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra , striatal dopamine depletion , and motor impairments . Evidence suggests that chronic inflammation , oxidative stress , and mitochondrial impairment  play important roles in PD neurodegeneration. It has been proposed that inflammation may be a driving factor in the progression of PD, especially since PD patients have increased proinflammatory molecules in their Cerebrospinal fluid and brain tissue , and activated microglia are found clustered throughout the SN  .
In 2014, it is estimated melanoma will contribute to 76,100 new cancer diagnoses and 9,710 deaths in the United States . Advanced melanoma presents a significant therapeutic challenge to clinicians. The cytokine interleukin 2  is also used to treat advanced melanoma, however, the response rate is only 6% to 10% and it too is associated with significant toxicities.
Hemoglobinopathies are characterized by oxidant damage due to increased resting oxygen consumption and circulating prooxidative free hemoglobin . In sickle cell disease , Hgb S is unstable and generates free radicals which damage cellular enzymes and membrane lipids . A similar finding has been shown in nontransfused thalassemia patients, due to the toxic effect of unpaired globin chains on the membrane .
Obesity is prevalent and can have significant negative impacts on health . In the United States, more than one third of adults are currently considered obese , and obesity contributes to 5 to 15% of deaths each year . Anabolic androgenic steroids, such as testosterone, can regulate body weight.
Antibody producing B cells are divided into B 1 and B 2 cells . In contrast, B 1 cells are T cell independent and produce natural autoantibodies  of the IgM isotype. They are phenotypically IgMhiIgDloCD23− B220lo and are subdivided based on expression of CD5  into B 1a  and B 1b  .
The embryonic vascular network initially forms de novo through the differentiation of ECs from mesodermal precursors and their assembly into a primitive plexus . Subsequently, these EC networks coalesce and are remodeled, giving rise to a series of mature vessels . Failure of this process leads to early embryonic lethality  .
Organophosphate  pesticides represent nearly half of worldwide insecticide use  but are undergoing increased scrutiny because of their propensity to elicit developmental neurotoxicity at levels that are below the threshold for acute signs of exposure, and even doses lower than those required for cholinesterase inhibition, the mechanism that is typically used for biomonitoring . Recent data point to dysregulation of cell signaling cascades as one of the critical targets that contribute to the adverse outcomes seen at lower exposures . Chief among these is the pathway that generates cyclic AMP, a critical second messenger that mediates numerous neurotransmitter and hormonal receptor signals; these are linked to the generation of cyclic AMP through G proteins that regulate adenylyl cyclase , the enzyme that synthesizes cyclic AMP from ATP .
Tobacco use remains the leading preventable cause of death in the US and globally. Between 2000 and 2011, the consumption of cigarettes in the U.S. decreased 33%. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  warns that the decrease in cigarette use is being “offset by increases in other forms of tobacco”.
The expanding obesity epidemic in the United States has negative repercussions for the reproductive health of both men and women. Overweight women experience more menstrual cycle abnormalities, anovulation, infertility, and fetal loss than their normal weight counterparts. Decreased levels of sex steroids and altered pulsatile gonadotropin secretion have also been observed in obese women.
The dystrophin glycoprotein complex  is a transmembrane molecular bridge that links cytoskeletal F actin with the extracellular matrix protein laminin 2 and localizes many signaling proteins within muscle cells, including vascular smooth muscle. Genetic defects that compromise the DGC have been implicated in muscular dystrophies   progressive muscle disorders characterized by skeletal muscle weakness and wasting that affect approximately 250,000 people in the United States alone. Whereas defects of the DGC are well studied in skeletal muscle, less is known about the role of this complex in vascular smooth muscle.
In Xenopus, the endoderm is derived from the vegetal hemisphere, and much is now understood about how the endodermal germ layer is formed and how regional specification of the endoderm is regulated .
