Fractures and loss of bone have significantly affected the quality of life for a large segment of the population. Furthermore, these acidic degradation products potentially compromise the bioactivity of growth factors. Biodegradable polyphosphazenes  have proved to be superior candidate materials to achieve this objective due to their unique buffering degradation products .
Over the decades following the onset of the AIDS epidemic, studies repeatedly show that only a minority of men who have sex with men  engage in behavior that is likely to lead to HIV infection, even among men who are recruited from venues long associated with risk behavior, such as gay bathhouses , cruising areas  and online cruise sites  . Such consistent results suggest that prevention for MSM should be more narrowly focused toward those who are truly at risk for HIV. Such an approach is called for in the National HIV/AIDS Strategy , which emphasizes the importance of bringing prevention to the most at risk populations .
Prostate cancer is one of the leading causes of death among men in the United States . Early stage prostate cancer requires androgen for growth and thus responds to androgen deprivation therapy . However, eventually the disease progresses to an androgen independent state that is unresponsive to androgen ablation.
Circulating peripheral blood monocytes represent a pleiotropic population of cells which are essential for innate immune responses to pathogenic micro organisms in the blood, mucosal surfaces and tissues . Peripheral blood monocytes, derived from bone marrow precursors, are recruited to sites of inflammation during bacterial infection . Monocytes demonstrate marked phenotypic differences from differentiated macrophages but their roles in the context of high bacterial loads, as occurs in sepsis, are incompletely characterized  .
Ciclopirox olamine  , the ethanolamine salt of 6 cyclohexyl 1 hydroxy 4 methyl 2 pyridone, is a synthetic antifungal agent used to treat mycoses of the skin and nails for more than 20 years. Studies have shown that CPX has a very broad spectrum of action against dermatophytes, yeast, filamentous fungi and bacteria. , The mechanisms of these actions of CPX seem diverse, involving disruption of membrane function in fungi, or targeting different metabolic  and energy producing processes in bacteria.
The knee meniscus is a fibrocartilaginous tissue that provides stability within the joint, while also bearing and transmitting loads during normal locomotion. Finite element models of the meniscus suggest that compressive forces dominate in the thinnest part of the wedge shape , while the thicker, more peripheral regions bear most of the circumferential tensile loads. This complex mechanical environment is reflected in marked regional variations in cell morphology and phenotype, matrix composition, and macroscale mechanical properties.
Acute myocardial infarction  is typically caused by platelet mediated thrombosis at the site of a ruptured or eroded atherosclerotic plaque. Anti platelet therapy with aspirin and clopidogrel is commonly prescribed early and continued following AMI to reduce recurrent ischemic events, but may cause an increase in the risk of bleeding. Both recurrent ischemic events and bleeding have been associated with increased late mortality., For example, compared with individuals with two ‘wild type’ CYP2C19*1 alleles, Caucasian carriers of the loss of function CYP2C19*2 allele treated with clopidogrel have decreased metabolism resulting in significantly decreased levels of active metabolite, increased on treatment platelet reactivity,, , ,  and an increased risk of adverse ischemic events after PCI., These previously reported effects of CYP gene polymorphisms on clopidogrel related platelet responsiveness and outcomes have been observed in predominantly Caucasian or Asian populations after PCI., , , , The effect of CYP polymorphisms on cardiovascular events among clopidogrel treated patients after an acute coronary syndrome remains controversial, and no studies to date have investigated the association of these CYP variants with outcomes in African American patients.
Higher step length variability is present in those with neurologic diseases and may precede dementia onset. Step length at preferred speeds is quite constant in healthy adults, but higher step length variability can be present in older adults without overt neurologic disease. Slower gait is common in older adults and is associated with higher gait variability, but age related increases in variability are independent of gait slowing .
Although close contact is a well recognised risk factor for tuberculosis, the proportion of tuberculosis cases found attributable to identifiable contact with other cases is generally low,. This proportion can be estimated through traditional case control studies, asking about contacts, or by molecular epidemiological studies in which cases with shared DNA fingerprint patterns  are investigated. Estimates in sub Saharan Africa of the proportion of “clustered” cases with identifiable links range from 11 27%,.
Integrins are heterodimeric transmembrane receptors for extracellular matrix components that consist of non covalently linked α and β subunits . The extracellular domain confers ligand specificity and is required for ligand interactions. Following ligand binding, the recruitment of intracellular signaling molecules and activation of downstream signaling pathways is coordinated primarily by the cytoplasmic tail .
In disease states such as heart failure, myocardial infarction and hypertrophy, changes in the expression and location of Connexin43  occur , and may predispose to arrhythmias. Stretch may be an important stimulus to Cx43 remodeling; however, it has only been investigated in neonatal cell cultures, which have different physiological properties to adult myocytes. We hypothesized that localized stretch in vivo causes Cx43 remodeling, with associated changes in conduction, mediated by the renin/angiotensin system  .
It has been generally accepted that maximum vertical jumps could provide a reliable and sensitive assessment of various kinematic and kinetic variables . Therefore, vertical jumps have been widely used not only for training purposes, but also for testing the velocity, force, and power production capacity of leg muscles both in athletes  and in various patient and elderly populations . Conversely, in addition to empirical and research evidence suggesting that subjects repeatedly select a particular Hcmd and adjust it to the external load  and effort , some studies have suggested that Hcmd could have a marked effect on Hmax .
Phosphatidylinositol and its phosphorylated derivatives  has long been known to have an important regulatory role in cell physiology . Phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5 triphosphate  and phosphatidylinositol 4,5 biphosphate  are two well known lipid second messengers . PIP3 target proteins are diverse in nature and include protein kinases, adaptor molecules, and GAP and GEF for small GTPases .
Humans have limited ability to repair injured or damaged organs. Recently, it has become clear that biophysical signals such as ion currents and patterned voltage gradients  are key components for the induction of regeneration and patterning of new tissue in structures such as amphibian limbs and mammalian corneas . The Xenopus larval tail is a complex organ containing multiple cell types: muscle, peripheral nerves, spinal cord, notochord, and vasculature.
The primary risk factor for cervical cancer is persistent infection with oncogenic subtypes of human papillomavirus  . In 2006, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration  approved the first HPV vaccine for administration to females 926 years of age for the prevention of cervical cancer  . Because many potential vaccine recipients are under 18 years of age, most HPV vaccine acceptability studies have focused on the diverse factors that may influence parental acceptability , including demographic factors , medical history variables , parental knowledge and awareness about HPV and cancer , and other psychosocial or attitudinal beliefs .
Hypertension is a cardiovascular risk factor common among hemodialysis patients  and one which that may be better assessed using out of office blood pressure  monitoring either by home BP measurements or automatic interdialytic ambulatory BP recordings . Interdialytic ambulatory BP monitoring more closely correlates with left ventricular hypertrophy  and all cause mortality  compared to BP recorded in the hemodialysis unit and, in contrast to home BP recordings, offers greater insights into circadian rhythms  . Chronobiologic analysis reveals that arterial BP rhythms are markedly altered in patients on hemodialysis .
Glioblastoma  is the most common type of brain tumor and is associated with high morbidity and mortality rates. Despite such aggressive treatment approaches, median survival times remain under 1 year in most cases. Brain tumor growth and progression depends on the establishment of an adequate blood supply , which confers a tremendous survival and growth advantage on the malignant cells.
The complement system serves as a critical hub in the human innate immune and inflammatory system, and fulfills numerous roles in homeostasis, defense, repair, and disease . These ligand bound ‘sensors’ can then trigger one of three canonical activation routes, , lectin , and alternative  pathways), which all result in cleavage of the abundant plasma protein C3 into its bioactive C3a  and C3b  fragments. Surface bound C4b then binds C2 to form the CP/LP C3 pro convertase which, when proteolytically activated by the same initiation complexes named above, gives rise to the fully active CP/LP C3 convertase, C4b2a.
The mesolimbic system, including the ventral tegmental area  and nucleus accumbens , is essential for reward seeking behavior. The NAcc integrates dopaminergic projections from the VTA and glutamatergic projections from limbic regions such as the basolateral amygdala , hippocampus, medial prefrontal cortex . It is hypothesized that the projection patterns of VP neurons allow the passage of limbic signals projected to NAcc to gain access to regions involved in appetitive behavior .
All proteins that traffic through the secretory pathway begin their journey when they are translocated as nascent polypeptides into the endoplasmic reticulum . When the load of client proteins exceeds ER capacity, a set of inter organelle signaling pathways responds to the stress by coordinately regulating translation and a broad program of gene transcription. The UPR regulates XBP1 through a novel mechanism of mRNA splicing initiated by IRE1 , an ER transmembrane kinase/endoribonuclease .
The microbial flora of the human oral cavity can be highly diverse, encompassing approximately 700 bacterial species , of which about ½ has not yet been grown in vitro. It is therefore of interest to characterize the normal flora of the elderly present in different oral sites. Significant site  and subject specificity has been shown in the microflora of the oral cavity of adults, but not of the elderly  .
Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder that gradually damages the neocortex and hippocampus, reducing memory, learning and reasoning . Despite its importance Aβ catabolism remains understudied  . In normal brain, rapid proteolysis attenuates Aβ accumulation.
Treatment interventions for co occurring posttraumatic stress disorder  and substance use disorders  have shown promising results  and provide alternatives to traditional relapse prevention strategies for women in substance abuse treatment. However, given high drop out rates and difficulties with retention among this population, questions remain as to the specific conditions under which these women can best be engaged and benefit from treatment. While the evidence on racial/ethnic differences in prevalence rates of PTSD and SUDs is mixed , research findings indicate there are racial/ethnic disparities in the adverse consequences of these conditions and in access to mental health care .
Clinical resistance to anticancer therapies is a persistent problem that can be caused by genetic or epigenetic events occurring within cancer cells or by extracellular cues such as soluble factors or cell cell contacts . Ultimately, these diverse events lead to the activation of growth and survival signaling pathways within cancer cells that enable them to survive otherwise lethal pharmacological insults . By blocking these drug resistance pathways, it may be possible to improve the efficacy and durability of anticancer drugs.
Atrial fibrillation  is the most common cardiac arrhythmia and represents a significant health risk to the population. Therapy for AF seeks to restore normal sinus rhythm through pharmacologic cardioversion. Lack of ion channel selectivity and overlap in ion channel expression in the atria and ventricles however, underlies the nonspecific ventricular side effects of current pharmacological agents, .
Despite long standing interest in the relations between stress and eating behavior, the true nature of these associations and the underlying biological mechanisms involved remain poorly understood. Stress induced elevation in cortisol, a glucocorticoid hormone secreted by the hypothalamic pituitary adrenocortical  axis, has been linked to increased energy intake following stress. Surgical removal of the adrenal glands  results in decreased food intake in rodents, and administration of glucocorticoids reverses this effect .
Toxoplasma gondii is an obligate intracellular parasite of the phylum Apicomplexa, which also includes the deadly agent of malaria, Plasmodium falciparum. Some of the proteins implicated in invasion are sequentially released from two types of secretory organelles, named micronemes and rhoptries . More complexes are, however, likely to contribute to invasion since additional uncharacterized transmembrane microneme proteins  are encoded in the genome .
Huntington’s disease  is associated with atrophy of the striatum and cerebral cortex, which leads to a loss of motor control and declines in cognitive function . The disease usually manifests in midlife and is due to an expansion in the CAG trinucleotide repeat within the gene encoding the protein huntingtin . In the cortex, pyramidal neurons of layers II, III and V degenerate.
Allogeneic bone marrow transplantation  is currently used for the treatment of a variety of hematologic malignancies. GVHD is an immune mediated disease in which donor T cells are primed mainly by recipient antigen presenting cells and then recognize and attack the genetically disparate recipient. Proinflammatory cytokines produced by donor T cells and other immune cells, have been shown to be critical for GVHD generation and play an important role in orchestrating the entire process .
Alzheimer’s disease , the most common form of dementia, is characterized by progressive neurodegeneration and presence of two major histopathological lesions in the brain; neurofibrillary tangles and senile plaques. Accumulation of amyloid β , the main constituent of senile plaques, is believed to be central in AD pathogenesis . Although the amount of senile plaques is critical to the neuropathological diagnosis it does not relate to the degree of dementia .
Stereotactic body radiotherapy  is now a well established treatment for medically inoperable early stage non small cell lung cancer , with 2 year local control rates ranging from 80 97%. However, an early prospective trial indicated that patients with centrally located lung tumors were at increased risk for severe pulmonary toxicity when treated with SBRT. As a result, tumors within a 2 cm radius of the proximal bronchial tree, often described as the “no fly zone ,” were excluded from the landmark RTOG 0236 trial  and are now being studied separately in a phase I/II trial  , which aims to determine the maximum tolerated dose  for SBRT in central lung tumors .
Gastrin is a peptide hormone produced primarily by endocrine G cells in the gastric antrum, with lower levels found in the duodenum and pituitary. Gastrin is initially generated as a 101 amino acid precursor peptide, preprogastrin that is converted to progastrin  by cleavage of a signal peptide. In most cases, the levels of the nonamidated precursor forms of gastrin comprise <10% of the total secreted peptide, but increased levels are occasionally observed in disease states, such as in patients with colorectal cancer  .
The risk of injury associated with alcohol use is a function of the simultaneous combination of a number of factors . One of the most important and easily identifiable is the degree to which the drinkers’ cognitive and/or motor functions are influenced, which is a function not only of how much and the manner in which the alcohol is consumed , but also factors such as the drinker’s gender, age, height and weight, and level of tolerance to the effects of alcohol. Risk of injury during an idealized control period would be the same as that during the period prior to the actual injury ; respondents would find themselves in the same contexts and participating in the same activities as those at the time of injury.
Two trials have shown that male circumcision reduces the prevalence of high risk penile human papillomavirus  infection by approximately 35% in HIV negative men , and several cross sectional studies have found a lower rate of prevalent penile HPV infection in circumcised HIV uninfected men . However, it is unclear whether circumcision reduces the incidence of HPV acquisition or increases the clearance of preexisting HPV infection. One longitudinal observational study of 285 U.S. men, 25 of whom were circumcised, found no statistically significant difference in the hazards ratio  of acquisition of either high risk HPV  infections  or any HPV infection  in circumcised versus uncircumcised men .
With an estimated 20,000 procedures per year, multi component, inflatable penile prosthesis placement is the most common treatment for erectile dysfunction refractory to medical therapy. Historically, infection rates have been cited as 3 5%, however, rates of less than 1% are often quoted in contemporary single surgeon series . Non infectious failure rates increase over time, with non infectious survival rates of 97.6 and 93.2% at 3 and 5 years in a contemporary cohort.
We assessed defibrillation strength shock induced changes of the membrane time constant  and membrane potential  in intact rabbit hearts after administration of lidocaine, a sodium  channel blocker, or nifedipine, a L type calcium  channel blocker . The experimental protocol was approved by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee of Cleveland Clinic. A photograph of the preparation is shown in  .
The beat to beat function of the L type calcium channel , CaV1.2, is to provide trigger Ca for excitation contraction coupling in cardiac myocytes. Over a longer time frame, LTCC Ca current  provides Ca that ultimately contributes to cellular Ca homeostasis. On first principles, CaV1.2 expression and function must be tightly regulated to maintain Ca homeostasis in cardiac myocytes.
Cystic fibrosis , an autosomal recessive disease manifesting progressive respiratory insufficiency, defective exocrine pancreatic secretion and elevated electrolyte concentration in the sweat, is related to loss of function mutations of the CF Transmembrane conductance Regulator  gene encoding a chloride transporting protein  . The major cause of morbidity and mortality of CF patients is chronic lung disease. Innovative therapies to prevent the onset or reduce the pulmonary damage are under intensive pre clinical and clinical investigation .
Many congenital heart defects affect formation of the cardiac valves  structures needed to direct blood flow through the heart and prevent regurgitation. Heart valve defects such as bicuspid valves are relatively common but typically do not cause symptoms until adult life, at which time degeneration and calcification lead to deterioration of valve function. Understanding the cellular mechanisms needed to form, maintain and repair the valve leaflets throughout adult life will facilitate the development of new strategies to treat heart valve defects and disease .
Rett syndrome  is a neurodevelopmental disorder caused by mutations in the gene encoding methyl CpG binding protein 2  that are predicted to result in loss of function of the protein  . Individuals affected with RTT are born healthy and experience normal development until 618 months of age, after which they enter a period characterized by regression of motor and language skills . MeCP2 is expressed at high levels in postmitotic neurons and only low levels in immature neurons, although RTT is a neuro developmental disorder .
Lumbar disc surgery remains one of the most commonly performed operations, with rates exhibiting considerable geographic variation. Two recent randomized trials demonstrated that surgery provides faster pain relief and perceived recovery in patients with herniated disc. Outcomes were similar at 1 year for patients assigned to surgery and for those assigned to non operative treatment.
Dioxin like compounds are environmental contaminants of great concern produced as unwanted byproducts of industrial processes and combustion . Some are resistant to chemical and biological degradation and bioaccumulate in animals and humans . The most toxic dioxin is 2,3,7,8 tetrachlorodibenzo p dioxin .
A remarkable insight emerging from the molecular era of carcinogenesis research is the universality of certain molecular pathways in the pathogenesis of a diverse array of tumor types. The prevailing evidence suggests that the highly expressed fusion protein usurps the function of both PML and RAR to interrupt the normal pathway of myelocytic maturation. Since the initial discovery of the PML gene through studies of the fusion protein in APL, evidence has accumulated that PML participates in cancer pathogenesis in other target sites.
While chronic degenerative arthropathy is the main morbidity of hemophilia, a very high prevalance of low bone density is also seen in men and boys with hemophilia. The current study investigates bone degradation in the knee joint of hemophilic mice resulting from hemarthrosis and the efficacy of aggressive treatment with factor VIII in the period surrounding injury to prevent bone pathology . Skeletally mature factor VIII knock out mice were subjected to knee joint hemorrhage induced by puncture of the left knee joint capsule.
Gliomas are the most common primary tumors of the central nervous system, with glioblastomas  as the most malignant entity. These invading cells are extremely resistant to radiation and chemotherapy, and currently there are no anti invasive therapies available. Microarray technology was used to explore the expression profile of migrating glioma cells.
Pushing is commonly used when opening doors or moving grocery shopping carts, as well as while moving goods in warehouse and distribution settings . Pushing activities are associated with 920% work related musculoskeletal disorders and low back injuries . Furthermore, health care workers frequently adopt asymmetrical postures, including lateral bending and trunk turning, laterally positioned arms and sideward force exertion during patients handling activities .
Severe orthostatic hypotension and pre syncopal symptoms are the main cause of disability among patients with autonomic failure. The current recommended therapeutic approaches are limited to medications that increase sodium reabsorption and expand plasma volume such as fludrocortisones,,  or vasoactive agents such as the alpha 1 adrenergic agonist, midodrine. Even though these interventions can effectively reduce symptoms related to orthostatic hypotension, in most cases they induce supine hypertension that further complicate their treatment.
Some of the best response rates with radionuclide therapy have been achieved in non Hodgkin’s lymphoma , which is considered to be a relatively radiosensitive malignancy that may be effectively treated with low dose rate radiation. In patients previously treated with chemotherapy, the reported overall response ranged from 47% to 68%, and the complete response ranged from 20% to 38%. Limited previous I 131 RIT patient studies investigating the tracer predicted and the therapy delivered tumor doses report good agreement, as well as considerable variation.
There are substantial socioeconomic differences in rates of obesity and chronic diseases, including type 2 diabetes, and cardiovascular disease. Diet is a modifiable risk factor for such outcomes and as such is a likely contributor to health inequalities. Understanding the social and economic patterning of diet is important for informing public health action, as recognised by Public Health England in 2013 .
The central nervous system  plays an integral role in blood pressure regulation, primarily through sympathetic activation and mediation of various neurohumoral factors such as angiotensin II and vasopressin. The AV3V region includes the median preoptic nucleus, the OVLT and the periventricular nucleus and has been shown to play an important role in several behavioral, neural and hormonal functions involved in body fluid and cardiovascular homeostasis. , Electrolytic lesions of this brain region abolish the centrally mediated pressor response to central and peripheral infusions of angiotensin II as well as preventing and/or reversing several other forms of experimental hypertension.
Canavan disease  is a rare recessive autosomal white matter leukodystrophy  that is caused by mutations of the aspartoacylase gene . The disease has a high prevalence in people of Askenazi Jewish origin , and it is characterized by the presence of widespread spongy degeneration in the brain and spinal cord . Affected individuals suffer from mental retardation, weakness, blindness and functional disability, and most die by the age of five  .
Male mammals display a wide range of complex social behaviors toward young that can range from aggression to indifference to parental care . Parental care is rare among animals and is estimated to be present in approximately 10% of mammalian species  and only 6% of rodent species . In addition to a lack of parental care, male mammals may also exhibit extreme aggression towards infants resulting in infanticide.
Citrobacter rodentium is a natural mouse pathogen. It is the causative agent of transmissible murine colonic hyperplasia, and is responsible for high mortality in suckling mice . As a member of the attaching and effacing  family of bacterial pathogens, and the only known AE pathogen to naturally infect mice, it is a valuable model organism for the study of pathogenesis of the clinically significant human pathogens, enteropathogenic Escherichia coli  and enterohaemorrhagic E. coli  .
The topology of chromatin is regulated by precise mechanisms that govern consistent packaging and replication of DNA, and also play a critical role in transcriptional regulation. Histone acetyltransferases  and histone deacetylases  work in an opposing manner by acetylating and deacetylating histones, respectively. In addition, several Phase I and II trials have confirmed the safety, tolerability, and single agent activity of vorinostat in patients with haematological malignancies.
The recent advent of pathway targeted chemotherapeutic agents, such as gefitinib and erlotinib, has led to improved therapy for a small subgroup of patients with advanced lung cancer. However, research findings have demonstrated that tumors with similar clinical characteristics  may respond differently to the same drug. The mitogen activated protein kinase kinase  is one of the critical molecules in the Ras/Raf/MEK/ERK cascade, which mediates signal transduction from Ras/Raf to extracellular signal regulated kinases  through phosphorylation of both tyrosine  and threonine  residues of ERK proteins.
The concept of neighborhood holds significance in South Africa. Under the apartheid regime , residential areas were forcefully segregated through the Group Areas Act of 1950  which restricted certain racial groups in terms of ownership and land occupation. In addition, the regime destroyed social cohesion by disrupting family structures and communities, giving rise to social conditions susceptible to both violence and crime, especially in many poor black areas .
The adolescent period is one of rapid and transformative development, characterized by efforts to confront and surmount challenges and to establish a sense of identity and autonomy. Adolescence is also a period fraught with many threats to the health and well being, sometimes leading to substantial premature impairment and disability . Large, national surveillance studies of adolescents have consistently found African American adolescents at greater sexual health risk compared to Hispanics and Caucasians: they begin sexual intercourse at an earlier age, have a higher prevalence rate of current sexual intercourse activity and a greater prevalence of having four or more lifetime sexual intercourse partners  .
The successful demonstration that epidural electrical stimulation of posterior spinal cord structures can suppress pain , led to a widely spread clinical practice of spinal cord stimulation  to modify the severity of perception of nociceptive and neuropathic pain. Clinical practice of SCS has been extensively reviewed . SCS for pain control has generally been applied to the thoracic spinal cord.
The hierarchy used for identifying hematopoietic and endothelial progenitors provides a unique quantitative method for assessing the degree of heterogeneity in stem cell cultures and may offer important insights into mesenchymal stem cell  biology. Hematopoietic high proliferative potential colony forming cells  obtained from both mouse and human bone marrow have been shown to form large colonies  in double layer agar cultures and differentiate into multiple hematopoietic cell types . Low proliferative potential colony forming cells  are defined as hematopoietic cells that can grow into colonies smaller than HPP CFC but greater than 50 cells .
In vivo thermoregulatory temperature responses of mammalian brains to radio frequency  heating are unknown for ultra high field magnetic resonance  systems . However, live humans can not be used to study the thermoregulatory temperature responses of RF heating at ultra high fields. Spatially unique correlations were reported between the whole head average specific absorption rate  and the maximum brain and rectal temperature changes during RF heating.
The inner ear comprises a fluid filled epithelium within a labyrinthine space ofthe temporal bone. A prevalent inner ear malformation is the Enlarged Vestibular Aqueduct. Dilation of ES and ED epithelia is thought to cause thebony malformation pathognomonic for EVA.
Mating systems determine how genes combine into genotypes, and therefore strongly affect population genetic structure  and evolutionary potential . Seed discounting, the loss of outcrossed seed production due to selfed seed production, can also reduce the benefit of selfing, especially in cases where selfing does not provide reproductive assurance . Such studies have generated valuable insights about the evolution of mating systems, including the roles of reproductive assurance and inbreeding depression in facilitating or retarding the spread of self fertilization .
Campylobacter is a leading bacterial cause of food born disease worldwide , representing a huge health challenge. This mainly zoonotic genus includes at least 18 species  of which Campylobacter jejuni and Campylobacter coli are the most common pathogens and account for the majority of diagnosed human Campylobacter infections . Young children remain most susceptible both in the developing and the developed world .
Obesity continues as a growing trend in the United States, with over 32% of the adult population with a BMI ≥30. Moreover, unintentional injury remains the fifth leading cause of death among adults. Obese trauma patients continue to be clinically challenging as they are more than five times more likely to die from their injury than their non obese counterparts.
COMMD proteins are a group of evolutionarily conserved factors present in a wide range of organisms . All ten members of this family are found in vertebrates and are also present in Dictyostelium discoideum. The COMM domain not only defines the protein family but provides a critical interface for protein protein interactions, such as COMMD1 COMMD1 dimer formation and binding to Cul2, Elongin C and SOCS1  .
Organic solvents are chemicals that are ubiquitous in occupational settings. Solvents are present in the workplace through the use of adhesives, paints, degreasing agents, and cleaning products. Solvents are also used in industrial processes, including the manufacturing of computer components, plastics, pharmaceuticals, and textiles.
Tuberous sclerosis complex  is an autosomal dominant disorder resulting from mutations in either the TSC1  or TSC2  gene . The neurological features of TSC are highly associated with cortical tubers, which are developmental cortical malformations histologically characterized by disordered cortical lamination, astrogliosis, dysplastic neurons and the presence of so called “giant cells” . Epilepsy is in most cases difficult to manage with antiepileptic drugs and often requires surgical resection of one or more tubers  .
The preBötzinger Complex  is essential for normal breathing in rodents  and is postulated to be an essential site for respiratory rhythm generation . Pharmacological studies suggest that pacemaker neurons are not obligatory for rhythmogenesis . Regardless, they could play a role in modulating/stabilizing the rhythm .
Recent reports from the District of Columbia  Department of Health describe an HIV epidemic in Washington comparable to that in East Africa . Three percent of adults in the US capital are known to be living with HIV; many more remain undiagnosed and unable to obtain either lifesaving care or counseling to reduce the spread of infection  . In response to the continuing spread of HIV in the US and internationally, both the US National Institutes of Health  and the World Health Organization  have committed to implementing and evaluating universal testing and treatment for prevention of HIV infection .
Lipid transmembrane diffusion  is of great interest to the biophysical community. Likewise, lipids arriving at the plasma membrane  must also distribute appropriately across the bilayer into the appropriate leaflet, via flip flop. This evidence supported the idea that proteins must be required for adequate flip flop .
The shared tumor associated antigens  that are potential targets of cancer immunotherapy primarily consist of non mutated self antigens that are either lineage specific or overexpressed. Due to immunological tolerance towards these proteins, B cells producing high affinity antibodies and T cells expressing high affinity T cell receptors  are often deleted, making the remaining repertoire relatively unresponsive to active immunization. Furthermore, for those antigens for which self tolerance is incomplete, the process of tumor development can actively tolerize the remaining T cells .
The clinical uses of mobile health  are broad and have expanded rapidly over the past decade but there has been little research on how useful these tools are across patient populations. The ubiquity of cell phones and touchscreen technology presents the opportunity to use mHealth tools to bridge gaps in health disparities if underserved communities accept and can easily use such tools. The Pew Research Center has reported that African Americans and English speaking Hispanics are the most active users of the mobile web, have higher rates of cell phone ownership, and use more cell phone applications  .
This study evaluates polyomavirus JC  large T antigen  as a potential target for drug development. LTA is a hexameric protein with a helicase activity that is powered by ATP binding and hydrolysis. The helicase and ATPase function is critical for viral replication .
Representations arising from distracting stimuli interfere with our ability to selectively attend to task relevant information. The effect of such representations is heightened when the tendency to respond to distracting information is habitual or reflexive, resulting in the need for greater attentional control to perform important tasks. Neuroimaging research has demonstrated increased recruitment of brain regions by older adults to perform cognitive tasks in which younger adults more selectively recruit neural resources .
Head and neck squamous cell carcinomas  are malignancies of the upper aerodigestive tract, including the mouth, larynx, and pharynx. HNSCC represents the sixth most common malignancy in the United States and accounts for ~500,000 new cancer cases per year worldwide . Recently, the addition of cetuximab, an inhibitor of the epidermal growth factor receptor , to radiation therapy was found to enhance HNSCC patient survival compared with radiation therapy alone .
Cholestasis, or impaired bile flow, is a form of liver disease that has various etiologies and can result in liver failure. Hepatocyte apoptosis is implicated in the pathogenesis of several liver diseases including cholestasis, viral hepatitis and autoimmune diseases . There are numerous causes of cholestasis, and apoptosis has been proposed as a mechanism of bile acid induced liver injury .
Amphipathic polymers have demonstrated great potential as suitable membrane substitutes . These properties make amphipols very promising for the investigation of 7 TM proteins including G protein coupled receptors  . Ligand binding capabilities of amphipol refolded GPCRs could be demonstrated and high resolution insights of the LTB4 ligand while bound to perdeuterated BLT2 receptor could be obtained using homonuclear 1H spectroscopy of the ligand.
Gene expression refers to the process of synthesizing a functional gene productfrom the information encoded in a gene, and the study of gene expression is central tobiomedical research. Indeed, due to several advantages of RNAseq technology over microarray, specificallyits ability to identify genes not included in a predetermined probe, its expanded resolutionallows for expression detection at the gene, exon, transcript, and coding DNA sequence levels, and its ability to detect structural variants in addition to gene expression, RNAseqhas begun to replace microarray altogether . The impact of dysfunction in this regulatory networkis the long list of diseases linked to miRNA expression  .
The asymmetric distribution of molecules in polarized cells is a hallmark of metazoan development. For example, one characteristic of the anterior posterior axis of Drosophila oocytes is the concentration of bicoid RNA at the anterior pole and oskar RNA at the posterior pole. In Xenopus, oocytes are polarized along an animal vegetal axis where RNAs, and organelles are asymmetrically distributed.
Alzheimer’s disease  is the most prevalent form of dementia worldwide. Amyloidogenesis results from the successive proteolysis of the membrane tethered amyloid precursor protein . Recent evidence from transgenic animal and in vitro studies suggests that beta site APP cleaving enzyme 1  is the major β secretase in the brain  and the rate limiting enzyme in amyloidogenesis .
Conventional chemoradiation  for locally or regionally advanced squamous cell head and neck cancer  results in 2 year progression free survival  rates of only approximately 35% . Relapse has historically been predominantly locoregional . Cetuximab with RT improved locoregional control and survival compared to RT alone .
Neonatal strokes occur in ~1 per 4000 term births and commonly present with acute seizures . Neonatal strokes and seizures frequently result in long lasting consequences like epilepsy and cognitive deficits, neurobehavioral impairments like hyperactivity disorders and problematic social skills . Thus stroke in the developing brain is a significant cause of associated neurological co morbidities that persist into adulthood .
The nervous system regulates epithelial homeostasis in different ways, and this regulation by the nervous system partly involves modulation of stem and progenitor cells . There is also crosstalk between tumor cells and nerves, such that tumors induce active neurogenesis, resulting in increased neuronal density in preneoplastic and neoplastic tissues . In addition, activation of muscarinic receptors has been shown to promote cell transformation and cancer progression .
More than 750,000 new strokes occur each year in the USA alone. Worldwide, stroke is responsible for approximately 4.4 million deaths  annually . Therefore, novel post stroke interventions to improve functional recovery and quality of life for stroke patients are urgently needed .
Systemic lupus erythematosus  patients have a 5 fold greater risk of myocardial infarction, occurring at a mean age of 49 , leading to a bimodal pattern of death where cardiovascular disease  is a leading cause of mortality 10 years after diagnosis of SLE . The increase in cardiovascular events observed in SLE is due in part to traditional risk factors , but SLE itself is an independent factor predisposing to accelerated CVD. Young women  with SLE are approximately 50 times more likely to have an MI versus age matched control subjects .
Alcohol misuse among college students continues to be a significant public health concern, marked by negative consequences . Students who violate campus alcohol policies tend to be riskier drinkers , and are often required to participate in mandated interventions . Many of these students are motivated to change and some will reduce their drinking behavior, even prior to intervention .
Poxviruses are large, complex, enveloped DNA viruses that replicate in the cytoplasm of infected cells . Two major infectious forms of VACV have been characterized. Thus, the EV is essentially a MV with an additional lipoprotein membrane.
Advances in donor management, organ preservation, surgical technique, post operative care and immunosuppression have improved overall survival rates following lung transplantation, but the incidence of lung ischemia reperfusion injury  remains unchanged at 20% . Clinically, LIRI is characterized by pulmonary edema, reduced pulmonary compliance and poor gas exchange . Patients surviving the initial insult face an upregulation of MHC class II molecules, which can vary depending on the severity of LIRI, increasing the risk of both acute rejection and obliterative bronchiolitis .
Hypoxic ischemic brain injury results in cerebral palsy , mental retardation or learning disabilities in surviving children . It is now widely recognized that the majority of cases of term neonatal encephalopathy are related to hypoxic ischemic brain injury that occurs in utero from a variety of intrapartum conditions . The incidence of CP increases dramatically with the decline in gestational age at birth, such that 412% of infants with a birth weight less than 1000 grams are affected  .
Mycobacteriosis is recognized as a significant disease problem in zebrafish research facilities . Findings range from overt disease outbreaks with high mortality to incidental findings where few fish show signs of disease. Several species of Mycobacterium have been identified, and experimental exposures indicate dramatic differences between species and strains .
In the CNS, myelin sheaths are elaborated by oligodendrocytes, which spirally ensheath segments of axons with multilayered compact membranes. Accordingly, computational modeling of myelinated axons  has been used widely to fill this void and has highlighted the interplay between morphological features and the biophysical properties of myelin  . Early experimental measurements suggest that myelin insulates the internodal axonal membrane by forming a high resistance, low capacitance compartment around the axon .
Pain perception is strongly modulated by dynamic adaptive processes e.g., , , . Many chronic pain syndromes are characterized by disturbed pain adaptation processes, such as a lack of habituation or abnormal sensitization e.g., , , , , ,  which may reflect an increased excitability of central  and/or of peripheral  nociceptive neurons. The temporal dynamics of pain, and the ability to estimate them accurately, may hold keys to understanding multiple mechanisms of pain regulation, as well as the development of chronic pain , , ,  .
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer related mortality in the United States when both sexes are combined . Mutations in MLH1 and MSH2 account for 90% of all identified mutations and MSH6 and PMS2 for 10% . The molecular fingerprint of deficiency in the MMR system is the presence of microsatellite instability .
Survival rates for lung cancer have been low for many years , mostly because the majority of patients present with advanced stage disease.. Lung cancer risk can be estimated by several factors that can be easily determined, including smoking history, age, previous tobacco related malignancy, family history of lung cancer and the presence of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease . However, clinical prediction based on these risk factors is poor at the individual level , and there is an urgent need for non invasive assays for early detection of lung cancer among smokers and former smokers.
The endogenous opioid peptides consist of the enkephalins, the endorphins and the dynorphins which are proteolytic products of proenkephalin, proopiomelanocortin, and prodynorphin, respectively. Dynorphin A  is one of the major proteolytic fragments of prodynorphin and is widely distributed in the central nervous system. This unexpected property of an endogenous opioid was thought to be due to the rapid breakdown of dynorphin A upon release, but subsequent analyses showed that dynorphin A and its proteolytic products had other, non opioid effects that may confound its actions at opioid receptors, including motor deficits,, neurotoxicity, release of excitatory neurotransmitters,, and inflammatory mediators, and prolonged hyperalgesia,.
The management of drug resistant HIV has improved dramatically with the recent approval of a number of highly effective antiretroviral drugs . Among these is raltegravir , the first clinically available inhibitor of HIV integrase. When used in combination with other active drugs, raltegravir has proven to be very potent, well tolerated, and highly effective  .
Within the uterus, the female sex steroids estrogen and progesterone play pivotal roles in the establishment of a suitable environment for embryo implantation and pregnancy. In recent years, microRNAs  have been identified as a novel class of small, non coding RNAs which also regulate gene expression by affecting mRNA translation and/or stability  . miRNAs are transcribed from specific genes which reside between protein coding genes, within introns of genes, within exons or which make up the entire intron .
The ability to easily evaluate respiratory function in children with asthma is of central importance in terms of following the course of disease. However, this approach may have limitations. For example, spirometric tests may be less helpful than other measures of respiratory function when assessing airway lability in preschool children at risk for persistent asthma.
The basal ganglia  are an evolutionarily conserved set of brain nuclei widely implicated in motor control and learning . The songbird area X, for example, is a specialized striato pallidal nucleus homologous to the mammalian basal ganglia  . A recent study suggests that, like the mammalian BG, area X has two populations of pallidal neurons— output neurons that send a long range GABAergic projection to the thalamus, and  local neurons that do not project to the thalamus but instead connect within the basal ganglia  .
Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance  is a precursor lesion for multiple myeloma , an incurable bone marrow malignancy with an annual incidence of approximately 4.6 per 100,000. Historically, MGUS has been characterized by evidence of immunoglobulin heavy chain  expression, but could therefore only account for 80% of MM cases since 20% of MM cases secrete no IgH . The prevalence and risk of progression of the premalignant precursor entity for these light chain only MM  cases is unknown .
Microtubules  are cytoskeletal polymeric structures that are assembled from heterodimers of α  and β tubulin proteins . Several parameters used to characterize MT dynamic instability include the rates of growth and shortening that together define dynamicity, and the frequency of transitioning between the two phases termed ‘catastrophe’ and ‘rescue’ . The complexity entailed in MT instability is essential to the biological functions that MTs perform during cell division, migration, and intracellular trafficking .
One common issue experienced by rare diseases patients, their families, and health professionals is the lack of information about a specific disorder . Several comprehensive sources of information about rare diseases have emerged in the past decade in the U.S. and in Europe, including the Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center  , the Rare Disease Database created by the National Organization for Rare Disorders   and Orphanet . These information sources are partially cross referenced to standard medical terminologies and among themselves.
Synaptic information processing depends on the amplitude and time course of neurotransmitter release from presynaptic terminals. Therefore, modifications in vesicle endo  and exocytosis can lead to altered synaptic interactions and information coding in neural circuits ,  . Hence, it can alter action potential firing patterns and could influence neuronal network reverberations , , .
Rehospitalizations cost Medicare $17 billion annually, are potentially avoidable, and a publicly reported statistic . For non Medicare patients, rates of rehospitalization for common disorders such as asthma, congestive heart failure, and acute myocardial infarction range from 21 29% one year following the index admission . A variety of disease based strategies can reduce the need for rehospitalization.
A rise in the incidence of hepatitis C virus  infection among men who have sex with men  has been reported . In those with HIV/HCV, treatment recommendations are less clear . In chronic HCV, PEG IFN/RBV responses are lower in HIV positive patients  .
Exposure to arsenic is a major public health concern throughout the world. Whether the source is naturally occurring deposits or industrial and agricultural runoff, the primary route of human exposure is contaminated ground water. Long term arsenic exposure is associated with increased risks of numerous human cancers , and so, arsenic has been classified as a human carcinogen by both the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the IARC.
It is becoming increasingly evident that precise regulation of eukaryotic gene expression requires communication between cis acting elements through alterations in higher order chromatin structure . During B cell development the mouse IgH locus rearranges first, by sequential D J and then V DJ joining, leading to the pro  and pre B cell stages of development, respectively . These results represented the first example a looping mechanism for enhancer action in an Ig gene locus, whose physical organization and developmental regulation differs dramatically from that of the well studied β globin locus as well as several other gene systems .
Managed care has been deployed as a cost containment policy in the Medicaid program for more than thirty years. However, it is only in more recent years that states have extended it to the beneficiaries who incur the lion’s share of Medicaid’s health care expenditures, adults with disabilities. , Second, MCOs may reduce expenditures by improving access to relatively inexpensive services , thereby decreasing the demand for expensive care .
Magnetic resonance microscopy  has become a standard tool for investigating cardiac structure and function in the mouse. The majority of MR work on mice has been done with 2D acquisition methods with limited resolution along the third axis . But 3D applications in small animal imaging thus far have been limited.
Mucolipidosis type IV  is a human lysosomal storage disorder caused by dysfunction of the mucolipin 1  protein . Clinical manifestations of ML IV include neuromotor retardation, retinal degeneration, corneal opacity, and gastric abnormality . These observations indicate that TRPML1 may be involved in endosomallysosomal biogenesis  and the regulation of lysosomal pH  .
The increased signal to noise ratio  at the static magnetic field  of 3T may improve cardiac MRI and MR spectroscopy  applications that are constrained by limited SNR at 1.5T . The f0 that yields best image quality is then visually selected by the operator and used for the subsequent high resolution scan. Another solution is to determine both localized second order shim corrections and localized on resonance frequency f0 at the same time based on an acquired B0 map  .
Bronchopulmonary dysplasia  develops in about 25% of very low birth weight infants, and remains a major cause of pulmonary morbidity and mortality in infancy . Vascular injury characterized by arrested vascular growth with decreased arborization and dysmorphic capillaries is a hallmark of the “new” BPD and may precede alveolar simplification . In premature infants, exposure to bacteria is common, can occur in utero or postnatally, and is associated with subsequent development of BPD .
Latinos are the largest and fastest growing ethnic minority group in the United States . A distinctive characteristic of the U.S. Latino population is its large number of immigrants. Today, the majority of immigrants gaining entry into the United States are Latino .
The use of alternative and complementary medicine has soared in popularity with patients, not just for improvement of baseline health, but even in the management of chronic conditions like psoriasis , . There is a growing body of popular and scientific literature for the use of nutritional supplementation in the treatment of psoriasis. With this information readily available, patients often perform independent research and ask their dermatologists about what they can add to their diets to make their condition more manageable.
The edge chipping test was originally developed in the late 1980s to study hard metal cutting tools at the National Physical Laboratory in London . The force required for chip formation, F, increases with distance from the edge, d. The shape of the chip usually is independent of the material tested . is an interesting exception where six chipping modes were reported for twenty two class IV restorations in a clinical study of 455 composite resin anterior restorations.
Alzheimer's disease  and its prodromal state, mild cognitive impairment , cause early episodic memory deficits . Because factors such as age and education play a role in determining AD risk and rate of cognitive decline, neuropsychological tests should also be capable of accounting for these individual differences  . In our prior study, we used ordinal logistic regression to develop an algorithm that assigns probability values to the suspected diagnoses of control, MCI, and AD, on the basis of four components of NAB List Learning performance .
Contrast enhanced coronary MR angiography  has been proven to be a promising technique for high quality anatomic imaging of coronary arteries . Usage of an improper acquisition delay can lead to suboptimal signal to noise ratio  and image artifacts. An empirical acquisition delay of 25  or 60  seconds was used.
Little is known about the frequency of persistent pain after endodontic procedures, even though pain is a core patient oriented outcome. We estimated the frequency of persistent pain, regardless of etiology, following endondontic treatment . Persistent tooth pain was defined as pain present ≥ 6 months after endodontic treatment.
During the past decade, gene expression profiling has become a powerful tool for predicting risk of breast cancer recurrence and mortality. Oncotype DX is a commercially available, validated 21 gene assay that quantifies risk of distant recurrence in node negative , estrogen receptor positive , tamoxifen treated breast cancer patients . Oncotype DX has also been shown to significantly predict benefit from adjuvant non anthracycline based and anthracycline based chemotherapy in N0 and node positive, ER+ patients .
DJ 1 is one of the genes that cause inherited forms of Parkinson's disease  when mutated . DJ 1  maps to chromosome 1p36  and encodes a 189 amino acid protein. Both mutations are homozygous and the disease is transmitted recessively.
Diffusion weighted magnetic resonance imaging  shows promise as an imaging biomarker for treatment response in glioma patients  as well as in a variety of other clinical tumor types . The efficacy of this technique lies in its sensitivity to the molecular motion of water which is affected by cellular, sub cellular and macromolecular elements that impede otherwise free diffusion of water. The theoretical basis for diffusion analysis is that cell membranes and other structures hinder the diffusion of molecules .
Thiol disulfide exchange reactions are universal among all living cells. TrxR and Trx are found in species from all three domains of life and the thioredoxin system is well characterized in species from the Bacteria and Eukarya domains, including humans . The thioredoxin system also serves a critical role in protection from oxidative stress in many organisms .
P70S6K1 is activated through PI3K  and MAPK pathways . Activated PI3K and AKT can induce cell transformation through the phosphorylation and activation of p70S6K1 . Treatment of mice with the rapamycin analog CCI 779 led to a reduction in p70S6K1 activation and inhibition of tumor growth .
Innate lymphoid cells  are emerging as important effector cells in innate immunity and tissue homeostasis . Type 2 ILCs  produce Th2 cytokines, such as IL 5 and IL 13, and play important roles in a variety of immune responses, including immunity to helminths, airway and skin inflammation, and tissue remodeling . However, we have limited knowledge about the ability of ILC2s to work together with other immune cells.
The Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome, caused by a novel coronavirus  infected 8000 individuals in 2002 2003, with an approximate 10% mortality rate . From these initial studies, several salient observations emerged. This virus then jumped species to infect intermediate hosts such as Himalayan palm civets in wet markets in Southern China prior to infecting humans .
Over 500 evidence based treatments  for child and adolescent mental health disorders exist, many with multiple randomized controlled trials  supporting their efficacy in improving outcomes and functioning., To address the current science to practice divide between empirical knowledge and adoption, states such as Hawaii and New York have used a variety of strategies in an attempt to address barriers to EBT adoption and to build in facilitators, with the ultimate goal of increasing child and adolescent access to and receipt of EBTs. Empirical studies support the effectiveness of local champions in facilitating implementation, particularly in its earlier phases . The most commonly used implementation strategy has been in person training for mental health professionals.
Point resolved spectroscopy  combined with 3 D phase encoding is commonly used for acquiring clinical magnetic resonance spectroscopic imaging  data. This provides metabolic data with excellent quality for patients with brain tumors and has been shown to be important for defining tumor burden . This method is currently limited by how much of the anatomic lesion can be covered within a single examination.
Cannabis is the world's most popular illicit substance. In contrast, cannabidiol , another major constituent of most strains of cannabis, appears to have anti psychotic properties , and is anxiolytic  and may be neuroprotective in humans . THC and CBD have been found to have opposing neuropharmacological actions   the former is an partial agonist while the latter is an antagonist at CB1 and CB2 receptors .
The present study investigated the rate and pattern of neuropsychological recovery in heavy episodic drinking teens during the initial days to weeks of abstinence from alcohol . Adolescents  with histories of heavy episodic drinking  and socio demographically similar control teens  were recruited from San Diego area schools. HED and CON were comparable on 5th grade standardized math and language arts test performance to ensure similar functioning prior to onset of substance use.
Fibrates are lipid lowering drugs and they are used in patients with hypercholesterolemia and hypertriglyceridemia. PPARs are ligand activated transcription factors belonging to the nuclear receptor family. They are important in lipid and glucose metabolism .
Neurogenesis continues throughout adulthood in vertebrates, due to endogenous progenitor cells which could be useful for brain repair . The SVZ contains GFAP+, astrocytic stem cells , which generate highly proliferative transient amplifying cells  that differentiate into neuroblasts  . Growth factors are important components of stem cell niches .
Prostate cancer is the second most frequently diagnosed cancer in men worldwide . There is also no reliable indicator for establishing the aggressiveness of prostate tumors . Proton  MR spectroscopy, exploiting metabolic characteristics, has also been advocated as a potential method of diagnosing and monitoring prostate cancer .
HDL levels are inversely related to the incidence of cardiovascular disease, and increasing HDL can reduce atherosclerosis in animal models. , A principal anti atherogenic property of HDL is thought to be its ability to promote cholesterol efflux from macrophage foam cells. The ability of HDL and its apolipoproteins to mediate macrophage cholesterol efflux depends in large part on the macrophage ABC transporters, ABCA1 and ABCG1.
Interests in the biochemistry of animal venoms started decades ago. Over the years, the venom components have been isolated, characterized and used as biochemical tools to probe the mammalian neuromuscular system. Although only a few percent of Conus peptides have been sequenced and studied, they are already well established and widely used as molecular tools in neuroscience with several in clinical trials and one has been approved as a drug against pain.
Plasmodium falciparum, the most virulent of the parasites causing human malaria, has the unique ability to sequester in the vasculature of diverse host organs. Sequestration resulting from the adherence of erythrocytes that contain mature forms of P. falciparum  to the vascular endothelium occurs in all infections. However, several adhesive phenotypes have been associated with severe pathological outcomes of malaria, such as the formation of rosettes, and the sequestration of infected erythrocytes  in the microvasculature of the brain and the placenta.
The recent development of metabolic imaging of hyperpolarized 13C labeled compounds  presents new opportunities for the in vivo investigation of metabolism under normal and pathologic conditions. Therefore, fast chemical shift imaging  methods are desirable, and several techniques have been developed recently for application to metabolic imaging of hyperpolarized substrates . exploited the sparse spectra, which occur in metabolic imaging of hyperpolarized  pyruvate, by applying compressed sensing  to speed up the acquisition or increase the spatial resolution.
Solid tumors possess a variety of physiological abnormalities that pose a barrier for conventional non surgical therapies . Aberrant angiogenesis drives new vessel sprouting, resulting in poorly organized vessel architecture. Additionally, the extracellular matrix  of tumors is reactive and contractile, supporting vascular proliferation and exerting mechanical stress on blood vessels to further compromise perfusion .
WT1 is a zinc finger transcription factor that can activate or repress target genes that control cell growth and development. WT1 is subject to alternative splicing in two regions; a 17 amino acid insertion within the central region of the protein  and the insertion of three amino acids  within the zinc finger region . A considerable body of evidence suggests that WT1 can also act as an oncogene,.
Flow cytometry has traditionally been a manually intensive technique. However, automated high throughput FCM methods have recently been developed to rapidly collect large data sets with complexities similar to gene microarrays . The large amount of complex information generated by high throughput technologies needs to be processed in an automated, well describable way.
The mechanisms by which alcohol causes cell injury are still not clear. Bradford et al  reported that CYP2E1 but not NADPH oxidase was required for ethanol induced oxidative DNA damage in rodent liver and may play a key role in ethanol associated hepatocarcinogenesis, whereas NADPH oxidase but not CYP2E1 played the major role in ethanol induced hepatotoxicity. There is clearly a need for oral models of ethanol treatment which result in the development of significant liver injury.
In living cells, intense electric pulses of nanosecond duration  impair the barrier function of membranous structures, including the plasma membrane, endoplasmic reticulum, and mitochondria . The difference between membrane permeabilization by nsEP and the traditional electroporation with longer milli  and microsecond stimuli has been a subject of a continuous debate. Reaching the cell interior and disruption of organelle membranes was introduced theoretically and then confirmed experimentally as the distinctive effect of nsEP .
Adult Purkinje cells each receive input from a single climbing fiber , which makes hundreds of synapses across its highly branched main dendrites . The mechanism of complex spike generation has been debated for decades . It is known that, similarly to simple spikes , the first spike of the complex spike is generated in the axon ; both backpropagate only weakly into the dendrites .
Coronary artery disease is the leading cause of death in the western world, and is responsible for approximately 450,000 deaths per year in the United States . Reliable imaging of distal coronary segments remains an open problem, and may become possible with improvements in signal to noise ratio , contrast to noise ratio , and spatial resolution . At 1.5T, balanced steady state free precession  imaging has been shown to provide significantly superior SNR and CNR compared to gradient echo sequences , and may alleviate the need for contrast agents as in the widely used slow injection gradient echo imaging method .
Dysregulated production of nitric oxide  is implicated in the pathogenesis of heart transplant failure, although the mechanisms by which this occurs in humans remains incompletely defined. NO has several biological properties that are concentration and cell source dependent. For instance, NO promotes T cell activation at low levels, but suppresses T cell responses at high concentrations.
Students with math difficulties  demonstrate varying levels of reading performance: Some students perform adequately in reading, whereas others demonstrate concurrent reading difficulties . As proposed by , this dichotomy may represent a productive scheme for subtyping MD . Deficits in phonological processing hinder acquisition of vocabulary and math facts, therefore leading to MDRD.
Mitochondria produce ATP that fuels excitation contraction coupling. They are also sources of damaging reactive oxygen species . Preserving cardiac mitochondrial health is therefore essential to maintaining normal cardiac function.
Murine models of rheumatoid arthritis  like disease have been essential for our understanding of disease pathogenesis and for preclinical testing of therapeutic agents. The K/BxAg7 mouse  is a well characterized model of inflammatory arthritis that develops a chronic, symmetric, progressive, and destructive arthropathy. Binding of IC and complement factors to Fc and complement receptors, respectively, expressed on neutrophils and macrophages triggers the release of inflammatory cytokines, chemokines, and proteolytic enzymes resulting in joint inflammation and destruction .
The TIM proteins are a recently discovered family of molecules that play critical roles in the regulation of effector T cells. TIM 3 is not expressed on Th2 cells but is found on Th17 cells, albeit at lower levels than on Th1 cells . TIM 3 was shown to be an important regulator of pro inflammatory immune responses, notably in the central nervous system , as blocking the TIM 3 pathway using anti TIM 3 mAbs or TIM 3 Ig fusion proteins in mice led to increased proliferation and IFNγ production in Th1 cells and exacerbated the clinical and pathological features of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis  .
  This was a prospective observational study conducted at an academic, tertiary care ED. Standardized forms were developed and utilized to track the rate of intervention associated with EM pharmacist review of prescriptions for patients being discharged from the ED. The ED is a level I burn and trauma center for both pediatric and adult patients.
Until recently, the vertebrate crown group within chordates was thought to be characterized by at least two unique features, ectodermal neurogenic placodes and migrating neural crest cells. Tunicates, or urochordates, which had been assigned the basal node of the extant chordates, were largely overlooked with respect to these features as they were believed not to share as recent an ancestry as cephalochordates and vertebrates . Vertebrate placodes include otic, olfactory, hypophyseal, lens, trigeminal, epibranchial, lateral line, and profundal placodes .
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a chronic, progressive autoimmune disease primarily affecting the synovial joints and causing both significant morbidity and increased mortality . IFN γ has several pro inflammatory properties that contribute to inflammation in arthritis. These findings indicate that IFN γ is an important pro inflammatory cytokine promoting disease severity in PGIA .
The Dominican Republic  has a long history of innovative HIV prevention programs in the female commercial sex industry. An environmental structural intervention integrating community solidarity and government policy strategies demonstrated significant reductions in sexually transmitted infections  and increases in condom use among female sex workers in the DR . Continued HIV related vulnerability, however, as documented by the frequency of STI and gaps in consistent condom use with regular partners, indicates the need to continue building upon these efforts.
Arsenic is a widely distributed environmental toxicant that can cause multi tissue pathologies. Proteomic assays allow for the identification of biological processes modulated by arsenic in diverse tissue types . The altered abundance of proteins from HaCaT human keratinocyte cell line exposed to arsenic was quantified using a label free LC MS/MS mass spectrometry workflow.
Quantifying changes in gastroduodenal permeability became more practical after Meddings et al introduced the sucrose permeability test in 1993 as a non invasive measure for assessing the extent of gastroduodenal damage induced by non steroidal anti inflammatory agents . Subsequently, several studies showed that abnormal gastroduodenal permeability to sucrose is a reasonable marker for the presence of gastroduodenal injury in NSAID users . Alcohol is another agent that disturbs the integrity of the gastrointestinal barrier.
Virtual screening, a process in which ligands are docked to the structure of a target receptor and ranked according to their interactions with the receptor, has become an integral part of identifying lead compounds in modern drug discovery. Accurately ranking closely related cogeners is essential to successfully guide the design of optimized leads; incorporating the flexibility of the target receptor and the ligand while considering their conformations is critical to achieving accurate ranking results. Ensembles can be generated by compiling experimentally determined structures or stochastically determined conformations via molecular dynamics .
Adherence, or the degree to which program components are delivered as prescribed, is an important aspect of the multidimensional construct of program fidelity. In the context of a controlled research environment, adherence to curriculum is achieved through close monitoring of facilitator training and program implementation. For this reason, standardization of program content and training protocols is often a precondition for programs to be designated “model” or “exemplary” , and strict adherence to program content is emphasized in trainings .
Mitochondria play a central role in energy metabolism, in which mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation is an extremely efficient system to produce energy required for the body . Although reactive oxygen species  are a natural byproduct during the normal oxidative phosphorylation process, increased production of ROS and decline of mitochondrial respiratory capacity is observed during aging . This theory has been broadly supported by previous reports of accumulation of mtDNA mutations with aging , as well as molecular genetic and evolutionary studies  .
Application of convection enhanced delivery  to intracerebral dosing of therapeutic molecules is intended as a method to maximize distribution per inoculation , minimizing the risks associated to multiple injections sites . CED combined with Intraoperative Magnetic Resonance Imaging  increases targeting accuracy and allows monitoring of the infusion cloud . In the last decade, adeno associated virus  serotype 2  has been the vector of choice for preclinical and clinical research in the central nervous system.
Discovery of central nervous system  drugs is challenging due to the complexity of neurological disorders, the paucity of pre clinical models with proven human translational value, and the persistent difficulty of delivering drug molecules across the blood brain barrier  to achieve optimal CNS exposure. The brain to plasma distribution ratio has been widely used in drug discovery as an index of brain penetration . However, Kp used in isolation is a misleading parameter since it is generally accepted that it is the unbound drug that exerts the physiological effect .
Muscle fatigue is defined as “any exercise induced loss of ability to produce force with a muscle or muscle group” , and can result from failure at one or more sites along the motor pathway originating from the central nervous system and ending with force loss through cross bridge cycling. Muscle fatigue has been documented as task dependent, meaning that fatigue and its mechanisms vary depending on the task the muscle performs . The cause of muscle fatigue may depend on task performance and is important to developing task specific training interventions .
Calcium hydroxide aqueous slurry is widely used as an inter appointment antimicrobial dressing in root canal treatment . Most of the calcium hydroxide aqueous slurry is composed of undissolved particles . This may result in a continuing high local pH for enhanced antimicrobial effectiveness  .
After acute antigen challenge, T cells rapidly activate, proliferate and differentiate into effector cells and then subsequently contract in number. It is increasingly clear that co inhibition is essential for maintaining a balanced immune response, the contraction of the T cell pool after clearance of antigen, and the homeostasis of immune cells . It is believed that co stimulatory signaling may be more influential during early stages of an immune response, while co inhibitory signaling may play a dominant role in later stages, aiding T cell contraction.
Ovarian cancer is the leading cause of death from gynecological malignancies . Despite the high initial response rate, up to 80% of patients will recur and eventually develop resistance to therapy, which leads to incurable disease . Addition of doxorubicin, topotecan, gemcitabine , or bevacizumab   to standard chemotherapy unfortunately has no advantages in improving patient overall survival, further indicating the significant therapeutic challenges in the treatment of ovarian cancer .
Class Ia ribonucleotide reductases  play a crucial role in DNA replication and repair catalyzing the reduction of nucleoside 5′ diphosphates  to 2′ deoxynucleoside 5′ diphosphates . E. coli RNR consists of two homodimeric subunits: α2 and β2. This thiyl radical initiates nucleotide reduction.
Both pH and temperature are vital indicators of normal metabolism and physiology in the central nervous system. Usually departure from tightly regulated temperature and pH are considered to be warning signs of life abnormal conditions. Therefore temperature and pH measurements are extremely important for both assessment, and perhaps even treatment, of various pathophysiological states .
Transmission of Schistosoma mansoni and subsequent infection of human hosts are influenced by a large number of variables that are important not only to maintain the parasite life cycle but also to determine the outcome and severity of the disease. Among these factors are those related to the environment, particularly surface water distribution, presence of the snail intermediate host, and also factors related to the human host such as age, sex, water contact behavior, type of water supply, genetics, immune response and physiology . Indeed, several studies have been carried out to understand how epidemiological, socioeconomic and behavioral factors can affect the transmission and prevalence of infection  .
Episodic memory allows us to remember past events with a striking level of detail and specificity. How does the brain accomplish this amazing feat? Although the standard reactivation paradigm has generated many important findings , it has one limitation: It focuses on the reinstatement of sets of items  rather on the reinstatement of individual items .
In a recent study we found that orthographically familiar forms of German nouns compared to orthographically unfamiliar forms of the very same phonological words  led to reduced activation in a region of the left visual ventral pathway, in left inferior parietal regions and in a large left inferior frontal language region . The location of the left occipitotemporal region, which showed an orthographic familiarity effect, roughly corresponded to that of the Visual Word Form Area  of Cohen, Dehaene and collaborators . Similar to , we contrasted case deviant and letter deviant forms with familiar forms of German nouns.
Clopidogrel is an antiplatelet drug used to prevent cardiovascular events in patients with acute coronary syndromes or a history of stroke, myocardial infarction, or peripheral arterial disease.
