Antiplatelet responses, as measured by ex vivo platelet function testing or aggregometry, are small or absent in approximately one third of patients. CYP2C19, a genetically polymorphic drug metabolizing enzyme, is one of several cytochrome P450 drug metabolizing enzymes that are involved in the two oxidative steps that generate the active metabolite of clopidogrel., Individuals with reduced function CYP2C19 alleles, particularly CYP2C19*2 homozygotes , have lower active metabolite concentrations, which results in diminished antiplatelet responses and higher cardiovascular event rates.
The dysfunction of glycogen synthase kinase 3β has been implicated in a number of diseases, including Alzheimer’s disease. The ability to non invasively quantify GSK 3βactivity in vivo is therefore of critical importance, and this work is focused upon development of inhibitors of GSK 3βradiolabeled with carbon 11 to examine quantification of the enzyme using positron emission tomography  imaging . PyrATP 1 was prepared from the corresponding desmethyl piperazine precursor in an automated synthesis module.
Histone deacetylases  represent a promising new target for drug development in cancer therapy. Compounds that inhibit HDACs are currently being tested in clinical trials as primary or adjunctive anti cancer agents. When cells experience ER stress, such as ER Ca2+ efflux or accumulation of unfolded proteins in the ER, a signal transduction cascade is initiated that triggers the unfolded protein response  .
Metals and alloys are the most commonly used materials for engineering surgically implantable devices in humans. Titanium in particular shows properties which render it a very suitable implant based on its durability and the passively formed oxide film on the metallic surface . Furthermore, titanium is the building block for engineering mechanical cardiac assist devices which can be implanted into patients with end stage heart failure in order to support the heart pump blood through the circulatory system.
Non small cell lung cancer  is a leading cause of cancer related death. PI3Ks are heterodimers that consist of the p110 catalytic subunit and p85 adaptor/regulatory subunits. These enzymes catalyze the conversion of phosphatidylinositol biphosphate  to phosphatidylinositol triphosphate .
Breast cancer ranks as the most common cancer in African American women and is the second leading cause of cancer deaths within low income populations . Although the occurrence of breast cancer in African American women is less than in Caucasians, the five year survival is only 75 percent as compared to 89 percent for Caucasians . It has been estimated that as much as one half of the disparity in breast cancer mortality for African American women, as compared to Caucasian women, can be explained by less frequent breast cancer screening that would have led to treatment at earlier stages of disease when the survival rates are much more favorable  .
Lung cancer, of which 8090% is non small cell lung cancer , has been the leading cause of cancer death in the U.S since the late 1960’s , with median survival below 8 months for disease stages III and IV . Given the wide variation in English fluency, education, culture, immigration history, and socioeconomic status  among API ethnic groups in the U.S. , these groups most likely have differential access to health care, including cancer diagnosis and treatment. Differences in treatment and stage at diagnosis, in turn, are largely responsible for other, well documented racial/ethnic disparities in survival after NSCLC .
Vision loss due to posterior eye diseases, such as age related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, glaucoma, and retinitis pigmentosa, accounts for most of the irreversible blindness world wide . However, effective drug delivery to the posterior segment of the eye still remains a challenge for treating these diseases. Systemic administration requires high doses of drugs and has the potential of causing systemic toxicities .
The vast majority of people in the contemporary US experience sexual debut sometime during adolescence and prior to marriage . Despite this statistical normality, the characterization of adolescent sexual initiation as problematic in the US is largely accepted. Concern about unintended pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections , which are more likely with younger ages at debut , is one rationale for characterizing adolescent debut as a problem behavior.
GnRH neurons form the final common pathway for the central regulation of fertility. GnRH is typically released in pulses of varying frequencies . In addition to episodic release, in females a surge mode of GnRH release also exists in which neural activity and hormone release are elevated for hours .
Each year, more than 175,000 Americans are diagnosed with acute respiratory distress syndrome  . Despite management advances such as the use of lung protective ventilation , ARDS continues to be associated with high morbidity and approximately 30 40% mortality . Patients who develop severe ARDS are typically under represented in clinical trials.
MicroRNAs are evolutionarily conserved, 2025 nucleotide long, non coding RNAs which bind to their targets through partial complementary sequence recognition. Several hundred miRNAs have been identified in human cells . It is estimated that a single miRNA can regulate hundreds of targets, and 30% or more of human mRNAs are regulated by miRNAs .
Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impairments in social functioning, stereotypica, including mental retardation , and seizure disorders, including epilepsy , are often comorbid with autism . Gamma aminobutyric acid  is the main inhibitory neurotransmitter in the brain. There are three classes of GABA receptors: GABAA, GABAB, and GABAC.
Accidental exposure to high doses of ionizing radiation often results in death due to multiple organ dysfunction. Survival as well as lung damage was mitigated by short term treatment with the superoxidedismutase catalase mimetic EUK 207 . used a similar model with 8.912.2 Gy to study radiation induced damage to the kidney.
The primary motor function of the stomach is to receive, store and prepare food for digestion . This task is made possible by the accommodation reflex which, through active relaxation of the gastric fundus, allows for a volume increase without a rise in intragastric  pressure and thus enables the stomach to incorporate large volumes during food intake . Gastric accommodation involves vago vagal reflex pathways that activate inhibitory motor neurons of the enteric nervous system in the gastric wall .
Xenotransplantation promises an unlimited supply of organs for clinical use. Pigs are thought to be the most suitable source of xenografts . Nonetheless, acute humoral xenograft rejection  ensues and leads to intravascular thrombosis .
One possible mechanism of higher cardiovascular mortality associated with the metabolic syndrome  may be through abnormal modulation in autonomic tone . The Twins Heart Study  is an investigation of psychological, behavioral and biological risk factors for subclinical cardiovascular disease using twins. Characteristics of the VET Registry have been previously reported.
Carbon monoxide  is a tasteless, odorless gaseous pollutant ubiquitous in the outdoor atmosphere, that is generated by combustion. The most definitive evidence on CO and CVD comes largely from controlled exposure studies, involving CO inhalation at concentrations to mimic exposures previously typical of urban environments. Findings of earlier epidemiological studies were mixed, and few recent epidemiological studies have been conducted.
Exposure to trauma is common among individuals with substance use disorders , particularly among those with opioid related disorders, and is associated with elevated rates of posttraumatic stress disorder . , Lifetime prevalence estimates of PTSD among patients in methadone maintenance treatment  exceed those for the general population and vary from 14 to 41%. ,,,,, An improved understanding of lifetime trauma exposure and PTSD symptoms among methadone maintained patients with a variety of pain experiences could help resource and program planning for MMT programs.
The proliferation of vascular smooth muscle cells  plays a critical role in the formation of vascular lesions, and is the major pathophysiologic mechanism responsible for the failure of interventional therapeutic approaches to treat occlusive vascular disorders, including vein bypass failure, transplant arteriosclerosis, and restenosis after balloon angioplasty . With the recognition of the essential involvement of VSMC proliferation in occlusive vascular disorders, considerable effort has been directed at characterizing biochemical and molecular pathways that regulate the proliferative response of VSMC following arterial injury. Arginase is a binuclear manganese metalloenzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of L arginine to L ornithine and urea .
The prevalence of autism spectrum disorders  has increased since the early 1990s . One in 88 American children have an ASD, a 78% increase from 2002 to 2008 . Consequently, there are a growing number of adolescents with an ASD transitioning into adulthood.
Up to 15,000 children in the United States suffer an out of hospital cardiac arrest  every year. Between 10 and 30% of pediatric OHCA patients treated in the field have sustained return of spontaneous circulation  and survive to be admitted to a pediatric intensive care unit . Of these, <40% survive to hospital discharge.
The last 20 years have witnessed remarkable progress in understanding the cellular origins and molecular mechanisms involved in the development of B cell lineage neoplasms. It has been suggested that nongenetic B cell extrinsic contributions to lymphoma induction, progression and survival may be multiple. They include engagement of the B cell receptor  by self or microbial antigens , influences mediated by T cells activated by microbial pathogens , host inflammatory responses , and the interface between tumor cells and stromal elements such as collagen interactions with integrins and other receptors .
Early adolescents are at a pivotal time in their lives regarding personal decisions that impact their future health. In this challenging stage of child development, social, environmental, and personal factors interact with each other to form the foundation from which most health related decisions develop . Today’s youth are disproportionately affected by HIV/AIDS.
Monoacylglycerol lipase  is a 33 kDa, peripherally associated membrane enzyme of the serine hydrolase superfamily that catalyzes the hydrolysis of monoacylglycerols  to free fatty acid and glycerol . MAGL contains the classical GXSXG consensus sequence common to most serine hydrolases and is predicted by sequence homology to have an α/β hydrolase fold. The catalytic triad has been identified as Ser122, His269, and Asp239 .
Transient protein modification is an essential regulatory mechanism for many biological processes. One type of transient modification, phosphorylation, is predicted to occur on approximately 1/3 of the total proteins encoded within the human genome,. Since the majority of Ser/Thr phosphorylation sites are reversible, the specificity of the phosphatases appears to be low when compared to Ser/Thr kinases .
Y box binding protein 1  is expressed in over 40% of breast cancers, but is most commonly associated with the estrogen receptor  negative subtypes . The activity of YB 1 is contingent upon phosphorylation of its serine 102 residue by p90 ribosomal S6 kinase  . Within the last decade, mounting evidence has supported the notion that cancer arises from a pool of stem/progenitor like cells, colloquially referred to as TICs .
Fc receptors  are cell surface molecules primarily expressed on effector leucocytes of the innate immune system and by binding immunoglobulins provide adaptive immunity with a cell based effector system . There are three classes of leukocyte IgG FcRs  in humans, the high affinity IgG receptor FcγRI  and the low affinity IgG receptors, FcγRII  and FcγRIII  . The two major genes of the huFcγRII family encode FcγRIIa and FcγRIIb and its splice variants.
Proteins have evolved to fold, associate and function within cells or in other physiological fluid media, where the concentration of macromolecules, including proteins, nucleic acids, and carbohydrates, can be as high as 400 g/L . Obviously, the volume occupied by solutes is unavailable to other molecules because two molecules cannot be in the same place at the same time. The thermodynamic consequences of this phenomenon are known as excluded volume effects .
The neuronal ceroid lipofuscinoses are the most common cause of pediatric neurodegeneration worldwide. There are 9 different disease variants caused by mutations in 13 identified genes. The clinical presentations of these variants are all very similar, varying primarily in age of onset and speed of progression.
Lateralization is a basic organizational feature of the nervous system that is reflected in the fact that during the course of evolution the relative size of the corpus callosum and anterior commissure has decreased while the size of intrahemispheric circuitry has increased . Thus, as new neurobehavioral functions arise during evolution, such as language, cognitive processes, and complex and coordinated arm movements, they are represented by local, lateralized circuitry. However, such neural organization of motor functions is less well understood .
Mn superoxide dismutase , one of the three mammalian superoxide dismutases, is encoded by a nuclear gene  and is then transported into the mitochondrial matrix. Increased levels of MnSOD have been shown to be protective against acute oxidative insults such as heart ischemia reperfusion injury , MPTP toxicity , adriamycin induced cardiomyopathy , and ionizing radiation damage . Higher levels of MnSOD have also been shown to confer a longer life span in Drosophila  and a longer chronological life span in yeast .
Clinically overt heart failure is the endpoint of a long disease continuum characterized by progressive structural and functional changes of the heart, a dynamic process referred to as cardiac remodeling. Given the current burden of heart failure and the projected increase over the next 5 decades, it is important to understand factors that influence cardiac remodeling over the adult life course. LV mass is an important cardiac remodeling trait that is an intermediate phenotype for heart failure, and is also associated with increased risk for various cardiovascular disease  outcomes.
Hematopoietic stem cells  are able to self renew as well as give rise to all blood lineages. HSCs mainly reside in specialized bone marrow microenvironments, called HSC niches. However, the identity of these signals and the molecular mechanisms governing HSC fate largely remain elusive.
Overweight and obesity are at unprecedented levels. Advertisers capitalize on these responses, inundating potential customers with pictures of juicy hamburgers, crisp fries, and creamy chocolate desserts. These dollars are not wasted; subjective cravings for energy dense  foods are associated with an attentional bias toward those foods , increased eating of ED foods , and future increases in weight  .
In both eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells, cytoskeletal proteins are likely to assemble in vivo into structures with a thickness greater than a single molecule and the formation of lateral interactions between individual filaments and their regulation may have important consequences for understanding filament assembly and function. An example of suprastructures formed in eukaryotic cells is the actin cytoskeleton, where parallel actin bundles have been observed near the cell surface in lamellopodia or filapodia. One of the best studied in vitro system of supramolecular condensates experimentally and theoretically is DNA, which also exists in highly condensed, tightly packed states in viruses and sperm cells in vivo.
Loss of cell polarization and luminal filling of mammary glands are crucial structural alterations in breast cancer . However, the role of transcription factors in regulating the expression of genes implicated in formation of the luminal space and in cell polarization during mammary epithelial gland formation is not well defined . The Runx transcription factors  are essential for organogenesis, and mutations in these genes have been linked to several types of cancer .
Rhabdomyosarcomas are the largest subset of soft tissue sarcomas in infants and children and are highly heterogeneous, clinically aggressive tumors that show varying degrees of skeletal muscle differentiation . The two main histological patterns recognized include embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma  and alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma . Morphologic evaluation alone is often insufficient to make the distinction between ARMS and ERMS as some ARMS lack the alveolar architecture  and ERMS can be densely cellular and poorly differentiated .
Neurotransmission at chemical synapses is initiated by an action potential in the pre synaptic nerve terminal that opens Ca2+ channels and triggers exocytosis of neurotransmitter. Different forms of short term plasticity are recognized based on the pattern of activity required for their generation and the characteristic time course of their decay. In contrast, augmentation and post tetanic potentiation follow repetitive stimulation and last for seconds or minutes, respectively.
Lung cancer is a devastating disease that affects over 200,000 individuals in the U.S. each year . The number of affected individuals throughout the world is, of course, several times greater and it has been estimated that 1.2 million people die worldwide from lung cancer each year . The prognosis for patients diagnosed with lung cancer is often poor and dependent on a number of factors including the stage at which the disease is diagnosed and the responsiveness of the tumor to treatment.
Cytochromes P450  are obligatory enzymes in metabolism of cholesterol, steroid hormones and vitamin D3, in mitochondria . Partial or complete lack of CYP27A1 activity results in a disease cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis manifested by a variety of phenotypes including tendon xanthomas, bilateral cataracts, premature atherosclerosis, osteoporosis, neurological and neuropsychiatric abnormalities . Several different approaches have been used previously to study membrane topology of mitochondrial P450s .
The first evidence incriminating Akt in oncogenesis was provided by studies of acute transforming viruses. The predicted oncoprotein contained viral Gag sequences fused to a cellularly derived protein related to protein kinase C. The oncogenic potential of v akt was found to arise from the creation of a myristylation signal at the amino terminus, with consequent constitutive kinase activity  . Transgenic mice in which the Lck promoter is used to drive expression of MyrAkt  in early thymocyte development are unique among Akt transgenic models in that they develop tumors spontaneously.
LTP in CA1 hippocampal pyramidal neurons is believed to represent one form of the cellular basis for learning and memory . NMDA type glutamate receptor  engagement induces elevation of intracellular calcium, which in turn activates Erk. This event is required for many types of LTP .
Substantial evidence exists to indicate that T cell responses can mediate the suppression and elimination of tumors in animal models and in human subjects . The type of DC most widely used for immunotherapy is the monocyte derived DC , which is differentiated in vitro from peripheral blood monocyte precursors in the presence of IL 4 and GM CSF. Following differentiation, DC must undergo a maturation step before they gain the ability to induce and enhance anti tumor T cell responses .
Angiogenin  is a 14 kDa ribonuclease originally identified as an angiogenic protein  that has been shown to play an important role in tumor angiogenesis . ANG undergoes nuclear translocation in endothelial cells where it stimulates rRNA transcription . Recently, ANG has been shown to be progressively upregulated in prostate cancer  and to play a direct role in cancer cell proliferation by constitutive nuclear translocation in cancer cells where it also stimulates rRNA transcription .
The structural Microtubule Associated Proteins  of neurons consist of two classes,the HMW MAPs  and the Tau family. In contrast with MAP1a,b in which the MT binding domains are located in the N terminal domain , MAP2 and Tau isoforms contain tubulin binding motives in the C terminal domain while the N terminal domain of the molecules form a projection extending away from the MT wall . MAPs accelerate the polymerization of tubulin dimers and induce the stabilization of the MT polymers .
Alcohol abuse and dependence remain public health problems, with the worldwide prevalence of alcohol use disorders being 1.7% and the prevalence in the United States being 8.5% with an annual cost of 185 billion dollars . The deleterious effects of alcohol abuse on societal health are staggering . The central cholinergic system has been implicated in the development of alcohol and/or drug abuse .
TGFβ signals through a heterotetrameric receptor complex comprising type II receptors and type I receptors, both serine/threonine kinases, followed by a canonical SMAD dependent signaling cascade. The TGFβ SMAD cascade in epithelial cells is growth suppressive. The disruption of TGFβ SMAD suppressive signaling is advantageous for the cancer cells to grow .
CD4+ T helper cells can differentiate into different functional subsets defined by patterns of cytokine production , TH2, TH 17). TH 17 cells produce IL 17A, IL 17F, IL 21, and IL 22, and are important in host defense against certain bacteria and fungi and implicated in autoimmune diseases including Crohn’s disease and psoriasis , . IL 4 drives TH2 differentiation; STAT6 has been considered to be the most important STAT protein for mediating IL 4 signaling ,, and STAT5A  was reported to augment IL 4 production by altering chromatin accessibility at the Il4 gene locus in differentiated TH2 cells .
Genital herpes is a chronic, lifelong disease caused by herpes simplex virus  that is characterized by unpredictable recurrences. It is one of the most common sexually transmitted diseases worldwide, and the primary cause of genital ulcer disease in the developed and developing countries . HSV 2 has been the main cause for genital herpes, whereas HSV 1 has been predominantly associated with orofacial infections, herpetic keratitis, and herpes encephalitis .
Valsalva maneuver  is commonly used as a provocative maneuver to augment right to left shunting through patent foramen ovale . Obstructive sleep apnea  occurs when a sleeping patient attempts to inhale against an obstructed airway, and several reports suggest that OSA might also provoke right to left shunting. However, no previous studies explored the hemodynamic basis for this notion.
The extracellular signal regulated kinases ERK1/2 are among the most prominent signal transduction molecules through which extracellular stimuli are propagated from the cell surface to cytoplasmic and nuclear effectors. ERK1  and ERK2  exhibit 84% sequence identity and are uniquely and coordinately activated through the sequential phosphorylation of the classical three tier mitogen activated protein kinase  cascade. The orchestration of cortical development occurs primarily through the actions of growth factors that signal through receptor tyrosine kinases  to control cell cycle initiation, progression, and cell fate decisions in neural progenitor cells .
The human cerebral cortex was first mapped into more than 47 areas by histological descriptions such as cell shapes and packing density . It is unclear how the size and shape of cortical functional areas are accurately organized in order to conduct complex behaviors . This simple and parallel cortical organization makes the mouse an excellent model for the investigation, using genetic and molecular approaches, of how cortical areas are formed in humans .
One out of every four children in the United States fails to achieve basic reading skills by the eighth grade . In the population of children with neurodevelopmental conditions, data suggest that these failure rates are even higher. Learning disorders may occur, independent from intellectual problems.
More than one billion children worldwide live in areas affected by armed conflict. Of these children, a majority live in sub Saharan Africa  . In addition to the risk of physical harm, war affected children often experience direct and indirect exposure to violence, disrupted family functioning, damaged social structures, limited access to a range of traditional or formal services, all of which serve to increase risks for mental health problems .
Both stress urinary incontinence  and pelvic organ prolapse  are common conditions and many women will choose to undergo surgical treatment due to patient preference or dissatisfaction with conservative therapy. Because the prevalence of both SUI and POP have been shown to increase with age,  it is expected that the number of older women undergoing surgical treatment for these conditions will also increase. There is a growing body of evidence showing that although older women may be at higher risk for morbidity following procedures for pelvic floor disorders, the absolute risk of death is very small.
Major depressive disorder  is currently recognized as one of the leading causes of disease related disability worldwide and is predicted to be the leading cause by 2020 . Unfortunately, the debilitating effects of MDD  are not limited to the individuals diagnosed; when parents are depressed, their depression has the potential to adversely impact their children. However, not all research with this population has supported a relation between parental depressive symptoms and negative child outcome .
Prostate cancer is the second most fatal cancer among men in the United States, accounting for approximately 28,000 deaths in 2008 . Considerable epidemiologic attention in prostate cancer has focused on the vitamin D endocrine system and on calcium . Although numerous studies have investigated prostate cancer with respect to calcium intake from the diet, the subject of calcium in serum has received scarce attention, perhaps because calcium levels in serum are believed to be under strict homeostatic control.
Many methods of recombinant protein purification have been developed. One of the most widely used techniques is the His tag affinity purification. A small His tag  is fused to either the N or C terminus of the target protein, enabling capture by nickel or cobalt ions coordinated on a variety of commercially available resins.
Most proteins are marginally stable and degrade by numerous pathways in aqueous solution., The degradation processes can often be inhibited by keeping properly formulated proteins in a frozen state . At a laboratory scale, cryopreservation provides an effective way for researchers to preserve precious protein samples and standards, minimize interexperiment variability and maximize flexibility for experimental design and scheduling. In turn, aggregates of therapeutic proteins may elicit undesirable immune responses, such as the generation of antidrug antibodies.
PPARγ, a dynamic nuclear transcriptional regulator, has well characterized roles in adipocyte differentiation, lipid metabolism and insulin sensitivity, . In the PROACTIVE trial, the PPARγ agonist pioglitazone had beneficial effects on the combined secondary endpoints of myocardial infarction, stroke and death. The putative PPARγ agonist lysophosphatidic acid  accelerates neointimal formation after vessel injury in rodents in a PPARγ dependent manner, suggesting that activation of PPARγ may promote the development of intimal hyperplasia.
In the retinal inner plexiform layer , rod and cone pathways are linked to output ganglion cells via abundant gap junctions . Cx36 containing junctions, in particular, exhibit large scale ultrastructural diversity , with different forms correlated with different complements of the gap junction scaffolding and regulatory proteins zonula occludens 1 , ZO 2 and ZONAB  . However, ultrastructural associations of Cx45 with Cx36, morphologies of Cx45 containing gap junctions, and identities of Cx45 associated scaffolding proteins are not established .
The accuracy of diet and disease associations is largely dependent upon the quality of dietary exposure assessment. However, assessing dietary intake in free living populations poses several challenges. Also, although biologically based assessments of nutritional status are optimal, biomarkers are not always feasible or practical for widespread use in population based investigations .
Tuberculosis  is a serious infectious disease caused by the Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacterium. Therefore, there is an urgent need for the development of new drugs and suitable therapeutic targets. The two ZmDXR enzymes present in the PDB have been resolved in complex with an acetate ion in one structure and with NADPH in the other  .
There has been a rapid rise in the use of anti hypertensive medications in pregnancy during the past decade. Recent data demonstrate that the most common 1st trimester antihypertensive exposure is beta adrenergic blocking agents, with nearly 0.5% of all pregnant women exposed to these medications during this trimester. The most concerning potential adverse effect of first trimester medication exposure is teratogenicity.
Alzheimer's disease  is characterized by the presence of β amyloid plaques, composed predominantly of the Aβ peptide, a 40  or 42 amino acid cleavage product of the amyloid precursor protein . Although much is known about the processing of APP to generate or prevent generation of Aβ , relatively little is known about the physiological function of APP itself. The extracellular domain of APP interacts with the extracellular matrix  protein F spondin , and F spondin alters the trafficking of APP and its processing to Aβ .
Vestibular schwannomas  originate from Schwann cells  of the vestibular nerve and typically occur as either unilateral, sporadic tumors or as bilateral tumors in patients with neurofibromatosis type 2  . Both sporadic and NF2 associated VSs result from loss of function of the NF2 tumor suppressor gene . Merlin, the protein product of the NF2 gene, regulates several signaling events that control tumor growth .
Men with a family history of prostate cancer and African American men are at increased risk for developing prostate cancer , with subsets at increased risk of aggressive disease and/or death from the disease . There is a need to better refine risk estimates for prostate cancer among high risk men in order to provide individualized screening recommendations based on predicted risk . BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations have been reported to raise the risk for prostate cancer in males from families with hereditary breast and ovarian cancer syndrome  .
Translation termination takes place when one of three stop codons is recognized by a proteinaceous class 1 release factor  in the A site of the ribosome. These local structural changes, triggered by cognate codon recognition, lead to global rearrangements  in the ribosome that result in accelerated rates of GTPase activation  and tRNA accommodation, and thus to accurate tRNA selection during the elongation cycle. And, again, these views yielded detailed information only on the structural state of the decoding center and for the near cognate case only when paromomycin was simultaneously bound.
Helicobacter pylori  infection is among the most frequent human bacterial infections worldwide. Chronic H. pylori infection is a risk factor for peptic ulcer disease and gastric cancer, yet there remain gaps in knowledge regarding its natural history and determinants of chronic infection. The infection is usually acquired in childhood,,  but patterns of persistence and spontaneous clearance have not been well described.
“Any emotion, if it is sincere, is involuntary.” Mark TwainDeep brain stimulation  is an effective treatment for many neurological diseases, ameliorating select disease features by modulating brain activity. DBS of various brain regions and circuit pathways has been employed to treat many basal ganglia related disorders . DBS has been utilized more recently to treat medication refractory neuropsychiatric disease  .
Allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant  is used as a curative therapy for a large number of malignant and non malignant hematologic diseases. Graft versus host disease  is the major reason for non relapse mortality and is staged and graded according to severity of symptoms in three target organs . Effective GVHD prevention remains an area of active clinical research, but at present most patients are administered prophylactic agents that interfere with T lymphocyte numbers or function .
Myasthenia gravis  and experimental autoimmune myasthenia gravis , are caused by antibody mediated autoimmune responses to nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  which impair neuromuscular transmission . At least half of the autoantibodies in both MG and EAMG are directed at the main immunogenic region  on AChR α1 subunits . The α1 sequence 6676, the MIR loop, is crucial to the MIR .
As part of the development of atherosclerotic plaques, calcium is deposited in the arterial wall by a process that is histologically similar to bone formation. Coronary calcium occurs exclusively in atherosclerotic arteries and is absent in the normal vessel wall. Thoracic calcification may be atherosclerotic and also contribute to aortic stiffness, which has also been associated with adverse outcomes.
Gastrointestinal stromal tumors  are the most common mesenchymal tumors of the gastrointestinal tract, with an estimated annual incidence of 5,0006,000 cases in the United States . Approximately 1015% of GISTs from adult patients lack mutations in these genes . Tumor response to IM correlates with KIT or PDGFRA mutational status .
The noradrenergic nucleus locus coeruleus  provides the sole source of noradrenergic innervation of the main olfactory bulb  . Noradrenergic fibers terminate in all but the most superficial MOB layers, densely targeting the internal plexiform and granule cell  layers with a more moderate density in the mitral cell and external plexiform layers . The LC system plays well documented roles in modulation of behavioral state and sensory processing including olfactory function.
Craniofacial wounds resulting from injury trauma or iatrogenic sources  present a major problem for surgery. However, problems exist with this approach , including the shortage of the amount of available bony tissue that can be harvested from the patient  and associated significant morbidities . More recently attention has been paid to growth factor therapies, specifically bone morphogenetic protein 2 , a member of the transforming growth factor beta  superfamily.
Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease  is the most common monogenic kidney disease and the fourth leading cause of end stage kidney disease worldwide., Polycystic liver disease , arbitrarily defined as the presence of any liver cyst, is its most common extrarenal expression., Symptoms of PLD relate to effects from the volume of hepatic cysts or complications such as cyst hemorrhage, rupture, or infection. Massive hepatomegaly can cause compression of the adjacent gastrointestinal tract, vasculature, and diaphragm. Highly symptomatic PLD has become more common due to reduced cardiovascular mortality, extended renal survival and life expectancy on renal replacement therapy.
Herpes simplex virus type 1  is widespread, with seropositivity estimates of 45% to 98% worldwide and 57% to 85% of adults in the United States . HSV 1induced diseases, including genital lesions, cold sores in and around the mouth, corneal disease that can lead to impaired vision, and viral encephalitis, are all more likely to occur following viral reactivations rather than primary infection. The HSV 1 latency associated transcript  gene is the only viral gene whose transcript is readily and consistently detected during neuronal latency .
N methyl D aspartate receptors  mediate excitatory transmission and are involved in synaptic function associated with long term synaptic changes, oscillations, bursting behavior, learning, and memory . Acetylcholine  released from terminals of neurons whose cell body are located in the Nucleus Basalis  modulates the behavior of many cortical areas by activation of muscarinic receptors  and nicotinic receptors . Excitatory synaptic transmission in the primary auditory neocortex is subject to a particularly intense cholinergic modulation .
Reactive oxygen species , such as superoxide  and hydrogen peroxide , are implicated in the development of multiple cardiovascular disease pathologies, including hypertension, atherosclerosis and restenosis. Physiologically, ROS mediate many cellular functions such as proliferation, gene expression, migration, differentiation, and cytoskeletal remodeling. One major source of ROS is the NADPH oxidase  family of enzymes .
Type 1 diabetes  is a common chronic illness that affects approximately 1 in every 400600 youth in the United States under the age of 20 . The impact of T1D care on parent functioning is extensive. Parents of both preschool and older age children with T1D regularly experience elevated levels of parenting stress, anxiety, and depression .
Integrins are among the most important cell adhesion molecules in metazoa. They play a key role in development, immune responses, leukocyte trafficking, homeostasis and cancer. The β subunits contain an I like domain, which is inserted within the hybrid domain.
Injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve  results in vocal fold paresis or paralysis. Treatment with neurotrophic growth factors such as vascular endothelial growth factor  is one approach that has the potential to preserve and restore functional innervation to axotomized vocal folds. In the nervous system, alternative splicing results in the generation of at least 5 different VEGF isoforms .
For several decades, the go to list of behavioral risk factors for chronic disease epidemiology has included smoking, alcohol consumption, physical activity, diet, and body habitus. In recent years, some researchers have added sleep duration to this list . These associations are particularly alarming when coupled with the common assertion that Americans are sleeping less than they used to, suggesting that a long term societal trend in sleep duration could be a significant contributor to the serious public health problems of increasing obesity and diabetes .
A variety of distinct visual manual signed languages have emerged, independently of the surrounding spoken languages, in Deaf communities around the globe. The question arises whether the right and left hemispheres play the same relative roles during language processing in signers as they do in speakers. Left hemisphere  damage in signers results in typical patterns of aphasia , while RH lesions have more subtle, if any, effects on grammar, fluency, or semantics .
An estimated 5.4 million South Africans are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus  . For example, this challenging task is more difficult when one seeks to translate a health measure from one language to another  as compared to producing a same language version . For example, translating a measure of nutritional intake would require one to establish an understanding of the types of locally available foods and measurement system , but would not require the researcher to establish whether individuals in the target group ingests food to survive.
Sex steroids and glucocorticoids have long been utilized in the clinic to control allergy, asthma and autoimmune diseases due to their anti inflammatory effects. Multiple sclerosis  is a debilitating neurological autoimmune disease with higher incidence in women. However, MS relapse rates are decreased during late pregnancy and treatment with pregnancy levels of estriol reduces CNS lesions.
Verbs are fundamentally different from nouns. Verb argument structure can specify one, two, or three nominal arguments in roles such as agent, theme, recipient, goal or experiencer. Despite this apparent vulnerability of verb argument structure in SLI, only a few studies have yet compared object naming with action naming in children with SLI using a picture naming task .
Collapse of the primary cavitation bubbles generated by a high intensityacoustic pulse can produce an extensive population of residual bubble nuclei . The resulting daughter bubbles are microscopic in size  and can persist for tens of milliseconds or even full seconds , depending on the conditions underwhich they were generated. As such, residual bubble nuclei imparta cavitation memory to their host medium, influencing the threshold, extent, anddistribution of ensuing cavitation events  .
Two significant milestones have characterized the pediatric HIV epidemic. The next major hurdle is the containment of the epidemic in resource limited settings, particularly in HIV infected children. The HIV 1 RNA levels remain relatively high and fluctuate over the years in symptomatic as well as in asymptomatic children, making it a less reliable tool for prediction of disease progression and for initiation of therapy .
With the recent development of molecularly targeted agents, numerous epidermal growth factor receptor inhibitors  have been developed and some are approved for treatment of nonsmall cell lung cancer , head and neck squamous cell carcinoma , and colorectal cancer . There are two main classes of EGFRIs:  small molecule tyrosine kinase inhibitors  such as gefitinib and erlotinib, and  monoclonal antibodies such as cetuximab and panitumumab. Although the response rates to these agents as monotherapy in unselected patients are modest, several studies have shown that survival is improved even in unselected patients .
Poly polymerase  1 and 2 enzymes regulate DNA damage repair and maintain genomic stability in cells. Inhibition of DNA repair by small molecule PARP inhibitors potentiates DNA damage caused by cytotoxic chemotherapies, including cyclophosphamide . Clinical activity is observed with PARP inhibitors alone and in combination with cytotoxic chemotherapy in patients with breast or ovarian cancers carrying germline BRCA mutations  .
Total joint replacement  is a highly successful procedure for the treatment of severe destructive arthritis. While failures of the surgery due to infections and errors have been greatly reduced in recent years, aseptic prosthetic loosening remains the most common complication of total joint replacement and represents a major problem for the long term success and survival of prostheses. These cytokines in turn provoke cellular proliferation, promote osteoclastogenesis, and stimulate mature osteoclasts to absorb the adjacent bone.
Central sensitization is a complex phenomenon of synaptic plasticity characterized by the rapid onset activity dependent increase in the excitability of nociceptive spinal dorsal horn neurons . It has recently become clear that there are distinct forms of central sensitization. These include other immediate onset, transcription independent phenomena, such as wind up and long term potentiation .
Genetic factors are important for developing a psychotic disorder, the heritability for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, the two most common psychotic illnesses, are both above 0.80 . While recent genome wide association studies have successfully localized a number of statically significant risk loci, these findings only explain a fraction of the genetic variance associated with psychotic illnesses. Comprehensive neuropsychological research has established cognitive impairment as an intrinsic feature of psychosis .
A key step in the progression of atherosclerotic lesions is formation of lipid loaded macrophage foam cells. Soluble lipoproteins accumulate at sites of atherosclerotic plaque formation where they undergo modification, aggregation and anchoring to the extracellular matrix. These cholesteryl ester  filled foam cells acquire new biological properties, particularly loss of motility; secretion of cytokines, growth factors and proteases; and induction of apoptosis, .
Food allergies pose significant risk of morbidity and mortality, particularly in young children. Broadly, the hygiene hypothesis suggests that reduced exposure to pathogens or their components early in life results in an increased IgE response to allergens and a subsequent increase in allergic diseases. Despite not knowing the precise immune mechanisms that account for increased frequencies of atopic patients, one approach to testing the hygiene hypothesis has been to identify inverse relationships between rates of allergic hypersensitivities and immunity to pathogens in hypersensitive patients.
The temporal fine structure of a sound is the cycle by cycle timing of the waveform. Electrical stimulation of the auditory nerve through cochlear implants bypasses that imprecision. For those reasons, one might hypothesize that temporal perception should be more acute in electrical hearing than in normal hearing.
Astrocytes have recently gained prominence as essential mediators of the brain’s innate immune response to a variety of brain insults including infection. In addition, astrocytes upregulate the intermediate filament glial fibrillary acidic protein  and form a physical barrier around the microbes and the infiltrating immune cells. This barrier function is a key characteristic of astrocytes during infection and serves to protect the brain from immune cell infiltration and neuronal injury .
Parkinson disease  is a prevalent neurodegenerative movement disorder characterized pathologically by the rather selective loss of dopaminergic  neurons in the substantia nigra pars compacta . Of these, LRRK2 mutations are currently recognized as the most common genetic cause of parkinsonism . To date, a large number of LRRK2 mutations have been identified.
Fucosidosis caused by deficiency of the lysosomal enzyme α L fucosidase is a progressive neurological lysosomal storage disease . Hypomyelination is the failure of normal myelin deposition that is attributable to oligodendrocyte dysfunction during active postnatal myelination . Downregulation of oligodendrocyte and myelin specific genes at 16 weeks in the frontal cerebrum of fucosidosis affected pups  suggests that the 14% loss of corpus callosum myelin in fucosidosis at this time   may be due to hypomyelination, rather than active myelin destruction.
Dentin matrix protein 1 , originally postulated to be dentin specific , was later detected in bone . The distinctive feature of DMP1 is the presence of many acidic domains, a property that implicates it is a possible participant in regulating matrix mineralization. The importance of DMP1 in biomineralization has been demonstrated by a number of studies  .
Photodynamic therapy  is an emerging treatment that has been used to treat malignant, premalignant, and benign conditions . It has received health regulatory agency approval in many countries throughout the world, and clinical trials continue to establish new applications. Among these, an interesting and pressing application of PDT is in treating malignant tumors in patients that have not responded to more traditional therapies or which have recurred and may be otherwise untreatable  .
Pain is a compound sensation that indicates real or potential injury. One way to characterize afferent pain pathways is to distinguish between phylogenetically younger ascending nociceptive pathways that convey sensory discriminative information from the spinal cord to the ventral posterolateral thalamus and somatosensory cortex, and phylogenetically older pathways that terminate in the medial/intralaminar complex of the thalamus and limbic areas, and are involved in affective and cognitive aspects of pain as well as stress responses . Processing of nociceptive information in higher brain structures activates descending pathways that modulate pain.
Bacterial DNA topoisomerase I belongs to the type IA family of DNA topoisomerase. This class of enzyme removes excess negative supercoiling from chromosomal DNA by cleaving the single stranded region of negatively supercoiled DNA while forming a covalent complex with the cleaved DNA, followed by passage of a second single DNA strand through the break, and rejoining of the cleaved DNA strand. Topoisomerase poisons targeting type IB and type IIA topoisomerases are effective antibacterial and anti cancer agents because these drugs can inhibit the DNA rejoining step of these topoisomerases .
Signaling from receptors in the plasma membrane requires a strong correlation between the extracellular stimulus and downstream intracellular events if information is not to be lost. The mechanisms by which changes in extracellular stimulus intensity are reliably converted into graded changes in cellular activity have not been fully resolved. IP3 receptors  are intracellular Ca2+ channels located on the endoplasmic reticulum .
During development, extracellular cues activate conserved signal transduction pathways, which trigger changes in gene expression and ultimately lead to pleiotropic effects, including growth and differentiation. Moreover, a dominant active form of Stat3 called Stat3 c is oncogenic, transforms fibroblasts and causes tumors in nude mice . We and others have previously shown that the JAK/STAT pathway plays important roles in growth and patterning of the Drosophila eye.
Dog allergy is a public health burden highly associated with both asthma and allergic rhinitis. Contributing to this disease burden is the presence of around 53 million domestic dogs in the United States residing in approximately 33% of US homes. The magnitude of this problem makes it important to identify factors related to the accumulation of the major dog allergen Canis familiaris 1  in homes .
Growth factors are strongly associated with cancer development. Insulin like growth factor 1  and IGF2 are major growth factors involved in development and growth. During fetal growth IGF2 plays the main role in development and mice with IGF2 disruption exhibit serious growth retardation at birth .
Red cell distribution width  is routinely assessed as part of the complete blood count  to gather information on the heterogeneity in the size of circulating erythrocytes. Computationally, RDW is the coefficient of variation of the mean corpuscular volume  and therefore higher RDW values reflect greater heterogeneity in MCV , which is usually caused by perturbation in erythrocyte maturation or degradation. The RDW is used as an auxiliary index to help diagnose different types of anemia, but has also been evaluated as a potential screening marker for colon cancer and celiac disease because of its responsiveness to subtle nutrient deficiency.
The master circadian clock in mammals is a gene driven neural network that temporally regulates behavior and physiology. 20,000 neurons, and is located in the suprachiasmatic nuclei of the hypothalamus  . At a gross level, the SCN's control of circadian behavior is clearly established as SCN lesions result in behavioral circadian arrhythmicity  that can be restored by SCN transplants .
Salmonella enterica is a leading cause of bacterial gastro enteritis in humans worldwide . While most S. enterica infections are self limiting, serious cases often require treatment with antibiotics. For several decades, an increase in antibiotic resistance has been noted in S. enterica, as in other gram negative bacteria .
Herbicides represent an important group of agricultural pesticides. Propanil exposure has been associated with toxicity in humans and other mammals. Chloracne observed in industrial workers during propanil manufacture was originally ascribed to propanil, but subsequent studies have demonstrated that this toxicity was due to chemical contaminants .
A preovulatory prolactin surge is evident on proestrous afternoon in rats . The preovulatory rise in progesterone  on proestrous afternoon augments the magnitude or extends the duration of this prolactin surge . This proestrous prolactin surge may have a luteolytic role to maintain the estrous cycle  .
One important observation about trabecular bone is its ability to adapt its structure according to the specific mechanical environment, as commonly defined as “Wolff's law” . To overcome the limitation of the current bone imaging techniques, researchers have developed alternative modalities to assess bone quality and predict fracture risk . Quantitative ultrasound , a safe, low cost, portable, radiation free and noninvasive imaging tool, has been widely used for bone quality assessment since it was introduced  .
A common mechanism through which activated receptor tyrosine kinases control intracellular pathways involves recruitment of SH2 containing proteins with regulatory or adaptor functions . Loss of inhibitors can result in dysregulation of growth factor signaling, promoting the re wiring of metabolic pathways in a manner that supports rapid growth and cell survival. This re wiring provides proliferating cells with biosynthetic precursors from increased glucose derived carbon intermediates that are essential for increasing cell biomass .
Rapid advances in magnetic resonance imaging  have enabled noninvasive exploration of the human brain with increasing level of detail. Large databases of MR images are being assembled to enable researchers to examine subtle relationships between quantitative brain anatomy, disease progression, treatment regimens, risk, and other factors for various diseases. This research has been recently extended to an investigation of genetic influences on brain structure.
Sudden cardiac death  results in 250,000 to 400,000 deaths in the United States annually. Coronary heart disease , with or without myocardial infarction , is the most common substrate underlying SCD in the western world, being responsible for approximately 75% of SCDs. However, the majority of individuals who die suddenly are not in recognized high risk subsets, and over half have no clinically recognized heart disease prior to death.
Over 40 years ago, Tokuhata and Lilienfeld  provided clear epidemiologic evidence for familial aggregation of lung cancer after accounting for personal smoking, suggesting the possible interaction of genes and smoking behavior in the etiology of lung cancer. The familial effects were most pronounced among smoking relatives, for which the case relatives showed a 2.4 fold higher risk compared to smoking relatives of controls. similarly showed a 2.5 fold higher risk in the relatives of cases compared with controls after conditioning on smoking behavior and age.
Differentiation between acute and older MIs is of great importance in clinical decision making. In the last decade, delayed enhancement  inversion recovery gradient echo  MRI with standard extracellular contrast agents became the most important and accurate imaging tool for assessing either the localization, the transmurality, or the extent, of MIs . DE is also capable of differentiating stunned myocardium from necrotic tissue in the acute phase , and hibernated myocardium from scar tissue in the chronic phase, of a MI .
Unintended pregnancy, defined as a pregnancy that is either unwanted or mistimed, is a serious global health issue related to a host of adverse health outcomes  including maternal and infant/child morbidity and mortality  as well as negative social consequences, such as school drop out . In 2012, 42% of pregnancies in Honduras were either unwanted or mistimed . Although there have been major improvements in health status in recent decades in Latin America, these improvements have not been equally distributed across socioeconomic groups.
Proponents of translational research have identified practice based research  and practice based research networks  as essential for answering questions relevant to primary care and for overcoming barriers to the implementation of existing evidence into community based primary care practice. Family physicians in PBRNs have been contributing new knowledge to the discipline of family medicine for the past three decades. The Ambulatory Sentinel Practice Network  began collecting data in 1982 and published research on important primary care subjects such as headaches, spontaneous abortion, cough in children and carpal tunnel syndrome.
Epithelial to mesenchymal transition  enables the migration of epithelial cells into connective tissues, a critical process for embryonic development . It has also been shown that epithelial cells can be endowed with stem like properties through EMT . It has been recently shown that EMT is modulated by transcription factors that regulate E cadherin, e.g. Snail , Twist , and ZEB1 .
Coffee and tea, the most frequently consumed beverages in the world, contain high levels of caffeine and polyphenols. Caffeine is well known to be a stimulant of the central nervous system and has many physiological effects on the brain, including decreasing cerebral blood flow . Although the in vivo effects of caffeine on brain tumors are not known, decreased cerebral blood flow could potentially affect angiogenesis by reducing access to nutrients and oxygen.
Among the multiple forms of age related hearing loss , the form associated with degeneration of cochlear stria vascularis  has been suggested to demonstrate the clearest genetic influences in humans . However, few mouse strains have been shown to possess the essential feature of this condition, namely delayed decline in the endocochlear potential . Through a detailed comparison of BALB/cJ  and C57BL/6J  mice, we showed that BALBs exhibit a lifelong EP pattern that is predicted by the density of strial marginal cells , while the overall appearance of the stria remains largely normal.
Adenovirus  has been found in every class of vertebrates including mammals, birds, fish, amphibians and reptiles . At least 11 structural proteins combine to form the non enveloped icosahedral adenovirus capsid that contains the dsDNA protein core complex. Each capsid facet has 12 trimers of the major coat protein, hexon.
The majority of cancer occurs as a result of alterations in oncogenes. Ligands of EGFR bind to the ectodomain of the receptor, leading to the formation of catalytically active receptor homo  and heterodimers in which the EGFR associates with other ErbB receptors. Although HER2 cannot bind any of the ErbB ligands directly, its catalytic activity can potently amplify signaling by ErbB containing heterodimers .
Human immunodeficiency virus  infection within the central nervous system  causes a variety of neuropathological changes. Neurons are not generally thought to be infected by HIV, although latent neuron infection has been reported . Neuropathology is instead mediated by direct neurotoxic actions of released viral proteins, or secondarily, through toxic effects orchestrated by glial cells .
Parkinson's disease  is characterized by progressive nigrostriatal degeneration and deficits in dopamine transmission. A pathological hallmark of PD are Lewy bodies  that present as intracellular inclusions of aggregated proteins and lipids in dopaminergic  neurons . In transgenic mutant α syn mice, and in mice treated with 1 methyl 4 phenyl 1,2,3,6 tetrahydopyridine  and rotenone  similar microglial responses are operative.
While many youth face obstacles to the successful development of sexual health, gay and bisexual youth and other young men who have sex with men  face particular challenges in this respect due to lack of support in the settings that traditionally promote positive youth development. Parents, who play a critical role in the development of sexual health among heterosexual youth , may become silent in this respect if they are unaware or unwilling to acknowledge the sexual orientation of their children. Unfortunately, peers may victimize sexual minority youth , which can produce shame that inhibits self acceptance.
Living organisms exhibit daily rhythms in physiology, behaviour, and gene expression due to the existence of endogenous circadian clocks. These clocks synchronize biological processes to the 24 h light/dark cycle, allowing the organisms to anticipate changes in their environment. In metazoans, the generation of circadian rhythmicity appears to be consequence of specialised tissues known as “master clocks”, which have different locations among species, i.e. lateral neurons in Drosophila , the pineal gland and retina in fish , pineal gland, retina and hypothalamus in birds , and the hypothalamic suprachiasmatic nuclei  in mammals  .
Advancing age has a significant impact on retinal structure, physiology and function. Age is a leading risk factor in age related macular degeneration, glaucoma, and vascular occlusive diseases., However, most optically based BF imaging techniques are limited to imaging the fovea or the optic nerve head, are confounded by media opacity if present , and are qualitative or semi quantitative which makes comparison across different subjects challenging . In awake humans, the challenges of BF MRI are eye motion and limited spatial resolution of clinical MRI systems.
A number of mental disorders and altered physiological states are increasingly being associated with fetal antecedent events . Around the time of birth, the sex steroid hormone environment is important for brain sexual differentiation and the development of neuroendocrine systems; however, the precise timing of critical periods differs between species. Vinclozolin is a widely used dicarboximide fungicide previously described as an anti androgenic compound in mammals .
Numerous studies have shown that limitations in activities of daily living  are associated with institutionalization, death, and high health care costs. Because of this, assessment of ADL function has become a key component of geriatric assessment. However, ADL difficulty represents a fairly advanced stage of functional decline, and identification of older adults at risk for future ADL disability is important for prevention.
Neuronal cell death following traumatic brain injury  has been attributed to direct mechanical injury or to post traumatic secondary mechanisms that are activated weeks to months following brain injury . There is increased expression, cleavage and activation of caspases after TBI . While the cellular mechanisms underlying neuronal cell death in TBI are not fully understood, many studies have found that expression of several members of the Bcl 2 family is altered after brain injury .
In functional studies of the mouse brain, transgenic lines have played an invaluable role in various strategies including: labeling specific neurons by fluorescent protein expression, knocking out or over expressing genes in specific cell types, and ablating or inhibiting activity of specific neuronal populations. New molecular tools developed over the last decade have transformed approaches to study neural circuitry and plasticity with exquisite detail and control . For example, use of transgenic mice that express fluorescent markers at relatively high levels in defined neuronal populations, such as Thy1 EYFP, has facilitated detailed studies of the properties of a single neuron: morphology, connectivity, electrophysiology and gene expression, , and permits long term in vivo imaging.
Degeneration of the intervertebral disc  is a common and significant source of morbidity in our society. From 25% to 80% of adults over the course of their life will experience an episode of significant low back pain and as many as 90% of these people will improve without formal treatment. However, for those with low back pain that does not resolve spontaneously, surgical management may be indicated.
Cigarette smoking is a chronic illness characterized by repeated cycles of quit attempts and relapse. Most models for addressing smoking cessation are based on single, short term interventions lasting only a few weeks or months . Although most smokers will not quit after a single intervention, few studies have addressed the chronic nature of nicotine dependence by providing systematic, repetitive treatment opportunities .
  Light adapted adult zebrafish  were decapitated according to an Animal Study Protocol approved by the Animal Care and Use Committee of the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke, NIH, in accordance with National Research Council Guidelines and Public Health Service Policy on Humane Care and Use of Laboratory Animals. Fish were kindly donated by The Laboratory of Molecular Genetics, NICHD, NIH. Eyes were removed and mounted upright on squares of black nitrocellulose filter paper .
Globally, 247 million people are infected with malaria every year, which causes 881,000 deaths annually. Maternal malaria infection occurs partly because infected erythrocytes  accumulate in the placenta . Women acquire immunity to pregnancy associated malaria  by generating antibodies against PAM variant surface antigens  in a gravidity dependent manner .
Cholinergic neurons of the medial septum  that project to the hippocampus play an important role in learning, memory, and attentional processes, and have long been associated with the acquisition of working memory tasks . More recently, investigations utilizing the selective cholinergic immunotoxin 192 IgG Saporin  have found that lesioning cholinergic neurons of the MS has little or no effect on working memory in tests such as the Morris water maze . However, this same lesion significantly delays acquisition of a delayed matching to position  T maze task, which also requires intact working memory .
The normal development of cortical regions of the mammalian brain depends on the migrations of neuronal precursors from germinal zones and assembly into neuronal laminae, where synaptic connections form . In higher vertebrates, radial glial fibers guide the migration of the principal output neurons of the cerebral cortex and the two major classes of neurons in the cerebellar cortex, the Purkinje neuron and the granule cell. Since migration disorders are associated with cortical malformations, mental retardation and epilepsy , a clearer understanding of the molecular control of CNS neuronal migration could be relevant to the diagnosis and treatment of human brain disorders .
The overall health problems related to schistosomiasis seems greater than ever; according to recent estimates up to 210 million people are infected with the disease in more than 76 countries , and an additional 779 million people are at risk of acquiring this infection . This is primarily because of the suboptimal success rates of most conventional control approaches especially as it relates to the developing world. Thus, the emphasis has been placed to develop new approaches involving a vaccine as an addition to the existing methods to control morbidity and mortality of the disease .
Exosomes are virus sized vesicles, ranging from 20100nm in size, and enveloped by a phospholipid membrane . There is also some evidence that microvesicles might have properties and functions distinct from exosomes  . Studies of exosomes have been largely performed using supernatants of cultured cells.
Ergosterol modulates membrane fluidity, stability, permeability and the activities of membrane bound enzymes in fungi. The transcription factors Upc2p and Ecm22p are major regulators of ergosterol biosynthesis in S.cerevisiae. Upc2p and Ecm22p are Zn CyS binuclear cluster transcription factors  and bind a conserved cis octamer SRE within promoters of ERG genes .
Staphylococcus aureus is an aggressive pathogen that is responsible for a wide array of diseases ranging from pyogenic skin infections and food poisoning to complicated life threatening diseases such as bacteremia and endocarditis . Peptidoglycan hydrolases are enzymes that hydrolyse the peptidoglycan of the bacterial cell wall. These enzymes in S. aureus include N acetyl muramidase, N acetyl glucosaminidase, N acetylmuramyl L alanine amidase and endopeptidase .
Pervasive Developmental Disorders  are lifelong, neurodevelopmental conditions characterized by impairments in social interaction and communication skills, as well as repetitive behavior and unusual preoccupations. Not surprisingly, aggression is a common chief complaint of parents and educators. Behavioral treatment of aggression can be challenging, expensive and often requires expertise that may not be available in all communities.
Psychiatric epidemiological studies have consistently demonstrated a significant gap between the need for and availability of mental health services in the United States. Despite improvements in the available psychosocial and medication treatments, this gap remains discouragingly wide, especially among many vulnerable populations including ethnic minorities. Currently, Latinos represent over 14% of the US population and are projected to represent nearly one third of the US population by 2050.
Post radiotherapy fragility fractures are a frequent complication in cancer survivors. ; Radiation is effective in soft tissue sarcoma and carcinoma treatment, but underlying bone damage is common. Pelvic fracture rates range from is 9.520% , while rib fracture rates  range from 821% depending on dose.
Primary open angle  glaucoma is a leading cause of vision impairment and blindness in the United States and worldwide. The incidence of glaucoma increases with age, and it is higher among African Americans than most other racial and ethnic groups. As a broad category, thyroid condition may potentially have an effect on the development of glaucoma.
Tuberculosis  continues to be a world health problem of staggering proportions. There are an estimated nine million new cases and two million deaths annually, making TB the most common infectious cause of death . ETA, and other second line anti tuberculosis drugs, exhibit higher rates of adverse drug reactions, including hepatotoxicity  .
Peptide libraries are commonly used in a variety of endeavors including identifying peptide DNA interactions , as surrogates for screening protein protein interactions , and as a basis for finding potential peptidic drug molecules. Typically, peptides for libraries have been produced via solid phase synthesis, which involves sequential coupling of amine protected amino acids to resin bound amino acids. The resulting libraries generally contain peptides no longer than 15 20 amino acids, which can prove limiting in applications requiring longer peptides.
Gene based drugs typically require a carrier to facilitate delivery into cell nuclei, where they are transcribed and later translated into proteins that can elicit a therapeutic effect. One of the most effective and commonly used cationic polymers is polyethylenimine ; however, it is non degradable and has a high density of positive amino groups that contribute to its cytotoxicity. In vivo, PEI aggregates and accumulates in the lungs and liver upon systemic administration due to strong electrostatic interactions with cell membranes, proteins, and the extracellular matrix., Several other cationic materials such as poly,, chitosan, poly , and poly  have also been investigated and are able to achieve transfection efficiencies comparable to that of PEI but with the advantage of improved cell viability.
Spinal bulbar muscular atrophy  is an adult onset, slowly progressive lower motoneuron disease characterized by proximal limb and bulbar muscle weakness and atrophy affecting primarily men. This disease is linked to an expansion of a CAG repeat in the androgen receptor  gene, coding for an expanded polyglutamine  repeat in the AR protein . Most clinical evaluations conclude that muscle pathology represents neurogenic atrophy that is secondary to motoneuronal death  .
Gastric motility is initiated and coordinated by an underlying omnipresentslow wave activity, that is generated by the interstitial cells of Cajal. Slow wavespropagate through the ICC networks and conduct to adjacent smooth muscle layers,inducing contractions when co regulatory conditions are met, such as after ameal. Loss of ICC networksand altered slow wave activity have been implicated in the pathogenesis offunctional gastric disorders, such as gastroparesis, a condition in which thestomach fails to empty normally in the absence of an obstruction.
Inhibitory control is a multi faceted cognitive process that facilitates resistance to interference from irrelevant environmental stimuli and the suppression of previously activated inappropriate motor responses . In essence, inhibitory control is the ability to restrain behaviors that would disrupt the efficient completion of a goal. Regardless, impaired inhibitory control is neither necessary nor sufficient to account for ADHD symptoms alone .
Recent studies have led to the emergence of a new class of genes with a specific anti cancer activity. Some of the factors are in clinical trials and show promising results. We have recently presented ORCTL3 as one of the members of this growing, functionally defined gene family that we collectively named “anticancer genes”.
Chlamydiae sps are obligate intracellular bacterial pathogens of humans and animals. Shortly after invasion, EBs differentiate into RBs and replicate within a membrane bound parasitophorous vacuole termed an “inclusion”. The inclusion expands as bacteria replicate and is maintained as a large intact organelle.
Current therapy for HCV infection consists of pegylated interferon  and ribavirin  . However, less than 50% of treated patients infected with HCV genotype 1 achieve sustained virologic response  or a cure of the infection . Treatment options currently in development include drugs that target the HCV encoded NS3 4A serine protease and the NS5B RNA dependent RNA polymerase  .
Although inhibitory behavior has been the focus of substantial prior research, most studies have emphasized motor inhibition by measuring performance variables such as stop signal reaction time or levels of premature responding . Far fewer studies have considered the process by which individuals learn to omit a response. Yet, learning to withhold a behavioral response when signaled by a cue in the environment is an essential aspect of adaptive behavior.
Despite the development of highly active antiretroviral therapy , people who use illicit drugs continue to experience high levels of preventable HIV/AIDS related morbidity and mortality . To date, studies from a wide variety of settings indicate that people who use illicit drugs  have lower rates of HAART initiation , are less likely to achieve virological suppression , and experience higher rates of mortality  . A number of studies have identified links between common psychoactive agents, including cannabis, heroin and cocaine, and relevant immunologic or virologic parameters .
Metagenomics uses gene expression patterns to understand the taxonomy and metabolic activities of microbial communities. Metaproteomics applies the same approach to community proteomes. Previously, we used a novel three dimensional peptide separation method to identify over 2,000 salivary proteins, including 139 of microbial origin.
Alcohol and tobacco use each contribute 4% to the global burden of disease, with illicit drugs contributing an additional 0.8% . This measure combines years of life lost due to premature mortality with years of life lived with disabling conditions . In the U.S., binge drinking  results in more than half of the 79,000 annual deaths due to excessive drinking  .
  Demographic information about the participants is presented in . Siblings were included regardless of overall intellectual functioning. Participants recruited from the community were only included if intellectual functioning fell within the range seen in the NF1 group, to ensure that children with high intellectual functioning were not overrepresented.
Although not high in frequency, negative interpersonal interactions such as conflict with family and friends, teasing or harassment by peers, and being reprimanded by parents or teachers are a feature of the adolescent experience . Interpersonal stressors such as these are examples of low frequency events that nevertheless have a high psychological impact. Interpersonal stressors such as these are among the most frequent and powerful predictors of psychological distress among individuals  .
Certain regions in the adult mammalian nervous system, including thesubventricular zone and the dentate gyrus, retain an ability to replenish neurons. Here,neurons are vulnerable and must be replaced to maintain function of a sensory systemthat is vitally important to most mammals. Olfactory mucosal cells include bipolar receptor neurons, sustentacular andmicrovillar cells, gland cells, and two categories of basal cells.
Over 25 million Americans have asthma, and the number of diagnoses increased nearly 15% in the last decade. African Americans are at the highest risk for developing asthma and are two to three times more likely to die from asthma than any other race or ethnic group. Asthma exacerbations can be prevented by proper pharmacotherapy and guideline adherence, yet missing asthma action plans, suboptimal use of prescribed medications, poor adherence, and insufficient patient education contribute to significant gaps in care.
Acquired mesial temporal lobe epilepsy  with hippocampal sclerosis is a common, often medically refractory neurological disorder thought to be initiated by a brain insult . Refractory MTLE is associated with a characteristic pattern of selective and extensive hippocampal neuron loss that results in hippocampal atrophy . Suspected causes of acquired temporal lobe epilepsy with hippocampal sclerosis include prolonged febrile seizures in childhood, and seizures, head trauma, or infection at any age .
Ozone is a chemically reactive gas present in air pollution and as such is one of the most common environmental toxicants . Ozone is generated through various photochemical driven reactions between oxygen and nitrogen oxides or volatile organic compounds , and therefore more prominent during summer months in most areas. Concentrations of ozone found in many suburban areas often reach 100 ppb or higher, commonly exceeding the current EPA limit of 75 ppb .
Secondhand tobacco smoke  consists of the side stream smoke from the burning end of the cigarette, which contains the highest concentration of particulate matter, and the exhaled mainstream smoke . Exposure to SHS is associated with diverse health effects in nonsmokers. These adverse health outcomes include heart disease, lung cancer, asthma flares, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , and upper airway problems such as sinusitis .
Black blood turbo spin echo  sequences are an essential component of the cardiac MRI pulse sequence repertoire and are commonly used for tissue characterization. Black blood preparation pulses suppress the signal from flowing blood without affecting the contrast in stationary tissues.
