The primary objective of the study was to determine whether the use of ADM would decrease patient reported, post operative pain.
Inherited deficiency of hepatic alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 1  or glyoxylate reductase/hydroxypyruvate reductase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 2  results in marked overproduction of oxalate by the liver . High concentrations of oxalate in the urine form complexes and crystals with calcium resulting in urinary tract stones, as well as injury to renal tubule epithelial cells and nephrocalcinosis . Over time there is progressive loss of renal function .
Although the role of B7: CD28 interactions in promoting initial T cell activation is well established, a separate role for B7: CD28 interactions in promoting T cell tolerance has only recently been acknowledged . Investigation of the severe and accelerated diabetes that develops in CD28 deficient  and B7.1/2 double deficient  NOD  mice  revealed that B7: CD28 interactions control regulatory T cells . The results suggest that the B7: CD28 costimulatory pathway is essential for the development and homeostasis of regulatory T cells.
Transforming growth factor βs  are multifunctional cytokines with widespread effects on cell growth and differentiation, migration, and extracellular matrix  deposition, and have key roles in wound repair . With respect to cutaneous repair, TGF β1 and TGF β2 are known to promote fibroplasia and scar, while TGF β3 may or may not reduce scar  . The transition from scarless fetal type repair to adult type repair with scar occurs between days 16  and 18  of gestation in fetal rat skin .
TMS holds significant promise as a tool for cognitive neuroscience  as well as psychiatric research in the areas of depression and obsessive compulsive disorder . Unfortunately, the poor spatial focus of the current generation of TMS coils severely limits the ability of the clinical investigator in psychiatry to more precisely direct neuronal stimulation. Present TMS coilss stimulate large regions of tissue at a time limited to areas near the surface of the brain, as the electric field drops as the inverse of the distance to the coil.
A growing consensus has indicated that the temperature sensitivity of the water proton resonant frequency   is the most well suited parameter to exploit to create temperature maps for MRI guidance of thermal therapies. Typically, changes in water PRF are estimated using phase difference images of a gradient echo sequence . Difference images are necessary to remove variations caused by inhomogeneities in the magnetic field.
Podosomes and invadopodia are related cellular structures present in cells with physiologically or pathologically invasive behaviors respectively . Reactive oxygen species , particularly superoxide and peroxide, can be produced in a number of ways . In cancer cells, mitochondrial dysfunction and metabolic stress can lead to increased ROS production, with subsequent DNA damage and altered apoptotic responses .
During the year 2008, there were about 215,000 new patients diagnosed with lung cancer, more than 80% of whom will die of their disease. One solution lies in understanding the lung cancer genome and its variations in their entirety, based not only on the histologic type, but also the developmental stages of lung cancers. FFPE tumor tissues serve as indispensable tools for determining proteinaceous antigens and therefore serve the cause of research, diagnosis and teaching .
Adults rely on intrinsic sources of regulation to manage their emotions and effectively navigate social interactions and the environment . However, children have yet to develop these internal mechanisms of regulation, as amygdalaprefrontal circuitry undergoes protracted development through adolescence . Early in life, the caregiver, often the mother, is one of the most potent stimuli for  altricial species and plays an essential role in typical behavioral and neural development .
Programmed cell death 4  is a novel tumor suppressor that inhibits tumorigenesis by interfering with translation initiation. Consequently, Pdcd4 is predicted to specifically prevent the translation of mRNAs with highly structured 5’UTRs that require unwinding for efficient translation. As a result of its translation inhibitory effects, Pdcd4 inhibits transformation, migration and invasion in vitro .
The domestic dog  exhibits the greatest morphologic diversity of any mammal . Variation in size between breeds spans two orders of magnitude with the 1 kg Chihuahua and 100 kg mastiff representing extremes of the continuum. An equally impressive level of variation is apparent when considering conformation.
Endothelial cell proliferation and migration are essential for angiogenesis. Moreover, neuropilin has recently been identified as a VEGF binding protein and has been shown to function as a co receptor for VEGFR2 . VEGF induces a cascade of phosphorylation reactions, beginning with autophosphorylation of both receptors on tyrosine .
The goals of non surgical periodontal therapy  are debridement of bacterial plaque and removal of bacterial products from root surfaces. While this approach is usually successful in arresting periodontal attachment loss, periodontal breakdown may continue to progress in some patients. Both pathogens are capable of evading the body’s immune/defense system by invading epithelial cells lining periodontal pockets .
Obsessive compulsive disorder  and Tourette syndrome  are neurodevelopmental disorders with significant phenotypic and genetic overlap., The association of large, rare CNVs with neurodevelopmental disorders including autism spectrum disorders , schizophrenia, and intellectual disability  has been one of the most important recent advances in psychiatric genomics. Both OCD and TS are highly heritable and have long been suspected to share genetic liability, though specific gene variants have been difficult to identify. Both disorders frequently co occur in individuals, and there is evidence for shared OCD/TS genetic risk from family studies,, with genetic correlation estimates ranging from 4190%.,.
The Mammalian Rel NF κB family of transcription factors play important roles in innate and adaptive immune responses, inflammation, cell survival and cancer, . However, the Nfκb2 gene product p100, which contains IκB like ankyrin repeats in its C terminal region, is regulated through the alternative NF κB signaling pathway. TRAF2 6 also contain an N terminal RING finger that is critical for E3 activity, which catalyzes formation of non degradative K63 linked polyubiquitin chains, a function demonstrated most clearly for TRAF2 and TRAF6.
Bipolar disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of hypomania or mania and major depression. The rate reported by a representative community sample of adolescents and young adults in Germany  appears lower than that from clinical samples. In a sample of seriously ill inpatients from Switzerland, the rate of conversion was greatest in the first four years after onset of first episode and thereafter was linear at a change rate of about 1.25% per year .
Head and neck squamous cell carcinomas  may arise in diverse locations but have a common etiologic association with tobacco and/or alcohol exposure. The management of HNSCC often consists of surgical resection, followed by postoperative radiotherapy or chemoradiation therapy. However, cure rates from chemoradiotherapy or radiation alone, with preservation of organ function, have been reported comparable to those achieved by combined surgery and postoperative radiotherapy.
Biofilms, defined as surface attached bacteria encased in a hydrated polymeric matrix, are the cause of many persistent and chronic bacterial infections. Biofilms are notoriously difficult to eradicate because the embedded bacteria are less susceptible to antibiotics and the host immune response . The typical polymeric matrix is composed primarily of exopolysaccharides that are secreted by the bacteria and remain loosely associated with their surfaces .
Cancer immunoediting, the process whereby the immune system controls tumor outgrowth and shapes tumor immunogenicity, is comprised of three phases: elimination, equilibrium and escape ). Elimination is a modernized view of the older concept of cancer immunosurveillance that now takes into account that efficient tumor destruction requires the coordinated effects of both innate and adaptive immunity. Sometimes not all tumor cells are eliminated and the residual tumor cells enter the equilibrium phase where the immune system and developing tumor enter into a temporary state of balance that controls tumor outgrowth.
Early experience has been shown to have a profound impact on the prevalence of functional bowel disorders. Restricted fetal growth  significantly increases the incidence of irritable bowel syndrome  and a birth weight less than 1500g accelerates the age of symptom onset , most likely due to an immature gastrointestinal tract at birth . Neonatal stress in rats, generated by either maternal separation  or unpredictable shock , produces many of the symptoms observed in IBS patients, including visceral hyperalgesia , enhanced colonic motility  and increased epithelial permeability .
Traumatic brain injury  is one of the most common causes of death and long term disability in the pediatric age range . According to a report on Emergency Department  visit, hospitalizations, and deaths in the United States for the years 19952001 , nearly half a million children 014 years of age had TBI each year during this period. Of this number, 91.6% were treated and released from an ED, 7.8 % were hospitalized, and .6% died.
Oligodendrocytes  are necessary for myelination of axons in the central nervous system, and thus essential for proper brain function. Several cell types are described as the initial oligodendrocyte progenitors: common oligodendrocyte and astrocyte progenitors  , glial restricted precursors , a common neuronoligodendrocyte progenitor in the ventral spinal cord , and adult subventricular zone . However, SHH independent oligodendrogenesis from dorsal progenitors has been reported both in vivo  and in vitro  .
Matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight mass spectrometry  is a well established rapid, selective, and sensitive analytical tool for characterization of biomolecules. using 30 nm cobalt particles mixed with glycerol. demonstrated SALDI MS using larger size  graphite particles mixed with glycerol as a matrix.
Activation of N methyl D aspartate receptors  initiates a cascade of molecular events underlying synaptic plasticity and learning . However, NMDARs are not necessary for hippocampal dependent forms of learning and memory under all experimental conditions   and the precise role of NMDARs in synaptic plasticity and memory encoding is not fully understood . NMDARs are heteromeric assemblies composed of an obligatory GluN1 subunit and 1 or more GluN2  subunits .
The acute phase response  is characterized by rapid and dramatic changes in the pattern of proteins produced and released by liver cells in response to a series of pathological conditions such as inflammations, infections and traumas . The APR constitutes an ideal system for the study of the regulation of gene expression. In the liver, the APR is characterized by significant changes in its gene and protein expression profile, resulting in the up regulation of positive acute phase proteins  such as C reactive protein, as well as in the down regulation of negative APPs such as transthyretin  and albumin.
In contrast to most other mammalian cell types, adult neural cells have traditionally been thought of as non regenerative cells. Over the past 20 years, however, our understanding of the reality, importance and consequences of post developmental neural cell proliferation has undergone considerable revision. Originally believed to be derived from astrocytes, there is now convincing genetic and functional evidence that gliomas, the predominant primary brain tumors, originate from neural stem cells  , suggesting that these cell types may share common mechanisms of cell cycle regulation .
Progressive remodeling of the left ventricular  architecture occurs after myocardial infarction . Even with current optimal therapy, mortality in end stage heart failure amounts to 2050% per year . To restore wall tension, the endoventricular circular patch plasty technique   and partial left ventriculectomy   have been clinically implemented for severe cardiac dilation and dysfunction many years after an infarction.
Recent estimates for the incidence of hypertriglyceridemia  levels over 150 mg/dl) is 30% of U.S. adults . Report that mice lacking sn glycerol 3 phosphate acyltransferase , the accepted rate controlling enzyme in de novo TG synthesis pathway , exhibit decreased blood and liver TG, and improved insulin sensitivity suggests the possibility that the regulation of TG synthesis be a target for therapy . But to date no therapeutic strategy targets GPAT .
Imitation plays a central role in the development of motor control, speech/language/communication, and social life . Many of these skills have been reported to play a relevant role in imitation. Imitation is not a simple matching mechanism; it includes various motor, perceptual, and cognitive elements such as visuomotor perception, visual attention, short term memory .
Vascular smooth muscle cells  arise from a diverse range of tissues including neural crest, somites, splanchnic mesoderm, gut mesothelium, and epicardium , and past data has demonstrated that many coronary VSMC  are derived from the embryonic epicardium, . While several genes have been identified that are essential for the formation, attachment, and spreading of the epicardium, few genes have been identified that are essential during epithelial to mesenchymal transition  and subsequent differentiation into cVSMC and cardiac fibroblasts . Platelet derived growth factor receptor  tyrosine kinases are one family of signaling proteins that are potentially involved in epicardial cell function.
Several of the biochemical constituents of saliva, such as acidic and basic proline rich proteins , lysozyme, lactoferrin, peroxidase, histatins, cystatins, mucins and secretory immunoglobulins A , have been isolated in sufficient quantities, mostly from pure glandular secretions, enabling studies to investigate their functional roles . Major groups of these salivary proteins, including acidic PRPs, statherin and histatins, have characteristics deemed important for oral health . Their beneficial properties comprise the inhibition of primary and secondary calcium phosphate precipitation which is essential for maintaining tooth enamel integrity  and antimicrobial activities critical for the host defense against oral infections .
The Hsp90/Hsp70 based chaperone machinery that forms signaling protein•Hsp90 heterocomplexes  is also part of the cellular defense against unfolded proteins . However, there are many E3 ligases , and it is not known how many of them function in a chaperone dependent manner, although some clearly do . There is some evidence that E3 ligases may function in a redundant manner to ubiquitinate Hsp90 client proteins.
Toxoplasmosis is a serious infectious disease for humans. The disease is most severe in the fetus, newborn infants and in immunocompromised individuals . They are self adjuvanting and have been successful in the induction of immune responses without additional adjuvants .
Despite an overall decline in mortality rates, the gap in mortality rates among socioeconomic status  groups has increased in many countries in the last couple of decades . In addition, international variations in the three established coronary risk factors account for less than half of the international variations in coronary heart disease mortality rates  . Karasek reported that high demands and low control conditions at work were considered stressful .
The costs and benefits of producing communication signals can vary , and therefore individuals should modulate their signalling effort  according to extrinsic factors, such as characteristics of the physical environment or the quality of competition among conspecifics, and to intrinsic factors, such as the signaller’s own physiological state or competitive quality. Such context dependent, behavioral plasticity requires the neural processing of these factors, followed by production of the appropriate motor programs involved in modulating signal production . In most songbird species, adult males attract mates and repel competing males by producing learned vocalizations known as song .
Mitochondria are essential for cellular function and are a sensitive target for damage induced by ischemia reperfusion  injury, such as the overproduction of reactive oxygen species  and overload of Ca2+, both of which can trigger the formation of the mitochondrial permeability transition  pore at reperfusion . Mitochondrial dysfunction has significant implications for post ischemic recovery . IPC triggers an array of cell signaling pathways, many of which converge at the mitochondrion.
Well differentiated neuronal neoplasms composed of small neurons superficially resembling oligodendrocytes  have a tendency to arise within the ventricular system, most often in the septum pellucidum nearby the foramen of Monro. Morphologically similar neoplasms may occur in the cerebral hemispheres or in the spinal cord parenchyma and are therefore referred as “extraventricular neurocytomas”   . Concurrent deletion of chromosome arms 1p and 19q, abnormalities frequently encountered in oligodendrogliomas, is associated with an improved response to treatment and/or a more favorable prognosis in these tumors .
Crystallins, the major structural proteins of the eye lens, are primarily categorized into three distinct families: α, β and γ. The two α crystallins, αA and αB, are the principal members of the small heat shock protein  family acting as molecular chaperones. The agents that induce oxidative stress include hydrogen peroxide , superoxide, hydroxyl radical, and others.
Microfabrication technologies have been used to chemically and topologically pattern glass coverslips to investigate the influences of such features on neuronal polarity, axon migration and growth cone behaviours. In the brain and in vitro, neurons contact surfaces for stabilizing attachment and, importantly, for receiving developmentally instructive signals that are transduced to modulate gene transcription, energy/resource utilisation, and neuronal fine structure mediated through the cytoskeleton. , Microfluidic devices can be used to form binary chemical patterns that can be used to present cells with stark differences in the substratum.
suggest that a chemical agent’s optical clearing potential is strongly tied to its ability to screen non covalent, hydrophilic, intermolecular attractive forces resulting in destabilization of high order collagen structures. Unfortunately, these agents typically possess hydrophilic properties, and hence are unsuitable as topically applied agents due to their inability to penetrate through the lipid rich stratum corneum. The primary objective of our study was to evaluate the optical clearing potential of DMSO  when applied topically to in vitro and in vivo skin.
Anemia, bleeding, and other potential indications for allogenic red blood cell  transfusions are common among patients admitted to intensive care units . Historically, pathophysiologic reasoning informed recommendations that a hemoglobin concentration  greater than 10 g/dL should be maintained in this patient population. However, based on more than a decade of clinical research evidence, more recent clinical practice guidelines advocate for using restrictive transfusion thresholds in ICU patients .
Obesity is a serious public health problem of dramatically rising prevalence in recent decades in the United States and the world, with currently over 65% of adults in the U.S. classified as either overweight or obese . Early studies of obesity focused on metabolic differences between obese and non obese persons; however, advances in structural and functional neuroimaging techniques have recently begun to shed light on neuroanatomical and neurophysiological factors that may be related to obesity . These studies have generally found increased responses to both visual and olfactory cues associated with high calorie foods in obesity.
Retinal microvascular abnormalities that accompany diabetes include arteriolar constriction , capillary dropout, and localized areas of ischemia, the last of which is implicated in the eventual vision problems associated with the pathological growth of new blood vessels . The decreases in retinal blood flow associated with human diabetes, which have been reported to be ~33% , occur early in the progression of the disease. The mechanisms of the decrease in blood flow have yet to be determined .
Tuberculosis  is an infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis  and related species that is most commonly observed as a chronic pulmonary infection . TB, once the leading cause of infectious disease mortality, was nearly eradicated from industrialized nations in the 20th century through a combination of public health measures and the introduction of antibiotics . Ultimately, success in each area will be required to control TB .
The cerebellar cortex is one of the best characterized circuits of the central nervous system and is known to play a key role in the precise timing of motor control. Purkinje cells form the sole output of the cerebellar cortex and project to the deep nuclei of the cerebellum  where they form GABAergic synapses. Purkinje cells also exhibit local axon collaterals, which typically bifurcate in the granule cell layer and project back up to the Purkinje cell layer, and occasionally into the molecular layer.
Oxidative damage to DNA leads to activation of poly polymerase , which participates in DNA repair. Within the nucleus, PARP 1 and PARP 2 are the major enzymes that contribute to overall PARP activity induced by DNA damage , and they appear to have specific functions in the DNA repair process . With extensive oxidative damage, as occurs with cerebral ischemia, PARP activity increases substantially, and poly  polymers accumulate on a variety of proteins .
Malaria is a significant cause of anemia in children living in areas of high and low intensities of transmission . In these children, the prevalence of malarial anemia is over 30%, and in the future, it is likely the prevalence and intensities of malarial anemia will increase as drug resistance in Plasmodium falciparum, already reported to artemisinin in Asia, increases and spreads to Africa and elsewhere. The anemia in malaria has been attributed to destruction of infected and non infected red cells and variable degree of dyserythropoiesis,   and both acute and sub acute infections contribute to the morbidity and mortality associated with malarial anemia , .
Emergency department  evaluation of syncope may benefit from improved epidemiologic understanding of patterns and predictors of short term, cardiac events. Previous studies have examined risk factors at 1 year following an episode of syncope, a timeframe not ideal for decision making in the acute care setting . Recent cohort studies identifying predictors of short term  events after syncope are relatively small ,  and reported prediction models have limited stability and generalizability.
It is well established that pregnant women are at a significantly higher risk of HIV acquisition during pregnancy and breastfeeding than their non pregnant counterparts. Research done in several low and middle income countries show that despite universal antenatal testing, HIV infected babies are born to women who had negative HIV tests during prenatal care, implicating seroconversion during pregnancy. Because of this concern, HIV testing of women at the time of labor and delivery has been implemented at the Grupo Conceiçao, a large public medical group located in Porto Alegre, the capital and largest city in the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul.
In cemented total hip arthroplasty, the implant needs a mechanically stable cement bone interface for long term survival. These factors, combined with the quantity and morphology of the bone, contribute to a substantial variation in mechanical properties of the cement bone interface  . Although previously the strength of the cement bone interface has been investigated as a single variable , the strength of the cement bone interface has also been related to morphologic characteristics such as cement penetration depth and cement bone contact area.
Although vocal communication is essential for the survival of many animal species, the neurophysiological basis of the perception of intra specific communication signals is still not well understood. Vocalizations used by animals are rich signals that contain information about the vocalizer identity and spatial location and some “meaning” that refers to the emotional status, the intent of the vocalizer or even referential information such as a particular type of food in advertising calls or a particular type of predator in alarm calls . Depending on the type of information a listener is attending to , the variability of the acoustic signals that relates to the identity of the vocalizer , the production variance between renditions  or even the transmission variability ) might be of less importance and could be ignored by the listener .
HisG is an ATP phosphoribosyl transferase  that catalyzes the first step in the biosynthetic pathway for histidine, which also leads to intermediates that play a role in purine biosynthesis. HisG condenses ATP with phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate  to produce phosphoribosyl ATP  and inorganic pyrophosphate  . Tuberculosis kills over 2 million people per year worldwide, and it is estimated that over one third of the human population is at least latently infected.
In response to injury/infection there is the sequential release of pro inflammatory mediators including complement, histamine, bradykinin and 5 hydroxytryptamine along with cytokines and chemokines that cause cell and edema accumulation. In attempts to enhance our understanding of acute inflammation, we are beginning to realise that, in addition to endogenous checkpoints that temper PMN trafficking there are also signals that control the transition of PMNs to phagocytosing macrophages , IL6/IL6ra complex), scavenge cytokine/chemokine from the inflammatory environment , lipoxins) as well as clear macrophages to the draining lymph nodes  and resolvins) leading to inflammatory resolution. Thus, innate immune responses are designed to combat infection and repair injured tissues in a timely manner.
The central nervous system  is composed of complex networks of synaptically linked neurons. The development and use of neurotropic viruses as an alternative to traditional tract tracing tools have greatly enhanced our understanding of complex neuronal circuitry, particularly the innervation of thoracic and abdominal viscera . Despite this progress there is a paucity of knowledge concerning how injury, particularly spinal cord injury , affects neuronal circuitry.
A “divergent pathway” model has been proposed to conceptualize the development of cutaneous melanoma. , The model seeks to incorporate diverse yet consistently reported phenomena relating to the development of melanoma. Thus, it is hypothesized that people predisposed to few nevi, who are assumed to have a low propensity for melanocytic proliferation, require continued high levels of sun exposure to drive the proliferation of epidermal melanocytes to cancer.
Ewing’s sarcoma is a poorly differentiated pediatric and young adult cancer of bone and soft tissue. EWS/FL 1 is the most common chromosome translocation associated with Ewing’s sarcomas . Rapid tumor growth and extensive bone destruction are typical features of this tumor .
The vast majority of Cardiac Magnetic Resonance  is performed using non real time techniques based on either prospective or retrospective processing of physiological signals such as using the ECG to synchronize MRI data acquisition with the cardiac phases, but real time CMR at high spatial resolution has long been a goal of the field. Another contributor to real time CMR research is known as dynamic imaging. Unfortunately, all acceleration techniques for MRI can only be pushed so far until image artifacts destroy the reconstructions, and each method has its own unique limitations.
The conserved kinase Chk1 is a participant in the first line of defense against DNA damage and replication blocks. The Chk1 proteins consist of two primary domains, the well conserved N terminal kinase domain and the less conserved non catalytic C terminal domain that contains two highly conserved subdomains that we call TRF and GD domains., The C termini of the Chk1 orthologues are phosphorylated following DNA damage and replication blocks. The C terminal domain of vertebrate Chk1 has also been suggested to play an inhibitory role in the kinase activity of the protein.
David Marr  characterized vision as “knowing what is where.” Despite these displacements, our perception of the world is for the most part reassuringly stationary and stable. Whether these coordinates are explicitly represented in a spatiotopic map  or are only derived for individual objects when needed  is a topic of intense debate. Clearly, a retinotopic map can be made to track object locations in the world if retinotopic target positions are shifted to compensate for eye movements .
Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive and gradual decline in cognitive function accompanied by extensive neurodegeneration. APP is sequentially cleaved by two membrane bound endoprotease activities, β  and γ secretase. β secretase  first cleaves APP to release an amino terminal derivative, sAPPβ.
The delivery of antigen to elicit protective immunity or tolerance represents an area of considerable interest for both vaccine development and the treatment of autoimmunity . Fc receptors that bind to the Fc region of IgG encompass the classical Fc receptors  and the neonatal Fc receptor, FcRn, that can be distinguished in several important ways. FcRn transports IgGs within and across cells, and the interaction properties of an IgG with FcRn are key determinants of its in vivo persistence .
Coronary thrombosis on a ruptured coronary plaque is the main pathophysiologic event that leads to acute coronary syndromes . Current recanalization therapies in these disease states include pharmacological thrombolysis and percutaneous coronary intervention , both of which have improved the prognosis of patients with STEMI . Each of these therapeutic interventions, however, has significant limitations.
Knowledge of the spatial radiofrequency  field distribution is important in a number of MRI applications such as quantitative T1 measurement  and correction of the B1 dependent intensity variation . While overall distribution of the RF field for each coil can be obtained by measuring test objects or numerically solving the Maxwell equation based on the known coil geometry and sample model, the actual RF distribution is dependent on the conductivity, dielectric properties, and coil loading of each object. A number of B1 mapping methods have been introduced .
Soft tissue sarcoma  is a heterogeneous group of mesenchymal malignancies. Consequently, identifying factors that regulate the anti apoptotic phenotype and elucidating the underlying molecular mechanisms of these apoptosis regulatory factors are crucial for the success of molecular target based therapeutics for human sarcoma . IRF8  is a transcription factor of the interferon regulatory factor family .
Although it has been appreciated for decades that folding of RNA into biologically active structures is controlled by the rate of RNA synthesis by RNA polymerase ,, the mechanisms by which RNAP guides RNA folding remain poorly understood. Pausing by both bacterial RNAP and eukaryotic RNAPII can guide proper RNA folding. The interplay of RNA folding and transcriptional pausing and their modulation by RNAP and associated regulators has been studied most extensively in bacteria.
Body dysmorphic disorder , a severe disorder characterized by preoccupation with an imagined or slight defect in one’s physical appearance, affects an estimated 1.82.4% of the population . A variant of BDD has been documented in which the primary preoccupation involves perceived imperfections of another person who looks normal ; however, to our knowledge, only five published case reports of body dysmorphic disorder by proxy  exist to date . For example,  described a woman who worried excessively about her daughter’s “crooked” nose and tried “pushing on it to make it straight” .
We and others have recently described a new subset of antigen presenting cells , termed Interferon producing Killer Dendritic Cells  or Natural Killer Dendritic Cells , that exhibit properties of both natural killer cells  and dendritic cells  . In depth phenotypic analyses established splenic IKDC as a homogeneous CD11cloB220+CD49b+ population, distinct from murine NK by their expression of MHC class II molecules  and from DC by their expression of NK receptors. Upon stimulation in vitro with CpG oligodeoxynucleotides  or in vivo with Listeria monocytogenes  splenic IKDC killed typical NK targets and demonstrated the unique ability to produce interferon gamma , IFN α and interleukin  12 .
Currently emerging and re emerging infectious diseases of zoonotic origin such as highly pathogenic avian influenza A pose a significant threat to human and animal health due to their elevated transmissibility . These drivers can be of an environmental, geographic, demographic, genetic, or other nature. Several techniques exist to help identify these drivers including bioinformatics, phylogeography, and spatial epidemiology but these methods are generally evaluated separately and do not consider the natural complementary principles of each other.
Emergency Medical Dispatchers  play an important role in optimizing acute stroke care and facilitating rapid transport by initiating pre arrival instructions to callers and dispatching emergency resources at the appropriate high level of priority. A more recent study of EMS calls in Germany similarly found that dispatchers recognized stroke in only 51% of stroke patients. In response to the availability of thrombolytic stroke therapy, a new algorithm for dispatcher use in interrogating 911 callers to identify stroke was implemented nationally in 2000.
Telomeres are repetitive DNA sequences that cap and protect chromosomal integrity. Average leukocyte telomere length is thought to provide a cumulative marker of cellular aging that integrates across multiple pathways, including DNA damage due to oxidative stress and the replicative history of various populations of WBC. Broadly defined, stress is a condition that occurs when environmental demands require physiologic or behavioral changes to maintain balance and homeostasis.
Posttraumatic stress disorder  is a stress linked disorder that affects a substantial proportion of the population, and is particularly prevalent in combat veterans. PTSD can be triggered by acute or chronic exposure to traumatic events, with intensity and duration of trauma considered important determinants in the trajectory of posttraumatic symptoms  There are several animals models of PTSD in the literature, including acute predator exposure , electric tails shocks, single prolonged stress, and inescapable stress, among others . However, efforts to develop paradigms that model chronic stress induced emergence of posttraumatic stress like behaviors have been limited .
The use of phages to treat bacterial infections, phage therapy, is an enigma of Western medicine. Only now, amid an ever growing threat from antibiotic resistant bacterial pathogens, is it being entertained again in the West. In concept, phage therapy seems invincible: a self replicating organism selectively killing only a pathogen, amplifying itself only where it is most needed  sites where the pathogen is lurking and abundant.
Acute lung injury  and acute respiratory distress syndrome  remain major challenges in modern intensive care medicine that are still associated with high mortality and morbidity . Several targets to control PMN infiltration have been identified and some drug candidates are in clinical trials, but no specific drug is available for treatment of ALI patients today . Chemokines exert their biological function through specific G protein coupled receptors.
Myocarditis is an acute inflammatory disease of the heart which may lead to chronic inflammation of the myocardium and dilated cardiomyopathy  . In myocarditis and DCM, autoantibodies react with cardiac myosin . While virus is important in acute myocarditis , the development of chronic myocarditis and cardiomyopathy may require exposure and release of cardiac myosin from damaged myocytes .
Helicobacter hepaticus  infection was discovered in the early 1990s in mice used in a carcinogenesis study . Increased liver cell proliferation has been observed in infected mice . In 8 of the 9 NTP studies with H. hepaticus infection, accompanied by hepatitis in many male mice, biologically significant increases in neoplasms were not observed or were observed at sites other than the liver .
RNA interference , a post transcriptional gene silencing method, mediated by small interfering RNA  of 1923 base pairs   has attracted attention for the development of novel highly effective therapeutics. Therefore, a considerable interest is being devoted to the development of non viral gene delivery vehicles  . Attempts to develop effective non viral vectors for in vivo delivery of nucleic acids to cancer cells through a systemic route are hampered by difficulties of combining high extracellular stability in the blood stream with ready availability of the nucleic acids following entry into the cells.
Diuretic drugs are central to the treatment of hypertension. It is therefore appropriate to consider ways in which their benefit can be optimized. Placebo controlled trials have demonstrated that diuretics are highly efficacious in reducing cerebrovascular accidents and yield a smaller but significant reduction in non fatal myocardial infarction.
Most mutations induced by carcinogens occur when DNA containing residual damage is replicated during S phase of the cell cycle. Such lesions perturb the structure of DNA and are likely to block replicative DNA polymerase complexes. These mechanisms are conserved but with additional layers of complexity in higher eukaryotes .
Antiretroviral  adherence is a key determinant of clinical outcomes, including viral load suppression, emergence of drug resistance, and progression to AIDS and death . Studies from low resource settings have reported adherence rates that are equivalent to or higher than those in resource rich countries . These high levels of adherence have been found despite structural barriers that can exact a significant economic and emotional toll on patients with HIV and their families .
Most current research involving measurement of gaze direction  employs video based eyetracking devices, which provide a relatively simple and cost effective way of obtaining two dimensional records. The usual method of determining eye position used by these devices is based on the relationship between the pupil center and image of one or more light sources formed by the corneal first surface . For angles of eye position up to ±30 deg relative to straight ahead, the pupil center shifts approximately linearly with eye position, while the minified corneal reflection shifts considerably less.
Because of its great importance, isoprene  and its oxidation reactions have been studied for many decades. , Approximately 500 teragrams of isoprene are emitted into the atmosphere annually, and consequently, the process of isoprene oxidation has significant effects on atmospheric chemistry. Isoprene oxidation by the hydroxyl radical leads to ozone formation in the troposphere.
Successful behavior requires continuous coordination between the initiation and inhibition of actions, the latter being particularly important when sudden changes in the situation call for an alteration, or even the cancellation, of a planned or ongoing behavior. Although in such trials the Stop process loses the race against the Go process, it will nevertheless usually be initiated and have proceeded partway . Consequently, approaches and results differ quite substantially between studies .
Lung transplantation has the potential to increase survival and improve quality of life for patients suffering from end stage lung disease. These positive outcomes have driven increased demand for the procedure with the number of transplants performed increasing every year . Due to the shortage of available donor organs and high mortality on the waiting list, the allocation system for lung transplantation in the United States has undergone considerable evolution over the past decade.
A greater understanding of the molecular pathways driving tumor initiation and proliferation has heralded an age of targeted therapies for cancer. The therapeutic successes of these drugs are satisfying from both the scientific and medical perspectives. In human papillomavirus  associated HNSCC, the high risk HPV type 16  E6 oncoprotein targets the cellular phosphatase, PTPN13, for degradation .
The trillions of microbial cells that reside within the intestine shape aspects of host metabolism and immune function and extend the physiological definition of humans . Community membership and function of the microbiota can change due to numerous variables including antibiotic treatment, inflammation, or changes in diet . In addition, changes in composition have been associated with obesity and weight loss; however, factors that cause these changes are not well defined .
Activation induced deaminase  catalyzes two B cell specific DNA alteration events, somatic hypermutation  and class switch recombination  . During SHM, point mutations are introduced into variable  region exons and the immediate downstream intronic J region, thereby enhancing the DNA sequence diversity of V regions to allow the selection of B cell clones with increased affinity for antigens . CSR can be induced by T cell dependent and independent antigens in vivo, and thus can occur in both GC and extra follicular B cells .
Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation  is commonly used for the relief of acute and chronic pain. TENS delivers electrical current through the skin to produce pain relief. Placebo induced expectancies decrease pain and modulate specific neural mechanisms , , .
Shotgun proteomics is a method of identifying proteins in a complex mixture by digesting a protein mixture to peptides prior to analysis. The resulting MS/MS spectra are then searched against a protein sequence database using a database searching algorithm to produce a peptide spectrum match  . High resolution mass spectrometers such as hybrid LTQ FT or LTQ Orbitrap combine the strengths of a Fourier transform mass analyzer with a linear ion trap mass spectrometer.
Axon regeneration in the mature mammalian brain and spinal cord is extremely limited after injury. Consequently, spinal cord injury causes persistent paralysis due to disconnection of descending axons from their normal targets. Presumably, recovery would be improved if axon regeneration could be achieved and if regenerating axons re established functional synapses below the injury level .
Ventricular arrhythmias commonly occur after successful resuscitation from cardiac arrest with a reported incidence of ventricular fibrillation  as high as 79%. Some studies have reported an inverse relationship between the number of VF episodes and survival. These episodes were noted to occur within a time window of 23 to 115 seconds with a median of 45 seconds after the return of spontaneous circulation.
The discovery of DNA vaccine technology in the early 1990s was a major event in the history of vaccinology due to the many unique features of DNA immunization, including its ability to elicit balanced antibody and T cell immunity . Animal studies further demonstrated that DNA immunization is effective in eliciting higher levels of antigen specific B cell responses . At the same time, the DNA plasmid itself confers an intrinsic adjuvant effect that enhances the immune response generated towards the vaccine encoded immunogens , but the intracellular processes involved remain to be fully elucidated.
Parity has a nonlinear association with cardiovascular events;,  with the minimum incidence in women with 2 births, a slightly higher incidence in nulliparas and primiparas, and a sharply higher incidence for women with higher parity. Parity is also associated with greater LV mass. Thus childbearing may have long lasting effects on the cardiovascular system, but the mechanism is unknown.
Lung cancer is the second most prevalent cancer occurring in both men and women in the United States, accounting for 162,000 deaths in 2008 , more than any other cancer. High risk populations include smokers and former smokers, as well as individuals exposed to second hand smoke, asbestos, and radon. Presently, there is no easily applied screening protocol for lung cancer similar to those used for breast, prostate, and colon cancers.
While sensory input is complex and dynamic, it also contains regularities that have shaped sensory systems over phylogenetic time . But regularities are also pervasive over more local timescales, in the sense that certain stimuli repeatedly precede, follow, or co occur with other stimuli. Statistical learning refers to an unconscious process by which regularities are automatically segmented from continuous environments, where the only cues for segmentation are statistics of co occurrence between specific stimuli.
Fear extinction is a form of learning in which the expression of a conditioned fear response is reduced after repeated experience of a conditioned stimulus in the absence of a unconditioned aversive stimulus . There is growing evidence that fear conditioning and fear extinction are independent forms of learning that are mediated by partially dissociable neural mechanisms . Fear extinction is readily quantifiable in laboratory rodents, providing important behavioral models for translational studies of anxiety disorders .
Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  is a high risk medical procedure that is utilized worldwide as therapy for many malignant and non malignant hematologic diseases., Nonetheless, efficacy is still limited by short and long term treatment related complications. The translation of basic science advances into human applications provides the opportunity to test hypothesis driven questions, investigate new therapies, and evaluate outcomes in efforts to improve overall health care. For example, only 3% of U.S. adults with cancer participate in clinical trials., The consequences of poor recruitment or slower than anticipated enrollment into clinical research studies include premature closure, underpowered results, lack of generalizability, and wasted resources.
ATP binding cassette  transporters constitute a large family of integral membrane proteins that utilize the energy of ATP hydrolysis to translocate ions, lipids, nutrients and drugs across lipid bilayers. ABC exporters are medically important since their members contribute to antibiotic or antifungal resistance of human pathogens, the development of multiple drug resistance , and several human genetic disorders due to protein dysfunctions. A prominent example is P glycoprotein  that affects the pharmacokinetics of numerous drugs and is implicated in MDR of many human cancers, HIV, and epileptic diseases  .
In metazoans, germline tissue is required for the transmission of genetic information from one generation to the next. Zebrafish PGCs are similarly specified by maternal germ plasm determinants, in this case localized to the cleavage planes at the two  and four cell stages . The PGCs then begin to proliferate, and between 4 and 5 hpf they transition from round, immotile cells into a polarized migratory population , localizing to the anterior and lateral boundaries of the mesoderm during gastrulation .
Atherosclerosis, the disease process responsible for the leading cause of death in the industrialized world, is driven by a chronic, maladaptive inflammatory response . This response is triggered by the persistent and amplified subendothelial retention of apolipoprotein Bcontaining lipoproteins in focal areas of the arterial tree . However, more proof in vivo is needed to support this concept.
Stress to a cell can trigger the activation of a specialized group of mitogen activated protein kinase  cascades that induce cell death . ASK1 is activated by a variety of stress related stimulus, including hydrogen peroxide , reactive oxygen species , serum withdrawal, genotoxic agents, as well as ligation of Fas ligand and tumor necrosis factor  . This specific dephosphorylation results in the dissociation of the ASK1:14 3 3 complex with a concomitant increase of Ask1 catalytic activity .
Epilepsy is a common neurological disorder . The mesial temporal lobe includes the dentate gyrus, which is suspected to play a role in epileptogenesis, in part, because it displays neuropathological changes . In laboratory animal models of temporal lobe epilepsy, granule cells receive less inhibitory synaptic input , which has been attributed to loss of some interneurons , but additional factors may contribute .
The Ubiquitin Proteasome System  and the HDAC6 dependent lysosomal pathway are two major pathways for protein turn over within eukaryotic cells . The proteasome inhibitor Bortezomib  has recently been licensed for the treatment of refractory multiple myeloma and mantle cell lymphoma and it is currently being examined as a treatment for several cancer types including ovarian carcinoma . PS 341 exhibits selective anti tumor activity against ovarian cancer cells in vitro, but in a xenograft model only slowed ovarian tumor growth .
Ultraviolet radiation  spectrum of solar light represents the major skin stressor. Exposure to UVR causes DNA damage in form of primarily cyclobutane pyrimidine dimers  and to lower degree of pyrimidine photoproducts PPs . Melatonin  and its metabolites have multiple functions.
Eukaryotic secretory and membrane proteins are translated on the endoplasmic reticulum  membrane, facilitating translocation across the lipid bilayer and integration of membrane domains. Vesicle biogenesis is initiated by the small G protein, Sar1p, which becomes membrane associated when bound to GTP. A central function of the COPII coat is to capture cargo proteins into nascent vesicles for delivery to the Golgi apparatus.
In the United States, 50,000 patients are affected by multiple myeloma , 16,000 patients are newly diagnosed with MM, and 11,000 MM patients die of the disease each year . MM can occur de novo or it can evolve from benign monoclonal gammapathy of undetermined significance  that involves in low levels of bone marrow plasmacytosis and M protein. Approximately 1% of patients with MGUS develop MM each year.
We previously reported models that characterized the synergistic interaction between remifentanil and sevoflurane in blunting responses to verbal and painful stimuli. This preliminary study evaluated the ability of these models to predict a return of responsiveness  during emergence from anesthesia and a response to tibial pressure when patients required analgesics in the recovery room. We hypothesized that model predictions would be consistent with observed responses.
The T cell receptor :CD3 complex mediates numerous downstream signaling events at multiple developmental stages to ensure optimal T cell development, peripheral function, and a finely tuned and effective adaptive immune system . Indeed, the CD3ε proline rich sequence , which recruits the adapter molecule Nck, facilitates early thymocyte development and enhances signals to low avidity TCR:pMHC interactions . TCR binding to pMHC results in release of the CD3ε cytoplasmic domain from the plasma membrane .
Bladder diverticula are defined as outpouchings of the urothelial lining through the muscularis layer of the bladder wall. They may result from congenital weakness of the bladder wall at the level of the ureterovesical junction  or may be acquired as a result of increased intravesical pressure, typically in the context of lower urinary tract obstruction . Bladder diverticula may sometimes harbor tumors, classically thought to be secondary to urinary stasis with chronic infection and inflammation leading to metaplasia and subsequent tumor formation.
The intestinal epithelium plays a central role in orchestrating organ function through nutrient absorption and by providing a barrier between the environment and underlying tissues. One family of factors implicated in enterocyte development is the GATA family of zinc finger DNA binding transcription factors, specifically GATA4 and GATA6. Both GATA4 and GATA6 are expressed in midgut endoderm during development and continue to be expressed in the small intestinal epithelium throughout adulthood although in differing patterns .
Oscillatory activity is a ubiquitous feature of neuronal dynamics. It has been suggested that the synchronous discharge of neuronal assemblies might provide a mechanism to couple distributed processing over different neuronal populations . Many studies investigating oscillatory activity have focussed on linear coupling between nodes of a network at the same frequency .
Body’s stress controlling mechanism that are disrupted and implicated in tumor progression causally connected to enhanced body’s immune defense system. Specifically, increased cancer incidence, malignancy and growth rate has been shown to be prevalent in patients with chronic stress, whereas managing stress of these patients promoted immune function that fights against their cancer . The increasing understanding of the mechanism and control of the neuroimmune system in the regulation of cancer chemoprevention offers promise for the design of therapeutic strategies.
Sarcoidosis is a granulomatous inflammatory disorder that can affect multiple organs . Pharmacological treatment, which mainly consists of corticosteroids and immunosuppressive agents, can decrease symptoms. This discovery was followed by intense interest in the potential use of exhaled NO as a noninvasive marker of inflammation and oxidative stress in the lungs .
A major driver of spatial attention is one’s prior knowledge about where important events may appear. Such knowledge guided attention is a critical component of all influential models of attention and is captured by a single term  top down attention . Likewise, recent work on spatial attention has revealed differences between explicit, goal driven attention and experience driven attention .
In addition to functioning as a barrier and absorptive organ, intestinal epithelial cells  are involved in defense and inflammatory diseases by releasing multiple cytokines and inflammatory mediators . These adaptor molecules act independently or in combination based on the TLRs and activate MAPK  and NF κB resulting in the transcription of inflammatory and immunomodulatory genes include chemokines, cytokines and co stimulatory molecules . Following per oral infection, bradyzoites in tissue cysts convert to tachyzoites and actively invade IECs and disseminate to different tissues until host immune responses finally stops parasite multiplication resulting in parasite tissue cysts in lungs, liver, kidney, pancreas, brain and skeletal muscles .
Dysregulation of the hedgehog signalling pathway has been linked to the development and progression of a variety of different human tumors including cancers of the skin, brain, colon, prostate, blood, and pancreas. We assessed the clinicopathological factors that are potentially related to expression of Gli1, the transcription factor that is thought to be the most reliable marker of hedgehog pathway activation in bladder cancer . Bladder cancer cases were identified from the New Hampshire State Cancer Registry as histologically confirmed primary bladder cancer diagnosed between January 1, 2002, and July 31, 2004.
Two characteristics, inhibition by intracellular ATP and activation by MgADP, define ATP sensitive potassium  channels and underlie their ability to respond to metabolic changes inside a cell . Different KATP channels have different metabolic sensitivities . This property allows the pancreatic KATP channels to regulate insulin .
Alveolar soft part sarcoma  is a malignant neoplasm of unknown histogenesis that typically arises in the soft tissues of children and young adults . In that original study, the patients studied were predominantly female and were young , both of which remain characteristic features in ASPS . Characteristic for ASPS, most tumors in that original study arose within  the skeletal muscle of the extremity, or less commonly in the buttock, tongue, or abdominal wall .
Autistic and psychotic disorders have historically been considered as related diagnostic entities. ASD and SZ share common neurobiological processes  and genetic risk factors . There is some evidence that affective symptoms in children with ASD may mediate the emergence of psychotic symptoms.
Bone morphogenetic protein 4  is a member of the transforming growth factor beta  superfamily of secreted signaling ligands. Given the high amino acid identity between the mature peptides of human Bmp4 and Bmp2  and Bmp4 and Dpp  , it has been proposed that these proteins could function interchangeably. In fact, Dpp protein can induce subcutaneous bone formation in rats similarly to Bmp4 and Bmp2 .
Disruption in circadian rhythms and perceived changes in sleep continuity and architecture are common features of psychiatric disorders. Disruptions of circadian rhythms are also seen in psychiatric disorder patients. Similar results have been found for plasma melatonin  and plasma cortisol in BPD.
Elucidating how risk factors interact over time may facilitate targeting and tailoring interventions to improve outcomes. For instance, while depressive symptoms have been associated with poor cardiovascular outcomes , Ferketich et al. noted they may be associated with higher risk for men than women . Among women, an interaction between race and increasing body mass index may lead to higher mortality for whites than blacks .
The effects of acetylcholinesterase  inhibitors on the symptoms of dementia of the Alzheimer type  can be highly variable. Although AChE inhibitors demonstrate modest overall benefits compared with placebo for stabilizing or slowing decline in mild to moderate Alzheimer’s disease, summary estimates show small effect sizes. It is not currently possible to identify those who will respond to treatment prior to treatment.
Urea Cycle Disorders  comprise several inherited deficiencies of enzymes or transporters necessary for the synthesis of urea from ammonia . UCD incidence is estimated to be ~1:8200 live births. .
Photoacoustic imaging  has been used extensively in pre clinical models of human disease including prostate, breast, and ovarian cancer. This modality produces contrast by converting nanosecond light pulses into an acoustic signal and offers significant improvements in spatial resolution relative to other optics based approach. Small molecule agents include methylene blue or indocyanine green with very intensephotoacoustic signal.
Anatomical alignment of the lower extremity has been proposed as a risk factor for lower extremity injuries, in particular, knee injuries. Among these lower extremity alignment variables, the quadriceps angle  has been frequently studied, which is defined as the angle formed by a line from the anterior superior iliac spine to the patella center and a line from the patella center to the tibial tuberosity. As Q angle represents the direction of the quadriceps muscle force vector in the frontal plane, excessive angulation is thought to predispose individuals to injuries caused by abnormal quadriceps forces acting at the knee and patellofemoral joints.
Epithelial cells are central participants in mucosal immunity against microbial infection in the gastrointestinal tract. This host immune response is finely controlled and reflects a delicate balance between effector functions and their potential to cause unwanted damage to healthy tissues . Disturbance of this balance will lead to devastating immunopathology, resulting in either an over reacted immunoreaction or insufficient immunity to clear pathogenic agents  .
Huntington's disease  is a dominantly inherited neurodegenerative disorder caused by the expansion of a CAG repeat within the HD gene encoding huntingtin . The repeat also exhibits somatic instability, undergoing expansion particularly in the striatum . Significantly, age of onset and disease severity are highly dependent on CAG length .
Three randomized trials indicate that circumcised men have lower risk of acquisition of human immunodeficiency virus  than uncircumcised men,  and prevention interventions focusing on male circumcision  are being introduced worldwide. Whether MC is associated with women's risk of acquisition of HIV or other sexually transmitted infections , however, has not been well studied. is a necessary cause  which is significantly lower in women with circumcised male partners. )
There is consistent epidemiologic evidence that self reported long sleep  is associated with increased mortality and numerous morbidities, including hypertension, stroke, coronary heart disease, and diabetes. These hazards have increased in a dose response pattern with increases in sleep duration beyond 7 h, and have persisted following control for multiple factors, including sleep apnea, depression, health status, and medication use. Of course, causality cannot be established with epidemiologic studies, and the risks associated with long sleep might be explained by other factors., An important limitation of the extant literature is that there has been remarkably little systematic investigation of those who report long sleep durations.
Alzheimer’s disease  is a genetically complex disorder characterized by neurodegeneration and progressive cognitive dysfunction. Risk for AD is likely influenced by a variety of genes affecting multiple biological pathways. In an effort to identify these susceptibility genes, well over 1,000 genetic association studies have been published implicating or refuting nearly 600 different loci as potential AD loci.
Transcription factor binding to genetic regulatory elements initiates gene expression. This process is regulated through signaling cascades that modify proteins to permit their binding. Methylating regulatory elements, such as CpG islands in the promoters of tumor suppressor genes, silences the gene despite the presence of the requisite factors.
A growing body of evidence supports the contention that epithelial cancers including the colorectal cancer are diseases driven by a small set of self renewing cells, termed cancer stem cells  or cancer initiating cells, that are distinct from the bulk of the cells in the tumor . CSCs are widely believed to arise from the normal stem cells or progenitor cells upon mutation . CSC possess not only the ability to self renew but also differentiate and can give rise to heterogeneous tumors .
Long interspersed elements type 1  are the most abundant transposable elements in both human and mouse genomes. For example, the mouse genome contains 3600,000 copies of L1, with 33,000 full length, potentially active copies . Full length L1s are 67 kb, encompassing an internal promoter in the 5′ untranslated region , two nonoverlapping open reading frames , and a weak polyadenylation signal in the 3′ UTR .
Intraoperative resident participation is integral to any surgical training program. With recent technological advancements and an emphasis on minimally invasive procedures, numerous surgical fields now train their residents in robotic procedures . In Urology, many programs utilize robotic prostatectomy  to familiarize residents with appropriate robotic technique  .
Most currently available vaccines work by eliciting antibody responses and are relatively inefficient at inducing cellular immunity. In mice, naked plasmid DNA immunization is very effective at promoting cytotoxic T lymphocyte  responses yet DNA vaccines have yielded less impressive results in human trials,. This may be due in part to the fact that in humans DNA vaccines are administered in a small volume.
Conjugated equine estrogen  was introduced into clinical practice in 1941 for the treatment of menopausal symptoms and related conditions. Despite its widespread use, there were concerns with unopposed estrogen therapy. Reports  of an increased risk of endometrial cancer in women taking CEE resulted in package label warnings about the risks of cancer and thrombosis.
The development of vaccines against a wide variety of infectious diseases is one of the greatest accomplishments of the scientific community. However, the World Health Organization  and the Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunizations  report that almost 27 million children worldwide do not receive vaccines. Therefore, alternative RV vaccine strategies are needed that are affordable, effective, safe and simple to administer, .
Multiple myeloma  is a malignancy of the plasma cells and remains incurable despite recent advances in therapy. Non Hodgkin's lymphoma  is the most common cancer of the lymphatic system and represents a heterogenous group of diseases. Depending on the type of NHL, the response to treatment could vary greatly from being curable to being resistant to available therapies.
In normal, non pathological aging, even in the absence of ocular pathology, humans and monkeys exhibit deficits in visual function . Since these changes cannot be explained by ocular deficits, they have been hypothesized to be due to functional and/or degenerative changes in central visual areas such as the visual cortices . It has been shown that relative to young monkeys, V1 neurons of old monkeys lose orientation and direction selectivity while exhibiting an increased excitability .
In many mammalian species, unmated females show repeated estrous cycles during which females are sexually receptive on only one or a few days of the cycle. During estrus, female hamsters are amicable toward males and readily assume the receptive lordosis posture, whereas on the other three days of the estrous cycle females are aggressive toward males. It could be argued, however, that one problem with non contact methods is that they disrupt the usual response of males to female vaginal secretion, which is to contact the secretion and lick it .
Consequences resulting from excessive alcohol consumption are responsible for considerable disease burden . Consequently, interventions aimed at reducing excessive alcohol consumption are viewed as beneficial from a public health point of view. Assessing readiness to change is recommended as part of brief interventions to tailor advice and counseling, and physicians have been encouraged to see changes in readiness as short term goals on the path to behavior change  .
Parenteral nutrition  is a major contributing factor to the long term survival of children with intestinal failure . IF results in prolonged PN dependence secondary to intestinal malabsorption. Pediatric IFALD is hallmarked by cholestasis exhibited biochemically by direct hyperbilirubinemia, elevated serum liver transaminases, and histological findings on liver biopsy including cholestasis, steatosis, lipidosis, and eventually fibrosis and cirrhosis.
The compromised ability of older persons to carry out a wide range of activities of daily living has been associated with a number of adverse outcomes including institutionalization  and death . Despite these adverse consequences, there remains little known about factors that predict change in functional ability in aging . Functional ability requires the integration of diverse cognitive, sensory, and motor information.
The Wolbachia infected mosquito cell line, Aa23, established from infected Aedes albopictus  embryos , provides an important tool for understanding metabolic interactions between an obligate intracellular bacterium and its mosquito host cell. Growth of Aa23 cells proceeds by formation of cell clusters that detach from the substrate as floating aggregates of tightly adherent cells, which attain sizes easily visible to the naked eye. Tetracycline has been used for a number of years to eliminate Wolbachia infections from diverse insects , as well as from Aa23 cells  .
The niche concept is fundamental to our understanding of range dynamics. The niche is usually defined as the combination of environmental conditions that allow a species to persist . If population growth shows such negative density dependence, the realized niche is the set of environmental conditions, x, where the intrinsic population growth rate ) is positive in the presence of competitors .
Any sound will activate neurons throughout auditory cortex, but we know little about how the activity of neural populations is “read out”. In addition to spike rate, response latencies can encode sensory events , but it is unclear what would serve as a temporal “reference”, given that the brain has no independent measure of stimulus onset. Relative latency codes are particularly attractive because they could potentially facilitate rapid behavioral judgments  .
Human breast cancer, from which the T 47D cell line was derived, is known to overexpress the gastrin releasing peptide receptor  in some cases. Bombesin , an agonist for the GRPR, has been appended with a radionuclide capable of positron emission tomography  imaging and therapy. 64Cu NO2A 8 Aoc BBNNH2  has produced high quality microPET images of GRPR positive breast cancer xenografted tumors in mice .
Major histocompatibility Complex  encodes for the HLA class II genes, the most polymorphic genes in the human genome. We are exposed to many microbes, some beneficial and other pathogenic. Tuberculosis  is a leading health problem in the world, specially developing countries.
Insulin resistance is a key factor in the development of metabolic syndrome and type 2 diabetes mellitus  and is characterized by normal or elevated insulin levels with reduced biological response . In this regard, lifestyle modifications, i.e. weight loss and increased exercise, can improve insulin sensitivity on a clinical level; however, such changes are often difficult to maintain permanently. In contrast, nutritional supplementation with botanical extracts is postulated as an alternative to pharmaceutical intervention.
Bone marrow derived myeloid cells, particularly neutrophils  and macrophages, are key regulators of tumor progression and metastasis. One of the major tumor promoting functions of these cells is their facilitation of angiogenesis ). PMNs and macrophages contribute to angiogenesis via a variety of well established mechanisms.
Checklists have been reported to substantially decrease rates of adverse outcomes in surgical patients in controlled settings. Numerous studies  and systematic reviews have since corroborated these findings. Given the potential benefits of use, and the perceived ease of implementation, surgical safety checklists have since been adopted in more than 1500 hospitals around the world, and have been nationally implemented in multiple countries.
The regulation of sleep is of vast clinical importance. Insomnia and circadian disorders are costly in both economic and human health terms. Sleep is believed to be controlled by both circadian and homeostatic systems, which ensure that sleep needs are met.
Epidemiological studies have consistently shown beneficial effects of moderate consumption of ethanol in reducing ischemic heart disease, . Acute ethanol administration can also protect the heart and isolated cardiomyocytes from ischemic injury, although the acute cytoprotective effect of ethanol depends critically on the dose and timing of administration, . We also found that ethanol preconditioning results in mitochondrial translocation of PKCε, increased ALDH2 activity and reduced cardiac injury, in vivo.
Ewing's sarcoma is an aggressive bone associated tumor that affects the pediatric population. EWS/FLI is thought to function as a transcriptional activator . However, in Ewing's sarcoma cells, three times as many genes are down regulated by EWS/FLI than are up regulated .
Chromosome ends are protected by telomeres which prevent DNA damage response and degradation . Telomeres form a large duplex loop mediated by single strand invasion of a G rich overhang . When telomeres become critically short the DNA damage response is engaged at chromosome ends .
Renal cell carcinoma  is the third most common urological cancer after prostate and bladder cancer, accounting for about 3% of all human malignancies in adults . The absence of biomarkers is responsible for late diagnosis and subsequent poor prognosis. Recent studies have shown that genetic events and histopathologically heterogeneous disorder play a major role in the development of ccRCC .
A variety of natural products with a vast range of biological activities have polyketide and nonribosomal peptide fragments joined together. Of special note are cyclic five membered nitrogen containing ring structures that generate conformational constraints and offer hydrogen bonding possibilities for interaction with target proteins. Typically the ketone at C4 is enolized with the 4 hydroxy 3 ene tautomer predominating .
Structured diagnostic interviews are used in large scale surveys as a way to eliminate clinician bias, improve standardization of diagnosis, and assess prevalence of psychiatric disorders in national studies . The World Health Organization  Composite International Diagnostic Interview Version 3.0  is a standardized diagnostic interview designed to assess current and lifetime mental disorders according to the definitions and criteria of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders IV . The primary features of the CIDI are its reliance on respondents' self report and standardization of administration by reliable non clinicians after a relatively brief training period  .
Status epilepticus  is a major medical and neurological emergency that requires immediate treatment to avoid significant morbidity and mortality. Status epilepticus has been estimated to affect as many as 200,000 people in the United States annually and causes as many as 55,000 deaths per year . Despite significant improvements in the diagnosis and treatment of SE over the past 30 years, SE in adults is still associated with a significant morbidity and mortality .
The ade6 gene of fission yeast encodes a phosphoribosylaminoimidazole carboxylase required for the de novo synthesis of purines . Cells with mutations in ade6 are auxotrophic for adenine, but grow as efficiently as wild type when adenine is added to the media . Early work based on these properties identified nearly 400 different alleles of ade6 and about 46,000 additional alleles were created in the following five decades .
Spinal Muscular Atrophy  is an autosomal recessive disorder characterized by loss of motor neurons and atrophy of the muscle . In humans, the SMA determining region on chromosome 5q contains two genes Survival Motor Neuron 1  and SMN2. Low levels of SMN lead to the selective death of motor neurons and subsequent muscle atrophy.
Adolescent use of alcohol and cannabis are major public health and legal concerns in all Western countries, given the evidence of association with concurrent and future harm . Laws and policies are in place in most Western countries to limit access and restrict use of substances . However, drug laws tend to be complicated, subject to interpretation, and enforced and adjudicated variably.
Suspensions of stabilized microbubbles have been approved as commercial contrast agents for ultrasound imaging. The highly non linear response of the microbubbles provides novel opportunities for diagnostic imaging . This unique phenomenon may present an attractive opportunity for development of non invasive therapeutic applications .
Structural interventions are increasingly touted as necessary for quelling the HIV/AIDS epidemic  and for preventing the spread of HIV among youth . Despite a decade of calls for their implementation and assessment, structural interventions have rarely been developed  or evaluated . Having youth participate in problem identification and solution setting when they are the intended beneficiaries of health promotion efforts may enhance the utility of proposed solutions and promote cause based passion among adult members .
Aortic aneurysms are characterized by abnormal enlargements of the aorta caused by global or localized weakness of the vessel wall. Genetically engineered mice provide further evidence that the vascular ECM is the critical determinant of aneurysm development, including an allelic series of Fbn1 mutant mice, and mice homozygous for null alleles of the genes encoding lysyl oxidase, a crosslinking enzyme for elastin and collagen, and ECM proteins such as fibulin 4  and biglycan   . Thus, the pathogenesis of aortic aneurysm formation may involve abnormalities in homeostasis of vascular ECM proteins or abnormal SMC development, or both .
Creating surfaces with defined topography is a simple way to manipulate the environment that a cell experiences on the micrometer and nanometer scale. More recent work in this area has largely exploited the development of new, more enabling protocols for fabricating substrates that provide attachment points or guidance cues for cellular attachment and growth. Many of the previously reported studies of cell guidance have used PDMS substrates containing microchannels/grooves, many of which were created by replica molding .
Epidemiological and toxicological evidence suggests lower risk of smokeless tobacco  products compared to cigarettes. Less is known, however, about consumer perceptions and use of novel forms of ST, including snus and dissolvable tobacco . In this study, we conducted in person experimental auctions in Buffalo, NY, Columbia, SC, and Selinsgrove, PA with 571 smokers to test the impact of information and product trials on smokers’ preferences.
Researchers studying empathy typically have focused on empathic responses to others’ negative emotions rather than positive emotions. Positive affect has been related to benefits in a variety of domains of functioning , but the relations of vicariously induced positive affect  to other socio emotional competencies, such as social adjustment, seldom have been examined. The main purpose of this study was to examine the reliability of a new measure of children’s dispositional positive empathy and to examine the concurrent and longitudinal relations of positive empathy to positive emotion, empathy/sympathy, and social competence .
