Accelerated hypofractionated partial breast irradiation  condenses the standard 6 weeks of radiation treatment into 5 days, offering logistical and quality of life benefits . A mode of APBI that has become increasingly popular is interstitial brachythereapy  . In particular, a recent study evaluating rates of normal tissue toxicity for those treated with IBAPBI report grade I, II, and III radiation induced fibrosis  to occur at a rate of 26%, 2%, and 0%, respectively  .
Langerhans cells  are dendritic cells that reside in the epidermis. LC are capable, in several experimental systems, of Ag presentation for stimulation of cell mediated immunity  and have been believed to play a key role in initiation of cutaneous immune responses. As LC in situ in the skin are frequently anatomically associated with calcitonin gene related peptide  containing nerves , the possibility that CGRP influences the ability of LC to support Th1  or Th2 type immunity must be considered.
Alcohol consumption has been established as a major risk factor for esophageal cancer , which remains one of the most common and fatal malignancies worldwide  . When further oxidized, acetaldehyde produces less toxic acetic acid by aldehyde dehydrogenases   . The ADH1B  A/A homodimer has been found to have a 40 fold higher enzyme activity than the G/G form.
Genital Chlamydia trachomatis infection in humans leads to pathological sequelae in the upper genital tract  including pelvic inflammatory disease, ectopic pregnancy and infertility . A licensed preventive vaccine is thought to be the solution to this problem, but has yet to be developed . Th 1 type cellular responses including IFN γ production have been shown to play a predominant role in anti chlamydial protective immunity .
The elevation of nitric oxide  in skin cells after ultraviolet light B  irradiation plays an important role in regulation of apoptosis . UVB also induces the production of superoxide  , which could rapidly react with NO• to form peroxynitrite  . An elevation of intracellular Zn2+  has been shown to correlate to NO• production and oxidative stress induced apoptosis .
Glyceraldehyde 3 phosphate dehydrogenase, spermatogenic , the sperm specific isoform of human GAPDH , is under active study as a male contraceptive target . In contrast to the somatic form of GAPDH, the sperm specific GAPDHS possesses a unique proline rich extension at the amino terminus which varies between species ), and may mediate binding to the fibrous sheath in the sperm flagellum  . Isolation of native GAPDHS from sperm has proved challenging due to its tight association with the fibrous sheath.
TGFβ inducible early gene 1 , also referred to as KLF10, was originally cloned from human osteoblasts  as a primary response gene following TGFβ treatment . Following the initial discovery, we demonstrated that TIEG over expression in MG63 human osteosarcoma cells mimicked TGFβ treatment by inducing alkaline phosphatase mRNA and inhibiting cell proliferation and osteocalcin secretion . More specifically, we have shown that TIEG over expression enhances Smad binding element  reporter activity that is dependent on Smad 4 expression .
The wide range in contractile, biochemical and morphological properties among muscle fibers is a common feature of skeletal muscle in virtually all animal species . During development, this muscle fiber heterogeneity is largely regulated by cell lineage . The MyoD family of myogenic regulatory factors  consists of MyoD, myogenin, myf5 and MRF4 .
The Transforming Growth Factor β  superfamily comprises a large number of cytokines that regulate tissue homeostasis and development through the regulation of fundamental processes such as cell proliferation, differentiation, motility and programmed cell death. TGF β has been shown to not only play a central role in development and normal organ function, but also to affect many pathological processes such as cirrhosis, nephrosclerosis, and tumorigenesis ) . There is considerable genetic evidence that the TGF _ signaling pathway is a tumor suppressor pathway in colon epithelial cells.
Non small cell lung cancer  is the leading cause of cancer death in the United States and worldwide . Five year survival rate of NSCLC patients is only 13%. Therefore, finding NSCLC early is a realistic approach to reduce the mortality associated with lung cancer .
During development of the central nervous system , differentiation of the myelinating cells, oligodendrocytes, and the process of active myelination itself are regulated by complex interactions of the oligodendrocytes’ cell surfaces with their extracellular environments . These interactions are to a large extent mediated by the integrin class of extracellular matrix  receptors . In agreement with a pivotal role of integrin ECM signaling for the regulation of oligodendrocyte differentiation and CNS myelination, signaling molecules that are effectors in integrin mediated signaling cascades have also been implicated in these processes  .
Targeting interventions to characteristics of specific groups of patients has been supported in research studies and frequently discussed as desirable. Thus, in addition to the overall comparison of an intervention to usual care or another intervention, it is important to test for moderating effects to identify potential efficacy for subgroups of the population. Post hoc tests for characteristics, such as age, may lack discrimination because distributions are skewed toward older ages.
In the United States, employees are legally entitled to a safe and healthy workplace. Surveillance systems capture these data and are key for designing effective interventions to improve worker safety and health . With a warming climate and more frequent extreme weather events predicted, exposure to ambient heat could become a prominent employee safety issue in the near future.
Chronic kidney disease, particularly end stage renal disease  treated with hemodialysis, is a powerful, independent risk factor for coronary artery disease  . In addition, traditional risk factors such as hypertension, diabetes and hyperlipidemia are common coexisting conditions. This highly atherogenic milieu in patients with ESRD results in a CAD associated mortality 1020 times greater than the normal population  .
The development of a non invasive imaging methodology that is both sensitive and specific to white matter  pathologies would be very valuable for the diagnosis, characterization and follow up of different WM associated disorders of the central nervous system . q Space diffusion MRS was first used by King et al. q Space analysis is performed by Fourier transformation of the signal decay with respect to the q value  to obtain the displacement distribution profile of molecules in the system, according to :EΔ=∫P¯sexpdR In this equation, EΔ represents the echo decay as a function of q, R is the net displacement vector  and P¯s is the displacement probability. Kurtosis is another parameter that has recently been added to describe restricted diffusion.
Depressive symptoms are common in elderly hospitalized patients, with significant symptom levels occurring in 10 to 44% of patients. The presence of depressive symptoms during hospitalization is associated with adverse outcomes, a finding initially noted among select patient groups such as those with acute myocardial infarction. , It is now recognized that among elderly patients hospitalized with a range of medical diagnoses, those with depressive symptoms are at increased risk of poor post hospitalization outcomes including worse physical and mental health, functional decline and increased mortality.
Griscelli syndrome  is a rare autosomal recessive disorder caused by mutations in the MYO5A , RAB27A , or MLPH  genes . In addition, GS1 patients present with severe central nervous system dysfunction, while GS2 patients develop hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis  with or without neurological involvement. For GS3 patients, the clinical phenotype is restricted to hypomelanosis of the skin; the same is true for GS1 patients with mutations in exon F of MYO5A  .
Steroid hormone receptors bind hormones such as estrogen, glucocorticoid or progesterone within the cell and then regulate transcription of steroid responsive genes. Hence, the RNA was entitled “steroid receptor RNA activator”, or “SRA”. It was subsequently proposed that SRA asserts similar regulatory effects on transcription in additional biological contexts, such as myogenesis  and adipogenesis , reviewed recently in  .
Over the past decade, transcatheter cardiac ablation  procedures for treatment of supraventricular arrhythmias have become routine in hospitals around the world. TCA aims to restore normal sinus rhythm by destroying or electrically isolating arrhythmogenic tissue with radiofrequency ablation  lesions. Fluoroscopy is used to visualize catheters in the body but does not provide the soft tissue resolution needed to visualize the cardiac anatomy or RFA lesions.
Prostate development begins prenatally when fetal androgens bind to androgen receptors in UGS mesenchyme to stimulate prostatic ductal progenitors, or buds in UGS epithelium. Prostatic buds, like buds in other organs , are formed in sequential stages . The first stage is the specification stage, when molecular signals specify where buds will form on the UGS surface.
The Lsm proteins were identified in Saccharomyces cerevisiae by their sequence similarity to the canonical Sm proteins . They are found throughout eukaryotes and related proteins are also present in archaebacteria  and in eubacteria . Eight Lsm proteins have been identified in S. cerevisiae.
Fulminant hepatic failure is a life threatening condition that is treated by transplantation of the liver when a donor organ can be found. Thus, the use of a liver assist devices  has greater theoretic potential as a minimally intrusive therapy, as incorporated hepatocytes might provide additional metabolic capacity and physiologically active molecules important for recovery of native hepatic function  . The expected cell type used in LADs is clearly a human hepatocyte to support the systemic dysfunction that occurs after liver failure, other cell sources include porcine hepatocytes and lately stem cell derived hepatocytes .
Adolescent involvement in gangs is a serious public health problem, with an estimated 788 000 youths involved in 27 000 gangs in the United States in 2007 . Gang membership is typically characterized by engagement in some form of criminal activity, such as fighting with other gangs, stealing cars or other goods, selling illegal drugs, or engaging in property damage . Accordingly, gang members report higher rates of violent offending, nonviolent delinquency, and victimization than their peers .
Persistent oxidative damage to cellular DNA associated with chronic inflammation developed in response to microbial and viral infections, tobacco smoke, and other environmental insults, is genotoxic and has been implicated in the etiology of many human cancers . The most common DNA lesion detected in vivo is 8 oxo 7,8 dihydroguanine , a well known biomarker of oxidative stress . This lesion is mutagenic because it mispairs with A during replication by DNA polymerases that lead to a predominant G → T transversion mutation , the second most common somatic mutation in human carcinomas .
Dendritic Cells  are critical antigen presenting cells  characterized by their efficient conversion of internalized antigens into peptide MHC complexes  required to orchestrate T cell responses . Critical DC functions such as antigen presentation, expression of co stimulatory molecules and migration are tightly controlled by a maturation process, where stimuli such as Toll like receptor  ligands or inflammatory cytokines convert immature DCs into mature DCs specialized for T cell stimulation  . Due to the paucity of DCs and the consequent difficulty in tracking their APC function in situ, many of the studies of DC maturation have relied on culture systems amenable for DC manipulation and analysis.
Allergic airway inflammation is a complex disease that involves generation, mobilization, trafficking and recruitment of multiple inflammatory cells, including T helper type 2  cells, eosinophils, neutrophils and natural killer  cells to the airways . Amongst these, eosinophils play a prominent pro inflammatory role in airway allergic inflammation , contributing to several of the clinical features of allergic asthma . Clinical studies as well as murine models of allergic airway inflammation have shown up regulation of bone marrow  eosinophils and their progenitors .
The correct and consistent use of condoms during sexual activity can effectively reduce the transmission of HIV,, so condom use is regularly measured as a proxy for HIV risk. Finally, condom use, which is a repeated behavior that must be reenacted each time one has sex with each different partner, is complex. Challenges to accurately measuring condom use exist on three levels.
Approximately 2.4 million people in India  are infected with HIV; the vast majority of these  are infected via heterosexual sex . Marriage is now the primary risk factor for HIV among women in India, and almost 90 % of new HIV infections among women do not involve commercial sex and mostly occur in the context of marriage . Women are often unaware of being exposed to this risk from their husbands.
Traumatic brain injury  is a major cause of acquired disability in children , which results in physical impairments and difficulty with cognition, mood, behavior, social development, and school performance . Many children also experience changes in their sleep patterns after TBI that could contribute to irritability, disrupted sleep, and daytime somnolence . Sleep maturation is influenced by hormones of puberty, sleep hormones, circadian rhythms, and social and behavioral contexts .
Poorly differentiated thyroid carcinomas of conventional type  and oncocytic  type  are biologically situated between well differentiated papillary  and follicular  thyroid carcinomas on the one hand and anaplastic thyroid carcinomas  on the other. The entity was finally recognized by the WHO in 2004, however, the criteria were not well defined . A consensus meeting was held in 2007 and a diagnostic algorithm was developed by different experts in thyroid pathology throughout the world .
TAR DNA binding protein of 43 kDa  is the major component of protein aggregates in patients with sporadic and most familial ALS and in a subclass of patients with frontotemporal lobar degeneration  characterized by ubiquitin positive inclusions . Moreover, mutations in the gene encoding TDP43 are associated with familial ALS and FTLD with motor neuron disease, strengthening the conclusion that this protein plays a central role in disease pathogenesis  . TDP 43 is a widely expressed nuclear protein that binds DNA and RNA, inhibits retroviral replication, and participates in RNA splicing and nuclear body formation .
Neurosteroids are endogenous steroid molecules in the brain that can allosterically potentiate or inhibit GABAA receptor function . Both synaptic  and extrasynaptic  GABAA receptors can be modulated by neurosteroids; extrasynaptic GABAA receptors may be of particular importance as targets of neurosteroid modulation . Enhancing neurosteroids, such as 5α, 3α THDOC, play a role in depression, seizure susceptibility, ethanol action, and many other nervous system functions .
Neural proliferation has been recorded in adults animals of all vertebrate taxa and, with few exceptions, occurs in the cell layer surrounding the lateral ventricles, the ventricular zone  . Neural progenitor cells migrate into distinct brain areas where they differentiate into functional neurons . Steroids are among the factors affecting neural proliferation.
Influenza A viruses cause a highly contagious respiratory disease that results in approximately 36,000 deaths annually in the United States . Influenza A viruses are also responsible for the world wide pandemics that usually result in high mortality rates . We are now in the midst of a pandemic caused by a virus originating in swine, the 2009 H1N1 virus or “swine flu” .
Dopaminergic amacrine  cells are retinal interneurons that modulate a variety of key visual processes, most notably, those associated with light adaptation and the transition from scotopic to photopic visual function . Despite comprising such a tiny minority of all retinal cells, the total number of DA cells in the mouse retina is tightly regulated, exhibiting minimal variation within a given strain of mice despite large inter strain differences . These cells are distributed equally across the four quadrants of the mouse retina , but their local distribution has been variously described as “regularly ordered” , “irregular” , or “randomly distributed” .
Methylphenidate is one of the most frequently prescribed medications for the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder . Its prescription usage has been rising along with increasing public awareness of the morbidity and disability associated with this disorder, and the critical importance of successful diagnosis and treatment . At the same time, diversion of methylphenidate for use as a recreational street drug has also been on the rise  causing serious and persisting concerns about the potential addictive properties of this compound  .
Worldwide, there are over 350 million individuals chronically infected with the human hepatitis B virus ; approximately 25% of chronically HBV infected individuals will develop hepatocellular carcinoma  . The HBV genome is a partially double stranded DNA genome containing four overlapping open reading frames  that encode the viral polymerase/reverse transcriptase, capsid, envelope, and X  proteins . HBx is a multifunctional protein that can modulate cellular transcription, protein degradation, calcium signaling, cell cycle, and apoptotic pathways ).
The behavioral economic approach to the study of cross temporal decision making conceptualizes addiction as a disorder of restricted time horizon , where future consequences falling beyond the horizon  are not adequately integrated into the valuation of current behavioral alternatives. However, addiction is also characterized by memory deficits , insensitivity to risk , and social cognitive dysfunction beyond generalized addiction related social withdrawal . Insights from basic research suggest that these addiction related deficits may simply be different manifestations of a common underlying process .
In order for a tumor to grow beyond approximately 1 2 mm3, it must recruit and form new vasculature as it can no longer rely on the passive diffusion of nutrients . With the development of vascular specific contrast agents, medical imaging techniques have become much more sensitive to particular aspects of angiogenesis . For example, the advent of contrast enhanced ultrasound  using microbubbles targeted to specific receptors permits the study of angiogenesis at a molecular level .
Many diseases are characterized by undesired peripheral neural activity. For example, spasticity , chorea, tics and intractable hiccups are all associated with pathological motor activity. Numerous painful conditions including cancer pain, neuromas and neuralgias are associated with pathological afferent activity.
Dysphagia is a serious yet common problem in older adults, especially for those in hospital settings and in sub acute care facilities  . Patients with stroke or hip fracture, the most common reasons for sub acute care admission , are at especially high dysphagia risk. Forty to seventy percent of older adults with acute stroke experience dysphagia .
Microarrays have shown increasing potential as a component of high throughput analytical devices for the rapid detection of biomolecules for a variety of applications such as drug screening. Microarrays of proteins, DNA, carbohydrates, and lipid bilayers have been prepared . Protein microarrays have applications in proteomics and protein functional studies , DNA chips are used in gene expression studies and rapid DNA sequencing , and carbohydrate microarrays can be used in glycomics studies and pathogen identification .
Plasticity in transcription regulation can be achieved by dynamic regulation of histone modifications, particularly on the amino terminal histone tails . H4 K16 acetylation in higher eukaryotes is mainly carried out by histone acetyltransferase  MOF , also called MYST1 or KAT8 . Both components are highly conserved among eukaryotes.
Historically, all diagnostic testing was performed at the patient’s bedside. Under either definition, rapid turn around time is a key requirement for POCT particularly because it can improve medical decision making. However, with advances in technology, POCT has now been extended to infectious diseases, cardiac markers, and drugs of abuse.
Aicardi syndrome is a rare neurodevelopmental disorder affecting females and, very rarely, males with a 47,XXY karyotype . The diagnosis of Aicardi syndrome in boys with a 46,XY karyotype has been reported but not confirmed subsequently . Aicardi syndrome is sporadic except for one reported pair of affected sisters  and a pair of affected monozygotic twins .
The production of superoxide from macrophages is a noted antibacterial function of innate immunity. Exactly how endotoxin activates macrophages to generate superoxide is still largely unknown. Specifically, the signaling mechanisms involved between the activation of the putative endotoxin receptor CD14:TLR4 and the assembly of the NADPH oxidase have not been determined .
Cleft palate is one of the most commonly observed congenital malformations in humans, occurring in up to 1 in 500 live births. The function of the palate is to separate the oral cavity and nasal cavity to allow respiration, deglutition and phonation to occur. Interruption of the normal palate proliferation, elevation or fusion process leads to cleft palate formation.
Anger is related to both acute  and chronic pain intensity . That is, they may reveal strong contraction of low back muscles ) during stress while not necessarily showing such tension increases in muscle groups distant from the pain site. Findings support symptom specificity models among CLBP patients  and those with neck and shoulder pain .
The active metabolite of vitamin D, 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin D 2D3), regulates transcription through its binding to the vitamin D receptor  for subsequent regulation of proliferation and differentiation in a number of cells, including keratinocytes . The 1,252D3 independent actions of VDR in keratinocytes have also been shown in in vivo mouse models . Later, we found out that DRIP complex belong to the transcriptional coactivator complex called “Mediator” by structural simila­rity.
Butterflies and moths  have a large number of short holocentric chromosomes  with substantial variation in chromosome number  . However, the most common chromosome numbers are n=29 31, , and the distribution is markedly skewed with only a few species having n>31. The ancestral chromosome number has been inferred to be 31, , but until recently this has been difficult to confirm due to lack of comprehensive phylogenies.
Natural Killer  cells are a critical component of the immune system where they play a role in viral responses and tumor control. Human NK cells develop from CD34+ hematopoietic stem cells  and must traverse through a number of developmental stages prior to acquisition of CD56 expression and functional competence . NK cell commitment is marked by CD56 expression that can be divided further into two populations of NK cells based on CD56 intensity, with the CD56bright NK cells preceding, and giving rise to the CD56dim NK cells .
Neuroimaging methods play an important role in the process of extending our understanding of brain structure and function. Despite the large number of neuroimaging studies conducted to delineate brain activations related to a wide range of cognitive functions, the fundamental issue of how the brain regions communicate to each other still remains open . In the context of this paper, we stress that in resting state studies, functional connectivity analysis commonly plays a central role  .
Alzheimer's disease , the most common cause of dementia in the elderly, is characterized pathologically by the deposition of β amyloid  plaques and neurofibrillary tangles in the hippocampus and cerebral cortex. Because only symptomatic treatments are now available, safe and effective mechanism based therapies are needed for this devastating neurodegenerative disease of later life. Experimental support of the “amyloid cascade hypothesis” has led investigators to identify and evaluate targets for anti amyloid therapeutic strategies, which are designed to reduce the amyloid burden in the brains of individuals with AD .
2 deoxy D glucose  is a glucose analogue which, when administered in vivo, can be taken up by cells through glucose transporters. Once intracellular, it undergoes phosphorylation catalyzed by hexokinase but, unlike glucose itself, does not undergo further metabolism but is trapped and accumulates within cells . 2DG has previously been used ex vivo to evaluate cellular function and metabolic activity, and non invasive methods of measurement of 2DG or similar molecules would be valuable for studies of glucose uptake in a variety of applications including assessments of tumors and other pathologies .
The preponderance of research addressing violence against women in the United States focuses on intimate partner violence, meaning physical or sexual violence perpetrated by male partners . The distressingly high level of intimate partner violence among women who use drugs is well established . Intimate partner violence is 3 times more common among women who use drugs than among other women  and appears to be particularly common among those women who have partners who also use drugs .
Asbestos fibers are a naturally occurring hydrated silicate mineral used for commercial applications. Exposure to asbestos typically occurs during mining and milling of the fibers or during industrial application of asbestos in textiles, insulation, shipbuilding, brake lining mechanics, and other areas. Asbestos has two primary classes: serpentine and amphibole.
The metabolic syndrome , a highly prevalent condition in the elderly, is associated with potentially reversible risk factors and with cardiovascular and cerebrovascular morbidity and mortality. MetS is also associated with inflammation and hormonal dysfunction,, which in turn are involved in the pathogenesis of anemia . Low hemoglobin levels are common in older subjects, and herald several adverse outcomes like mortality, disability and hospitalization.
Adaptive behavior requires the ability to maintain stable cognitive representations while remaining sensitive to novel information in order to modify behavior based on changing task contexts . These complementary mechanisms, referred to as cognitive stability and flexibility, form the core of cognitive control . Although the stability/flexibility framework is not typically applied to infant research, doing so may provide a link between the components of cognitive stability and flexibility that are available early in life and more complex cognitive control processes observed among older children and adults.
Floods have occurred in the recent past, including those during the monsoons of 1998, 2004, and 2007. In addition to flood related epidemics, Bangladesh faces seasonal diarrheal peaks resulting from an increased incidence of waterborne diseases, which are a cause of significant morbidity. , Clinical features of diarrheal diseases seen at health facilities tend to be more severe during floods.
Initially described by Dor in 1989 , endoventricular patch plasty  is used to reduce left ventricular  volume after myocardial infarction  and subsequent LV remodeling. The Dor procedure can be performed safely. , The authors speculated that improved systolic function was balanced by worsened diastolic function.
Brain development depends on a sequence of cellular and molecular events underlying the process of neuronal generation. Through this sequence, neuronal identity is restricted and defined. The generation of specific classes of neurons is a complex process that can be subdivided into a series of steps.
According to the U.S. National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute's  Asthma Guidelines, the goal of asthma treatment is to improve the quality of life  of people who have asthma, while working toward controlling symptoms, reducing the risk of exacerbations, and preventing asthma related death  . Most notably, past efforts to measure asthma QoL have resulted in tools that can confound QoL with symptoms , functional impairment , and control . Instead, the Subcommittee strongly recommended development of new instruments that incorporate the patient's perspective and are able to measure the impact of asthma on QoL as a construct that is distinct from asthma symptoms or functional status.
The development of new treatments for a disease requires knowledge of the molecular target of those treatments. Naringenin  is a member of the flavonone subclass of flavonoids, a large family of plant polyphenols. Naringenin is ingested mostly as naringin  and is available at relatively high doses  in grapefruit juice .
Birds, unlike mammals, have the ability to regenerate hair cells  following damage to the peripheral auditory organ, the basilar papilla   and  for reviews). Aminoglycoside antibiotics cause damage to both short and tall HCs over a region of the papilla extending from the base for a distance that depends on the dose administered and the duration of administration. Recovery of neural and behavioral thresholds after aminoglycoside treatment is correlated with HC regeneration.
Over the past decade, studies of animal models have transformed our understanding of cardiac embryology. In particular, the use of genetic cell lineage analysis, along with the ability to assess large numbers of specimens, has permitted the accurate tracking of distinct cellular contributions within the developing mouse heart. These findings have provided a framework for understanding cardiac development in man, where comparable studies are hampered by limited availability of specimens, and the impossibility of following cell lineage.
Diabetes is a metabolic disease that involves the death or dysfunction of the insulin secreting β cells of the pancreas. Although diabetes can be managed with insulin and other drugs, physiological glucose homeostasis is difficult to achieve by these means, and hyperglycemia is largely responsible for the co morbidities associated with diabetes. Consequently, much research on diabetes is aimed at understanding the molecular and cellular basis for pancreatic β cell development, survival, and regulated insulin secretion in order to discover ways to restore β cells or their functions in diabetic patients .
Ubiquitination is the process of tagging a target protein with ubiquitin  or a polyubiquitin chain as part of post translational modifications leading to regulatory roles such as protein degradation in the proteosome . The main function of E1 ubiquitin activating enzyme is to catalyse the adenylation of ubiquitin at the expense of one ATP molecule. Amongst the most promising inhibitors of p53 Mdm2 interaction in drug development are the highly potent imidazoline based Nutlin compounds   .
Thyroid hormones  are essential for the normal growth and development of the fetus with even minor perturbations in maternal thyroid status during early pregnancy being associated with neurodevelopmental abnormalities in children in later life . Since effects of maternal thyroid status impact on outcome at a time before development of the thyroid in the fetus, it is clear that supply of maternal THs across the placenta is critical to normal fetal development during pregnancy. Significant transport of maternal THs across the placenta is also evidenced by the finding of significant concentrations of serum T4 and T3 in neonates with congenital hypothyroidism and absent endogenous thyroid function  .
Iron plays an important role in central nervous system  myelination and inflammation. During development, a spatial temporal relationship exists involving iron accumulation by microglia and oligodendrocytes. Most iron is present within microglia during the first two weeks after birth; subsequently iron stores shift to oligodendrocytes, which become the major iron containing cells in the adult CNS .
Assessment of human cancer risk from environmental carcinogen exposures remains a challenging and inexact prospect. The magnitude of the problem is outlined in . Risk assessments based on this procedure can involve extrapolations several orders of magnitude below the actual experimental data.
Bladder cancer is the sixth most common cancer in the United States, with an estimated 72,570 new cases and 15,210 deaths in 2013 . Patients with NMIBC are treated by bladder sparing therapies and require frequent expensive surveillance but the disease is not life threatening. Bladder cancer is considered a clinically heterogeneous disease, with low grade NMIBC classified as non aggressive and genomically stable, while high grade NMIBC and MIBC classified as aggressive and genomically unstable  .
All trans retinoic acid  is the biologically active derivative of vitamin A. atRA has been considered a potentially promising chemotherapeutic agent, due to its pro apoptotic and growth suppressing activity. Previous results from our laboratory have demonstrated that atRA treatment of the ovarian carcinoma cell line CAOV3 results in >50% growth suppression. This results from arrest of the cell cycle during the G1 phase .
Dietary restriction  extends lifespan and slows aging across a variety of taxa and also causes myriad other physiological changes . To ascertain which of these processes affected by DR might be causally responsible for DR’s benefits, we have utilized genetic variation underlying a variety of physiological traits in the ILSXISS  series of recombinant inbred  strains of mice . The ILSXISS is one of the largest RI panels available in mice , which makes it advantageous for applying genetic approaches, similar to those that have advanced our understanding of aging in invertebrate models .
G protein coupled receptors  comprise a large family of integral membrane proteins that mediate signal transduction across the cell membrane. Structural models predicted in silico can provide insights to better understand ligand binding specificity and the activation mechanism of GPCRs . After the rhodopsin structure was solved in 2000, homology modeling and fragment based threading methods were applied to build models for GPCRs using the rhodopsin structure as the template.
Recent epidemiological studies have demonstrated a correlation between exposure to fine particulate matter and an increased incidence of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality . Unfortunately the mechanisms behind this correlation remain largely unknown. Ultrafine particles  have been reported to be particularly relevant pathologically due to their small size and high reactivity.
Parkinson’s disease  is a common neurodegenerative disorder characterized clinically by tremor, rigidity, bradykinesia, and postural instability, and pathologically by selective loss of dopaminergic  neurons in affected brain regions. Mutations in leucine rich repeat kinase 2  represent the most frequent cause of autosomal dominant and idiopathic PD identified to date . About thirty LRRK2 sequence variations have been identified .
Sorbitol is a sugar substitute often used in diet foods  and sugar free chewing gums. It also occurs naturally in many stone fruits and berries from trees of the genus Sorbus. Sorbitol can also aggravate irritable bowl syndrome and fructose malabsorption.
Angiosarcoma  is a rare, usually high grade malignant vascular endothelial tumor comprising less than 1% of all sarcomas. Histologically angiosarcomas vary from spindled to epithelioid morphology. CD30 is a 120 kD transmembrane glycoprotein and a member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 8 .
The caries process is potentially preventable and curable. Light scattering in sound dental enamel decreases markedly in the near infrared  region and studies have shown that enamel has the highest transparency near 1310nm . The decay on the important occlusal surfaces can also be imaged employing an alternative NIR transillumination imaging configuration in which NIR light is delivered to the tooth from the buccal or lingual surface to diffuse upward through the dentin to provide uniform back illumination of the enamel of the crown .
Hsp70s are universally conserved and essential protein chaperones that protect proteins during stress and help proteins fold, cross membranes, assemble and disassemble into complexes and become degraded . In the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae several infectious amyloids  have been described that are transmitted between cells during mating and cell division . Changes in expression levels or function of any of several major chaperones or co chaperones can influence prion propagation .
Nanoparticle based in vivo diagnostic imaging is one part of the broad research field of nanomedicine that is currently the focus of numerous interdisciplinary research groups worldwide. Other contrast agents that are under development are based on other nuclei, for instance 19F, which is thought to be the most useful in functional MRI applications and for applications involving in vivo drug monitoring. , , As 19F contrast agents, fluorinated compounds, such as small molecule perfluorocarbons  with high fluorine content and a single fluorine resonance, have been utilized.
Cannabis is one of the most widely used psychoactive substances in the United States . Perceived risk of use is associated with substance use; the recent debate surrounding medicalization and legalization of cannabis in the U.S. has the potential to impact perceived risk of use. Recent estimates are needed to assess temporal changes in, and identify correlates of, perceived risk of cannabis use .
Collagen induced arthritis  is an established mouse model of human rheumatoid arthritis . Immunization with heterologous collagen type II in susceptible mouse strains results in autoantibody production to murine collagen type II, followed by autoantibody binding to joint cartilage, activation of the complement cascade, and inflammation resulting in tissue destruction . Both MHC and non MHC genes are implicated in disease susceptibility .
Numerous proteins that are critical to cellular function are synthesized endoplasmic reticulum  ribosomes, then folded and further post translationally modified in the ER lumen. Stresses that impede ER protein folding trigger the ER stress response  , a signaling system that has not been studied extensively in the heart. ER stress activates the transcription factors, X box binding protein  and activator of transcription 6 , which induce numerous ERSR proteins designed to restore efficient ER protein folding, which contributes to resisting the stress ,.
Mallory Denk Bodies , which are an intracellular deposition of misfolded protein in ballooned hepatocytes, consist of abnormally phosphorylated, ubiquitylated, and cross linked keratins or non keratin K18 and 8, and p62 components . Balloon hepatocytes forming MDBs are progenitor preneoplasia cells . In the DDC fed mouse model where liver cells proliferate, MDBs form and later, after DDC withdrawal, HCCs develop .
A number of epidemiologic studies have associated pre  and post natal exposure toambient air pollution with adverse respiratory outcomes. Post natal exposures to airpollutants, including particulate matter , ozone , nitrogen dioxide, carbon monoxide , and sulfur dioxide , have beenassociated with increased infant mortality, even in developed countries such as the UnitedStates, with the strongest associations for post neonatal respiratory mortality . Although a number of studies report increased risks of respiratory symptoms inearly life in association with air pollution exposure,, relatively few studies havespecifically examined early life respiratory infection  in relation to traffic related emissions.
Our objective was to determine the probability threshold for recurrent symptoms at which elective cholecystectomy compared to observation in older patients with symptomatic cholelithiasis is the more effective and cost effective option . We built a decision model of elective cholecystectomy vs. observation in patients >65 presenting with initial episodes of symptomatic cholelithiasis that did not require initial hospitalization or cholecystectomy. Probabilities for subsequent hospitalization, emergency cholecystectomy, and perioperative complications were based on previously published probabilities from a 5% national sample of Medicare patients.
In the kidney, the proximal tubule reabsorbs 6070% of filtered NaCl and fluid. Therefore changes in proximal tubule reabsorption can have profound effects on renal and body fluid balance and may contribute to the development of hypertension. The normal kidney protects against acute increases in blood pressure by excreting NaCl rapidly.
The number of incarcerations in the US has dramatically increased in recent years . Incarcerated women are affected by a myriad of difficult life circumstances, including poverty, unemployment, lack of education, and unstable housing conditions . Typically, their socioeconomic difficulties exist before their incarceration .
Antibody mediated injury has reached epidemic proportions in kidney transplantation. Recent studies suggest that antibody mediated rejection  is the most important cause of allograft loss following kidney transplantation . Around the same time, C4d, a degradation product of the complement pathway that binds covalently to the endothelium, was identified as a stable marker of anti donor humoral activity .
Dental caries are the result of acidification of dental plaque, mainly by oral lactic acid bacteria, most notably Streptococcus mutans, but also other acid producing plaque bacteria. Plaque acidification is not only damaging to teeth but also stressful for the acid producing organisms, which have developed a variety of means to moderate acid stress. Other environmental stresses, such as oxidative or starvation stress, may act in conjunction with acidification in causing damage.
The nuclear envelope, comprised of the inner and outer nuclear membranes , define the nuclear rim and separate the nucleus from the cytoplasm. B type lamins, subdivided into lamins B1 and B2, are products of individual genes . Reversible phosphorylation at conserved serines within lamin head and tail domains regulates the integrity of the nuclear lamina.
Clinical and epidemiological data has associated an inflammatory microenvironment with cancer development . Although each of the IL 6 family cytokines signals through a distinct receptor complex, they share the gp130 receptor subunit . OSM was originally identified based upon its ability to inhibit the proliferation of melanoma cells , an observation that has since been confirmed in breast cancer cells, lung cancer cells, glioma, and neuroblastoma .
Hereditary deafness is phenotypically and genetically heterogeneous affecting nearly 300 million people worldwide. Genetically, it has been estimated that ~1% of all human genes may be implicated in the etiology of hereditary deafness., To date, the molecular genetic etiology for approximately 100 deafness genes have been reported. The major challenges and goals in the field have been to identify all the genes containing mutations leading to deafness and to decipher the functions of the encoded protein in auditory and vestibular pathways.
The qualities of a self specific T lymphocyte that define its pathogenicity are incompletely understood. It may be presumed that affinity guides competition among self reactive T cells during autoimmunity, much as it does for pathogen specific T cells during infections. TCR affinity may have dual roles in defining a T cell's autoimmune potential.
Globally, the estimate of those with an active headache disorder is 46% of the adult population. Cervicogenic headache  is a type of headache causally associated with cervical myofascial tender spots or cervical spine dysfunction. The reported prevalence of CGH varies from 13.8% to 17.8% of the headache population in different epidemiological studies.
Great Danes  with cervical spondylomyelopathy  are most frequently affected by the osseous associated form, which is characterized by vertebral canal stenosis secondary to osseous proliferation of the vertebral arch, articular processes and/or pedicles . Magnetic resonance imaging  is the imaging modality of choice for dogs with suspected CSM  . The morphologic MRI features of GDs with osseous associated CSM have been described retrospectively .
Synthetic biology aims at engineering tunable gene circuits, with standardized components , whose properties then can be extensively studied by combining experiments and computational modeling. Experience gained in this way deepens our understanding of natural networks  and widens our perspective on building more complex networks for applications  . An important approach in synthetic biology is to screen through many alternative network designs, computationally or experimentally, to find a network capable of achieving a pre defined function.
When viewing a stimulus with two or more distinct interpretations, observers experience perceptual switches between the two alternatives. For both binocular rivalry and ambiguous motion displays, the dynamics of the perceptual alternations were found to be stationary . A well known ambiguity in the interpretation of two superimposed drifting gratings concerns their relative motion: as  shows, they may be perceived as sliding over each other in different directions  or as moving together as a single pattern .
Improving the quality of care in nursing homes has been a major theme in health care for over 30 years. In this vein, a number of structural and process characteristics of nursing homes have been examined over the years in terms of their relationship with quality. Characteristics such as facility size, ownership, chain membership, facility resources and culture, medical treatments offered, specialized care settings, and percent private pay have all been related to outcomes.
More than two thirds of individuals with psychiatric disabilities  receiving mental health services want to work . Thus, this population still faces major barriers to employment  . Moreover, a 10 year follow up study of SE indicated that only 30% of consumers felt that practicing job interviews was helpful , which suggests that SE’s approach to improving job interview skills may have limited effectiveness.
Major depressive disorder  carries a significant risk of suicidal behavior . Epidemiologic studies suggest that 15% of individuals with MDD have attempted suicide at some point in their life  and rates of 40% have been observed in clinical populations . The vast majority of our knowledge is drawn from clinical samples of depressed individuals.
Pathogenic HIV infection of humans and SIV infection of rhesus macaques  are characterized by progressive depletion of CD4+ T cells and development of a lethal state of immunodeficiency termed AIDS . In contrast, SIV infection of African nonhuman primate species that are natural hosts for the virus, such as the sooty mangabeys  and the African green monkeys , are typically nonpathogenic despite high virus replication . Interestingly, infection of CD4+ TCM seems to play a significant role in the persistence of reservoirs of latently infected cells in HIV infected individuals treated with antiretroviral therapy , and low levels of latent CD4+ TCM infection are present in HIV infected individuals that control virus replication either spontaneously  or after ART  .
Thymidylate synthases  catalyze the reductive methylation of 2′ deoxyuridine 5′ monophosphate  to form 2′ deoxythymidine 5′ monophosphate  in nearly all eukaryotes including humans. Thus, the genomes of thyA dependent organisms have always been found to contain folA as well, forming a TS DHFR coupled catalytic cycle that is essential for thymidine biosynthesis . FDTS is a homotetramer with four identical active sites, each of which is formed at an interface of three of the four subunits .
The p21 Ras family of monomeric GTPases function as molecular switches relaying signals from cell surface receptors to intracellular kinase cascades regulating cell proliferation, differentiation, apoptosis and senescence . Studies indicating identical in vitro effector activation profiles  implied that the isoforms were functionally redundant. A simple mechanism is through regulation of the cellular expression profiles but scant quantitative data exist for relative levels of cellular Ras protein expression .
Nicotine is the primary addictive component of tobacco smoke . Through interactions with nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  in the central nervous system , nicotine modulates various genes and cellular pathways in target neurons. Through its interaction directly or indirectly with these genes, pathways, and neurotransmitter systems, nicotine is involved in the regulation of various physiological processes , as well as the morphology and function of different organelles  .
As members of the sodium and chloride dependent neurotransmitter transporter gene family, serotonin  transporters  carry out the uptake of 5 HT across plasma membranes in the central nervous system, peripheral nervous system, placenta, platelets, and pulmonary system. , SERTs are targets of antidepressants and substances of abuse like cocaine and 3,4 methyl dioxy methamphetamine, commonly known as “Ecstasy.” Hydropathy analyses initially suggested that SERTs are integral membrane proteins with 12 α helices. ,, Several studies have identified amino acid sequence differences among SERT species that confer alternate specificities for substrates and inhibitors.
The deposition of β amyloid  in the form of diffuse , primitive , and classic  deposits is one of the pathological hallmarks of Alzheimer’s disease  and Down’s syndrome  . The frequency distributions of Aβ deposit size in AD and DS have a single peak  and are positively skewed, i.e. there are few deposits in the smallest size classes , maximum frequency occurs between deposit diameters of 20 and 40 μm , and the frequency of the larger deposits declines exponentially with increasing size . Two major processes have been identified:  addition and removal of protein molecules  and  diffusion of substances into a deposit  .
Initial investigations of cancer focused on the proximate causes of the disease ; however, more recent studies have addressed the ultimate causes behind the persistence of cancer . Xmrk is the predominant gene underlying disease progression and melanomas do not occur if this gene is disrupted . Several behavioral studies have highlighted the specific importance of melanin patterns in sexual selection  and found that the same phenotype can play a role in both mate choice and male male competition.
Physical activity in children is an important determinant of health   . While studies have examined the association between physical activity and environmental factors and sociodemographic factors, few studies have reported on the role of specific physical characteristics such as eyesight that might influence physical activity . Myopia, or short sightedness, has been estimated to affect 8.4% of 412 year olds in Australia and 9.2% of 517 year olds in the U.S.A.  Children from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children  were asked to wear a uniaxial accelerometer for seven days.
For decades, coronary artery bypass graft surgery  has been the treatment of choice for symptomatic patients with medically refractory multi vessel coronary artery disease  . The SYNTAX trial is the first randomized controlled trial comparing CABG with multi vessel percutaneous coronary intervention  utilizing drug eluting stents for multi vessel CAD . The combined primary endpoint was death, stroke, myocardial infarction or repeat revascularization at 12 months.
Kv2.1 channels are the principal component of sustained outward K+ currents  in hippocampus and cortex and are found in large, highly phosphorylated clusters on the soma and proximal dendrites of pyramidal neurons . It has been proposed that the cellular location of Kv2.1 channels allows for control of somatic sub threshold excitatory responses, and ultimately, regulation of action potential initiation . However, knock down of Kv2.1 channels increases excitability of CA1 pyramidal neurons only during high frequency, but not low frequency stimulation , suggesting that these channels function differently than typical delayed rectifier channels  .
The hunting spider Cupiennius salei Keys is a nocturnal predator that has been in focus of interest for a long time because of its excellent mechano sensory systems. For hunting and mating the spider depends mainly on its mechanosensory systems . Recent studies however, have shown that C. salei has also a well developed visual system .
During development, morphogenetic movements are induced and controlled by a variety of molecules such as growth factors or hormones and their receptors. These hormones regulate gene expression patterns required for development. αPS1 is a typical laminin binding type subunit while αPS2 is an RGD  binding type subunit.
Recently, a new concept is emerging that activation of the inflammasomes, in particular, the Nlrp3  inflammasome, plays a critical role in the development of vascular diseases . It has been known that the Nlrp3 inflammasome usually consists of three main components including Nlrp3 that functions as pattern recognition receptor, the adaptor protein, ASC  and inactive pro caspase 1 protein . This inflammasome serves as intracellular machinery responsible for the production of important pro inflammatory cytokines such as interleukin 1β  and interleukin 18  , thereby producing inflammatory response.
The peritrichs are classified into two assemblages : the free living Sessilida and the parasitic Mobilida with their characteristic adhesive disk. The Sessilida, which includes the species described here, comprises about 105  to 140  genera, showing the great diversity of the group. Although a comprehensive recent review is not available, these genera comprise at least 800 described species.
Nitric oxide , a ubiquitous cellular signaling molecule, is one of the most studied small molecules in biology due to its involvement in numerous biological processes such as vasodilation, neurotransmission and immune response . There is still much that is unknown about how NO production by nitric oxide synthase  is tightly regulated . The FMN binding domain and oxygenase domain are linked by a calmodulin  binding region.
In the United States, the prevalence of adolescents who are obese has more than tripled over the past thirty years, increasing from 5% in 1976 to over 18% in 2008 . With the high prevalence of adolescent obesity, identification of physiological and psychological factors associated with obesity has become a national priority . There has been debate over whether all obese individuals have disordered eating patterns.
Microparticles  are membrane encapsulated vesicles of less than 1 μm diameter shed by all types of cells, including platelets, red blood cells , leukocytes, epithelial cells of various tissue origins, as well as tumor cells . For these reasons MPs are regarded as indicators for cell injury, stress and thrombosis and are of particular interest for understanding the mechanisms of vascular pathology  . All agree that plasma should be separated immediately or as soon possible after blood collection .
Stroke is the 4th leading cause of death in the United States and the leading cause of long term disability. Over 7 million Americans have had a stroke . The American Heart Association predicts that by 2030, the direct cost of caring for stroke patients will triple from $61.55 billion to $183.13 billion, due in large part to increasing life expectancy, declining stroke related mortality and aging U.S. population.
c Myc is a transcription factor implicated in many cellular processes such as proliferation, and apoptosis  and is over expressed in most cancers . Phase II genes play a major role in chemoresistance by detoxifying anticancer drugs. The c Myc protein belongs to the basic helix loop helix leucine zipper protein family , and forms a dimer with the ubiquitously expressed protein Max.
Atrial fibrillation  is the most common sustained dysrhythmia, affecting over 2 million people in the United States. Preventing AF is a priority given the high lifetime risk for developing the condition, the projected increase in population burden, and the substantial morbidity and mortality associated with the disease. Identification and characterization of intermediate phenotypes for AF may identify high risk individuals prior to disease onset.
Survival after out of hospital cardiac arrest  varies widely betweencommunities. These differences reflectdifferences in the distribution of patient risk factors and severity of disease; thestructure and function of emergency medical services ; and the method of measuring theprocess and outcome of care. Experts developed and disseminated the Utstein template tostandardize methods of measuring care for patients with OHCA to improve the comparabilitywithin and between communities of reports of risk factors, quality of care and outcomesafter OHCA.
Pulmonary arterial hypertension  involves abnormal proliferation of pulmonary vascular cells, resulting in pulmonary arterial remodeling and obliteration of the pulmonary vascular lumen. Ultimate clinical outcomes include increased pulmonary vascular resistance and right ventricular  failure. However, despite these advancements, there is a clear need for better understanding of the mechanisms of the disease process, given the persistently high mortality rates in this patient population.
Electrical injuries represent a small proportion of the total burn injuries that occur in North America , . The mechanisms of thermal and electrical injury are inherently different. Thermal injury occurs from superficial to deep with the majority of injury apparent on clinical examination.
Sleep disorders are reported in Parkinson’s disease, Dementia with Lewy Bodies and Alzheimer’ Disease . Whilst the pathophysiology of sleep disorders in these diseases remains unclear, it has been linked with reduced hypocretin levels in other sleep disorders such as narcolepsy . Hypocretins 1 and 2,  are hypothalamic neuropeptides, initially identified and investigated as regulators of food intake but which have more recently been shown to stimulate wakefulness  .
Over the last two decades, neuroimaging experiments have substantially increased our knowledge of how the brain processes pain, both in health and disease . The vast majority of the studies published so far, however, predominantly focuses on brain activations, and tends to neglect brain deactivations . Nonetheless, some studies indicate that an investigation of deactivations might yield a fuller understanding of central pain processing.
Differences in both drinking patterns and alcohol related outcomes have been found in US comparisons of Hispanic, Non Hispanic white and Non Hispanic black race/ethnicity groups. Hispanic and black groups have been found to have more extreme drinking patterns relative to whites with higher levels of abstention, a higher proportion of heavy drinking among drinkers and less reduction of heavy drinking with age . The stability of heavy drinking among blacks moving into older age groups has been linked to substantially higher cirrhosis mortality rates relative to whites , a difference that also exists for Hispanics .
Breast cancer incidence and mortality varies widely among women of different population groups in the U.S. African American women have lower age adjusted incidence of breast cancer compared with European Americans . However, breast cancer incidence is higher in African Americans who are 35 years of age or younger . African American women are also diagnosed, on average, with later stage of disease, larger tumors, and are more likely to present with lymph node metastases at the time of diagnosis .
Anti N methyl D aspartate receptor  encephalitis is an immune mediated disorder that associates with IgG antibodies against the GluN1 subunit of the NMDAR. The antibody reactivity depends on the conformation of GluN1 expressed alone or in combination with GluN2  in HEK293 cells  and it is always detectable with immunohistochemistry of rat brain and with cultures of dissociated rat hippocampal neurons. Over the years we have studied anecdotal patients who had a clinical picture characteristic of anti NMDAR encephalitis but serum testing was negative in other laboratories.
Circadian  rhythms are driven by cell autonomous clocks that are generally composed of interconnected transcriptional and translational feedback loops . Studies using Drosophila have made seminal contributions to our understanding of clock mechanisms in general and those of animals in particular . In Drosophila, the major transcriptional negative feedback loop is comprised of dCLOCK  and CYCLE , that heterodimerize to activate the daily transcription of target genes, including the core clock genes period  and timeless , whose protein products participate in the repression of dCLK CYC mediated gene expression .
Microarray probes are designed to match the sequences of the target genes in the selected reference genome. This property is also fully utilized in the Affymetrix SNP Arrays, where each SNP is interrogated with approximately 40 different probes. used genomic DNA of Arobidopsis theliana to hybridize to RNA expression GeneChips.
It is generally accepted that GnRH is secreted in pulses from the hypothalamus . These pulses reach the pituitary through the portal vasculature and stimulate the release of LH and FSH, also in a pulsatile fashion. This was suggested when pulsatile release of GnRH was observed from isolated hypothalamic fragments and cultures obtained from hypothalamic tissue dispersions .
The tumor necrosis factor  receptorassociated factor  family of adaptor proteins promotes the activation of several transcription factors to induce immune and inflammatory responses, including nuclear factor kB , activator protein 1 , and interferon  regulatory factors 3 and 7 , which are especially important for innate immune antiviral function . Despite high sequence homology, TRAF proteins associate with different ligands and carry out nonredundant functions . TRAF proteins are recruited directly or indirectly by various pattern recognition receptors, whereupon they recruit additional factors that activate the inhibitor of kB kinase  complex to trigger NF kB activation .
Cardiogenic shock  complicates 58% of all cases of acute myocardial infarction  and is a common cause of death in patients hospitalized with MI An estimated 120,000140,000 patients in North America and Europe develop CS annually. Early revascularization  has a large, favorable impact on one year survival. However, not all patients receive early revascularization and there remains wide variability in mortality rates from CS with and without early revascularization and use of other support measures, from less than 30 to over 80%., Previous studies have identified patient, MI and treatment determinants of outcome,, Published risk models have primarily examined populations undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention  or participating in fibrinolytic trials.,, A robust risk model applicable to a broader group of shock patients would be useful not only for discussion of benefits and risks of therapeutic options with patients and families, but also for health care policies on resource utilization and in risk adjustment for outcome reporting from quality improvement programs.
Sleep characteristics that represent insufficient or poor quality sleep are associated with the development of coronary heart disease  and stroke in population studies. A number of pathophysiologic processes that are correlated with sleep and CHD could account for the relationship including inflammation, autonomic dysfunction,, endothelial dysfunction and insulin resistance. However, the contribution of the coagulation system is less well studied despite its plausibility as an alternative pathway .
As a pivotal part of the innate immunity, complement exists at high concentration in serum as well as in many other body fluids to fight against infections . When activated, complement activation products  opsonize their targets to enable efficient phagocytosis through interactions with complement receptors on phagocytic cells . At the same time, the terminal pathway of complement activation assembles membrane attack complexes , which lyses target cells by forming osmotic channels on cell surfaces .
A decade of studies using high throughput genomics and proteomics data revealed that cancer cells differ from normal cells in both RNA and protein contents. Presumably, a substantial part of this difference originates from gene expression regulators. Not surprisingly, a substantial number of tumor suppressor genes and oncogenes are in fact transcription factors .
Breast cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer and second leading cause of cancer death among African American women . Healthcare disparities have been documented across the spectrum of breast cancer detection and treatment: African American women are less likely to be diagnosed with early stage disease, less likely to receive breast sparing treatment, less likely to receive adjuvant treatment, and more likely to die compared to White women . African American women who undergo mastectomy are also significantly less likely to have breast reconstruction compared with White women in the US , an issue garnering increasing research attention and concern .
Angiogenesis, a process of new blood vessel formation, contributes to various physiological processes and pathological settings. ROS producing systems in vascular endothelial cells  are numerous including various NADPH oxidases, xanthine oxidase, the uncoupling of NO synthase as well as mitochondria . Recent data support that ROS generated from mitochondria significantly regulate EC function, , , .
The RAF MEK ERK protein kinase signaling cascade is a central pathway that regulates cell growth, proliferation, differentiation and survival in response to extracellular stimuli . Somatic mutations in B RAF, a member of the RAF kinase family, have been found in ∼6% of human cancer , with the highest incidence in malignant melanoma , papilliary thyroid cancer , serous ovarian cancer  and colorectal cancer  . The oncogenic B RAF V600E mutant has been shown to be important for tumor induction, growth, maintenance and progression, but the detailed molecular mechanisms remain to be elucidated  .
Most mortality in sub Saharan Africa  is currently due to communicable diseases, but WHO estimates that by 2030 noncommunicable diseases  will be the most common causes of death., As NCDs rise to account for 46% of all deaths by 2030, the SSA region will face a 64% increase in deaths due to NCDs  the largest percent increase of all regions. Many studies have documented the emerging burden of NCDs in rural and urban sub Saharan Africa, including rates of and risk factors for hypertension, stroke, diabetes mellitus, and ischemic heart disease. Recent meta analyses document the overall prevalence of hypertension in the general population to be 16.2%., In Uganda, cross sectional surveys defined hypertension as one elevated blood pressure reading, and found a prevalence of 27.2% in a mostly rural population, and 22% in a strictly rural population.
The relationship between inflammation and depression in humans and in animal models is well established. Individuals receiving immunotherapies have a higher incidence of depressive symptoms . Likewise, depressive phenotypes were observed in response to bacterial challenge .
CD4+ T cells have emerged as an important arm of immune system in combating tumors . CD4+ T cells could mediate tumor rejection by killing tumor cells via TRAIL, FasL or granzyme perforin dependent pathways, by up regulating MHC class I and II expressions on tumor cells, inhibiting tumor cell proliferation, promoting NK cell function, rescuing CTL from activation induced cell death, inducing angiogenesis inhibitors and recruiting macrophages/eosinophils via IFN γ mediated mechanisms . CD4+ T cells freshly purified, restimulated and/or activated in vitro or genetically modified in vitro have been used to investigate their role in antitumor immunity in multiple animal models .
Borderline Personality Disorder  is a serious, disabling condition with significant morbidity and mortality. Individuals with this disorder have high rates of both nonsuicidal self injurious behavior  and suicide attempts , and a completed suicide rate of approximately 10% . Although Borderline Personality Disorder is sometimes confused with or classified as a cyclical mood disorder , research suggests that it is a distinct disorder with a unique set of characteristic symptoms and traits , with a distinct illness course  and specialized treatment approaches .
One of the most interesting characteristics of synapses lies in their ability to differentially respond following variations in afferent input, a property known as synaptic plasticity. Functional AMPARs are heteromeric tetramers assembled from a combination of four different subunits . In addition to activity regulated insertion and removal from synapses, AMPARs constitutively cycle into the synapse .
Glioblastoma multiforme  is the most aggressive and fatal adult human brain cancer, and over 10,000 new cases are diagnosed in the United States each year. Molecular characterization suggests that there are 4 GBM subtypes, which are each associated with a unique set of genetic alterations and prognoses . This subtyping has increased interest in the development of therapies targeted to specific genetic alterations and which could be more effective than current approaches .
Obesity is now regarded as an epidemic on a worldwide scale, a consequence of nutritional and genetic factors . One major factor that predisposes obese individuals to infection is nutritional status . Saturated fatty acids  in particular are abundant in the ‘high fat Western diet’ and could contribute to immunosuppression .
There is a natural propensity for attention to be captured by threatening stimuli; however, individuals differ in the extent to which they selectively attend to threat cues in social environments. Over the past decade, a number of brain imaging studies have investigated the neural circuits involved in attentional control and processing threat signals. Data suggest that anxiety prone individuals may have an attentional bias toward threat signals, and be more vulnerable to emotional interference from such signals, and that this vulnerability may be associated with aberrant activation in frontal regions that are involved in higher order cognitive and/ or attentionemotion functions.
Mercury  in the environment is an increasing health concern. The levels of inorganic mercury  are elevated in the cerebellum of Alzheimer's disease patients . Therefore, inorganic mercury is an important form of mercury that contributes significantly to this heavy metal neurotoxicity and neurodegeneration .
Balanced facial growth is essential for a symmetric, well proportioned face and normal occlusion. However, little is understood about the etiological factors that account for the phenotype variations in craniofacial form . Clinical records are routinely obtained from patients seeking orthodontic treatment.
Speech consists of rapidly changing elements that require fine grained neural representation of temporal information, especially in background noise. Temporal cues are important components of auditory object formation , a necessary element of auditory stream segregation. It is well established that neural synchrony is degraded in noise, leading to delayed and reduced auditory evoked responses from cortical  and brainstem structures .
Uveal melanoma is the most common intra ocular malignancy. Although there are effective treatments for primary tumors in the eye, 50% of patients who develop large primary tumors develop metastatic disease and die within 615 months of diagnosis . Because there are no effective therapies for metastatic disease, we are exploring cell based vaccines as a therapeutic option.
Over the past two decades, the development of functional magnetic resonance imaging  technology has generated near exponential growth in neuroimaging research and its clinical applications . In 95% of event related studies containing a decision process , the duration of the decision period is assumed to be constant and is typically modeled by the convolution of a constant height, finite impulse function  positioned at event onset with a canonical hemodynamic response function  . This simplification is generally thought to have little or no impact on the results.
Hypophysiotropic thyrotropin releasing hormone  synthesizing neurons located in the medial and periventricular parvocellular subdivisions of the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus  control the hypothalamic pituitary thyroid  axis. These neurons integrate a variety of humoral and neuronal signals and mediate the effects of these inputs toward the pituitary gland. One of the major regulatory mechanisms over hypophysiotropic TRH neurons is the negative feedback effect of thyroid hormones which maintains euthyroid levels of thyroid hormone in the circulating blood.
Despite a proliferation of research on the experiences of same sex attracted or lesbian, gay, and bisexual  youth, contextual influences on these youths’ development are not fully understood . Among the countries participating in the International Social Survey in 2008, the Netherlands ranked highest in acceptance of same sex sexual behavior, with 69.6% of adults surveyed responding that same sex sexual behavior is “not wrong at all” . Acceptance of lesbian and gay people has also been found to be particularly limited in ethnic and religious minority communities .
The serum level of CA 125 is well established as a highly useful surrogate for monitoring the response to treatment and confirming relapse in women with epithelial ovarian cancer . However, the literature has focused on the more common ovarian cancer histologies, particularly the serous subtype  . The prognostic value of CA 125 for clear cell or mucinous ovarian cancers is less certain.
Endometrial cancer is the most common gynecological malignancy in the United States, with approximately 46,000 newly diagnosed cases and 8,100 related deaths in 2012 . Endometrioid adenocarcinoma, the numerically predominant histological tumor type, typically presents with stage 1 disease, which is an important factor in the overall favorable outcomes for these tumors . Most endometrial carcinomas appear to develop from precursors termed endometrial hyperplasia that progress over a period of years .
Interoception is the sense of the internal physiological and sensory status of the organism . An impaired ability to effectively monitor and modulate interoceptive status may result in emotional distress and contribute to the development of some forms of psychiatric illness . The current literature in PTSD often takes a regional focus which does not include the insula , however this area stands out in meta analysis .
Human brain maturation is a complex process that can now be examined in detail using in vivo neuroimaging techniques . Early neuroimaging investigations focused on region, lobe or total brain volumes . However, more recent studies have begun to examine brain structures using finer voxel wise resolution and temporal dynamics.
The nitrite anion  is biologically important, for example in denitrifying bacteria where it forms from nitrate  reduction catalyzed by a molybdoenzyme. It is noteworthy that unlike the CcO oxidase reaction, which involves four electrons, only one electron is required for the CcO nitrite reductase reaction. This follows our initial report on this type of chemistry showing a copper complex with coordinated nitrite anion reacts with a ferrous heme, producing nitric oxide.
Skin cancer is the most common form of cancer in the United States, with approximately 1 million new cases per year . Among three major types of skin cancer, melanoma is the most serious form. The most common type of skin cancer is basal cell carcinoma , followed by squamous cell carcinoma .
Infants, children, adults, and many non human animals are able to represent large numbers of objects, sounds, and events in an imprecise fashion, using the Approximate Number System . In contrast, the left angular gyrus  exhibits greater activation during a multiplication task compared to a number comparison or subtraction task . Further, the effect was robust to format, indicative of the highly conceptual nature of the proportions.
A considerable body of evidence suggests that painful conditions are often accompanied by alterations in cutaneous sensory perception. In some clinical conditions, widespread impairment of tactile sensitivity has been documented. Although the clinical presentations of these conditions differ, there is increasing recognition that systematic assessment of somatosensory perception in disorders characterized by persistent pain would greatly aid diagnosis and evaluation of treatment efficacy .
Acute compartment syndrome  is a condition which occurs when increased intramuscular pressure  within a closed fascial space impairs vascular perfusion to a point below the level necessary for muscle and nerve viability. ACS can be diagnosed based on clinical findings such as the 6 Ps: pressure, pain, paresthesias, paresis, pink skin, and presence of a distal pulse . Treatment of ACS relies on early recognition and timely fasciotomy to prevent irreversible muscle death and other complications, such as contracture or a devascularized limb requiring amputation.
Tissue recombination studies and genetic experiments in chick and mice demonstrated an intricate dependence of craniofacial and pharyngeal morphogenesis on signaling between the anterior mesoderm and the neural crest . At the genetic level, the expression of transcription factor Twist1 or activation of the canonical Wnt signaling in the cranial neural crest regulates patterning of the pharyngeal arch mesoderm in a non cell autonomous manner , while expression of Jagged 1 in the pharyngeal endothelial cells or VEGFR2, Fgf8 or Tbx1 in the anterior mesoderm regulates neural crest cell survival, migration, differentiation and patterning . Communications between the neural crest and anterior mesoderm play obligate roles in morphogenesis of the aortic arch arteries, a system of blood vessels that routes oxygenated blood to various destinations within the systemic circulation.
