Importantly, SnoN promotes the development of axons in the mammalian brain as demonstrated by the dramatic impairment of granule neuron parallel fiber axons in the cerebellar cortex in rats subjected to SnoN knockdown in vivo  .
More than 40% of patients with the demyelinating disease multiple sclerosis  suffer some form of cognitive decline. Traditional imaging measures, such as assessment of macroscopic lesion burden, are weakly related to cognitive changes , leading some researchers to focus on the role of gray matter  pathology in cognitive dysfunction . The hippocampus has emerged as a target for much of this research  .
Imaging genetics is a rapidly growing research field, examining how genetic factors contribute to brain structure and function. Even so, with a few exceptions , specific genes that influence normal brain anatomy and function have been hard to identify. Single gene variations  are likely to influence the overall architecture of the brain only to a very minor extent.
Phosphodiesterase 5  inhibitors including sildenafil , vardenafil  and tadalafil  are FDA approved for treatment of erectile dysfunction. More recently, sildenafil was indicated for management of pulmonary arterial hypertension . Several studies from our laboratory have shown that sildenafil and vardenafil reduce infarct size, apoptosis, and attenuate cardiac dysfunction following I/R or permanent coronary artery ligation .
Contrast enhanced MR angiography  has become a non invasive modality of choice for detecting arterial disease in many vascular areas of the body. Therefore, MRA methods that do not require contrast agents will have importance for patients with renal insufficiency. Furthermore, with CE MRA, the short contrast first pass window in arteries often limits imaging coverage or spatial resolution and venous contamination may be present at distal run off vessels, particularly for calf and foot arterial imaging.
The cyclical exchange between actin monomers and its assembly into filaments is an energy dependent process, where the incorporation of ATP actin into filaments  ultimately results in ATP hydrolysis . Recycling factors such as cofilin and related ADF  family members bind ADP actin filaments to promote Pi release and filament severing . Filament severing accelerates the dynamic exchange of actin between monomers and filaments by simultaneously stimulating actin filament disassembly  and promoting actin polymerization on newly severed barbed ends .
Neuronal intermediate filament inclusion disease  is an uncommon neurodegenerative condition  that was first recognized as a unique entity, based on the neuropathological finding of neuronal inclusions that are immunoreactive for neurofilament  proteins but negative for tau and α synuclein . It was initially referred to as neurofilament inclusion  disease, however subsequent studies demonstrated the inclusions to be immunoreactive for all class IV intermediate filaments , including α internexin, as well as light, medium and heavy NF subunits  . Twenty cases of NIFID have been published to date .
Opsin visual pigments are located in a stacked membranous structure of rod and cone photoreceptor cells called the outer segment . After a brief period, all trans retinaldehyde  dissociates from the bleached pigment, rendering it insensitive to light. Conversion of all trans RAL to 11 cis RAL is performed by a multistep enzyme pathway called the visual cycle .
Twin twin transfusion syndrome  arises in monochorionic twin gestations due to unequal exchange of blood through the placental vascular communications. Selective laser photocoagulation of communicating vessels  is the preferred treatment for TTTS resulting in improved prenatal and perinatal survival. With enhanced survival, identification of risk factors to later cognitive performance and outcomes becomes critical.
Vascular calcification is a common finding in patients with cardiovascular disease , diabetes and end stage renal disease . Furthermore, coronary calcium score is a strong predictor of incident coronary heart disease  and stroke . In diabetes mellitus, vascular calcification is strongly correlated with coronary artery disease and future cardiovascular events including lower extremity amputation , .
Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria  is a non malignant clonal disorder of hematopoietic stem cells characterized by a somatic mutation in the PIG A gene. Due to a defect in the glycosylphosphatidylinositol  anchor, PNH stem cells and their progeny lack GPI anchored surface proteins, some of which  protect erythrocytes from complement mediated lysis. Patients with PNH may manifest with a variety of symptoms including recurrent intravascular hemolysis, venous thrombosis, and hematopoietic failure, all of which shorten survival compared to healthy age matched controls.
Aberrant promoter methylation of tumor suppressor genes is an important mechanism of gene transcriptional inactivation and has been associated with the development of many kinds of cancers , including lung cancer, the most common cause of cancer death worldwide. Although much attention has been paid to understand the molecular and cellular mechanisms of lung cancer, the 5 year overall survival rate for all stages combined is only 15% , due primarily to the presence of metastatic tumors in approximately two third of patients at the time of diagnosis . Detection of lung cancer at earlier stages could potentially increase survival rates by 1050 folds .
Studies conducted in Western Europe and North America suggest that insomnia could affect between 30% and 60% of non institutionalized elderly persons. Reported rates have varied because of differences in definition and settings of studies. Insomnia has been defined in terms of symptoms, symptoms with duration or frequency of their occurrence, or diagnosis, such as those based on the criteria of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition .
Thioredoxin 1  is a 12 kDa endogenous protein found in micromolar concentrations in the cytosol of cells . Trx 1 has multiple functions in the cell, including antioxidant, anti inflammatory, and anti apoptotic activity. While the molecular mechanisms for the cellular functions of Trx are complex and not fully understood, the cellular activity of Trx 1 likely involves its interaction with specific signaling cascades.
Heterogeneity is observed in the patterns of cognition in Alzheimer's disease . Such heterogeneity might suggest the involvement of different aetiological pathways or different host responses to pathology . 627 subjects with mild/moderate AD underwent cognitive assessment with the Mini Mental Status Exam  and the Dementia Rating Scale 2 .
Mercury is a ubiquitous global environmental pollutant, with human exposure to organic, inorganic, and elemental species of mercury occurring in many diverse settings. In susceptible strains of mice, treatment with organic species of mercury also elicits an autoimmune response, though there are differences in toxicokinetic and the toxicodynamic responses based on the species of mercury used. Relatively few studies exist in the literature on the relationship of mercury exposure and biomarkers of autommunity or autoimmune disease in human populations.
Cancer is a genetic disease in which genomic abnormalities alter the transcriptome, thereby directly or indirectly deregulating the pathways that control proliferation and survival. The transcriptomic diversity in cancer has been captured by robust expression subtypes that are characterized by similarity to gene signatures related to developmental lineages and cellular differentiation. Furthermore, molecular subtypes are frequently found to associate with somatic alterations, such as EGFR abnormalities in the classical subtype of glioblastoma, or the enrichment of NF1 deletions and mutations in the primitive group of lung squamous carcinoma.
Targeted therapy against oncogenic mutations, such as BRAFV600E, represents one of the most significant advances in the treatment of melanoma in decades. In particular, the use of immune checkpoint inhibitors has shown tremendous promise. Additional immunomodulatory agents are in clinical trials, and have shown impressive results.
Ultraviolet radiation  is a major cause of non melanoma skin cancer including squamous cell carcinoma . Several studies have suggested that tobacco smoke is an independent risk factor for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma . Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons  represent an important class of carcinogens found in tobacco smoke .
Obesity, previously primarily an adult condition, is increasing dramatically among the younger age groups . In 2006, the prevalence of overweight in U. S. children and adolescents had been estimated at 17%, and is predicted to rise to 20% by 2010 . Excess weight in early life leads to adult obesity and increased cardiovascular morbidity .
Cisplatin is a potent agent used in cancer chemotherapy. Numerous studies have provided information to elucidate the molecular mechanism of cisplatin cytotoxicity. It is widely accepted that the anti tumor action of cisplatin is attributed to the formation of cisplatin DNA adducts, inducing several signal pathways and subsequently leading to cell cycle arrest, necrosis or/and apoptosis .
Interleukin  12p40  is a common subunit of both IL 12p70  and IL 23 . IL 12p70 plays a role in resistance and adaptive immunity and is also involved in antitumor responses,. In addition to associating with IL 12p35 and IL 23p19 to comprise the well studied heterodimeric cytokines IL 12 and IL 23, IL 12p40 can exist in a monomeric form; the monomeric form may play an independent role in immune responses.
Malignant gliomas are characterized by their invasiveness and dissemination, resulting in frequent tumor recurrence after surgical resection and/or other treatment. We had previously engineered Interleukin 12 producing murine primary NSCs and demonstrated that these NSCs migrated towards intracranial gliomas and induced T cell anti tumor immunity . We had further identified that the tumor tropic NSCs comprise largely of chemokine CXC receptor 4  expressing progenitors  .
The concept of imidazoline binding sites was first proposed in 1984 ; since then, research has focused on understanding the nature of these binding sites . Initially, these binding sites were thought to recognize compounds with imidazoline moiety; however, we now know that some compounds with no imidazoline structure also have high affinities for these binding sites . In addition, there appears to be at least three different imidazoline receptor subtypes, each of which has unique pharmacological properties .
1, 6 Hexamethylene diamine  in biological media  has been utilized as a biological marker for occupational exposure to 1,6 hexamethylene diisocyanate  . During automotive spray painting, workers may be exposed to HDI present in paint formulations via skin or inhalation routes. HDA could be N acetylated by N acetyltransferase  to form N acetyl 1,6 hexamethylene diamine   and N,N′ diacetyl 1,6 hexamethylene diamine , which is rapidly excreted.
The Spanish speaking population has been growing rapidly in the U.S., and this trend is expected to continue. By the year 2050, the population is estimated to nearly double to 24.4 million people. In 2006, it was estimated that nearly 222,000 people in Indiana primarily speak Spanish at home, out of a total population of approximately 6.5 million people.
In bacteria, the ability to resist mechanical forces is necessary for survival and growth, allowing cells to withstand osmotic pressures while maintaining cell shape, cell growth and division. The mechanical properties of bacteria are known to vary among and within species. Gram positive bacteria have a thicker cell wall and greater turgor pressure than Gram negative organisms, and are therefore more stiff than Gram negative organisms , .
Cytokines control a large panel of biological functions, many of them mediated by the JAK STAT signal transduction pathway. STAT5 regulated genes encode transcription factors, membrane proteins, enzymes and milk proteins . In contrast, transplantation experiments with primary mammary epithelial cells have not provided evidence for a role of STAT5 in mammary stem cells  .
Concurrent and discrete trial choice procedures are used to measure the relative reinforcing strength of abused drugs. Choice procedures have the purported advantage that the primary dependent measure, response allocation, is independent of the rate decreasing effects of the self administered drug . For example, in a discrete trial choice paradigm,  noted that when cocaine was preferred over d,l cathinone , response rates on the cocaine associated lever were higher than rates on d,l cathinone associated lever in only 22% of those cases.
Adeno associated virus  is a ssDNA virus from the Parvoviridae family. Initially AAV serotype 2 was considered as a vehicle for gene transfer in various in vitro and in vivo experimental and therapeutic settings. More recently, several alternative serotypes have been used as vectors for gene therapy.
Methylphenidate  enhances cognitive and behavioral function by acting, at least in part, on the prefrontal cortex . Recent reports state that the use of MPD as a cognitive enhancer has become widely abused among college students and adults. Due to the PFC’s critical role in higher cognitive functions, it is considered one of the main brain regions to respond to acute and chronic MPD administration., MPD binds to dopamine  and noradrenaline  transporters, blocking the reuptake of both DA and NE from the synaptic cleft to the presynaptic terminals, therefore leading to an increased level of DA and NE in the extracellular space.
Smoking prevalence among adults in the U.S. has decreased from 40% in 1964 to 20% currently . Studies of persons entering treatment for alcohol as well as opioid dependence suggest that these populations are more likely to die from smoking related causes than other substance abuse related causes . Responses were received from 311 staff in 23 clinics; 40% of respondents were smokers, and staff who smoked were less likely to encourage smoking cessation among clients.
Thymic derived CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells  have an important role in the mechanisms of peripheral immune tolerance and in the prevention of pathogenic autoimmunity through the suppression of proliferation and production of pro inflammatory cytokines in effector immune cells. CD28 is required for tTreg development and peripheral homeostasis since mice deficient for CD28 have very few tTregs in both thymuses and spleens, and this defect cannot be rescued by IL 2 . In addition to CD28, it has been documented that IL 2 is essential for tTreg expansion and maintenance, whereas IL 2Rγ is also required for tTreg development  .
Mammalian Target of Rapamycin  is an ATP and nutrient sensor that contributes to the control of cell size and cell cycle progression. mTOR’s ability to control cell size and cell cycle is due at least in part to its ability to regulate the translation of specific classes of mRNAs. mTOR mediated control of translation is a rapamycin sensitive process accomplished by regulation of the downstream targets, S6K and eIF4E .
Neural progenitor cells  of the embryonic neocortex initially comprise a large population of the neuroepithelial cells and, as development proceeds, radial glia located in the ventricular zone  continue to provide a source of NPCs. Autosomal recessive primary microcephaly  is a congenital brain disorder characterized by a small brain size without severe effects on brain structure ,. Human genetic studies have identified ten MCPH loci, and most MCPH proteins localize to the centrosome or spindle pole for at least part of the cell cycle.
Methamphetamine  is a highly addictive psychostimulant. In the United States, an estimated 600,000 people are weekly users of the drug. METH exerts pharmacological effects on the central nervous system  through a non exocytoxic mechanism that releases monoamine neurotransmitters including dopamine, norepinephrine, and serotonin.
A number of disease states highlight the significant effects that interferons can have on hematopoiesis. Interferons may also be used therapeutically in some hematologic malignancies . Despite these observations, little is known about the effects of interferons on the hematopoietic stem cell .
Cyclin dependent kinases  together with cyclins constitute the central components of the cell cycle machinery . Later Cdk2 complexes with cyclin A and is essential for S phase progression . In addition, it was described that Cdk2 is present predominantly in the nucleus throughout the cell cycle .
Pain originating from the musculoskeletal system is common and costs billions of dollars in healthcare and lost wages . Chronic musculoskeletal pain syndromes such as fibromyalgia and myofacial pain syndrome can be disabling and difficult to treat . In addition, histological analysis of the injection site reveals no significant changes in the muscle when compared to controls that receive intramuscular injection of pH 7.2 saline .
Several factor  VIII products of different origin and structure are being used for hemophilia A treatment worldwide. The assessment of FVIII concentration in these products is done using activity assays, which are dependent upon the assay and its modifications . Three activity  and two immunoassays  were used in this study with albumin free full length recombinant  FVIII as a standard .
Macrophages  are mononuclear phagocytes of the innate immune system and are involved in host defence, metabolism and the homeostatic regulation of healthy tissues. Mφs can assume several functionally different states of activation which are regulated by the prevailing cytokine milieu and other factors that are present at sites of inflammation. Distinct resident and inflammatory sub populations of Mφs exist in tissues, including the gut.
Epilepsy is the commonest neurological disorder worldwide and one of the most common chronic, non communicable diseases among adults in resource poor settings. Previous work among adults with epilepsy in Zambia found them to have significantly lower socioeconomic status than their peers with non stigmatized chronic conditions. Women with epilepsy were less likely to access healthcare services for antenatal care .
Manganese superoxide dismutase  is responsible for converting superoxide to hydrogen peroxide in the mitochondrial matrix. MnSOD is translated in the cytoplasm and then imported into the mitochondria via a mitochondrial targeting signal . This polymorphism is predicted to result in a change in the secondary structure in the MTS domain of the protein from an α helix  to a β sheet conformation  .
Efavirenz, a potent non nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor , remains preferred component of highly active antiretroviral therapy  for treatment naïve patients despite an emergence of second generation of NNRTIs and new classes of antiretroviral agents . It is the only antiretroviral agent currently on the market that has been combined with other two nucleoside/nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors in a single tablet and administered once daily, which significantly improve adherence ). Efavirenz is always used in combination therapy and in concert with drugs directed at the treatment of opportunistic infections, cancers and other HIV related co morbidities.
CD1 proteins are non polymorphic, class I antigen presenting molecules, which present both self and foreign lipids as cognate antigens to T cells. Groups 1 and 2 are involved in antigen presentation, whereas group 3 is involved in lipid processing and trafficking. Group 1 CD1 molecules present lipid antigens to clonally diverse T cells that mediate adaptive immunity.
Internalizing behaviours , prevalent in children born very preterm compared to full term, are evident by 2 years corrected age   and persist to school age, late adolescence and young adulthood . Exposure to repeated pain in very preterm infants  in the neonatal intensive care unit  is associated with altered cognitive and motor development . Previously, we found that greater neonatal pain  was associated with greater internalizing behaviours at 18 months CA .
A promising research area from the 1950s through 1970s involved the therapeutic use of 5 HT2AR agonist hallucinogens in the treatment of drug dependence, including alcohol and opioid dependence . Some studies did not include the rigor and controls expected of modern clinical research, thus obscuring efficacy. However, a recent meta analysis of randomized controlled trials found that LSD facilitated treatment of alcoholism approximately doubled the success rates of control conditions at the first follow up .
Dose escalated external beam radiation therapy  for prostate cancer is associated with improved tumor control rates in all disease risk groups. Randomized controlled trials  conducted in the United States demonstrated improved PSA control following treatment of localized prostate cancer with EBRT doses of 78 Gy and 79.2 Gy compared to 70 Gy., Clinical guidelines of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network  have evolved over the last decade but have generally suggested doses between 7079 Gy for men with low risk disease and 7580+ Gy for men with intermediate and high risk disease., Thus, in 2007 the use of higher dose EBRT  was established as a clinical performance measure in assessing the quality of prostate cancer radiotherapy. Despite these observed benefits, selection of patients most likely to benefit from dose escalated EBRT is complicated by several factors.
It has been hypothesized that an “activity center” or “activitystat” within the central nervous system controls an individual’s amount of physical activity over time, and therefore daily energy expenditure . Physical activity may be kept within narrow tolerance limits in order to maintain energy balance, much like internal body temperature, pH, and blood pressure . For example, on a day that an individual jogged for 30 minutes, they might increase the amount of time spent being sedentary; whereas on a day that the same individual did not jog, they might increase the amount of time spent walking and decrease the amount of time in sedentary activities.
Fragile X syndrome , caused by a mutation in FMR1 at Xq27.3, is the most common inherited cause of mental impairment and the leading known single gene cause of autism. The behavioral phenotype is characterized by deficits in attention and inhibitory control, autistic symptoms, social anxiety and withdrawal, hyperarousal, and gaze aversion  . However, new leads to potential targeted treatments have come from recent advances in the neurobiology of FXS.
Anionic lipids and cholesterol  are often critical membrane components to ensure ion channel stability and functionality. These lipids appeared to be phosphatidylcholine  molecules, which do not exist naturally in the bacterial membrane. The ability of PA and CHOL to reduce lipid fluidity has been proposed to indirectly affect the nAChR function,, but other lines of experimental evidence point to direct effects.
Most illicit drug use initiation begins between the ages of 12 and 20, with peak periods of initiation of drug use between ages 15 and 19 . Clinical studies suggest that drug use during adolescence may lead to an increased likelihood of chronic drug use during adulthood . It has been suggested that these changes during adolescence could lead to differential responses to drugs compared to that seen in juveniles or adults .
developed a technique to image electrical conductivity using the ultrasonically induced Lorentz force. An ultrasonic wave is passed through tissue in the presence of a magnetic field. The wave causes the tissue  and the charged ions within the tissue  to move.
Rod and cone photoreceptors are two major photoreceptor cell types in vertebrates. As their names indicate, rod and cone photoreceptors have been classified based on the shape of their respective outer segments . The topology of cone disk membranes appears to vary among species.
Research on source memory  the ability to recall the conditions under which a memory was acquired  has increasingly come to focus on how agendas at the time of retrieval can influence which mnemonic features are retrieved and used to make source judgments . One factor that has been shown to influence source memory judgments is the number of sources mentioned in the test instructions: Subjects are more likely to falsely attribute items to a source if that source is the only one mentioned at test  vs. if multiple sources are mentioned at test  . The goal of our study is to map out differences in how subjects make source judgments on single agenda vs. multi agenda tests.
Research examining the potential impact of gender on quality of life in HIV/AIDS is limited . A US based study showed that women and HIV infected individuals reported the poorest QOL scores . In another study, a sample of 126 low socioeconomic men and women seeking care from HIV treatment centers in the United States was surveyed using measures of physical and psychological well being.
Membrane proteins, which constitute a third of all proteins in nature, regulate and direct a host of important cellular processes, ranging from transport of nutrients to generation of energy. Membrane proteins exhibit molecular motions on a wide range of time scales under physiological conditions and insight into their motions is the key to understanding their functions. Molecular motions on the order of milliseconds are frequently observed in many essential and fascinating biological processes ranging from ligand binding to enzyme catalysis.
One potentially important application of functional image information is in the planning, guidance, and assessment of therapeutic interventions. Radiation treatment of cancer has long been an image guided therapeutic modality. Extensive 3D anatomic information from CT and MRI came into widespread use for radiation treatment planning in the 1980’s and 1990’s.
Information about injuries sustained by survivors of airplane crashes is scant, although some information is available on fatal aviation related injuries. Objectives of this study were to explore the patterns of aviation related injuries admitted to U.S. hospitals and relate them to aviation deaths in the same period . The Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project  Nationwide Inpatient Sample  contains information for approximately 20% of all hospital admissions in the United States each year.
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention , the aging process is associated with increased risk for disease that can cause physical and economic burden for older adults. Thus, the growing older adult population places significant burden on the health care system. From anti wrinkle creams to antioxidants, many companies are currently in the business of selling products to delay the aging process.
Heart disease is not only the leading cause of death, disability, and healthcare expense in the US, but also the leading cause of death worldwide, and treatments to reduce cardiac damage could have significant health and fiscal impacts. Sustained β adrenergic receptor  activation was shown to enhance the synthesis of myocardial proteins. Catecholamine induced cardiac hypertrophy is associated with reduced contractile responses to adrenergic agonists, an effect attributed to the down regulation of myocardial β ARs, uncoupling of the β ARs and adenylate cyclase, in addition to modifications of downstream cAMP mediated signaling., SDF 1 CXCR4 axis was identified as a key factor in the recruitment of stem cells to areas of tissue injury in multiple organ systems.
Chronic lower respiratory diseases are the third leading cause of death In the United States, resulting in 137,082 deaths in 2009. Lung function, as assessed by the spirometric measures of forced expiratory volume in one second , forced vital capacity  and the FEV1 to FVC ratio , is an objective indicator of general respiratory health, as well as an important long term predictor of morbidity and mortality. Recently, genome wide association studies  have begun to shed light on the complex genetic architecture of lung function measures.
The metabolic syndrome is a cluster of cardiovascular risk factors including elevated blood pressure, dyslipidemia, impaired glycemic control, and abdominal obesity. This syndrome affects about 25% of the adult US population and is reaching an epidemic spread in parallel to obesity, which is estimated to affect about 312 million people worldwide. With at least 1.1 billion overweight people, the incidence of the metabolic syndrome is expected to continue to rise, warranting thorough mechanistic understanding to enable optimal treatment at a socioeconomic scale .
Plant oil is an important renewable resource for both edible and industrial uses. Increases in corn seed oil content are possible by traditional breeding. The synthesis of storage oils requires the coordinated activity of many enzymes in the lipid biosynthetic pathway.
ATF5 is a member of the activating transcription factor/cAMP response element binding  protein family that represents a large group of basic leucine zipper  transcription factors with diverse physiological functions . Recent studies have shown that ATF5 is a regulator of cell survival that is specific to cancer cells . Exogenous expression of ATF5 suppresses apoptosis in HeLa cells induced by serum withdrawal and in FL5.12 cells, an interleukin 3  dependent cell line, from IL 3 deprivation .
The dentate gyrus is one of only two regions of the mammalian brain  where substantial neurogenesis has been unequivocally shown to occur postnatally . In primates, although the majority of the neurons in the hippocampal formation are generated prenatally , neurogenesis has been shown to continue throughout life in the dentate gyrus of marmosets , macaque monkeys  and humans . Later studies using the cell division marker 5′ bromo 2 deoxyuridine  revealed that neurogenesis occurs in adult primates , but did not fully appreciate its importance with respect to the addition of new neurons and their maturation into hippocampal circuits.
Ubiquitin mediated proteolysis of cell cycle proteins is critical for tight control of normal cell proliferation and is often deregulated in human cancers . One major class of multi subunit E3 ubiquitin ligases is Skp1/Cullin/F box protein  complexes. SCF complexes target many cell cycle regulators and their deregulation contributes to neoplastic transformation .
With declining fertility rates and increasing life expectancy, the population of Sri Lanka is rapidly ageing . Elderly Sri Lankans  constituted 9.4% of the population in 2006, up from 9.1% in 2001 and from 6.9% in 1998 . Care of elders in Sri Lanka remains the responsibility of their adult children, but migration patterns, increasingly common dual earning households, and a shift from the extended family structure to a nuclear family structure, all contribute to a reduction in the availability of caregivers .
Active smoking has long been considered deleterious to health and a risk factor for a number of diseases . Cigarette smoke contains more than 4,000 chemicals and at least 60 known carcinogens . Research has found that sidestream smoke, the smoke from the tip of cigarette, contains greater amounts of tar, nicotine, and other chemicals, than mainstream smoke .
Over 50% of individuals with an anterior cruciate ligament  injury and reconstruction develop post traumatic osteoarthritis . Multiple studies have shown that individuals with ACL reconstruction  continue to demonstrate abnormal walking mechanics of the reconstructed knee when compared to the contralateral knee and compared to control subjects. It has been hypothesized that abnormal gait mechanics may contribute to altered cartilage loading and subsequent PTOA following an ACL R. Specifically, higher external knee adduction moment  and dynamic knee varus during walking have been implicated in the pathogenesis of knee OA.
Enormous progress has recently been made to understand the genetic basis of dilated cardiomyopathy . Also, identified mutations are usually unique  to that family, and this allelic heterogeneity demands that, minimally, all coding exons and intron/exon junctions of any gene under study be examined to exclude variants relevant for disease. Furthermore, some of the genes that harbor DCM mutations are very large.
At times near the onset of saccadic eye movements, our spatial perception can be distorted. Specifically, a flashed stimulus presented shortly before or after saccade onset is likely to be mislocalized. One remaining mystery about this phenomenon is the non uniformity of the mislocalization.
Vietnam is disproportionately affected by the HIV epidemic amongst countries in Southeast Asia . The HIV epidemic in Vietnam is concentrated in high risk populations, including injection drug users, male and female sex workers, and men who have sex with men  . A large proportion of MSW in Vietnam are in urban areas, are frequently migrants from other regions, and have unstable housing .
Hidradenitis Suppurativa  is a follicular occlusion disorder occurring in apocrine rich areas that often presents with tender, occasionally draining, papules and nodules with an onset early in puberty, occasionally leading to sinus tract formation. Associations with other illnesses  have been described. Due to the involvement of many different sites, HS patients may see not only dermatologists, but also general internists, colorectal surgeons, plastic surgeons, gastroenterologists and family physicians.
The formation and retrieval of relational memories critically depends on the hippocampus, as demonstrated by numerous lesion, electrophysiological, and human imaging studies . Nonetheless, how it performs these operations remains poorly understood. Strictly in terms of neuronal firing rate, previously encoded events can be distinguished from novel ones by increased activity for events that match stored representations , or by greater activity for novel events .
A growing body of evidence indicates that group I metabotropic glutamate receptors , which include mGluR1 and mGluR5 receptors, play a critical role in the reinstatement of cocaine seeking behavior, an animal model of relapse. Group I mGluRs are expressed predominantly on postsynaptic membranes  throughout the brain including the nucleus accumbens . The nucleus accumbens is a heterogeneous structure that consists of two major subregions, the core and the shell, each of which modulates aspects of cocaine seeking behavior .
Phospholipase D  catalyzes the hydrolysis of phosphatidylcholine to generate the lipid second messenger phosphatidic acid , and choline, in response to mitogenic signals such as PDGF, EGF, FGF, insulin, IGF, VEGF and serum . The expression levels of the PLD gene are under developmental control and can also vary during the different stages of cell differentiation. Cell differentiation is accompanied with a very large increase in PLD2 expression.
Urinary catheters are frequently used for both short  and long term care in skilled nursing home  facilities. , Within Department of Veterans Affairs NHs, 14% of residents have an indwelling urinary catheter. Microbial surveys have shown that over 95% of all NH residents with urinary catheters have bacteriuria.
Huntington’s disease  is a neurodegenerative disorder caused by a polyglutamine repeat expansion in the huntingtin  protein, producing the pathological mutant huntingtin  . Synaptic dysfunction and striatal neurodegeneration in HD are attributed, in part, to abnormal localization, function and signaling of NMDA receptors  and subsequent elevated excitotoxicity . In presymptomatic yeast artificial chromosome mice expressing full length Htt with 128 polyglutamine repeats , NMDARs traffic faster to the cell surface and accumulate at extrasynaptic sites .
Recruitment of circulating monocytes, their differentiation into macrophages, uptake of LDL derived cholesterol, and the ensuing activation of a broad range of inflammatory responses are the major events leading to atherosclerosis initiation and progression. Hypercholesterolemia for example is intimately associated with monocytosis and gives rise to proinflammatory Ly 6C+ monocyte subsets, which infiltrate the arterial wall to contribute to atherosclerosis formation. The majority of these circulating monocytes originate from hematopoietic stem cell commitment to myeloid progenitor cells and their proliferation in response to atherogenic cues.
Obesity is a major risk factor for common disorders such as type 2 diabetes mellitus, cardiovascular disease, and cancer . α Melanocyte stimulating hormone , a thirteen amino acid peptide derived from proopiomelanocortin , is involved in regulation of food intake and energy homeostasis in mammals,  and is an inhibitor of inflammatory reactions. α MSH suppresses feeding behavior in mice and fish,  and POMC mRNA expression is increased in the pituitaries of genetically obese mice .
Vaccinia virus  is a complex, enveloped virus with an ~ 189 kbp double stranded DNA genome. The EV has an additional outer membrane layer and thus exhibits different proteins on its surface compared to the MV . The envelope of the MV consists of approximately twenty five integral or peripheral membrane proteins , at least sixteen of which have been implicated to function in virus entry and/or fusion  .
Herpetic stromal keratitis  is a chronic immunoinflammatory condition that develops in corneal tissue in response to recurrent herpes simplex virus 1  infection of the cornea. Studies carried out in mouse models have clearly shown the involvement of both innate and adaptive immune cells in regulating the severity of HSK . In addition, recent studies suggest the involvement of CD8 T cells in clearing HSV 1 from corneas at late time points post infection .
How are innate behaviors programmed into the genome? Social behaviors, such as courtship and aggression, are of particular interest, because they have strong innate components. Mating has been studied in both Drosophila and C. elegans using a combination of molecular genetic and cellular approaches,.
A large class of cellular response systems regulates the flux and concentration of small molecules by controlling transport and metabolism pathways via two feedback loops connected by a common transcription factor  that senses the intracellular concentration of the small molecule. The simplest systems consist of two operons, a regulator gene and a regulated operon containing at least two cistrons, one encoding a transporter and the other encoding an enzyme which modifies/degrades the small molecule. In E. coli cells expression of several sugar operons are repressed when glucose is abundant in the growth medium.
Cryopreservation of oocytes or ovarian tissue provides a potential option for fertility preservation of women facing the loss of reproductive function, either due to diseases such as cancer or treatments, including radiation and chemotherapy . Cryopreserved and thawed ovarian tissue has been successfully reimplanted and has produced live births, with lower success rates for frozen tissue vs. fresh transplant . Ovarian tissue is cryopreserved using conventional freezing  or vitrification .
Epithelial ovarian cancer is the most lethal gynecologic malignancy and the fourth leading cause of death from cancer among women. Continuous menstrual cycle activity is the strongest risk factor for the sporadic form of ovarian carcinomas  including the serous subtype, the most common histological subtype of this disease, while being a carrier of a mutation in BRCA1 is the most common risk factor for the familial form . Although BRCA1 expression is reduced in some sporadic ovarian tumors , there is no definitive evidence that this protein is important for their development.
Candida albicans is a frequent cause of both mucocutaneous and systemic infections . Incidence of invasive candidiasis is increasing among immunocompromised patients with mortality rates ranging from 30 50% despite aggressive antifungal therapy . Central to the pathogenesis of this organism is its ability to respond to environmental signals by changing its growth morphology.
Relaxation dispersion NMR techniques provide a powerful approach for characterizing transient excursions away from energetically favorable ground state  conformations of biomolecules toward short lived  and low populated  excited states . Such fleeting states have been shown to play important roles in signaling, folding, catalysis, and recognition. Carr Purcell Meiboom Gill  relaxation dispersion experiments involve the application of a series of 180° pulses during a relaxation period at varying time intervals to modulate the chemical exchange contribution  to the observed transverse relaxation rate .
Designing and implementing a human research protocol has grown increasingly challenging due to the increasing expectations about scientific and biostatistical rigor, the growth in regulatory requirements, and the increasing subtlety of bioethical review. As a result, the successful design of a human research protocol requires inputs from a variety of content experts in addition to the investigator. We hypothesized that having an expert and experienced leader  coordinate and integrate those inputs in a structured program could expand opportunities for, and accelerate, translational research by: 1) lowering the barriers for basic investigators to develop human subjects protocols, 2) providing practical and comprehensive education in the principles of good clinical practice , 3) speeding IRB approval, and 4) insuring scientific quality .
Reactive chemical species including free radicals and non free radical species have a significant role in cell signaling and tissue damage . Nitrone spin traps are a group of synthetic chemicals initially designed for stabilizing free radicals to allow their detection by electron spin resonance  spectroscopy . The nitrone spin trap 5,5 dimethyl 1 pyrroline N oxide  was first introduced by Janzen and his colleagues about 40 years ago .
Working memory  refers to the ability to maintain goal relevant information in mind. Electrophysiological, lesion, and cooling studies with primates  and functional neuroimaging studies with humans   provide convergent evidence that prefrontal and parietal cortices support the maintenance of information in WM in the absence of perceptual information. Behavioral studies have documented an increase in WM ability from childhood to adulthood .
Reducing infection and mortality rates from viral pathogens, such as dengue and Ebola viruses, requires rapid and early diagnosis. This need poses a special challenge in economically challenged areas with limited laboratory infrastructure where these viruses are often endemic. Lateral flow assays  are a rapid, cheap, and simple option for POC diagnosis.
The ADNI  is a large longitudinal study of patients with probable Alzheimer's disease , patients with mild cognitive impairment  and healthy elderly controls followed for at least 23 years. Many participants in the ADNI are being treated with medications, and these may have beneficial or deleterious effects . Diagnosis, demographics, medication status, psychometric data and MRI measures of hippocampal volume and entorhinal cortex thickness were obtained for 818 participants from the ADNI cohort.
Acute Trypanosoma cruzi infection is followed by a lifelong chronic phase during which 10% to 30% of infected patients develop clinical Chagas disease . Seven to 10% of patients develop megasyndromes involving the GI tract, in particular, the esophagus and the colon . These megasyndromes are coupled with gastrointestinal motility disturbances in patients with Chagas disease .
of Haemophilus influenzae type b  conjugate vaccines into childhood immunization programs has dramatically reduced the incidence of Hib meningitis in countries using Hib vaccines . Hib conjugate vaccines are highly efficacious against invasive Hib disease , decrease Hib carriage among vaccinated children and reduce transmission and invasive disease among non immunized children  . Hib conjugate vaccines do not prevent H. influenzae disease due to other serotypes, raising the potential for the emergence of H. influenzae disease due to virulent organisms with non type b capsules .
Taenia solium and T. saginata are among the most prevalent human tapeworms in the world. The intermediate host of T. solium are mainly pigs. Humans act as definitive hosts for the parasite.
The functional, three dimensional structure of a protein reflects a careful balance of diverse noncovalent interactions. Stabilizing forces such as hydrogen bonds, salt bridges, and hydrophobic effect have been studied extensively. In contrast, much less is known about cationπ interactions in proteins, in part because of the challenges inherent to rigorous characterization of these interactions.
Simian immunodeficiency viruses  belong to the group of lentiviruses that infect non human primates . The lentiviruses that cause immunodeficiencies in humans and Asian macaques originated from cross species transmission of viruses that naturally infect nonhuman primates in Africa. Moreover, both SIV infection of Asian macaques and HIV 1 infection of humans result in chronic infection and the majority of infected individuals progress to AIDS .
The recessive Arabidopsis acd11 mutant initiates defense related programmed cell death  at the early seedling stage, leading to a lethal phenotype before flowering . The ACD11 protein has homology to glycolipid transfer proteins  found in most eukaryotes . The biological role of mammalian GLTP remains unknown, but the protein is well characterized structurally and biophysically .
Distinct types of neurons and glia are generated from progenitor cells following a precise spatial and temporal order during development of the nervous system. In the developing spinal cord, sequential generation of neurons and glia has been observed in different progenitor domains along the D V axis. At the onset of neurogenesis, ventrally located motor neurons  are the first type of neurons generated in the spinal cord, and various subtypes of MNs are born from the MN progenitor domain  at different times during development.
Neonatal herpes is one of the most serious consequences of herpes simplex virus  infection, and is a significant public health concern in many developed countries. . To reduce the risk of perinatal transmission of HSV, the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists  and the Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada  have recommended that caesarean delivery be performed on women presenting with genital herpes lesions at the onset of labour.
The presence of necrotic areas is a common feature of human solid tumors . This genus comprises a large and heterogeneous group of gram positive, spore forming bacteria that become vegetative and grow only in the absence  of oxygen and can be genetically engineered to produce a prodrug activating enzyme to specifically target anticancer drugs to tumors, an approach we have termed Clostridia Directed Enzyme Prodrug Therapy   . Initially, efforts to use the tumor targeting properties of non pathogenic strains of Clostridia focused on the fact that following intravenous injection, spores of these strains localized and germinated in the necrotic areas of experimental tumors and produced extensive tumor lysis.
Adoptive cell transfer of T lymphocytes has demonstrated successful tumor regression in clinical trials. , Although such responses are promising, one obstacle to T cell therapy is the requirement for T cell activation through the TCR with subsequent clonal expansion not only to generate sufficient numbers for effective tumor rejection but to activate effector molecules such as FasL to become involved in actual tumor killing. Signaling through the FasL lytic pathway is triggered when low or high affinity T cell receptor engagement of antigen occurs, whereas perforin/granzyme mediated killing is dependent on high affinity TCRantigen interactions.
Over the past several decades, investigators, academic institutions, and funding agencies have been increasingly investing in cross disciplinary team science initiatives with the aim of producing more comprehensive and innovative science that can effectively address important real world problems . The cross disciplinary research approach can be conceptualized along a continuum of increasing disciplinary integration, with unidisciplinary research at one end of the continuum and transdisciplinary  research at the other end . This definition highlights the goals not only to synthesize approaches from the contributing disciplines, but also to extend beyond these origins to produce new approaches that yield scientific innovations and findings with practical relevance to solving real world problems .
In 2010, an estimated 59,000 Americans were diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma  and approximately 13,000 died from the disease . The different subtypes of RCC and their distinct molecular characteristics  has led to improved treatment and therapy directed by tumor subtype . Although cytokine therapy with interferon alfa or interleukin 2  was considered as the standard treatment for metastatic RCC  prior to the introduction of targeted therapies, the latter are now considered the standard of care for most patients with mRCC .
The p27kip1 protein is a member of a family of CDK inhibitors  and plays an important role in multiple fundamental cellular processes and in the pathogenesis of human malignancies, with roles in cell proliferation, cell senescence, cell differentiation, migration, and invasion . P27kip1 is frequently inactivated in human cancers through accelerated proteolysis, and reduced p27kip1 expression has been shown to be associated with poor prognosis in a variety of human malignancies , whereas restoration of p27kip1 levels can inhibit tumor growth and progression . Identifying new pathways and molecules which regulate p27 expression is therefore critical for developing cancer treatments through restoration of p27 levels .
Myelinated axons are segregated into distinct domains that include the node of Ranvier, its flanking paranodal and juxtaparanodal regions, and the internode. These CAMs in turn bind to cytoskeletal and scaffolding proteins such as ankyrins, spectrins, 4.1 proteins, and MAGUKs. Finally, these cytoskeletal proteins and scaffolds function to recruit and/or stabilize the ion channels necessary for action potential conduction .
Apathy is increasingly being recognized as a common and clinically significant neurobehavioral syndrome. Similar prevalence of apathy has also been reported in frontotemporal degeneration . While clinicians appreciate the prevalence of apathy in dementia, little has been reported about its pathophysiology, characteristics, and behavioral associations .
Mammalian cystathionine β synthase  catalyzes the condensation of homocysteine with serine to form cystathionine and water in the first step of the transsulfuration pathway that yields cysteine. Additionally, elevations in plasma homocysteine correlate with other pathologies such as neurological disorders . CBS is the only known PLP dependent enzyme that also contains heme .
Bile acids  are essential for the normal digestion and absorption of lipids and vitamins . Chenodeoxycholic acid  and cholic acid , the two primary BAs in humans, are secreted from the gallbladder into the intestine, and are absorbed and recycled via the enterohepatic circulation. The small amounts of primary BAs that reach the colon are dehydroxylated by bacterial enzymes, forming secondary BAs .
Vitamin B12 , or cobalamin, plays a key role in cellular metabolism and DNA synthesis. It is produced in nature only by microbial synthesis, and animal products are the principal dietary sources for humans. Prevalence rates of deficiency of 47 71% have been reported among adults.
Glioblastoma multiforme  is the highest grade primary glioma  with a median survival time of approximately 12 months . Thus, current research for GBM therapy is focused on the elimination of these residual, post resection tumor cells. Adeno associated virus  vector mediated gene delivery for brain tumor therapy using transgenes encoding anti tumor proteins has shown promising results in experimental GBM models .
Human B7 H3  is a member of the B7/CD28 immunoglobulin superfamily which provides crucial costimulatory signals that regulate T cell functions in tumor surveillance, infections, and autoimmune diseases . The inhibitory role of B7 H3 was supported by the reports that both 2Ig and 4Ig forms of human B7 H3 inhibited T cell proliferation and cytokine production . In more recent studies of patients with prostate cancer, tumor B7 H3 expression was strongly correlated with disease spread at time of surgery, increased risk of clinical cancer recurrence and cancer specific death .
Cigarette’s addictive properties are largely due to the psychoactive effects of nicotine. Due to the relatively short half life of nicotine, approximately 2 hours, dependent smokers smoke at regular intervals to maintain nicotine levels. Therefore, factors that influence the intake or removal  of nicotine from the body can affect smoking behaviours such as the number of cigarettes smoked or the likelihood of cessation.
Farmers’ markets have been increasing in prevalence, and a 3.6% growth from 2012 to 2013 has led to 8,144 markets identified by the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s  directory. However, little is known about medical center farmers’ markets customers and current outreach efforts . Medical center farmers’ markets have the opportunity to accomplish more than simply selling produce.
Head and neck cancer  and its associated complications will account for 53,000 new cases and 13,000 deaths in 2013 . Thus, a means to prevent these pathologies would be highly desirable . Amifostine  is an organic thiophosphate prodrug under investigation for its cytoprotective capabilities in the setting of XRT.
The use of tacrolimus, a calcineurin inhibitor, to prevent solid organ transplant rejection is routinely guided by therapeutic blood level monitoring  . Despite close monitoring and individualization of dosing, TDM has not prevented some transplant recipients from developing chronic calcineurin inhibitor nephrotoxicity   . The pathogenesis of CNIT is complex and largely unpredictable .
There is evidence that chronic infections might increase the risk for diabetogenesis. For example, clinical indicators of periodontal infection were reported to be associated with a 2 fold increase in the risk of diabetes development during 20 years of prospective follow up and more recently, serological evidence of H. pylori infection was found to be associated with a 2.7 fold increase in risk for incident diabetes . Studies have also examined the relationship between infection and early markers of impaired glucose metabolism to advance our understanding of the natural history of associations.
Benzene is an important industrial chemical and also a significant environmental pollutant . Additionally, benzene metabolites may give rise to reactive oxygen species   . Mitochondria also play a role in cell apoptosis.
Men are typically assumed to respond more to visual sexual stimuli than women. Studies asking participants to indicate how attractive and sexually arousing they find visual sexual stimuli generally report higher ratings from men than from women , although there is substantial variability in the effect size of this sex difference . This variability may be due, in part, to the use of uncontrolled and varied types of experimental sexual stimuli.
The first case of human immunodeficiency virus  in Vietnam was reported in 1990. By 2006 the number of reported cases had increased to 280,000 representing an overall prevalence estimate of 0.5% among adults . In Vietnam, the HIV epidemic began and remains largely concentrated in injection drug users  and commercial sex workers .
In vivo cellular level monitoring and probing of biological systems can be realized using different microscopy techniques. Pancreatic islets or islets of Langerhans are highly vascularized micro organs in which the blood vessels have a distinct and tortuous architecture . In rodents, they are composed of a core of β cells, which produce insulin .
The trigeminal sensory complex in the brainstem is the first relay in the central nervous system for facial somatosensation. The STN is divided into three subnuclei, subnuclei oralis , interpolaris  and caudalis   . Rats and mice are useful for studying trigeminal somatosensation because their mystacial vibrissae have large, anatomically visible representations, with each facial whisker follicle visible as a distinct unit.
The locus coeruleus ,a small nucleus located in the pons, is the main source of brain norepinephrine especially for the hippocampus and forebrain. The activity of LC neurons is considered to be involved in numerous important functions including response to stress, attention, emotion, motivation, decision making, learning and memory. It is reported that LC neuronal numbers decrease during normal aging and in aging related diseases.
Colorectal cancer  remains the third most common cancer in both men and women and the second leading cause of cancer related deaths in the U.S. National guidelines, including those from the United States Preventive Services Task Force and the American Cancer Society, recommend CRC screening for all men and women 50 years of age and older. While there is no ideal screening method, recommended screening modalities include fecal occult blood testing, sigmoidoscopy, colonoscopy, double contrast barium enema, as well as CT colonography and fecal DNA analysis. While studies suggest that up to 60% of colorectal cancer deaths could be prevented with routine CRC screening, a major barrier to decreasing colorectal cancer morbidity and mortality is poor utilization of CRC screening procedures.
Obstructive sleep apnea  is characterized by repeated episodes of upper airway obstruction that are associated with reductions in ventilation, arousals and/or oxyhemoglobin desaturations during sleep . OSA can lead to excessive daytime sleepiness and fatigue, which, in turn, may cause vehicular and industrial accidents . In addition to neurocognitive sequelae , OSA is associated with increased cardiovascular disease  morbidity and mortality  .
Effective communication and teamwork have been recognized as critical drivers of quality and safety in many “High Consequence” industries. High consequence industries are those in which critical procedures are conducted in environments of high complexity and failure is potentially catastrophic . Within the surgical domain, one analysis demonstrated incomplete, nonexistent, or erroneous communication to be a causal factor in 43% of errors .
Plasma high density lipoprotein  levels are inversely correlated with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease and raising HDL levels by lifestyle changes or pharmacological interventions is an emerging strategy that might help to reduce the residual burden of disease in patients treated with Low density lipoprotein  lowering approaches , . While increasing synthesis or infusion of apolipoprotein A I  or HDL reduces atherosclerosis in animals and humans, it is not clear that all approaches to raising HDL will reduce atherosclerosis . The scavenger receptor B I  is a major factor regulating HDL catabolism.
Radiolabeled antibody targeting of tumor associated antigens often requires several days for adequate visualization of tumors due to the slow pharmacokinetics and accretion of intact antibodies in tumors . Pretargeting techniques were developed to improve radioimmunotargeting of tumors . The disadvantages of the biotin avidin based approaches are the immunogenicity of avidin and the need for a clearing agent to remove the antibody conjugate from the blood .
Amino acid based radiotracers target tumor cells through increased uptake by membrane associated amino acid transport  systems. In the present study, four structurally related non natural 18F labeled amino acids,   and  FAMP 1 and   and  MeFAMP 2 have been prepared and evaluated in vitro and in vivo for their potential utility in brain and systemic tumor imaging based upon primarily system A transport with positron emission tomography  . The transport of enantiomers of FAMP 1 and MeFAMP 2 was measured through in vitro uptake assays in human derived cancer cells including A549 , DU145 , SKOV3 , MDA MB468  and U87  in the presence and absence of amino acid transporter inhibitors.
Under physiological conditions, the endothelial cells play an important role in regulating vascular tone and in maintaining an anti thrombogenic layer through the release of substances such as nitric oxide  and prostacyclin . In this process, NO is produced by endothelial nitric oxide synthase  during the enzymatic conversion of L arginine to L citrulline , while PGI2 is formed from arachidonic acid  through a series of enzymatic conversions mediated by cyclooxygenase  and PGI2 synthase  . In the coronary microvascular endothelium of the pig, PGI2 and another vasodilator prostanoid, prostaglandin E2 , have been found to be predominant products of COX metabolism .
  The data used for this investigation came from the baseline assessment of an ongoing randomized control trial, “Project EARLY”, developed to test the efficacy of a one session motivational interviewing based intervention to reduce alcohol exposed pregnancy risk among women of child bearing age . Alcohol exposed pregnancy risk was defined as having sexual intercourse with a man while using contraception ineffectively  and drinking at risky levels, defined as consuming on average more than 7 standard drinks per week or more than three drinks on one occasion . Exclusion criteria were:  Untreated Major Depressive Disorder according to DSM IV TR criteria ;  Untreated Opioid Dependence according to DSM IV TR criteria .
Hepcidin is a peptide hormone synthesized in the liver and is the principal regulator of systemic iron homeostasis. Hepcidin controls plasma iron concentration and tissue iron distribution by inhibiting intestinal iron absorption, iron recycling by macrophages, and iron mobilization from hepatic stores . Hepcidin influences iron absorption through direct binding to ferroportin at the basolateral membrane, leading to decreased export of iron to the circulation system .
Atherosclerosis is triggered by complex interactions between macrophages, smooth muscle cells and extracellular matrix molecules, following the pathologic build up of low density lipoproteins  within the vascular wall region. OxLDL uptake is mediated by scavenger receptors, which unlike the receptors for native LDL, are not down regulated. Interactions of ligands with CD36 are generally hydrophobic and only somewhat mediated by charge.
Non invasive prenatal testing  using cell free DNA has proven to be highly sensitive and specific for the detection of fetal aneuploidy  . NIPT works by analyzing circulating fetal DNA, whose concentration comprises between 340% of the total cell free DNA in maternal serum. Because of its safety profile, NIPT can be particularly useful in the third trimester, allowing for diagnosis without the risk of premature labor, and appropriate planning and preparation for acute perinatal and neonatal management as required .
Myelinating oligodendrocytes originate from well characterized oligodendrocyte progenitor cells  whose major source in the postnatal brain is the subventricular zone . While differentiated oligodendrocytes cannot migrate, OPCs migrate from SVZ into developing white matter where they can again divide, before finally differentiating and myelinating axons  . These include extracellular matrix components , growth factors  and chemokines .
One way cancers arise is due to accumulation of varied types of genomic instabilities. The ability of cells to efficiently and faithfully replicate their genome is critical for maintaining the integrity of the genome and preventing tumorigenesis. Replication stresses due to endogenous factors include the presence of G rich sequences and highly repeated regions that are difficult to replicate.
Constitutive MAPK activation is frequent in human cancer and is often the result of activating mutations in RAS  . Mutationally activated forms of RAS were first identified in the Harvey and Kirsten sarcoma viruses, in which they were determined to be oncogenic  . Shortly thereafter, somatic RAS mutations were detected in human tumors  .
Obesity is a primary risk factor for osteoarthritis; however, there is currently no comprehensive explanation for why obesity increases the risk of OA at sites throughout the body. Most hypotheses focus on mechanical factors because the risk of developing knee osteoarthritis increases with body weight . One adipokine in particular, leptin, is known to influence all of these varied processes  .
Persons living with HIV  in the US smoke cigarettes at approximately triple the rate of the general adult population, and tobacco use has emerged as a leading killer in the highly active antiretroviral therapy  era. It is driving alarming rises in the incidences of cardiovascular disease, lung cancer, and head and neck cancers in this population. It is also associated with inferior adherence to HAART and poorer quality of life .
The mature mouse prostate is comprised of four bilaterally symmetric lobes: anterior, dorsal, lateral and ventral. Dorsal prostate buds also emerge on E16.5 and lateral and ventral buds are the last to appear on approximately E17.5 . The most fundamental aspect of the prostatic budding mechanism, how activation of ARs by fetal testosterone participates in bud initiation and patterning, remains unknown.
Cytoplasmic dynein is a large multisubunit motor protein implicated in the transport of membranous organelles, chromosomes and other cargos . This interaction has been proposed as a mechanism to link dynein to cargo in both interphase and mitosis . However, additional dynein subunits have also been implicated in tethering dynein to cargo, raising the possibility that multiple dynein subunits are responsible for organelle binding.
Carbon monoxide  is one of the more toxic agents present in the gas phase of tobacco smoke. It is a colourless, odourless, tasteless and non irritating gas formed when tobacco is not burned completely. It is present in mainstream smoke which is directly inhaled by an active smokers, at levels of 5 to 22 mg/cigarette.
Epigenetic dysfunction is a common and perhaps universal feature of human cancer. Studies into the biological consequences of hypo  and hypermethylation indicate that each plays a participative role in carcinogenesis . While significant progress has been made in identifying aberrant methylation events that occur during carcinogenesis, the timing, origins, and consequences of these events remain incompletely understood .
The production of the vasodilator nitric oxide  by endothelial nitric oxide synthase  is critical for the maintenance of normal vasomotor function. Tetrahydrobiopterin  is an essential cofactor required for activity of eNOS. BH4 is synthesized from guanosine triphosphate  in a three step process that is initiated by the enzyme GTP cyclohydrolase I .
Insulin like growth factor 1 receptor  represents a ubiquitously expressed heterotetrameric protein involved in the regulation of proliferation and metabolic function of many cell types . TSHR mediates the influence TSH exerts on specialized thyroidal function. Most of the downstream signaling provoked by TSHR occupancy occurs as a consequence of its interactions with G proteins and the activation of adenylate cyclase .
Chronic inflammatory disorders are relapsing and remitting conditions that reflect an underlying immune dysfunction. In the latter category, the thiopurines azathioprine and 6 mercaptopurine , are the treatments of choice for severe inflammatory bowel disease  and are often used in the management of rheumatoid arthritis . Thiopurines are efficacious and 70% of patients with steroid dependent IBD achieve and maintain remission .
There is increasing interest in chemical exchange saturation transfer contrast as several metabolites have been reported to be detectable by this approach in vivo , including amide protons in proteins , creatine , glutamate  and glucose . However, the signal of both endogenous DIACEST agents and exogenous PARACEST agents  may be altered by concomitant effects from direct saturation and semi solid magnetization transfer  . Recent studies have allowed insight into the interaction between direct water saturation and CEST, and showed that the effects add up inversely .
The mitochondrion has developed an elaborate translocation system with translocons on both the mitochondrial outer and inner membranes; proteins destined for the mitochondrion, termed precursors until they reach their correct location, utilize the Translocase of the Outer Membrane  complex and Translocase of Inner Membrane  complexes TIM23 and TIM22 to cross the outer and inner membranes, respectively. The small Tim complexes, Tim8Tim13 or Tim9Tim10, then bind to the substrates to facilitate transport across the intermembrane space. At the inner membrane, the small Tim complexes hand the substrate over to the insertion complex.
Drug regimen adherence and long term systemic toxicities are notable risk factors for safety and efficacy of lifelong antiretroviral therapy . The establishment of ART depots would circumvent this risk by requiring less frequent drug administrations. While prior clinical studies support the idea that viral suppression could be achieved with a simplified regimen of protease inhibitors atazanvir  and ritonavir , none have created long acting antiretroviral formulations nor correlated immune outcomes with drug distribution to tissue viral reservoirs.
Familial ovarian cancer is under strong genetic control, with many known high penetrance genetic risk factors, such as the rare BRCA1/2 mutations . Recently, many studies of epigenetics, such as DNAm, have been completed that add to the understanding of cancer development, risk and progression , including ovarian cancer . Many such studies have focused on methylation patterns in ovarian tumor tissue, demonstrating a clear role of DNAm in EOC tumors and facilitating improved understanding of cancer biology  .
“An old time hominid would be liable to pay dearly, had s/he failed to recognize a pair of glowing dots in the bush at dark as the eyes of a predator, mistaking it for two fireflies” David Navon We tend to see faces in objects that have constituent parts resembling those of a face. This is an example of a phenomenon called pareidolia, which involves the perception of an ambiguous and random stimulus as significant, such as seeing faces in landscapes, clouds   or even in grilled toasts . Why and how do we tend to see faces in objects that have constituent parts resembling those of a face?
Periosteum contains a population of stem/progenitor cells that play key roles in cortical bone repair . Following cortical bone fracture or osteotomy, the local progenitor cells residing in periosteum are activated, enabling them to respond to biological or biophysical stimuli produced within the local injury milieu. During the first few days of fracture, hematoma is formed followed by infiltration of inflammatory cells and release of growth factors.
The first tumor suppressor to be cloned was the retinoblastoma gene, Rb. Overall, greater than 70% of osteosarcomas demonstrate a molecular change or mutation at the Rb locus  . Overexpression of pRb causes G1 cell cycle arrest , while acute ablation of pRb induces cell cycle re entry in quiescent cells .
Numerous studies have shown that DNA efficiently mediates long range charge transport both in solution and at DNA modified surfaces. , SECM is also inherently compatible with aqueous environments, thereby allowing for the direct electrochemical profiling of DNA arrays with micrometer resolution. , In addition, SECM has been used successfully to monitor DNA hybridization and to detect DNA lesions.
Mesenchymal stem/stromal cells  are currently being investigated for a variety of clinical treatment applications. To date, over 300 clinical trials involve the use of MSCs, with over 2000 patients safely treated with MSCs. MSCs are typically cultured ex vivo and expanded to a sufficient cell number before patient administration.
The intramural injection of BoNT/A into the urinary bladder has proven to be a useful therapeutic approach for the treatment of various bladder disorders including refractory idiopathic detrusor overactivity as well as neurogenic detrusor overactivity., Following uptake into nerve terminals BoNT/A is thought to affect bladder function by targeting intracellular proteins involved in exocytosis and then suppressing the release of transmitters from intramural nerves . Though most of the studies on mechanism of action have focused on bladder nerves and change in neural control of the smooth muscle, other cellular targets may also be involved in the therapeutic effects of the toxin. Recent evidence has suggested that BoNT/A may act in part by targeting afferent mechanisms., This may be due to a direct effect on afferent nerves or an indirect effect to block release of transmitters from the epithelial cells that line the bladder wall .
T cell receptor  affinity is a key parameter that dictates T cell fate decisions during development in the thymus and after encounter with antigens in the periphery. Therefore, the majority of self reactive T cells involved in autoimmune disease have escaped thymic selection due to the lower affinity of their TCRs and/or the lack of tissue specific antigen expressed in the thymus. These two mechanisms of escape can potentially result in a self reactive population of T cells with variable TCR affinities.
Three related ocular birth defectsanophthalmia, microphthalmia and colobomaare an important contributor to childhood visual impairment and blindness, impacting 2 out of 10,000 newborns annually. However, each known gene is responsible for only a small percentage of cases, and many additional causative genetic factors still await identification. Studies have shown that gene deletions and duplications may comprise up to 15% of mutations underlying monogenic disease .
A fundamental process of B cells is the expression of different classes of antibodies to neutralize specific pathogens. Each IgG subclass is present in human serum at variable levels and displays a unique profile of effector activities that results in a distinct isotype/subclass profile to a given antigen within a defined local environment . Protein antigens characteristically invoke IgG1 and IgG3 responses whereas IgG2 often predominates in humoral responses to carbohydrate antigens .
Dendritic cells  are a promising target for gene therapeutic strategies to induce antitumor responses, as DC initiate immune responses by presenting tumor associated antigens  to naive T cells. Therapeutic strategies that target DC should aim for high transduction efficiency and specificity, as optimal TAA delivery to DC is critical for the therapeutic efficacy of DC based vaccination strategies. It is well known that the commonly used subgroup C adenovirus serotype 5  is of limited utility for transduction of human DC, both in vitro and in vivo, as DC lack expression of the adenovirus binding receptor CAR .
A large body of work has shown that anxiety disorders aggregate within families . Indeed, family studies indicate that both children of parents with anxiety disorders  and parents of children with anxiety disorders  display higher rates of anxiety disorders than do relatives of family members without anxiety disorders. Although these findings suggest that the transmission of anxiety within families is biological/genetic, quantitative behavioral genetic studies demonstrate that environmental factors have a prominent role in the etiology of anxiety disorders.
CVID is the most commonly diagnosed primary immunodeficiency , likely due to the variety of clinical presentations, although more than 90% of analyzed CVID patients lack a definitive genetic defect . The multifaceted nature of this disease coupled with the lack of solid genetics has led to a dearth of available mouse models to understand the manifestations and mechanisms underlying CVID . As a result, the deficient Ig production common to CVID may not encompass the full mechanistic extent of the disorder .
Ovarian cancer has the highest mortality rate among gynecological malignancies, and is currently the fourth most common cancer in women. Each year, more than 22,000 women are diagnosed with ovarian cancer in the US and about 15,000 women die of the disease, primarily due to difficulties in early diagnosis and poor prognosis . However, the role of linker histone variants in ovarian cancer cells has not been explored .
Hyperpolarization activated current, Ih or If, contributes to many cellular functions such as resting membrane potential, synaptic transmission, and rhythmic activity in neurons and myocytes . One of the unique features about this current is its distinct properties in different tissues . Each isoform exhibits different gating properties when expressed in heterologous expressing systems such as Xenopus oocytes and HEK293 cells  .
Toxic red tides  were reported along the Florida Gulf coast by Spanish explorers in the 1500s with written documentation in the 1840s . Brevetoxins are polycyclic ether ladder compounds that are differentiated into two similar, yet distinct backbone structures PbTx 1  with 10 rings, and PbTx 2  with 11 rings  . The primary mode of action is binding of PbTx to site 5 of voltage sensitive sodium channels  in neurons .
Praziquantel, the drug of choice against schistosomiasis,  has shown excellent safety and therapeutic effect against schistosomiasis morbidity. Praziquantel became available in 1979, but had never been studied in pregnant or lactating women hence, although presumed safe in pregnancy based on animal studies, was widely withheld from pregnant or lactating women during treatment programmes . In 2002, an informal consultation by the World Health Organisation reviewed experience on use of praziquantel in pregnancy.
A major bottleneck in structural studies of membrane proteins is their expression and subsequently purification to homogeneity. To circumvent this problem, we have developed a novel technology to express in E. coli cells a single membrane protein of interest in high yield. We have previously demonstrated that a single soluble protein can be produced in E. coli by the method termed the single protein production  .
Circulating tumor cells  captured from peripheral blood recently were shown to predict disease outcome and therapy response in cancer patients . Currently, CTCs are isolated from blood by methods which rely on immuno magnetic binding of cell surface epithelial cell adhesion molecules , an expensive, labor intense approach that is limited to EpCAM expressing tumors .
