Although the nucleotide sequences of mouse and human fortilins, also known as p21 and translationally controlled tumor protein , were reported in 1988 and 1999, their role in apoptosis regulation has been unknown. Fortilin proved to be a molecule that interacts specifically with MCL1 . Fortilin’s amino acid sequence is highly conserved in a variety of species such as plants and humans.
FTLD is amongst the most prevalent neurodegenerative dementias after Alzheimer's. Symptomatology includes pronounced behavioral changes with altered motivation, personality and/or language function, with pathology in the frontal and temporal lobes . Thus, understanding of FTLD TDP is intimately connected with the function of the neuronal lysosome .
The similarities between the rhesus macaque brain and its human counterpart have lead to use of the former in studies of neurological disorders and their treatment . Due to the serial nature and high cost of these studies, non invasive modalities: MRI for morphology or function and proton MR spectroscopy  for metabolism, are often favored. Instrumental factors such as the static  and radio frequency  field inhomogeneity can be handled by field mapping and internal water referencing .
The cardiovascular manifestations of acute neurological events have been well documented . Several ECG abnormalities have been reported in patients following acute cerebrovascular events including QT interval prolongation, ST segment deviation and T wave changes . These abnormalities have been attributed to transient increases in sympathetic activity  .
Muscular dystrophies  comprise a heterogeneous group of inherited diseases that mainly affect striated muscle. MD are characterized by progressive muscle weakness, atrophy and in many instances, premature death . Many of these mutations cause cell membrane disruption  which may trigger cytoplasmic and/or mitochondrial calcium overload .
Group AB plasma, the traditional universal donor plasma product, is a limited resource. We compared outcomes of Group A plasma transfusion in comparison to AB . Analysis of blunt injured patients who received emergency release plasma from was performed.
Primary biliary cirrhosis  is a complex autoimmune disease that is likely caused by environmental interaction with genetically determined predisposition . PBC is characterized by the destruction of small intrahepatic bile ducts, subsequently causing biliary cholestasis. This sustained chronic injury may ultimately lead to the development of end stage liver disease requiring liver transplantation.
Our ability to prepare and adapt to the environment is fundamental to human existence. This alerting mechanism appears largely driven by the hippocampus preparing the HPA axis for arousal and stress , which may be accompanied by memory representations upon waking that allow orientation to self, place, time and personal demands  . While previous studies suggest that the CAR is robust and reliable based on age in children and adults , developmental changes may influence the presence and magnitude of the CAR especially during adolescence .
Recent reports indicate the increased use of methylphenidate  for behavioral disorders, cognitive enhancing effects, and for recreation . MPD exerts its effects by altering the dopamine  system. The NAc mediates reward behavior through dense dopaminergic projections from the ventral tegmental area  .
Over the last four decades, the use of Drosophila as a model organism has expanded dramatically to include many aspects of behavior and physiology previously thought inaccessible to genetic analysis. The pioneering work in this area by Benzer and colleagues included the isolation of neurodegeneration mutants, beginning with drd. Since this first report, a number of Drosophila neurodegeneration mutants have been characterized, including several with phenotypes similar to human diseases.
Telomerase is a ribonucleoprotein complex composed of the catalytic protein subunit hTERT  and RNA subunit hTR , which serves as the template for the synthesis of telomeric DNA . Therefore, detailed understanding of telomerase regulation is necessary to determine the mechanisms of carcinogenesis and to develop novel armaments against cancer . These efforts have revealed that hTERT promoter is enriched with transcription factor binding sites .
Collateral vessels provide a mechanism to protect against adverse outcomes associated with atherosclerosis. For people with lower extremity peripheral artery disease , collateral vessels are a natural bypass system, protect against critical limb ischemia, and may reduce ischemia related leg symptoms. However, collateral vessels do not restore perfusion to normal.
Allergic rhinitis  is an IgE mediated disease with symptoms of rhinorrhea, nasal obstruction, nasal itching and sneezing upon exposure to aeroallergens. In the USA, approximately $11.2 billion was spent on AR treatments in 2005. Preschool children and young adults with AR are at increased risk for asthma later in life., Early exposure to traffic related air pollutants, specifically diesel exhaust particles , may enhance risk for aeroallergen sensitization and development of allergic disorders in childhood., To address these gaps, we conducted the Cincinnati Childhood Allergy and Air Pollution Study  birth cohort to test the hypothesis that childhood DEP exposure is associated with development of aeroallergen sensitization and allergic disease.
The class of foods known as added sugars has been defined by the United States Department of Agriculture  as sugars and syrups that are added to foods during processing or preparation. They include white sugar, brown sugar, raw sugar, corn syrup, corn syrup solids, high fructose corn syrup, malt syrup, maple syrup, pancake syrup, and fructose sweetener; they do not include naturally occurring sugars such as lactose in milk or fructose in fruits . The consumption of added sugars in the United States  has increased dramatically since 1985 , and there has been increasing concern and research about their role in disease.
The human placenta represents the anatomical and functional feto maternal interface. When a robust inflammatory reaction during pregnancy is mounted , both maternal and fetal inflammatory responses can be observed. One of the histologic manifestations of such an inflammatory response is infiltration of both maternal and fetal neutrophils in the placenta .
Magnetic resonance imaging  provides exquisitely detailed images of the anatomy of the prostate and is the most sensitive imaging modality available for the detection and local staging of prostate cancer. For optimal MR imaging of prostate cancer, an endorectal coil must be used in conjunction with a pelvic phased array coil . However, since the endorectal coil introduces considerable deformation of the prostate and surrounding tissues, the registration of endorectal MR images with pathological sections is especially challenging.
Previous research has primarily focused on the relationship between illicit drug use and HIV/STI risk behavior among African American women. Very few studies have solely reviewed the role of alcohol use on risky sexual behavior. The present study examined the relationship between alcohol use at non abuse levels and risky sexual behaviors and sexually transmitted infections  among young adult African American women .
High resolution peripheral quantitative computed tomography  is a promising non invasive method for in vivo 3D characterization of human bone . Whereas clinical HR pQCT studies have primarily focused on trabecular micro architecture , the significance of cortical bone at these sites has recently received increased attention . These properties are modified through distinct physiologic processes  and, therefore, represent unique targets for pharmacologic intervention.
There has recently been a series of neuroimaging studies that demonstrate that there is a pitch processing center in lateral Heschl’s gyrus . There is more activation when a sound has a pitch, and the level of activation varies with pitch strength. It is referred to as the pitch onset response   .
Endocrine disrupting compounds  are chemicals that perturb the endocrine system either by acting as agonists or antagonists to sex hormone receptors, thus mimicking or preventing the action of endogenous estrogens and androgens. Bisphenol A   is a monomer used in the synthesis of polycarbonate plastics and epoxy resins worldwide and is commonly found in baby bottles, food containers, and linings of food and beverage cans. BPA can migrate from containers into the contents, allowing for the direct exposure to humans via ingestion .
Stress is common and unavoidable, and exposure to stress of various forms can significantly alter brain function and promote cognitive and emotional disorders. Effects of stress on cognition are complex and depend on factors including the nature, duration, and timing of stress, and the specific cognitive task employed. In contrast, ventral hippocampus is endowed with distinct afferent/efferent connections, including robust pathways to amygdala,, which may enhance the emotional salience of memories., Stress, and stress hormones, influence dorsal and ventral hippocampus differentially: chronic stress attenuates long term potentiation in dorsal, but not ventral CA1, suggesting that discrete mechanisms exist for the effects of stress mediators on dorso ventral components of the hippocampal formation.
During T cell development, the organism generates a T cell population with an extended repertoire of antigen specificities. The majority of thymocytes bear TCRs that do not recognize the MHC molecules present in the thymus, and these cells die relatively rapidly . Most of what we understand about these processes has been learnt using genetically modified mice, especially mice engineered to express a rearranged transgenic TCR.
Human HCC is the fifth commonest cause of cancer deaths worldwide  and is increasingly frequent in the USA , with approximately 15,000 new cases annually . There is thus the need for less toxic and effective therapy for HCC. It has broad activity against various tumor cell lines in vitro and in xenograft models .
Placebo response rates in trials of antipsychotic medications for acute schizophrenia are rising, mirroring increases observed in illnesses such as Major Depressive Disorder  . In 28 atypical antipsychotic trials, Kemp et al. reported that the average symptom improvement among patients assigned to placebo increased by over 10 points on the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale  between 1991 and 2006 . Agid et al  found that the standardized mean effect size associated with placebo treatment significantly increased over time .
Although cementless implants have become increasingly popular, particularly in the North American market, polymethylmethacrylate  cement is still widely used to secure orthopaedic implants within bone. Despite its long clinical history, the behavior of the cement mantle in an implant/cement/bone construct is poorly understood. This has led to unexpectedly poor clinical outcomes for some novel cemented implants .
Estrogens regulate physiological processes in various tissues, including but not limited to the uterus, mammary gland, bone, prostate, colon, lung, heart and brain. Estradiol stimulates a number of physiological responses in the mammary gland. These include DNA synthesis in mammary epithelial cells and proliferation of stromal cells .
Integral membrane proteins  are difficult to handle in vitro because they are not soluble in aqueous solutions unless they are complexed by surfactants, most often detergents. Detergents, however, destabilize most MPs . CD provides an easy measure of secondary structure content, allowing direct comparison of the conformational state of the protein in various environments.
Cardiovascular diseases are the leading cause of deaths in the developed world. These alterations at a cellular level precede the macroscopic manifestation of the pathology that may enable its early detection. Inflammation in endothelial cells of an artery may participate in initiation and progression of plaque .
Delirium is common, morbid, and costly in hospitalized elders . Despite increasing awareness of its importance, most delirium, particularly hypoactive delirium and delirium superimposed on dementia, still goes unrecognized . Prompt recognition of delirium is the first key step in its appropriate management, which involves careful review for reversible contributors, preventing complications , and instituting cognitive and physical rehabilitation .
The biologic and physiologic changes during the teen years are more strongly correlated with pubertal maturation than chronologic age. Common markers of pubertal onset include self or parental report of menarche, height velocity, and breast development. Difficulties in determining breast stage development in the obese child and teen inaccuracies in self report limit the use of such methods .
Phase II enzymes play important roles in maintaining redox homeostasis, resistance against oxidative stress, and detoxification and elimination of toxins. It is important to note that many commercial protein kinase inhibitors do not have absolute specificity of action. This approach was used in this study as the principal goal was not to identify the signaling pathways for each phase II gene but to determine whether or not the same pathways were involved in their induction.
Metastatic melanoma is the leading cause of skin cancer deaths in the US, with a median overall survival of only 69 months . Despite advances in the field, the reference therapy for patients diagnosed with metastatic melanoma is Dacarbazine , which was first approved for treatment in the 1970’s. DTIC therapy is associated with poor patient outcome, with complete response occurring in less than 5% of cases .
Therapeutic hypothermia is now standard clinical care for moderate to severe neonatal encephalopathy in the UK and developed world. Clinical trials have included whole body cooling with core temperature reduced to 33.5°C for 72 hours, as the optimal temperature for neural rescue is likely to be below 34°C. There are however around 40% of infants who, despite hypothermic treatment, have an adverse neurodevelopmental outcome.
Acquisition of chronic pulmonary infection with Pseudomonas aeruginosa is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in patients with cystic fibrosis . The accumulation of mucus plugs in the airways, composed in part of bacterial alginate, reduces airway conductance, accelerating the rate of decline in pulmonary function. Increased transcription of genes that encode alginate biosynthetic enzymes involves multiple regulatory and signalling molecules .
China has witnessed an increasing rate of heterosexual transmission of HIV in recent years. In 2007, heterosexual transmission was reported to be responsible for 37.9% of new infections, a rapid increase from 10.7% in 2005 . Sexual intercourse is a social behavior not only in the sense that it usually involves two persons, but also in that multiple dimensions of social structures and social interaction can also influence the choice of sexual partners and risky sexual behaviors .
It is predicted that in 2009, 192,370 women in the United States will develop breast cancer and 40,170 women will die from the disease . Selective estrogen receptor modulators  reduce ER positive breast cancer recurrence by approximately 50% . However, these agents are not effective in treating ER negative breast cancer, which accounts for 3040% of all breast cancers .
Viridins, a class of compounds from fungi of which wortmannin  is a member, have long intrigued pharmacologists because of their potent antiproliferative and immune suppressive properties. Viridins are steroid like molecules which have a “extra” furan ring as a common, key structural feature. Wm is a nanomolar PI3 kinase inhibitor, , but at higher concentrations inhibits polo like kinase, mTOR, DNA dependent protein kinase and ATM.
Integrins are extracellular matrix  receptors that play important and diverse roles in metazoans, including regulation of cell motility, differentiation, survival and proliferation. The cytoplasmic domain of Itgb1 interacts with multiple proteins and transmits outside signals to cytoskeleton proteins and various membrane receptors. Tissue specific depletion of Itgb1 in cartilage as well as different epithelial tissues, such as mammary gland and skin, negatively affected cell survival and proliferation in these tissues .
Spinal cord injury  typically leads to formation of scar tissue that can be categorized into glial and fibrotic components. Most of our current knowledge of the scar tissue has come from studies on the astroglial component, whereas our understanding of the fibrotic component is relatively lacking. We recently reported that collagen1α1+ perivascular fibroblasts are a major cellular component of the fibrotic scar after SCI .
Drugs of abuse that are reinforcing share a common mechanism in causing elevated synaptic dopamine levels in the nucleus accumbens . Two distinct components of behavioral sensitization are understood to be differentially mediated by these brain regions. The influence of NK 3 receptors on dopaminergic neurotransmission also results in altered dopamine mediated behaviors.
A formidable challenge in the field of Parkinson’s Disease  research is to understand the processes that lead to the death of dopamine  containing neurons in the substantia nigra . Mitochondrial function is critical to the maintenance of adequate adenosine triphosphate  for basic cell processes. Acute glutamate excitotoxicity can produce necrotic cell death .
There has been much debate about the role of depression and other mental disorders as risk factors that further the initiation of smoking in young people . The association between mood disorders and smoking has been well established in epidemiological research ; nevertheless, the direction of the relation between smoking and depression has not been understood fully . For example, the findings of Kendler et al. supported the causal linkage from depression to smoking, whereas Wu & Anthony  found that smoking occurred before depression in older children and adolescents.
Cryptococcus neoformans is a free living pathogenic fungus that primarily inhabits soil contaminated with decaying organic matter and bird excreta . C. neoformans is a non specific pathogen that has been reported to infect and/or cause disease in a myriad of taxonomically diverse organisms from mammals to birds to such invertebrates as insects and worms  . One of the enduring questions in the field of medical mycology is the origin and maintenance of virulence by microbes, such as C. neoformans , which have no requirement to inhabit vertebrate hosts for replication or survival.
Toll like receptor 9  was identified as the receptor for oligodeoxynucleotides  containing unmethylated cytosine guanosine  dinucleotides and was originally thought to distinguish pathogen DNA from that of the mammalian host on this basis, as unmethylated CpG dinucleotides are relatively uncommon in mammalian DNA compared with pathogen DNA . This intracellular localization serves to facilitate TLR9 access to pathogen DNA and at the same time restrict TLR9 access to self DNA . This occurs by uptake and internalization of the IC by a cell surface Fcγ receptor on the DC with subsequent delivery of the DNA to intracellular TLR9 .
The purpose of this article is to describe the development of a scale that will allow us to understand the level of confidence that family members have for participating in health care decisions for terminally ill loved ones. We first identified a need for such a scale when our study of terminally ill patient decision making revealed that a high percentage of patients preferred shared decision making with family. The challenge, however, is that family and other surrogate decision makers are often unprepared for end of life decision making and many report high levels of distress from this role .
ADP ribosylation factor  proteins are small GTPases that are essential regulators of many intracellular vesicular trafficking pathways . The five human ARF isoforms  fall into three categories based on sequence similarities and comprise the class I ARFs , the class II isoforms  and a single class III protein . ARF1 is a key component in the formation of a number of different vesicular coat complexes and is essential to the dynamic assembly/disassembly of AP 1, AP 3, AP 4 and GGA1 3 based vesicle coats .
Niacin is a lipid altering agent that favorably affects multiple lipid parameters. Niacin has been evaluated in combination with simvastatin in several clinical trials and has demonstrated efficacy, with clinical improvement in multiple lipid parameters . Simvastatin like other statins is a lipid altering drug with proven lipid and coronary artery disease  outcome efficacy .
Cell migration in response to chemotactic and haptotactic cues is essential for proper organismal development . Dysregulation of cell migration can lead to developmental disorders and diseases, including cancer invasion and metastasis . Localized control of actomyosin contractility is essential for directed cell migration.
Spontaneous fluctuations in blood oxygenation level dependent  fMRI signals have recently aroused a large amount of interest in the fMRI literature . By studying fluctuations at rest, researchers have claimed that the brain is intrinsically organized into dynamic, anti correlated functional networks . Subsequent studies have identified several consistent resting state networks, including motor, auditory, visual, attention and default mode .
Hepatitis B virus  remains an important human pathogen despite the existence of a highly effective vaccine. Particularly in resource limited contexts, vaccination rates remain well under 100% and vaccination at birth of infants born to HBV positive mothers is not fully protective against vertical transmission . Moreover, it is estimated that over 240 million individuals, ~4% of the world population, remain chronically infected with HBV and are therefore at high risk for cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma , leading to ~800,000 deaths per year that are directly linked to HBV infection  .
Necrotizing enterocolitis  is the leading cause of death from gastrointestinal disease in preterm infants, and remains a major cause of long term disability in those who survive the disease, . Despite the increasing frequency with which NEC is diagnosed, its pathogenesis remains largely uncertain, although there is general acceptance that its development reflects persistent intestinal mucosal injury. In seeking to understand how mucosal injury in NEC occurs, we have recently shown that NEC development requires activation of the innate immune receptor Toll like receptor 4  on enterocytes, and that TLR4 activation by bacterial endotoxin  inhibits enterocyte proliferation and leads to disease progression, .
Based on experimental animal models and epidemiological evidence, Helicobacter pylori infection causes persistent chronic gastritis, which in susceptible individuals, may progress to atrophy, intestinal metaplasia, dysplasia, and finally intestinal type gastric cancer . H. pylori infection resulted in overexpression of type 2 cyclooxygenase  in primary gastric cancer and gastric cancer cell lines of human and mouse gastric epithelial cells . Recent studies suggested a positive association between hypergastrinemia, H. pylori infection, and gastric cancer in humans and mice .
When a population is well adapted to its environment, the vast majority of new mutations will be neutral or negative. In small populations, individually deleterious mutations may fix sequentially by drift . At low frequencies, mutations required for a given complex adaptation are almost always present separately, where selection acts against them.
Retinal ganglion cells  are the sole output neurons of the retina. Their dendrites receive synapses from bipolar and amacrine interneurons in the inner plexiform layer , their somata reside in a narrow ganglion cell layer, they express several common molecular features, and their axons travel through the optic nerve to retinorecipient structures in the brain, where they form glutamatergic synapses . As a well defined and accessible neuronal type, RGCs have been a favored object for elucidating developmental, molecular, cell biological and electrophysiological principles that apply to central neurons generally .
Within its native range in Asia, Aedes japonicus  larvae are found in a wide variety of natural and artificial containers, however rock pools appear to be the most favored habitat . Immatures of this species have occupied a similar ecological niche since its invasion of the United States in 1998 via used tire shipments  from Japan . This species appears to have become established on the west coast in Washington  and has recently been detected in Mississippi, Nevada , and Hawaii .
Herpesviruses comprise a family of relatively large double stranded DNA viruses, which are widespread among humans and other animals. The Roseolovirus genus is composed of three human viruses: the closely related human herpesvirus 6A  and human herpesvirus 6B  and the more distantly related human herpesvirus 7  . Roseoloviruses are among the most prevalent viruses in the human population with primary infection occurring during early childhood .
Although common in Nature, self assemblies that are principally driven by entropy are rare among the range of synthetic assemblies reported to date. Instead, it is routine to ensure assembly by using structural motifs that make a significant enthalpic contribution to the overall free energy change during assembly. Recently, we have been interested in assembly systems designed to rely on entropic changes.
Chromatin structure is organized by nucleosomes, each of which consists of an octamer composed of four core histones  and ~147 bp DNA, which wraps around the octamer. For instance, histone H3K4 trimethylation marks promoters that are either active or poised for transcription while H3K36 trimethylation is often associated with gene bodies and has been shown to suppress spurious gene transcription and promote transcriptional elongation . RNA splicing is involved in the expression of most human genes, playing key roles in differentiation, cell cycle progression, and development.
T regulatory cells  play a critical role in maintaining peripheral tolerance, and their loss results in severe autoimmune disease in both humans and in mice . In humans, however, generation of therapeutic quantities of Tregs, particularly under GMP compliant conditions, has proven problematic . Since T effector cells have a replicative advantage in most culture systems, low level contamination of input cultures by effector T cells after Treg enrichment presents an obstacle to developing therapeutic adoptive transfer strategies with Treg cultures after several weeks of ex vivo expansion.
Mucus secretions serve as the body’s first line of defense against pathogens , toxins , and environmental ultrafine particles  at exposed surfaces not covered by skin, such as the eye and the respiratory, gastrointestinal and cervicovaginal tracts. The barrier properties of mucus are rooted in its dense network of mucin fibers, which contain highly glycosylated  segments interspersed by hydrophobic, lipid coated domains . These features enable mucus to trap foreign particles through steric obstruction and/or adhesion to mucus constituents via hydrophobic, electrostatic and hydrogen bonding interactions.
Optimal adherence to highly active antiretroviral therapy  is crucial to maximize the clinical benefits of treatment, delay disease progression, and to prevent the emergence and transmission of drug resistant viruses. Although recent data suggest that boosted protease inhibitors and non nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors are more forgiving than nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors and non boosted protease inhibitors,,  adherence at levels of 95% or greater has long been recommended. Maintaining long term adherence to HAART is difficult due to complex regimens, unpleasant side effects and because patients with HIV infection must take HAART consistently for the duration of their lives.
With Edward Kendall’s discovery of compound E, Louis Sarrett’s synthesis of ‘cortisone’ and Philip Hench’s successful application to a patient with rheumatoid arthritis , glucocorticoids  became the ‘wonder drug’ of the 20th century and have held a special place in the management of rheumatoid arthritis ever since . Their use is cost effective and their potent anti inflammatory properties help provide rapid symptomatic relief. Randomized controlled trials have demonstrated an ability to retard radiographic progression in RA and prevent development of new erosions, thus confirming disease modifying effects when used in low doses .
The population in the US is progressively aging. The proportion of the population aged >65 years is projected to increase from 12.4% to 19.6% by 2030. and the absolute number of elderly persons is projected to increase from approximately 35 million to 71 million. Moreover, the number of persons in the US > 80 years of age is projected to double from 9.5 million in 2000 to 19 million in 2030. , .
Memory storage remains a limitation when running very large neuronal networks . With number of neurons n, connectivity storage grows as n2. With connectivity densities of 0.110%, 1 · 106 neurons will require from 1 · 109 to 1 · 1011 synapses.
Banned organochlorine  insecticides are widespread persistent organic pollutants that bioaccumulate in wildlife and humans. While OC insecticides are structurally diverse, they share a number of modes of toxic action. Alterations in lipid homeostasis occur in rodents at OC insecticide doses that are not overtly neurotoxic or carcinogenic.
ATP dependent cyclical interactions between myosin containing thick filaments and actin containing thin filaments drive muscle contraction in all animals. In vertebrate striated muscles, the C terminal two thirds of tropomyosin associates with specific domains of troponin, an asymmetric protein complex comprised of TnT , TnI , and TnC subunits  . Thus, a single thin filament “regulatory unit” consists of seven actin subunits controlled by a single troponin tropomyosin complex.
Glycerol 3 phosphate acyltransferase 1 converts sn glycerol 3 phosphate to 1 acyl sn glycerol 3 phosphate, the first step in the biosynthetic pathway of all glycerolipids. Also, mtGPAT activity is higher in the livers from both diet induced obese mice and leptin deficient ob/ob mice when compared with their lean controls  . It has been shown that elevated hepatic mtGPAT is associated with obesity since the enzyme can divert activated fatty acids from oxidation to glycerolipid synthesis.
Venous thromboembolism , comprising the conditions of deep vein thrombosis  and pulmonary embolism , is the third most common cardiovascular disorder in adult Americans. While the magnitude of VTE increases dramatically with advancing age, relatively little is known about the natural history of this disorder in the elderly. The high risk elderly population has unfortunately been under represented in clinical trials evaluating therapeutic options for this condition, thereby leaving clinicians to generalize resulting data to the elderly when making clinical decisions.
The neuregulin 1  encodes a family of growth factors that interact with ERBB receptor tyrosine kinases via the epidermal growth factor  like domain to initiate intracellular signaling cascades critical to neuronal functions . NRG1 proproteins undergo extracellular proteolytic processing at the juxtamembrane region to release EGF like domain, which then participates in paracrine signaling involving ERBB receptors . Thus, Type III NRG1 is believed to signal via ERBB receptors in a juxtacrine manner .
Cochlear implants are the first successful example of replacing a human sensory end organ with an electronic device. There are two main reasons why the cochlear implant is considered one of the major medical advances of the twentieth century. The case of children is significant because in their case cochlear implants influence not only their ability to understand speech but also their ability to speak intelligibly and their development of oral language.
Hepatocellular carcinoma  is the most common primary hepatic malignancy and is the second most common cause of cancer related deaths in the world. Recently, HCC recurrence and stage has been shown to be independently predicted by the degree of CD8+ tumor infiltrating T cells . PD 1  may have an important role in the exhaustion of CD8+ T cells in infectious diseases .
Mast cells  are stem cell factor  dependent hematopoietic cells that are ubiquitously distributed throughout the body  and they initiate inflammatory responses to allergens and infectious agents . c Kit is a member of the type III subclass of receptor tyrosine kinases, comprising of an N terminal extracellular ligand binding domain, a transmembrane domain and a cytoplasmic kinase domain, which is activated by ligand mediated receptor dimerization . C Kit activation by SCF is crucial for the survival and proliferation of human MCs and and the deregulation of the c kit/SCF axis can lead to uncontrolled proliferation as seen during systemic mastocytosis.
While medical advances have improved cancer survival, there is an increasing emphasis on addressing the “human costs” of cancer treatment . These costs include the aversive side effects of often life saving treatments. Side effects including pain, fatigue, nausea, and vomiting are not only commonly experienced; they can significantly negatively impact quality of life  and increase patients’ distress .
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a chronic systemic autoimmune disease characterized by joint inflammation and progressive cartilage and bone erosion . Leukocyte infiltration into the joint space and tissue is a key component of both RA and CIA . A recent commercially available arthritis induction protocol has provided a new murine RA model .
Halophilic Archaea  represent some of the mostextremophilic microorganisms known. Haloarchaea inhabit hypersaline habitats with35 M sodium chloride concentrations and contain equally high concentrationof salts in their cytoplasm . NRC 1 was the first in the Haloarchaeafamily to be sequenced and provided a convenient experimental genetic system forpostgenomic studies of DNA repair and replication .
When Ca2+ enters cells in response to depletion of intracellular stores, it is called store operated Ca2+ entry, and serves as the major route of Ca2+ entry into animal cells . Store operated Ca2+ entry is mediated primarily by the Ca2+ selective release activated Ca2+  channel , which consists of the pore forming subunits ORAI13 and the Ca2+ sensors, STIM1 and STIM2. STIM1 binds Ca2+ through two EF hand containing domains located in the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum .
In bilingual populations, residual differences can be seen between native and non native language processing, even if both languages are spoken well. The sentences are embedded in different levels of noise, which allows the investigation of how degrading the ‘bottomup’ speech input interacts with ‘topdown’ knowledge of higher level linguistic information. Here, we propose to extend existing research showing that native listeners benefit from linguistic context under adverse listening conditions by using a new paradigm which will allow to specifically isolate the semantic ‘higher level’ component of language, and to determine whether this level  contributes to the native language advantage when listening to degraded speech.
Since the first description of simple and complex cells in the primary visual cortex  , the synaptic circuits underlying these two types of cells have been extensively studied and discussed. It is generally proposed for simple cells that the spatially segregated On and Off subregions in their receptive fields  primarily originate from convergent inputs from On  and Off center thalamic relay cells, respectively . However, the contribution of cortical input, especially that of cortical inhibitory input, to the generation of simple cell RFs remains controversial.
Single particle electron microscopy  is routinely used to resolve the three dimensional  structure of large macromolecular assemblies . In some cases, structural heterogeneity can be approximated with discrete number of conformations. However, a description by a number of intermediate structural states is practically reasonable  .
Programming refers to the action of a factor during a sensitive developmental period affecting the organization and maturity of specific organs. Considering the extended pre  and postnatal developmental trajectory of the brain, it is apparent that early life experiences have the potential to sculpt brain morphology. The immature brain can be considered “under construction”  with the development of the human central nervous system following a protracted, neatly orchestrated chain of specific ontogenetic events.
Infections acquired during hospitalization  are associated with increased hospital length of stay, rates of death, and increased costs. Substantial effort is devoted to preventing healthcare associated infections through practices designed to reduce the transmission of nosocomial pathogens, such as hand hygiene, bundles for insertion and care of devices, and isolation of patients with multi drug resistant organisms , . The skin of hospitalized patients is a reservoir for pathogens and invasion by skin flora is thought to be a mechanism contributing to healthcare associated infections.
Filling out personality measures takes time. First, development of an abbreviated measure can be a relatively laborious process. For example, a common strategy for abbreviating multi dimensional personality inventories is to select a subset of items from each scale that maximize item total correlations while maintaining high internal consistency ; however, this approach can inadvertently restrict the breadth of the abbreviated measure by failing to sample from the full breadth of the original domain .
Staphylococcus aureus, a persistent nasal colonizer in approximately one third of the human population , causes infections ranging from superficial skin lesions to life threatening syndromes such as endocarditis, osteomyelitis, toxic shock, and sepsis . Indeed, S. aureus is the second leading cause of healthcare associated bacteremia, accounting for ~13 % of such infections. Of note, the acquisition of nosocomial S. aureus bloodstream infections leads to extended length of hospital stay and increased antibiotic usage, costs, and mortality  .
  Participants were asked to make judgments about the probability of an air traffic conflict, a horizontal loss of separation of 5 nautical miles . All were paid and bonuses were awarded to top performers . A compass was displayed with the 40 nm circle.
Epithelial tubes enable the rapid distribution of liquids, gases, and circulating cells throughout the body. In larger tubes, multiple cells connected by junctions surround a common extracellular lumen . For example, vertebrate vascular endothelial cells form a lumen when cytoplasmic vesicles accumulate in a central region of the cell and fuse with one another, or fuse with an invading apical membrane domain .
Colonoscopy is the primary modality for prevention of colorectal cancer  per multisociety guidelines , and the cost effectiveness of CRC screening with colonoscopy is primarily dependent on high quality baseline examination and adherence to guideline recommendations for timing of repeat screening colonoscopy . When endoscopists report this and multiple other quality indicators, they receive a small bonus in Medicare payments. By 2014, failure to report will result in a reduction in Medicare payments.
Skin cancer is the most common cancer in the US . Targeting these molecular pathways has been demonstrated to hold promise for skin cancer prevention  . Overexpressing SIRT6 extends lifespans in male mice but not in female mice .
A recognized important component of the pathophysiology of hemorrhagic shock  is an increase in vascular permeability. This hyperpermeability is secondary to disruption of the microvascular endothelial cell barrier . Apoptosis is initiated either via the extrinsic “death ligand” pathway or the intrinsic “mitochondrial” pathway .
Temporal lobe epilepsy is the most common type of epilepsy in adults . In humans, basal dendrites normally extend into the hilus in 22 47% of granule cells . Granule cell basal dendrites are more frequent in schizophrenics , but that might be a side effect of treatment with neuroleptics, which stimulate granule cell neurogenesis .
Primary ovarian insufficiency , which is probably a more appropriate term for premature ovarian failure , is a disorder associated with female infertility affecting 1 2% of women under 40 years . The cause of the ovarian defect remains obscure in most of the patients with spontaneous POI but the genetic contribution is considered a significant aetiological component. BMP15 is an oocyte derived growth factor belonging to the Transforming Growth Factor beta  superfamily which is involved in follicular development as critical regulator of many granulosa cell processes .
With increasing participation in youth sports, there is an increasing desire for young athletes to achieve peak performance . Resistance training may be one of the most popular and effective forms of conditioning aimed at enhancing sports performance, and its use is widespread among high school, college, and professional athletes . However, resistance training in the young athlete has been controversial.
The respiratory system has evolved a potent ability of host defense against bacterial infection. Alveolar epithelial and immune cells, such as macrophages, are the critical components of innate immune system to recognize invading microbes and use inflammatory signals to concert an effective innate and adaptive immune response, , . Gram negative bacteria are commonly isolated from hospital acquired infection patients and can cause serious acute and chronic infections in susceptible individuals.
Recent reports suggest that up to 40% of patients who have a sagittal split ramus osteotomy  experience persistent  neurosensory alteration . Several authors have suggested that the anatomical position of the mandibular canal and surrounding bone quality before surgery may be related to the likelihood of nerve injury during an SSRO,. Others have suggested that the placement of osteotomy cuts and/or fixation placement may be important contributors to the possibility of nerve injury,.
As unintentional injuries continue to be the leading cause of hospitalization and death for toddlers between the ages of 1 and 4, the Centers for Disease Control in the United States has argued that child supervision is a key factor in reducing injuries and fatalities . Yet, according to injury prevention scholars, this key factor is not easily defined or measured . Then, her cell phone rang and she answered.
Malignant gliomas are the most common tumors in the central nervous system . Despite rapid improvements in imaging, surgery, adjuvant radiotherapy, and chemotherapy, the prognosis for patients with gliomas still remains dismal. Acquisition of malignant growth, insidious invasion, high neovascularization, and resistance to therapies by glioma cells involve multiple genetic alterations, such as epidermal growth factor receptor  overexpression, that activate various cellular signaling pathways .
Burn patients are at high risk for infection. Burn injury causes significant immune dysfunction, which might be attributable to burn induced apoptosis in immune organs., As the thymus degenerates with age in humans, the spleen plays a pivotal role in human immune defenses. This splenic dysfunction is recognized as an important factor in burn associated infections.
Tissue reperfusion following a period of ischemia triggers a complement dependent inflammatory reaction that culminates in necrotic and apoptotic cell death. established that following ischemia and reperfusion  of skeletal muscle, complement is activated by self reactive natural IgM antibodies  that bind to post ischemic tissue. Our recent studies have identified additional targets for self reactive natural Abs on post ischemic tissue, namely annexin IV and a subset of phospholipids that are expressed in the post ischemic intestine and brain , .
RNAs carry out a myriad of cellular functions, many of which require folding to specific structures. Thus, the sequences of these RNAs must encode functional structures that are stable enough to be populated at equilibrium and are kinetically accessible during folding. Because structured RNAs typically include base paired regions that form favorably even as isolated elements, globally unfolded conformations are generally not stable.
Cognitive dysfunction is a critical component of schizophrenia and a major predictor of impaired long term outcome . The present study utilizes event related potentials  and functional magnetic resonance imaging , along with behavior, to investigate mechanisms underlying perceptual closure impairments in schizophrenia . Perceptual closure refers to the ability of the brain to recognize an object even when presented with only fragmentary information.
B cell regulator of immunoglobulin heavy chain transcription  was the first eukaryotic member of the ARID  family of DNA binding proteins described  but its function in vivo has not been elucidated. While all contain a similar ARID sequence, only a few of the ARID3 subfamily members  bind specific DNA motifs, and gene targets have been identified for only a handful of those . Recently, we and other labs  have obtained data suggesting a role for Btk in transcription mediated processes including pathways that require Bright .
Since 1922, lifelong insulin replacement has been the mainstay of type 1 diabetes treatment. Efforts to generate surrogate insulin producing cells that could serve as a “permanent cure” of the disease have been underway for nearly two decades, and progress has been made toward the generation of pancreatic hormone producing cells from either embryonic stem or induced pluripotent stem cells . Although terminally differentiated β cells are only present in the pancreas, endocrine progenitors with similar features to pancreatic endocrine progenitors are also found in the intestine, the site of the body’s largest endocrine system.
Vaccinia virus  is a large DNA virus widely known for its use as a vaccine for the closely related variola virus, the causative agent of smallpox . Routine administration of this vaccine was stopped after smallpox was eradicated, however VV has been utilized for vaccination of selected high risk individuals such as some individuals serving in the military , and to study the disease mechanisms of smallpox. Inoculation typically results in a localized VV infection of keratinocytes at the inoculation site.
Nitrone spin traps are a class of synthetic chemicals specifically designed for trapping free radicals and making them more stable. Two commonly used nitrone spin traps are 5,5 dimethyl 1 pyrroline N oxide  and phenyl N tert butylnitrone . However, DMPO has been far less studied in this regard.
Since a predominant area of focus in the newly expanded antiretroviral therapy  era has been cardiovascular problems such as insulin resistance, hyperlipidemia, and fat redistribution, other emerging metabolic alterations have been, for the most part, neglected. For example, data indicate that ART carries the potential to alter calcium  metabolism  . Research shows that chronic heavy alcohol use can impair calcium absorption and affect calcium regulating hormones.
Pediatric low grade astrocytomas  encompass the most frequent primary brain tumors afflicting children. These alterations lead to increased downstream signaling pathways that have been found to be active in PLGA, particularly MAPK . Other PLGA subtypes have different alterations.
Acetaminophen  is one of the most widely used drugs to relieve mild to moderate pain and reduce fever . APAP is generally safe at therapeutic doses; however, an overdose of APAP may lead to severe liver damage . NAPQI depletes glutathione  and subsequently binds to liver proteins, leading to oxidative stress, mitochondrial dysfunction, and necrotic cell death  .
Juvenile idiopathic arthritis  is the most common rheumatic disease of childhood with an incidence of 2 to 20 per 100,000 children, and a prevalence of 16 to 150 per 100,000,. It is a chronic arthritis of unknown etiology with 7 subtypes  oligoarticular persistent, oligoarticular extended polyarticular rheumatoid factor  positive, polyarticular RF negative, systemic, psoriatic, enthesitis related, and undifferentiated JIA. Although JIA is the most commonly used classification scheme, other categorizations include juvenile rheumatoid arthritis  consisting of 3 subtypes  and juvenile chronic arthritis  with 4 subtypes  .
The main olfactory epithelium  of rodents comprises several cell types: ciliated olfactory sensory neurons  sending odorant information to the olfactory bulb, supporting cells that control the local ionic environment, and basal cells that proliferate to give rise to the different epithelial cells . Furthermore, multiple microvillous cells whose function is not well understood have been observed in the MOE of rodents and humans: 1) Microvillous OSNs with an axon projecting to the olfactory bulb  displaying a morphology similar to that of the microvillous sensory neurons of the vomeronasal organ  express the transient receptor channel C2  . 2) Microvillous cells that are not OSNs and lack a basal process/axon .
There is a resurgence of interest in the area of cancer metabolism, including understanding deregulated metabolic pathways, which confer growth advantages to tumors . One metabolic adaptation to energy metabolism in cancer is known as the Warburg Effect , where glycolysis readily occurs even in the presence of oxygen; this classical hallmark of cancer has been associated with the activity and expression of the key enzyme lactate dehydrogenase , where increased enzyme activity has been associated with more aggressive disease . There is a need, therefore, for robust assays of enzyme kinetics, historically carried out by spectrophotometric analysis ; however, the spectrophotometric assays cannot be performed on whole, viable cells and are consequently an indirect method of evaluating response to targeted therapies .
Entering its third decade, the HIV/AIDS epidemic continues to pose a major public health problem. As the number of persons who are infected with HIV continues to increase in Puerto Rico, the subjects of stigma and discrimination become important social issues that need to be addressed. Stigma may be defined as a social process or related personal experience characterized by exclusion, rejection, blame or devaluation that result from either the experience or the reasonable anticipation of an adverse social judgment about a person or group .
1,3 Butadiene  is a petrochemical used in production of synthetic rubber and plastics. BD, which is also present in motor vehicle exhaust emissions  and cigarette smoke  , has been classified by the National Toxicology Program as “known to be a human carcinogen” . Lymphocytic and myelogenous leukemias and non Hodgkin's lymphomas have been associated with human occupational exposure .
Primates have a large representation of the oral cavity, especially of the teeth and tongue, in the primary somatosensory cortex . Much like the hand, representations of different parts of the oral cavity and face have been found in multiple areas of somatosensory and motor cortex. Microelectrode mapping studies have shown, at least in part, orderly arrangements of the responses to stimulation of the oral cavity and face in somatosensory areas including 3b, 3a, 1, 2, the second somatosensory area , and parietal ventral area  in Old World macaques  and New World monkeys .
It was previously believed that corneal allograft rejection was solely mediated by CD4+ Th1 immune responses. In the classical T helper cell paradigm, type 2 T helper cells  secrete IL 4, IL 5 and IL 13, as well as other cytokines, which cross regulate Th1 cytokines, thereby suppressing clonal expansion of Th1 cells . Thus, it has been proposed that tilting the alloimmune response toward a Th2 pathway favors corneal allograft survival .
Natural killer  cells can kill cancer cells in the absence of prior stimulation and hold considerable potential for cell based therapies targeting human malignancies . This notion is corroborated by the observation that, among patients with leukemia undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation, the antileukemic effect of the transplant was significantly greater when the donor NK cells exhibited a killer inhibitory receptor  profile that predicted a higher cytotoxicity against the leukemic cells of the recipient . Moreover, allogeneic NK cells might be beneficial when directly infused into patients, a procedure that was shown to induce clinical remission in patients with high risk acute myeloid leukemia  .
Invasive weeds that colonize agricultural fields cost millions of dollars in crop losses and weed control measures every year. For example, rapid growth, deep roots, high seed production and increased seed dispersal allow weeds to acquire more resources, as well as to produce more offspring . Efficient seed dispersal, in particular, may be a trait crucial to weed fitness.
Gigantism, a rare condition that causes abnormal growth in children, often has a genetic etiology. Indeed, cases running in a family were first reported in the late 19th century . Growth hormone  secreting pituitary adenomas and/or hyperplasia are the main causes of gigantism in childhood.
An important aspect in the fabrication of microscale systems is the ability to control wetting and surface tension of fluids by defining regions of hydrophilicity. Plasma treatment is widely used for creating hydrophilic surfaces and patterns, and for chemically functionalizing the surface. It involves exposing surfaces to reactive ionized atoms that are then incorporated into the surfaces as various chemical species.
Metanephric adenoma  is a benign, often asymptomatic and incidentally identified renal tumor comprised of primitive metanephric tubular cells . Patients commonly present in the fifth to sixth decade of life, and there is a slight female preponderance . Grossly, MA is usually a solid, solitary, unilateral mass that lacks a true fibrous capsule.
The family of mammalian toll like receptors  includes at least 10 members that sense the presence of pathogenic microorganisms and injury induced endogenous ligands . Activation of TLRs mediates innate immune responses through nuclear factor κB  and interferon regulatory factor  dependent pathways . IRF 5 is mainly activated following TLR2 activation while other IRFs such as IRF3 are more specific for TLR3 and TLR4 activation .
Proline rich tyrosine kinase 2  is a focal adhesion kinase  related protein, also known as calcium dependent tyrosine kinase , cellular adhesion kinase β, related adhesion focal tyrosine kinase , or FAK2 . Nevertheless, Pyk2 can functionally replace FAK in biological processes where FAK is limited. In addition, Pyk2 and Src family PTKs  combine to promote fibronectin  stimulated signaling events that promote activation of extracellular signal regulated kinase 2  in the absence of FAK, and Pyk2 tyrosine phosphorylation is enhanced by fibronectin  stimulation of FAK cells, but not in FAK+ cells .
C. albicans, in healthy people, resides as a commensal microorganism. However, in immunocompromized patients it becomes an opportunistic fungal pathogen, capable of causing mucosal, cutaneous, and systemic infections including oropharyngeal candidiasis . OPC remains a significant cause of morbidity despite the use of effective antiretroviral therapy  .
The functional imaging technique Intrinsic Signal Optical Imaging ; ; ; for a recent review see ) using red illumination is commonly employed for mapping cortical activity and plays an important role in furthering our understanding of brain function and organization. The detected ISOI signal evoked by a brief stimulus is slow in onset , long in duration , and, at least in the rat , is comprised of three signal phases consisting of a dip in signal below baseline followed by an overshoot in signal above baseline and another dip below baseline . Capture of the entire signal is not necessary; rather, the ISOI initial dip is better suited and preferentially exploited for successful ISOI mapping of brain function.
Young adulthood is characterized by important life transitions, often including migration from one’s parents’ home and sexual debut. Although some observers have noted that migration away from one’s home could influence sexual debut, such pathways have seldom been investigated using methodological tools that can reduce the influence of important confounders . Early age at first sex has important negative consequences, including school dropout , increased risk of unwanted pregnancy , and sexually transmitted infections .
The process of tumorigenesis, previously thought to stem primarily from genetic changes within transformed cells, is now known to also depend on extracellular signals from non cancerous cells present in the tumor microenvironment  . Among the normal cells that contribute to the TME are bone marrow derived myeloid cells whose function and contribution to neoplastic growth has been best understood . Within the bone marrow microenvironment, BMMSC and osteoblasts provide a supportive niche for homing of hematopoietic stem cells  and tumor cells which promotes quiescence and survival .
Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  is a neurodegenerative disorder that primarily affects lower motor neurons resulting in progressive muscle atrophy that eventually leads to respiratory failure and death within 15 years . About 20% of these inherited cases are caused by missense mutations in the Cu/Zn superoxide dismutase gene resulting in an adverse gain of function of the SOD1 protein . Epidemiological and experimental findings suggest that individuals with high levels of energy expenditure and/or low levels of energy intake may be at increased risk for ALS .
Collagen type I from skin and tendon is highly conserved teleologically, and has optimal compatibility as a biomaterial. For these reasons, collagen has served as the fundamental component in a wide variety of engineered tissues, including skin, bone, blood vessels, tracheae, and nerve   . Pore size can be optimized for cellular attachment, migration and proliferation by several different methods including, but not limited to, lyophilization, electrospinning or solvent casting ,  .
High rates of injury incidence related to sports and recreation in children aged 1014 years  identify adolescence as a potential period of childhood development in which children may be at an amplified risk for such injuries. Regular participation in physical activity improves strength, prevents obesity and increases self esteem. In order to minimise healthcare costs and optimally assist children in becoming healthy, active adults, efforts must be made to identify factors that increase sports  and recreation related injury susceptibility during adolescence and to devise and implement prevention programmes to target modifiable risk factors .
Magnetic resonance angiography  is a useful tool in the diagnosis of vascular diseases and the monitoring of their treatment. Contrast enhanced MRA is fast, but it requires the injection of potentially harmful contrast agents . On the other hand, flow independent angiography  exploits the inherent MR properties  of the tissues .
Tumor necrosis factor  related apoptosis inducing ligand , a potent death ligand that preferentially induces apoptosis in transformed cells, is under evaluation as an anti cancer agent in humans, . TRAIL initiates apoptosis signaling cascades by ligating two death receptors, death receptor 4   and death receptor 5   . Differences in signaling between the two receptors have not been identified to date, although DR4 selectively mediates apoptosis in chronic lymphocytic leukemia cells while DR5 appears to mediate TRAIL cytotoxicity in epithelial derived malignancies .
Natural killer  cells defined by CD56 expression and the absence of CD3 comprise 1015% of peripheral blood lymphocytes. They also reside in spleen, bone marrow, lymph nodes, liver, intestine and the pregnant uterus. In order to protect healthy tissues, NK cells are under a constant inhibition delivered by engagement of inhibitory receptors, which recognize ‘self’ class 1 human leukocyte antigens  .
Scientific interest in one carbon metabolism  and cancer risk is increasing. OCM denotes a metabolic system made up of interdependent pathways that involve the transfer of one carbon units for numerous biosynthetic reactions relevant to DNA synthesis, repair, and methylation . The primary component of the system is folate, and the transfer reactions involve conversions between several of its forms.
In nuclear medicine imaging it is essential to find a balance between diagnostic quality of the images, which can, in principle, be improved by longer acquisition times, with the need to reduce acquisition time or injected activity. In the process, we provide some theoretical and experimental results that shed light on the important issues that determine the tradeoff for other applications . Human and mathematical observer studies and ROC analysis are powerful tools for optimizing and evaluating image quality for a variety of applications .
Catheter ablation is finding increasing use in modern medicine. Current ablation strategies include thermal ablation , ethanol injection and photodynamic therapy. Characteristic of all approaches is the indiscriminant destruction of both cells and extra cellular structures within the ablated volume.
The theoretical foundations of speech comprehension and production modeling date back to the nineteenth century when it was observed that language disorders resulted from lesions to particular cortical regions . These observations led to the first modeling frameworks that linked independent brain regions with speech comprehension and production . Since that time, pioneering human electrical stimulation studies mapping cortical representations of the speech articulators  and investigations on patients with stroke related lesions  have elaborated initial theories, providing greater detail into the functional segregation of brain regions involved in speech production and perception.
It has been shown that the traditional biomedical approach is insufficient for understanding chronic pain. , Global distress measures do not permit a precise investigation of this distinction. Moreover, behavioral assessments not based on self report can provide an objective measure to differentiate the two clusters.
Malignant rhabdoid tumor  is a rare and extremely aggressive childhood cancer. MRT was initially described as an unfavorable histologic type of pediatric renal tumor, a variant of Wilms’ tumor . Despite significant advances in the treatment and outcome of other pediatric tumors, for MRTs diagnosed before the age of 6 months, patient survival at 4 years drops to approximately 8.8% .
Corynebacterium jeikeium is a clinically important opportunisticpathogen capable of causing a wide range of disorders including endocarditis, septicemia,joint infection, pneumonia, osteomyelitis, meningitis, and soft tissue infection , particularly inimmunocompromised patients or those with indwelling medical devices. It is recognized as themost frequently recovered medically significant Corynebacterium speciesamong patients in intensive care facilities, with the capacity for nosocomial dissemination . Previous work  hassought to investigate the range of genomic, physiological, and phenotypic differencesdisplayed by this organism.
Aging issues in cancer are becoming more prominent as age projections suggest the number of geriatric cancer patients will increase in the next 20 to 30 years. Currently, the elderly comprise 61% of cancer survivors, while 60% of new cancer diagnoses and 70% of cancer deaths occur in people over the age of 65. Physically healthy older individuals experience significant levels of depression .
Prostate cancer  is the most common cancer in elderly men with one out of six men afflicted with this malignancy in the United States . The initial line of treatment for PCA involves limiting systemic testosterone levels which is effective initially; however, the malignancy resurfaces as an androgen independent/hormone refractory stage of PCA . In spite of improvements in diagnostic and treatment strategies for PCA, prognosis remains poor at advanced stages  suggesting that newer strategies are still required to control PCA.
Smoking blends containing high efficacy synthetic cannabinoids  have recently emerged as popular substitutes for cannabis. Commercial preparations of these products are readily available, heavily marketed toward young people, perceived as safe, and not easily detected in drug screens . Like Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol , the primary psychoactive constituent of marijuana, the synthetic compounds in these smoking products are presumed to elicit their psychoactive effects by activating CB1 cannabinoid receptors  in the CNS, although many of these compounds possess much higher efficacy than Δ9 THC .
The bipotent population of cells that give rise to both cortical  aswell as medullary epithelial  cells that participate in the maintenance ofself tolerance within the organism  has received much attention in recent years. By embryonic day twelve, E12, the structural morphology ofthe thymus becomes visible, with the initial separation of the cortex and themedulla . The cells that comprise the cortex orthe medulla can be distinguished by their cytoplasmic keratin profiles .
Injuries from trauma continue to be the leading cause of death for persons less than 45 years of age in the U.S. . Despite recent advances in trauma and critical care, as well as an improved understanding of the basic pathophysiology of severe trauma and its sequelae, morbidity and mortality, especially later following trauma, remain high . Although it is generally accepted that murine models do not fully recapitulate the human condition in its entirety, they remain the mainstay for invasive and interventional studies in trauma and burns .
Methamphetamine  is one of the most commonly abused drugs in the U.S. Approximately 10.4 million Americans 12 years of age or older have used MA for non medical reasons at least once in their lifetimes . MA is a functional dopamine agonist  and its effects may last for hours, adding to its potent addictive qualities.
Compromised energy metabolism in brain cells is believed to play a pivotal role in the dysfunction and degeneration of neurons that occurs in disorders such as stroke and Alzheimer's disease . As a major excitatory neurotransmitter, glutamate and glutamate receptors are essential for the normal function of nervous system. However, during pathological conditions with impaired energy metabolism such as cerebral ischemia, membrane depolarization results in excessive release of glutamate from the synaptic vesicles of injured neurons.
A link between the ABO blood group system and malaria susceptibility has long been suspected. Significant associations between blood group and P. falciparum malaria have been reported from cross sectional and case control studies in Brazil, Gabon, India, Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe  ). However other studies in Colombia, India, Sudan and Nigeria could not find an association between malaria and blood group .
Previous implementation of 3D Single Breath hold Chemical Shift Imaging  in humans has already been demonstrated for evaluating hyperpolarized xenon 129  distribution in multiple lung compartments in healthy subjects and in subjects with cystic fibrosis . Here, we report the application of this technique for assessing, in a regional manner, pulmonary ventilation and gas uptake exchange in lung tissue and in the red blood cells  in smokers and second hand smokers . Eight subjects enrolled in this study underwent 3D SB CSI, .
The lifetime risk of colorectal cancer  in Western populations is about 5 6%, with annual incidence rates of 48 50 per 100,000 population. Screening colonoscopy holds great promise for primary prevention of CRC by enabling direct visualization and removal of precancerous polyps. One academic medical center reported zero CRC incidence among persons without adenomas at initial colonoscopy over 5.34 years of mean follow up.
Plants produce thousands of phenolic compounds, which play roles in plant development and interactions with microbes . Among these are hydroxycinnamic acids , which are monocyclic phenylpropanoid molecules. Roots exude HCAs and related phenolics to chelate metals, thereby facilitating uptake and transport of metals in the xylem sap .
Adoptive transfer of human hematopoietic stem cells  into immunodeficient mice that lack T cells, B cells and natural killer  cells can lead to stable engraftment of human HSCs . Differentiation of the transferred HSCs gives rise to different lineages of human blood cells in the recipient mice, which are often referred to as humanized mice. In humanized mice, human B cells and T cells are the most abundantly reconstituted cell types among all blood lineage cells.
Autism spectrum disorder  is a heterogeneous disorder with significant genotypic and phenotypic complexity . The genetic etiology of ASD is no less varied. Over 100 genes and genomic regions have been associated with ASD , and over 800 genes have been suggested to play a role in ASD .
Antigen presenting cells  play a central role in the induction of T cell activation as well as T cell tolerance. IL 10, a cytokine with immunosuppressive properties, has been shown to be critical in the generation of APCs with tolerogenic properties and in the prevention of self tissue damage. Important transcriptional regulators of IL 10 include STAT3, Sp1, AP 1, NFκB, C/EBPβ, and GATA3.
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer related deathin the United States  when men and women are considered together . The estimated fraction of CRC attributed toinherited predisposition ranges between 1030% . In March 2012, Ambry Genetics Corporation  was thefirst clinical laboratory to offer hereditary cancer panel based testing in theUnited States ; subsequently, other laboratories have started offering cancerpanels.
Phenotype driven screens of mutagenized populations of cells underlie much of the advances made in modern genetic research in the last century . Such endeavors, however, were limited mostly to lower organisms. Although regional or genome wide mutagenesis and phenotypic screens have been carried out in mice by several large laboratories, the operational burden in cost and time was extremely high.
Normal heart rhythms originate in the sinoatrial node. HCN encoded funny current  and the Kir2 encoded inward rectifier  counteract each other by respectively oscillating and stabilizing the negative resting membrane potential, controlling action potential firing. Therefore, IK1 suppression and If overexpression have been independently exploited to convert cardiomyocytes  into AP firing bioartificial pacemakers.
The thymus provides a unique inductive microenvironment for the maturation of bone marrow derived precursor cells into the immunocompetent T lymphocytes. The molecular mechanisms exerted by thymic nonlymphoid cells, which govern the process of thymocyte maturation, have been studied in greater detail and largely elucidated in recent time . Additionally, it has been shown that the interactions between nonlymphoid cells of the thymic warp and maturing thymocytes are bidirectional: the latter cells control the maturation of respective nonlymphoid cells and induce the formation of microenvironmental niches for their own development .
Earlier, we reported syntheses of ethyl β D galactopyranosyl  2′ deoxy 2′ fluoro β D glucopyranoside  and 1′ fluoroethyl β D lactose  for positron emission tomography  of pancreatic carcinoma. Et FDL requires a precursor, which involves 11 steps to synthesize and produces overall low yields. Synthesis of precursors for  FEL requires four steps, but those precursors produced low radiochemical yields.
Lateral interactions mediated by local interneurons  are ubiquitous in neural networks. In insects, olfactory receptor neurons  on the antennae detect specific suites of odors and send this information to the primary olfactory neuropil in the insect brain, the antennal lobe . In the AL, ORN axonal terminals innervate spheroidal neuropil called glomeruli.
Breast cancer is the most prevalent cancer diagnosis in women. It is a significant cause of mortality and morbidity in the United States, with an estimated 182,460 new cases of invasive breast cancer and 40,480 new deaths in the year 2008  . Steady improvements in the survival rates of patients with breast cancer have been observed in recent years.
Lung cancer is the world’s leading cause of cancer death, and non small cell lung cancer  accounts for 8085% of lung cancer cases. Cisplatin  or carboplatin based combinations are generally used in metastatic NSCLC, and yield median survival times  of 810 months. The Wingless type protein  signaling pathway helps maintain cancer stem cells, and signals through the major  Wnt pathway via β catenin and through various secondary  pathways., This ultimately leads to expression of cyclin D1,, c Myc, and other target genes .
Defects in formation of the human brain are common, devastating birth defects. Neural tube closure defects and microcephaly both occur at frequencies of approximately one in 1000 live births . Both genetic and environmental factors contribute to these conditions.
Excess of glucocorticoids , either endogenous as in aging or due to glucocorticoid administration as immunosuppressants, leads to loss of bone . Approximately 25% of patients also develop osteonecrosis due to accumulation of apoptotic osteocytes, which increases the risk of femoral head collapse . Thus, understanding the mechanisms of GC action on bone cells and designing therapeutic strategies that prevent the deleterious effects of these drugs is imperative .
Ricin is a heterodimeric toxin which inactivates ribosomes. It consists of two disulfide linked subunits, an A chain  and a B chain , each with a molecular weight of 3032 kDa. Inexpensively manufactured small molecule inhibitors of ricin have also been studied and are promising when tested in vitro.
Organogenesis integrates signaling, proliferation, patterning and structural processes to generate the variety of forms and functions essential to viability. This tubular outgrowth of the larval tracheal system is induced during the third instar  period by Bnl/FGF expressed in the wing imaginal disc. Within sixteen hours of its induction, the ASP grows from a simple epithelial bud to a sac with many cells and with a distinct stalk and tip.
Military service can have positive as well as negative consequences  and both short term and long term effects. The psychosocial stress experienced by veterans with a history of active combat has both psychological and physical components. Approximately 65% of American men over the age of 55 served in World War II or the Korean conflict and about 25% of older American men were exposed to combat early in their lives.
Parkinson’s disease  is one of the most common neurodegenerative diseases in the world, affecting nearly 1.8% of people above 65 years of age in Europe . The major clinical symptoms of this disease are rigidity, bradykinesia, tremor, and postural instability caused by selective degeneration of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra in the midbrain with proteinaceous Lewy body inclusions in surviving cells. Although PD is a sporadic disease in most cases, various hereditary forms have similar clinical phenotypes to those of sporadic PD.
Mounting evidence has shown that a significant proportion of pelvic high grade serous carcinomas  arise from a non invasive occult carcinoma in the distal fallopian tube, designated “serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma ”. STICs have been identified in 1015% of prophylactic salpingo oophorectomy specimens from women with germline BRCA mutations, , and in the tubal fimbriae from up to 60% of women with sporadic ovarian HGSC. Complete microscopic sectioning of fallopian tubes has also revealed focal proliferations of morphologically normal secretory cells that show diffuse p53 immunoreactivity, termed “p53 signatures,” which may represent early clonal expansions of tumour initiating cells .
In 20092010, 17% of United States  children ages 219 years were obese, with greater odds of obesity among black and Hispanic children. The percentage of US children ages 017 years with at least one parent born outside the US grew from 15% in 1994 to 23% in 2011. Though little is known about the influence of having a non US born parent on obesity related behaviors in childhood,  designing appropriate interventions for these children will be key to addressing racial/ethnic disparities.
The hepatitis C virus  is an important human pathogen, infecting an estimated 120 180 million individuals worldwide. Although HCV is recognized and targeted by innate, cellular, and humoral immune mechanisms, persistent infection is common. The major site of HCV replication is the liver.
Each year, nearly 400,000 Americans ages 65 and older are hospitalized for pneumonia .Pneumonia is the third most common cause of hospitalization among Americans 6584 years old, and the second most common among those over age 85 . Nearly 11% of older adults hospitalized for pneumonia die within 30 days of hospitalization , and approximately half die within one year . Beyond increased mortality, hospitalization for pneumonia may raise the risk of subsequent cognitive and functional decline .
Scaffold design is important in tissue engineering due to its role in supporting cell attachment and growth, assisting exchanges of nutrients/oxygen and metabolite wastes, and eventually facilitating the formation of a functional tissue/organ. Many parameters need to be considered for scaffold design: pore size, porosity, interconnectivity, surface properties, and mechanical properties, among others . Many research groups have demonstrated that incorporation of HAp nanoparticles and Ap coating could enhance preosteoblast differentiation and mineral secretion.
A small for gestational age  neonate is usually defined as one whose birth weight is below the 10th percentile for gestational age.
