Consistent with these biological distinctions, some epidemiologic studies have reported that histologic subtypes of breast cancer differ in their associations with established breast cancer risk factors  .
The insulin like growth factor II receptor  is a transmembrane receptor that primarily binds IGF II, resulting in the degradation of IGF II by internalization and transport to the lysosomes. By removing IGF II from the extracellular environment and precluding its activation of the insulin like growth factor I receptor , IGF2R is believed to reduce the mitogenic effects of IGF II . Loss of heterozygosity at the IGF2R locus has been reported in breast carcinomas, and somatic missense mutations of the remaining allele have shown alteration in ligand binding .
A prior localized inflammatory response  or a period of unpredictable sound stress  produce long term changes in the duration and second messenger signaling pathway for inflammatory mediator induced mechanical hyperalgesia. This change involves a switch from Gs to Gi in the G protein that mediates inflammatory mediator induced mechanical hyperalgesia . While this type of switch in second messenger signaling pathways, from Gs to Gi, has previously been reported for β2 adrenergic receptor  signaling in cardiac myocytes, caused by chronic exposure to receptor agonists such as epinephrine , in cardiac muscle cells this involves an increased Gi mediated inhibition of adenylyl cyclase, which would be expected to attenuate rather than enhance mechanical hyperalgesia .
Perhaps the largest public health initiative in the western world has focused on improvement of diet, particularly in those with a high risk of cardiovascular disease. Trials have shown that diets rich in fruits and vegetables reduce blood pressure ; and adverse cardiovascular events . This nitrite is swallowed and in the acidic environment of the stomach is reduced to nitric oxide  or re enters the circulation as nitrite.
Peer and parental influences have long been noted as key socialization forces affecting adolescent development. Adolescence is a critical time period during which youth form friendships, and simultaneously engage in substance use behaviors such as cigarette smoking within their peer networks. It is also a time during which the initiation and subsequent fueling of long term smoking trajectories occur , as most adult smokers begin in adolescence .
The process of T cell activation in secondary lymphoid organs  is accompanied by the up regulation of several different adhesion proteins and chemokine receptors associated with recruitment to sites of inflammation in peripheral tissues . The α4β7 integrin and CCR9 are associated with specific homing of CD4  and CD8  T cells to the gut, and the ligands for P selectin and E selectin  have been associated with CD4  and CD8  T cell homing to the skin. Several studies have sought to understand how the site of T cell priming influences their expression of homing receptors.
One in every 50 children undergoes a surgical procedure in their first year of life. A large body of evidence, predominantly from laboratory studies of healthy animals and to a lesser extent from children that had surgical procedures under general anesthesia at an early postnatal age, suggests that general anesthesia administered during the early postnatal period may have negative long term consequences for brain development . The mechanisms that mediate these developmental changes and the full spectrum of pathophysiological alterations induced by neonatal anesthesia, currently predominantly linked to the brain, are poorly understood .
Traumatic brain injury  is a leading cause of death and disability for over 1.5 million Americans annually . Current medical therapies do not adequately control cerebral edema and the effectiveness of invasive neurosurgical approaches to alleviate brain swelling remains limited. These shortcomings emphasize the need for novel approaches to limit post traumatic edema .
Tissue engineering approaches to skeletal muscle regeneration using both in vitro and in vivo means have been met with limited success, largely due to an inability to provide adequate vascularization. We have previously identified a method by which prevascular tissues are formed from scaffold free self assembly of human endothelial and fibroblast cells,. To evaluate the anastomotic potential of these prevascular tissue constructs and their ability to facilitate skeletal muscle repair, tissue constructs were implanted into hind limb muscle defects in athymic mice and immune competent rats, a model we have used previously to investigate muscle regeneration,, .
Previous research has demonstrated that a relationship exists between external bone size and tissue level mechanical properties . Further, variation in tissue modulus among individuals was shown to arise through modulation of both mineralization and porosity . Specifically, slender tibiae  had a lower porosity and higher ash content than more robust tibiae .
Despite advances in modern chemotherapy, CLL remains incurable. These include ‘spontaneous’ remission of the disease during increased immunity , responses to α interferons  and the graft versus leukemia effect following allogeneic stem cell transplant . CLL may, therefore, be an ideal disease for immunotherapeutic approaches.
The hepatitis C virus  infects 3% of the world population and is mainly responsible for liver transplantation in patients with cirrhosis in developed countries . Furthermore, HCV is the most common chronic blood borne pathogen in the United States  affecting 1.8% of the population and is the major etiologic factor responsible for the recent doubling of hepatocellular carcinoma   . HCV is an RNA virus classified in the genus Hepacivirus in the Flavivirus family and possesses an approximately 10kb positive sense RNA genome.
Human embryonic stem cells  are derived from the inner cell mass of the blastocyst stage of development, characterized by a unique capacity for indefinite self renewal, while maintaining an ability to differentiate into specialized cells . The switch from self renewing to quiescent cellular status is particularly evident during liver morphogenesis when ESCs differentiate into quiescent hepatocytes . Because 7080% of the cytoplasmic liver mass is composed of hepatocytes, much attention has been focused on directing the differentiation of hESCs into hepatocytes in vitro, in an effort to generate cells suitable for replacing damaged liver tissue in patients with acute liver failure or chronic end stage liver disease.
Oxford Houses are democratically run recovery home systems that serve over 10,000 individuals in the United States . The democratic, self run property of Oxford Houses differentiates them from many recovery models; instead of employing staff to manage day to day house operations, house members elect house officials to take on these responsibilities. There are no limits on how long a resident can stay in a house.
The production of new neurons in the adult mammalian brain is predominantly restricted to two areas, the subventricular zone  and the hippocampal subgranular zone  . Whether neurogenesis continues in the normal adult cerebral cortex, either from SVZ neural stem cells  , or from intrinsic neural progenitors within cortex  remains controversial , though formation of new cortical interneurons from subventricular zone or intrinsic cortical progenitors following cerebral injury has been well documented . In the present study, we provide genetic fate mapping evidence for the de novo formation of glutamatergic pyramidal neurons from oligodendroglial progenitor cells  within the normal adult murine piriform cortex .
Acute pancreatitis  was once considered an uncommon disease of childhood. Most children with pancreatitis have a single, mild, acute episode that resolves without complications. However, a subset of children with AP develops recurrent episodes of acute pancreatitis  and some progress to chronic pancreatitis .
Huntington’s disease  is a progressive neurodegenerative disease caused by an expansion of a CAG repeat in the Huntingtin  gene . Although the disease is monogenic and the etiology is known, there is no current treatment . Since then, it has been shown that short hairpin RNA  delivered by viral vectors leads to a decrease in Htt protein and associated pathology ; however, shRNAs can be toxic when integrated into the genome .
Overweight and obesity are common, affecting more than 1.1 billion individuals worldwide. In several industrialised countries, approximately two thirds of the adult population is classified as overweight or obese on the basis of having a body mass index  in excess of 25 kg/m2. In addition to reducing life expectancy, excess weight is an independent risk factor for a wide spectrum of chronic disorders, in particular, type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease  and some site specific cancers.
A fundamental question in developmental biology is the degree to which embryogenesis is stereotyped versus stochastic. This is indicated by the non deterministic nature of many fate maps , the partially stochastic nature of many developmental processes  and the remarkable regulative and plastic properties of some of these embryos  . Fate mapping with single cell resolution is not straightforward in vertebrate embryos and other embryos with large cell numbers, so it is possible that their cell lineages and movements may be more stereotyped than currently believed, or that hidden patterns may emerge from finer scale analysis.
Recent decades have seen substantial increases in the prevalence and severity of asthma, a complex inflammatory disorder of the airways. For instance, a large percentage of asthmatics are atopic, with elevated serum immunoglobulin E ; others have no evidence of atopy. Given that individuals with severe asthma display not only severe AHR, but also robust neutrophilia and increased IL 17A production, it has been postulated that aberrant IL 17A production may drive severe forms of the disease.
The spliceosome is a highly dynamic RNA protein machine requiring the ordered binding and release of 5 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein particles  to the intron containing pre mRNA. Aside from the binding of the U1 snRNP to the 5′ splice site, each step in this dynamic cycle requires ATP and one or more DExD/H RNA dependent ATPases, a large protein family whose members share a ∼300 amino acid domain with eight highly conserved sequence motifs,. The founding member of this family is eIF4A, a DEAD box protein that is thought to use the energy of ATP hydrolysis to unwind base paired RNAs.
The normal, alert conscious state is critical for functioning in the real world. Patients with temporal lobe seizures, a common form of epilepsy, often experience transient episodes of impaired consciousness, with major negative impact on quality of life . However, the mechanisms of impaired consciousness in temporal lobe seizures are not well understood.
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  comprise a diverse family of ligand gated ion channels  that are expressed throughout the vertebrate central and peripheral nervous systems. Twelve neuronal nAChR subunits have been identified . Subunit composition determines the localization and the physiological and pharmacological properties of each receptor subtype.
Aging and atherosclerosis are accompanied by geometric, material, and consequentially, deformational changes in arteries. For example, age is correlated with a decrease in elastin content in the abdominal aorta concomitant with increased diameter, and increased stiffness as evidenced by decreased diametric pulsatility and increased pulse propagation speed . Additionally, these effects may be exacerbated by added tissue stiffening resulting from the process of atherosclerosis .
Elevated triglyceride , low high density lipoprotein cholesterol , and elevated small, dense low density lipoprotein particles  have been established as important risk factors for cardiovascular diseases  . Several studies have revealed ethnic difference in the variation in lipid/lipoprotein traits . In contrast, Asians had higher TG and lower HDL c than whites despite the lower body mass index  .
Netrin 1 is a secreted molecule that is largely known to play a defined role in guiding vertebrate commissural axons in neuronal development . At least eight netrin receptors have been characterized in neurons, vascular system and other cell types in mammals. Netrin 1 binding to DCC mediates attractive outgrowth of axons, as well as positive angiogenic signalings in endothelial and vascular smooth muscle cells .
Developing new cancer drugs is an endeavor with a high probability of failure and extraordinary costs. One tactic used to accelerate new cancer drug discovery is to focus on compounds that have anti cancer effects and are already FDA approved for non cancer indications. A candidate for this drug development paradigm may be metformin.
It is increasingly appreciated that among cigarette smokers, those with schizophrenia have elevated rates of smoking  compared to the general population  . Many cognitive deficits are present in patients with schizophrenia, including deficits in attention , executive function  verbal memory  and spatial working memory . Prepulse inhibition , an operationalized measure of sensorimotor gating , is also deficient in schizophrenia, and thought to be associated with dysfunction in the dopamine projections from the ventral tegmental area to the PFC  .
Hair cells  and supporting cells  in the sensory epithelium of the inner ear arise from a common progenitor . Recent evidence suggests that Notch pathway proteins play a role in keeping SCs in their phenotypic state in mammals and prevent them from becoming HCs via a process of lateral inhibition  . The Notch pathway determines initial specification and subsequent cell fate of sensory progenitors .
Atherosclerosis, a major cause of stroke and myocardial infarction, is an inflammatory process. Recent research has sought to identify inflammatory risk factors that may predict risk of downstream clinical complications associated with atheromatous plaque formation. Atherosclerotic lesions are initiated by endothelial damage, leading to an upregulation of adhesion molecules that recruit both monocytes and lymphocytes into the subendothelial space, where monocytes become macrophages.
Excessive alcohol drinking is a leading cause of chronic liver disease worldwide, which results in a spectrum of liver disorders, ranging from simple fatty liver to more severe forms of liver injury such as alcoholic hepatitis, cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma. , Fatty liver is the earliest response to alcohol drinking and occurs in almost everyone who drinks heavily, while more severe forms of alcoholic liver injury typically develop in up to 35% of heavy drinkers. , More severe forms of alcoholic liver disease such as alcoholic hepatitis require treatment.
Distraction osteogenesis  is a technique for skeletal expansion that uses the body’s natural healing capacity to form bone in response to mechanical tension across an osteotomy. During the active distraction phase, a network of hematoma and fibrous tissue develops followed by the appearance of nests of cartilage and finally bone. As the callus consolidates, there is progressive replacement of fibrous tissue, hematoma and cartilage with trabecular bone.
Despite recent progress in our understanding of iron absorption, iron deficiency remains the most prevalent micronutrient deficiency worldwide. Whereas dietary calcium is known to reduce the bioavailability of iron , the molecular basis of this interaction is not understood. Divalent metal ion transporter 1   is the principal or only mechanism by which nonheme iron is taken up at the intestinal brush border , reviewed .
The migration of lung DCs to lymph nodes  is critical for orchestrating adaptive immune responses against inhaled antigens or microbes . Under homeostatic conditions, CCR7 dependent migration of lung DCs to draining LN is important for the induction of regulatory T cells, which help maintain peripheral tolerance to innocuous environmental antigens . Because migratory DCs play a central role in shaping immune responses in the lungs, manipulating Ccr7 expression is a potential strategy for either augmenting or suppressing adaptive immunity.
For large segments of the population, the internet has become a primary source of information on a broad range of health issues and a means of communication. This development provides a unique opportunity for epidemiologic research, in particular the conduct of prospective cohort studies. The attraction of using the internet for recruitment of an epidemiologic cohort stems mainly from cost efficiency and convenience for study participants .
Rotavirus  is the most common cause of severe dehydrating diarrheal disease in young children worldwide, causing up to 100 million cases and > 600,000 deaths each year . RV infections are also common in adults, especially those who interact with children, but generally cause only mild symptoms . RV, a member of the Reoviridae family of viruses, is a non enveloped double  stranded  RNA virus containing three concentric protein layers .
The pigmentation of amphibian eggs and cleavage stage embryos differs dramatically from species to species, but the species can be generally categorized as having pigmented or unpigmented eggs. Essentially nothing is known about the cell biological mechanisms of animal hemisphere pigmentation in amphibians or about how such mechanism may be modified during evolution to achieve the interspecific variation in pigmentation patterns. The specific pathway that directs the accumulation of pigmentation in the animal cortex in Xenopus is not well understood.
The deposition of amyloid β  in the extracellular space of the brain is a pathological hallmark of Alzheimer's disease . These cells are responsible for normal tissue maintenance and continually sample the extracellular environment. Additionally, they take up solutes and nutrients through endocytosis  .
Intracerebral hemorrhage  is a common and often fatal stroke subtype that burdens approximately 1 in 5000 people every year  for which there is no treatment. Red blood cell, a main cellular component of the hematoma, lyses within days and releases hemoglobin , which subsequently is degraded into heme and iron, cytotoxins representing key contributor to secondary brain injury after ICH . In agreement with this scheme, intra cerebral injection of lysed erythrocytes or purified Hb produces massive brain edema within less than 24h .
Practice protocols that mandate prescreening for sexually transmitted infection prior to insertion of an intrauterine device for contraception can pose obstacles for women seeking this highly effective method of birth control. Some practices screen for presumed risk factors for sexually transmitted infection in order to identify those who may be infected or those in whom laboratory testing should be obtained. The value of such criterion based screening is unclear .
In 2007, about 33 million people globally were infected with HIV 1. The number of HIV infections worldwide has been stable since 2000; however, new cases continue to increase in resource limited nations. The source of infection differs by country, and includes intercourse , injected drugs, transmission from mother to child including breast milk and unsafe injections or other nosocomial sources .
Mucosal surfaces serve as both entry and transmission routes for most pathogens. Although there are studies suggesting that systemic immunization can provide mucosal protection , others have suggested that mucosal immunization is required for effective T cell dependent mucosal immunity  . There are important distinctions between different mucosal tissues.
The concept of vascular or arterial age has been proposed in several previous studies. The idea is to adjust the age of a patient based on their level of atherosclerosis. Stein et al  have developed an algorithm for calculating vascular age based on carotid IMT.
The option of multichannel cochlear implantation for patients who have sensory hearing loss has been available for the last two decades. Although it is optimal to implant children in early childhood , it is not always possible to do so. Therefore, it is important to evaluate the efficacy of implantation at various stages of human development.
The adaptive immune response to intracellular parasites or bacteria is in large part dependent upon the generation of primed CD4+ T cells in secondary lymphoid organs. The clonal proliferation that accompanies priming provides for a greater number of antigen specific cells that can differentiate into effector cells capable of homing to sites of infection. The number and function of Th1 cells can be limited by the activation of regulatory T cells  and other populations of IL 10 secreting cells, including Th1 cells, which may restrain immunopathology while preventing the complete elimination of the parasite .
Hematopoietic stem cells  constantly differentiate into all blood cell lineages via distinct differentiation programs. While early studies led to the proposal that the flow of intermediate cells within each lineage is fixed , recent evidence suggests otherwise   that oligopotent progenitor differentiation is very “plastic”, especially when the host is stressed, by infection for example. using a novel “cellular barcoding” technique .
Although colon rectal cancer  is the third leading cause of cancer death in men and women in the United States , the cellular and molecular events associated with its pathogenesis are not known to a certainty. Despite extensive research, the pathological and molecular markers for prognosis of colon cancer are still lacking. The COX 2 transcription is regulated through transcription factors, especially nuclear factor κB  .
Reductions of 70% or more of new AIDS diagnoses and death have been reported in the highly active antiretroviral therapy  era . As a result, older HIV infected patients are one of the fastest growing demographics, with a quintupling of AIDS patients in the U.S. over 50 years of age between 1990 2000 . The HIV epidemic also has disproportionately affected minority populations, particularly African Americans.
Protein tyrosine O sulfation is a widespread post translational modification that was suggested to affect an average of 1% of all tyrosine residues in all proteins, secreted and membrane bound, in higher order eukaryotes . Among the more than 60 tyrosine sulfated proteins identified to date, a great deal of interest is focused on the role of tyrosine sulfation in the binding of the seven transmembrane G protein coupled receptors . In vitro substrate specificity studies using synthetic peptides indicated several differences in substrate preferences of the individual isozymes .
Oxidative stress is associated with the aging process, is a risk factor for several neurodegenerative diseases, and is decreased by reduced energy intake. Oxidation of a cysteine residue can be reduced by various antioxidants, but methionine sulfoxide is unique in that it is reduced by the methionine sulfoxide reductase  system. MsrA is considered the major Msr because it positively regulates MsrB expression .
Glutamate is an endogenous excitatory neurotransmitter, and it is estimated that this neurotransmitter is used by as many as one third of the synapses in the central nervous system . At high concentrations, glutamate is neurotoxic, and glutamate induced neuronal death contributes to the development of neurodegenerative diseases . Two common pathways of glutamate neurotoxicity have been described.
Single channel recordings yield important information about ion channels. The analysis of single channel recordings is based either on time course fitting or event list analysis . In a patch containing a single channel, open probability  can be calculated from the above list.
In 2007, ~ 218,890 men in the U.S. will be diagnosed with prostate cancer , and >27,000 deaths will be attributed to the disease . Several etiologic factors for PC have been suggested, including genetic and environmental factors. However, only age, race/ethnicity and family history are established risk factors .
Genistein is a phytoestrogen abundant in soy . as well as a variety of processed food, such as meatless burger, energy bar and soy yogurt, etc. .
Alcohol use disorders  occur commonly in the general population, with recent estimates of their current  prevalence of 8.46% . Despite the adverse effects of AUDs, most individuals with such a diagnosis never receive treatment . One particular focus of research has been the identification and evaluation of medications to treat alcohol dependence, which since 1994 has resulted in the approval by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration of three medications to treat the disorder: oral naltrexone, acamprosate, and extended release naltrexone.
Prostate cancer  is the most frequently diagnosed non cutaneous male malignancy and the third leading cause of cancer related death in men in most western industrialized countries . It is estimated that around 660,000 men worldwide will be diagnosed with PCa and 250,000 men will die from it in 2010; thus, it will remain a major health problem in coming years . Therefore, finding novel and more effective inhibitors of AR signaling is of paramount interest.
Nitroxyl  donors are used clinically as deterrents for alcohol use  and also exhibit anti cancer properties , protect tissue against reperfusion injury , and show promise for the treatment of heart failure . HNO also regulates vasorelaxation  and alters calcium channel function  through binding of HNO to a ferric or thiol site . 2HNO→→N2O+H2OAdditionally, the reactive nature of HNO with a variety of biological targets depletes the concentration of free and measurable HNO in cells .
Intracellular protein degradation is an important facet of proteome maintenance, and misregulation of proteolysis can lead to severe cellular defects. Thus, mechanisms must exist to limit the destructive potential of this enzyme. One mechanism involves active site remodeling.
The vertebrate body axis undergoes segmentation and specialization into distinct regions during embryogenesis. As a taxon, salamanders  exhibit almost no diversity in body plan, yet they do vary in life cycle. Some are direct developing and hatch from the egg as miniature adults.
Success rates for long term weight loss maintenance through traditional lifestyle strategies are poor, with high recidivism rates being the norm. This is in part attributable to individual level barriers that may prevent weight reduced individuals from achieving the amount of daily physical activity necessary to prevent weight regain. Daily physical activity has been consistently shown to be a critical factor in maintaining long term weight loss.
The complex relationship between inflammation and cancer has been well described since the late 1800’s . Persistent inflammation, however, may promote tumor formation  . The intricate molecular and cellular mechanisms responsible for the association between inflammation and cancer have recently become subjects of intense study.
Bipolar Disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of depression and/or mania along with interepisodic mood symptoms that interfere with psychosocial functioning. Despite periods of symptomatic recovery, individuals with bipolar disorder often continue to experience impairments in psychosocial functioning, particularly occupational functioning. Two determinants of psychosocial functioning of euthymic  individuals with bipolar disorder are residual depressive symptoms and cognitive impairment  .
Cardiac mortality of end stage renal disease patients is several fold increased in comparison to the general population . However, the precise nature of the inflammatory and/or oxidative pathways involved remains unclear. As renal failure progresses, compounds accumulate in blood and tissues due to a decline in renal function.
In mammalian cells, both the nucleus and mitochondria serve as repositories for genetic information . In the cell, mitochondria perform numerous functions including, but not limited to producing the bulk of the ATP , generating reactive oxygen species, which can be both damaging and play a role in normal cellular signaling , and regulation of cell death . As a consequence, alterations in mtDNA integrity have been associated with various human pathologies, such as mitochondrial diseases , diabetes , cancer  and neurodegenerative disorders  .
Delirium is an acute confusional state marked by inattention and global cognitive dysfunction. Importantly, at least 3040% of delirium cases are preventable . Recent systematic reviews and clinical guidelines have recommended targeted multi component non pharmacologic intervention strategies for the prevention of delirium .
Immune related pathology can result in a number of bone marrow failure diseases including systemic lupus erythematosis , rheumatoid arthritis or Felty’s syndrome, and Large Granular Lymphocyte  leukemia. Phenotypic and functional data suggest that LGL leukemia is caused by the expansion of mature cytotoxic lymphocytes with either a clonal CD8+ T cell LGL  or NK cell LGL  phenotype, with T LGL leukemia accounting for 85% of cases. The occurrence of autoimmune diseases and B cell abnormalities normally precedes the onset of LGL leukemia expansion suggesting that this may be a disease continuum with similar underlying mechanisms.
The antigen specific T cell repertoire is shaped by binding of the TCR hypervariable region to a diverse array of short processed peptides bound to MHC molecules. Hence, it is surprising that nearly identical antigen specific or public T cells have been identified in multiple individuals . Public T cells are characterized by the expression of identical TCR Vα and/or Vβ genes that are present in the majority of subjects and dominate the response to a specific epitope.
Human natural killer  cells are part of the innate immune system and recognize microbe infected cells and tumor cells through a combination of activating and inhibitory receptors that do not require somatic gene rearrangement, such as the killer cell immunoglobulin like receptor  family . T cells, in contrast, mediate adaptive immune response to major histocompatibility complex bound antigens through recognition by rearranged T cell receptors  . KIR generates diversity through variable haplotype gene content, allele polymorphism, and stochastic expression , whereas TCR recombines αβ or γδ chains during development .
Transcranial electrical stimulation using weak direct currents   transcranial direct current stimulation    is a powerful method of brain modulation that has been increasingly tested as a tool to modulate plasticity in neuropsychiatric diseases . Relatively simple to apply, tDCS involves application of direct current through at least one electrode positioned on the scalp. Because of these initial positive results, tDCS has the potential to be used for the rehabilitation of patients with brain lesions who also have skull defect  such as patients with traumatic brain injury  or patients who undergo neurosurgery.
Powassan virus  is the sole North American member of the tick borne encephalitis  complex which is otherwise geographically distributed across temperate Eurasia . Lineage I, the “prototype” lineage, is maintained in an enzootic transmission cycle between Ixodes cookei and Ix. marxi and small and medium sized woodland mammals .
Atherosclerosis is a focal inflammatory disease of the vasculature, marked by chronic activation of the endothelium. In regions of disease, inflammatory signaling is continuously stimulated by the local environment to promote disease progression. This complex initiates many early signaling events in response to shear stress, including activation of MAP kinases and integrins.
Uncontrolled proliferation and migration of vascular smooth muscle cells  coupled with increased deposition of extracellular matrix  are major causes of intimal thickening during the development of vascular occlusive disease . Moreover, cellular and molecular compositional changes in the vessel wall modulate the mechanical properties of the vessel . Specifically, we and others have found that VSMC migration and proliferation increase with substrate stiffness .
Antiretroviral pre exposure prophylaxis , as daily oral tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and co formulated emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate, has been demonstrated to be efficacious for the prevention of HIV acquisition in diverse populations. PrEP could be an important component of safer conception strategies for women at risk for HIV infection, including those in HIV serodiscordant couples , particularly if the infected partner is not eligible for, willing, or able to take antiretroviral treatment., Efforts to implement PrEP as a public health strategy for HIV prevention in heterosexual populations will be accompanied by PrEP exposure during conception and pregnancy, either inadvertently for women with unrecognized early pregnancy or intentionally as part of reducing HIV risk during conception, and thus understanding the safety of PrEP in the periconception period is a priority . Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and emtricitabine are pregnancy category B medications, with no evidence of teratogenicity in animal experiments and in observational studies of humans.
One of the key themes in biology is the characterisation of structure function relationships. In the brain, a similar relationship exists between anatomical and effective connectivity. It is generally accepted that anatomical connectivity provides important constraints on effective connectivity.
γ Amino butyric , the major neurotransmitter of inhibitory synaptic neurotransmission, influences virtually every homeostatic function mediated by the medulla oblongata. These functions include respiration , chemosensitivity to carbon dioxide , blood pressure regulation  and the laryngeal chemoreflex . The 5 HT medullary system is comprised of the raphé , extra raphé , and ventral surface arcuate nucleus in the human , all sites where 5HT source neurons are located.
The current first line therapy for patients with glioblastoma multiforme  consists of maximal surgical resection followed by radiotherapy and Temozolomide chemotherapy. The limited efficacy of current therapies for GBM highlights the importance of increasing understanding of the physiology and pathology of this devastating disease. GBM is composed of heterogeneous types of tumor cells.
Cancer care requires a great deal of information work on the part of the patient . Beyond the psychological stress of dealing with a life threatening illness, patients must manage a range of personal health information to play an active role in their health care . For example, patients often gather and integrate their medical records, web pages, notes, and articles to make treatment decisions.
The 2011 National Healthcare Disparities Report documents that racial and ethnic disparities remain pervasive . These initiatives are commonly referred to as pay for performance programs  . The primary goal of P4P is rewarding or improving quality of care; a secondary goal is controlling cost by reducing errors and inappropriate utilizations .
Allergic rhinitis is estimated to affect 30 to 60 million people in western countries and is associated with decreased quality of life, disorder in sleep hygiene, and impairment in work performance. Eosinophils trigger rhinitis symptoms in numerous inflammatory diseases, including allergic rhinitis, non allergic rhinitis eosinophilia syndrome, and chronic sinusitis. While a nasal smear is easy to perform and well tolerated in general, some patients find this procedure unpleasant.
The noradrenaline  lies at the confluence of massive cortical and subcortical inputs . Individual NA medium spiny neurons  receive convergent glutamatergic inputs from the prefrontal cortex , hippocampus, and amygdala , as well as GABAergic and modulatory inputs from multiple sources . Subthreshold membrane fluctuations are essential for integrating information carried by such inputs, as MSN have highly negative resting membrane potentials  and must be driven to depolarized potentials  in order for action potentials to be generated .
Brain injuries are suspected causes of acquired temporal lobe epilepsy . The temporal mismatch between a presumed initial injury and the onset of clinically detectable epilepsy was attributed early on to the concept of the “ripening of the scar” , which refers to a presumably gradual epileptogenic process. Initial chance observations of spontaneous seizures long after SE was induced , and the results of non continuous behavioral monitoring after convulsive SE , established and reinforced the notion that a prolonged seizure free latent period reliably follows convulsive SE in rats .
Juvenile hormones  play a key role in insect development . JH dependent ovarian previtellogenic maturation involves changes in primary follicles, nurse cells and follicular epithelium . Extensive JH dependent cellular remodeling has also been described in the fat body  and midgut .
During mitosis, sister chromatids must segregate properly to maintain the genetic integrity of the two daughter cells. The mitotic spindle, a microtubule based network originating from opposite poles, captures, aligns, and separates the replicated chromosomes. The spindle assembly checkpoint ensures that chromosomes do not segregate until they are properly attached.
Infantile spasms syndrome  is a devastating form of childhood epilepsy characterized by involuntary, massive motor spasms during early infancy that herald a lifelong disorder of severe seizures and intellectual disability. Mutations in a growing list of genes critical for the establishment of proper neural networks during development have been associated with its many inherited forms . Although short term spasm reduction can be achieved, high relapse rates, cognitive impairment, and long lasting side effects highlight the need for more effective therapy  .
ZIP4 is a zinc transporter that plays an important role in maintaining the cellular zinc level  . Conversely, silencing of ZIP4 by shRNA significantly inhibits pancreatic cancer growth and increases survival rate of nude mice with pancreatic cancer xenografts , suggesting that ZIP4 might be a novel therapeutic target for pancreatic cancer treatment. Altered expression of zinc transporters is associated with many other cancers.
In a recent paper  we reported that dermal fibroblasts obtained from human skin during surgery for soft tissue sarcoma at 2 9 weeks after the end of a course of fractionated radiotherapy  demonstrated substantial levels of DNA damage when examined at their first division in culture after removal from the patient. Estimates of the dose received by the skin samples demonstrated that the levels of micronuclei observed were dependent on dose. Latent damage in human skin after irradiation is consistent with results of studies of wound healing after irradiation  and with reduction of the tolerance to late radiation damage after a second course of radiation treatment to previously irradiated skin .
Craniosynostosis is defined as the premature fusion of one or more cranial sutures and has an overall prevalence of 35 per 10,000 individuals . Approximately 515% of craniosynostosis cases involve multiple cranial sutures, referred to as complex craniosynostosis. Craniosynostosis can be further described as syndromic, in which other features are present in the patient, or non syndromic.
Squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck  is one of the six most common cancers in the world . Its traditional risk factors, including tobacco and alcohol consumption, have recently declined . Infection with high risk HPV, mostly HPV16, is also associated with cervical and most anal cancers .
Dopamine is thought to influence impulsivity , a category of behaviors encompassing deficits in the ability to delay immediate gratification for future larger rewards, and in response inhibition. Novelty seeking, which includes a dimension of impulsiveness , and attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder , which features impulsivity as a symptom , are associated with variants of genes encoding synaptic proteins that modulate dopaminergic activity . Suboptimal activity  at D2 like  receptors apparently induces impulsive responses.
Transcriptional regulation is a key mechanism controlling the formation and subsequent behaviour of hematopoietic stem cells  . These computational screens were performed using the Ets/Ets/Gata  signature  using the Scl +19 HSC enhancer as a template . Given these constraints, the predicted E/E/G elements have all been clustered within a single hematopoietic enhancer.
Congestive heart failure  is a major cause of morbidity and mortality and represents the leading discharge diagnosis among older individuals in the United States , . This disorder has a high prevalence, morbidity, and is associated with substantial economic burden  . The situation with HFpEF is somewhat different.
Although some cognitive functions, such as episodic memory and visuo spatial skills, decline in older age , language abilities remain relatively stable among older adults . In normal speech, about two to five words per second are retrieved from the mental lexicon . Phonologically related errors may emerge but usually not until later in the course of the disease  .
Acute allograft rejection is a T cell dependent phenomenon. IL 17 transcripts have been described in the early phase of rat and human kidney allograft rejection  and IL 17 producing cells were sufficient to mediate rejection of rat lung allografts . Whether this equilibrium occurs in transplantation models in vivo and if so, whether it can be skewed in one direction or the other, remains to be determined .
Chronic exposure to nicotine, the addictive chemical in tobacco smoke, produces neuroadaptive changes that promote continued smoking . Even with the most effective pharmacotherapies, only one in four smokers is able to quit . Nicotine binds to neuronal nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  in the mesolimbic cortical reward pathway , pointing to nAChRs as attractive candidates for genetic investigations of nicotine dependence.
Social cognition is broadly defined as the cognitive processes and individual factors  involved in social interactions . Additionally, tractography analyses have revealed alcoholism related abnormalities in fiber tracts  connecting cortical and limbic portions of emotion and reward circuits  . observed dampened amygdala and hippocampal activation in alcoholics viewing positive and negative emotional facial expressions during fMRI.
Medullary carcinoma of the colon  is a distinct subtype of colonic adenocarcinoma with a unique histologic appearance and a more favorable prognosis in comparison to poorly differentiated colonic adenocarcinomas . Previous studies have shown that MC as opposed to PDC of the colon are more often right sided, seen in older female patients, and have a lower incidence of lymph node metastases . The tumor cells of PDC are typically more pleomorphic and more commonly exhibit some evidence of glandular differentiation.
Activation of protein kinase A , which traditionally occurs with β adrenergic receptor  stimulation, is known to enhance cardiomyocyte contraction . These effects occur primarily through the phosphorylation of phospholamban  by PKA at Serine16 , and can be reversed by phosphatases, namely protein phosphatase 1  and 2a  . Consequently, the phosphatase vs. kinase equilibrium plays a critical role in regulating cardiomyocyte contractility .
Fifty years have passed since the first description of sickle cell disease  in Saudi Arabia . When the HbS mutation was associated with the Arab Indian  HBB  haplotype, HbS homozygotes or compound heterozygotes for HbS and β0 thalassaemia were reported to have a milder phenotype than patients with a HbS mutation of African origin . This was attributed to their high fetal haemoglobin  level.
Life for the vertebrate requires sustained and rhythmic beating of the heart for delivery of oxygen and nutrients to the brain and other organs. The vertebrate cardiomyocyte has evolved elegant membrane regulatory pathways to maintain efficient excitation contraction coupling at baseline or in the face of acute and chronic stress. Central to this membrane regulation is the cardiac cytoskeleton.
Developmentally present steroids are recognized as essential components of mammalian sexual differentiation . Testosterone  has three metabolic pathways. While both AR  and ER  dependent pathways likely contribute to sexual differentiation, their relative importance has been debated and likely varies by species.
Emerging lines of evidence suggest that cancer cells may have mitochondrial dysfunction and adapt aerobic glycolysis to generate ATP. The involvement of reactive oxygen species  signaling in tumor metastasis has also been recognized . The increased ROS in cancer cells may in turn affect certain redox sensitive molecules and further lead to significant consequences such as stimulation of cellular proliferation, cell differentiation, alterations in sensitivity to anticancer agents, promotion of mutations and genetic instability, and contributing to carcinogenesis .
A major goal in the search for therapies for spinal cord injuries  is to develop tools for promoting both the regeneration of damaged axons and the restoration of synaptic contacts with their appropriate targets. Several different proteins expressed on mature oligodendrocytes cause axonal growth cones to collapse and thus arrest further growth . Axons may also be confronted by a proteoglycan rich glial scar at the lesion site, which forms a physical and molecular barrier to regrowth  .
Uterine fibroid tumors  are the most common gynecological neoplasms clinically affecting up to 30% of all women during reproductive age. The primary characteristics of uterine fibroids are the increased proliferation of myometrial cell, production of the abundant extracellular matrix , and the downregulation of ECM degrading enzymes. Recent progress in cDNA microarray analysis revealed a distinct similarity of leiomyoma with other fibrotic processes.
Lymphoid malignancies are a heterogeneous group of neoplasms originating from B  and T lymphocytes . Although the etiology of lymphoid malignancies remains largely unexplained, immune deficiency is the strongest known risk factor, with HIV infection conferring a more than 20 fold increased risk of non Hodgkin lymphoma  . Other factors affecting the immune system have also been postulated to increase the risk of developing lymphoid malignancies, particularly NHL  .
TLX1  is an evolutionarily conserved member of the non clustered NKL subclass of homeobox genes that orchestrates spleen organogenesis and specification of neuronal cell fates . The recurrent TLX1 associated translocations, which occur during thymocyte differentiation, are presumed to be initiating genetic lesions in this disease. The potential of TLX1 to disrupt normal hematopoietic processes has also been demonstrated in a number of in vitro studies, where retroviral expression of TLX1 promoted the immortalization of murine progenitor cells derived from various hematopoietic sources .
Schizophrenia is a psychiatric disorder with a prevalence of 0.51.0%. Although its heritability has been estimated to be in the order of 80%, unambiguous identification of susceptibility genes has proven to be extremely challenging. This paper is devoted to dysbindin, the product of the DTNBP1 gene.
The endoplasmic reticulum  is essential for secretory and membrane protein folding and assembly. The UPR regulates transcriptional, translational, and post translational intracellular programs such as ER associated protein degradation  whereby ER chaperones, protein folding enzymes, and lectins identify malformed proteins in the ER and retrotranslocate them into the cytosol for degradation by proteasomes . The ERAD program therefore prevents misfolded protein accumulation, and disruption of ERAD components often leads to early embryonic lethality  .
Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons  comprise a class of chemicals composed of two or more fused aromatic rings. Since PAHs are produced by the incomplete combustion of organic matter, including petroleum, coal, and other carbonaceous materials , they are ubiquitous contaminants of the human environment. Humans are exposed to PAHs via inhalation, ingestion, and dermal contact.
Human visual object recognition is impressive in several ways: it is fast, seemingly automatic, robust under degraded viewing conditions, and capable of recognizing novel instances of a very large number of common categories . For example, in their everyday lives, people routinely recognize the dog whose nose is sticking out from the blanket, the highly unique modernistic chair, and the cup on the table as a particular and favorite cup. Competing theories of object recognition  often pit different kinds of hypothesized processes and representations against each other.
One of the cardinal pathological changes in Alzheimer's disease  is the accumulation of amyloid beta peptide  in amyloid plaques and the walls of blood vessels . Additionally, these Aβ immunotherapies were often associated with vasogenic edema and microhemorrhages in the brain . The latter was thought to be caused by relocation of parenchymal Aβ aggregates to the walls of cerebral blood vessels ; thus, the inflammatory responses and cerebral hemorrhages associated with Aβ immunotherapies can be detrimental to the AD patients’ health.
Highly active anti retroviral therapy  markedly decreases AIDS progression among HIV infected individuals . Nearly all of these adverse effects resemble clinical symptoms seen in inherited mitochondrial diseases , , suggesting that host mitochondrial genotype may play a role in their development. Associated primarily with the thymidine analogue nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors  zidovudine  and stavudine , lipoatrophy is the loss of subcutaneous fat from the face, extremities, and buttocks .
The triggering receptors expressed on myeloid cells  contain a single V set immunoglobulin  domain, and are involved in cell activation within the innate immune system . A glycoprotein with significant homology to the TREMs, TREM like transcript 1 , has been exclusively found in the mouse and human megakaryocyte  lineages . TLT 1 was tentatively localized to the α granule membrane, a conclusion made from its colocalization with P selectin in confocal microscopy.
High levels of treatment adherence are critical for people with HIV to benefit from antiretroviral medications, and to remain free from opportunistic infections resulting from a compromised immune system . Nevertheless, a substantial number of people with HIV do not achieve optimal adherence levels. For example, research has found mean adherence rates of 67% of prescribed doses over 6 months .
The mitogen activated protein kinase  pathway is one of the critical downstream effectors of Ras, a small GTPase that is vital in the modulation of numerous cellular functions. Ras has long been known to play an important role in cancer genetics. The RASopathies are a class of human genetic syndromes that are caused by germline mutations in genes which encode components of the Ras/MAPK pathway ,.
The striking increase of uterine blood flow in pregnancy is essential both for optimal growth and survival of the fetus and for cardiovascular well being of the mother. Maladaptation of the uteroplacental circulation during pregnancy is associated with high incidence of clinical complications including preeclampsia and fetal intrauterine growth restriction. Thus, a comprehensive understanding of regulatory mechanisms of uterine vascular adaptation in pregnancy has long been sought, but has not been achieved.
Data mining algorithms, sometimes called machine learning or statistical learning algorithms, have been increasingly used in biomedical research in recent years. Data mining is broadly defined as the process of selecting, exploring, and modeling large amounts of data to discover unknown and useful patterns or relationships. Data mining algorithms arose from the fields of statistics and computer science, and are widely used in marketing, banking, engineering, and bioinformatics.
“Why do adolescents become dependent on alcohol and other drugs  and what might be done to redirect them back to sobriety?” In short, reducing youth AOD use disorders is a critical area of social concern, but there are a number of factors that have made attaining this goal difficult. Consequently, lower parental monitoring results in adolescents following fewer rules and receiving less guidance from responsible adults, leading to more unstructured free time . The latter may be related to growing narcissistic tendencies in youth .
Delivery of foreign DNA into eukaryotic cells has become an important tool in molecular biology and in gene therapy studies. Electroporation is a physical based method for DNA delivery, and thus possesses some advantages over other methods. Because of these favorable features, electroporation gene transfer has been heavily investigated as an alternative strategy to viral methods in the development of gene therapy protocols  .
Practice guidelines recommend the use of ICDs in patients with heart failure  and a left ventricular ejection fraction  of ≤ 35% in the absence of contraindications . The GWTG program is a national, voluntary, observational, hospital based, and ongoing quality improvement initiative that began in the year 2000 under the auspices of the AHA. The GWTG program has been described previously., Begun in January/March 2005 and continued to the present, the HF module originating from the Organized Program to Initiate Life Saving Treatment in Hospitalized Patients with Heart Failure serves as the primary dataset for this analysis.
Human beings’ complex social environment has evolved hand in hand with two other distinct capacities: our ability to identify other people as individuals, and our ability to convey complex ideas to them via spoken language. Our person perception abilities allow us to distinguish and uniquely identify numerous other individual human beings . However, little research has examined the mechanisms by which the auditory system integrates information across cognitive domains.
Neurogenesis in the dentate gyrus of the adult hippocampus is highly labile. Glucocorticoids have two principal roles: absolute levels regulate the proliferation rate of the progenitor cells; and the presence of an intact diurnal corticoid rhythm is an essential requirement for the action of two further controlling factors, namely serotonin and nitric oxide . l NAME as well as markedly stimulating neurogenesis has also been found to increase BDNF in the dentate gyrus .
The mouse genome encodes a large number of nonclassical MHC class I  molecules, including many with unknown functions . In general, class Ib genes show little polymorphism relative to the highly polymorphic classical MHC class I genes, H2 K,  D, and L. Protein folding and expression in most cases requires assembly with β2 microglobulin . The MHC class Ib tissue distribution and expression levels vary considerably .
Following in the footsteps of exciting clinical data on the efficacy of the small drug inhibitor of Bruton tyrosine kinase   ibrutinib, in patients with mantle cell lymphoma   and chronic lymphocytic leukemia   ibrutinib is now undergoing phase 2 clinical testing for multiple myeloma   registered online at ClinicalTrials.gov as NCT01478581 and NCT01962792. BTK  is an X chromosome encoded member of the Tec protein tyrosine kinase family that has long been known to play a central role in B cell receptor  signaling . BTK’s pleiotropic functionality in the B lineage may complicate efforts to elucidate the mechanisms by which targeted inhibition of BTK suppresses neoplastic growth; i.e., the mode of action in MM  may differ in some respects from that in Waldenström’s macroglobulinemia , CLL , diffuse large B cell lymphoma  , and other blood cancers .
The impact of neoadjuvant therapy on post pancreatectomy complications is inadequately described . Data from the NSQIP Pancreatectomy Demonstration Project  was used to identify patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma who did and did not receive neoadjuvant therapy. Neoadjuvant therapy was classified as chemotherapy alone or radiation ± chemotherapy.
Laboratory methods routinely used for diagnosis of HIV infection are based on detection of anti HIV antibodies, which typically appear 35 weeks after HIV infection . These methods do not identify individuals with acute  HIV infection. Furthermore, acute HIV infection is often associated with a high concentration of HIV in plasma and genital secretions , which in turn is associated with increased risk of transmission .
Incidental encounters with mediastinal masses have become more common with the growing use of computed tomography  in clinical practice as well as in screening of lung cancer. Anterior mediastinal masses account for 50% of all mediastinal masses . Anterior mediastinal masses can represent a wide spectrum of diseases, including thymoma, thymic carcinoma, thymic cyst, thymic hyperplasia, mature teratoma, malignant germ cell tumor, and malignant lymphoma .
Voltage gated potassium  channel pore forming α subunits form complexes with a range of ancillary  subunits, such as the single transmembrane domain proteins encoded by the KCNE gene family , leading to various channel subunit compositions with diverse functional characteristics . The KCNQ1 K+ channel α subunit is widely distributed in both excitable and non excitable cells of vertebrates, and is unique among the S4 gene superfamily in that it forms either voltage activated or constitutively active K+ selective channels depending on its specific KCNE family β subunit partner . KCNQ1 and KCNE gene disruption are linked to multiple pathologies, often with an unclear molecular etiology.
Relapse is a common feature of cocaine addiction even after long periods of abstinence . Several types of stimuli are known to induce cocaine relapse, including: stress , re exposure to the previously self administered drug , and cues previously paired with the drug . Although there is no effective treatment, the neural circuitry underlying relapse is rapidly coming into focus .
In 2009, more than seven million Americans were involved currently with thecriminal justice system  in some capacity, and nearly 70% of those involved with the CJS met criteriafor an alcohol or other substance use disorder . In 2004, Witkiewitz andMarlatt published anintegrated and updated model of relapse for persons with SUDs in the general population. In this model, social support is categorized as adistal factor, which implies that social support is a static variable influencing anindividual’s relapse.
The hepatitis delta virus  ribozyme is a small, self cleaving RNA that participates in the double rolling cycle replication of the HDV virus. The active site is found at the cleft where the stacking networks intersect. More recently, HDV like ribozymes have been found in the human transcriptome, and they are prevalent in other forms of life as well.
In DSM 5, low prosocial emotions , designate youth at risk for early onset, persistent conduct problems , and adult psychopathy . Yet, little is currently known about how CU traits develop. However, to date, few published biologically informed longitudinal studies have tested whether such a distinction is valid .
During adult neurogenesis glial fibrillary acidic protein  expressing quiescent type I cells self renew, divide and give rise to transient amplifying type IIa cells which will differentiate into neuronal nuclei  expressing mature granular cell neurons . We previously developed and characterized a transgenic animal that labels type I and IIa progenitor cells with green fluorescent protein  under the control of the nestin promoter and its second intron enhancer . Excitatory amino acid transporter 2 , a glutamate transporter, was identified in this screen and found to be upregulated about ten fold in postnatal day 28  progenitors compared to those isolated at P7.
Spina bifida myelomeningocele  is a neural tube defect associated with a modal pattern of strengths and deficits in motor, cognitive, academic, and behavioral domains . Moreover, even when children with SBM do not meet stipulated criteria for the diagnosis of a reading comprehension disability per se, their reading comprehension skill is typically significantly lower than their word decoding skill, a pattern less often observed in typically developing  controls  . Studies of how reading comprehension unfolds in children with SBM have been informed through experiments that examine this population's strengths and weaknesses at accessing meaning from three levels of text : the surface code , text base , and situation model  .
Mammalian sterile 20 like kinase 1  is a serine/threonine kinase of the Hippo signaling pathway, with regulating apoptosis as one of its major functions . Prior studies in the heart concluded that Mst1 induces cardiac damage through activating myocyte apoptosis and that inhibiting Mst1 is cardioprotective by reducing myocyte apoptosis . The tacit assumption is that Mst1 regulates cardiomyocyte numbers, thereby affecting cardiac function, but this has rarely been measured.
Advances in high throughput sequencing technologies present the opportunity to infer aspects of biological mechanisms from vast amounts of sequence data—the cell's own language for encoding those mechanisms. Such inferences rely on the assumption that sequence patterns that have been conserved for a billion years or more reflect important structural or mechanistic similarities. More relevant to the analysis here, divergent patterns that are conserved in descendent proteins maintaining a particular divergent function likewise reflect important structural or mechanistic differences.
MicroRNAs  are endogenously processed non coding RNAs which regulate gene expression by blocking the translation or decreasing the stability of mRNAs . They are initially transcribed by RNA polymerase II into larger transcripts, called pri miRNAs . In the nucleus, the RNase III Drosha, interacting with DGCR8, cleaves pri miRNAs to form pre miRNAs .
Mitral valve repair has become the gold standard treatment for patients with mitral regurgitation and most commonly includes the implantation of an annuloplasty ring  which invariably changes the geometry, dynamics and force distribution of the mitral annulus . Such annular changes have been demonstrated to perturb the geometry of the mitral leaflets during valve closure , which has been associated with alterations in physiological stress patterns acting on the leaflets and suboptimal repair durability . The effects of annuloplasty rings on mitral leaflet dynamics are, however, less clear.
Mammalian TOR is a constitutively expressed, evolutionarily conserved protein kinase which plays a central role in the regulation of cell growth, proliferation, apoptosis, and metabolism . mTORC1 contains mTOR, raptor, mLST8  and PRAS40, and its function is acutely inhibited by rapamycin, a potent immunosuppressant with anti tumor effect . Mammalian TORC2 is resistant to acute rapamycin inhibition.
The Wellcome Trust Case Control Consortium  genome wide association  study, in addition to the detection of four new and confirmed type I diabetes  loci, provided some evidence for previously undetected  T1D loci with effect sizes in the range of odds ratios between 1.1 and 1.3. The evidence provided by such GWA studies for these previously undetected loci can be pooled together in meta analysis studies or used to design follow up studies. Both of these approaches provide the additional samples required to detect novel loci with robust statistical power.
Desmoplastic small round cell tumor  is a rare and aggressive sarcoma that typically affects adolescent and young adult Caucasian males . Patients usually present with nonspecific abdominal symptoms, an abdominopelvic mass, and diffuse peritoneal lesions. Because of the rarity of this disease, no general consensus has been reached regarding staging and treatment.
Differentiated phenotypes derived from pluripotent stem cells are potential cell sources for tissue engineering and therapeutic applications, but effective and robust methods for scale up production have yet to be identified. Scale up bioreactors are typically based on stir based suspension systems, which not only remove gradients of cytokines and metabolic byproducts caused by biological activity, but also decrease the medium to cell ratio by minimizing areas of stagnant volume. Initial studies indicate, however, that cells cultured on microcarriers may be more sensitive to shear stress  and therefore motivate a more thorough understanding of the biological impact of shear stress parameters .
The prevalence of asthma has increased since 2001 in the United States and is a major public health problem in many countries such as Colombia, which has a prevalence estimated at 1012%., Childhood asthma causes considerable morbidity, interference with normal daily activities, and a burden for the whole family. It is a major reason for absence from school, admissions to hospital, and visits to the emergency department, especially during periods when it is inadequately controlled. Identification of asthma is particularly important in infants and preschoolers due to the fact that almost 80% of asthmatic patients start having symptoms during the first 5 years of their life.
The most common cause of damage to the myocardium is ischemic injury resulting from occlusion of the coronary arteries. Numerous investigators have observed a decreased ability of the aged myocardium to tolerate an ischemic or hypoxic stress in both animal models and in human subjects. , In addition, aging decreases myocardial tolerance to specific components of ischemic injury, including oxidative stress.
Vascular response to mechanical injury comprises 2 main processes, neointimal hyperplasia and vessel remodeling. The three major subfamilies of MAPKs, i.e. extracellular signal regulated kinase , c Jun N terminal Kinase  and p38MAPK are activated in response to stimuli such as cytokines and growth factors, and studies using both genetic models as well as pharmacological inhibitors of MAPKs showed significant inhibition of neointimal hyperplasia after injury, indicating that MAPKs promote neointima formation. MAPKs are regulated by a three tiered kinase cascade in which the MAPK is phosphorylated and activated by a MAP kinase kinase, which in turn is phosphorylated and activated by a MAP kinase kinase kinase .
In our previous study on individuals with autism spectrum disorder   we reported abnormalities in the attention orienting frontal event related potentials  and the sustained attention centro parietal ERPs in a visual oddball experiment. The character of rTMS induced plasticity depends on the intensity, frequency, and number of magnetic pulses during stimulation sessions, and the excitability of the targeted cortex. Autism is associated with cortical cytoarchitectural abnormalities .
Hepatic stellate cells  are the principle source of hepatic collagen, and therefore, play a critical role in the development and maintenance of hepatic fibrosis, a nefarious consequence of all chronic liver diseases regardless of etiopathogenesis, . In health, HSCs store retinoids and generate little if any collagen. Thus, reversal and/or inhibition of hepatic fibrosis requires HSC apoptosis.
The ERBB4 receptor tyrosine protein kinase gene is involved in the production of different isoforms of the ERBB4 protein through alternative splicing . ERBB4 binds trophic factors, such as neuregulin 1  or neuregulin 3. In prior epidemiologic studies, genetic variations and risk haplotypes in ERBB4 were associated with SCZ and BPD  in several ethnicities .
CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells  constitute 510% of peripheral CD4+ T cells in naïve mice . Tumors may differentiate, expand, recruit and activate Treg  via multiple mechanisms . When compared with naïve Treg, suppressor functions of tumor Treg have been reported to be ineffective, comparable or enhanced in various tumor models .
Results of the recent Treatment of Preserved Cardiac Function Heart Failure with an Aldosterone Antagonist  trial examining the clinical benefit of mineralocorticoid receptor  antagonism in patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction  were negative. However, interpretation of these results is hampered by broad inclusion criteria resulting in a heterogeneous patient population that could mask specific patient subgroups that may preferentially benefit from MR antagonism,. One of these potential populations are patients with diabetes, obesity and the metabolic syndrome  that exhibit >30% prevalence of cardiac diastolic dysfunction , the major cardiac functional defect in HFpEF.
For more than 1/3 of individuals ages 1824 in the U.S., the transition into adulthood co occurs with transitions into, through, and out of college . During this developmental period these young adults must learn to navigate new freedoms and responsibilities , tasks which may be especially challenging for those coping with trauma and its effects. Trauma and resulting post traumatic stress  symptoms are unfortunately common in young adults attending college .
It has been known for some time that tumor cells can have impaired HLA class I antigen expression during the course of tumor progression . HLA class I antigen downregulation or loss often occurs in tumor cells when the primary tumor breaks the basal membrane, invades the surrounding tissues, and/or starts to metastasize to regional lymph nodes or distant organs . Tumor induced immune modulation of surrounding tissue including sentinel lymph nodes plays an important role in this invasive/metastatic process.
Immunodominance is a well established phenomenon whereby a few specific peptides are selected as representative epitopes of a given protein antigen to the immune system. Many studies have aimed to understand mechanisms of epitope selection and immunodominance; a range of hypotheses related to the structural features of antigens, sensitivity to proteases,, epitope affinity for MHC class II, T cell precursor frequency, and T cell receptor affinity for peptide/MHCII have been considered. Efficient displacement of CLIP from the MHC groove requires the accessory molecule HLA DM in human or H2 M in mice .
Acetaminophen  is a widely used analgesic and antipyretic drug. Despite recent substantial progress in understanding the pathogenesis of APAP hepatotoxicity in rodents  and in humans , many questions regarding the mechanisms of APAP induced liver injury remain to be answered. However, an excess of NAPQI after APAP overdose depletes GSH and binds to cellular proteins .
Antigen receptor diversity due to VJ recombination is the hallmark of the adaptive immune system in jawed vertebrates. The large pool of V gene segments is situated upstream of Dδ, Jδ and Jα gene segments and could therefore contribute to both rearranged Tcrd  and Tcra  genes. The factors that direct particular V gene segments for usage as Vδ or Vα gene segments remain unknown .
Preterm  birth  is a complex adverse outcome of pregnancy, accounting for approximately 70% of perinatal mortality, and is a major predictor of long term neurologic morbidity  . Despite intense research and clinical efforts, progress in preventing PTB has been disappointing . This represents an increase in the PTB rate of 20% since 1990,  .
The genomes of eukaryotic cells are constantly being subjected to exogenous and endogenous genotoxic stresses. Damage resulting from exposure to these stresses threatens cell survival and can lead to cancer, as well as other genetic diseases. In order to preserve genomic integrity and ensure that an accurate copy of the genome is passed on to subsequent generations, cells have evolved a core surveillance machinery known as cell cycle checkpoints.
The hippocampal formation comprises a group of cortical regions including the dentate gyrus, hippocampus, subiculum, presubiculum, parasubiculum and the entorhinal cortex . The dentate gyrus, in turn, projects to the CA3 field of the hippocampus. However, the neuroanatomical organization of the major connections of the primate dentate gyrus, namely the mossy fibers, the associational projection and the local projections, has received relatively meager investigation .
Several studies have examined the longitudinal course of attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder  in samples of male subjects . Although recent studies have begun to examine ADHD in females , few studies have examined its longitudinal course in these samples . Also, the influence of sex on the course of ADHD has yet to be specifically tested.
CD4+ T cell activation involves the formation of a highly organized interface between the T cell and the antigen presenting cell  known as the immunological synapse  . This process requires differential polarization of surface and intracellular molecules to the IS proximal pole  or to the antipodal pole of the T cell , in a cytoskeleton dependent manner . In addition, T cell polarization is highly dynamic as illustrated by the early detection of signalling TCR microclusters or signalosomes in the outer ring of the synapse  and their subsequent movement to the centre of the synapse where they are internalized and destined to degradation , thus ensuring signal down regulation  .
In the United States, and more prominently in South Carolina, a large and widening disparity in breast cancer mortality rates has been reported between African American and European American women . The cause of this disparity has been attributed to factors ranging from differences in tumor biology, to environmental factors, to socioeconomic and cultural differences between the groups . Socioeconomic status and cultural beliefs could affect a woman's survival through certain time intervals across the breast cancer diagnosis continuum, resulting in delays in detection, diagnosis, and treatment.
While numerous molecular targets have been identified and several targeted molecular imaging agents have been reported for the detection of malignant tumors, only a handful of them showed limited clinical potential. This is in part due to the widespread expression of these molecular targets, in both cancerous and normal tissues. Cathepsin E , a tumor associated protein which is an intracellular non lysosomal aspartic proteolytic enzyme, was observed in several tumors including pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma , cervical, gastric and intestinal cancers.
Mutations in the gene HPRT1, encoding the enzyme hypoxanthine guanine phosphoribosyltransferase , are known to cause a rare X linked metabolic disorder, Lesch Nyhan disease . Many different diseasecausing mutations have been reported . Residual HPRT enzyme function is the most important factor for determining the variable severity of the clinical phenotype.
Current recommendations for measuring the cerebrospinal fluid opening pressure obtained during lumbar puncture include performance of lumbar puncture in the lateral recumbent position, followed by repeat measurement after extension of the legs and placement of the neck in the neutral position. ,, Extending the legs is thought to decrease intra abdominal pressure, thereby avoiding false elevations of the opening pressure. In our experience, many pediatric lumbar punctures are performed with the patient in the flexed lateral recumbent position without returning the patient to the extended position for measurement of opening pressure .
Increased spontaneous neural activity is a major consequence of intense sound exposure that has been observed at several levels of the mammalian auditory system, including the cochlear nucleus, inferior colliculus and auditory cortex . Such changes are potentially disruptive to normal signal detection and information processing in neurons further downstream from hyperactive cell populations. Knowledge of the mechanisms underlying the induction of hyperactivity would thus seem likely to have important implications for the understanding and treatment of tinnitus and other related hearing disorders .
When naïve T cells are stimulated by antigen, engagement of CD28 by its ligands CD80 or CD86  lowers the threshold for activation . Also when human T cells are expanded in vitro with HIV or influenza  antigens, 4 1BB triggering increases expansion of CD8+ T cells with polyfunctional cytokine secretion and higher perforin and granzyme A expression . In such A/PR8 infection, 41BBL is redundant for the primary response but remains essential for secondary T cell expansion upon antigen re encounter.
Neuronal firing patterns are shaped by the characteristics of the after hyperpolarization  following action potentials . Control over the computational state of excitable cells can be exerted via activation of SK channels alone, as for example in hippocampal LTP, whereby adding or removing SK channels from the plasma membrane modulates EPSP strength  . Cochlear hair cells can be functionally and spatially divided into inner and outer hair cells.
Oxidative stress induced cell damage is implicated in many neurological disorders including stroke, spinal cord injury, and periventricular leukomalacia , the major underlying pathology for cerebral palsy and cognitive impairment associated with prematurity . Premyelinating oligodendrocytes  as well as axons  are damaged in PVL , resulting in subsequent myelination abnormalities and neurological deficits in long term survivors. The exquisite susceptibility of preOLs to free radical mediated oxidative damage in comparison to mature differentiated OLs appears to account for the vulnerability of developing cerebral white matter to hypoxic/ischemic insults .
Advances in the therapy of heart failure  have delayed disease progression and prolonged survival. Earlier use of neurohormonal antagonists and devices have diminished untimely sudden death, leaving more patients with symptoms of advanced HF . Yet there is little understanding about the trajectory of patient preferences in heart failure .
Progressive hepatolenticular degeneration, also known as Wilson’s disease , is a genetic disorder characterized by excess copper accumulation in the liver and other vital organs., If untreated, WD can lead to severe disability, a need for liver transplantation and death. Before chelation therapy was introduced by John Walshe in 1956, WD had been almost invariably progressive and fatal. There is clear evidence to suggest that both D pen and trientine can mobilize copper ions stored in the body tissues and reroute them into circulation, thus increasing the concentrations of copper in the brain.
Microbes secrete a range of products that aid in adhesion to surfaces and to other cells , but even within a single species, microbes vary widely in their tendency to adhere .
