Adhesion is critical for the formation of surface attached microbial communities known as biofilms . When conditions are suitable, cells strengthen their attachment and divide to form a growing population on the surface .
Laparoscopic cholecystectomy is the most frequently performed abdominal surgical procedure, and one of the most common operations in Europe and the United States . Surgical morbidity has been reported as 24%, however the incidence of major complications that require acute re intervention is much lower . Whether this procedure should be performed routinely is still an active subject of debate, as systematic reviews are inconclusive .
Id  proteins are helix loop helix  transcription factors that regulate cell proliferation and differentiation. Id proteins are mainly expressed during embryogenesis and are required for maintaining the timing of neuronal differentiation. However, expression of Id proteins is reactivated in many human cancers.
It has long been known that cigarette smoking and other forms of tobacco consumption are addicting, and that addiction is at least in part caused by nicotine . Nicotine, believed to be the substance primarily responsible for addiction to tobacco smoking, is a simple molecule that affects many parts of the brain through binding sites on nicotinic acetylcholine receptors . When acetylcholinergic neurons release acetylcholine, it binds to muscarinic and nicotinic acetylcholine receptors and generally stimulates the release of glutamate and GABA.
Long term persistence of mycobacteria in the face of an apparently robust immune response thwarts tuberculosis control, and may explain the inefficacy of the BCG vaccine. Tuberculosis begins with the phagocytosis of mycobacteria by macrophages and dendritic cells at the site of infection, and the migration of infected cells into deeper tissues where they aggregate with additional macrophages and other immune cells to form characteristic structures called granulomas. It has been hypothesized that superinfecting or re infecting bacteria are able to survive by evading established granulomas where pre existing immune elements are concentrated .
Since their characterization, cytosine phosphate guanine  oligodeoxynucleotides  have been studied as immunotherapeutic agents for the treatment of different diseases, including various cancers. Members of the CpG A ODN family are potent natural killer  cell activators, and induce effective responses against NK sensitive tumors. CpG B ODNs are effective activators of B cells, less so of NK cells, and induce a stronger effect when a more elaborate and lengthy immune response needs to be orchestrated.
Identification and isolation of adult stem cells are still challenging for stem cell biologists. For example, no consensus exists yet regarding definitive markers for corneal epithelial stem cells, which have been recognized to reside in a ring around the peripheral cornea called the limbus for two decades. The evidence through previous studies leaves little doubt that corneal epithelial stem cells reside in the limbus, and these cells exhibit the full complement of well defined keratinocyte stem cell properties .
Prenatal stress has been associated with increased vulnerability to psychiatric disturbances such as schizophrenia, depression, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and autism . Together with genetic factors, the nature of the postnatal environment, the quality of maternal attention, and stress experienced in utero can determine the behaviour of offspring . Maternal anxiety in late pregnancy has been shown to produce anxiety like behaviour as well as alterations in plasma cortisol in the offspring, reflecting altered regulation of the hypothalamic pituitary  adrenal  axis .
Obstetrical Brachial Plexus Palsy  is a common birth injury, occurring in approximately three in every 1000 births; ; ; . Enhanced knowledge of how the sequelae associated with OBPP affects the three dimensional  humeral architecture will likely support improved efficacy of OBPP management strategies . The studies that have focused on humeral pathology demonstrated atrophy; ;  and “retroversion” on the involved side .
Friedreich ataxia  is an autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder caused by mutations in the FXN gene, reducing the levels of the mitochondrial protein frataxin . Deficiency of frataxin leads to increased intramitochondrial iron levels, deficiency of iron sulfur cluster containing enzymes, and enhanced sensitivity to oxidative stress . Patients usually present during adolescence with progressive limb and gait ataxia, dysarthria, and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy .
Gonads are essential parts of animal reproductive systems. Somatic gonads provide environment for proper maintenance and development of germline and support transport of gametes and subsequent fertilization. In the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans, hermaphroditic somatic gonads exhibit highly coordinated contractile activities during ovulation, a process to expel a mature oocyte out of the ovary .
Parkinson’s disease is a neurological disorder characterized by the progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons in specific brain areas and occurs most prevalently in older adults . The Parkinsonian voice has been described qualitatively as breathy, rough, hoarse, tremulous, abnormally pitched, having reduced pitch range, and unusually quiet  . Some studies have found higher mean F0 values in individuals with Parkinsonian voice , particularly in males .
Inflammatory molecules play a pivotal role in tumorigenesis and cancer progression . However, little is known about the mechanism of action of LL 37 on tumor cells. LL 37 initiates these responses through multiple receptors including the Gαi proteincoupled receptor , formyl peptide receptorlike 1 , the epidermal growth factor receptor , the purinergic receptor P2X7, and another receptor  that remains uncharacterized .
The anterior olfactory nucleus  is a cortical structure located in the olfactory peduncle, caudal to the olfactory bulb and rostral to the piriform cortex, and receives a significant input from mitral and tufted cells in the olfactory bulb . It has significant reciprocal connections with both the bulb and the piriform cortex , and is thought to play an important role in relaying information between the left and right hemispheres  . The AON is comprised of subregions  that are named for their relative location in the AON: pars dorsalis, pars lateralis, pars ventralis , pars medialis, and pars externa .
Shock wave lithotripsy  is an effective means of removing uncomplicated stone burdens of 2 centimeters or less located in the upper urinary tract , and is the most preferred therapy by urologists  and patients  alike. Despite such wide acceptance, however, both human and animal studies have documented a consistent and predictable pattern of acute tissue injury and impaired renal hemodynamics after SWL . The tissue injury primarily occurs in the microvascular system of the renal medulla and spreads into the cortex toward the capsule where a subcapsular hematoma may form.
The aphelids are a phylogenetically divergent group of intracellular parasitoids of common species of eukaryotic phytoplankton. There are three known genera: Aphelidium, Amoeboaphelidium, and Pseudaphelidium, but the group is very diverse, including many related environmental sequences . The phyla Microsporidia and Cryptomycota , and the class Aphelidea have recently been shown to be the deepest branches of the ‘Holomycota’ lineage forming the so called ARM clade , which is sister to the classical fungi .
Microarrays using bacterial cells as sensors have found many uses in such areas as high throughput assays of gene expression,,  detection of toxins,  and determination of the bioavailability of chemicals in soil. For example, contamination by Salmonella spp. A majority of the documented methods for bacterial immobilization utilize either the physical entrapment of bacteria or the nonspecific binding of bacterial cells  on chemically modified surfaces.
Cardiomyocytes undergo remodeling in response to pathological stimuli, such as neurohumoral factors, pressure or volume overload, biomechanical stress, myocarditis, or inherited mutations . Thus, understanding the cellular signaling events regulating cardiac function may facilitate therapeutic measures to prevent development of cardiac disease . RhoA belongs to the Rho subfamily of GTP binding proteins that regulate the actin cytoskeleton.
Cyclin D1, a protein involved in cell cycle progression, is thought to be the point of convergence of mitogenic signal transduction cascades . In addition to this cell cycle related function, it was recently shown that cyclin D1 acts as a transcriptional regulator in a CDK independent manner  . Yet, experiments in cyclin D1 null mice  or cyclin D1 deficient cells have shown that cyclin D1 is necessary for tumor development .
The natural alkaloid epibatidine, while showing high affinity to neuronal nAChRs and an analgesic effect in animal models of pain, produces many negative side effects including toxicity, hypertension, respiratory paralysis and seizures due, in part, to its low selectivity for central nAChRs . Neuronal nAChRs consist of various combinations of α2 α10 and β2 β4 subunits and are differently distributed in various regions of the mammalian nervous system with respect to their subunit composition . The α4β2 is a major nAChR subtype of the central nervous system , while α3β4, though detected in some brain regions, predominates in the periphery , and α7 nAChRs are present in both central and peripheral regions of the nervous system .
Breast cancer is one of the most common cancers and is responsible for 14% of all cancer related deaths in women and 1.6% of all female deaths worldwide. Presently, nearly 4.5 million women worldwide have been diagnosed with breast cancer during the last five years. When detected early, breast cancer is very treatable and therefore the ability to diagnose breast cancer in its early stages is vital to significantly improving the 5 year survival rate.
Fyn is a tyrosine kinase that belongs to the Src family of protein tyrosine kinases  . Fyn is highly expressed in the adult brain , and plays an important role in the central nervous system  . Fyn is composed of a regulatory and a catalytic domain .
Growing evidence from preclinical and clinical studies suggests that stem cell therapy may provide a viable therapeutic alternative to restore the target organ . Development of a sensitive, noninvasive imaging technology to track the engraftment of transplanted stem cells will be critical in monitoring therapeutic efficacy . MRI using super paramagnetic iron oxide  cell labeling techniques is emerging as the main diagnostic modality to track the transplanted stem cells.
Self poisoning through ingestion of Oduvanthalai is common in South India. Mortality may occur due to arrhythmias, renal failure, shock and respiratory distress. This prospective, clinical study was designed to assess renal tubular dysfunction due to Oduvanthalai poisoning .
Pain is a significant health concern with considerable economic and emotional costs. However, pain perception can vary greatly between individuals . For example, significant associations have been observed between clinical pain and lower order, pain related constructs including: pain catastrophizing , ; fear of pain , ; anxiety , , ; anxiety sensitivity , ; and somatosensory amplification , 6.
Mutations in the gene encoding presenilin 1  are responsible for many cases of early onset familial Alzheimer’s disease , in part by increasing amyloid β peptide  production as a result of aberrant processing of the amyloid β protein precursor . Presenilin dependent γ secretase is involved in intramembranous proteolysis of many proteins, which suggests that PS1 may have Aβ independent roles in regulating synaptic function . Modifications of synaptic plasticity could thus be critical for understanding synaptotoxicity involved in AD .
Tumors that recur after an initially positive response to treatment are often resistant to chemotherapeutic drugs. To date, the mechanism of clinical tumor resistance to cisplatin is not entirely understood, despite intensive research to identify the basis of resistance. It is important to explore the mechanism responsible for cisplatin resistance to improve its therapeutic index and overcome the resistance to this drug that emerges in the clinic .
Recent advances in the treatment of lung cancers have come from recognition that lung cancers are not a single disease entity, but rather a collection of distinct molecularly driven neoplasms. BRAF is a member of the RAF kinase family of serine/threonine protein kinases which have diverse roles in mediating proliferation and survival. Upon activation by RAS, BRAF phosphorylates MEK leading to activation of ERK and the ERK signaling pathway.
Isolated renal phosphate wasting and subsequent hypophosphatemia may result from a number of genetic syndromes that include: autosomal dominant hypophosphatemic rickets , X linked hypophosphatemic rickets , and autosomal recessive hypophosphatemic rickets . Furthermore, ARHR patients manifest peri osteocytic lesions upon bone biopsy, which are a hallmark of XLH . We previously demonstrated that homozygous mutations in Dentin matrix protein 1 , including the deletion of nucleotides 1484 1490  and the missense replacement of the initial methionine with valine, , are causative for ARHR .
There is increasing evidence for a link between bone metabolism and the vasculature. Thus, elderly women with osteoporosis  or with high bone turnover  have increased cardiovascular mortality. These findings collectively suggest that changes in bone turnover affect the vasculature, although the possible mechanism of this are unclear .
UV resonance Raman  spectroscopy is recognized as a powerful technique for probing peptide and protein secondary structure. UVRR spectroscopy also provides insight into the geometry of the excited states and electronic transitions through Raman excitation profiles and Raman depolarization ratios. Alanine based peptides are often used as theoretical and experimental models to study protein conformation and folding.
Intestinal commensals are potential important contributors to the development of sporadic human colorectal cancer , but the identification of relevant microorganisms has been impeded by the complex ecology of the large intestine . the human colon contains >400 species with >1011 colony forming units  per gram of feces . An alternate approach involves focusing on commensals that can confer long term exposure to the host and are potentially mutagenic .
Myocardial infarction  is a leading cause of death worldwide, . Although the mortality rate from MI has declined steadily over the last 50 years due to the application of medical innovations, scientific discoveries, and improvements in public health, the total number of deaths is on the rise. The healing of acute ischemic myocardial injury influences the outcomes post infarction decisively.
Carbonic anhydrase  on the extracellular membrane surface is found in a variety of tissues that include kidney , lung , and skeletal muscle . The principal isoforms of ECA in the brain are CA4  and CA14  and both enzymes catalyze the buffering of activity dependent pHe transients  . Although ECA plays a role in buffering the brain extracellular space, the CAs are also involved in the transport of protons or bicarbonate .
Natural killer  cells are known to provide a critical host defence system during the early phases of infection with a variety of viruses, fungi, bacteria and parasites . NK cells do not possess conventional clonotypic antigen specific receptors but are capable of spontaneously killing tumour and virus infected cells that have down regulated one or more MHC molecules and/or expressed certain stress antigens on their surface .. NK cells have also been shown to play an important role during pregnancy , autoimmunity and tissue inflammation  . Target recognition and cytokine stimulation are the two major triggering mechanisms for NK cells and both shape their effector responses .
Spinal transection in humans results in an irreversible loss of motor and sensory functions. In a number of other vertebrates like cyclostomes , some teleosts  and tailed amphibians  the spinal cord seems to have self repairing mechanisms that lead to total or partial recovery of sensory motor functions. According to  “urodeles thus constitute the most advanced phylogenetic group in which functional regeneration occurs following lesions that interrupt ascending and descending pathways of the spinal cord”.
Tissue morphogenesis occurs in the complex and changing environment of a developing organism. Individual cells must interact with and respond to this environment to execute their appropriate developmental fates. Integrins are heterodimeric transmembrane receptors composed of an α and a β subunit.
Older adults constitute an increasing proportion of people living with HIV disease. The most recent CDC report indicates that 35% of HIV infected individuals in the US are age 50 and above, which represents a significant rise from 17% in 2001 . This steady increase has been attributed to both the success of combination antiretroviral therapy  in reducing the rate of mortality associated with HIV/AIDS, and recent findings indicating increasing rates of HIV seroconversion among older adults .
Language shift from Spanish to English has been studied in different communities in the United States . In general, when a minority group comes into contact with a dominant host group, language shift frequently results —a phenomenon that has been documented in a number of countries where minority language groups come in contact with more dominant cultural groups . Mexicans who abandon the use of Spanish as they increase their English language usage are said to have experienced a language shift—a transition that may at times be the product of socially coercive processes.
Apoptotic dysregulation is a fundamental characteristic of cancer that allows transformed cells to survive and proliferate . The family currently consists of eight members that are characterized by the presence of one or more baculoviral IAP repeat  domains and are highly conserved among mammalian and non mammalian species  . XIAP can bind and inhibit activation of procaspases 9, 7, and 3 .
Acute lung injury  is a common cause of life threatening acute respiratory failure in children and adults. ALI is characterized by activation of the pulmonary endothelium, disruption of endothelial and alveolar epithelial barriers, and an increase in microvascular permeability, resulting in protein rich pulmonary edema . While the exact pathogenetic mechanisms of this clinical disorder are unknown, an understanding of these mechanisms is critical for the development of novel therapies .
The Hedgehog  pathway controls cell proliferation and differentiation in response to a gradient of secreted Hh ligands . Smo is an essential, non redundant transducer of Hh signals whose activation leads to activation of GLI type transcription factors, which in turn induce the expression of Hh target genes. These target genes include downstream transcription factors such as Mycn , along with core Hh pathway components including Ptch1 and Gli1.
Clinical imaging of the longitudinal relaxation time, T1, in human subjects has several potential applications, including perfusion imaging , dynamic contrast imaging , assessment of Parkinson’s disease , assessment of schizophrenia  and multiple sclerosis , and quantification of myocardial blood flow . DESPOT1 derives T1 from two or more spoiled gradient recalled echo  images acquired with a constant TR and different flip angles. This transformed linear least squares fitting method—first described by Gupta in 1977 , which we denote as GLLS, and used in many previous works —has the advantage of being computationally efficient.
Depression is associated with increased mortality risk after acute myocardial infarction , with an approximate relative risk of 2.4 for all cause mortality  according to a meta analysis of 22 studies. However, there have been relatively few published studies of depression as a predictor of mortality in unstable angina . UA patients comprise about 26 percent of hospitalized patients with acute coronary syndrome , and although long term prognosis is more favorable compared with MI patients, early invasive revascularization strategies are less beneficial for prevention of recurrent events in UA patients.
In eukaryotic cells, molecular oxygen primarily functions as the terminal acceptor of electrons during mitochondrial electron transport. Most of the oxygen consumed in this process is reduced to water by cytochrome oxidase. Normally, only a small percentage of the total oxygen consumption appears as partially reduced species such as the superoxide ion and hydrogen peroxide.
Ethanol exposure during pregnancy causes birth defects  and can lead to fetal alcohol spectrumdisorders  . FASD symptoms generally include growth deficiency and brain damage. FASD is one of the major contributors to intellectual disability in the Westernworld .
Abundant evidence implicates the peptide hormones oxytocin and arginine vasopressin in the regulation of social behavior. In humans, intranasal oxytocin administration increased trust and prosocial behaviors in experimental economic tasks , and led to a higher ratio of positive to negative behaviors during the discussion of a marital disagreement , compared to participants who received the placebo administration . High peripheral oxytocin levels have been associated with better relationship quality.
Prenatal and early postnatal exposures and events can affect the entire life course. As one example, cesarean birth has been associated with an increased likelihood of asthma and cardiovascular disease in children, hypertension in young adults, and obesity in both children and adults. Among 1032 infants studied at age 1 month, Penders and colleagues used polymerase chain reaction to quantify total bacteria and five bacterial taxa, finding that cesarean birth was associated with higher carriage of Clostridium difficile and lower abundance of Bacteroides and Bifidobacteria, thereby confirming Biasucci.
Identifying novel approaches to detect EOCs more effectively would have a substantial clinical impact in reducing ovarian cancer related mortality. Fewer than 30% of patients diagnosed with advanced epithelial ovarian cancer  survive more than 5 years after their initial diagnosis . If more reliable blood based biomarkers made it possible to detect ovarian cancers earlier, it is clear that may lives could be saved .
Bregs are present in several murine models of chronic inflammation, including collagen induced arthritis , inflammatory bowel disease, and experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis  . This regulatory function appears to be directly mediated by the production of IL 10 and by the ability of B cells to interact with pathogenic T cells to dampen harmful immune responses . Although the most widely used markers for B regs are the expression of IL 10 and CD19, combinations of other surface molecules including CD1d/CD21 , CD5/CD1d  or CD1d, CD21, CD23 and CD24 )  have emerged as additional markers for the identification of this subset of B cells .
This paper addresses the question: when both selection and demography vary over time in a structured population with overlapping generations, how can we measure the long run expected strength of selection on quantitative traits? may have been the first to consider selection for structured populations in variable environments for which population dynamics are modeled by projection matrices. Here, we build in another layer of complexity experienced by many organisms: selection may also vary over time among environments in addition to over the life cycle .
Dendritic spines are small protrusions on the surface of dendrites that receive the majority of excitatory synapses, and changes in their morphology are implicated in synaptic plasticity and long term memory . Many cell adhesion molecules are located on the surface of dendritic spines and play important roles in dendritic spine formation and plasticity, including Eph receptors and ephrins, neuroligins, and neurexins, as well as cadherins and integrins . These cell surface proteins mediate dendritic spine communications with presynaptic terminals, glial cells, or components of the extracellular matrix, and trigger intracellular signaling cascades that influence actin cytoskeletal organization in dendritic spines .
Thousands of single gene, mitochondrial, and chromosomal disorders have been described. Often, patients who are followed in genetics clinics remain without a diagnosis for years. We describe a patient who was diagnosed with a Williams like syndrome as a child based upon the aortic stenosis and facial features.
Sepsis is a progressive, inflammatory response to overwhelming infection associated with tissue hypoperfusion and multiorgan dysfunction. At present, therapeutic interventions to treat ALI or ARDS remain limited. Based on pathophysiologically oriented views, ALI and ARDS can be of pulmonary  or extrapulmonary  origin.
Homologous recombination  promotes the repair of DNA double strand breaks and facilitates the recovery of stalled or collapsed replication folks,. In mitotic cells, two major mechanisms ensure the timely elimination of joint molecules. Secondly, structure selective endonucleases resolve joint molecules to form both COs and NCOs.
Chronic disease is the central health care problem in the United States  and beyond. Nearly one out of two Americans suffer from at least one chronic disease, and chronic diseases contribute to the majority of U.S. health care costs. Chronic diseases often require extensive lifestyle changes and consistent attention from both the person who has the disease and the care provider.
Data have accumulated demonstrating that the adult olfactory epithelium  retains stem cells that are competent to make neurons, i.e., neural stem cells, and that the population of globose basal cells  is likely to include stem cells capable of replacing destroyed neurons and all other epithelial cell types during the recovery of the epithelium from direct or indirect injury. While still subject to investigation, it has been suggested that a set of multipotent olfactory progenitor  cells resides among the GBC population of the OE and can be activated after lesion when both neurons and non neuronal cells need to be replaced . For example, cells that are phenotypically transitional between GBCs and sustentacular cells and between GBCs and HBCs are observed after MeBr lesion , and truncated Mash1 mRNA persists in both sustentacular cells and the basal cells in Mash 1 knockout mice .
The zebrafish is gaining popularity in a number of disciplines that can utilize the sophisticated genetic methods already available for this species, the pharmacological tools originally developed for other laboratory model organisms, and also numerous practical advantages of zebrafish, e.g., its small size and prolific nature. Behavioral brain research is one of these disciplines. Indeed recently there has been an upsurge of publications that focus on the characterization of the behavior of zebrafish and the development of novel behavioral tasks .
HIV/AIDS is a leading cause of infectious disease mortality worldwide. HLA A,  B, and  C genes encode molecules that bind antigenic peptides, and present the peptides to CD8+ T cells, thereby initiating a cytotoxic T cell  response during infection. In a study by Gao et al , accelerated AIDS progression among HLA B*35 positive individuals was attributed to HLA B*35 Px alleles  .
Falls are common among individuals with Parkinson disease , a progressive neurodegenerative movement disorder affecting more than 1 million people in the United States. Fall related hip fractures in the United States cost approximately $192 million annually. , Seventy percent of patients experienced a fall within a one year period, with 50% of fallers experiencing a recurrent fall in the subsequent year .
Cortical bone is a composite material containing approximately 20 25% water by volume  . Bone water occurs at various locations and in different binding states. In normal bone the majority of bone water is loosely bound to the organic matrix , with a minor fraction tightly bound to bone mineral  .
The potential risks surrounding a pandemic outbreak of influenza would apply to any new variant of the influenza virus, although, there is a significant clinical difference in the immunopathology of certain influenza strains when humans have been infected . Little attention, however, has been given to the intrinsic ability of humans to mount an immune response against an emerging strain of influenza. Strain A/H5N1 was first identified in domestic chicken stocks in the Far East .
Parvocellular neurons that produce arginine vastotocin  or arginine vasopressin  are present in the medial bed nucleus of the stria terminalis  of almost all land vertebrates . These features have been examined in a wide variety of species, thus we also know a great deal about species differences in anatomical features such as VT/VP cell numbers in the BSTm, and the density of projections to extrahypothalamic brain sites, particularly the lateral septum . Most or all of the VT/VP projections to the LS arise from the neurons of the BSTm, and those BSTm neurons likely innervate other behaviorally relevant regions as well, including the habenula, midbrain central gray, diagonal band of Broca, and the ventral pallidum .
  In line with its theoretical objectives, the study was conceived as qualitative and open ended, aiming at eliciting individual definitions and processes of recovery in order to facilitate in depth understanding of what recovery means and how it happens from the point of view of persons with recurrent mental health problems in Ireland . Constant comparison, theoretical sampling and constant modification of the interview schedule in accordance with the emerging findings  facilitate coding and integration of the theoretical framework . Irish service users consulted during the scoping stage of the study commented that individual interviews were preferable for a recovery study, as people may feel threatened to speak in depth about sensitive individual experiences in a group .
Cardiac muscle contraction is regulated by a Ca2+ triggered cascade of thin and thick filament protein protein interactions. The thin filament is comprised of three molecular units: troponin, tropomyosin, and f actin. Troponin is a heterotrimeric protein complex consisting of troponin C , a Ca2+ binding protein with two EF hand motifs in each terminal domain, troponin I , the subunit which inhibits contraction via its interaction with f actin, and troponin T , a scaffolding protein that tethers troponin to the thin filament through association with cTnI and tropomyosin.
Falls are the leading cause of fatal and nonfatal injuries among adults aged 65 and older . Older adults who fall once are 2 3 times more likely to fall again within one year . Previous research identifies several principal predictors of falls among community dwelling older adults.
The number of patients undergoing primary total hip and knee arthroplasties has steadily increased over the past decade, with nearly 800,000 procedures being performed in the United States each year . The majority of PJIs are thought to occur during surgery, likely originating from skin commensals. This has led to increased screening for S. aureus carriage to ensure that patients undergo decolonization regimens prior to their surgical procedure in an attempt to minimize infection risk .
The aim of this study was to investigate the effect of quantification method on estimates of voluntary quadriceps muscle activation . Twenty two people with no history of serious lower extremity injuries underwent voluntary quadriceps activation testing at 60° of knee flexion. Three electrical pulses at sub maximal intensity were subsequently delivered to familiarize the subjects with electrical stimuli.
Determination of ribonucleic acid structure by NMR spectroscopy can be challenging for a number of reasons. Although spectral resolution can be improved through the use of multi dimensional 13C editing, the aromatic 1H and 13C atoms critical for residue assignment and structure analysis exhibit strong 1H 13C dipolar coupling in larger RNAs, which can result in severely broadened NMR signals. As such, the average size of the 298 RNA NMR structures that have been deposited in the Nucleic Acid Database  to date is only 25 nucleotides, and only 13 comprise more than 50 nucleotides .
Spatial attention helps us select relevant information from rich, noisy, and potentially overwhelming amounts of perceptual information. Although many influential theories of perceptual attention were driven by research in the auditory domain , recent neuroimaging research has predominantly examined the visual modality. One modality can be used to orient another , and we can combine information across modalities to respond to the appropriate location.
Penile cancer is a rare malignancy, and few guidelines are available to define treatment paradigms. For greater understanding of the natural history of surgically treated penile cancer, we analyzed experience at our institution . Using an institutional database, we identified 127 patients treated for squamous cell carcinoma of the penis from 1995  2011.
Each summer U.S. teaching hospitals experience a turnover of resident physicians, leading many to investigate whether declines in patient outcomes occur as a result of operational disruption and relative inexperience of new cohorts of physicians . While substantial variability in results exists across studies of the July effect, most large and high quality studies find a relatively small but statistically significant increase in mortality at the start of the residency year. Mortality outcomes of patients at low risk of inpatient mortality  either because of few severe co morbid conditions or because the disease necessitating hospitalization is relatively low risk  may be unaffected by resident inexperience in July, whereas mortality among hospitalized patients with high predicted mortality may be most affected by errors or relative inexperience at the start of the residency year .
Calicheamicin  γ1I  from Micromonospora echinospora spp. calichensis is a prominent member of the enediyne family due to its unprecedented molecular architecture, remarkable mechanism of action, and clinical utility . Structurally, CLM is a member of the 10 membered enediynes which all share a signature bicycloenediyne core.
Exocyclic nucleobase adducts are among the most important types of DNA damage because of their ability to exert significant biological effects . These lesions are characterized by considerable changes of the molecular size/shape and hydrogen bonding characteristics of the parent nucleobase, leading to mispairing during DNA synthesis . One prominent bis electrophile capable of inducing exocyclic nucleobase lesions is 1,2,3,4 diepoxybutane , the proposed ultimate carcinogenic metabolite of 1,3 butadiene  .
Biologic scaffold materials composed of mammalian extracellular matrix  are commonly used for the repair and reconstruction of injured or missing tissues and organs . The mechanical and material properties of ECM scaffolds and the host tissue response to these biomaterials has been shown to depend upon the tissue specificity of the ECM material , processing methods , hydration , three dimensional configuration , and terminal sterilization . The wide spectrum of clinical outcomes possible as a result of these factors has been recently reviewed for ECM scaffold materials commonly used for orthopedic applications  .
DNA protein cross links  are bulky macromolecular conjugates that can form following the sequential alkylation of DNA and proteins by bis electrophiles. DPCs can be induced by a variety of cytotoxic, mutagenic, and carcinogenic agents, including ionizing radiation , transition metals , endogenous and exogenous aldehydes , and chemotherapeutic drugs . As a result of their bulky nature and their ability to distort DNA structure, DPCs are expected to block the binding and progression of protein complexes involved in crucial cellular processes, including DNA replication, transcription, repair, recombination, and chromatin remodeling .
Hypertension and cerebral amyloid angiopathy  account for most primary intracerebral hemorrhage. CAA affects the vessels of the cortex and leptomeninges without significant involvement of the penetrating. By contrast, hypertension causes arteriosclerosis in both cortical and subcortical arteries.
The use of a newly developed three dimensional  ultrasound method to measure volume blood flow  is reported. This method was originally proposed by  and . At the time they performed their studies, however, suitable 3D scanning technology was not available.
It has been suggested that cultural identification is strongly associated with the expression of certain anxiety disorders . Yet, while this interest is growing, there still remains a dearth of information about the mental health picture of non White race ethnic groups in the United States  . Past studies have primarily documented lower prevalence rates of anxiety disorders in minority groups as compared to their White counterparts.
Cell transplantation shows great promise for repair and restoration of heart function following myocardial infarction . Several interventions, including the use of cells over expressing pro survival/anti apoptotic proteins , and pharmacological agents , have been reported to augment survival, function, and homing of the transplanted cells in the hostile ischemic environment . They reported a higher proportion of engraftment when compared to simpler interventions .
Many common causes of blindness involve the death of retinal photoreceptors: in Retinitis Pigmentosa  mutations, typically in photoreceptor specific genes, lead to progressive degeneration of rods and cones and gradual loss all useful sight. A strategy for improving vision in RP is the development of prostheses based upon retinal implants designed to electrically stimulate deep retinal layers and thereby taking over the function of lost photoreceptors . Both subretinal and epiretinal electronic prostheses have the capability to stimulate retinal ganglion cells  directly .
Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma , accounts for 650,000 new cases worldwide  with more than 12% distributed in China . Unfortunately, most patients in China are already in advanced stages when diagnosed and over 76,000 die each year  . Nearly 20% of OSCC patients harbor multiple pre malignant lesions, often identified as leukoplakia .
Hantaviruses, enveloped RNA viruses of the family Bunyaviridae, are known to cause hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome  and hantavirus cardiopulmonary syndrome  in humans. The HFRS is found primarily in Europe and Asia, and presents as an acute febrile illness associated with marked renal involvement. Hantavirus cardiopulmonary syndrome, found primarily in North and South America, is characterized by dramatic cardiopulmonary collapse.
Konzo is an upper motor neuron disease characterized by a sudden onset of a non progressive and irreversible spastic paraparesis . Outbreaks of konzo have been reported from several remote rural areas of the Democratic Republic of Congo, Central African Republic, Tanzania, and Mozambique . The pathogenetic mechanisms of konzo have yet to be elucidated.
During adolescence, structural remodeling occurs in a number of brain regions, including the hippocampus, where neural plasticity is a characteristic throughout the lifespan . Adolescence is also a period of rapid behavioral and physiological change. Likewise, developmental changes in learning and memory occur in conjunction with the adolescent development of a variety of social and nonsocial behaviors .
RNA dependent protein kinase  is an interferon induced, double stranded , RNA activated serine/threonine protein kinase that has a well established role in anti viral defense mechanisms. In the absence of viral infections, however, PKR also plays a role in other important cellular functions including growth control, apoptosis regulation, cell proliferation, signal transduction and differentiation. Lastly, in studies of primary human cancers from the head and neck, thyroid and colon, increasing PKR expression has been correlated with more well differentiated tumors and diminished proliferative activity, suggesting that PKR regulates tumor suppression.
Myotendinous junctions  are highly specialized and architecturally complex structures which form at the interface between muscle and tendon . Structural and functional interaction between muscle and tendon cells at the MTJ, especially mechanical force transduction, results in the development of the adult phenotype. Type I collagen is the predominant ECM component comprising more than 60% of the tendon’s dry weight .
Recent epidemiologic studies suggest that sunlight may protect against non Hodgkin lymphoma . Most ,  studies,  including a pooled analysis of 10 studies, have found inverse associations between NHL risk and individual  sun exposure, evaluated in terms of self reported time outdoors, sunbathing or other behavioral exposures during various ages. Ultraviolet radiation  exposure is the product of many factors, including not only duration of sun exposure, and host susceptibility characteristics , but also season and geographic location, among others.
Tumor cells have been characterized by “plasticity”, or the capacity to transition between mesenchymal  or amoeboid  migration mechanisms thought to be analogous to normal physiological function for motile cell types such as fibroblasts or immune cells  . Direct comparisons between tumorigenic and non tumorigenic cell types   thought to utilize analogous migration modes   have revealed important differences in function  . For example, while HT 1080 fibrosarcoma cells  were previously characterized by a mesenchymal mode that was qualitatively similar to motile fibroblasts in collagen , , pronounced differences in cytoskeletal structure and cell adhesion properties have been identified through comparisons with human dermal fibroblasts  cultured using identical 2D and 3D cell culture platforms  .
Over the last four million years, the Earth has undergone frequent climatic oscillations including many ice ages . Recent studies making use of the increased power afforded by genome scale data have allowed to test increasingly finer hypotheses regarding the existence and the timing of post divergence gene flow  . The impact that quaternary climatic fluctuations had on speciation is highly dependent on the taxa and the geographic range .
Eukaryotic cells contain a set of functionally distinct membrane bound compartments called organelles. Peroxisomes are organelles that are found in almost all eukaryotic cells. The family of dynamin related proteins  has been implicated in multiple membrane remodelling events in eukaryotic cells.
18F is the most commonly used isotope for positron emission tomography , due to its nearly ideal imaging properties . Conventionally, 18F is attached to peptides by binding it to a carbon atom , but attachments to silicon  and boron  also have been reported. The most common use of 18F labeled peptides is to image receptor sites in vivo .
Protein motions are necessary for an enzyme's biological function, but the role of enzyme dynamics at various timescales and their contribution toward catalytic activity is not clear. Enzymes undergo slow conformational sampling that involves large regions of the protein moving on time scales of nanoseconds to seconds. In addition, there are local motions that occur on the picosecond to femtosecond time scale.
Weakness in the autoimmune disease, myasthenia gravis  is caused by antibodies directed against skeletal muscle acetylcholine receptors  on the muscle membrane portion of the endplate . These antibodies reduce the number of AChRs at the endplate  by a combination of complement mediated membrane lysis  and acceleration of AChR catabolism by receptor cross linking . Weakness in PTMG begins about 12 hours after antibody injection and peaks at 48 hours .
The link between chronic inflammation and tumor progression is now a well accepted concept . Natural plant derived compounds are an attractive class of investigational agents for cancer prevention and treatment. TRP, a diterpenoid triepoxide, has been used as an anti inflammatory agent for diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis for centuries in Chinese natural medicine .
Polybrominated diphenyl ethers  are flame retardant chemicals that have been used in commercial products such as textiles, plastics, wood, electronic materials, and polyurethane foam . At high temperatures, PBDEs release bromine radicals that inhibit the spread of flame . For example, in mammalian and avian wildlife, exposures to relevant levels of PBDEs have been linked with deleterious effects on offspring development and thyroid function  .
Smoking is the number one preventable cause of premature death in the United States with approximately 440,000 dying each year . There are several behavioral and pharmacological interventions that improve cessation rates. Nicotine replacement therapies, such as gum or the patch, provide small doses of nicotine, the addictive component in tobacco, to alleviate withdrawal symptoms .
An important logistical limitation of quantitative positron emission tomography  scans is the need to measure, during image acquisition, the concentration over time of the parent radiotracer in plasma, i.e. the input function. This is generally done by collecting serial arterial blood samples, then separating the fraction of parent compound from its radiometabolites. Towards this end, one of the most often studied techniques is image derived input function .
Each year, it is estimated that 250 000 anterior cruciate ligament  reconstruction surgeries are performed in the USA. The average cost associated with ACL injuries, including diagnostic tests, surgery and rehabilitation, is conservatively estimated to be $17 000 per each reconstructive case from 1999 data. Time lost from ACL injury can be 6 months or longer.
Faces, unlike many of the visual stimuli that we encounter each day, are processed holistically. One issue that has complicated progress in understanding holistic processing is that there are numerous different meanings and measures of holistic processing in the literature . Faces are presented sequentially; a study face composed of two face halves is shown, followed by a blank screen or mask, and then a test face.
Young adults ages 1824 have the highest smoking prevalence compared to other age groups in the United States . During young adulthood many people either make the transition from occasional use to addiction or stop smoking . Tobacco industry marketing aggressively targets young adults , and marketing to this group is largely unrestricted in the United States .
Acute and chronic rhinosinusitis are a common cause of significant morbidity and healthcare expenditure. Therapies for CRS are divided into medical and surgical options. Medical therapies have traditionally included antibiotics, corticosteroid and antihistamine nasal sprays, and nasal irrigation.
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are a diverse family of ligand gated cation channels that are expressed throughout the nervous system. Its dysfunction has been implicated in many neurological and neuropsychiatric disorders such as Alzheimer’s disease , schizophrenia , and Down’s syndrome . Furthermore, in macrophages, α7 AChRs regulate an anti inflammatory pathway by controlling the production of proinflamatory cytokines  .
Endometrial cancer is the most common female gynaecological cancer in the United States, ranking fourth among all cancers in women in age adjusted incidence . However, despite the well established association of estrogens unopposed by progesterone and endometrial cancer , the role of phytoestrogens in endometrial cancer risk has received little attention . Phytoestrogens are non steroidal plant derived compounds, structurally similar to endogenous estrogens, but capable of showing both estrogenic and antiestrogenic effects .
Murine B cell development is a leading developmental system for the analysis of gene regulatory networks that orchestrate cell fate ‘choice’ and lineage commitment . The analyses of early B cell development are thus highly advanced, as regulatory networks of signaling molecules and transcription factors have been elucidated that endeavor to account for the generation of B lineage progeny from multi potent progenitors . Published work suggests that B lymphocytes develop from lymphoid primed multi potent progenitors  in the bone marrow that also give rise to myeloid progeny such as macrophages and granulocytes .
Novel targeted therapies for cancer include immune therapy and small molecule targeted therapies. Targeted therapies inhibit cell signaling pathways critical for cancer cell growth, division, and metastasis. There is rationale for considering combinations of these approaches.
The effect of vitamin D on a wide variety of non skeletal health outcomes, including colorectal cancer , has been the subject of considerable debate . High vitamin D has been associated with reduced risk of CRC in observational studies evaluating dietary intake , circulating 25 hydroxyvitamin D , and predicted 25D . A recent meta analysis of observational data reported a 26% lower risk of CRC  per 10 ng/mL increment in blood 25D levels .
Sudden cardiac death following myocardial infarction  is the most common cause of mortality from heart disease. Furthermore, declining death rates from acute MI have increased the population of patients with chronic MI that are at risk for developing ventricular arrhythmias. As we and others,  have shown, abnormal intracellular Ca2+ cycling is a well established mechanism of alternans.
The Junín, Machupo and Guanarito clade B new world hemorrhagic fever arenaviruses  are associated with outbreaks in Argentina, Bolivia and Venezuela, respectively . Because they are readily transmitted by aerosols, these Category A arenaviruses are potential bioterrorism agents and are included in the list of agents in the Material Threat Determinations and Population Threat Assessment issued by the Department of Homeland Security . Although an effective Junín virus vaccine has greatly decreased disease incidence, there are sporadic cases of this as well as the other known and novel clade B arenaviruses .
Death certificates are the main data source for many mortality studies. These data are often used to identify public health problems, allocate funding, and set new goals. Previous studies suggest that death certificates, compared with other data sources, may misclassify the underlying cause of death, especially in older individuals with multiple comorbidities.
Lung cancer is the most common cancer and the leading cause of cancer death both globally and in the United States. In prospective studies, a study in Norway involving 51,452 subjects and 154 lung cancer cases noted a significant protective effect of cod liver oil  against lung cancer ; and a Japanese prospective study showed that frequent consumption of fresh fish or shellfish was associated with lower lung cancer risk . Studies have indicated that in contrast to the cancer preventive effect of n 3 PUFA, n 6 PUFA such as linoleic acid  is associated with higher risk of cancer .
Nucleotide Excision Repair  in eukaryotes repairs DNA via a cascade of biochemical interactions requiring more than 30 proteins. Genetic defects in NER in humans lead to several cancer prone conditions including Xeroderma pigmentosum. NER can function in two modes with differing recognition steps: global genome repair  and transcription coupled repair .
Calcium regulated exocytosis is a process by which vesicles containing neurotransmitters or hormones fuse with the plasma membrane . Several groups of proteins coordinate this multistep process. However, the Ca2+ sensor responsible for vesicle refilling and priming is still not well characterized .
In radioactive decay, three types of radiations can be produced: alpha particles ; beta particles ; and gamma rays  . Gamma radiation has a very small wavelength  and therefore has high energy, which is capable of ionizing molecules and atoms. These hydroxyl radicals  are the predominant source of ionizing radiation induced damage to cellular components including lipids, proteins and genomic DNA.
Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial disease , and is associated with elevated rates of mortality and morbidity. Thus, intermittent claudication impairs ambulation, daily physical activity, and health related quality of life. Walking economy, defined as the oxygen uptake during ambulation, is a key aspect in sustaining ambulatory activities.
Sexual reproduction provides genetic variation that allows populations to adapt to changing environments  and in some species such as cyclical parthenogenetic monogonont rotifers its product is a diapausing embryo. This embryo remains in a state of suspended animation until conditions favorable for hatching occur, thus allowing the population to persist under adverse environments. Although monogonont rotifer mating behavior was first described more than 40 years ago, few studies have provided detailed information on specific components of the mating sequence .
Synaptic vesicle components, including vesicular membrane proteins, are constantly transported by constitutive vesicles from the cell soma to the active zone at the presynaptic membrane. In order to refill the readily releasable pool depleted after exocytosis during stimulation, sufficient SVs should be available in the slow response and reserve pools within the pre active zone, a region proximal to the active zone . Synapsin, an F actin interacting protein has recently been shown to structurally maintain the SVs within the pre active zone , and scaffolding proteins, including Rim1, have also been reported to contribute to the maintenance of SVs in these zones  .
Defining the molecular mechanisms underlying synapse loss presents a critical challenge to understanding neurodegenerative disease pathology. By contrast, mutations that directly affect mitochondrial metabolism cause early onset neurodegeneration in a number of developmental disorders, including Leigh Syndrome, Leber’s Hereditary Optic Neuropathy and Kearns Sayre Syndrome . These behavioral deficits are associated with lesions in several sub cortical structures, as well as optic atrophy .
The global emergence of novel psychoactive drugs of abuse has triggered the need for close monitoring around the world. One class of anorexigenic compounds studied in the early 1960s was based on the 5 phenyl 4,5 dihydrooxazol 2 amine  template structure . The majority of these analogs published by Poos et al.  All reagents and dry solvents used in the syntheses were obtained from Sigma Aldrich Ltd. .
Platelet activating factor , prostaglandins  and lysophosphatidic acid  are three major phospholipid mediators shown to be involved in many different biological pathways in inflammatory diseases and cancer . Like PGs and LPA, PAF is an important proinflammatory activator of platelets, neutrophils, macrophages, lymphocytes and endothelial cells, which are often essential micro environmental components interacting with the cancer cells  . PAF also plays a significant role in oncogenic transformation , anti apoptosis , metastasis  and angiogenesis in several types of cancers .
A number of cyanobacterial lectins bind with high affinity to high mannose oligosaccharides on viral envelope glycoproteins, preventing virus attachment and entry into target cells . These natural products might therefore be utilized to prevent or treat human viral diseases. One potential target for lectin therapy is the Zaire Ebola virus , the causative agent of the current epidemic in West Africa.
AS1411 is a 26 base guanine rich oligonucleotide  with an unmodified  DNA backbone. This molecule and its related analogs can inhibit proliferation and induce cell death in many types of cancer cells, but have little effect on normal cells . A Phase I clinical trial of AS1411  in patients with metastatic cancer has indicated no serious adverse effects with promising clinical activity, and AS1411 is now being tested in Phase II trials  .
Cervical cancer, a virally caused cancer, is the second most common cancer and the second most frequent cause of death by cancer in women worldwide . The vast majority of cervical cancers are associated with the so called high risk human papillomaviruses , among which HPV 16 is most common, being found in approximately 60% of all cervical cancers . Despite the robust carcinogenic potential of E6 and E7, HPV infection alone is not sufficient for the development of cervical cancer because only a minor fraction of patients infected with HPV develop cervical cancer .
Transgender people are individuals who do not identify with the gender that society commonly associates with their birth sex assignment . Discrimination against trans persons has been reported to be pervasive in society, including in housing, healthcare, employment, and education . Wilchins and Taylor  and others suggest that race and gender presentation influence trans people’s experiences of discrimination .
Delay  discounting refers to the devaluation of an outcome as a function of the time to the delivery of that outcome. A variety of reward outcomes have been used in discounting experiments including money, compact disks, alcohol and cigarettes . These rewards are typically hypothetical and used in lieu of real rewards for three reasons.
Chondroitin sulfate  is a linear, polydisperse, microheterogeneous, anionic polysaccharide having an average molecular weight of 10,00030,000 Da. Bacterial chondroitin lyases serve a role in the initial microbial catabolism of CSs  and have found many applications as analytical tools in carbohydrate biochemistry , for the determination of the type of CS present in cells and tissues , for the quantitative analysis of CS , for the preparation of new therapeutic agents , and most recently in the removal of glial scar CS in the treatment of spinal cord injury  . The increased use of these enzymes, particularly for medical applications, has led to the isolation, cloning, and recombinant expression of new bacterial chondroitin lyases .
The Family System Genetic Illness model postulates the importance of a family centered approach in understanding the impacts of genetically influenced illnesses on coping and adaptation of family members due to the presence of future disease risk for multiple family members . When mutations associated with hereditary disorders are identified, this information inevitably concerns multiple members of the family. Consequently, disclosure of genetic test results influences family relationships as well as theoverall family environment .
Synapse development requires recruitment and precise alignment of synaptic vesicles and release apparatus in axons opposite appropriate neurotransmitter receptors and postsynaptic machinery on dendrites. Mimicking these alterations in mice can phenocopy the psychiatric disorder  . Different isoforms of neurexins and neuroligins selectively contribute to glutamatergic or GABAergic synapse development.
The formation of an emulsion from two immiscible fluids  leads to the generation of interfacial area between the two fluids. , This generation of interfacial area requires that work be performed, typically through processes such as ultrasonication or mechanical agitation. The resulting emulsions are kinetically stable, and surfactants are typically used to slow processes such as coalescence of the dispersed phase.
It has been estimated that nearly a quarter of American adults have the metabolic syndrome. Inhibition of stearoyl CoA desaturase 1  has been proposed as an attractive strategy for preventing most aspects of the metabolic syndrome including obesity, insulin resistance,,,, hypertriglyceridemia,, and hepatic steatosis. ,,,, However, several unwanted side effects are associated with SCD1 inhibition or deletion, including alopecia and accelerated atherosclerosis.
Immune targeting of tumor antigens that are over expressed by cancer cells in numerous cancer types with limited expression in normal tissues holds significant promise for widespread clinical application. Folate receptor alpha  is a glycosylphosphatidylinositol anchored protein that is overexpressed on the surface of cancer cells in a spectrum of epithelial malignancies, including ovarian, breast, renal, colorectal, lung and other solid cancers but limited in normal tissues . FRα overexpression is associated with high grade, tumor progression and poor prognosis in ovarian cancer  and poor survival in breast cancer , and therefore represents an attractive candidate for targeted biologic therapy of epithelial derived cancers, particularly for epithelial ovarian carcinomas  where nearly 90% of cancers express FRα .
Hemoglobins are heme proteins present in all groups of organisms, even those without a bloodstream. They carry out different functions, including transport of oxygen between tissues, intracellular oxygen transport and catalysis of redox reactions . Mammalian Hb has been traditionally thought to be exclusively present in erythrocytes circulating in blood.
It is becoming increasingly clear that the quality and quantity of innate immune responses that are induced by the host in response to lentivirus infections in humans and nonhuman primates plays a critical role in establishing the course of infection and the dynamics of disease . Among the cell lineages that play a prominent role in mediating such innate immune responses are cells of the NK cell lineage. Among these are the diverse arrays of receptors which can mediate either activating or inhibitory signals.
The life of a T lymphocyte can be divided into multiple distinct stages . Thymocyte precursors that are CD4−CD8− double negative  mature into CD4+CD8+ double positive  and then either CD4+ or CD8+ single positive  thymocytes. When a naïve T cell encounters its cognate antigen it undergoes activation and proliferation and differentiates into effector T cells.
In the guinea pig 17 β estradiol  treatment increases the mRNA expression of T type calcium channel subunit, Cav3.1 , in hypothalamic nuclei, including the arcuate nucleus . Increased excitability with E2 treatment has also been observed in ventromedial hypothalamic  neurons . Voltage gated Ca2+ channels represent a heterogenous family of calcium selective channels that are critical for controlling calcium entry and neuronal firing in a number of brain regions including the hypothalamus .
Olfactory studies indicate that the detection of odorants by olfactory receptors  is performed in a combinatorial fashion, such that each receptor can bind different odorants and, conversely, each odorant is capable of binding to various receptors . Comparative data from these two stages of the olfactory system: peripheral receptors and behavior, added to an understanding of processing effects at intermediate stages, e.g., olfactory bulb  and cortex , are necessary to achieve a comprehensive picture of the functional aspects of the sense of smell, among them, odorant sensitivity . At the behavioral level, this chemical family is an important component in the determination of human body odor .
Nerve conduction block is an important technique for use in both basic experimental neuroscience  and in applied neurophysiology and neuroengineering research . Numerous methods for achieving nerve conduction block have been devised and include techniques which can be categorized into four broad categories: chemical methods, thermal methods, electrical methods and methods which involve physical tissue trauma. Thermal blocking methods include reversible nerve cooling  and irreversible thermal ablation.
Cranial irradiation is an effective treatment for primary and metastatic central nervous system tumors . However, it is well known that long term complications of radiation therapy can be severe, especially in children. The cognitive consequences of radiation treatment are usually debilitating.
Protein C, a vitamin Kdependent plasma glycoprotein synthesized in the liver, is one of the most important endogenous anticoagulants. Upon activation by the thrombin thrombomodulin complex, it inactivates factor Va and factor VIIIa, consequently reducing thrombin generation. Hereditary protein C deficiency, characterized by reduction of protein C levels or activity, is due to rare genetic mutations and contributes to familial venous thrombosis .
In the periphery, naive T lymphocytes are sensitive to different fate determination pathways due to their intrinsic epigenetic plasticity. Th17 is a recently recognised third Teff type, generated in the presence of interleukin 6  and associated with chronic inflammatory conditions. The immune competent individual requires control mechanisms to protect against auto immune disease.
Sarcoglycans are members of the dystrophin glycoprotein complex  found in the sarcolemma that are important in maintaining integrity of the muscle against forces generated during contractions . There is evidence of aberrant neurohumoral activation in muscular dystrophy . Angiotensin converting enzyme  converts angiotensin I to angiotensin II  that acts via angiotensin type 1  and type 2  receptors.
Mutation of the STK11/LKB1  gene is the causative genetic defect underlying the autosomal dominant Peutz Jeghers syndrome  . LKB1 encodes a ubiquitously expressed serine/threonine kinase that affects cell growth, cell cycle progression, glucose and fatty acid metabolism, mitochondrial function, cell polarity, migration, and angiogenesis . The primary targets of LKB1 appear to be a family of AMP activated protein kinases  .
NK cells are experts in the destruction of tumor and virally infected cells . They are considered to be a component of the innate immune system and the specificity their effector functions relies on an integrated processing of signals, transduced by activating, and inhibitory receptors . Inhibitory receptors recognize molecules such as MHC class I proteins that are expressed on healthy cells to protect these cells from NK cell attack.
Glucagon like Peptide 1  was originally discovered as a gut hormone that is secreted by the endocrine L cells in the small intestine and colon following exposure to ingested nutrients . In addition, it has been well established that, in the pancreas, GLP 1 stimulates insulin secretion from insulin producing β cells in a blood glucose dependent manner, and inhibits glucagon secretion from the glucagon producing α cells, thus plays an essential role in blood glucose regulation  . GLP 1 and glucagon share the same precursor molecule—proglucagon.
In cancer, a tumor’s switch to angiogenesis is a rate limiting stepin its progression from microscopic to macroscopic size . In contrast, the conversefinding—of tumors that switch off angiogenesis and thus cease macroscopicgrowth—is rare . In experimental models of pathological conditionsit is rare to observe small, stepwise accumulation of additional vessels.
The PGSA  aims at avoiding problems of sample representativeness and ethical issues typical of placebo controlled secondary prevention trials with MCI patients. The PGSA uses mathematical modeling to forecast the distribution of quantified outcomes of MCI patient groups based on their own baseline data established at the outset of clinical trials. These forecasted distributions are then compared with the distribution of actual outcomes observed on candidate treatments, thus substituting for a concomitant placebo group.
Infection by Kaposi’s sarcoma associated herpesvirus , also known as human herpesvirus 8 , is associated with the development of Kaposi’s sarcoma , primary effusion lymphoma   and a subset of multicentric Castleman’s diseases . The switch from KSHV latent to lytic replication can be initiated by specific intracellular signals or extracellular stimuli including chemical inducers such as 12 O tetradecanoyl phorbol 13 acetate  and sodium butyrate that activate the expression of this key lytic switch protein. RTA has been shown to activate the transcription of several downstream viral genes, including ORFK1 , ORFK2 , ORFK3 , ORFK5 , ORFK6 , PAN RNAs , ORF35 , ORF49 , ORF50 itself , ORFK8 , ORF57 , ORFK9 , ORF74 , ORFK12 , and ORFK15 .
Acute graft versus host disease , a disease of selective epithelial damage, is a severe complication of allogeneic stem cell transplantation . Chemokines bind G protein coupled chemokine receptors, which direct the migration of lymphocytes to target locations. However, despite multiple attempts, we have not been successful in completely preventing aGvHD by blocking proteins important for T cell migration .
Inflammatory activation of macrophages occurs in atheromatous plaques , inflamed adipose tissue in obesity , and tumors . For instance, superoxide radical anion  is produced primarily, but not exclusively, by NADPH oxidases . Peroxynitrite has been shown to nitrate proteins in cells with the intermediacy of transient protein centered radicals  .
Pancreatic cystic lesions  comprise a variety of pathologically different groups of lesions that usually share many common clinical features . About 90% of PCLs are benign processes such as pseudocysts related to acute or chronic pancreatitis . Pancreatic cystic neoplasms  constitute 1015% of all PCLs and less than 1% of all pancreatic neoplasms .
Intracerebral hemorrhage  remains a major medical problem, which so far does not have an effective treatment. This response includes the infiltration of neutrophils and macrophages into and around the hematoma, which peaks at 48 to 72 hours after ICH onset  . Many studies attribute a significant involvement of leukocytes in ICH induced brain injury .
A number of potential markers for the identification of multipotent bone marrow stromal cells have been developed in recent years . While alkaline phosphatase  is expressed by mature osteoblasts, recent studies have demonstrated that the AP+ fraction of human bone marrow  contains virtually all of the osteoprogenitor population in the marrow , indicating that AP expression is associated not only with mature osteoblasts, but likely also with osteoblastic cells at varying stages of differentiation, including relatively early mesenchymal cells . Subsequent studies by others have provided further support for the existence of circulating osteoprogenitor cells, although the precise relationship of these circulating cells to their BM counterparts remains to be fully defined.
MEG is a functional imaging technique that directly measures neuronal activity with millisecond temporal resolution. The key outcomes of MEG source imaging are the source locations and the source time courses of neuronal activities responsible for the observed MEG field distribution. However, if no constraint is imposed, there are many sets of source configurations that can generate essentially the same MEG field distribution.
Elucidating the neural basis of common psychiatric disorders, such as anxiety and addiction, can guide the development of novel preventions and therapeutics. Neuroimaging methods provide a powerful tool for examining neural circuits in vivo and progress has been made in identifying the neurocircuitry of anxiety  and addiction . Research in rodents has established that the BNST mediates sustained anxiety responses .
Many studies in recent years have investigated the brain network involved in speech production and have identified a set of regions supporting processes related to reading, retrieving, and articulating words. Despite the uncertainty over the units that drive articulation, previous neuroimaging studies have presented evidence that manipulating syllabic and phonemic content of stimuli modulates the activity of certain regions from the speech network. Regions that have been associated with different aspects of phoneme level processes include the inferior frontal sulcus , the posterior parts of the inferior frontal gyrus , the posterior superior temporal gyrus , and the superior cerebellum .
Computed tomography  is a widely used modality to guide percutaneous biopsy of lesions located within the liver and the lung . It is preferable to have both the skin entry point and the target lesion within the same imaging plane in order to follow the biopsy needle during the image guided procedure and to avoid critical structures. This technique has been reported for biopsies of the lung , primarily, and the liver, but other applications, including biopsy retrieval of suspicious masses in the pelvis, have been reported as well  .
The biological basis of T cell depletion in animal models for the prevention of GVHD has been established since 1968. Using the Center for International Blood and Marrow Transplant Research  database, Champlin et al. evaluated various T cell depletion strategies in 870 patients with leukemia who received T cell depleted transplants from unrelated or HLA mismatched related donors from 1982 to 1994. In vivo administration of T cell  and B cell depleting agents as GVHD prophylaxis is a much simpler strategy and therefore much more generalizable in its application .
The large gene family of G protein coupled receptors  has major roles in health and disease. In general, most GPCR disease causing polymorphisms are either amino acid altering point mutations or truncations that lead to GPCR misfolding. These structural changes cause a variety of altered pharmacological properties, including reduced ligand binding, loss of intrinsic function, increased intracellular retention, and decreased plasma membrane expression.
Aldosterone excess is increasingly recognized as a common cause of hypertension. Compared to patients with similar levels of hypertension, patients with hyperaldosteronism have greater left ventricular  hypertrophy, worse diastolic function and an increased rate of cardiovascular complications including myocardial infarction, stroke, and atrial fibrillation. A large body of experimental literature, including landmark studies by Brilla and Weber, clearly demonstrates that aldosterone excess in the presence of high dietary salt intake induces LV hypertrophy and fibrosis.
Feeding conditions can impact the behavioral effects of directly acting dopamine receptor agonists . For example, food restriction decreases the frequency of quinpirole induced yawning in rats . Dopamine receptor agonist induced yawning generates an inverted U shaped dose response curve with the induction of yawning  thought to be mediated by D3 receptors and the decrease in yawning  thought to be mediated by D2 receptors .
Standardized auditory thresholds are measured clinically for frequencies only through 6 kHz by bone conduction, but up to 16 kHz by air conduction . This lack of information can influence decisions for setting the high frequency gain for conventional hearing aids, and may also influence decisions for using frequency transposition hearing aids that transpose high frequency information to lower frequency regions. First, it is now known that speech contains more high frequency information than previously thought .
Chromatin immunoprecipitation  has become an important assay for the genome wide study of protein DNA interactions and gene regulation. A genome wide readout of the protein binding sites is produced either by hybridization of the DNA pool to a tiling array  or by end sequencing of millions of different DNA fragments . As a consequence, ChIP chip is being rapidly displaced by ChIP Seq in genome wide discovery of mammalian transcription factor binding sites .
Phenylketonuria , one of the most common human inborn errors of metabolism, is caused by recessively inherited phenylalanine hydroxylase  deficiency . PAH deficiency leads to chronically elevated L phenylalanine  in blood and brain, and if left untreated, causes profound cognitive disability. However, PKU therapy requires lifelong strict adherence to an unpalatable and complicated diet, and mild cognitive deficits still persist in some treated children .
Alzheimer’s disease is a neurodegenerative disorder characterized by severe cognitive impairment and neurofibrillary tangles , and shows disrupted functional neuronal metabolic activity in specific brain regions . Brain derived neurotrophic factor  is a member of the ‘neurotrophin’ family of growth factors related to the nerve growth factor, which is critical for the survival and maintenance of sympathetic and sensory neurons . Without the nerve growth factor, the sympathetic and sensory neurons will undergo apoptosis.
Total laryngectomy results in a variety of functional changes including the loss of normal laryngeal voice and alterations in swallowing physiology . Current literature recognizes tracheoesophageal  voice restoration as the preferred alaryngeal speech alternative in most patients with total laryngectomy. Although total laryngectomy disrupts the neurophysiology of the oropharynx, patients who have undergone total laryngectomy rarely complain of significant swallowing impairments.
The cell surface expressed glucagon like peptide 1 receptor  has emerged as a high value drug target in diabetes. GLP1R is highly expressed on insulin producing pancreatic β cells but unfortunately there is a lack of suitable antibodies that could be used for reliable identification. The fortuitous discovery of GLP1R peptide antagonists from the gila monster has led to the development of different exendin 4  derived therapeutics, many with nM affinity., In addition, certain E4 derivatives are being developed for whole body nuclear imaging or intraoperative imaging.
Variation in patient outcomes is attributable to variation in individual patient attributes, variation in care processes and structures, and random variation. Though patient attributes have the greatest impact on ultimate outcomes,  opportunity exists to improve patient outcomes through both refining and reducing variability in clinical care processes. By identifying aspects of care with the greatest effect on specific outcomes, clinicians could focus efforts on changes in care with the greatest clinical impact, even among patients at low risk of experiencing suboptimal outcomes.
Colorectal cancer is the second most common cause of cancer related death in the United States. In 2009, an estimated 106,100 new cases will be diagnosed and 49,920 deaths will occur. Recent evidence suggests that there are gender related differences in the development of colonic carcinomas.
Fractures are a common consequence of falls in older adults that occur when the applied load exceeds bone strength. Frost proposed that bone adaptation occurs to maintain strains within a particular biological set point .
