In growing children, exercise that loads the skeleton leads to long term increases in bone mineral content .
The hepatitis C virus  is the most common blood borne infection and affects approximately 2% of the U.S. population . HCV causes inflammation of the liver that can be characterized by liver enlargement, fibrosis, cirrhosis, abnormal liver function, and other symptoms. Pain conditions in HCV patients are also common.
Current investigations of cell cycle progression and arrest typically make use of endpoint measurements in fixed cells. Bulk analysis eliminates the ability to observe variability within a population; synchronization procedures may irreversibly interfere with normal cycle progression; and fixation gives only a snapshot of a truly dynamic process. Time lapse, live, unsynchronized single cell analysis using transmitted light microscopy is limited to the observation of prominent morphology changes like those occurring in mitosis, and the experiments are difficult to perform.
Prostate cancer is the most frequent solid cancer in older men in the Western world, representing one of the most frequent causes of cancer deaths, and is now emerging in developing countries as well . The receptor tyrosine kinase Axl  belongs to the TAM  family whose members are distinguished from each other by a conserved sequence within the kinase domain and adhesion molecule like domains in the extracellular region. Previous reports have shown Axl to have transforming potential when overexpressed .
The term “syndemics” refers to multiple, overlapping adverse health conditions that affect each other synergistically within a population. The term was introduced by Merrill Singer  following its description by Wallace in the late 1980s . Interest in syndemic associations in public health has grown in recent years, particularly among men who have sex with men .
The ability to accurately estimate a molecule’s properties given molecular structure has been a goal for over a century. Methods that can also help to elucidate molecular features associated with a property may prove useful for designing and optimizing candidate molecules. In this paper we present a method for modeling chemical mutagenicity, the ability of a chemical to cause genetic mutations, and show how the models may be interpreted in terms of simple molecular features familiar to chemists.
Patients with chronic liver disease  often show hepatic encephalopathy , a complex neuropsychiatric syndrome. In the early phases, known as minimal hepatic encephalopathy , patients do not show evident symptoms of encephalopathy, but show mild cognitive impairment, attention deficits, psychomotor slowing and impaired bimanual and visuomotor coordination which can be unveiled using psychometric tests . MHE can progress to clinical HE, showing evident, more serious alterations in motor activity and coordination , in intellectual and cognitive functions and alterations in consciousness which, in the worst cases, can progress to coma and death.
Stress is a potent motivator of opiate seeking and relapse . These effects are mediated, in part, by the corticotropin releasing factor 1  receptor in the anterolateral bed nucleus of the stria terminalis . The BSTal, comprised within the extended amygdala, is a complex limbic brain region implicated in many of the motivational aspects of opiate dependence .
Mesencephalic astrocyte derived neurotrophic factor , an endoplasmic reticulum  stress protein , was first purified from the conditioned medium of a ventral mesencephalic cell line 1  . Subsequent studies have shown that MANF protein does not contain this arginine rich region . MANF belongs to the same family of evolutionarily conserved proteins as the conserved dopamine neurotrophic factor  .
Familial Amyloidosis of Finnish type  is a rare type of autosomal dominant hereditary amyloidosis associated with variant gelsolin. Thus far only three causative mutations in the GSN gene have been reported, two resulting from change of aspartate at position 214 to either asparagine or tyrosine  and one from replacing glycine with arginine at codon 194  . The distinct clinical features of FAF include cranial neuropathy, corneal lattice dystrophy, distal sensorimotor neuropathy and skin changes.
Migraine is a chronic neurovascular disorder characterized by recurrent episodes of severe unilateral throbbing head pain and associated symptoms, such as photophobia . Mechanistic studies in the field of migraine pathophysiology are hampered by the lack of appropriate animal models. This mouse is sensitized to the calcitonin gene related peptide , a key player in migraine pathophysiology , by overexpression of the human receptor activity modifying protein 1  subunit of the CGRP receptor in the nervous system .
The collective term “homing” refers to the early stages of bone marrow  seeding by hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells  after transplantation, which precedes engraftment, proliferation, and differentiation of these cells. However, it is well demonstrated that α chemokine stromal derived factor 1    chemokine receptor CXCR4 axis and vascular cell adhesion molecule 1    very late antigen 4  interactions play important roles in these processes. It is well known that conditioning for transplantation by chemo/radiotherapy destroys old hematopoiesis and by emptying hematopoietic niches, makes space available for transplanted cells and highly upregulates expression of SDF 1 in the BM microenvironment, which creates a proper chemoattracting gradient for HSPCs .
Although recent trends suggest a decline in substance use among middle school students in the United States, their level of use remains a concern. In this paper, we investigate the role of teacher training in fidelity of implementation of evidence based substance use prevention curricula . As of the beginning of the decade, however, a large majority of the nation’s middle schools had not yet implemented any evidence based curricula  .
MicroRNAs  are small  single stranded RNA molecules that bind to messenger RNA and block subsequent protein production by either inhibiting translation machinery or inducing message degradation, depending on the degree of complementarity . Genes encoding miRNA produce a primary transcript , which is cotranscriptionally cleaved by a complex containing the double stranded RNA binding protein Pasha and its RNAse counterpart Drosha . The resulting stem loop pre miRNA is exported to the cytoplasm by Exportin 5 , where it is further processed by the endonuclease Dicer into a 2025 nt double stranded RNA molecule .
Chronic HCV infection is a worldwide health problem which can lead to chronic hepatitis, cirrhosis, and end stage liver disease . The virus has a plus stranded RNA genome with a single long open reading frame containing 5′ and 3′ flanking non translated nucleotide regions that are important for translation and replication. Standard treatment of patients with chronic HCV includes alpha interferon and Ribavirin for 24 48 weeks, depending on HCV genotype.
Mortality from sudden cardiac death  is notoriously high within the first month after acute myocardial infarction  and remains high in the first six months thereafter. Post MI and congestive heart failure , its frequent complication, are both conditions characterized by sympathetic hyperactivity that is so important in triggering potentially life threatening cardiac arrhythmias that in selected patients with CHF, some investigators even propose ablating the stellate ganglion. Ample evidence nevertheless shows that in CHF, vagal activity protects against SCD, through its direct antiarrhythmic action mediated by nitric oxide.
The vast majority of Mendelian inherited epilepsy genes encode ion channels ), leading to a central hypothesis that genetically altered channel function lowers seizure threshold. Mutations of LGI1 are found in many families with Autosomal Dominant Partial Epilepsy with Auditory Features  . The common clinical symptom is of a seizure aura with auditory features or aphasia.
Childhood obesity is not only associated with increased risk of metabolic diseases, but also with a range of behavioral/psychological disorders, including depression , anxiety , poor learning , and attention deficient disorder . However, it is difficult to separate cause and effect with psychological diagnosis as there is evidence that the stigma associated with obesity increases the risk for behavioral disorders . Furthermore, the relative contribution of early programming events caused by maternal obesity, diabetes and diet on behavioral and metabolic disorders in offspring remains unclear.
Stability of human movements is one of their most crucial characteristics for success in changing and unpredictable external conditions. Because these two levels have different metrics , this comparison cannot be made directly. Recently, such an analysis of motor equivalence has been developed within the UCM hypothesis framework .
Spinocerebellar Ataxia Type 3 , which is also known as Machado Joseph Disease, is an age related neurodegenerative disease that belongs to the family of polyglutamine  dependent disorders, . The maladies that comprise this group result from abnormal expansions in the polyQ region of different proteins. PolyQ diseases also include Huntington's, Spinobulbar Muscular Atrophy, Dentatorubral Pallidoluysian Atrophy and five more SCAs, ,  .
The 26S proteasome is a multicatalytic enzyme complex that degrades ubiquitinated proteins via an ATP dependent mechanism. Its success has prompted the development of structurally distinct proteasome inhibitors , including NPI 0052 , which is an orally active irreversible PI that is distinct from bortezomib in terms of its effects on the proteasome's three active sites and its mechanisms of action . Therefore, understanding the molecular mechanisms involved in the responses of cells to PIs should facilitate the development of PIs based combination that will best exploit their unique antitumor activities .
The prevalence of obesity in America has reached epidemic proportions. Currently, 69% of Americans are either overweight or obese. Inadequate energy expenditure  and excessive energy intake can lead to an increased risk of obesity, as well as, cardiovascular disease, diabetes and cancer.
Acute myeloid leukemia  accounts for 17% of all childhood leukemia . Recent risk adapted therapeutic approaches, including the use of cytarabine , anthracyclines and etoposide, together with improved supportive care, have increased survival rates to 60 70% . Nevertheless, up to 40% of patients still suffer from relapse or refractory disease .
Iron  is an essential element for all mammalian cells and is the most plentiful transition metal in the human body. In addition, local Fe mediated oxidative injury may occur even without systemic Fe overload . Reactive oxygen or nitrogen species may severely deregulate cellular Fe homeostasis .
Borderline personality disorder  is a complex and serious mental disorder characterized by emotional dysregulation and aggressive behavior . Impulsive aggression can manifest in a variety of behaviors, including destruction of property, assault, domestic violence, self injurious and suicidal behavior, or substance abuse  . Moreover, aggressive children with a blunted prolactin response to fenfluramine were more likely to have relatives with aggression than those with a normal responses .
Incidence of head and neck cancer  is estimated to account for approximately 5%  of all new cancers in the United States for the year 2012 . Even though regional cervical lymphatic metastases are common in HNC, distant  metastases may also occur  . Treatments of HNC include surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or combined treatment modalities  based on clinical parameters such as the cancer stage   .
While testicular germ cell tumors  are the most common malignancy in young men, germ cell tumors in women are uncommon. Familial clustering, epidemiologic evidence of increased risk with family or personal history of TGCT, and associations with genitourinary tract anomalies suggest an underlying genetic predisposition to TGCT, but traditional linkage studies have yet to identify a highlypenetrant TGCT cancer susceptibility gene. In this paper, we investigate the familial occurrence of testicular and ovarian germ cell tumors .
EpsteinBarr virus , a γ herpesvirus, infects and maintains lifelong latency in human B cells. LMP1 promotes B cell survival by functioning as a dysregulated CD40 mimic, inducing abnormal cellular proliferation, activation and resistance to apoptosis. Signaling via the LMP1 C terminal cytoplasmic domain results in amplifed and sustained activation of several cell survival pathways, including nuclear factor κB  transcriptional regulators and the kinases PI3K /AKT, JNK , ERK  and p38 .
Current regulations focus only on individual participants. However, systematic reviews and meta analyses of published results are often exempt from IRB review  because they are based on previously published findings. Ethics reporting in systematic reviews has received little attention .
Radiotherapy  is one of the primary treatments for prostate cancer. Approximately 50% of patients are treated with radiotherapy either alone or in combination with other therapies . Solid tumors contain a significant population of tumor infiltrating myeloid cells  .
Signal transducer and activator of transcription 3  has received considerable attention due to reports that it is constitutively activated in a number of human cancers and cancer cell lines . Recent reports, however, have described alternative activities of Stat3. Unphosphorylated Stat3  complexes with unphosphorylated NF κB resulting in the transcription of κB dependent genes.
Systemic Lupus Erythematosus  is an autoimmune disease classically associated with a loss in immune tolerance that leads to the production of a complex array of autoantibodies that predominantly recognize nuclear material. In an extensive series of investigations, we produced a collection of B6 congenic strains carrying individual susceptibility loci derived from NZM2410 . Thus, our congenic dissection strategy has provided a model system with which to characterize the genetic interactions that drive the development of severe disease pathology .
Dysregulation of signaling pathways mediated by phosphoinositide 3 kinase  and PKC have been implicated in the development of colorectal cancer . Both Akt and PKC belong to the AGC kinase superfamily, and they share three highly conserved phosphorylation sites namely the activation loop, turn motif, and hydrophobic motif sites . Since the activity and the total protein expression of Akt and PKC are controlled by phosphorylation, dephosphorylation leads to effective signaling termination by either inactivating the enzyme directly or by decreasing the functional lifetime of the protein.
Fragile X associated tremor/ataxia syndrome  is a neurodegenerative disorder caused by premutation CGG expansion  of the fragile X mental retardation 1  gene. Neuropathological examination shows numerous eosinophilic mRNA containing intranuclear inclusions in neurons and astrocytes of FXTAS brain . A recent neuropathological case series of 8 autopsied female premutation carriers  reported Alzheimer disease  type neuropathology in 4 women    including one woman without clinical AD symptoms, suggesting a high prevalence of AD type neuropathology in association with the FMR1 premutation.
Hermann von Helmholtz argued that perception is based on a process he called unconscious inference that, according to him, involved the unconscious formation of hypotheses as to what external objects may have given rise to an observed pattern of nervous stimulation . Here an observer is presented with a particular visual pattern that has two  plausible external world interpretations . However, alternations cannot be arrested during continuous viewing, despite mental effort to hold one interpretation dominant.
After spermatogenesis in the testis, spermatozoa pass sequentially through the caput and corpus epididymidis and are retained in the cauda epididymidis where they are stored until ejaculation . Earlier studies suggested that most sperm structures, such as the chromatin and tail components, gradually become stabilized by formation of disulfide bonds . The addition of diamide, a sulfhydryl oxidant, prevents this phenomenon .
In our industrial society, increased noise levels can interfere with communication and learning. In fact, classroom noise levels are directly related to scholastic achievement , and increases in noise of as little as 10 dB can result in a significant decrease in test scores. The brainstem's representation of the stimulus is remarkably robust; in addition to the brainstem response waveform being visually similar to the stimulus waveform , the audio file of the brainstem response is also acoustically similar to the stimulus .
The recruitment of participants for clinical trials can be a daunting task; no less important is the recruitment of participants for smaller pilot studies. This was the case in a feasibility study to test a cryotherapy intervention on the microcirculation of skin affected by chronic venous disorders . Although a number of strategies for recruiting participants for large clinical studies are well documented, this process evaluation report describes proactive and reactive recruitment strategies for a small clinical trial.
In the year 2008, it is estimated that breast cancer  would account for 26% of all new cancer diagnoses , and 15% of cancer deaths among women in the United States. It will also be the leading cause of cancer deaths in women between the ages of 20 and 59 years. A significant proportion of these deaths will be among women of minority race/ethnicity and the medically underserved.
The prevalence of developmental or behavioral disorders in “healthy” American children is estimated to be 12% to 16%. These data have led the American Academy of Pediatrics  to recommend consistent screening of infants and young children up to 5 years of age . To improve our understanding of the developmental consequences of childhood cancer therapy, prospective surveillance is needed throughout the course of cancer treatment.
Crystallization from solution is a fundamental phenomenon with important scientific and engineering implications. Crystals with different morphologies are prime candidates for new materials with interesting and novel properties. An interesting prototype system for crystallization studies in NaCl.
Selective inhibitors of the inducible isoform of cyclooxygenase  were developed to provide relief of pain associated with arthritis, surgery, and other conditions, while lowering the incidence of gastrointestinal complications compared to non selective, non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs . On the other hand, nsNSAIDs have also been implicated in increased cardiovascular events. , On the other hand, in endothelium, COX catalyzes the formation of prostacyclin , a substance known to be anti thrombotic and a vasodilator.
Smoke free laws and smoking restrictions have been effective in minimizing exposure to environmental tobacco smoke and denormalizing tobacco use. Apart from potential health concerns of pollutants in secondhand vapors, there is much concern that e cigarette use may re glamorize smoking. Because of the similarity between e cigarettes and combustible cigarettes, concerns have been expressed that increasing prevalence of e cigarette use and presence of e cigarettes advertising or media portrayals could potentially undermine smoking denormalization efforts.
Several cytomegaloviruses  infect Old World primate hosts, including green monkey CMV , rhesus macaque CMV , baboon CMV , chimpanzee CMV  and human CMV . These viruses belong, actually or potentially, to the genus Cytomegalovirus, subfamily Betaherpesvirinae, family Herpesviridae, order Herpesvirales. Various strains have been isolated, and, in the description below, their names are given in parentheses immediately after the virus name abbreviations .
In 1906 Alois Alzheimer discovered in the brains of a patient suffering from early age onset of dementia, aggregates of a proteinaceus material, later identified to be composed of amyloid fibers. Alzheimer disease  is associated with several genetic defects and the abnormal accumulation of the amyloid β protein  and tau in the form of extracellular  and intracellular  aggregates respectively. When one of these causative events cannot be recognized, the myocardial disease is classified as idiopathic  .
Approximately 80% of individuals diagnosed with cancer during childhood are expected to survive for at least five years after diagnosis . Improved survival rates have been largely brought about by improvements in multi modal therapy and supportive care. However, increases in survival have not come without cost.
Epidermis, the outermost layer of skin is composed of epithelial cells, primarily keratinocytes associated with specialized cells such as Langerhans cells, melanocytes and Merkel cells. In intact epidermis, a layer of basal keratinocytes adhere to the basement membrane via desmosomes and are non migratory in nature. The myosin family consists of actin associated motor proteins that can be subdivided into 25 different classes.
Men who have sex with men  bear a disproportionate burden of sexually transmissible infections  in resource rich countries. A substantial decline in rates of many STIs occurred in MSM soon after HIV/AIDS was recognized, but many countries have witnessed a resurgence of STIs among this population . Traditional methods of STI control are clearly failing to control the STI epidemic in MSM and novel strategies to reduce STI transmission require investigation .
Breast cancer is one of the major causes of premature death in women; however, the combination of early detection coupled with improved treatment has significantly improved survival from this disease . Antiestrogens and aromatase inhibitors are highly effective endocrine therapies used for treating early stage estrogen receptor   positive breast cancer. Compounds that include tamoxifen, raloxifene, fulvestrant, and their combinations or sequential use provide successful outcomes for patients with hormone responsive tumors .
Kaposi’s Sarcoma Associated Herpesvirus , also known as Human Herpesvirus 8 , is a more recent member of the Herpesviridae family  etiologically associated with all forms  of Kaposi’s sarcoma  . Classic KS , the topic of this analysis, is a rare vascular tumor mainly observed in elderly Mediterranean individuals. The incidence rate of this tumor varies widely in different geographic areas; in Italy the estimated incidence rate is 0.4/100000 in women and 1/100000 in men ; this rate is higher compared to what is observed in other European areas.
The rates of cell proliferation, cell death and cell differentiation are coordinated with respect to each other to ensure proper development and functioning of an organism . During differentiation in primary lymphoid organs and after activation in the periphery, B and T lymphocytes undergo successive rounds of cell division and growth arrest followed by the death of cells that are useless or potentially dangerous . Bax, Bak and Bok/Mtd have three BH regions and despite extensive structural similarity to their anti apoptotic relatives, they are essential for activation of the downstream apoptosis effector processes, including mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization  and unleashing of the caspase cascade .
Breast cancer is the most common cause of cancer death among women worldwide, accounting for 458,000 deaths each year. Although the incidence of breast cancer is higher in developed countries, it is on the rise in developing countries., Women in developing countries tend to present with more advanced breast cancer upon initial diagnosis as compared to women in developed countries. However, the majority of breast cancer patients in Egypt are diagnosed at advanced disease stages.
Cell death in seizures has been observed in in vitro and in vivo models of epilepsy and is the hallmark of hippocampal sclerosis, the commonest pathology associated with epilepsy . Such activity induces large ionic shifts with consequent demands for energy substrates to maintain transmembrane ion homeostasis. Biochemical studies of brain homogenates have revealed decreased ATP concentrations after repeated seizures and seizure induced energy failure has long been suggested as a reason for clinical sequelae in prolonged seizures .
Total Variation  based strategies, which were originally designed for denoising of images  have recently gained wide interest for many MRI applications beyond denoising. Examples include regularization for parallel imaging , the elimination of truncation artifacts , inpainting of sensitivity maps , their use as a regularization method for undersampled imaging techniques within the compressed sensing framework  as well as in iterative reconstruction of undersampled radial data sets . TV models have the main benefit that they are very well suited to remove random noise, incoherent noise like artifacts from random subsampling and streaking artifacts from undersampled radial sampling, while preserving the edges in the image.
Adenocarcinoma of the gastroesophageal junction  is increasingly prevalent in industrialized countries, with a 6 fold rise in the United States from 19752000 . For a minority of patients with HER2 positive cancers, the addition of trastuzumab does improve survival . New therapeutic agents exploiting novel targets are desperately needed to improve clinical outcomes in this disease .
Serotonin  is a neurotransmitter involved in a large number of physiological processes including motility and secretion in the digestive system. Enteric neurons and enterochromaffin cells  within the intestinal epithelial layer store approximately 95% of the 5 HT within the vertebrate body. 5 HT is charged at physiological pH and does not cross cellular membranes.
Migration is population movement from one country, region, or other place of residence to another location. Discriminated individuals, when compared to non discriminated individuals, generally have an increased risk for both mental and physical health problems . The cumulative effect of the stress response  stands at the forefront when discussing discrimination and the long term impact on a person's health .
Almost 6% of the world's adult population now lives with diabetes mellitus. Type II diabetes mellitus , i.e. non insulin dependent diabetes mellitus, represents over 80% of all diabetics and is dramatically increasing in incidence as a result of changes in human behavior and increased body mass index . NASH is characterized by fat accumulation and inflammation in the liver.
Resistin is a hormone that was originally identified in the adipose tissue with physiological roles in promoting insulin resistance and linked to obesity with insulin resistance . Recently, a new family of Resistin like molecules including Relm α, Relm β and Relm γ have been identified . This group of Relm proteins share sequence homology with resistin and contain highly conserved C terminal cysteine residues, which support the assembly of disulfide dependent multimeric units .
Schistosomiasis remains prevalent in tropical developing countries where an estimated 600 million people are at risk for exposure . The parasitic schistosome  life cycle involves two hosts; the larval miracidia infect freshwater snails where they develop into cercariae, infective to the human host. In the absence of an effective vaccine, control efforts to reduce disease transmission rely on the use of molluscicides and targeted drug therapy e.g. in school aged children.
Glutamate is the major excitatory neurotransmitter in the CNS, and regulates the excitability of neurons by activating ionotropic and metabotropic  glutamate receptors . mGluRs are G protein coupled receptors, and are divided into three groups  on the basis of sequence homology, G protein effector coupling  and agonist pharmacology . Group I mGluRs , especially mGluR5, play an important role in the regulation of neuronal excitability and synaptic plasticity .
Streptococcus agalactiae or Lancefield's group B Streptococcus  is a leading cause of morbidity and mortality among neonates in the United States. A correlation between neonatal GBS disease and low maternal levels of antibody to the capsular polysaccharide  of GBS led to several clinical trials with purified CPS as vaccines, culminating in immunization of pregnant women with purified type III CPS. This landmark trial showed that vaccination was safe and well tolerated, that a direct relationship between maternal  and cord blood specific IgG resulted, but that maternal type III CPS specific IgG levels were not optimal and were dependent upon the pre vaccination antibody level.
Entry of adenovirus into a host cell and the replication of the linear, double stranded DNA viral genome inundates the cell with what may be sensed as double stranded DNA breaks, regions of single stranded DNA, and stalled replication forks . Once localized to sites of DNA damage, the MRN complex recruits apical kinases related to the phosphoinositol 3' kinase, including the DNA dependent protein kinase , ataxia telangiectasia mutated protein , and ATM  and Rad3 related protein  . Adenovirus inhibits multiple steps of the DDR pathway.
The cholinergic neurons of the nucleus basalis , which provide the major source of cholinergic innervations to the cerebral cortex and play a key role in memory and attention, are particularly vulnerable in Alzheimer's disease  . Therefore cholinergic ionotropic  and metabotropic  receptors remain major drug discovery targets for the treatment of AD . Previous studies have shown that the predominantly post synaptic M1 receptor, which is expressed throughout the cortex and hippocampus  plays a key role in regulating cognition .
Paraoxonase 1  is a high density lipoprotein   associated serum enzyme that has anti oxidant and anti atherogenic properties . In a recent large human study, the incidence of major cardiac events was approximately 3 fold lower in patients with the highest quartile of PON1 activity compared to patients with PON1 activity in the lowest quartile . PON1 has been shown in various in vitro studies to inhibit the accumulation of pro atherogenic lipid peroxides in low density lipoproteins  and protect the HDL particle from oxidation and preserve its functional integrity .
The extent and rate of spread of emerging diseases has important consequences for public health, as well as animal management and conservation. Understanding the environmental drivers of disease spread is essential for effective management of disease risks. LD provides a classic demonstration of the linkage between environmental factors and epidemiological processes .
Aldehydes are highly reactive compounds that can lead to cellular toxicity through their ability to form adducts with a variety of cellular nucleophiles found in proteins, nucleic acids, as well as small molecule metabolites. In humans, aldehyde detoxication occurs via three main enzyme systems: aldehyde oxidases, aldo keto reductases, and aldehyde dehydrogenases. ALDH2 is the primary enzyme involved in the oxidation of acetaldehyde during ethanol metabolism and a single nucleotide polymorphism  results in an enzymatically crippled protein , in which acetaldehyde, derived from ethanol oxidation, accumulates and induces alcohol toxicity,.
Single shot echo planar imaging  has become the standard pulse sequence for diffusion weighted imaging of the brain due to its high speed and efficiency. Unfortunately, EPI suffers from significant image artifacts primarily due to inhomogeneities in the main magnetic field, which although mild in some areas of the brain make measurements of diffusion parameters or fiber tractography in other regions impossible  . Rapid diffusion encoding and traversal of k space minimize the T2 dephasing that degrades the image quality.
In resource limited settings, nevirapine  based regimens are often used for prevention of mother to child transmission of HIV 1 . , Use of these regimens is associated with the emergence of NVP resistant variants in many infants who are HIV infected despite prophylaxis,  which can compromise future treatment with a nonnucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor  containing regimen. Recent studies in adults suggest that the presence of minority variants may be associated with a poor response to subsequent antiretroviral therapy.
Visual cues are known to significantly impact speech perception; when one can both hear a speaker’s utterance and concurrently see the articulation of that utterance , speech comprehension is more accurate  and less effortful  than when only auditory information is available. As a general rule, greater benefits are observed from pairing stimuli that, on their own, are each weakly effective, compared to pairing stimuli that are both strongly effective when presented in isolation. This concept of “inverse effectiveness” implies that the primary benefits of multisensory integration take place when the individual stimuli provide weak or ambiguous information.
Much remains to be learned about the impact of current era treatment regimens for high risk neuroblastoma  on the patient experience. Administrative databases such as the Pediatric Health Information System  database are well established resources for addressing clinical questions. Methods for assembly of pediatric leukemia cohorts using PHIS have been established .
Cell population level signals are important in the study of brain physiology because they index activity across many scales of time and anatomy, can be measured non invasively at the scalp as well as intracranially and can reveal large scale interactions in the brain . Recording of such signals has become particularly important in the diagnosis and clinical evaluation of a number of disorders, such as epilepsy. A sobering reminder that the inverse problem extends well beyond the discrimination of cortical sources is the recent observation that signals generated by the eye muscles during saccades can be mistaken for scalp EEG activity in the gamma band .
Vertebrate retinal development is a complex process that involves the coordination of morphogenetic tissue movements with gene expression. This process leads to retinal progenitor cells that have been “coded” with ventral positional identity in the form of EphB receptor tyrosine kinase expression  . A current model of dorsal retinal patterning posits that Bmp4, expressed in the dorsal retina, triggers the graded dorsal expression of tbx5, which in turn leads to graded expression of EphrinB molecules .
Motion estimation is critical to many modern signal processing algorithms. Because of its central significance, estimator accuracy, precision, and computational cost are of critical importance to these and numerous other applications . A great number of pattern matching techniques are currently employed, each offering tradeoffs between computation complexity, hardware implementation cost, precision, and accuracy.
Organophosphorus  insecticides 1 are a relatively safe group of agricultural chemicals used extensively in plant and crop protection and include malathion, chlorpyrifos, parathion, methyl parathion, and diazinon . The thionate linkage also confers hydrolytic stability owing to increased electron density at phosphorus. OP insecticides can be converted from thionates 1 to oxons 2  either in the environment or in vivo and become reactive and potentially toxic following occupational or incidental exposures by direct contact with air, food and water .
Hibernation is an adaptive strategy of reduced metabolic demand and greatly limited mobility that conserves energy during periods of low food availability in highly seasonal or unpredictable environments . In contrast, hibernating bears and ground squirrels demonstrate very limited muscle atrophy over the prolonged periods  of physical inactivity of winter hibernation suggesting that hibernating mammals have evolved natural mechanisms that prevent disuse muscle atrophy. Although attenuation of atrophy in muscle over the hibernation season in bears and ground squirrels has been documented , the molecular mechanisms underlying this protective musculoskeletal adaptation are not known .
Crickets in the family Gryllotalpidae are commonly known as mole crickets, aptly named for their largely subterranean lifestyle and accompanying morphology , giving them some similarities with moles . Invasive mole crickets have become significant agricultural pests and have been extensively studied in the southeastern United States . They are known to cause damage to golf courses, lawns, pastures, and the rising turf grass industry .
Most epidemiologic studies have found a positive association between alcohol intake and breast cancer incidence . This relationship appears to be modest in magnitude, yet consistent across a variety of populations and study designs. In addition to being implicated in breast cancer incidence, these hormone and peptide measures may also promote recurrence and poor prognosis among women diagnosed with breast cancer  however, we are not aware of published research examining the relationship between alcohol and these serum measures in women with a previous diagnosis of breast cancer .
Dr. Per Ingvar Brånemark introduced the method of direct skeletal attachment of limb prostheses in the 1980s . The method holds advantages over the prior art but has concerns associated with it as well, especially related to inflammation in the skin surrounding the implant.
Juvenile criminal offending is a significant social and public policy concern, with approximately 1 million adolescents in the United States formally processed within the justice system each year . Finally, substance use may interfere with adolescents’ abilities to successfully occupy and fulfill adult roles , which prevent them from ”maturing out” of criminal behavior  . The first goal of the current study was to examine the effects of substance abuse treatments that were received by a sample of serious juvenile offenders in the ‘real world’ rather than in the context of a treatment outcome study.
Since shortly after the discovery of immunoglobulin D , its main role in the immune system has been believed to be as a B cell receptor  , for review see . This ability of IgD expression to be regulated by RNA splicing is evolutionarily ancient and probably predates the process of class switching  . Surface expression of IgD varies with B cell subset.
The formation of multispecies biofilms is influenced by three major factors; the nature of the surface to which the biofilm adheres, the composition of the potential colonizing species that will make up the biofilm and the bulk fluid that bathe and sustain the biofilm community. After an initial professional cleaning, subjects refrained from oral hygiene for 7 days. Total DNA probe counts returned to pre cleaning levels in about 4 days.
In picking an apple off a tree, you move your eyes and head to look at various apples. In this way, target selection commonly is assumed to be the first step in a sequential process that guides goal directed reaching. Maintaining gaze on the target optimizes the precision of reaching movements .
In vitro studies show that prolonged infection of macrophages with Mycobacterium tuberculosis  or M. bovis BCG  inhibits IFN gamma induced expression of class II transactivator  and MHC II , as well as a subset of other IFN gamma induced genes , and results in decreased MHC II antigen presentation . This mechanism has been demonstrated with murine bone marrow derived macrophages , murine alveolar macrophages  and human monocyte derived macrophages and THP 1 cells . The inhibition involves blockade of IFN gamma induced chromatin remodeling at the CIITA promoter .
Among 40 million people worldwide infected with the Human Immunodeficiency Virus , approximately 5 million are also co infected chronically with the hepatitis C Virus  . However, PegIFN α/RBV triggers the development of neuropsychiatric adverse effects including anxiety, irritability, mood lability, depression and suicidal behavior . Psychiatric toxicity occurs within the first few months of treatment and may affect up to 50% of all patients receiving PegIFN α based therapy .
Structurally diverse small molecules serve as selective agents to dissect complex cellular signaling pathways dysregulated in disease. , N containing heterocycles are commonly occurring structural motifs in natural products as well as pharmacophores in top selling drugs. , Not surprisingly, they continue to be the inspiration for core scaffolds for library synthesis in modern day drug discovery .
The behavioral and neuromodulatory effects of dopamine are mediated via D1 like and D2 like dopamine receptors, members of the G protein coupled receptor family . The dopamine D1 receptor is highly expressed in striatal regions of the brain  and is coupled to stimulatory G proteins . Previous studies have assessed the role of the dopamine D1 receptor in locomotor behaviors.
CNC cells are a group of pluripotent cells that delaminate from the neural tube early in embryogenesis and contribute extensively to the formation of vertebrate facial architecture, including cartilage and bone. Dysregulation of CNC development can lead to dramatic congenital defects such as orofacial clefting. Post translational modifications of histones by acetylation, phosphorylation, methylation and sumoylation have been demonstrated to regulate craniofacial development.
Extensive preclinical and clinical investigations of atherosclerosis link inflammation to plaque progression and complications. While several imaging methods can assess plaque structure, few can visualize specific molecular and cellular aspects of the inflammatory process. To address this need, rapidly developing molecular sensing strategies may permit visualization of key biological processes in atherosclerosis.
Genomic analyses of malignant disease are intended to distinguish the molecular features that underlie carcinogenesis and identify clinical targets. Moreover, comparing primary and metastatic tumors is an exceptionally useful way to assess the molecular alterations associated with stage or progression . This complexity is likely to result, in part, from different genetic backgrounds and environmental exposures of the patients.
Mammalian target of rapamycin  signaling has emerged as a central mechanism in controlling many physiological processes in mammalian cells. In particular, the physiological role of mTORC2 has been understudied. More recently, mouse genetic studies have implicated hepatic mTORC2 in regulating whole body metabolism.
Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder that is characterized by the selective loss of upper and lower motor neurons. There have been various approaches to design treatments based on those hypotheses. Creatine, based upon its ability to stabilize the mitochondrial transition pore, is postulated to improve mitochondrial energy metabolism .
Nasopharyngeal carcinoma  is a relatively rare head and neck malignancy in the United States. In contrast, certain southern regions of China have an incidence as high as 50 cases per 100,000 per year. The initial presentation of NPC varies widely, but rarely is the disease localized to the nasopharynx.
In response to encounter with self antigen, autoreactive B cells may undergo secondary L chain gene rearrangement and edit their antigen receptor specificity by expression of a new L chain . B cells may also edit their antigen receptor specificity by a process known as VH replacement, in which case the targeting of a cryptic recombination signal sequence 2 within a rearranged VH gene results in its replacement by an upstream VH gene  . There is evidence that VH replacement may also occur relatively late in B cell differentiation.
Sarcopenia encompasses the loss of muscle mass and function with age, and occurs in a variety of species . Although evidence suggests that calcium dependent proteolysis, caspases, and lysosomal degradation contribute to accelerated muscle proteolysis, such as in muscle disuse and denervation, the major pathway responsible for the degradation of contractile proteins in skeletal muscle is orchestrated through the ubiquitin proteasome system  . Attaix, Combaret and colleagues concluded in their reviews of the literature that it currently remains unclear whether proteasome activity and proteasome function  are increased or decreased in aged skeletal muscle .
One of the major concerns regarding the use of radioprotective agents is that, while they protect cells from the acute effects of radiation, the surviving cells and their progeny are at an increased risk for delayed radiation induced genomic instability. Genomic instability is defined as the increased rate of alterations to the genome, including gene mutations, chromosomal abnormalities, micronucleus formation, reduced plating efficiency and cellular transformation. Genomic instability has been detected after both low  and high linear energy transfer  radiation exposure .
Neuromyelitis optica  is a chronic inflammatory demyelinating disease that has long been considered a variant of multiple sclerosis . Recently, antibodies against aquaporin 4  have been identified as a specific disease marker of NMO . Their titres have been shown to correlate loosely with disease severity and length of spinal cord involvement .
Lung cancer is the second most common cancer and the leading cause of cancer related death in men and women in the United States . Vitamin D may influence cancer survival and inhibit tumor progression by suppressing metastasis, proliferation, and angiogenesis, or by promoting apoptosis in cancer cells . 25 hydroxyvitamin D D) is the primary form of circulating vitamin D and the accepted measure of vitamin D status, integrating vitamin D obtained from sunlight exposure and dietary intake  .
Capnography is a useful monitoring tool during mechanical ventilation and is the standard of care for confirmation of endotracheal tube placement,,,, and for monitoring in the operating room setting,,. Capnography is also useful for monitoring the integrity of the ventilator circuit for early detection of mishaps such as inadvertent extubation,, . There is less agreement about the utility of continuous capnography for ventilated intensive care unit patients.
Natural killer  cells need to be in close contact with tumour cells in order to trigger their cytolytic machinery . In human NK cells, however, the only MMPs described to date are MMP 1,  2,  9, MT1  and MT2 MMP  . Knowledge about the expression and regulation of MMPs and other matrix degrading proteases in NK cells is limited.
The regulation of enterocyte apoptosis in the newborn intestine plays an important role in determining the balance between mucosal homeostasis and disease. Such regulation may be of particular relevance to the development of necrotizing enterocolitis , a devastating illness of premature neonates that is characterized by exaggerated enterocyte apoptosis leading to severe intestinal injury. Since the newborn intestine does not spontaneously develop NEC, we now posit that counter regulatory pathways may exist within enterocytes to restrain TLR4 signaling, and that the failure of such pathways lead to NEC development.
Among injection drug users , the sharing of injection equipment places users at a high risk for serious health consequences, including acquisition of HIV and hepatitis C. Identifying and examining behavioral risk factors for infection raises crucial issues in the measurement of drug use and associated behaviors . Comprehensive measurement of drug use and risk behavior depends largely on retrospective self reports . Although researchers have attempted to increase the accuracy of these measures, it is generally accepted that illicit drug use  is underreported .
Antigen arrays contain many different molecules, such as proteins, peptides, and carbohydrates, immobilized on a solid support in a spatially defined arrangement. , While antigen arrays are becoming a mainstay of basic and clinical research, improved array design and enhanced capabilities are still needed. First, detection is limited to the antigens found on the array.
Blood oxygenation level dependent  based functional magnetic resonance imaging  has been widely used to study brain function . For instance, identical neural activity may not be able to repeatedly trigger the same BOLD response due to a refractory effect of vascular response . The mechanism underlying BOLD nonlinearity is poorly understood, partially because of its uncertain physiological origin.
With the continued global trend toward urbanization, management of the growth of cities—and the daily transport of people into and out of those cities—is an increasingly complex and important concern. The challenges of efficiently moving large numbers of people have traditionally been addressed through mass transit infrastructure, and most major cities in the developed world have extensive transit systems. The benefits of these systems include improvements in air and water quality, increased speed of passenger movement, energy conservation, mitigation of climate change, and reductions in acute and chronic illness., Despite these benefits, however, mass transit systems can also present public health hazards when not designed or maintained properly.
The escalating incarceration rate of women has increased attention to female offenders and more specifically to those with substance abuse problems. This trend has continued, and as of 2006, females made up 7.2% of the population under State or Federal jurisdiction, up from 6.7% in 2000 . As arrest rates have risen, so has the number of women mandated by courts to drug treatment .
Aß is continuously produced from the amyloid precursor protein  in brains of normal individuals and patients with Alzheimer’s disease . A key pathological feature in AD patients, deposits of Aß build up for some period prior to the onset of symptoms. This gradual build up of Aß is mimicked in APP transgenic mouse models  , despite stability of APP transgene expression .
The follicle stimulating hormone, a pituitary glycoprotein, plays a critical role in ovarian follicular development . Null mutation of FSHβ or FSHR gene in mice results in arrest in follicular development at the preantral stage . Further, the formation of primordial follicles in the golden hamster has been shown to require FSH action .
GABAA receptors are heteropentameric ligand gated chloride channels responsible for the majority of fast inhibitory neurotransmission in the mammalian brain . Seven subunit families  are known to exist , with αβγ and αβδ isoforms representing the majority of neuronal GABAA receptors . In general, αβγ receptors are targeted to the synapse , while αβδ receptors are targeted to extra  or perisynaptic areas  .
The minipig is emerging as an alternative non rodent model besides NHP and dogs, to be used for radiation countermeasure testing under the FDA animal rule. Such a rule requires that the model is well characterized and predictive of the human condition. We have undertaken a step by step approach to evaluate the suitability of the minipig to replicate the Hematopoietic Acute Radiation Syndrome  observed in humans.
Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder  is among the most common behavioral disorders of childhood with a prevalence of approximately 7.8% in the United States . Tests of this prediction, however, have produced variable findings. For example, several well known longitudinal studies of children diagnosed with ADHD did not find greater rates of adolescent AUD  when compared to adolescents without ADHD histories .
HIV infects host cells through a process of membrane fusion directed by the viral membrane protein gp41. Activation occurs by binding of gp120 to specific target cell receptors, with subsequent interaction of gp41 with the target cell membrane. , The ~180 residue ectodomain of gp41 lies outside the virus and undergoes conformational change which is correlated with membrane fusion.
Each year, an estimated 150,000 to 200,000 migrants from Mexico, El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras enter the United States in search of work opportunities. Roughly 40% of the Mexican and Central American immigrant population currently resides in the state of California  . Faced with long term separation from their families and difficult working conditions, many migrants develop depression and anxiety disorders and turn to alcohol and other drugs to cope .
The ability to decode movement intent from the cerebral cortex has spurred accelerating development of brain machine interfaces  in the last decade. BMIs provide a way to control an external device directly  or restore limb movement  using cortical signals. Biomimetic BMIs are trained using normal movement, providing an intuitive mapping between body movements and the external effector .
Failing to show  rates are the percentage of patients who fail to appear at their appointments with no, or only a few hours, warning. FTS for dental appointments have important potential ramifications for the dental health care system and patients’ oral health. When patients FTS for appointments dental practices generate less revenue/production, staff are less efficiently used, and patients who FTS access less dental care thereby increasing their risk of poor dental health  .
Progress is being made in developing interventions that are truly effective in preventing or slowing the progression of Alzheimer's disease . Should such treatments become available, it then becomes critical to identify persons who are in the earliest stages of the illness or are destined to develop it in the future. Many studies have shown that loss of delayed episodic memory typically occurs early in the disease .
A large body of previous work has indicated that children of substance abusing parents are at increased risk for both emotional and behavioral difficulties relative to their same age peers . In addition, these children are more likely to develop similar problems of substance use and abuse as they enter adolescence . Although it is well known that children of substance abusing parents are at greater risk for a multitude of problems, studies also demonstrate considerable variability in their psychological functioning.
Presynaptic modulators often act by altering the probability of transmitter release , which is heterogeneous across the population of a neuron’s presynaptic terminals . At least in some systems, this presynaptic activation requires protein synthesis  and takes several hours. On the other hand, rapid activation of cAMP signaling does not seem to increase functional terminals , despite apparent enhancement of synaptic output by electrophysiological assessment .
Memory is a process that is vulnerable to degradation with the advancement of age. Cognitive decline related to aging affects many mammalian species, from humans to primates to rodents, therefore rodents have served as an appropriate model for cognitive aging  . Recent evidence suggests that the relationship between PSD 95 and GluN2B may be altered during aging in the frontal cortices of mice .
Immunoglobulin M , the first antibody to be secreted during an immune response, is highly effective at neutralizing and agglutinating pathogens, and also activates the classical complement cascade with 1000 fold increased avidity than IgG . This increased avidity is largely due to the pentameric structure of IgM . Natural IgM, produced by B 1 B cells of naïve animals, has been identified as a link between innate and adaptive immune responses because of their ability to control the dissemination of both viruses and bacteria .
DNA has considerable potential to form structures other than canonical Watson Crick duplexes, with potentially profound consequences for genomic stability. Transient denaturation accompanying replication or transcription enables G4 DNA formation . Because G4 DNA forms transiently, it is difficult to detect directly in a living cell .
Mesenchymal stem cells  are multipotent progenitors that have been isolated from a variety of adult tissues and are capable of self renewal as well as differentiation into bone, fat, and cartilage under specific culture conditions . Indeed, the differentiation of MSCs into the osteoblastic lineage has been touted as a promising strategy for in vivo regeneration and repair of damaged bone tissue . Emerging studies clearly indicate the role of extracellular cues arising from the matrix on directing osteogenic commitment of stem cells.
Lymphocyte motility is critical for the development and function of T cells. Overexpression of CCR7 promotes commitment to the CD8 single positive  lineage . CCR7−/− thymocytes also demonstrate defective negative selection .
Prognosis of clinical outcome in oncology determines treatment decisions in patients with early and advanced cancer. Variables currently used include epidemiological information, tumor type, molecular characterization, and clinical parameters such as tumor size and the presence of nodal and extranodal metastasis . Hence, determining the clinical predictive value from histological epidemiology remains limited.
Although alopecia is rarely reported in wild populations of non human primates, it has been a persistent concern in captive populations. Several studies report prevalence rates in rhesus macaques , either for individually housed animals or for captive social groups. However, despite this strong relationship, hair pulling explained only 4 to 7 percent of the variance in alopecia presentation in the study.
Bioflocculants are natural product metabolites produced by a wide variety of microorganisms including bacteria, fungi, yeast and algae . The basic building blocks found in bioflocculants include sugar monomers , amino sugars , organic acids , amino acids, nucleic acids, fatty acids, sulfate groups, and O acetyl esters . Chemical flocculants are generally classified into two groups.
Heart failure is a significant cause of morbidity and mortality in the United States. This approach has the added advantage that it can also identify novel candidate genes for Mendelian forms of heart disease . Dilated cardiomyopathy exhibits high genetic heterogeneity as mutations in more than 20 genes have been associated with the disease, such as desmin, tafazzin, δ sarcoglycan, dystrophin, and metavinculin, and nuclear envelope proteins such as emerin and lamin A/C .
The most common cytogenetic abnormality among adults with acute lymphoblastic leukemia  is the Philadelphia  chromosome, found in about 20% to 30% of all cases. Incidence of Ph positive ALL increases with age, occurring in up to 50% of patients over 50 years old. The disease in patients with Ph positive ALL has a more aggressive clinical course and is associated with a higher incidence of central nervous system involvement.
Pituitary tumors  are a diverse group of neoplasms of the pituitary with an estimated prevalence of approximately 15%. The vast majority of PTs involve adenohypophyseal cells of the pituitary, and are histologically proven to be benign pituitary adenomas. While most PTs are asymptomatic, they may compress surrounding structures and secrete abnormal levels of pituitary hormones causing various endocrinologic symptoms.
This study examined the effect of vapor lock on canal debridement efficacy by testing the null hypothesis that there is no difference between a “Closed” and an “Open” system design in smear layer and debris removal using a side vented needle for irrigant delivery . Twenty eight extracted human single rooted teeth were radiographed to ensure that each tooth contained one canal, and that an equal number of narrow  and wide canals  were present in the two experimental groups. Each tooth was decoronated at 17 mm from the anatomical apex.
Acting in several brain regions, neurotrophins and their signaling pathways play significant roles in neuronal excitability, synaptic transmission, models of learning and memory , and responses to drugs of abuse . Neurotrophin signaling cascades have also been shown to play crucial roles in regulating responses to stress in several animal models of depression and antidepressant action  . Midbrain dopamine neurons of the ventral tegmental area  and their projections to the nucleus accumbens , which together form the mesolimbic dopamine system, express neurotrophins and their Trk receptors .
Zinc is the second most abundant transition metal in the body, and it exists in high concentrations within the brain . Besides participating in cell growth and development as an important structural and functional component in a large number of proteins, zinc can function as a neuromodulator to affect synaptic signaling  . However, mice lacking vesicular zinc still show zinc accumulation in degenerating neurons following excitotoxic stimuli, suggesting that zinc may be released from cellular locations other than synaptic vesicles .
With the development of advanced ultrasensitive fluorescence detection methods, it is possible to perform experiments on single biomolecules and particles. In general, two approaches are followed for single particle tracking: either tracking is performed ex post facto from data collected with a camera via post processing or the tracking is performed in real time using a feedback approach. The former approach has the advantage that multiple particles can be tracked simultaneously whereas the latter approach is typically faster and more flexible.
Examining exposures to mixtures of insecticides is important for understanding the underlying mechanisms of organophosphorus  compound toxicity and assessing aggregate risk. Numerous studies have examined additive and synergistic effects of combinations of OPs in vitro and in vivo. Significant individual variability in levels of CaE in human liver microsomes has been reported, with activities varying from 5.3  to 44.7 fold, depending on the substrate used for measuring CaE activity .
The Hippo pathway was initially identified through genetic screening in Drosophila as having crucial roles in restricting tissue growth. The evolutionarily conserved functions of this pathway in control of tissue and organ size were further demonstrated through genetically engineered mouse models. In mammalian systems, the Hippo pathway is composed of core kinase complexes , adaptor proteins , downstream effectors  and nuclear transcription factors .
Autism spectrum disorders are a group of relatively common pervasive neurodevelopmental disorders affecting between 2 6 children per 1000 . Evidence includes increased rates of infection in neonates who were later diagnosed with autism, , and links with congenital rubella, cytomegalovirus and other viral infections . Descriptions of aberrant immune function in individuals with autism have been reported for nearly 40 years.
Over the past few decades, the incidence of invasive aspergillosis has risen steadily. It is now the most common invasive mould infection worldwide . Mortality is almost 100% if the disease is left untreated and high  even with therapy .
Many transmembrane signaling proteins in prokaryotes contain a 50 residue HAMP motif, so called because it occurs in histidine kinases, adenylyl cyclases, methyl accepting chemotaxis proteins  and certain phosphatases. Native MCP molecules are homodimers of ~550 residue subunits organized into three functional modules : a transmembrane sensing module composed of a periplasmic ligand binding domain and four transmembrane helices, a signal converting HAMP domain that adjoins one of the transmembrane helices in each subunit, and a 4 helix bundle kinase control module connected to the HAMP domain. E. coli has two amino acid sensing MCPs, Tar  and Tsr  that have been extensively studied .
The public health importance of maternal zinc deficiency is increasingly recognized . Yet, efforts to define the magnitude and distribution of zinc deficiency are hampered by a lack of indicators of zinc status among individuals and populations . In the last 15 years there has been considerable interest in the concentration of metallothionein   in red blood cells , as a potential indicator of zinc status in different populations  including pregnant women .
Endocannabinoids  are lipid metabolites that suppress neurotransmitter release at excitatory and inhibitory synapses by serving as agonist for presynaptic CB1 cannabinoid receptors . The eCBs are acutely generated  in the postsynaptic neurons following a stimulus and release is believed to occur via passive diffusion through the plasma membrane or facilitated by as yet unidentified mechanisms. The direction of chemical transmission is opposite to fast synaptic transmission and hence eCBs are termed retrograde messengers.
Human endosomal sorting complex required for transport  I is involved in sorting of membrane receptors into multivesicular body  pathway . In the last step of retroviral release, membrane fission event is mediated by the late budding domain  of Gag protein, which directly or indirectly interacts with proteins of the class E vacuolar protein sorting  pathway . The class E VPS proteins are organized into four complexes, namely ESCRT 0,  I,  II, and  III .
Advances in functional brain imaging techniques have led to the identification of possible neuroanatomical substrates of pain perception. It is well established that SI is involved in processing innocuous tactile information, but little is known about the specific functional roles of Brodmann areas 3a, 3b, 1 and 2 within SI in processing nociceptive information. Some studies suggest involvement of areas 3b and 1 , while others implicate area 3a, , and yet others areas 1 and 2 .
The central circadian pacemaker in mammals is located in the suprachiasmatic nuclei  of the hypothalamus. It is entrained most potently by photic environmental input via direct and indirect retinofugal projections, which ultimately yield alterations in multiple feedback loops of clock related gene products within SCN cells to effect shifts in their rhythmic output that allow synchronization with environmental light dark cycles . Photic input also induces expression of the immediate early gene, c fos, in retinorecipient SCN cells.
Fluorescence correlation spectroscopy  or fluorescence fluctuation spectroscopy  have emerged as sensitive techniques to monitor a variety of biochemical reactions, such as protein protein interactions,  reaction kinetics,  and equilibrium concentrations. FCS was introduced more than 35 years ago to measure diffusion and chemical dynamics of DNA drug interactions through the analysis of concentration fluctuations about the equilibrium of a small ensemble  of molecules. Recently, FCS has been applied as a tool to screen for protein interactions for both fundamental research and drug development/discovery applications due to its noninvasiveness, single molecule limits of detection, rapid readout, high analytical sensitivity and accessibility to physical and chemical information at the single molecule level free from ensemble averaging.
The prevalence of cancer survivors in the United States  has increased steadily in recent decades due to dramatic improvements in survival resulting from new treatments and early detection. With over 13 million survivors in the US today, understanding the long term health of cancer survivors is of vital public health importance. Second primary cancers  are a leading cause of morbidity and mortality in this population, yet the etiology of most second cancers is largely unknown.
Microenvironments built in microfluidic systems provide excellent conditions for single cell experiments due to the controllability of various culturing factors inside the system. Many types of single cell trapping methods have been developed to address this issue., These methods can be classified fundamentally into five categories: chemical, hydrodynamic, optical, acoustic, and magnetic trapping. Among them, hydrodynamic trapping is the most common and simplest way to realize cell or particle trapping in the microfluidic system.
Bovine seminal ribonuclease  and several amphibian ribonucleases, including ranpirnase , exhibit innate antitumoral activity . The ability to retain ribonucleolytic activity in the presence of RI is a primary determinant of the cytotoxicity of BS RNase, ONC, and engineered ribonucleases  . Tandem dimers of RNase A are likewise toxic to cancer cells  .
New onset diabetes mellitus after transplantation  is a widely recognized and serious complication in renal transplant recipients. It has been associated with reduced patient and graft survival, impaired graft function, cardiovascular disease , and atherosclerotic events. Incidence rates vary from 2 to 50% during first post transplantation year, depending on the inclusion and diagnostic criteria.
Chronic increases in the rates of endogenous synthesis of NO have been implicated in the development of several human diseases, including cancer . In the gastrointestinal tract, NO or its metabolites have been linked to the pathogenesis of inflammatory bowel diseases , which often precede colon cancer . In an open system, the extent to which the diffusional loss of NO competes with Reactions 1 and 2 is determined by the liquid depth and the availability of O2 and O2− in the medium.
Malignant tumors of the bladder account for approximately 5% of all new primary cancers diagnosed in the United States, with an estimated 70,980 new cases in 2009 . Seventy percent to 80% of bladder cancer is non muscle invasive bladder cancer . Although NMIBC has an excellent prognosis and greater than an 80% overall 5 year survival rate, tumor recurrence is a major clinical problem and occurs in up to 70% of NMIBC patients after transurethral resection .
Photodynamic therapy  is an emerging therapy for many diseases including cancer, neovascular and hyperproliferative disorders and infections. This is a short lived  species that can lose its energy by emitting light  or by internal conversion into heat. The PS excited triplet can undergo three broad kinds of reactions that are usually known as Type I and Type II.
In sub Saharan Africa, diseases caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae and Haemophilus influenzae type b  are important causes of morbidity and mortality in children. Collectively they cause up to 500,000 deaths per year . In 2001, two East African countries, Kenya and Uganda, introduced the conjugate Hib vaccine into their routine immunization schedules with funding from the GAVI Alliance.
Adolescent substance use and misuse continues to be a major public health concern . Among adolescents, peers are important sources for obtaining drugs. Approximately 25% of all students in grades 9 through 12 indicate someone has offered, sold, or given them an illegal drug on school property .
As we walk down a crowded street we encounter numerous complex objects over time, many of which are similar at the feature level. How does the visual system represent sets of similar objects or features presented over time? One possibility is to generate discrete, high fidelity representations for every object we encounter.
Activation of G protein coupled receptors  provides an important signaling pathway for neurotransmitters in the brain. The best example is the GABAB receptor, which functions as an obligatory heterodimer of two subtypes, GBR1 and GBR2 . Subsequent studies revealed that GBR1 contains the agonist binding site while GBR2 signals to G proteins  .
Injection drug use is a well established risk factor for morbidity and pre mature mortality due to various causes, including HIV infection . A recent systematic review and meta analysis that included over 60 cohorts of persons who inject drugs  demonstrated a pooled crude mortality rate of 2.4 per 100 person years among this population, and found a pooled standardized mortality ratio to be almost 15 times higher among those who inject drugs compared to the general population . Premature mortality among this population results primarily from potentially preventable causes such as accidental overdose, infectious diseases including HIV infection, suicide and injuries  .
Mef2C is a member of the Mef2 family of transcription factors characterized by the MADS  box . Mef2C expression level varies at different stages of hematopoiesis. Transcription factors play pivotal roles in hematopoiesis.
Assessment of functional capacity is an intrinsic part of determining the functional relevance of response to treatment of cognitive impairment in schizophrenia. Existing methods are highly and consistently correlated with performance on neuropsychological tests, but most current assessments of functional capacity are still paper and pencil simulations. We developed a computerized virtual reality assessment that contains all of the components of a shopping trip .
Posttraumatic stress disorder  can develop in individuals who experience severely traumatic events. Exaggerated suppression of HPA activity following dexamethasone challenge has been a consistent finding in PTSD  and in traumatized individuals regardless of PTSD status . On the other hand, concentrations of corticotropin releasing hormone  in the cerebrospinal fluid are higher in PTSD patients .
The negative symptoms of schizophrenia are related to a wide range of adverse outcomes, including lower subjective psychological well being , reduced likelihood of illness remission , and impairments in social and vocational functioning . In particular, diminished vocal communication has been reported in a subset of individuals with schizophrenia , and there is evidence that this involves separate channels of speech production  and speech variability . However, much of this early work relied on subjective ratings of prosody.
The phosphorylated derivatives of phosphatidylinositol , called collectively PIs, are eukaryotic cell membrane phospholipids, whose inositol head group is phosphorylated at positions D3, D4 or D5, singly or in all combinations, to yield seven PI metabolites. Accumulated evidence indicates that PtdInsP2, a low abundance PI comprising as little as 0.8% of total PIs, mediates essential aspects of endosome plasticity. The enzymes and regulators involved in PtdInsP2 synthesis and turnover are all large evolutionarily conserved proteins, products of single copy genes from yeast to humans.
A potential recurring challenge to IOP homeostasis is posture change with the consequent gravity dependent changes in cephalic arterial and venous pressures . In humans in the upright position, blood flowing from the heart to the eye and back experiences the force of gravity such that the cephalic arterial and venous pressures are 10   15 mmHg lower than in the supine position , yet the IOP increase in going from upright to supine is only a few mmHg, much smaller than the changes in cephalic vascular pressures  . Based on the Goldmann equation, the normal EVP of 9 mmHg is responsible for 60% of the typical human IOP of 15mmHg and changes in EVP should elicit 1:1 changes in IOP .
Integrins, including the β1 integrins, have been linked to tumor progression and the remodeling of extracellular matrix  associated with this progression ]. In human breast carcinomas, expression of β1 integrin has been reported to be unchanged , but also to be increased and predictive of poor survival . In vitro, a function blocking antibody to β1 integrin reverses the malignant phenotype of breast cancer cells grown in three dimensional  cultures .
The blood vascular endothelium in lymphoid tissues controls homeostatic lymphocyte homing and leukocyte recruitment during inflammation, regulates metabolite exchange and blood flow to meet the energy requirements of the immune response, and maintains vascular integrity and hemostasis. These diverse functions require specialization of the endothelium. In addition, HEVs display tissue specialization.
A majority of problem drinkers in the United States that seek help do so byattending Alcoholics Anonymous , and a majority of treatment programs routinelyrefer patients to attend AA . Prospective studies  and meta analytic reviews  reportmodest yet positive benefits associated with AA exposure, with the importantfootnote that measures of AA engagement and commitment often are stronger and moreconsistent predictors of positive outcome relative to sheer AA meeting attendance. Giventhese findings, attention has focused on the psychological and social mechanismsthat account for AA related benefit  .
Two general processes are thought to contribute to hepatocellular cancer  prognosis. These two general processes may also affect one another. Non disease specific factors such as gender and age can also influence HCC outcomes, suggesting that any individual disease parameter needs to be considered within a total personal clinical context.
Young children demonstrate an impressive ability to learn words. Although full knowledge of a word is constructed over a protracted period of time, preschool children add new words to their lexicon at a rate of at least several words per day . The size of a child’s vocabulary at school entry may be 6,00010,000 words.
Coronary heart disease  is the leading cause of death world wide and the burden of heart disease has been growing among economically developing nations . In China, rapid economic development has significantly changed living conditions, nutrition, and health care. While low in comparison to CHD rates in some Western countries, these rates have been increasing rapidly in tandem with economic and lifestyle changes.
Periodontal diseases are prevalent diseases and are substantial public health burden world wide. It was not clear, however, which of the enamel matrix proteins induce the regeneration, and what molecular mechanisms are involved  . Mature enamel is composed of highly organized tightly packed hydroxy apatite crystallites.
Considerable work has defined an important role for the neuropeptide oxytocin in social behavior . Recently, work has begun to generalize these findings to human social behaviors . These studies have shown that intranasally delivered oxytocin can increase trust or generosity in economic games , improve inference of emotions from images of the eyes  and increase fixations to the eye region in human faces .
Plakins are multi domain proteins implicated in cytoskeletal regulation, intercellular interactions, and cell signaling . Both proteins contain N terminal actin binding domains , followed by plakin domains, extended spectrin repeat domains, EF hand motifs, and C terminal microtubule binding domains  . In addition, MACF1 has been shown to regulate MT binding of the plus end tracking protein CLASP2, suggesting a role in MT stabilization and cell motility .
Predominantly uncontrolled studies suggest that there may be a greater risk of subsequent vertebral compression fractures  associated with vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty. To further understand the risk of VCFs, we conducted a population based retrospective cohort study using data from a large regional health insurer .
