Gonadal growth, gamete maturation, and steroidogenesis in vertebrates are predominantly under the control of luteinizing hormone  and follicle stimulating hormone . However, in teleost fish unlike in mammals, LH and FSH are more promiscuous and are capable of binding to the other gonadotropin receptor  . Gonadotropins have been sequenced and characterized in a number of teleost fish representing anguilliformes, salmoniforms, perciforms, cypriniformes, and siluriformes in addition to other species .
One of the great challenges in the study of the function of the nervous system is the quantitative understanding of the manner in which information is processed by neuronal ensembles in the form of sequences of action potentials . An additional challenge is presented by the binary nature of the neuronal signals  that requires appropriate mathematical methods of analysis and modeling, distinct from the various methods developed for continuous data. We note the fundamental distinction between discretized continuous data  and point process data .
Genomic instability plays an important role in most human cancers . What is the association between genomic instability and risk factors and clinical phenotypes? Such integrated analysis for ESCC has been examined only once previously, and then only in a study of cell lines .
Relative adrenal insufficiency, a concept which has gained increasing attention in recent years, occurs when cortisol concentrations do not rise appropriately in response to stress or illness. Different investigators, using various definitions, have reported a 5 to 50% incidence of relative adrenal insufficiency , or inappropriately low cortisol values, in children and adults with critical illness. Low cortisol values and/or inadequate responses to adrenocorticotropic hormone  stimulation have been found to correlate with increased mortality and morbidity, in particular cardiovascular dysfunction with vasopressor resistant hypotension.
Alzheimer's disease  is the most frequent age related neurode generative disorder and a major public health concern. The presence of one APOE ε4 copy substantially increases the risk of developing the disease by a factor of 3 compared with the most common APOE ε3 allele, whereas two copies lead to a 12 fold increase . The average age of onset of dementia corresponds to these risk profiles, with APOE4/4 carriers having an onset in their mid 60s and APOE2/3 carriers in their early 90s, a shift of almost three decades, whereas APOE3/3 individuals have an age of onset in the mid 70s  .
Sunitinib is a multitargeted tyrosine kinase inhibitor known to selectively inhibit several growth factor receptors including vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 1 , 2  and 3 , platelet derived growth factor receptor alpha , and beta  and stem cell factor . Recent research has explored the potential anti angiogenic effects of sunitinib, given the critical role of many of these receptor kinases in tumor angiogenesis . It has demonstrated improvements in progression free when compared to interferon  therapy in metastatic RCC patients , and has become a front line therapy for this disease .
The group of woody, perennial, evergreen plants, commonly referred to as bamboo, belong to the grass family . Bambusa oldhamii Munro, known as ‘green timber bamboo’, is a well known semitropical clumping bamboo species native of Taiwan and southern China . This giant bamboo, which forms abundant forests in Taiwan, is a valuable natural resource, with its mature culms used as building material and its young shoots cultivated extensively for human consumption .
Units in low level regions of the cortical visual hierarchy each receive stimulation from a restricted portion of the visual field. Yet important features in the visual image are often spatially extensive and have complex  form structure that is not necessarily apparent in such local representations. provided a compelling demonstration of our sensitivity to such complex spatial structure in his eponymous patterns; if a dense field of randomly positioned dots is combined with a duplicate that has been displaced at a polar angle , we can perceive spatial form consistent with the geometric transformation .
Many epidemiological studies have been conducted to investigate the effect of maternal exposure to air pollution on adverse pregnancy outcomes . Results of these studies have shown that exposure to air pollution may elevate the risk of adverse birth outcomes, including low birthweight, preterm delivery, and small for gestational age  . Poor birth outcomes are significant predictors of neonatal mortality and morbidity .
Abnormal scapular kinematics are associated with a number of shoulder pathologies, including, but not limited to, shoulder impingement syndrome , rotator cuff tendinopathy , rotator cuff tears , shoulder instability , and adhesive capsulitis  . A variety of methods have been proposed to quantify scapular movement. These have progressed from initial attempts utilizing two dimensional radiographs to modern experimental designs creating digital maps from high speed computerized imaging .
Inhaled corticosteroid  therapy is considered to be first line treatment for the control of persistent asthma. However, there appears to be substantial variation in ICS treatment response, which may contribute to a significant proportion of disease related morbidity. In vitro models have identified dual specificity phosphatase 1 , also known as MAP kinase phosphatase 1 , as a potential master regulator of corticosteroid response.
Recently, we developed an assay employing high performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry  to measure 3',5' cAMP and other purines in the renal venous effluent from isolated, perfused kidneys. To our knowledge this was the first report of the endogenous generation of 2',3' cAMP by any tissue, organ or cell . Studies in isolated, perfused rat kidneys support the extracellular 2',3' cAMP adenosine pathway hypothesis.
Tumors promote immune tolerance, and DCs play an important role in this. Retinoic acid , an active metabolite of vitamin A, regulates a broad array of immune responses . However, its role in Treg induction and activation in response to tumor induced immune tolerance is not known.
The prodromal period prior to the onset of schizophrenia is often marked by declines in cognitive function, as well as attenuated psychotic symptoms . In addition to positive psychotic symptoms, UHR individuals and patients with schizophrenia also suffer from negative symptoms. Furthermore, UHR individuals also exhibit brain abnormalities when compared to healthy controls .
Endogenous sex steroid hormones play an important role in the etiology of female cancers, including breast and endometrial cancer . Sex steroid hormones are synthesized and eliminated through complex metabolic pathways. Polymorphisms in genes coding for key enzymes involved in these pathways could modulate endogenous hormone levels and through this mechanism, influence the risk of hormone related cancers  .
The lung faces unique challenges in that it is continuously exposed to a variety of potentially noxious agents from the environment yet must maintain a delicate architecture to allow for efficient gas exchange. Thus, immune responses in the lung are tightly regulated to protect the host without interfering with lung function. Individuals with allergic asthma respond to inhalation of allergens with the development of chronic inflammation.
Autism spectrum disorders  comprise a complex and heterogeneous group of neurodevelopmental conditions including autism, Asperger syndromes, and pervasive developmental disorder not otherwise specified . Despite their high prevalence, relatively little is known about the pathology underlying ASDs. The lack of widely available biological samples of relevant cell and tissue types has made studying the pathophysiology of many neurological conditions a challenging prospect.
Osteosarcoma is a highly malignant bone sarcoma seen in children with a peak incidence occurring during adolescence, thus establishing a relationship between bone development and tumor formation . The type 1 interferon gene cluster spans about 400 Kbp within the chromosome 9p21 p22 region . It consists of one beta gene , one omega gene, 13 alpha genes and 11 pseudogenes  ;see  for gene map).
It is well known that expectation can significantly modulate pain perception . In one of the few studies on this topic performed in human subjects, Vokow and colleagues investigated how expectation can influence response to the stimulant drug methylphenidate in both cocaine abusers  and non abusers . In these trials, it is not uncommon for “placebo/sham acupuncture/minimal acupuncture” controls to induce positive therapeutic effects on the same order of magnitude as verum  acupuncture, with verum and sham groups usually demonstrating superiority and clinical benefits over wait list or standard of care controls .
The 5′ cap is a distinctive feature of eukaryal cellular and viral messenger RNA that is required for mRNA stability and efficient translation. The cap consists of 7 methylguanosine linked via an inverted 5′ 5′ triphosphate bridge to the initiating nucleoside of the transcript. The cap is formed by enzymatic modification of nascent pre mRNAs synthesized by cellular or viral RNA polymerases.
Infection with HIV has become a manageable chronic illness with the advent ofcombination antiretroviral therapy . Considering theemergence of safer antiretroviral medications and the availability of cARTworldwide, aging with HIV has become an internationally important issue. Both age and HIV are risk factors for cognitive decline, and older age isassociated with greater risk for HAND., Older patients oftenhave higher rates of comorbid illness, including cardiovascular disease, whichfurther increases risk for impaired cognition and may impact the patterns ofimpairment on neuropsychological testing.
Anopheles sinensis Wiedemann 1828 is a member of the Hyrcanus group that belongs to the Myzorhynchus series within the subgenus Anopheles . Because of its importance as a vector, An. This species has a 2n=6 chromosome complement typical to Anopheles.
The expulsive component of cough is generated primarily by the coordinated activity of the anterolateral abdominal muscles . Input from the brainstem cough neural networks ) to the motoneuron pools for these primary expiratory muscles is disrupted following cervical and thoracic injuries involving the ventral and ventrolateral spinal cord . In the cat, the motoneuron pools for these four muscles all terminate at L3, but they have varying rostral extents with the rectus abdominis extending most rostrally ; the external oblique to T6; the transverses abdominis to T9; and the internal oblique to T13 .
In the periodontal microenvironment, bacterial constituents including gram negative derived lipopolysaccharide  can initiate inflammatory bone loss as appreciated in periodontal diseases. The production of inflammatory cytokines results from the activation of kinase induced signaling cascades and transcriptional factors. These cytokines orchestrate the cascade of destructive events that occur in the periodontal tissues, and trigger the production of an array of inflammatory enzymes and mediators including MMPs and prostaglandins.
The hair follicle  is a unique regenerative mini organ that provides a highly instructive model system to study the underlying mechanisms that govern hair and skin appendage development as well as hair follicle stem cell  homeostasis and progeny differentiation. Basal keratinocytes of the IFE proliferate and their progenies detach from the basement membrane, progressively differentiating while moving upwards to generate the overlying layers of stratified epidermis  . Mature HFs are fully established during the growth phase , the lower epithelial portion of HFs then undergo cycles of degeneration  and rest  with subsequent re growth at the next anagen .
Tumor necrosis factor alpha  is a cytokine involved in regulation of immune cells, tumorigenesis, inflammation, and apoptotic/necrotic cell death . Exposure of mammalian cells to TNF α and inhibitors of transcription or translation, such as actinomycin D and cycloheximide , leads to induction of apoptosis in a cell specific manner by sequential activation of either caspases 8 and 3 or of 8, 9 and 3 . Conversely, nitric oxide  produced by low molecular mass compounds or intracellularly by nitric oxide synthases inactivates caspases 9, 8 and 3 via reactions of S nitrosation .
Cigarette smoking is causally associated with cancers of the lung, bladder, pancreas kidney, oral cavity, esophagus, larynx and uterine cervix. Studies of cigarette smoking in relation to the risk of cutaneous malignant melanoma  have been reported, but the evidence to date has not been clear cut. Surprisingly, the results have often suggested the possibility that smoking may be inversely associated with melanoma risk .
Elucidation of the cellular mechanisms that contribute to the ontogeny of orderly neural connections is a major theme of developmental neurobiology. Retinal projections have been a widely used experimental system for studies of this issue. In mammals, the dorsal nucleus of the lateral geniculate body  and the superior colliculus  are, respectively, the principal thalamic and midbrain targets of the retina.
Ovulation in women is thought to occur spontaneously during each menstrual cycle, regardless of sexual behavior, as a result of positive and negative feedback mechanisms of the hypothalamic pituitary ovarian axis . Female  versus male initiated sexual activity has been shown to be greater around the time of ovulation  and numerous studies have found that sexual activity among women in general peaks during the time of ovulation  as does the desirability of a male partner . Together these studies suggest that peri ovulatory hormonal patterns may cause an increase in female libido, which together with their partner’s desire and the couple’s intentions regarding pregnancy, can affect sexual behavior  .
Apolipoprotein E  is a 34 kDa glycosylated protein whose primary function is to transport lipids between cells and throughout the circulatory system. Inflammation is a hallmark of many of these CNS diseases. Increasing evidence suggests that apoE down regulates CNS inflammation in an isoform specific manner and application of apoE or apoE mimetic peptides, formed from the receptor binding region of apoE, modulates the inflammatory response  .
Atrial fibrillation  is the most common sustained cardiac arrhythmia, occurring in 1 2% of the general population . The risk of stroke in the setting of AF increases with age, affecting up to 23.5% of patients aged 80 to 90 years . AF confers a 5 fold risk of stroke and one in five of all strokes is attributable to AF .ENREF 3 Recognition of comorbidities associated with increased stroke risk has led to the publication of various stroke risk schemes such as the CHADS2 and, recently, the CHA2DS2 VASc scores .
Glypicans  are a conserved family of cell surface heparan sulfate proteoglycans  that modulate major signaling pathways during embryonic development of fruit flies to mammals . Accordingly, functional perturbation of glypicans has been shown to cause significant defects in cell fate, cell movements, survival and proliferation in mice, Xenopus laevis, Drosophila, and zebrafish  . During vertebrate development, glypicans are expressed in a spatiotemporally regulated manner in the nervous system and other tissues .
The knowledge of the three dimensional  structure of a protein is crucial in under  standing its biological function. The two main methods used in protein structure prediction are template based  and ab initio modeling. There was some new progress in model refinement as demonstrated in CASP10 and CASP11 ; however, it was based on very long time MD simulations, which may not be generally applicable for routine structure prediction .
Personality—an individual’s habitual pattern of cognition, emotion, and behaviour—is relatively stable and enduring . These changes may be influenced in part by genetic predispositions  or by environmental influences such as life experiences and age related role expectations . Continuous changes in brain structure and function that occur throughout life also likely play a significant role.
A central goal in cognitive and developmental science is to develop models that capture the richness of human behavior in specific situations and make behavioral predictions that span across situations. Although many models do an excellent job capturing the specific details of behavior, most models are exclusively linked to a single task and thus have relatively limited generalizability . There are a handful of formal models that have confronted this challenge, speaking to the processes that underlie behavior, while still addressing multiple tasks and time scales .
In the United States there were 58,000 cases and about 13,000 deaths from renal cell carcinoma in 2009 . Renal cell carcinoma represents 3.9% of all US cancers and 2% of all cancer deaths. The majority of kidney tumors are discovered incidentally during investigation of unrelated complaints.
The renin angiotensin aldosterone system  is a major humoral system involved in the control of blood pressure and volume . This system produces angiotensin II  from a precursor, angiotensinogen , produced by the liver , through sequential activation of two proteases, renin and angiotensin converting enzyme . Renin, produced in the kidney by the afferent arteriolar myoepithelial cells and released into the circulation, cleaves circulating AGT to yield a decapeptide, angiotensin I .
In short echo time  proton MR spectra of the human brain, a number of broad signals are observed which are believed to originate from ‘macromolecular’  compounds with relatively short T2 relaxation times . The biochemical origin of these signals is not completely certain, but it appears that they originate from cytosolic proteins, and perhaps also lipids . Resonances between 3.5 and 4.5 ppm have been assigned to α methine protons also .
The clostridial neurotoxins, botulinum neurotoxin  and tetanus neurotoxin  are the most toxic proteins for humans . TeNT is responsible for the paralytic disease tetanus, and BoNT is responsible for botulism. TeNT and BoNT share ~35% identity and ~65% similarity and overall structure function properties .
High birth weight  is an established risk factor for childhood acute lymoblastic leukemia . The purpose of this study was to evaluate if birth weight  corrected for gestational age is a better predictor than BW alone for occurrence of ALL and other malignancies in children . Birth certificate data of 2254 children with cancer who were younger than 5 years old at diagnosis and registered at Texas Cancer Registry during 19952003 were compared to 11734 age matched controls.
Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma is the predominant form of pancreatic cancer and one of the most lethal and aggressive human malignancies. Approximately 37,000 new cases are diagnosed annually in the United States alone, which is virtually the same number of deaths reported to occur every year due to metastatic complications . One of these originally novel genes, mda 7, displayed an inverse relationship with the pathogenesis and progression of melanoma .
Fatty acids are biosynthesized by the fatty acid synthase , which consists of several catalytic domains, either present on separate proteins  or on one polypeptide . Type II synthases are typically found in bacteria but also in mitochondria, chloroplasts and apicoplasts of eukaryotes. In type II synthases, ACP buries its attached cargo within its inner hydrophobic core, and protein protein interactions with catalytic proteins induces the acyl chain to release from the inner core and into the active site of the catalytic protein .
In smooth muscles, contraction is initiated by phosphorylation of the smooth muscle myosin  regulatory light chain  at Ser19 by Ca2+ CaM dependent myosin light chain kinase . ; ; MLCK is ubiquitously expressed in smooth muscles  and its only known substrate in vivo is myosin. This MLCK isoform has an actin binding domain, composed of 3 DFRXXL motifs, at the N terminus.
Smoking and physical inactivity rank among the top 3 modifiable risk factors for chronic disease and premature death. These unhealthy behaviors tend to clusterwithin person and have been associated withlower education level. Physical activitytends to be lower in smoking adults.
Recent epidemiological studies using administrative hospital data have reported trends of rising incidence and declining hospital mortality rates associated with severe sepsis in the Unites States . For example, increasing the number of claims for severe sepsis or acute organ failures by including patients who technically meet criteria for severe sepsis but have milder disease may enhance hospital reimbursement but result in lower illness severity among patients identified as having severe sepsis. Such a trend would potentially result in a spurious decline in mortality rates., Thus, without an alternative standard available with which to study mortality trends, it is unclear whether severe sepsis mortality is truly declining or whether reported improvements in severe sepsis outcomes are artifacts of changing coding and discharge practices .
Collective migration involves the coordinated movement of groups, strands or sheets of cells . It is a process essential to development, wound repair and pathogenic disease . Cell cell junctions are a pivotal feature of collectively migrating cells, as they provide the mechanism by which cells associate and communicate with one another.
HIV 1 entry is a multi step process; the trimeric surface glycoprotein of HIV 1, gp120, binds to CD4 on the host cell surface, and undergoes a conformational change enabling an interaction with the alternative coreceptors, CCR5 or CXCR4. Thereafter, the viral and cellular membranes fuse and the viral RNA enters the cell. Agents that inhibit these processes might allow further investigation of the molecular interactions involved, and also have potential as viral therapeutics .
The inflammatory cytokine tumor necrosis factor  α is an important tumor promoter in a variety of experimental animal models whether produced by initiated epithelial cells  or by stromal components . This cytokine is also produced by the malignant cells of advanced cancers , its presence often being associated with poor prognostic factors . Epithelial ovarian cancer is one cancer in which tumor cell TNF α production has been described .
Proliferation and differentiation are two fundamental cellular processes in development and cancer. These two processes are generally opposing each other in that inhibition of proliferation is necessary for differentiation and less differentiation is accompanied by more proliferation . Early research with AR deficient  mice and tissue reconstitution has established that androgen signaling in prostate epithelial cells directly promotes terminal cellular differentiation, not cell proliferation .
Food insecurity and malnutrition pose barriers to antiretroviral treatment  adherence in resource poor settings, and are often cited by patients, providers, and HIV treatment advocates as main obstacles to accessing and adhering to ART treatment . ART requires regular medical visits, which involve transport costs and lost work time, thereby reducing household monetary resources available for food acquisition. Poor adherence, in turn, leads to treatment failure and development and spread of drug resistance.
Pathogen recognition is a critical function of innate immunity. Classical” PRRs sense pathogen associated molecular patterns , structural molecular motifs that are evolutionarily conserved and shared among members of a given microbial class . In mouse and man, the TLRs represent a family of >10 single transmembrane classical PRRs that detect chemically conserved microbial components, for example, lipopolysaccharide , lipopeptides, and RNA.
Diabetes mellitus  is characterized by changes in fluid balance and blood volume homeostasis . Patients with type 1 diabetes have increased proximal tubular sodium reabsorption . Glomerular hyperfiltration is believed to play a role in the pathophysiology of diabetic nephropathy .
Most animal models of peripheral neuropathic pain involve partial nerve injury and manifest with hypersensitivity to noxious and non noxious stimuli in the neighboring spared territory . However, these models do not distinguish the cellular and molecular pathways specifically responsible for initiating and maintaining neuropathic pain like hypersensitivity  from the more general consequences of nerve damage, including the nerve regeneration response and the cellular stress response associated with altered metabolic and survival pathways. We have exploited the observation that partial nerve injury in rats from birth to the age of 3 weeks does not produce mechanical hypersensitivity  to tease out what is responsible for producing peripheral neuropathic mechanical allodynia in mature animals .
Bone is a dynamic tissue system in a constant state of flux. In bone loss diseases such as osteoporosis, bone resorption exceeds formation. Unfortunately, there are few successful means to induce anabolic bone formation.
Vaccination by gene delivery is an important immunization strategy for viral diseases. Naked DNA is the simplest platform for gene delivery. It avoids vector related concerns, is easy to make and temperature stable.
Noninjurious brief ischemia or systemic hypoxia are effective preconditioning stimuli known to promote a state of increased ischemic resistance, or “ischemic tolerance,” in the retina. , The endogenous basis for this protection is thought to result from the preconditioning induced transcriptional activation of a host of survival promoting genes, as well as post translational protein processing, that affect metabolic, inflammatory, excitotoxic, apoptotic, and oxidative injury pathways. In brain models of ischemic tolerance, cytokines, metabolic inhibitors, anesthetics, and a number of pharmacologic treatments can serve as preconditioning stimuli.
Acute kidney injury  is a frequent complication following surgery for congenital heart disease associated with cardiopulmonary bypass  procedures and has been associated with poor clinical outcomes . The development of AKI may result in fluid overload and AKI, further comprising the clinical course, which increases a patient’s mortality risk . Indications for PD discontinuation are also not standardized in the literature .
The central nervous system provides several examples of circuits specialized for fast processing because they subserve tasks in which long transmission delays have important behavioral costs. Similarly the vestibulo ocular reflex can cause eye movements within 1015 ms of head motion . The forebrain nuclei mediating song control form two segregated pathways .
Maintenance of blood glucose levels is one of the most tightly regulated systems in the body, and although all cells require glucose, it is only available from exogenous sources as well as hepatic and to a lesser extent renal cortical gluconeogenisis . Insulin plays a critical role in maintaining normal levels of plasma glucose. Insulin secretion is stimulated when blood glucose levels rise, which stimulates the uptake of glucose by skeletal muscle and other tissues via specific glucose transporter proteins and decreases glucose production by the liver .
Shinya Yamanaka received the Nobel Prize for Medicine or Physiology in 2012 for his discovery that the forced expression of the transcription factors Oct4, Sox2, Klf4 and cMyc  can induce nuclear reprogramming of somatic cells to induced pluripotent stem cells , . We recently discovered that the retroviral vectors used in nuclear reprogramming are more than mere vehicles for the transcription factors. Indeed, by activating innate immune signaling  these viral vectors cause global changes in the expression and activity of epigenetic modifiers.
Dementia is a substantial, and growing, public health problem . Roughly 25 million people worldwide  and at least 3.4 million individuals in the United States  have dementia . Patients hospitalized with a dementia diagnosis have adverse outcomes, including higher cost, longer stays, and higher mortality, compared to those without dementia even within similar co existing disease categories .
Women diagnosed with breast cancer today have significantly better survival outcomes compared with their counterparts 30 years ago . Currently, 1525% of newly diagnosed breast cancers are preinvasive ductal carcinoma in situ  , and with improvements in imaging these percentages are likely to increase. Some have suggested that improving the detection of early cancers is essential for further decreasing mortality rates .
Ovarian cancers arising in the setting of germline mutation of the BRCA1 tumor suppressor gene exhibit particular clinical and molecular features, including predominantly serous histology, a high grade suggestive of a more aggressive malignancy, and distinct gene expression profiles . Furthermore, these tumors exhibit mutational inactivation of p53 in up to 80% of cases . Inactivation of p53 is thought to promote tumor cell survival in the face of BRCA1 dependent defects in DNA repair .
Type 1 diabetes  results from a complex interplay between varying degrees of genetic susceptibility and environmental factors. A trio of interacting facets that create a ‘perfect storm’ for diabetes development have been proposed including  an aberrant intestinal microbiota,  a ‘leaky’ intestinal mucosal barrier and  altered intestinal immune responsiveness . The first of these, an aberrant intestinal microbiota, the focus of this investigation, could readily lead to mucosal barrier dysfunction and altered intestinal immune responsiveness .
Systemic Lupus Erythematosus  is a prototypic systemic autoimmune disease characterized by heterogeneous clinical manifestations including skin rashes, joint pain, glomerulonephritis, thrombocytopenia, hemolytic anemia, atherosclerosis and central nervous system damage . Autoantibody production is the major pathogenic mediator in SLE,  and a hallmark of the disease is the elevation in serum IgG antinuclear antibodies . The heterogeneous clinical manifestations in SLE appear to be associated with the production of different pathogenic autoantibodies, particularly to nuclear antigens and by an abnormal production of proinflammatory cytokines  .
Dopamine  released from the ventral tegmental area  is necessary for the processing of information related to rewarding properties . The two main patterns of activity of VTA DA neurons, i.e. pacemaker or bursting activity, are thought to modulate the neurophysiology of the mesocorticolimbic system . In addiction and schizophrenia these two firing modes appear to be altered .
Chagas disease is an emerging parasitic disease in developed countries. In endemic countries, ~1618 million people are infected with Trypanosoma cruzi, and at risk of disease development . In most patients, acute infection results in non specific clinical symptoms.
The striatum is a critical nucleus for the basal ganglia’s modulation of motor control and its pathology accounts for many movement disorders. In some genetic mouse models of HD, degenerative signs in the striatum are greater in the striosomes than matrix . To address this question, we used a specific neurotoxin to lesion MOR containing cells of the striosomes and examined motor behaviors before and after the lesion in 13 month old FVB mice.
Oocyte maturation involves several complex cellular processes encompassing both nuclear and cytoplasmic maturation. The IVM of oocytes derived from unstimulated ovaries provides a unique opportunity to investigate the acquisition of oocyte developmental competence. Although the NHP is an excellent translational model for studying processes related to human reproduction , currently there is very little information on culture requirements for the IVM of primate oocytes.
Rigorous evaluations of abstinence education programs show no effects on adolescent sexual behavior . Sexual cognitions can be defined as the attitudes, expectations, beliefs and values related to sexual behavior . Early adolescence is a time of developmental transition, and their sexual cognitions are likely different from those at older ages.
Idiopathic minimal lesion nephrotic syndrome , the most common type of nephrotic syndrome in children and adolescents, is currently considered an immune mediated disease . In 1974 Shalhoub proposed the hypothesis that IMLNS was a T cell disorder . Circulating T cells were postulated to release cytokine that reached the glomerulus and induced an increase in permeability to plasma proteins.
Adipose derived stem cells  are a somatic stem cell population contained in fat tissue that possess the ability for self renewal, differentiation into one or more phenotypes and functional regeneration of damaged tissue, which will benefit the recovery of erectile function by using a stem cell based therapy . We examined the current data associated with the definition and characterization of adipose derived stem cells, including the differentiation of these cells and the initial effects of adipose derived stem cell therapy in a rat model of erectile dysfunction . There is strong evidence supporting the concept that ADSCs are a potential stem cell therapy source for treatment of erectile dysfunction .
Occasional episodic acute complications characterize sickle cell disease  in childhood. These acute complications often become more frequent in adolescents, who additionally begin to display variable degrees of chronic multi organ dysfunction typical of adults with this disorder. Pain resulting from sickle erythrocyte vaso occlusion is the most common acute complication in children, with both pain and priapism potentially becoming frequently recurrent complications.
In 2008, lung cancer was expected to cause 161,840 deaths within the United States. About 16% of these lung cancer patients are expected to have small cell lung cancer . At the time of diagnosis, about 30% of SCLC patients will have a tumor that is confined to the following areas: hemithorax of origin, the mediastinum, or the supraclavicular lymph nodes.
The use of zebrafish  in biomedical research has dramatically increased in recent years . In contrast, Mycobacterium marinum is not frequently seen in zebrafish, but when it occurs it has been associated with acute to chronic infections and also high mortality . Mycobacteriosis in zebrafish presents many challenges to effective management and control of the disease once established within research colonies .
The fusion of the zinc finger domain of the ZNF198 gene with the kinase domain of the FGFR1  gene was originally defined  in an AMPD  with poor prognosis . In the BaF3 growth factor dependent hematopoietic cells, the fusion kinases can confer growth factor independence, although when expressed in primary mouse hematopoietic stem cells, is apparently not sufficient in itself to cause cell transformation  . Various approaches have been taken to investigate the function of the FGFR1 fusion kinases more extensively.
Clinical trials of tobramycin inhalation solution  in patients with cystic fibrosis  with chronic Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection have shown acute improvement in lung function. TIS use has increased since its introduction in 1998. However, efficacy in clinical trials does not necessarily represent effectiveness in the routine clinical practice setting.
Sulfur mustard  is a potent vesicant that has been used as a chemical warfare agent. Inhalation of sulfur mustard causes lung damage in humans and laboratory animals . Pathological responses in humans include bronchial mucosal injury, inflammation, fibrosis and pneumonia .
It is widely recognized that both the hippocampus and thalamus play a critical role in episodic memory functioning . However, the extent to which the hippocampus and thalamus make unique contributions to episodic memory functioning and the nature of their respective contributions remains somewhat unclear. Whereas the hippocampus supports long term memory encoding and storage of the associations among the constituent elements of an experience  , the thalamus has been implicated in the executive aspects of episodic memory.
With increasing age, the ability of the immune system to protect against new antigenic challenges or to control chronic infections erodes. Already between the ages of 50 and 70 years, incidence rates and morbidity of infectious diseases start to increase. In the subsequent decades of life, immune failure accelerates and is a major contribution to morbidity and mortality in the elderly.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease  is a progressive lung disease in which impeded airflow makes breathing difficult. COPD is estimated to become the fourth leading cause of death by 2030 . This phenomenon indicates that other factors contribute to the etiology of the disease .
Quantitative dietary assessment remains limited by the expense involved in telephone or in person interviews, the time required to conduct quantitative nutrient analyses, and the need for multiple days to capture intra individual intake variation and compare intakes with levels recommended by the National Academy of Science . FFQs are generally self administered, can be scanned for entry, and pose little burden on the study staff, subjects, and investigators. However, they have failed to demonstrate energy intake validity .
Mammalian mitochondrial DNA  is a covalently closed circular molecule of approximately 16.5 kb. The mechanism by which it replicates is a subject of intense debate. For almost thirty years mtDNA was believed to replicate via a strand displacement mechanism first proposed in 1972 .
HD is an adult onset neurodegenerative disorder characterized by progressive deterioration of cognitive and motor functions . Neurodegeneration occurs most severely in the MSNs of the striatum, and at later stages in the cortex and other regions of the brain . Several lines of evidence have demonstrated that excitotoxicity is an important mechanism leading to neuronal death in HD .
Parental emotion socialization is defined as the set of practices parents employ to teach their children about the causes and consequences of emotions, the appropriate display of emotions, and how to regulate emotions effectively . Prior research has consistently demonstrated that parents’ use of non supportive emotion socialization practices, such as punishing the child for being upset or discouraging the expression of negative emotions, is linked with negative outcomes such as internalizing and externalizing symptoms . Although the mechanisms that explain this difference have yet to be tested, it has been proposed that African Americans may interpret and experience non supportive emotion socialization less negatively than European Americans which may protect them from the negative effects of this type of emotion socialization on well being .
An estimated 3.1% of adults between ages 1549 in Nigeria live with HIV and AIDS . With population of 140 million, Nigeria has greater mortality and morbidity resulting from HIV/AIDS than many other African countries with higher prevalence rates. The epidemic in Nigeria is largely driven by circulating recombinant subtypes A, G, and CRF02_AG .
Myeloproliferative neoplasms  are a heterogeneous disease group. Their many overlapping clinical and histological features cause frequent diagnostic challenges. In 2008 the World Health Organization  revised the diagnostic criteria for essential thrombocythemia , polycythemia vera , primary myelofibrosis , myelodysplastic syndrome , and other MPN .
Human immunodeficiency virus type 1  as well as other lentiviruses encode for a Vif protein, which has been shown to be essential for HIV 1 replication in certain cell types. Several groups subsequently showed that the Vif protein can prevent hypermutation by binding to hA3G and targeting this protein for degradation via the proteasome . In addition to A3G, humans have six other A3 genes: hA3A, hA3B, hA3C, hA3DE, hA3F, and hA3H .
Rheumatoid arthritis  is an autoimmune disease whose pathophysiology involves multiple cellular lineages and inflammatory processes that conspire to produce synovial inflammation, joint pain, joint swelling, and ultimately destruction of cartilage and bone. Less widely appreciated is the marked increase in mast cell  numbers in the synovial sublining of RA patients . Indeed, numerous groups reported that joint tissue isolated from RA patients contains 6  to 25 fold more hTryptase β expressing MCs than normal synovial tissue.
Spontaneous low frequency fluctuations in the blood oxygenation level dependent  signal, measured using functional magnetic resonance imaging , promise to provide critical information about the functional organization of the brain. Various methods exist for analyzing resting state data, including independent component analysis , partial correlation , and clustering . This technique has proven useful in revealing the connectivity properties of many seed areas, and has been used extensively in recent years  due to its efficacy and ease of implementation .
Colorectal cancer  represents a major public health problem accounting for over 1 million cases of new cancer and about half a million deaths worldwide annually . The lifetime risk of developing CRC is 1 in 17, affecting men and women alike, with 90% of cases occurring after the age of 50 years . CRC is thought to develop from the progressive accumulation of genetic mutations, many of which affect the control of apoptosis .
Malaria is a serious public health problem in tropical regions of the world and is responsible for about 1.5 million deaths yearly, mainly among sub Saharan children under 5 years old . AMA1 is thought to participate in the re orientation and attachment of merozoites to red blood cells, a crucial phase in red blood cell invasion by the parasite . Inadequate knowledge about surrogate markers of protection against P. falciparum infection has been a major obstacle to the rational design of malarial vaccines and has complicated measurements of vaccine efficacy.
Neurohumoral activation in congestive heart failure  is thought to be important in the mechanisms of sudden cardiac death  and malignant ventricular arrhythmias. In recent years, the HRV variables have acquired growing importance in stratifying the risk of SCD and in serving as a clinical marker of CHF severity. , Among the HRV variables, in healthy subjects, low frequency  power , especially as expressed in the normalized form, and the ratio between LF power and high frequency  power , increase during sympathetic stress .
Multiple studies have demonstrated acute increases in cardiovascular mortality and morbidity associated with both increasing and decreasing ambient temperature . Due to climate change, there is the potential for more extreme temperatures, both hot and cold, which may increase cardiovascular morbidity and mortality. However, the mechanisms through which these acute changes in temperature may act are unclear.
For more than eight decades, it has been known that cancer cells exhibit altered metabolism when compared to their normal counterparts . These alterations include increased rates of glycolysis and pentose phosphate cycle activity along with slightly reduced mitochondrial respiration . In normal mammalian cells, mitochondria represent the major cellular organelle responsible for respiration .
Plethora of preclinical studies indicated that recombinant erythropoietin , a pleiotropic cytokine, is neuroprotective . Furthermore, studies from our laboratory indicated that vascular protective effects of EPO could also be extended to large cerebral arteries . While existing evidence supporting neuroprotective and vascular protective effects of EPO makes it an appealing candidate for evaluation of protection against cerebrovascular disorders, the effects of EPO on cerebral microvessels, the vascular component in the neurovascular unit mediating trophic support and regulating blood flow in brain, has not been investigated.
Sudden unexplained death due to cardiac arrhythmia may occur at any age. When death occurs during infancy for no apparent reason a diagnosis of the sudden infant death syndrome  may be appropriate. , Recent evidence suggests that 910% of SIDS victims carry germ line mutations in arrhythmia susceptibility genes such as those associated with the congenital long QT syndrome .
Alcohol exposure in utero is one of the leading preventable causes of poor birth outcomes. Together, these outcomes are known as Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders . FASD can have lifelong effects on a child's cognitive and behavioral functioning , in turn impacting educational achievement and long term social outcomes .
Methamphetamine  is a stimulant drug of abuse. This drug can be synthesized with relative ease using readily available precursors. Use of METH continues to spread throughout the United States due in large part to its widespread availability and its high abuse potential.
Skeletal development, growth, function and repair are complex processes mediated by multiple cell types, such as osteoblasts, chondrocytes and osteoclasts, which are regulated by diverse microenvironmental cues including cell extracellular matrix  interactions. Adhesion to ECM is primarily mediated by the integrin receptor family, which also regulates crucial cell functions such as survival, migration and differentiation . During embryonic skeletal development, osteoblasts and chondrocytes differentiate from common precursor cells, found in condensed mesenchymal tissue.
Hyaluronic acid  is a high molecular weight carbohydrate polymer that plays a role in tissue growth, development, wound healing, and inflammation. HA consists of a disaccharide unit  repeated several thousand times. With no sulfate groups nor other charge modifications, HA might at first glance appear to be a passive molecule.
In the United States, hepatoma and pancreatic carcinomas have 5 year survival rates of less than 10% and less than 5%, respectively . These statistics emphasize the need to develop novel therapies against these lethal malignancies . The extracellular signalregulated kinase 1/2  pathway is frequently dysregulated in neoplastic transformation .
Our understanding of organismal evolution has improved significantly in recent decades, thanks largely to the contributions of improved molecular techniques and new microscopy data. However, the root of the eukaryotes and the relationships among these eukaryotic supergroups remain uncertain. Other authors have proposed alternative hypotheses, placing the root of the eukaryotes in the Excavata  or the Plantae ; however, these hypotheses do not generally contradict a monophyletic union of the unikonts  .
Intestinal immune homeostasis must encompass effective defense against pathogens but tolerance to antigens from food and commensals. T regulatory  cells are central to intestinal immune tolerance and are considered a potential therapeutic target in inflammatory bowel disease ., Tregs developing in the thymus are known as natural Treg , whereas those developing from conventional T cells are termed induced Treg  cells. Both nTreg and iTreg are characterized by expression of the transcription factor Forkhead box P3  which is essential to their suppressive function., However, many patients suffering from IBD have increased rather than decreased numbers of Foxp3+ Treg,,  leading to the suggestion that it is not the overall number of Foxp3+ Treg, but the formation of iTregs that is essential to intestinal immune homeostasis, similar to their role in oral tolerance., found that mice lacking the Foxp3 enhancer CNS1, which are unable to develop iTregs but have normal nTreg development and function, exhibit pronounced inflammation at mucosal sites such as the gastrointestinal and respiratory tracts.
Organogenesis depends on the precise execution of discrete gene expression cascades and the acquisition of stable cell identities from multi potent progenitors. DNA methylation on cytosine is a heritable epigenetic modification that is pivotal in regulating the transcriptional accessibility of the genome ). This regulation is effectuated in part by methylcytosine binding proteins that recruit chromatin modifying machinery and restrict transcription via heterochromatin formation ).
Because of its multiple vital functions, it is critical that the central nervous system  be successfully defended against pathogens. However, it is now well established that immune surveillance and inflammatory responses do occur within this compartment . Indeed, in response to either cerebral injury or systemic bacterial infection, the CNS launches a well organized immunological reaction that encompasses both neural components and peripheral immune system cells.
Methadone is a long acting μ opioid agonist that is highly effective for the treatment of opioid dependency. Among the opioid drug class, methadone is prescribed to a minority of patients, but is disproportionately implicated in opioid related deaths. While the higher lethality of methadone likely reflects its potency and long half life, it is known to block the cardiac delayed rectifier potassium ion current  and has been associated with prolongation of the rate corrected QT interval  and torsade de pointes.
Multiple myeloma  is a progressive hematological malignancy that ultimately results in renal failure, lytic bone lesions, hypercalcemia, and anemia . Standard myeloma treatment traditionally involves high dose chemotherapy and autologous stem cell transplant . Unfortunately even the most effective treatment eventually fails, resulting in chronic relapse and treatment resistance.
Temporal lobe epilepsy  is a common cause of intractable seizures , but mechanisms governing seizure propensity in TLE remain elusive. In many animal TLE models, an initial episode of status epilepticus  followed by a seizure free interval  before spontaneous seizures commence. In TLE, seizures often originate in the hippocampus .
Understanding the transmission dynamic of generalized HIV epidemics is key to prevention strategies. One model estimated that the majority of infections occurred within long term stable HIV serodiscordant couples, suggesting that couples voluntary counseling and testing  could prevent transmission, mitigating the epidemic., An alternative approach estimated that upwards of two thirds of infections occurred via multiple partnerships, predominantly outside of stable relationships, and thus would not be amenable to a CVCT intervention. We examined this issue using data on incident infections from Rakai, Uganda before and after the availability of antiretroviral therapy  .
Autonomic innervation is the primary extrinsic control mechanism regulating heart rate variability and cardiac performance. Chronic hyperglycemia promotes progressive autonomic neural dysfunction and cardiovascular autonomic neuropathy . Presence of CAN may be documented by abnormal heart rate variability.
In activated macrophages and neutrophils, excessive amounts of NO  are produced by inducible NO synthase to kill pathogenic bacteria and tumor cells . Among the primary targets of NO cytotoxicity are the iron containing redox centers hemes and iron sulfur clusters in proteins . Unlike reversible binding of NO to hemes in proteins , iron sulfur clusters are completely disrupted by NO forming the protein bound DNICs  .
Mutations in the PARK2 gene, which encodes the ubiquitin ligase, parkin, cause autosomal recessive juvenile parkin sonism . Parkin is found throughout the brain, including the hippocampus . Despite a lack of consistent overt motor phenotypes in parkin knockout mice created by several different groups , non motor alterations including behavioral phenotypes indicative of hippocampal dysfunction have been described in some of these mice .
A major quest in neuroscience is to understand the anatomical and functional organization of the brain. Other classical studies  organized the cortex based on myeloarchitecture, the density and arrangement of myelinated fibers across the depth of the cortex. For example, dense myelin bundles run horizontally throughout layer IV of the primary visual cortex in a feature called the stripe of Gennari.
Lung cancer is the second most common malignancy in the US and is responsible for more deaths than any other cancer. Pulmonary resection provides the best chance of cure for patients with early stage disease. Blacks with early stage lung cancer have lower 5 year survival rates than whites, and this difference in outcome has been attributed to lower rates of resection among blacks.
The effect of vitamin D on calcium and phosphate homeostasis is well known. However, the intracellular vitamin D receptor is broadly distributed among a variety of tissues, including leukocytes, vascular smooth muscle cells , and juxtaglomerular cells, implying other potential effects of vitamin D.   In addition, the 1α hydroxylase enzyme  is also widely distributed, expressed in endothelial cells, VSMC, macrophages, and various locations in the kidney. Experimental studies demonstrate that 1,252D inhibits renin expression,,  enhances insulin secretion and sensitivity,,  and blocks proliferation of VSMC.
Temporal Lobe Epilepsy  is a common form of focal epilepsy associated with major synaptic remodeling and rewiring of neuronal circuitry. This reorganization is thought to promote the progression of epilepsy. Alterations in inhibitory synaptic transmission combined with synapse reorganization may have an essential role in initiating and ultimately maintaining the seizure prone condition of the brain.
Obliterative bronchiolitis , and its clinical manifestation bronchiolitis obliterans syndrome, is a fibrotic airway obstruction disease that develops in response to many different stimuli, including toxicant exposure  and respiratory infections . Unfortunately, predicting which lung transplant recipients develop OB pathology has been unsuccessful to date due to a lack of discernible risk factors. IL 13 acts through its remodeling effects on airway epithelial cells .
Microglia, the principal resident innate immune cells in the central nervous system , have diverse roles in health and disease. Microglial activation is associated with virtually all CNS disorders or injuries, although their role in pathophysiology is not fully understood. Emerging studies suggest that microglia also play active roles in the healthy CNS .
The tripartite fibroblast growth factor  signaling system comprised of oligomeric combinations of variants of four transmembrane tyrosine kinases , diverse oligosaccharides within heparan sulfate and 18 transmembrane receptor activating FGFs is a ubiquitous mediator of tissue homeostasis through sensing perturbation and mediating cell to cell communication . Cell specific expression of FGFR isotype, heparin sulfate oligosaccharide motifs and other co factors combine to confer cell and tissue specificity of FGF signaling both in respect to activating FGF  and activation of downstream intracellular pathways . Dependent on cellular context, specific FGF, FGFR and heparan sulfate combinations may have opposite endpoints even within the same tissue .
Cigarette smoking, the leading cause of death in USA, accounts for ∼440,000 deaths and costs more than 167 related billion dollars, annually . Thus, the smoking components travel within the blood, which contains immune cells such as B cells, T cells, monocytes, and other active components. Long term exposure to nicotine can induce B cells to decrease the antibody secretion, inhibit the cell proliferation and development, and finally suppress the normal immune function  .
POLQ  is a member of the A family of DNA polymerases, which, unusually for this class of polymerases, synthesizes DNA with very low fidelity . The precise physiological functions of this protein are currently unclear. However a recent study found that mutation types and frequencies were similar in wild type, POLQ−/−, POLH−/−, and POLQ−/−POLH−/− mice .
The primary function of the endothelium is to act as a living barrier between blood and tissue that can, among many other functions, control the passage of molecules and leukocytes into and out of the bloodstream. Among various types of leukocytes, monocytes are thought to be important in particular for a variety of chronic inflammatory responses, most notably in the development of atherosclerotic lesions. Interestingly, evidence is mounting that endothelial cells also actively adapt themselves to assist the transmigration process.
Nuclear factor κB  is a transcription factor with critical roles in a number of inflammatory responses, as well as oncogenesis, metastasis and chemoresistance. There are five members of the NF κB family: p50/p105 , p52/p100 , c Rel, RelB, and p65 , characterized by the presence of the Rel homology domain which is involved in DNA binding, dimerization, and regulation by inhibitory proteins . Once freed from its binding proteins in the cytoplasm, NF κB is able to accumulate in the nucleus and interact with regulatory elements and affect gene specific transcription  .
High gamma  oscillations of electrocorticogram  signals play a crucial role both for functional brain mapping  and for BCI research . These HG signals are spatially localized over specific areas of the cortex directly related to the individuals environment and behavior. Consequently, these HG signals provide unique spatio temporal spectral signatures of task related brain activity.
Magnesium  is the most abundant divalent cation in biology and is essential to all living cells as it participates in a myriad of key physiological and biochemical processes, from enzymatic activity to genomic stability. In bacteria, Mg2+ homeostasis is carried out by three molecularly distinct translocation systems, MgtA/B, MgtE and CorA. CorA belongs to the GMN family and has been proposed to be one of the major Mg2+ uptake pathway.
The Microscale Life Sciences Center  at the University of Washington is dedicated to performing multi parameter analysis at the single cell level . Studying individual cells allows for a more comprehensive understanding of a cell’s activities. Understanding the characteristics of outlier cells is believed to be essential for developing better diagnoses and treatments of such ailments as heart disease, stroke, and cancer .
MicroRNAs  are small ~22 nucleotide  RNAs that post transcriptionally regulate gene expression . Using the mature miRNA as a guide, miRISC downregulates target gene expression . Underlying this importance is the finding that each step in miRNA biogenesis is subject to regulation .
Melanoma is a skin cancer arising from the uncontrolled proliferation and invasion of melanocytes. It has also been proposed that melanoma cells switch between mutually exclusive invasive and proliferative states., The proliferative state is characterised by high expression of the melanocyte transcription factor MITF and low Brn2 expression, whereas the invasive state is characterised as having Brn2 expression but low MITF expression., NICD binds to the DNA binding factor RBPSUK  and leads to increased transcription of target genes. The SRF pathway links changes in the actin cytoskeleton to gene transcription.
The thermophilic bacterium T. thermophilus has become a model organism for understanding life at extreme temperatures . It is also a rich source of proteins and macromolecular complexes for which structures have been determined including RNA polymerase , the 70S ribosome  and the Cmr complex of the CRISPR Cas host defense system . Additionally, several genetic tools are in place including an E. coli T. thermophilus shuttle vector  and the ability to make targeted gene knockouts by homologous recombination and gene replacement with any of three thermostable antibiotic resistance genes  .
Hypothyroidism, and to a lesser degree, hyperthyroidism and thyroid cancer, occur at increased rates following radiotherapy exposure to the thyroid. Children treated for acute lymphoblastic leukemia  may receive cranial or craniospinal radiotherapy as part of therapy, placing them at risk of thyroid dysfunction due to disruption of the hypothalamic pituitary axis and/or direct injury to the thyroid gland. While the risk of thyroid dysfunction has been described following higher dose radiotherapy given for brain tumors and Hodgkin lymphoma, the effect of lower doses given to ALL patients has not been as well characterized.
Cocaine is a highly abused psychostimulant with repeated use potentially culminating in drug addiction. As such, the aim of the present study was to investigate the role of the intracellular signaling protein, glycogen synthase kinase 3  on behaviors associated with acute and repeated cocaine administration . Dopaminergic cell bodies originate in the ventral tegmental area and the substantia nigra and project to the nucleus accumbens and caudate putamen, respectively.
Epilepsy is a common neurological disorder that affects about 1% of the world's population , and genetic epilepsy  syndromes comprise ~30% of all cases . The receptor is composed of five subunits, and the predominant synaptic receptors are composed of two α subunits, two β subunits and one γ2 subunit. Three GABRG2 mutations R82Q, P83S and N79S  were reported to be associated with generalized epilepsies and are all located in the same structural loop in the N terminus of γ2 subunits, suggesting that they might impair GABAA receptor function similarly .
Paclitaxel is a microtubule dynamics inhibitor widely used in cancer chemotherapy. Paclitaxel stabilizes microtubules, and as a result, interferes with normal microtubule breakdown during cell division, resulting in suppression of microtubule dynamics . The incidence of neuropathy in patients receiving paclitaxel is estimated to be 5090 % and is characterized by dysesthesia  of the hands and feet .
By the year 2030 there will be about 70 million Americans aged 65 and older. Among this group the “old old” who are over age 85 will be the fastest growing group . This dramatic increase in the elderly population will place significant stress on the healthcare system and increase the number of older individuals seen by almost all types of physicians.
Helper dependent adenoviral  vectors hold tremendous potential for a large number of therapeutic applications ranging from inherited disorders to cancer and vaccination. HDAd can infect a large variety of cell types to mediate long term, high level expression without chronic toxicity. However, a major disadvantage of HDAd is the induction of a potent and potentially lethal acute reaction following systemic injection of high vector doses.
The requirements for successful cancer immunotherapy are not fully understood. Tumor vaccines that successfully result in the stimulation of large numbers of tumor specific CTL do not necessarily result in tumor destruction . Several factors may constrain tumor eradication by specific effector CD8+ T cells.
Insulator DNA sequences are thought to partition the genome into functional chromosomal domains to regulate gene transcription . The compartmentalization of chromatin into distinct regulatory domains seems to alter interactions between target genes and nearby cis acting enhancer elements . CTCF was the first human insulator DNA binding protein identified that is a ubiquitously expressed, highly conserved, zinc finger protein that has multiple roles in gene regulation , including regulation of the imprinted maternal H19 allele .
Branched tubular organs such as the lung, vascular system, and kidney are essential for transporting oxygen, nutrients, and cells in all multicellular organisms. Type I tubes are multicellular, such as the dorsal trunk  and the majority of transverse connective . The narrower Type II tubes are unicelluar, such as the lateral trunk , ganglionic branch , dorsal branch , and visceral branch .
Genetic analysis can be used to identify genes required for specific behaviors and can lead to the identification of neural circuits and molecular mechanisms underlying the behavior. On the other hand, brain mechanisms that control sexual behavior in virgin females remain largely unknown . Receptive virgin females decide to accept courting males and copulate with them.
Nipah and Hendra viruses are highly pathogenic paramyxoviruses of the henipavirus genus that cause acute encephalitis and respiratory illness. Their mortality rate in humans can be greater than 90%, and they are the only paramyxoviruses that are classified as biosafety level 4  pathogens. The geographical distribution of these reservoir bats partially coincides with the distribution of HNV outbreaks and spillovers events around the Indian Ocean, reaching from Australia  to Southeast Asia and the Indian subcontinent .
The health benefits of physical activity  and aerobic fitness for children are well established . In general, published research indicates a positive, or at worst, a null association of PA and aerobic fitness with AA . conducted a three year randomized trial with elementary aged students to increase their PA to at least 90 weekly minutes by integrating PA and academic lessons in intervention classrooms.
Frontotemporal dementia  is a set of progressive disorders affecting predominantly the frontal and/or anterior temporal lobes of the brain. The genetics of FTD is complex, with multiple genes associated with disease etiology. Sixty six pathogenic mutations have been reported  in GRN.
Emerging evidence suggests that a significant number of the gene mechanisms that contribute to risk for schizophrenia modulate complex cognitive functions that depend upon the prefrontal cortex and medial temporal lobe . These genotype phenotype relationships further underscore the value of cognitive mechanisms as candidate endophenotypes for schizophrenia and related psychotic disorders . More recently, attention has focused on DTNBP1, the gene that codes for dystrobrevin binding protein  and its relationship to cognition .
Enzymes that produce nicotinamide from the catabolism of nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide  are now appreciated to mediate many physiological processes that were nearly unimaginable just a decade ago. After DNA damage, PARPs consume NAD+ to form large ADP ribose polymers and nicotinamide. Among other proposed functions, these polymers facilitate DNA double strand break repair .
Depression has substantial public health implications. It has been shown to exacerbate disease progression, disability, and cognitive decline, as well as increase the risk of mortality . It is also one of the most common psychiatric illnesses.
The coronary vasculature is essential for heart function, yet the processes that govern its formation are incompletely understood. It then envelops the developing heart, thus giving rise to the epicardium, the outer, mesothelial layer of the heart . Recent studies have indicated that PE identity is reliant on correct bone morphogenetic protein  and fibroblast growth factor  signaling  .
Rodents are capable of fine tactile discrimination tasks that require detection and processing of rapid whisker movements occurring in close succession . Thalamic barreloid neurons respond typically with 0 3 spikes per stimulus to single or periodic whisker deflections, with a mean of less than 2 spikes/stimulus . In support of this view, cells in layer IV of visual and somatosensory cortex are thought to respond preferentially to near synchronous firing of their thalamic input neurons .
Prostaglandins  play a diverse role in many physiological and pathological events in the human body. The currently available NSAIDs  inhibit either cyclooxygenase  1 or COX 2 or both. Recent withdrawal of rofecoxib  due to side effects further highlights the need to develop safer anti inflammatory drugs.
Social networks are defined as the web of social relationships that surround an individual. The most commonly examined characteristic in the epidemiologic literature on social networks and breast cancer survival is social network size, i.e. the number of network members. In the Nurses’ Health Study  of 2,835 postmenopausal women with any stage breast cancer, Kroenke and colleagues found that socially isolated women, i.e., those with small networks, were twice as likely to die of their breast cancer than socially integrated women.
Hypertension is the most common primary diagnosis in the US with about 35 million office visits and is a major risk factor for stroke, myocardial infarction, heart failure, and chronic kidney disease. It has been recognized that modifiable lifestyle factors  could play an important role in the prevention of hypertension. Consequently, the Seventh Report of the Joint National Committee on Prevention, detection, Evaluation, and Treatment of high blood pressure  recognized lifestyle management as an important factor in the prevention of hypertension.
Cannabis, the most widely used illicit drug worldwide, exerts dose related psychoactive effects when the primary psychoactive component, Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol , interacts with cannabinoid receptors in brain. THC binding to the CB1 cannabinoid receptor leads to the “high” experienced by cannabis smokers . Whole blood 11 OH THC concentrations are only about 10% of THC concentrations after smoking cannabis, in comparison to nearly equivalent concentrations after oral THC administration .
Tobacco smoking causes 500,000 deaths annually in the United States, and nicotine is the single most important pharmacological agent responsible for tobacco addiction . Nicotine, cotinine and 3HC undergo further phaseII detoxification reactions by conjugation with glucuronic acid via catalysis by the UDP glucuronosyltransferase  family of enzymes. Up to 31% of nicotine urinary metabolites are in the form of phase II glucuronidated compounds, with nicotine N glucuronide , cotinine N glucuronide , and cotinine 3′ O glucuronide  comprising the majority of these conjugates .
Relationships between objective measures of chronic rhinosinusitis  and health related quality of life  remain elusive for patients electing endoscopic sinus surgery . There is evidence that a patients’ subjective symptomatic experience correlates with improved HRQOL following sinus surgery. , However, a patients’ symptomatic experience has been shown, at best, to be weakly associated with objective findings such as computed tomography  results.
Myocardial infarction  and stroke are the leading vascular contributors to illness and death in the United States,,  with hundreds of thousands of Americans experiencing one of these events annually. In 2010, 7.6 million US adults were MI survivors and 6.8 million were stroke survivors, and these prevalence rates are predicted to increase by up to 25% over the next two decades owing to treatment advances and growth of the population aged 65 or older. The chronic care of MI and stroke survivors will place huge burdens on families, health care systems, and public programs such as Medicare and Medicaid .
Several cluster randomized HIV prevention trials aim to demonstrate the population level preventive impact of antiretroviral therapy . 2013 World Health Organization guidelines raising the ART initiation threshold to CD4<500/µL could attenuate these trials’ effect size by increasing ART usage in control clusters . We used a computational model to simulate strategies from a hypothetical cluster randomized HIV prevention trial.
Wnt signaling plays an essential role in the regulation of bone homeostasis and fracture repair . Activation of Wnt signaling by means of secreted Wnts leads to increased bone formation. This anabolic activity is regulated by the expression of several Wnt antagonists, such as secreted frizzled related proteins , Wnt inhibitory factor 1 , Dickkopf 1  and Sclerostin .
Environmental factors and genetic variants acting alone and in combination influence two interrelated and highly prevalent metabolic diseases, obesity and atherosclerosis . Obesity, particularly when coupled with insulin resistance and dyslipidemia, is a significant risk factor for vascular disease, but mechanisms driving this risk remain unclear . Also, gene discovery as well as gene gene and gene environment interactions can be identified efficiently.
Focal adhesion kinase  is an important cancer target, because FAK gene amplification and protein overexpression have been demonstrated in a wide range of malignancies . FAK inhibitors have been shown to decrease tumor growth and metastasis in preclinical models, and have shown initial clinical activity in cancer patients  . Alternatively, identification of a synthetic lethal relationship between a drug target and loss of a tumor suppressor is exemplified by the efficacy of PARP inhibitors in breast cancer bearing BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations .
Drug transport into the nail is expected to be influenced by formulation factors, such as pH. pH can influence nail permeability by affecting the degree of drug ionization within the solution or by altering the keratin matrix within the nail itself. found the penetration of miconazole to be independent of pH between pH 3.1 and 8.2.
Fibrinogen is a 340,000 kDa protein synthesized in the liver that plays an essential role in clot formation. Fibrinogen is composed of two sets of three polypeptide chains: Aα, Bβ and γ, which are assembled with the stoichiometry 2 . This allows for interaction of neighboring fibrin monomers to form the matrix that is the foundation of a fibrin clot.
Reactive oxygen species  are produced by metabolic processes such as oxidative phosphorylation, and the cytochrome p450 monoxygenase system, but can also be generated by radiation or other environmental exposures. We previously reported that plasma protein carbonyls, and urinary 15 f2t isoprostanes, were associated with an increase in breast cancer risk in a large case control study . Additionally, higher levels of 8 oxodG adducts have been detected in breast tumor tissue compared with adjacent non tumor tissue, and with normal breast tissue from controls .
Reactive oxygen species  generated during prolonged ischemia and subsequent reperfusion are known to contribute to ischemia/reperfusion injury , although, paradoxically, transient ROS generation is also an essential trigger for cardioprotection by ischemic  and pharmacologic preconditioning . In cardiac cells, mitochondria are the major source of ROS, although intracellular NADPH oxidase, xanthine oxidase, monoamine oxidase, etc., may become important ROS sources under pathophysiological conditions. Mitochondria energized with physiologically relevant NADH related substrates produce very little ROS, unless other factors, such as respiratory chain inhibitors  or mitochondrial ATP sensitive K channel activators  are also present.
Traumatic injury accounted for 30% of all life years lost in the United States and was the leading cause of death in Americans between 1 and 44 years old . Acute alcohol exposure was encountered in more than 30% of trauma patients and intoxication carried the highest risk for injury . Alcohol exposed trauma victims who survived their injuries were at increased risk for nosocomial infection and acute respiratory distress syndrome .
Vision is an active process—we frequently move our eyes, head, and body to acquire visual information to guide our actions. However, self movement also complicates interpretation of retinal images. Consider the case of an observer who translates side to side while counter rotating their eye to maintain fixation on a world fixed target .
Inorganic polyphosphates are used in the meat industry to increase the water holding capacity  of pork, poultry and beef products . Polyphosphates were initially used mainly in the poultry  and fish industry , with recent applications in pork and current studies on beef in terms of near intact muscle cuts . Polyphosphate use in comminuted meat products improves yield and is particularly useful for production of low salt products  .
Completion of a blood meal by the tick Ixodes scapularis requires an extended period of feeding during which it can transmit the pathogenic spirochete Borrelia burgdorferi. While attached to the host, the tick must overcome both short term responses such as the hemostatic system, and long term defenses such as acquired immunity. Their presence in the saliva suggests that they may target some of the essential processes enumerated above .
Abdominal aortic calcification  is associated with incident myocardial infarction or stroke, but no study has reported the association of AAC on lateral spine dual energy X ray absorptiometry  images with coronary artery calcium . The primary aim of this study was to assess the association between AAC scored on lateral spine DXA images intended for vertebral fracture assessment  using a validated 24 point semi quantitative scale and coronary artery calcium detected with electron beam computed tomography  in community dwelling older men and women without known heart disease. The secondary aims of this study were to assess the association between AAC scored on VFA images with a newer simplified 8 point semi quantitative scale and CAC scored with EBCT, and to perform an exploratory analysis of the additional prediction of a high CAC level from the additional of AAC score on lateral spine DXA images combined with clinical risk factors compared to the prediction of CAC from clinical risk factors alone .
Silencing is distinct from classic gene repression in its ability to block transcription throughout a chromosomal region. Chromatin domains that restrict gene expression are widespread in multi cellular organisms, playing crucial roles in development, cell identity, and position effect variegation of trans genes. Hence, silencing of HML and HMR is needed for a robust mating ability .
Human rhinoviruses  cause the common cold and are frequently detected in asthma exacerbations. RV typically induces neutrophilic inflammation in the upper airways of both asthmatic and non asthmatic patients; however, in asthmatics these infections can lead to more severe lower respiratory symptoms, as well as reductions in lung function. Interestingly, the severity of asthma symptoms may not be related to viral load, prolonged viral shedding, or to differences in proinflammatory cytokines in the upper airway secretions.
Individuals with schizophrenia consistently show impairments in social cognition . SC has become a potential treatment target due to its association with functional outcomes. An alternative method of assessment is to administer an observer based scale incorporating an informant’s “first hand” impressions in ratings .
An increase in urban populations in developing countries has been accompanied by increased industrial activities, an indiscriminate use of pesticides, a lack of environmental regulation and an increase in poorly planned cities, all resulting in environmental pollution .
