The presence of Aedes aegypti   larvae has been confirmed in polluted habitats such as drains containing domestic wastewater and man made aquatic habitats , habitats previously not associated with this species of mosquito. Metallic habitats are of particular interest as they provide a source of metal contamination directly to the breeding site.
The insulin/IGF 1 like signaling  pathway is an evolutionarily conserved neuro endocrine pathway that regulates metabolism, development, stress resistance and lifespan . These kinases in turn function to negatively regulate the forkhead transcription factor , DAF 16  . Reduction of function mutations in serine/threonine kinases upstream of DAF 16 lead to changes in lifespan, development, metabolism and/or stress resistance .
The Breast Cancer Susceptibility Gene 1  encodes a tumor suppressor that acts to maintain genetic stability. Individuals that inherit a mutation in BRCA1 are predisposed to developing breast, ovarian, and other cancers. In fact, carriers of BRCA1 mutations have a 4475% lifetime risk for developing breast cancer  and up to an approximate 45% risk for developing a second primary breast cancer .
Federal regulation of cigarettes and other tobacco products has been recommended as an element of a broad based approach to reduce the disease burden of tobacco use . Nicotine is responsible for tobacco induced disease in that it sustains tobacco use. It has been suggested that reduction of nicotine availability would make cigarettes less addicting and might facilitate quitting, thereby reducing smoking related disease .
Current standard combination chemotherapy regimens for patients with metastatic CRC contain 5 fluorouracil  in combination with oxaliplatin or irinotecan. Although the response rate to systemic therapies is ~50%, drug resistance develops in nearly all patients with metastatic CRC, leading to ~50,000 deaths each year in the United States . Advances in targeted therapy have not dramatically improved the outcomes of patients with metastatic CRC, and the majority of those with unresectable metastatic disease still die within 2 years of the diagnosis of metastasis .
The behavioral investigation of human memory has been of interest to neuropsychologists for several decades. Certain behavioral tests, in particular free recall, clearly display the memory deficit associated with a number of types of brain damage , neurological disorders , and healthy aging . A number of prominent studies have documented the organizational difficulties exhibited by various patient groups in free recall.
The vascular injury in systemic sclerosis  occurs very early in the disease, even before the onset of fibrosis. It has been suggested that vessel permeability and injury coincide with the infiltration of immune cells, mainly consisting of T cells and macrophages localised at perivascular regions. This immune cell recruitment is facilitated by vascular endothelial cells which, upon injury, upregulate adhesion molecules such as VCAM 1, ICAM 1 and E selectin, ultimately leading to immune activation, cell recruitment and tissue damage.
A growing interest in the field of glycobiology, defined in a broad sense as the study of sugars and their roles in biology, has emerged in recent years. Glycoconjugates, which include three broad groups, proteoglycans, glycoproteins, and glycolipids, are ubiquitously distributed in the cells, bodily fluids, tissues and organs, including the brain, of all animals, and are primarily, localized on the cell surface. Research in this area has uncovered many roles for both glycolipids and glycoproteins in the basic functioning of the brain.
Dendritic cells  are the primary antigen presenting cells  that mediate T cell immunity and tolerance . It has been suggested that LC continuously migrate to the cutaneous lymph node  to maintain tolerance to self Ag, however, a series of recent studies suggested that LCs may have an immunostimulatory function even in the steady state . The role of dDCs has remained even more elusive .
The importance of karyotype at diagnosis in predicting outcome in patients with acute myeloid leukemia  and myelodysplastic syndrome  is well established. These studies have clearly demonstrated that the outcome for patients with chromosome 5 and 7 abnormalities  have an inferior leukemia free survival and overall survival when traditional cytotoxic chemotherapy, including combinations of cytarabine and anthracyclines, are used. Such inferior outcome is also seen even with the use of allogeneic stem cell transplantation in first complete remission .
Internationally, the Peer Change Agent  model is one of the most frequently used conceptual frameworks for HIV prevention interventions . Peer change agents  are generally trained to use similar strategies to communicate HIV risk reduction messages among targeted peers. Change agents themselves, however, can often be more important than the messages they convey.
CL was the first polyglycerolphospholipid discovered and was first isolated from beef heart by Mary Pangborn . CL is localized to both inner and outer mitochondrial membranes and within contact sites in mammalian cells . CL anchors cytochrome c to the inner mitochondrial membrane  and may play a key role in cytochrome c release and apoptosis .
The mitogen activated protein  kinase / extracellular signal regulated kinase  pathway regulates cell cycle progression, cellular growth, survival, differentiation, and senescence by responding to extracellular signals. However, patients become resistant within a year of treatment . Although BRAFV600E supports melanoma proliferation, benign melanocytic nevi also harbor BRAF mutations.
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is the most common of liver pathologies and is closely associated with obesity and the metabolic syndrome. In patients with NASH, there is an initial development of steatosis, plus a second insult resulting in disease progression. This sensitizes the liver to potential “second hits” resulting in hepatocellular injury, inflammation and fibrosis.
It has been postulated that in schizophrenia there is a progressive excitotoxic process involving excessive glutamatergic activity in various cortical and subcortical fields that may account for the deteriorating course of the illness. This leads to neuronal dysfunction and underlies the deteriorating cognitive and social functional state characteristic of the illness, despite the beneficial symptomatic effects of antipsychotic medications. Most of the evidence for this process is indirect and stems from pharmacological studies with N methyl D aspartate receptor  blockers.
Gap junctions, formed by connexin  molecules, are transmembrane channels allowing the exchange of small molecules , such as metabolites, ions and second messengers between contacting cells. This type of cell cell communication is crucial in maintaining normal cell and tissue functions . Gap junctions are formed by a family of proteins named connexins, with approximately 20 different members in humans .
Although appropriate use of prescription drugs can substantially improve health status, accessing these treatments may sometimes consume catastrophic proportions of available income. Recent surveys have shown that low income households often cut back on basic necessities or take less medication than prescribed due to out of pocket drug costs . Family budgets in low income households are very tight, dominated by basic living needs for housing, food, and transportation.
Thymocytes undergo a series of developmental stages through interactions with major histocompatibility complex  expressing antigen presenting cells , resulting in the generation of mature T lymphocytes and selection of the T cell repertoire . This results in the selection of T cells expressing receptors recognizing a universe of foreign antigens in association with self MHC in the absence of autoreactivity. Although B cells also reside in the thymus in normal mice and humans , less attention has been paid to the thymic B cell population.
The primate auditory system is characterized by two parallel, chemically defined processing pathways that can be segregated based on immunoreactivity to either parvalbumin  or calbindin . The immunoreactivity to these calcium binding proteins  is sufficient to differentiate specific subdivisions of auditory nuclei, especially in midbrain, thalamic, and cortical structures . Currently, the functional purpose of these density changes remains unknown .
Acute myocardial infarction  is one of the leading causes of morbidity and mortality in the adult population that strikes 7.6 million American adults, or about one person every 44 seconds in the United States. The mainstay of current therapy for acute MI is the restoration of blood flow  to the affected area through angioplasty, sometimes in conjunction with thrombolytic therapy to remove/prevent thrombi formation. However, the reperfusion of ischemic tissue can itself lead to severe myocardial damage.
Cocaine is a widely abused drug with no FDA  approved medication available for treatment seeking users. A promising concept for anti cocaine medication is to accelerate cocaine metabolism by hydrolysis at the benzoyl ester, producing biologically inactive metabolites. In humans, butyrylcholinesterase  is the primary endogenous cocaine metabolizing enzyme capable of catalyzing this reaction in plasma.
ACL reconstruction improves stability of the ACL deficient knee, and may mitigate subsequent damage to the medial meniscus. However, it does not consistently protect the joint from osteoarthritis  progression over the long term, , . The high number of sports related ACL injuries in young individuals, and the lack of effective treatment options for knee OA in this population makes this an emerging problem .
Metastasis is the key process that leads to death from solid tumors. A wealth of genomic and transcriptional data for tumors has recently become available, but the data are largely derived from primary tumors. A major challenge is how to utilize these resources to identify regulatory mechanisms that drive tumor invasion and metastasis .
Family based linkage analysis has been highly successful in identifying genetic loci underlying Mendelian disorders. In contrast, linkage analysis of complex traits and diseases in the general population has resulted in little success. These observations have led investigators to assess new approaches and to reassess methods such as family based linkage analysis .
The innate immune response relies on the recognition of the antigen by receptors that recognize specific structures found exclusively in microbial pathogens termed pathogen associated molecular patterns  . Recent studies have demonstrated that recognition of PAMPs by antigen presenting cells  is mediated by a Toll like receptor  family . There are currently more than 10 known TLR family members capable of sensing bacterial wall components, such as LPS , CpG DNA , flagellin , as well as other microbial products .
The brain is a high oxygen consuming organ and constantly exposed to oxidative stress. Polyunsaturated lipid in lipoproteins and membranes are particularly susceptible to oxidative stress damage, leading to the production of several reactive aldehydes such as 4 hydroxynonenal  and 4 oxo 2 nonenal  , which are capable of modifying protein  and DNA . Indeed, there is substantial evidence for increased lipoperoxidation in neurodegenerative disease associated with oxidative stress, such as Alzheimer disease and Parkinson disease  .
Individuals with salt sensitivity of blood pressure  are usually unable to excrete excess sodium without experiencing a concurrent increase in arterial pressure , . These individuals are at increased risk for essential hypertension, cardiovascular disease , and premature death , . There is strong evidence that genetic mechanisms may underlie the inter individual variation in BP response to salt intake .
Schizophrenia is associated with very high rates of tobacco addiction  relative to the general population  . This post mortem study that controlled for smoking status showed that while nonsmokers with and without schizophrenia have similar binding of  nicotine , smokers with schizophrenia have lower  nicotine binding than smokers without schizophrenia. Taken together these findings suggested that smokers with schizophrenia do not upregulate nAChRs to the same extent as smokers without schizophrenia .
Functional imaging of the central nervous system is of great significance in the neurological sciences because of its potential to reveal how intricate physiological processes occurring at the cellular level contribute to the vast array of neurological functions in humans. Perhaps most importantly, functional imaging offers a means of examining brain activity that is global in its scope as well as non invasive: both of which are necessary to reveal the complex distribution of activity that is the hallmark of a functioning brain . In recent years, multiple imaging modalities have been employed in an effort to provide functional data about the inner workings of the human brain.
The use of effective connectivity has become more popular, with no single method being used to the exclusion of others. As these computational methods and data modeling techniques can be combined in many ways, it is important to understand how the results from these different pairings compare with each other and if any of the pairings may be better suited to calculating effective connectivity from fMRI data than the others . Structural equation modeling  has been applied to fMRI data from a wide variety of neural systems .
Recent discoveries linking tiny pieces of RNA, called microRNAs , with the activity of thousands of genes are fueling excitement about the roles that these molecules play inside the cell . Interestingly, the 2025 nucleotides of mature miRNAs form ‘imperfect’ double helical complexes with their RNA targets . That is, the sequence of bases on the interacting strands is not perfectly complementary, with much, but not all, of the molecular complex held in place by canonical Watson Crick pairs.
Human genetic disorders are caused by diverse types of mutations. Many transcripts carrying a PTC are targeted for rapid degradation before they can be translated into protein through a multistep process termed nonsense mediated RNA decay . The molecular mechanism of NMD has not been fully delineated, though working models have been proposed.
As shown in , definitions of dyslexia  have expanded and evolved in recent years, in part due to refined understanding obtained through research and in part due to controversy that has arisen over the role of cognitive abilities in the definition and classification of RD. However, the degree and/or type of genetic influence may also vary across individuals within the reading disabled group . Several studies have addressed this issue and will be described briefly .
Proton Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy  is widely considered the most accurate non invasive method to measure liver fat . It has been validated in phantoms, animals, and humans, and is performed clinically as well as in research . Its large scale feasibility has been demonstrated in a prospective cohort study in which liver fat content was measured spectroscopically in 2,349 subjects  .
Lead is now accepted to lower children’s IQ at commonly encountered exposures, and no threshold has been determined for this effect. Nevertheless, lead’s effect on children’s behavior is less understood compared to its impact on IQ. Few studies have been done at levels of exposure <10 µg/dL, and almost all have focused on attention related problems.
The prevalence of overweight among children in Texas is higher compared to U.S. wide estimates, especially among economically disadvantaged populations . Among 4th grade students in Texas, Latino  and African American  have a higher prevalence of obesity compared to their Caucasian counterparts  . Additional details on Senate Bill 19 are provided elsewhere  .
Ovarian cancer is the fourth most common cancer in women. While mutations in BRCA1 and BRCA2 are risk factors for familial ovarian cancer, the causal agents for sporadic ovarian cancers, representing the majority of cases, are relatively unknown . MPO also generates chloramines, reactive nitrating agents and free radicals leading to lipid peroxidation .
Gene therapy has great potential for treatment for many inherited retinopathies , which are mostly monogenic blinding diseases. LCA2 is an IR due to mutations in RPE65, a gene expressed in the retinal pigment epithelium . However, the cloning capacity of AAV vectors is close to its wild type genome length  and this represents a limitation for gene therapies of several IRs due to defects in larger genes, such as Usher1B , Stargardt disease 1 , and LCA10 .
Type 2 diabetes is considered “the epidemic of the 21st century”, affecting approximately 24 million individuals in the US alone . Compared with people without type 2 diabetes, those with type 2 diabetes have higher death rates , and are at elevated risk of cardiovascular disease  and other complications of diabetes, such as retinopathy, nephropathy, and neuropathy . Diabetes and its complications remain major causes of morbidity and mortality in the US  .
The cortical generators of EEG/MEG measurements can be estimated by solving an inverse imaging problem where the unknown sources are distributed on an individual’s cortex with their orientations fixed and orthogonal to the local surface . Typically, several thousand sources are needed to model the convolutions of the cortical manifold precisely, but only a hundred or so measurements are available. Several studies have proposed to address this issue by imposing a partial fMRI constraint  or by modeling more finely the relationship between the BOLD signals and the EEG/MEG measurements .
Pentachlorophenol  is a synthetic molecule that has been used throughout the world for purposes as varied as antimicrobial agent, detergent and wood preservative. Even though its use has been restricted after the 1980s, it is still widely present in the environment, and it is considered as a chemical pollutant of concern . The air and the food chain are main pathways for human exposure to this compound, and it is possible to detect significant concentrations of PCP in the plasma of various age groups including newborns .
The use of mosquito repellents helps reduce or prevent mosquito bites that may lead to not only discomfort but also mosquito borne diseases such as malaria and West Nile virus illness. Mosquito coils have been and are still the most commonly used mosquito repellents worldwide. To be effective, mosquito coils are typically used indoors, primarily at night during sleeping hours .
Colon cancer is third most malignant tumor type involving uncontrolled growth of cells in colon. Therefore, colon epithelial cells gets enhanced exposure to these high concentration of bile acids. Clinical studies have revealed elevated levels of fecal secondary bile acids from patients diagnosed with colon cancer.
Cyclodextrins are cyclic oligosaccharides with hydrophobic interiors used as formulation vehicles to increase the amount of drug, including hormones and vitamins, which can be solubilized in aqueous vehicles . 2 hydroxypropyl β cyclodextrin  was extensively studied in rodents, dogs, and monkeys where it was generally well tolerated at low doses . Daily intravenous administration of greater than 200 mg/kg caused reduced body weight, foamy macrophage infiltration of the lungs, elevations in hepatic enzymes, increased Kuppfer cells in the liver, and renal cortical tubular vacuolization in rodents .
T cell exhaustion is a type of immune response describing the condition in which T cells exhibit reduced differentiation, proliferation and effector function. T cell exhaustion is initially recognized and characterized in chronic viral infections. Phenotypically, PD 1 expression has been demonstrated to be a marker to identify exhausted T cells in viral infection and tumors .
The diagnosis of patients with pulmonary infiltrates and human immunodeficiency virus  infection remains a frequent challenge. In recent years a promising serologic test for the detection of invasive fungal infections has been established. Since that time several studies have been reported.
Pemphigus encompasses a group of autoimmune blistering diseases exhibiting pathogenic autoantibodies against desmogleins , a family of desmosomal cell adhesion glycoproteins . The hallmark of these diseases is the presence of intraepidermal vesicles  and anti epidermal autoantibodies . Pemphigus foliaceus  and pemphigus vulgaris  are the two major phenotypes of pemphigus .
Smoking is the leading cause of preventable death among women and a leading preventable cause of poor pregnancy and infant outcomes in high income countries . Self reported smoking during pregnancy in nine countries in Latin America, Asia, and Africa was highest in two countries, Uruguay  and Argentina  . Studies in high income countries have found that women’s self reported smoking status during pregnancy can underestimate smoking prevalence by 24 28%, and intervention studies have documented differences in self reported and biochemically verified quitting .
Polarized membrane trafficking of signaling receptors is critical for developing neurons to respond to extracellular stimuli mediating growth, guidance and neuronal survival. The family of tropomyosin related kinases  receptors provides a prominent example of trophic factor receptors that undergo long distance axonal trafficking to regulate growth and survival of developing neurons . Currently, little is known about the membrane trafficking mechanisms regulating proper localization of Trk receptors in axons .
Researchers have long sought to understand juvenile delinquency because of its very clear social costs . One approach to understanding delinquency focuses on parenting behaviors, which are commonly labeled “monitoring.” Recently, however, there has been a call to reconceptualize the way the parental monitoring construct is operationally defined, and evidence has been presented in support of this argument . A second approach to understanding delinquency utilizes measures of personality .
Kidney stones are a common and serious medical disorder, causing significant medical costs . Citrate, a tricarboxylate, keeps calcium soluble in the urine; however, the regulation of urinary citrate has received little recent attention and remains poorly understood at the cell and molecular level . After NaDC1 was cloned, the assumption was that this single apical transporter accounted for all of renal citrate reabsorption and control of urinary excretion.
The prevalence of type 2 diabetes is increasing worldwide, and is expected to affect 380 million people by 2025. In the US, use of sulfonylureas  continue to be one of the main classes used to manage type 2 diabetes. Despite over three decades of treatment experience with glipizide and glyburide, it remains unknown whether co administration of anti infective agents increases the risk of hypoglycemia, as suggested by case reports.
Obesity and over overweight, as defined by the , are important health concerns that continue to escalate in scope and severity. Obesity increases the risk for many medical and psychiatric conditions such as coronary heart disease, stroke, certain types of cancers, and depression . This is the first longitudinal study to examine the psychosocial antecedents of an increased BMI, as well its effects on aspects of neurocognitive dysfunction.
Maintenance of B cell homeostasis requires proper intracellular integration of signals delivered from multiple surface receptors such as the B cell antigen receptor, Toll like receptors , B cell activating factor  receptor, and CD40, as well as intracellular cues. Tnfaip3 encodes the A20 protein, a ubiquitin modifying enzyme . A20 was initially identified as a TNF induced molecule that restricts TNF induced signaling .
Our laboratory has shown that patients with sickle cell disease  have significantly decreased HDL C and apoA I., We have also demonstrated that among SCD patients, those with lower apoA I levels have impaired vasodilatory responses to acetylcholine during forearm blood flow strain gauge plethysmography , and they tend to have elevated estimated pulmonary artery systolic pressures, an echocardiographic marker of pulmonary hypertension. In support of this finding, in pulmonary arterial hypertension patients without SCD, plasma HDL C levels are low, and predict clinical worsening and death. Niacin ER treatment promotes an increase in HDL C containing apoA I.
Gene modification by homologous recombination  is a relatively inefficient process mammalian cells, typically occurring at a low frequency of about one event per 105   107treated cells as compared to the high rate of random, non targeted integration of the donor DNA , which occurs in about one cell per 102   105 treated cells. Thus, in most cells, targeted recombinants  are overshadowed by more than 1000 fold higher random, non targeted integrants . However, positive negative selection achieves only a low degree of enrichment in mammalian cells other mouse ES cells, and many colonies must be screened to identify the targeted recombinants.
Addressing the sexual and reproductive health needs of people living with HIV is an emerging concern in secondary HIV prevention, especially in sub Saharan Africa with generalised epidemics and large numbers of reproductive age women living with HIV. Newer options with demonstrated efficacy, such as PrEP for HIV  persons  and Treatment as Prevention for HIV positive partners  have been added to the safer conception options. Manual insemination at home and timed unprotected vaginal intercourse are “low technology” safer conception strategies that could be promoted in resource limited venues , but limited clinical knowledge of these strategies by health care providers mitigates against their use .
That brain derived neurotrophic factor  contributes to the processing of nociceptive messages was originally suggested by a dramatic alteration in the levels of BDNF expression in the spinal cord following tissue or nerve injury . Surprisingly, acute thermal pain responsiveness increased. In contrast, intrathecal administration of antisense directed against either BDNF or TrkB mRNA decreased both acute heat pain and inflammation associated thermal hyperalgesia , as did reduction of BDNF via intrathecal administration of anti BDNF antibodies or by sequestration of BDNF, via intrathecal TrkB IgG  .
Every year in the United States more than 1.25 million people suffer burns and 6.5 million have chronic skin ulcers caused by pressure, venous stasis, or diabetes mellitus . The treatment of these conditions remains imperfect and expensive. There is hope that stem cell therapy may prove beneficial as it has been increasingly well established that stem cells play an important role in wound healing.
Infusion of angiotensin II  induces a loss of lean tissue or skeletal muscle  that is attributed to a decrease in systemic and muscle insulin like growth factor 1  . The Ang II induced reduction in body mass  can be alleviated by treatment with an angiotensin receptor blocker  suggesting that the mechanism of mass loss is angiotensin receptor mediated  . In addition, the ubiquitin proteasome pathway of proteolysis, which is stimulated by elevated glucocorticoids, appears to be the major catabolic mechanism by which Ang II induces increased skeletal muscle atrophy, and thus reduced body mass .
Neural stem/precursor cells  have recently generated much interest as a therapeutic means of reducing neural tissue loss after neurodegenerative diseases or central nervous system  injury. Hence, the critical regulatory events that orchestrate the proliferation and maturation of NPCs are not only important in the cytoarchitectural organization of the developing brain, but also in maintaining neurogenesis in the mature CNS. In the latter processes, adult rodent SVZ NPC migration through the rostral migratory stream is essential in replacing olfactory bulb interneurons .
Sickle cell disease  associated vasculopathy in the penis is characterized by aberrant nitric oxide and phosphodiesterase  5 signaling, and by increased oxidative stress. Preliminary clinical trials show that continuous treatment with PDE5 inhibitor sildenafil unassociated with sexual activity decreases priapic activity in patients with SCD. However, the mechanism of its vasculoprotective effect in the penis remains unclear .
Homogeneous glycopeptides and glycoproteins carrying defined glycan structures are indispensible tools for structural and functional investigation of glycoproteins. A number of elegant synthetic methods have been developed, as discussed in recent reviews. Both glycosyltransferases and endoglycosidases have been used to elaborate sugar chains for glycopeptide/glycoprotein synthesis.
The distal vasculature in the adult lung—distributed through approximately 300,000,000 alveoli—is a major site of injury and remodeling in acute lung injury . Once destroyed by injury or disease the spontaneous restoration of small vessel and capillary networks, leading to better lung function, has proved limited. While major advances have been made in the treatment and management of patients with ALI, vascular loss remains a significant clinical problem.
Methylphenidate  continues to be an important pharmacotherapeutic option for treating Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder . Moreover, recent reports indicate that despite behavioral effects similar to psychostimulants such as cocaine, MPH has distinct effects on monoaminergic transmission, which appear to be unique among the variety of drugs that target the dopamine transporter . In humans, MPH produces positive subjective effects , which may serve as discriminative stimuli.
Early and successful reperfusion of the acutely ischemic myocardium is the most effective salvage against irreversible ischemic injury , but can also cause reperfusion injury. The myocardial milieu is a hostile environment in early reperfusion. The National Institutes of Health has recently convened workshops seeking suggestions to improve the translation of basic science findings to the clinic.
Lung cancer is the most common cause of cancer death, accounting for more deaths than colorectal, prostate, and breast cancer combined . One class of lung cancer is non small cell lung carcinoma  . NSCLC constitutes 75% of primary lung cancers and are comprised of large cell undifferentiated carcinomas, squamous carcinomas, and adenocarcinomas.
Cooling towers are heat rejection devices used in industrial settings to efficiently cool building water systems without the use of chemical refrigerants. Cooling towers provide a unique environment for microbial growth and dissemination . Many traditional water treatment chemicals, eg antiscalants and zinc based corrosion inhibitors, provide nutrients that accelerate the growth of microbes in the towers .
Early pharmacological based studies suggested the existence of at leastjust two receptors for cysteinyl leukotrienes  and these speculations were later confirmed with the cloning of the CysLT1 and 2 receptors . The CysLT1 receptor is expressed prominently on airway smooth muscle cells, mediates bronchospasm, and is the target of current leukotriene receptor antagonists. Neither of these receptors binds LTE4 with clinically relevant affinity .
In the past, most of medical schools’ curricula were based on the traditional model of teaching in which education activities were reduced to a transfer of information . Lectures represented the major and sometimes only venue to transfer information from content expert to student. Often students relied on memorization and became overly focused on a short term objective “What do I have to know to pass the exam?” Usage of ARS technologies has been growing in popularity in higher education settings over the last 15 years .
A central tenet of cancer biology states that cancer is clonal, with tumors arising as the result of expansion of increasingly dysregulated cells. Aberrant epigenetic events, including DNA hypermethylation induced gene silencing, are well recognized as important contributors to carcinogenesis. Methylation associated gene silencing occurs when certain cytosines in specific clustered regions primarily located in gene promoters are hypermethylated.
Proper adherence to a treatment plan, especially taking medication regularly and as prescribed is a common clinical challenge for both patients and clinicians. Medication adherence is generally defined as the extent to which patients take medications as prescribed by their health care providers . Importantly, some studies have shown that people who were acutely or persistently depressed tended to over report their treatment nonadherence, compared to those who were in remission from depression, and those who were not depressed .
Bmi1, a member of the mammalian polycomb group of multimeric transcriptional repressors, is involved in the regulation of development, stem cell self renewal, cell cycle, and senescence . Bmi1 was first identified as a c myc cooperating oncogene in murine B cell lymphomas . Subsequent studies have revealed that Bmi1 is required by both normal and leukemic hematopoietic stem cells to maintain their proliferative capacity .
The psychoactive properties of cannabis have been recognized since early time and today, it remains the most widely used illicit drug globally. Despite the possible stigma and legal issues associated with its use, Cannabis sativa has been widely used as a herbal remedy over the centuries for the treatment of various conditions such as migraine, spasticity, nausea and vomiting as well as a magnitude of other disorders. The search for the active ingredients of the plant led to the first identification of its main psychoactive ingredient, δ 9 tetrahydrocannabinol , and the subsequent development of cannabinoid medications .
Ordered progression through the eukaryotic cell cycle depends on mechanisms that tie the abundance and activity of critical regulatory molecules to the events of DNA replication and cellular division. One of the most pervasive of these mechanisms is ubiquitin  mediated proteolysis, a process in which covalent attachment of Ub to target proteins signals their destruction by the 26S proteasome. Despite the biological importance of cell cycle regulated proteolysis, techniques to study this phenomenon are limited.
Unlike mammals, adult teleost fish like zebrafish, are able to regenerate a damaged central nervous system and therefore provide a good model for investigating mechanisms underlying neuronal repair. These observations, combined with reports that Müller glia in postnatal chicks and rodents have a limited capacity to regenerate neurons following retinal injury , implicated Müller glia as a source of retinal progenitors that participate in repair of damaged retinas . Based on previous success in mice, we chose to use CreERT2/LoxP recombination system for this purpose  .
Malignant gliomas, including anaplastic astrocytoma  grade III) and glioblastoma multiforme  are among the most devastating malignancies. Maximal surgical resection of the tumor mass followed by radiotherapy and chemotherapy is the standard of care. Despite expression of certain neural and other stem cell markers  by brain tumor stem cells, the definition of cancer stem cells remains functional, requiring sustained self renewal and tumor propagation.
Preterm birth is the major cause of neonatal mortality and morbidity worldwide, yet the underlying etiologies remain poorly understood . Preterm labor is a syndrome diagnosed in the presence of increased uterine contractility, cervical ripening, and/or membrane rupture or activation, which may occur in response to multiple pathological processes. During pregnancy, intrauterine infections begin in the decidua, extend to the amnion and chorion and finally reach the amniotic cavity and the fetus .
The patient centered medical home  is a model of care that advocates believe is central to achieving the “triple aim” of improving health, controlling costs, and enhancing patient experience in primary care. A growing body of literature has demonstrated the benefits of patients taking an active role in their health care. The concept is an important aspect of patient centeredness, one of the six fundamental aims of a high performing health system.
Induction of efficient long term immune memory is the aim of all vaccine protocols. Costimulatory molecules play a critical role in initiating and maintaining optimal immune responses . In a study employing APCs with decreased costimulatory capacity , higher peptide concentrations were required to induce proliferation of naïve T cells than were required for effector/memory T cells.
The sulphydryl containing amino acid, cysteine plays an important role in intermediary metabolism in the heart. In premature and new born infants, cysteine is considered to be an essential dietary component . In adults cysteine is obtained from dietary sources, proteolysis and methionine catabolism .
Acute myeloid leukaemia  represents a biologically and clinically heterogeneous disorder characterised by a clonal expansion of haematopoietic progenitor cells blocked in their maturation. The remaining cytogenetically normal AML  can be subdivided based on molecular markers, such as mutations in the genes encoding the FLT3 receptor, C/EBPα, NPM1, IDH1 and IDH2, C KIT, RAS or WT1. Constituting some of the most frequent mutations found in CN AML, mutations in the FLT3 gene generally associate with an inferior outcome.
It is widely believed that somatic as well as germline mutations play important roles in the origin and progression of colorectal cancers . Many genes have been investigated for mutation to elucidate mechanisms of colorectal cancer development, with these investigations demonstrating the involvement of mutations in colorectal carcinogenesis and progression. reported that PIK3CA, a catalytic subunit of the class IA phosphatidylinositol 3 kinases, was somatically mutated in 32% of colorectal cancers, resulting in the attenuation of apoptosis and facilitated tumor invasion.
Engrailed  is a homeodomain containing transcriptional regulator that has an important role in nervous system development. It is found ubiquitously in bilaterian animals, indicating that it arose more than 500 million years ago, in the Cambrian era . En was first identified in Drosophila, where it was shown to play a crucial part in the early patterning of body segments and limbs ; it was subsequently found also to have a role in vertebrate limb development  .
High plasma triglyceride  concentration is an important risk factor for cardiovascular disease , particularly in women, who have a two  to three fold greater relative risk for CVD associated with an increase in plasma TG concentration than men . Therefore, interventions that decrease or prevent an increase in plasma TG concentrations might be important in reducing CVD, especially in women. Aerobic exercise lowers plasma TG concentration  and this might, at least in part, provide a mechanism for the cardioprotective effect of regular, endurance type physical activity .
With advancing age, adults experience a decline in appetite and food intake , and in the extreme could lead to severe weight loss and malnutrition . Undesired weight loss may involve social, psychological, and medical issues . If weight loss goes untreated, it generally has detrimental outcomes  including increased number of falls, injuries from falls, and mortality .
MicroRNAs  are 21 24 nucleotide RNA molecules that regulate the translational efficiency and stability of target messenger RNAs . Despite this significant progress in miRNA identification, the biological roles of most miRNAs remain to be characterized . Furthermore, miRNA expression signatures are not only highly characteristic of specific cancer subtypes and therefore useful for tumor classification, but also have been associated with prognosis, staging, and response to therapy.
HTR2C is a widely investigated serotonin receptor . This SNP is known to lead to a substitution of serine for cysteine at codon 23 , and is constitutively more active than the Cys23 G allele . Specifically, Ser23 C allele hemizygotes  had two fold larger increases in plasma cortisol during recall of situations that made them angry or sad compared to those carrying the Cys23 G allele.
HIV associated neurologic disorders  are characterized by a spectrum of central nervous system  complications. Based on disease progression, HAND can range from asymptomatic neurocognitive impairment  to minor neurocognitive disorder  to the more severe HIV associated dementia . Highly active antiretroviral therapy  has deceased the frequency of HAD, but HAND is still common: more than 50 % of HIV infected persons receiving HAART demonstrate milder HAND syndromes , including ANI and MND.
The prevalence of overweight and obesity is increasing and has doubled worldwide since 1980. In 2010, approximately 35% of adult women in the United States were obese. Women of childbearing age are at particularly high risk for significant weight gain during their reproductive years.
Cancer cells are characterized by metabolic alterations and the tumor microenvironment is often marked with impaired blood flow and hypoxia, all of which can elicit endoplasmic reticulum  stress. Tumor cells adapt to these adverse conditions by activating the unfolded protein response , with induction of GRP78 as a major pro survival arm of the UPR signaling pathways . Genetically altered GRP78 mouse models further demonstrated the critical role of GRP78 in cancer in vivo.
Ischemia/reperfusion injury  involves the transient deprivation of blood flow and oxygen followed by the return of blood flow during reperfusion. Liver IRI and subsequent dysfunction or failure occurs in many clinical settings including transplantation surgery, tissue resections or hemorrhagic shock . Liver IRI has been reported to cause up to 10% of early organ dysfunction, leading to increased rates of acute and chronic rejection .
The establishment of the vertebrate body plan during embryogenesis results from a series of exquisite and tightly controlled cell polarization and cell migration events during gastrulation . Wnt proteins comprise a large family of secreted glycoproteins with conserved functions from invertebrates to vertebrates . For non canonical Wnt signaling, the Wnt signal is transduced via the Wnt receptor Frizzled  to the cytoplasmic protein Dishevelled , and this pathway regulates cell movement during gastrulation via modification of the actin cytoskeleton .
During vascular development, smooth muscle cells are initially highly proliferative, then become quiescent and express proteins that allow the cells to assume a highly contractive phenotype. Unlike cardiac or skeletal muscle, smooth muscle cells are not terminally differentiated; instead these cells maintain plasticity where they can alternate between a contractile, “quiescent” state and a highly proliferative, “synthetic” state . This phenotypic modulation is critical for smooth muscle cells to respond to pathophysiological stresses.
Anorexia nervosa  and bulimia nervosa  are separate disorders in the DSM IV TR, although their diagnostic boundaries are far from stable . We apply behavioral genetic methods to determine the extent to which this partially overlapping symptom picture could be attributable to shared genetic or environmental factors . AN is marked by low weight; however, provisions are made for the presence of bulimic symptoms in the binge purge subtype .
The aryl hydrocarbon receptor  is a ligand activated transcription factor  that is well characterized for mediating the carcinogenic responses to environmental polyaromatic hydrocarbons , such as 2,3,7,8 tetrachloro dibenzo p dioxin  . It is a member of the basic helix loop helix /PAS family of heterodimeric transcriptional regulators. This heterodimer binds to a set of co activators and/or co repressors and the resulting complex interacts with consensus regulatory sequences  located in the promoter of PAH responsive genes such as CYP1A1, and enhances their transcription .
A remarkable problem in molecular neurobiology is how an ORN activates one of a large family of odor receptor genes, while simultaneously repressing all the others. The problem of receptor gene choice is faced by animals ranging from insects to mammals . The Drosophila genome contains 60 Or  genes, and each ORN expresses one or a small number of them.
The low density lipoprotein receptor  related protein 1  is a large endocytic receptor that belongs to the LDLR family. LRP1 binds and endocytoses over 30 structurally and functionally distinct ligands, including apolipoprotein, proteinases, proteinase inhibitor complexes, and extracellular matrix proteins such as matrix metalloproteinases  and urokinase type plasminogen activator  . We further showed that LRP1 promotes cancer cell migration and invasion by inducing the expression of matrix metalloproteinase  2 and 9 .
Considerable effort has been directed towards developing fast and effective ligand docking algorithms applicable to drug discovery and design  . Among commonly used virtual screening approaches are docking based techniques that prioritize the testing compounds by predicting the binding mode for a query compound  ; this is followed by the prediction of binding affinity  . To achieve satisfactory performance, most ligand docking approaches typically require high resolution structural information on a potential target receptor, preferably in the ligand bound conformational state .
As a critical component in the multi level regulation of gene expression, nuclear receptors  have been considered the Rosetta Stone of physiology , as they recognize hormonal, environmental, and dietary signals, and elicit individual physiological responses by altering transcription . NRs can function as monomers, homodimers, or heterodimers; many NRs interact with RXR, a common heterodimer partner  . Since the cloning of the glucocorticoid receptor in 1985 , new members have been constantly added to the NR superfamily with the various sequencing and annotation projects, providing valuable information on transcriptional regulation and evolution of the animal kingdom .
Type 1 diabetes  is an autoimmune disease characterized by immunocyte infiltration of the pancreatic islets  and destruction of the insulin secreting β cells. The MHC  contributes the largest genetic risk as it does in humans and in the NOD mouse. In rats, this is the HLA DQB1 homolog, RT1 B, specifically the RT1u haplotype .
The electrostatic interaction is crucial for the structural, functional, and dynamic properties of biomolecules. When the PBE is applied to model biomolecular electrostatics, a significant challenge is how to obtain accurate solution of the PBE efficiently given the limited memory and speed of today’s computer servers because a typical biomolecule consists of tens of thousands to millions of atoms. Many efforts have been invested to develop methods to obtain numerical solution of the PBE accurately and efficiently.
Cigarette smoke has been reported to contain well over 4000 chemicals, at least 81 of which have been classified as carcinogens by the International Agency for Research on Cancer , including the known carcinogens 4  1  1 butanone , which is present in cigarettes at a range of concentrations up to 500 ng per cigarette , and benzopyrene P), which is present in the range of 3.36 to 40 ng per cigarette . These values are far higher than the reported levels of either NNK or BP. Previous mutagenesis work by another group indicated that 3MI was not mutagenic in a TA100 Salmonella reverse mutation assay using rat liver S9 .
The incidence of abdominal aortic aneurysm  is on the increase with approximately 150,000 new cases diagnosed in the US each year . Currently, the trend is to use the maximum diameter criterion , where AAAs that reach or exceed 5  5.5 cm in maximum diameter are deemed a rupture risk, and subsequently repaired. However, recent research has questioned the effectiveness of this method  as it has been reported that smaller AAAs can rupture  and also larger AAAs may remain stable for the rest of the patients life .
There is an increasing appreciation of the essential roles of lipids in cellular metabolism and signaling that has replaced the notion that lipids only function as an energy reservoir or structural components for cells. Generally, lipids are not static but change dynamically during normal metabolism or in response to cellular stimuli. Lipids turn over and are biosynthetically remodeled during cell cycle or undergo chemical restructuring to new lipid species with altered properties that serve as bioactive mediators in various signaling pathways.
hMATE1 , encoded by SLC47A1, is a newly identified organic cation/H+ exchanger expressed in the apical membrane of renal tubule cells and the canalicular membrane of hepatocytes. hMATE1 has been shown to mediate the cellular uptake of structurally diverse small molecular weight organic cations such as tetraethylammonium , N methylpyridinium, metformin, paraquat and oxaliplatin. hMATE2 K , the paralog of hMATE1, is specifically expressed in the kidney and interacts with various organic cations with a substrate specificity overlapping that of hMATE1.
Despite a critical role in the control of human fertility, the mechanisms regulating human oocyte maturation are not well characterized. In model organisms, accumulation of critical cell cycle regulatory proteins during oocyte meiotic maturation depends upon the regulated translation of maternally derived mRNAs . The maternal mRNA encoding the Mos proto oncogene is subject to tight translational regulation in oocytes from a variety of vertebrate species.
HSV 2 is the major cause of genital herpes, one of the most common sexually transmitted infections worldwide and a significant risk factor of HIV acquisition . In the US, 17% of people are seropositive for HSV 2 and 58% are seropositive for HSV 1 . Elsewhere, the seroprevalence rate is much higher, reaching 95% in some populations of HIV infected persons and female sex workers .
ERG recordings are used widely in the clinical evaluation of human retinal disorders  and in animal models expressing mutations that result in retinal abnormalities . Among various animal models, rodents, especially mouse, have increasingly become one of the main choices for study, owing to the large repositories of mouse lines with genetic defects, as well as advances in genetics and transgenic technology. However, although the rod pathway is very similar in rodent and primate retinas , there are distinct differences in cone signal processing.
Blood transfusion is performed to augment oxygen carrying capacity, since allogeneic transfusion is not always available and can result in transmission of infectious and immunologic diseases, allergic, alloimmune and other adverse events. The “transfusion trigger” or minimal hematocrit  or Hb level at which transfusion is required is a subject of controversy. In some situations the concept of a set “transfusion trigger” has been replaced by a functional parameter monitoring for inadequate tissue O2 delivery on a case by case basis.
Genetic abnormality is responsible for a wide range of human diseases including cancer. Gene therapy holds great promise in treating cancer because the gene product can be chosen to cause cell death in cancer cells while being benign to healthy cells. Despite the promising utility, advances in technology have been limited due to the difficulty in finding delivery vectors with and optimal balance between safety and efficacy.
Atherosclerosis is characterized by chronic oxidative stress and inflammatory changes in the vascular tissue. Of note, LOX 1 is an NF κB and AP 1 responsive gene , indicating that in addition to signaling via LOX 1, OxLDL can also upregulate its expression, resulting in positive amplification in its pro inflammatory and pro apoptotic signaling. In cardiomyocytes, induction of TRAF3IP2 expression by angiotensin II was dependent on Nox2 dependent superoxide generation .
By the end of 2007, the number of people living with HIV  in China was estimated to be 700,000 . Between 1996 and 2004, the national prevalence of HIV rose from 0.02% to 0.93% among female sex workers  and from 1.95% to 6.48% among IDUs. Public health efforts are now primarily concerned with preventing the secondary transmission of HIV from these core groups to the general population.
A biochemical coagulopathy is part of the clinical spectrum of sickle cell anemia . These abnormalities persist in “steady state” between acute events, and they are accentuated during acute vasooclusive crisis . We previously examined transgenic sickle mice  for expression of tissue factor  by the vascular endothelium.
Although there are positive physical and psychological benefits of physical activity, a majority of the population does not participate in physical activity at the recommended levels . One challenge in clinical trials is obtaining accurate measures of behavior  while balancing participant and staff burden. It also is important to demonstrate the validity of accelerometry and different methods in intervention trials  .
The steroid hormone 17β estradiol , acting through estrogen receptors , plays an important role in development and progression of breast cancer . Acting through ERs, E2 regulates transcription of responsive genes, some of which control cell proliferation and apoptosis . Tamoxifen , an anti estrogen, reduces breast cancer recurrence and mortality in women with ER positive tumors .
Vision plays an important role in the ability of people to process information from their environment and to participate in many everyday activities such as reading, working at home or in the office, walking, driving, and interacting with others. People with visual impairment may face challenges completing these activities, which in some cases may lead to depression, social isolation, and difficulties at home, in school, or at work. We previously reported on significant associations between visual impairment, including visual acuity and visual field loss, and health related quality of Life  in the Los Angeles Latino Eye Study , a population based study of adults.
Outcome prediction of patients who are in a locked in state is challenging. Extensive pontine infarction on diffusion weighted imaging MRI  has been proposed as a poor prognosticator. We report on three patients with a locked in state with unexpected favorable recoveries despite DWI evidence of widespread pontine ischemia .
In human studies, research has clearly demonstrated a link between alcohol consumption and stress with those individuals that experience higher levels of stress exhibiting higher levels of alcohol consumption . Stress, either an internal or environmental event, disrupts homeostasis via an activation of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis, which leads to the rapid secretion of corticotropin releasing hormone  and ultimate release of glucocorticoids such as corticosterone  in the rodent . Disruptions in HPA axis function are believed to influence alcohol self administration , and alcohol itself increases brain levels of CRH and plasma levels of CORT , thereby activating the HPA axis.
Organ dysfunction in the critically ill is assuming an increasing level of importance, both as a primary outcome marker in clinical trials and as a quality indicator for patients in the intensive care unit . Thus the use of primary outcome measures other than mortality, such as organ failure, assume an even greater role in both the design of clinical trials and in measuring quality of care in PICUs . Thus reported incidence of MODS in children admitted to PICUs varies from 11%56% and reported mortality from MODS varies from 11%57%.
Mechanical loading plays a critical role in bone remodeling, and unloading due to bed rest and weightlessness in space reduces bone mass and structural strength . The β catenin dependent Wnt signaling plays an important role in bone formation  and fracture healing . RhoA is a member of the Rho family of GTPases, which encode fundamental cellular processes such as cell differentiation, migration, as well as the assembly and organization of the actin cytoskeleton .
Engineered nanomaterials  are a large variety of particles with at least one dimension in the 1100 nm range. Multi walled carbon nanotubes , in particular, possess properties, such as high surface area and tensile strength, that make them very attractive for technological and biomedical product development . Results from studies assessing the safety of ENM indicate that significant lung pathologies can arise following exposure to these materials .
Hb adducts are used for biomonitoring of toxicant exposure in human epidemiological studies  and to elucidate the relative contributions of different metabolic pathways in cases where a toxicant can yield multiple reactive metabolites . Hb interaction with reactive metabolites can also provide insight into the interactions of reactive metabolites with other proteins in target tissues of toxicity . TCE, an occupational hazard and environmental contaminant, is listed in the Eleventh Report on Carcinogens as “reasonably anticipated to be a human carcinogen” .
Controlled regulation of homeobox HOX cluster genes is critical for normal proliferation and differentiation in embryogenesis. During hematopoiesis, HOXA genes are transcribed at high levels in hematopoietic stem cells and immature progenitor cells, and their expression is downregulated upon differentiation and maturation . HOXA9 and HOXA10 are overexpressed in the majority of human acute myeloid leukemias  .
Chronic liver diseases  are an important cause of morbidity and mortality in the United States  nearly 150,000 persons are diagnosed with CLD annually , and 36,000 patients die of CLD, primarily attributable to complications of decompensated cirrhosis and/or hepatocellular cancer., Cirrhosis results from progressive hepatic fibrosis, a maladaptive response to chronic hepatocyte injury. The gold standard for the diagnosis and staging of fibrosis is liver biopsy. Because of these limitations, several non invasive imaging based methods of staging liver fibrosis have been developed.
The relationship between the biomechanical behavior of naturally occurring extracellular matrix  scaffolds and the remodeling of these scaffolds in vivo is not fully understood. Ideally, a scaffold would closely mimic the mechanical behavior of the tissue that it is intended to replace . The mechanical properties of an ECM scaffold are largely a function of the collagen fiber alignment and kinematics of the material, which in turn regulate the behavior of cells that migrate to the site of ECM remodeling.
An increase of substances abuse prevalence in Brazilian youths has been observed in the last few years. Results obtained in the First Household Survey on Psychotropic Substances Use, conducted by the Center for Psychotropic Substances Information  indicate that 19.4% of the population between 1265 years of age have lifetime use of a psychoactive drug other than alcohol or tobacco. Prior surveys of adolescents conducted in the ten most populous cities in Brazil in 1987, 1989, 1993, and 1997 reveal an increasing prevalence of substance abuse.
The ability to sort cells from heterogeneous population and to study them at the single cell level provides unique opportunities for drug discovery and for understanding signaling pathways in disease . Monoclonal antibodies  are a rapidly growing class of human therapeutics with a market size of roughly $78 billion in 2012 . Conventional mAb production involves fusing splenocytes from immunized mice with an immortalized myeloma cell line.
Activation of T cells required the integration of signals from a minimum of two receptors: in naïve T cells, these signals are generally provided by an antigen dependent signal through the T cell receptor   combined with an antigen independent signal through CD28 . If TCR signals are received in the absence of costimulatory signals, T cells are not activated and instead enter an anergic state, in which they are refractory to further stimulation even when both TCR and CD28 signals are subsequently given together. TCR/CD28 signaling initiates a cascade of events, starting with tyrosine phosphorylation of CD3/ζ chains by Src family kinases and recruitment of Syk family tyrosine kinases .
Immunotoxins are antibody toxin chimeric proteins targeted to kill cancer cells . However, there is a significant difference in the intracellular route taken by each toxin. DT uses the low pH of endosomes to escape from this organelle to the cytosol .
There is a growing literature on how combining information from different senses may enhance perceptual performance. Many  behavioral studies of multisensory integration have used relatively intense suprathreshold stimuli, hence could not test for near threshold detection sensitivity . Given PoIE proposals that multisensory benefits should arise particularly in near threshold detection for low intensity stimuli, we focused on d’ for lower   intensity visual stimuli when co occurring with a sound or alone .
The unique antibody repertoire development in rabbits  has been exploited for the generation of polyclonal and monoclonal antibodies with exceptionally high avidity, affinity, and specificity . This cross reactivity along with the demonstration that rabbit monoclonal antibodies can be humanized has raised an interest in utilizing rabbit monoclonal antibodies for therapeutic applications . A rabbit monoclonal antibody format of particular interest is the chimeric rabbit/human Fab which consist of rabbit variable domains VH and Vκ and human constant domains Cγ11 and Cκ ; .
In response to infection, B and T cells undergo rapid proliferation and subsequent differentiation leading to the generation of effector cells that successfully combat the infection. Immediate early genes are rapidly induced  and their induction does not require new protein synthesis. Genes included within this category are c fos and Egr 1.
The amygdala plays an essential role in emotional learning and memory, which is investigated extensively using pavlovian fear conditioning. The basolateral amygdalar complex , which comprises the lateral, basal, and basomedial nuclei, is a key site where the CS US association occurs . Results suggest that disruption of fibers of passage through the CeA is responsible for deficits in conditioned fear expression .
Consider four HIV negative men living in New York City: Ben, Darryl, Greg, and John. Greg reports four UAI acts with his HIV negative main partner. From an epidemiological perspective, each man engaged in four high risk sex acts, i.e., four acts of unprotected anal sex.
Although prolactin  is critical for physiologic development and differentiation of the mammary gland, its role in breast cancer remains poorly understood. Small early clinical studies and species differences in the sites of expression of this cytokine/ hormone, which include the mammary gland itself in women , obscured its role in the human disease. However, recent epidemiologic studies and experimental models have pointed to an important role for PRL in the development and progression of breast cancer .
The tongue plays a key role in both sensory and motor aspects of the oral stage of swallowing, particularly for preparing, forming, manipulating, and transporting the bolus. Sensory receptors in the mouth, including those on the surface of the tongue, are thought to transmit information about bolus characteristics to higher cortical centers , so that the motor program for swallowing can be tailored appropriately to properties such as viscosity . It is therefore of interest to understand the sensory function of the tongue for tasks that may be relevant for detecting differences in the flow characteristics of swallowing, in particular, sensory tasks that require motor behaviours of the tongue to explore, squeeze or move a bolus in order to ascertain its flow properties.
Chlamydia trachomatis is the most common sexually transmitted bacterial pathogen in the world and infection can lead to pelvic inflammatory disease and infertility in women. However, multiple host pathogen recognition receptors that can induce IFNβ expression during viral infection  have been identified. These include the RNA sensors, RIG I  and MDA5  , which recognize viral RNA and signal via the adaptor MAVS  to induce IFNβ expression .
There is growing evidence that constitutive as well as somatically acquired alterations in TGF β signaling are associated with colorectal cancer risk and disease progression. Germline mutations of the SMAD4 and BMPR1A genes are associated with juvenile polyposis  and common and functionally relevant alleles of SMAD7 influence colorectal cancer risk . There is also evidence that loss of SMAD signaling in human colorectal cancer is associated with advanced disease and poor prognosis .
Psychologists, economists and policy makers are interested in how early inputs in the life cycle affect later productivity . Children’s psychological problems  or exposure to abuse  impact functioning decades later in adulthood. The repeated aggression can be either direct  or relational with the intent to damage relationships  .
Consensus statements recommend that interdisciplinary family meetings occur for all ICU patients within five days of admission and include discussions about patient values, prognosis, and the options of comfort care or withdrawing life support when death is possible. However, whether surrogates of critically ill patients are offered comfort care as a treatment option depends primarily on whether their physician believes life support should be withheld or withdrawn., Previous work has documented that physicians are reluctant to discuss outcomes for critically ill patients in the face of prognostic uncertainty, and frequently do not ask surrogates about patient values. How physicians decide whether to discuss withdrawing life support as an option under these circumstances is unclear .
Hepatocellular carcinoma  is the most common primary malignant tumor of the liver and a major cause of death among patients with cirrhosis . Management of HCC is complicated by the challenge of treating late stage cancer in the setting of advanced liver disease. Over the past 20 years, the use of a multimodality therapy approach for HCC has improved overall 5 year survival from 7% to around 50%.
Head and neck lymphedema  is a common side effect of head and neck cancer  treatment. It has been estimated that more than 50% of treated HNC patients will develop some degree of HNL., HNL is characterized by swelling resulting from the blockage of normal drainage pathways in the lymphatic system. Although the etiology of HNL varies, common causes include surgery that removes lymph nodes, or impairment of lymphatic vessel contractility  associated with radiation therapy or surgery.
Neuronal monoamine transporters are targeted by a myriad of currently employed therapeutic drugs, such as antidepressants, as well as widely abused illicit drugs such as the psychostimulant cocaine. While it is generally accepted that inhibition of DAT function—resulting in a sustained increase in perisynaptic dopamine levels—underlies the behaviorally rewarding effects of cocaine, a number of other potent DAT inhibiting compounds do not share cocaine’s notorious abuse liability , even if they too elicit significant increases in extracellular dopamine concentration . For example, the highly selective dopamine uptake inhibitor GBR12909 has greater affinity for the DAT than cocaine, but does not share cocaine’s behavioral profile and high abuse potential .
Alterations in intracellular Ca2+ concentration  are fundamental transduction elements in cell signalling. There are two major classes of CaV channels; the Low  and the High Voltage Activated  channels. However, distinguishing macroscopic currents among CaV3.2 and the other two CaV3 members , requires a detailed analysis of specific parameters already described for recombinant channels such as recovery from inactivation , and/or their sensitivity to chemical compounds.
Hematopoiesis in normal hosts is tightly regulated in order to maintain daily blood cell turnover among different lineages . During bacterial infection, however, the equilibrium of hematopoiesis is altered, whereby granulopoiesis becomes predominant with inhibition of other lineage  development . It is well known that all types of blood cells are derived from hematopoietic stem cells.
An increasing body of evidence indicates that cytochrome P 450  dependent metabolites of arachidonic acid, including epoxyeicosatrienoic acids , play an important role in regulation of cardiovascular and renal functions . Numerous independent studies have shown that increasing bioavailability of EETs in tissues by preventing their degradation to the biologically inactive dihydroxyeicosatrienoic acids  employing soluble epoxide hydrolase  inhibition has antihypertensive effects . Though, c AUCB significantly increased the intrarenal availability of biologically active EETs in TGR, detailed analyses of the results of this study made us propose that the antihypertensive action of sEH inhibition in TGR is predominantly mediated by suppression of systemic and intrarenal renin angiotensin system  .
Embryonic stem  cells have the potential to replace tissues lost by injury, disease, or normal aging if lineage differentiation can be controlled. Replicating the intrinsic and extrinsic factors influencing fate choice provides one possible method toward obtaining the specific phenotype of interest for stem cell therapies. Regeneration of SGN does not occur endogenously.
Approximately half of the species in the moss family Splachnaceae are entomophilous, having their spores dispersed by flies . The sporophytes of all entomophilous species so far examined release volatile chemicals that attract flies . Sporophyte odour in the Splachnaceae is novel among mosses, with both visual and olfactory cues appearing integral to fly attraction .
Primary infection with influenza virus results in a localized pulmonary infection and inflammation, and elicits an influenza specific CD8+ T cell immune response that is necessary for viral clearance . These CD8+ T cells are thought to control virus infections by killing influenza infected pulmonary cells using perforin  and Fas dependent mechanisms . When Fas−/− or perforin−/− mice were infected with influenza virus in the absence of CD4+ T cells, viral titers persisted for an additional 3 days beyond controls but virus was eventually cleared .
The HER2/neu  gene is amplified in approximately 25% of breast cancers . Gene amplification results in overexpression of the HER2 protein which is associated with an aggressive clinical course to include a shorter disease free interval after adjuvant therapy and decreased overall survival  . Trastuzumab has been shown to improve survival in patients with metastatic HER2 positive breast cancer  as well as in patients with earlier stage disease.
Although invasive intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms  of the pancreas is thought to be more indolent than sporadic pancreatic adenocarcinoma , the natural history remains poorly defined. We compare survival and identify prognostic factors following resection for invasive IPMN vs. stage matched PAC . The Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results  database  was utilized to identify 729 patients with invasive IPMN and 8082 patients with PAC who underwent surgical resection .
Identification of microdeletion syndromes began with the recognition that syndromic phenotypes are often associated with mental retardation. Our ability to detect chromosomal microdeletion syndromes is evolving and is greatly enhanced by the use of more advanced molecular technologies especially the use of microarrays . The 3q29 syndrome was first described by  in 6 patients that presented with mild to moderate mental retardation, with only slightly dysmorphic facial features similar in most of these patients: a long and narrow face, short philtrum, and high nasal bridge.
Obesity and its co morbidities have reached epidemic proportions . Consumption of high calorie foods is proposed as a major factor contributing to the wide spread development of obesity . Importantly, food intake is driven not only by energy demands, termed “homeostatic” feeding, but also by the hedonic gratification associated with eating a preferred food, referred to as “non homeostatic” feeding .
Thiazolidinediones , including rosiglitazone and pioglitazone , are used widely to improve insulin sensitivity in patients with type 2 diabetes. Recent studies have demonstrated that TZDs also reduce AngII induced abdominal aortic aneurysm  development in apoE −/− mice. , Currently, it has not been defined whether the beneficial effects of TZDs are attributable to PPARγ agonism in a specific cell type.
Accurate measurement of cancer preventive behaviors is important for assessing quality of medical care, conducting descriptive and interventional research studies, monitoring progress toward national goals, and determining public policies. Data from insurance claims and medical records have been found to have high concordance for certain procedures such as colonoscopy ; however, relatively lower levels of agreement between medical record review and patient self report have been found in the documentation of diabetes care, cardiovascular disease care, cancer screening, and counseling or referral to additional services . Therefore, medical records are frequently used as the data source for assessing quality of medical care and conducting health services research in community settings.
